Summary Heading: there are better hotels that are cheaper and closer to the park.
Summary: The room had terrible window covers that allowed too much light to come in at night time. The halls were always loud. The breakfast consisted of powdered eggs and day old food. Wouldn’t recommend in the slightest. There are better hotels both closer to the park and further from the park. Don’t get suckered into this 1 star hotel showboating as 3 stars. This is a glorified motel 6.

Great hotel, friendly staff, walking distance is less than 5 minutes to the Disneyland Parks. plenty of places to eat, Walgreens and cvs are just over the road.  Free coffee in reception, collect refills of toiletries from reception as well.  Breakfast was different every morning,  great choice and friendly staff on the 5th floor.
Room tip:
Get to breakfast early, as making the waffles gets busy.
Sit on the deck outside the views are...

Summary: We, like everyone else here, stayed due to how close it is to Disneyland.   Cons: - no direct shuttle. Candy Cane right next door has a shuttle for its guest where after a 30K step day would be nice when you’re dragging your feet the walk home - no housekeeping. Using covid as the excuse. We had to call down for toilet paper, towels, garbage bags, etc and do all the general housekeeping ourselves like make beds exchange towels etc , which kind of sucks. - older hotel with a face lift, you can see it’s older and some fixes (like a light above the hotel is duct taped) are not quite fixes at all - bathroom had a slight sewage smell when water ran and toilet flushed, it passed fairly quick but was noticeable  - free breakfast (is not a con!) but you cannot take anything with you, so

Utilized this hotel for a business trip as it is close to the convention center. Upon check in they had my name reversed, last name as first and first name as last. I assumed they corrected this but when I couldn’t access wi-fi I found they had not. When entering my room after check-in on Monday I found I could not lock the deadbolt unless I used force to lift up on the door. I called the front desk and they sent someone from maintenance and assured me it would be fixed. I did not check out until Friday and the issue was never resolved. Found out from the desk attendant rudely yelling to me that the gym does not open until 6am when I tried to access it before 6am. This may be feasible for leisure travel but certainly not business travel. The gym also has minimal equipment, 3

Very clean hotel,a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, all staff were very helpful and friendly, great shops and restaurants nearby, there is a alamo car rental next door,I will highly recommend this hotel, if you are planning a trip to Disneyland.

Stayed here for a Disneyland trip. It ended up being a great choice for this.   Distance: Very close walking distance to the parks, enough that my party would go back midday for a rest and it wasn’t a big deal. Early check in has a $50 fee which isn’t great but since the hotel is so close to the parks it was fine leaving stuff at the hotel and going back to check in later. There’s only one street to cross and it has a crosswalk.   Free breakfast: Breakfast is included. They have good options- muffins, doughnuts, omelets, waffle maker, fruit, cereal, etc. My party took advantage of this every morning as it was quick and easy and let us get to the park swiftly.   Comfort: The hotel is far enough away that you don’t get the park noise. The beds and pillows are a little on the

This was a whole family trip for a Christmas present. Our son, his wife and 2 daughters had a two room suite with one room having double bed bunkbeds - top and bottom - and an outer room with a King. Both rooms had their own TV's. Our other son had a room with a queen bed. We, the parents/grandparents had a suite with 2 queen beds and a living area with a couch, chair and a kitchen table with 4 chairs. There were also 2 TV's in our room - one in the bed area and one in the living area. Each room had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, safe, and hairdryer. The rooms were exceptional clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool area has a hot tub and both were clean and there were always plentiful clean towels. The pool is heated. The lobby is large and inviting and the

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland and comfortable room!
Summary: We stayed for a week on a family trip to Disneyland.   The location is excellent as you are a ten minute walk to the parks, 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney, and a short stroll to Anaheim Garden Walk's shops and restaurants. It has fast food outlets and two pharmacies across the street. The room was comfortable with lots of useful items such as a safe, fridge, and coat hooks.  The beds were also very comfortable. Only one slight issue was that I couldn't make local calls on the room phone. Customer service was very good and helpful throughout the trip.  The main reason this hotel is a 4 instead of 5 is the breakfast.  The choices were limited on many days.  If you came down at 8 or 8:30am there would often be no muffins or donuts left.  We eat vegetarian and most days the eggs
Room tip: You can request a room facing Disneyland to view the fireworks, but they can also be seen through...

Summary: We stayed in the 2 room suite with a kitchen.  The room was clean and beds were comfortable. There was a sofa but no chair, the room definitely needs a chair.  We thought about taking one from the area in front of the elevator but we didn't. The room sleeps 6 but there's not enough space for 6 or enough places to sit for 6.  There was only 3 of us so it worked but it was tight. The kitchen had everything needed to cook and eat meals including pots, pans, plates, bowls, cups, and utensils. The fridge is an apt size, which is nice however ours was missing the bottom drawer and the rack on the bottom shelf of the door.  They include dishwasher pods and dish soap. It's a great location, about a 10 minute walk to Disney. There's a CVS and Walgreens across the street, and a 7-11 next

Summary Heading: Good Rooms, Great Location, Even Better Staff!
Summary: Stayed at a few different hotels and stayed recently at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites with our Family of 6. Rooms were a little small but had all you needed (and if you are going to Disneyland to stay in the room, you are doing it wrong.) Location was great and only had to cross 1 street to get to Disneyland (only a short 5-10 min walk). The STAFF WAS GREAT! Very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good with a decent selection of food. Great way to start a long day at Disney. We would absolutely stay here again.
Room tip: Rooms on the North Side face Disneyland.

Summary: Loved this place to go to the parks.  We have stayed in quite a few places, including the PP and the DR, but disney properties are WAY too expensive now for what you get (with the minimal early "magic" morning or whatever they are calling it now, that amounts to about 2 rides-not worth it for us!). We really like another property kitty-corner to the palms, but that has gotten too expensive too, plus crossing both katella AND harbor make that kind of a hassle. When we checked in, we loved our room. They changed us out from 2 queens to a king upon check in request, which was awesome. We got into our room, unpacked, and then went to DD for a bit to grab a bite, and when we came back our room smelled horrible!  Called the front desk, and they sent someone up-evidently a vacuum fried

Summary Heading: Cleaning the rooms and taking the garbage in a daily basis should be a must!
Summary: I had a good stay, distance to the park was not too bad. Breakfast it okay. However, I wasn’t too happy with housekeeping, I understand the COVID situation but if you are staying for more than three days, you deserve a clean room with new fresh towels. We had to ask housekeeping to get the garbage out otherwise it will stay in the room for days. A clean room it’s a must, specially if you are staying with your family for more than three days. At least taking garbage out, clean towels, extra shampoo and conditioner. They need to work more in the cleaning.

Summary Heading: Excellent room. Staff could use some motivation.
Summary: We had a huge party of 13. The rooms were fantastic. Location fantastic. Check in went like this: wait for the rep to confirm one room. Swipe your card. Digitally sign a form. Swipe a SECOND card. Wet sign another form. It was about 10-15 minutes per room for 4-5 rooms. I asked why we had to use two different credit cards and both digitally and physically sign separate forms and the answer I got was "to prevent a cybersecurity attack". Other hotels have figured this out. If Desert Palms can figure this out, the rating will definitely be higher. We did have one room that kept losing their key card. Eventually the staff stopped printing out new key cards and had that person wait until a staff member could come to the room and unlock the door for that person. 20 minute wait, I

The hotel  ha room ubication for disneyland parks.  the free brekfast is very cheap.  The cleaning room  services  is very bad. I stayed there for 4 nights and nobody clean my room, clean my bed,  they dont even take the garbage out of the room. I asked for help and nobody do it.

I went with two of my kids and their grandfather joined for a few days. The staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean. Breakfast was typical hotel style nothing fancy but we all enjoyed it and it made the mornings easy to get up and go. I would stay here again as it's an easy walk to Disney parks and also close to CVS or other out of park dining places.

Summary Heading: One of the WORST hotels in Anaheim
Summary: My wife and I have stayed at many hotels in Anaheim. We are season pass holders to Disneyland and enjoy the park often. This trip we invited some of our family and we booked this hotel due to its close proximity to the park. The rooms are okay, but regardless of how nice it looks, the staff and accommodations are the worst.  When we arrived, my son and I had to use the restroom and they provided a key. That was great. However, when my brother came to check in, they told him that he couldn’t use the bathroom and had to wait to be checked in first to use the bathroom in his room. It was very prejudiced.  They said the won’t clean rooms but they will change the towels out daily as well as grab the garbage. They left all our dirty towels on the ground and placed new ones in our

They gave us room 411, and it's right in front of the elevator, so you can imagine how much noise we would hear from it. If you stay here, and you get room 411 don't bother going to it, just ask right away for a different room. They refused to give us a better room. and the tub will fill up with water unless you turn on the shower head. Plus, they DON"T do house cleaning, cause "Covid" oh and if you happen to forget toothpaste, they don't give you that they will expect you to buy some from their store. I won't be staying at that Hotel ever again.

We stayed in a 2 room suite and it was perfect. There was plenty of storage and room to spread out. We loved that we could shut the bedroom doors. Hotel is within perfect walking distance to Disney parks, lots of food options nearby including the garden walk. Everyone we encountered was friendly and accommodating. Even though there was no full service housekeeping, our trash was emptied daily and the towels were refreshed. The room has a fridge but no freezer which we didn’t know until arrival. We had some items spoil because we couldn’t freeze them. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

The Desert Palms is fast becoming our preferred hotel for the Disneyland area. It’s clean, streamlined, fairly-priced and the staff are always nice. Beds are almost surprisingly comfortable (better than many Marriott etc beds), rooms are sizable and well thought-out. The small convince store inside the hotel is super-handy when you need a quick bite or something to drink. Parking is underground, so your vehicle is not sitting in the sun nor an open lot.  Very quick walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Possibly the worst place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: During the course of our stay medications were stolen from our room.  When discovered the matter was immediately brought to the attention of front desk staff, who did not really seem surprised or  to care one bit.  I later made contact with the guest service manager, who also did not really seem to care one bit about what happened and told me to call the police, which I had already done.  The guest service manager later provided me with information that the only staff member who had been in our room during our stay was the houseman.  The houseman had evidently been questioned by management and denied taking anything from the room, which is not surprising. The guest service manger told me there was no evidence to prove the houseman had taken anything nor was there evidence that

We couldn't have been happier with this hotel. We had a deluxe Studio Suite that was able to fit my family of six with everyone in a bed. One of the beds was a pull-out couch bed the other two were queen beds.  The hot breakfast begins at 6:30 which means we were able to eat and get to Disneyland before rope drop. The potatoes at the breakfast were so good! Unfortunately they only had those one of the four mornings we were there. The hotel is about a half a mile from Disneyland and we walked because it was quicker to walk than take the shuttle.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay with family
Summary: Within walking distance of Disneyland. We thought we might get Shuttle tickets. But it took longer for the shuttle to come by then it did for us just to walk to Disneyland. So we always walked. You can see California Adventure and the fireworks from the Hotel. The hot breakfast is great. It also starts at 6:30, which easily gave us time to eat and walk to Disneyland before rope drop. We had a family suite with two queen beds and a pullout couch bed. So fantastic for a family of 6 to have places for everyone to sleep. Would definitely stay again.

Before we arrived, we called multiple times to verify checkin was at 3pm, as we had dinner reservations at 430pm and wanted time to settle in and get ready. We called 4 hours prior to request to pay for early check in, but they could not grant that, which we completely understood. During this conversation we again clarified that check in would be 3pm and were again told yes. We arrived at the hotel early, 1pm, parked our car, and planned to go to downtown Disney for a bit before check in. We again, went inside and verified check in was 3pm. Once 3pm came, we went to check in and the front desk employee said not until after 4pm would our room be ready. She was absolutely not apologetic, didn’t offer any accommodations such as storing our luggage (at least an offer), said there

We usually stay at the marriot, sharaton, or hyatt and based on price and room type (2 room suite) we decided to give desert palms a try. We were all very impressed with our room and mostly the food at the oasis, they will even deliver it to your room. I would recommend this to anyone going to disneyland or even a convention.

Less than a ten minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland or Disney California Adventures. Suite with separate bunk bed room for children was great - bunk beds are larger than a twin - could probably sleep two children each quite easily. Breakfast was disappointing and pool area was always over-run with children but overall a good value for a family. If only going with adults maybe not such an attractive place to stay.

I use a mobility scooter and room I was given was great. Big layout, easy to store scooter in room. Overall hotel was great. Only issue is the pool area is difficult to access for wheelchairs / scooters. Main entrance has a step down limiting access. There is a back entrance, but was actually discouraged by staff to not use the entrance, as member said it was too narrow, even though door has a wheelchair sign on it.

Booked this hotel for the price point and the distance to the Anaheim Convention Center for an event. Only issue was that the air-conditioning didn't work in our room and we had maintenance out 3 times to try and fix it, so we had to do the repack and move after one night which is not easy in a kitchenette room when you have bags and groceries for 3 - thankfully it was to a room on the same floor. Unlike some other hotels, this kitchenette style with a separate bedroom had the bathroom not located through the bedroom, which was great for non-related roommates to share the space.

We have stayed in many hotels walking distance to Disneyland over the past 15 years with our family. This year we discovered Desert Palms and have found a real gem. This hotel is extremely clean and well taken care of. They offer a complimentary hot breakfast daily that includes sausage,eggs, waffles, fruit, breads, coffee etc. the breakfast room has indoor seating as well as a terrace with outdoor seating and views of California Adventure. The staff keep it well stocked and very clean. A great way to start the day. An extra thank you to Kristin for going out of her way to welcome us and make sure our stay has been wonderful. We will definitely be choosing to stay at this hotel next time we visit Disneyland.

It was a great place to stay at, not far from parks, food, also airport is only 25 minutes away. Great free breakfast food and great staff. Kristen Brown, the reservationist went above and beyond for my 3 kids. Overall a great stay and would definitely recommend.

Spent 3 nights for my birthday. I don’t recall mentioning it but I must have as I had a surprise waiting in my room! My first impression when I walked in was it was super open not stuffy at all like some other rooms I’ve stayed in. Very clean! Bed was very comfortable. I didn’t take advantage of the free breakfast but I did order from the restaurant twice. They do room service as well but I prefer to pick up. My only con is the water pressure in the shower wasn’t the best but other then that I had wonderful time & would highly recommend.

Rude front counter staff. Trying to get $50 out of me for arriving one hour early for check in. I have never had any hotel not check me in a little early and they threatened to cancel the reservation if I said anything further.  When we finally checked in around midnight, they again threatened to cancel the reservation when I inquired about the early check in fee. The room had a comfortable bed, but no amenities. In writing they stated they would offer no additional pillows, blankets, pen and paper by the phone, coffee or tea. The room had no black out curtains and faced a very busy street. The “free” breakfast was terrible. Dry cereal, one type of bread (with no toaster), make your own waffles (a huge line for this) and some kind of pre-packaged egg and cheese concoction.  This

Pros: * staff were competent and friendly at checkout - seemed to be grateful that we chose their hotel  * any issue we had or request made was taken care of quickly  * room was clean, spacious and had 2 separate sleeping spaces ( 1 room with double bunks, another with a king bed). My husband and I sleep so much better on a king, but that is rarely an option in family rooms at hotels. The double bunks allowed for our teen to sleep on one, and our two smaller boys to share.  * larger than normal fridge for a hotel room  * large closet and lots of hooks for clothes, towels etc * comfortable mattress ( or was I just exhausted?)  * decent food that could be ordered to your room from a restaurant downstairs. Lots of options.  * a pool that allowed these overheated Canadians a chance

Everything was wonderful. We had a 6 nights stay with a family of 5. The breakfast changed daily which was nice and we enjoyed sitting on the terrace with views of Cali adventure. The fridge was big enough to store snacks and drinks, no freezer. Our entire family slept well, zero issues with room temperature. Shower was always hot. Coffee always available in the lobby. The walk was easy in the morning, but tough for the littles at the end of the long day. The front of the park is close to the room, but not when you are leaving the park from Splash Mountain or Smugglers run. We did end up purchasing  a cheap stroller from target for the evenings. A sleeping sack of potatoes is hard to carry to the room. We were very satisfied and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Good option for families going to Disney or if you are attending Anaheim Convention Centre
Summary: Pro’s -excellent proximity to Disneyland -family friendly rooms with fridge, microwave  -complimentary hot buffet breakfast on 5th floor overlooking city -fitness facility (although the universal gym was broken) -hot tub and pool (but both are small, pool’s temperature was cool with minimal area to sit). It’s located in the middle of the hotel so it only gets sun for part of the day) -restaurant onsite  -comfortable beds -clean facility and rooms -located next to car rental Alamo -lots of restaurants nearby  Con’s -expensive parking (but it’s typical of area) -if you want to hang out by the pool for the day, it’s not great. If you just want a pool to do a quick dip to cool down, then it’s good  -lots of homeless people sleeping around hotel and Disney grounds. So sad considering

I usually have no issues with hotels next to Disney but this hotel was by far the worst one we have stayed at. Some of our family that was with us required a mobility scooter to which we were originally told to leave them in the lobby. We then received a  phone call to move them upstairs to which we did like we were asked. The next day we got a note to put them in our room due to a fire hazard. To which we understand, so we talked to the staff and told them our room does not accommodate us for mobility scooters in our room so it would be even more of a fire hazard to keep them in our room. The staff responded “well I don’t know what to tell you”. Finally, I asked to speak with the manager and she once again asked us to leave them in the lobby. Thinking all our problems are

We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Since it isn't a chain hotel you can never be too sure about the condition and amenities. The hotel looked just like the pictures. The staff was super friendly and helpful every time we interacted with them. The room was more than we were expecting. There were 2 queens and then a step down into the area with the pullout couch, table, and tv. There was also a tv on the dresser in front of the beds. The two areas were separated with a curtain. This was nice for giving us some space when our 6yr old went to sleep and to block the early morning sun. We were located on the back side of the hotel and were able to see the Guardians of the Galaxy(Tower of Terror). One of the nights we were able to see a lot of the fireworks from our window. We

The first ring we noticed about our room was the smell of mold. The bathroom had folded dirty towels. Two towels and the toilet paper had handprints of ‘who knows what’ on them.  Had to ask 2 times to have all the towels replaced and to be given something to clean the bathroom. On the third day of our stay I asked if they could vacuum the room. I was told that they only service the rooms (other than giving new linens if requested) every 7 days. I insisted and was told they would if there was time. The breakfast buffet staff was friendly and efficient.

We arrived at 8:00 am staff tagged our bags and held them until we returned after check in time. Husband and I went and enjoyed Disneyland for the day and returned to find we had been upgraded in our room. The suite was tiny but cute with a small living room space and a large bedroom/bathroom. All was clean and comfortable.  We ordered from the restaurant down by the lobby twice and had them deliverer to our room. Both meals were great and reasonably priced.  We enjoyed the short walk to the Disney property and parks.

Desert Palms is a very affordable and friendly hotel to stay at. From the moment I called to book my reservation the front desk agent was very helpful and friendly.  Upon arrival checkin was fast and staff friendly.  The room was very clean and the morning breakfast buffet was amazing.  Desert Palms is definitely a great place to stay at!

Summary Heading: Would be a five if they cleaned the rooms after checking in
Summary: We stayed five nights in four rooms.  They do not clean the rooms while staying so toilets can get really gross (you know what it is like eating food that normally is not eaten at home).  The hotel and rooms were spotless to start out though. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfortable.  There are no extra blankets but the air conditioner responds quickly.  I am glad I  brought my sound machine as the street has sirens during the night.  The buffet breakfast was good one day and meh the rest of the time with dry powdered eggs.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  If you are paying for several rooms, you must be there for anyone else to get in their room unless they put one night on theiir credit card.  This caused problems for us.   The location is about 18 minutes of

I stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites Anaheim for three nights last week and I thought the hotel was really great. The rooms were spacious and very quiet at night, even if my room faced Katella Avenue.   I stayed at this hotel because there was a car rental outlet next door and i did  not want to walk a lot to get a rental car. I did not go to Disneyland, but had to attend to some  family business instead in Orange County.   The hotel  offers a complimentary breakfast, which should be enough to fill any stomach. There is a small pool and ample parking for families that arrive by car.

Summary Heading: Incredible Right Down to the Small of Details
Summary: I have returned to Desert Palms Hotel & Suites for decades.  I stay two/three times a years, as an Disney Annual Passholder aka Magic Key.  I refer to Desert Palms as my “Vacation Angels”.  The location to all the parks, the convention center, and food and shopping is priceless.  The rooms are incredibly roomy and designed well for comfort.  I really like the ‘hotel’ feature of indoor halls, especially when staying with young children.  The breakfasts are amazing!  So many food and beverage choices all done with excellence.  That is why Desert Palms has had my return business for years and years.  Thank you to all my Vacation Angels!

Always start with perspective - we are a family of four with a 7 & 5 yr old who often bring along my 70’something mother.  This was the one place where I could afford to get a suite for us & separate room for my mother.  Staff is friendly, laundry room is lovely, walk is wonderful, & breakfast is convenient.  We never allowed ourselves to adjust to west coast time & were up @ 5:30, opening breakfast at 6:30, & in line at Disney by 7:15.  If this is your cup of tea - this is the right place to be.  Pool is ok for one or two afternoons, free breakfast saves you hundreds a trip, & proximity makes it easy to get along.

We arrived at exactly our check-in time with no issues and the front desk staff was very friendly and even gave us a free upgrade to the suite which was so nice having the extra space for the kids and the covered patio was definitely a plus as it’s very private and you can relax out there after a long day at Disneyland and the beach that we went to. The breakfast buffet that was free every morning was very good and was changed out daily with different items and of course my boy likes making his own waffles in the morning. The pool was nice and provided towels out there for our convenience and the temperature of the pool was perfect . The location is great we could’ve walked and probably would’ve taken us about 30 or 40 minutes but we drove to Disneyland but enjoyed the short

The hotel is good… but it’s the amazing staff that will have me going back.     They couldn’t do enough for us.   Very kind… helpful…and happy!!!   That all need raises!!!         Corrina and the front desk staff were amazing.   As well as the gentleman in housekeeping!

We came with our son and his family.  The distance to Disney is perfect.  Our grandchildren were able to take breaks throughout the day.  There were a couple of problems that travelers need to be aware.  The convenience store next to the hotel is dangerous.  Walking through that parking lot or around it is simply DANGEROUS.   Many homeless people scattered about on the ground sleeping, watching and living.  The room we stayed in was good.  The suite made it convenient.  Upon arrival, we were met with contemt which was wierd.  When planning a trip to the happiest place on earth and you arrive at the hotel next to it and pay a premium price, you do expect the people checking you in to at least be cordial.

I paid a premium to stay here during StarWars Celebration .The Wi-Fi was horrible , something in the building kills cell signals because inside the hotel on Verizon I could not send a picture through text and then there horrible Wi-Fi literally took five minutes to upload one picture to Facebook. I step outside and cell signal is good enough to send picture text. The pool is to small and it gets crowded fast. The hotel is still using the “Covid” excuse and will not come into the room to clean and change sheets unless you ask for it. I would not stay here at the high cost I just paid again.The staff was very friendly and helpful.

The hotel has a great location.  Room was clean and beds were comfortable.  Sleeper sofa was one of the worst ever - very uncomfortable.  And breakfast was awful.  Hot water with raw oats next to it?  Canned Fruit?  The last picture in the photo gallery of the breakfast buffet is NOTHING like the breakfast buffet!!!!

Felt that the neglect in room service is unacceptable. I would give a 1 rating for it. Front desk staff mostly was polite. Asked for concierge service on dining for pizza and was told Dominoes was the best. Gross!  Loved the proximity and walking distance to Disneyland.

Was dreading staying here after the reviews but can honestly say it wasn’t that bad!  The breakfast was an added bonus and as other reviewers have said it’s a bit sparse if you don’t like waffles but as I do it saved me a lot of money over the 4 days I stayed here and was very pleased with it. We had fresh towels delivered after our first night and the trash was removed. Bedding and bathroom were clean  We used the laundry room which was easy and my partner enjoyed the free coffee in the lobby. Every time we returned to the hotel we were greeted by reception with a hello.  It took about 10-15 minutes to walk to Disney depending on speed and only one road to cross   Thought this place was going to be bad but actually can’t fault it for the money spent.

The hotel is within walking distance of Disney, has a decent pool with towels, and a decent included breakfast buffet. Positives end there. The front desk staff was unhelpful and dishonest. I needed cleaning supplies after a family member became carsick in my vehicle, and the receptionist informed me there were no paper towels or cleaning supplies available (upon return to my car I passed by the housekeeping room and saw an entire cart full of them). The elevators did not all access the 2nd floor, and instead of explaining this or helping me to my nd floor room with my 4 bags and 2 small kids, the front desk staff watched me struggle, not even offering so much as a cart. There are also no housekeeping services during the stay. The air conditioner was loud and insufficient, and

I would advise to book a room above the 3rd floor.  We had a room on the 3rd floor (room 355) that had a view of a brick wall.  We were not told about the view. Plus the buffet is located on the 5th floor, if you wish to stay there book a room above the 3rd floor. Tried to change rooms, but no upper rooms available.  There are no trams or transportation available to Disney, even though you can walk, it's a good walk bacj ti the hotel. especially after a long day at Disney.  We used uber on the way back.

If you don't stay right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland this is one of the closest hotels.  It is on the same block and wasn't too bad of walk to the gate.  We went back to our room during the day and it wasn't bad.  The rooms were clean, but no maid service besides garbages which was fine.  The breakfast was not good.  I guess if you can eat waffles each day you would be fine, but my daughter and I can not eat them and the very few other choices were not edible.  Overall the hotel was nice, but if you are looking for a decent breakfast this is not the place.  Also the hot tub could use some defoamer.

Terrible hotel with horrible breakfast. Rooms are very noisy paper thin walls. Noise until midnight and then lots of noise starts at 6 am. Doors closing people talking you name it. Just brutal. I expect the hotel to be busy but the noise here for some reason was the worst I’ve ever experienced. Would not even give it one star if it was an option. Spend your money elsewhere and get a good nights sleep.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for 4 nights and were extremely satisfied with staff and hotel all around. We're a family of 5 so we stayed in their King w/ Bunk beds room, which the kids loved. This was our first time staying at property and ultimately chose it because it was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Its right across a CVS which was perfect because on the 2nd day i had to take my son to the minute clinic at CVS as he was complaining about his ear since we had landed; turned out to be an ear infection.   Breakfast  was great and perfect to get our morning started before heading out to Disneyland. We sat outside as the inside dining was limited but LA had great weather so we didnt mind.   We'll definitely stay again the next time we go to Anaheim. Oh, and my son loved

We were there for a Disneyland trip. The location, being right on the Disneyland block, was very convenient. The hotel was clean and very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a Disney trip.

We had a small suite and the rooms are large and appropriately furnished. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful and the location is great. Took 10 min to walk to Disney and about 15-20 to Uber to airport and to Knotts Berry farm. Breakfast area is large and convenient. Food was just ok, but it's free so can't expect too fancy. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Room 110 is brutal, a super bright light shines into the room all night and no curtains to block it, just wood shutter that do little to block out the light. Also the Southside of the building is quite loud but nothing the hotel can do about that.  I would stay again but would only stay on the Northside of the building.  Also, Parking your vehicle overnight is $25 which I think is a little ridiculous for a hotel guest.

Excellent location- close, walking distance to park, restaurants & car rental.  Friendly staff & service.  Clean, comfortable rooms & lobby area.  Heated pool for night time swimming.  Could use another jacuzzi to accommodate more adults with sore feet from the all day walking at park.  Will be returning & recommending to all our friends & family.  Thank you Desert Palms

Summary Heading: perfect for families. Walkable,  spacious. Great free breakfast. Can't wait to stay here again. Super affordable.
Summary: We had a family of 4.They saw we had a long visit and upgraded us to a larger room without asking!Plenty of towels and the kitchen was well stocked.The breakfast was way better than i had anticipated.It is VERY WALKABLE distance to disney too!

The hotel was quiet and super clean rooms. The friendly staff was also a plus. The hotel breakfast was great and so many choices of food to choose. We will be coming back soon. We loved that there was also coffee in the lobby. My wife and I would grab a cup before walking to Disneyland.

This hotel has a great location because it's a pretty quick walk to Disneyland.  The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly and efficient.  The walls and floors are thin so noise is a huge issue.  The breakfast buffet was adequate.

We stayed for our Disney trip the kids love this hotel the suites are spacious and this was the second time they upgraded our room for free! Staff was very friendly and check in/out was quick and easy. We will be coming back on our next trip.

Took a random family trip for a Disney day and stayed at this hotel. Everything was so clean and tidy as well the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. Our room was spacious as well had a great view of the back of the park (could see the firework show). Was within a 10min walking distance to the entrance of the park. Will definitely stay here again

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our Disney trip
Summary: My family and I loved staying at this hotel for our Disney trip. It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The rooms were clean, beds were comfy, and we had all the amenities we needed. The staff was super friendly, kind and helpful, and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We will definitely stay here again for our next Disney trip.

The staff was friendly from the check in process to recommending restaurants in the area. The room was spacious and very clean. The resort is walking distance to the Disneyland area. I would highly recommend this resort and they also offer free breakfast.

The hotel location is great, about 10-13 min walk to  Disneyland (on the same side of Disneyland, no need to cross the street). 7 Eleven, CVS, subway, & other food options nearby. The rate is affordable, they offered discounted rate if you're a Costco member. The hotel is older but clean, spacious room (we had double queen beds) with microwave & fridge. Great shower. Breakfast from 6:30 to 10:00, served hot food options like eggs, sausages, potatoes, biscuit & gravy as well as cereals, muffin, coffee, orange juice. Breakfast room was crowded with families but staff were attentive in cleaning.  The cons: sometimes plumbing was a little noisy for a few seconds when neighbor turned the shower but it didn't bother us, pillows were a little on hard. A $35 early check-in fee. but this

Summary Heading: Took grandkids to Disneyland for Christmas
Summary: Great stay. Staff wonderful. Clean. I think parking should be included. Of course we have to park our cars and paying for parking seems ridiculous. I also wish the pool was heated and open til midnight. My grandkids wanted to swim more than Disneyland. Disneyland is an all day adventure. I was bummed about the pool hours and not being heated. December we need heated pools. If it is heated it needs to be warmer.  Other than that it is a nice hotel.

I wish I took pictures of the room we had a two room split with 4 bed and it was nice and big plenty of room . It was only 5 minutes walk to Disneyland probably less if you don’t walk slow like I do . The staff all around was super nice and any time I asked for anything they did were on it . The breakfast was perfect it had a great selection and was always hot . I really liked this hotel a lot and will be using them in the future it was in the perfect spot in town and it was a nice hotel

Hotel will not let you keep your car on site after noon on the day of your check-out. I offered to pay for an additional day of hotel parking (because parking is $18 per night here at the hotel) and they told me no. So if you are planning to continue to visit Disney Parks on your check-out day, you will have to find a parking structure somewhere else. I had to move my car from the hotel and into the Toy Story parking lot and pay an additional $30 on the day of my check-out. This took us an additional 1 & 1/2 hr to get to the park. For being a Good Neighbor hotel, they are not accommodating for Disney guests. Will never stay here again !

Just the worst stay and awful people that are unprofessional. I expect such an expensive stay to be on their best behavior when you are accommodating families. There we’re other unhappy families there and it’s unfortunate that we wasted our hard earned money for this awful stay.

The only good part about our stay was the breakfast, We were there 5 days and no housekeeping services.  We had to change our own sheets, put our trash and linens outside the door. There were only 2 evening front desk gals that were friendly. We had family coming the following day and they would not let me pay for the room in advance or would be charged an early check-in fee. They already had my credit card on file. Kids running up and down the halls and the walls were paper thin. Traffic was very noisy in the back bedroom. We had a 2-bedroom 2 bath room. Overpriced for what you get. Our trip was great, except for the hotel.

Had a great stay! The staff was friendly and helped with any questions we had and met all our needs quickly and happily. The rooms were very clean. Housekeeping isn’t coming into your rooms for covid safety… But emptied trash left out in the hall and took dirty towels and replaced towels shampoo and other needs quickly! The breakfast was warm and good, great way to start a Disneyland day! Close easy walk to the parks! Would stay here again anytime!

We had canceled are room reservations 2 weeks prior to our stay well within company policy. We found a way better deal exactly right across the street from the park,  We were charged $187.00! Called up as soon as we noticed. We were told on 2 different attempts “it was the hotels fault give us 24 hours.” We have stayed here a few times before without incident. I believe they are trying  stealing people money because of the losses they took during the pandemic. I will keep calling everyday till I get my refund.

This was an excellent experience I highly recommend this hotel. Very clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating . It’s a short walk to Disneyland. The breakfast was delicious as well. Close to the store too

Pros: *Friendly staff *Pool and jacuzzi open until 10pm *Within walking distance to Disneyland  Cons: *Terrible breakfast buffet! Poor selection, unappetizing and I saw hair in multiple buffet trays. *Parking is $20 per day *AC wasn't working right, it was making a super loud sound all the time when on, we had to keep it off so we were freezing. *Paper thin walls. I could clearly hear some guy pissing, gargling, coughing, talking all night in the next room.

The location is great, its short distance to the disnyland. Upon check in Jackie, was very customer service oriented and attentive.. She was very welcoming overall. Overall the hospitality was great..   Thank you again Desert Palms Hotel and Suites,  Mr. Garcia

First time staying at Desert Palms. Other reviews seemed to be all over the place so I prepared myself that there might be a good chance i’d be unhappy with aspects of my stay.   We arrived early(before 7am after a red eye) and were offered early checkin for an extra fee for an accessible room. We took it! This allowed a quick power nap before starting our day. The room was comfortable, clean, modern - not dated furnishings, carpet, decor etc. The bathroom was fine, included a tub and i guess due to accessibility was quite large - we only missed a bit if counter space and hook behind the bathroom door. Again, due to accessibility, we were near an elevator Which was convenient but noisy when at the peak times of family coming and going but it really wasnt an issue - we were there

I had booked a two bedroom suite with kitchen two months prior and also called ahead then for a high-up room--a room with a view is what they promised on the phone. Upon arrival, they told us they "did the best they could". Our view was a wall. Our room also did not include the kitchen that the website advertised at the time of booking--not the same website advertisement two months later, which was misleading. Our room was half the size expected with no view. the only decent part was the breakfast. the housekeeping came in for dirty towels but didn't make the beds or tidy up anything. the front staff was not accommodating when these issues were brought up and blew it off like there was nothing they could do. NEVER COME HERE. don't waste your money here.

Summary Heading: Getaway to Disneyland (4 night at place)
Summary: 9/27/2021- 9.30-2021 check out time was 11:00AM Stayed in room 118 it was a small room with not many TV channels, back window had a parking lot so one can hear all that came in and out them going along with the excited kids coming out of the cars.  Toilet was way too low for the Handicap to get back up after taking care of body function.  No Bidet on the toilet to wash off with. No round table in the room to sit with family around, Was next to a 711 store so it seem to attract the homeless and made it feel unsafe to walk around with family.  The food was good and the people that working in a cafe' helped a lot. Not many channels on TV to watch Loud sounds of walking in the room above when one tries to sleep, and you even hear the pipes when they take a show. The pool was wounder

Our stay with Desert Palms was wonderful. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff is so helpful and friendly. The entire property is very clean and attractive. The breakfast is good too. There are conference rooms for business. They have elevators so you do not have to climb stairs with your luggage and they have luggage carriers wheel your luggage to your room.  I just enjoy staying here.

Summary Heading: great hotel experience for a very good price!
Summary: Very convenience hotel, just a 10 minutes walk from disneyland, very clean, confortable and with a good service! And they have very good prices. They also have a pool and a jacuzzi that you enjoy after a exausting day in the parks.

I booked ahead of time after ensuring I could have an early check in for a business call. However, upon arrival, front desk had no record of that even though I gave them my card info over the phone... Thankfully the room was available early BUT $30 to check in early. That seems rather unethical when the room is available. I understand if it had been held they might need to charge, but they made it clear they had no idea I was coming early... I had to upgrade the internet ($7) to make a basic video call. Parking is $18. There is tax and then an additional Anaheim tax and ultimately all the additional charges doubled the price of the room. Breakfast was great and rooms comfy! Just disappointed by the value. Only booked with them because they could guarantee the early check in.

very clean and spacious room , stuff was very friendly , breakfast was great , it was quiet and nice , i would recommend this hotel to friends and would love to stay again, pool was clean but a bit cold , hot tub was warm and nice

Summary Heading: Horribly loud, wouldn't allow us to leave vehicle on last day.
Summary: I asked for a quiet room but was told you were at capacity however the room we were offered would be quiet.  Instead it had a shared door and we heard our neighbors all night till 2-3am.  And, it was next to elevator and ice machine.  My wife didn't sleep at all the first night. And the bed wasn't comfortable.  We were told nothing could be done.  Also, I've never been told to take my car off property on my last day in my life at any Disney area hotel.  Dozens of trips. But we had to due to the lack of parking at your hotel.  Combined with my original hotel at Desert Inn being cancelled by your hotel and having to move to one further from Disney this was the worst hotel experience I've had staying at Disney in my life.

We stay here often as we visit 3 to 4 times a year. Nice place to say and generally affordable. The only complaints are the charge for parking (where else can we park except on the premises), weak breakfasts and an intermittent loss of of internet service. It's room, comfortable and close to the park. I recommend it, but the parking charge is irritating.

Summary Heading: Staff went above and beyond for us!
Summary: The front desk staff were so friendly and accommodating. They wished my daughter a happy birthday in our room and were very friendly throughout the trip. The suite was amazing the kids loved staying here. Will definitely be back.

My family enjoyed our stay. The hotel decor was nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was clean, convenient and had a variety of options. Safety/health protocols in place due to Covid-19 so rooms weren’t cleaned daily but trash and dirty linens were picked up daily. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub too.

This hotel is a little pricey but the walk to Disneyland is perfect. It’s literally five minutes from the hotel. The breakfast buffet is awesome and my kids loved it. Our room was very large and spacious. The only problem was that our AC unit kept turning off and our room was hot for half our stay. Otherwise the stay was beautiful. We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and balcony and it was a great experience.

The entire hotel was spotless. The staff was very helpful. The Superior room was very spacious. The hotel was within walking distance to Disneyland, Garden Walk, and many restaurants. There is a Walgreens and CVS across the street and a 7-11 convenience store right next door.

Summary Heading: Clean hotel located just minutes from the Disneyland.
Summary: This is a very clean and well maintained hotel conveniently located just minutes walk from the Disneyland. Our room was very clean and spacious. Staff was friendly and ready to help. Kids enjoyed the pool after long day of traveling. This will be our hotel of choice every time we visit.

Only a 10 minute walk to the Esplanade of Disney/DCA is fabulous! Some of the hotels across the street, we could see ppl waiting forever to cross the intersection & this path is a straight shot! Spacious & clean, very friendly, very quick to replentish towels (since we opted to not have room cleaned) & bring us coffee maker. We didn't use the spa or pool but it looks great lit up at night with colored lights & decor. Nice to have the coffee machine in the lobby always available + creamers.  Also great were the amount of luggage carriers to use.  Definitely worth staying!

-Need to pay extra for parking ($16 /day) -Biggest advantage of booking this place - Very walkable from Disneyland (10 minutes) - Pool - well heated, so was the jacuzzi - Breakfast - could be better. We stayed for 5 days and we got the same blueberry muffins and the same energy bar every day.  They give you bottled water with breakfast that can be easily skipped. Unnecessary plastic wastage, given that they also have a filtered water bottle refilling station in the hotel. - Water bottle filling station - loved that they had that but the filter needed maintenance, which they didn't replace even after I told them that it needed replacement.   Rooms - Decent. Mattress and pillows were uncomfortable. Cleaning service was limited due to covid. We didn't mind that since we think that,

Summary Heading: 3 stars with a few tweaks could be 4
Summary: Here the thing. This hotel is great. It has an ideal location to the Disney Parks (5 min walk) as well as an ideal location to the Anaheim Convention Center (across the street).   It’s right next door to a 7-11 for regular-priced food items and drinks. No need to pay hotel or park pricing.  The service is great. Very helpful and friendly. Will store luggage if needed. Parking is somewhat reasonable. Free breakfast.  The only reason I rank this hotel 3 out of 5 is because it just needs a few tweaks to make it to 4 stars and, in my opinion, a returner.  First, the carpets need replacing because they smell. Rooms and hallways. There’s just a “cheap hotel” stench which could be easily fixed. Second, they need to update their bedding. No one likes to sleep in a bed that contains an

Summary Heading: Considering the Global Pandemic, my experience was good...
Summary: Considering the Global Pandemic, my experience was good. Some of the services were absent because of the present situation but it would have been nice to have complimentary breakfast but I understand the situation.

Staff was very friendly and the hotel is beautiful - just opened up three weeks before we got there, as they were closed due to COVID. We had a suite with two beds and a hide-a-bed, which was perfect for five people. Will stay again for sure.

Our family of 7 booked a family room and a single queen room for 3 nights.  I called ahead to arrange for the rooms to be close together.  They upgraded us for free to a room with 2 beds so we could be side by side.  We were in town for the re-opening of Disneyland, and they were re-opening as well.  That considered, our stay was very nice.  The family room with a double sized bunk bed met our needs very well.  The hotel is only a 10 minute walk to the Main Gate.  Because of COVID restrictions, there is no food service.  But we planned ahead to use the microwave and refrigerator and brought our own breakfast items.

We stayed here for our California holiday as 4 adults and loved it! The layout of a bedroom with 2 queens, 2 bathrooms and then another room with 2 queens is perfect for a family of 4 adults! Gives you privacy and space but still together. I wish more hotels did rooms like this! From our room we could see the back of Disney which just added to the excitement! A perfect hotel for Disney stays, about 10 minutes max walk to the park. We couldn’t have asked for a better location or a nicer hotel! Loved it and would highly recommend!

Wonderful staff. Nice pool with hot tub. Great breakfast. They even made a towel elephant for my daughter one day. Very accommodating. We really liked the hotel. Hallways were quiet. Beds were comfortable. The whole place was impeccably clean. It was great.

The hotel was great. Clean rooms, good breakfast and friendly staff. However the room they put us in (first floor room 116) was right next to an exit door and the parking lot. We had people coming in and out all hours of the night and day. It was extremely loud! We (including our toddler) did not get one good nights rest in the 5 days we were there. Overall it was a good stay but didn't like paying as much as we did for that experience.

Love the location, easy to walk to Disneyland or take an Uber.  It's our 2nd time staying here, but over 30 years of Good Neighbor hotels, the Desert Palms has become my favorite.  Convenient location, love that there's a bar and restaurant and free breakfast.   Friendly staff and very comfortable beds.  I always recommend this hotel to others.

From Check-in to Check-out the staff could not have been more attentive and informative.  Loved the lay-out of the room which allowed everyone to have some me time.  The Corona virus was hitting hard but the staff rose to the occasion and we felt safe .  The distance to Disneyland was a very doable and delightful walk  Centrally located near many restaurants and coffee shops makes the location of the Desert Palms perfect.  I would highly recommend a stay when you are in the area.

We are family of 6 and this hotel was great for us. It had 2 tv's and a curtain we could close. The breakfast was really good. The staff was fantastic. It is a close walk to Disneyland about 12 minutes. It is very close to IHOP where kids eat free after 4 pm.

I stayed here last year for a work conference and again this year for a conference. The room this year was nice enough, clean with nice decor. The walls are thin, I could hear people running all night on the floor above me. The front desk staff is hit or miss for kindness and professional assistance. Parking is very limited.  Location is great for walking to Disney and it is a straight shot there. There are lots of restaurants near by and Walgreens, CVS and Starbucks.

Summary Heading: "Outside" Disneyland Resort with a didtance of walking.
Summary: This hotel although located "outside" Disneyland Resort but took nearly 15mins walk in order to get to the main entrance. A 7-11 located just next to it. Big hotel lobby equipped with lots of seats but staff on duty (@ counter) always not more than 2.  Assigned with room 364, large spacious and bright room equipped with 2double beds, microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, ironing facilities etc. Room was facing the swimming pool, self washing machine with dryer and ice machine was provided at level 3. Bathromm was so spacious but without hangers for clothing or rack/tray for toiletries etc. The is only a towel rack and a chair inside the shower room. Breakfast hall held at level 5 rather small,always packed with families with small kids. 3-4 hot dishes, that changed almost every

Summary Heading: Are you serious with this price?
Summary: Really badly ran hotel, front desk can’t make any changes or help in anyway, they give you a number to call. Beware of hidden fees, making your stay almost twice what was quoted. The homeless population right outside the hotel was pretty bad. We had to leave after just a day of this place, and the front desk could not even check us out we had to call yet another number, disappointed for sure.

Very close to Disneyland.  The hotel is very nice and the rooms are quite nice.  The breakfast included was great but much too small of a room for the amount of people in the hotel.  It was a great hot breakfast.  The staff was very nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: I would highly recommend another hotel if you are going to Disneyland.
Summary: We dealt with rude staff, excessive noise at the hotel, terrible and unhealthy breakfast options (not to mention the extreme amount of waste and zero recycling), and the most uncomfortable bed with the cheapest pillows and linens I have every stayed at. I would never stay here again.

Second time staying here because of the location and cleanliness.   Staff are very nice and helpful.   Adequate breakfast.   Love the newly added cafe and proximity to Wallgreens, restaurants and short walk to Disney.  However...the walls and floors are so thin that conversations carry through walls, walking and pounding feet overhead, and we happened to be there with groups of cheer leaders (competition), and the screeching and carrying on up and down the halls was very disruptive.  If you can sleep through anything - this is your place.  If not, bring noise cancelling headphones!  But nice hotel none-the-less.

So - I am not usually that person who complains about such petty stuff. But we had paid over 5k AUD for 11 nights which isn’t chump change. Overall it was a good stay so will balance out the positive with the areas lacking from our perspective.   Check in was easy enough, got our room an hour before check in time which is always a bonus. We were put on level 3 and we had booked a 2bedroom 2bathroom suite. Doesn’t have a kitchenette but does have fridge etc. nice and spacious with 2x double beds in each room. With only 2 of us it meant we could spread out. Rooms were clean and well stocked, beds comfy, pillows good enough. AC is noisy and trick to use, so you either freeze or get to hot. It was cool overnight whilst we were here so it was fine. Our room didn’t get any sun so

Love the room with Kitchen. Free wifi, Free breakfast buffet, Coffee 24/7 Will come here every year for the Namm convention at the Anaheim convention center. This will always be our go to spot. Looks like a nice pool area too.

Summary Heading: An excellent hotel for a Disneyland visit.
Summary: We visited Disneyland as part of a larger holiday and stayed 4 nights at the Desert Palms hotel. The hotel is modern and the rooms generous In size with plenty of power sockets to plug in the myriad electronic devices of a family holiday.  It’s about 12 minutes walk from the Disneyland entrance, and we walked home in the middle of each day for lunch and  a swim in the heated outdoor pool to break up the long days of queueing and riding. Soaking in the hot tub while the kids swam was great after a long day of walking and standing. The hotel has coin operated washing machines, which was very helpful, and the breakfast was pretty decent American standard breakfast fare with alternating cooked items including omelettes, scrambled eggs, turkey sausages and potatoes along with the

Summary Heading: The little things make a huge difference
Summary: While the hotel is beautiful & modern, they cut corners in other areas that really make a good hotel stay. Our room door wouldn't lock upon arrival, there was no hairdryer in the room, the shower knob was loose which made it hard to adjust the temperature, the eggs & meats at breakfast are processed foods that go right through you, and the staff was hardly ever at the front desk when we approached it. When told about our issues, they responded that we could switch rooms, but not understanding how hard it would be to move five people to another hotel room.

I am so happy with the accommodations at this hotel. It was everything I read about and I am adding a positive review! We were a group of 12 in 4 rooms. We reserved all the different rooms, king with bunk beds, king with kitchen suite, and 2 with double beds. Everyone was comfortable! The walking distance of 10 minutes was accurate.  It was clean, breakfast/staff was great, pool & hot tub enjoyable.  Would recommend to anyone traveling to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Clean, Great Staff, Close to Disney
Summary: We have stayed here several times during visits to Disneyland. The hotel is always clean, and the staff is friendly. Our first night we had a first floor room, and the first floor was pretty noisy. Of course, with any hotel you do have the potential to deal with loud neighbors and people in the hallway, but there isn't really much to block the noise between the first floor rooms and the lobby/pool area, so it was really loud and echo-y where we were. We did have a small issue with cigarette smoke smell coming into our bathroom (this is a non-smoking hotel), however we talked to the front desk about it and they said it was likely from someone smoking outside, as we had a corner room. Without us even asking, they immediately offered to move us up to a quiet third floor room so we

A very nice and very clean hotel with excellent facilities. Located a short walk from the entrance to Disneyland and located in the middle of so many different restaurants, drug stores and shops. We didn't drive but inside parking was available and after a long day in the Magic Kingdom the pool & hot tub were great for calming the grandkids! All the staff were very friendly and responsive to our needs. Will happily recommend this hotel to our friends.

We have been to Disneyland many times; however, this was our very best stay. The location and amenities of this hotel are perfect. The room is ideal for families. The breakfast is great (other than seating can be difficult). The rooms are extremely clean, elevators run quickly, staff is great, and we will not consider any other hotels for future visits.

We just came back from visiting the magic kingdom and it was our first time going during Christmas.  And of course, it was magically.  This time we stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites.  Excellent value and great staff.  The rooms were extremely comfortable and clean.  There were three of us and we two queen beds and a separate seating area with a pull out sofa.  We also had a great view of the Guardians of the Galaxy ride at California Adventure.  The hotel also offered a continental breakfast which was very good and the staff is so attentive.  We stayed for three nights and the parking fee was about $17 a day.  There is also so many restaurants and drugstores like CVS and Walgreens  which are literally right across the street, in case you need to pick something up like

We booked this hotel while we were on our winter holiday visiting the magic kingdom. The staff was very pleasant and extremely helpful and attentive.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  The continental breakfast was very good that the staff were very kind and made sure that everything was well stocked and clean.  We parked our car in the parking lot and was charged about $17 a day for parking which was very decent, plus everything was so close to us, Disneyland, CVS, Walgreens, Blaze Pizza, etc., we never had to use our car to drive anywhere.  We definitely will come back here when we visiting Disneyland again.

We booked this Hotel using our Alaska Air Miles. It was a great choice. Easy walking to Disneyland. Clean rooms convenient to restaurants and fast food service. Large parking and even a restaurant on site.

Summary Heading: Excellent location and service close to Disney and the Convention Center
Summary: I was at the hotel for a convention at the Anaheim Center.  This hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  It was located close to disney so I was able to walk to downtown disney and have dinner. I was able to walk to the convention center, restaurants and disney.  I parked the car in their lot and walked everywhere until I had to leave.  Enjoyed my stay at this hotel!

We require 2 rooms when we travel. We got the king with bunk beds and 2 queens. The staff upgraded our 2 queens to a suite so our rooms would be next door. The rooms were big, quiet, clean, and comfortable. The staff friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was good also. We plan on staying here again.

We visited during Thanksgiving week. The staff was incredibly friendly and polite. Rooms were spotless. We were “upgraded” for free to a room with bunk beds - my kids were thrilled to not have to share a bed! I love that there was a sink outside of the bathroom as well as one inside - helps when 4 people are getting ready at the same time. Breakfast was adequate - nothing special, the breakfast staff were attentive to needs and very polite. My complaint - the room was SMALL. Absolutely no where at all to put a suitcase - even on the floor. We were forced to put clothes in drawers just so we could put our suitcases in the closet out of the way. We would probably stay here again - but maybe ask for a different type of room.

The big plus for this place is location, it’s in a great spot for access to Disneyland & has a 7/11 & A mart right next door, with a CVS across the road. Got a family room with2 queen beds & a fold out lounge. Room was pretty spacious & in pretty good condition.  Overall the workers done a pretty good job & the motel was kept nice & clean & in pretty good condition. The breakfast was basic & not bad however it stays pretty much the same so if your there for longer than a few days you might need to look at going elsewhere for a change. The pool & spa were also on good condition & like the rest of the place well maintained. TIP, ask if your room is facing the 7/11 because if it is you’ll be getting early wake ups with trucks backing into drop off good to the 7/11 & crates banging

All I can say that's kind about this hotel is the location, which is near the convention center and the major attractions. The property is noisy, between the screeching plumbing, the equally screeching kids running around, the noise in the pool area and on the street. I never got a decent night of sleep. The breakfast buffet is very low quality food and limited options. There is also a problem with street harassment in the area near the hotel. I was sexually harassed on multiple occasions walking in the vicinity of the hotel. I alerted the desk clerk who said they knew about the issue but there was nothing they could do. Unacceptable. Will not stay there again.

Overall, the hotel was clean, comfortable, and a short distance from Disneyland. The breakfast buffet was limited in choice of items but okay otherwise. The staff was friendly and helpful and this hotel is a great choice for families on a Disney vacation.

This hotel has all you need to make your vacation easy and fun. Helpful, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms, free breakfast, on site restaurant, pool, fitness room, wifi. Within walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure but we chose to buy the shuttle passes. You can also purchase your Disneyland passes at the front desk.

We loved it here.  Sergio (desk staff) was extra helpful, the food was good, and it was a short walk to Disney.  My daughter enjoyed the pool too.  Everything was nice and clean and updated. It was a great stay!

I stayed at this hotel for a week with my family for a Disneyland vacation.  Excellent location... actually walking distance, even after a long day at the park.   We had a suite with a king bed and bunk beds, it was spacious and comfortable.  The air conditioning seemed to kick in on it’s own... so pack warmer pj’s. The pool was nice, not overly warm though. The free breakfast was a great perk!  It was perfectly adequate (not gourmet).  Every morning we were able to wake up and have food (and fresh coffee) in our stomachs before we left the hotel.   The staff were great.  If you stay at the hotel you get 15% off at the hotel restaurant.  I found the parking expensive, but safe and easy access.   This is absolutely a hotel that we would stay at again and would recommend to

We stay here every time we come to Los Angeles.  My daughter and her family also stays here. We all came this time we had great rooms for families. Its only 2 blocks from Disneyland the walk is very nice day or night.  Last year it was just myself and my husband and we came down for Christmas in Disneyland and we know this is where we always stay. Lori

Summary Heading: Too Much Variability in the room
Summary: All three couples paid the same price and each got drastically different size and style of room. We had the smallest room with a view out our window of wait for it... A WALL! For $500 it was not worth it to be on the same side of the street as Disney. We go every year during this time and I can assure you we will never being staying there again.

Very clean,good location,good breakfast and friendly staff,but the manager was very unhelpful and unsympathetic to the needs of my autistic grandchild.she has no training or clue in how to deal with children with special needs,she ruined a great stay because of her insensitivity

Desert Palms Hotel was a great place to stay. The staff was very friendly & check-in was very smooth. Short walk to Disneyland, which was nice we could spend the mornings and evenings(for nightly events) at Disneyland.

Sergio, Natalie and Aman are the best hotel staff I've ever seen. They went above and beyond to make sure our experience was amazing and truly were a treat!  Based on the hotel location and the customer service mentioned above, I will never stay in a different location in Anaheim again!

Summary Heading: Excellent family hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel had everything we required - the room accommodated the 6 of us comfortably, the breakfast was great and the location superb.  Would recommend for families visiting Disneyland - only a 10 minute walk to the entrance.

Great location, easy 10 min walk to Disneyland. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was fine, I did feel guilty with having to use the plastic plates and cutlery on offer. Perhaps a change to plates that can be reused, better for the environment.

Nice place to stay close to Disneyland. Easy walking distance to Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, Bubba Gumps, Pizza Press. Clean & tidy but would really missed a balcony to sit out at night whilst kids rested after long days at Theme parks.Stayed at Howard Johnson last visit to the US & found that better value for money & better with 3 teenage kids.

We had two rooms in our party, and both of us were put into accessible rooms (us 411, them 211), I assume because we checked in late.  The room we were supposed to be in was a "Deluxe Room, 2 Queen Beds", but it was far from deluxe.  I assume that because it was an accessible room there were fewer pieces of furniture—other than the beds, a tv stand, fridge/microwave, and a VERY small desk, there was nothing else.  This meant that and we had to have our stuff all on the floor—and for a family of 4, that's a lot of stuff.  There wasn't even any counter space in the bathroom, and we had to use the ironing board as a counter—I am not kidding, there was a toilet and a very small wall mounted sink with no place to put things.  There was more than enough room to have some kind of

We chose this hotel due to it's proximity to Disneyland for a recent family trip. A really nice and clean hotel with attentive staff. We all enjoyed our stay in this hotel and definitely would stay here again. The breakfast is so convenient and a great way to start the day

It was great for our Disneyland trip.It was about a 10 min walk to Disneyland. It had free breakfast every morning.Mske your own waffles,egg,and fresh fruit and yogurt. It was good. The pool and hot tub were nice. It also has washers and dryers for doing laundry which came in handy as we camped coming up the oregan coast. The rooms were clean and a good size. Would stay here again.

The hotel was really nice and clean.  The staff was very friendly and responded quickly to any requests.  It is only a short (10-15 minute) walk to the front gate, but there is also an ART shuttle directly in front of the hotel that you can buy daily passes for.  The only downside was the noise from the shower above us that woke me up both nights, but it was otherwise a great place to stay.

We stayed in the mini suite with the bunkbeds. Our 2 daughters had gift bags waiting for them when we arrived. Our girls had a blast in their room and loved the pool. The buffet breakfast had a decent variety and the hotel was very clean. Staff was friendly! 10 minute walk to Disney. We’ll stay here again!

Summary Heading: Trip for Halloween Party at Disneyland
Summary: The check in was easy and fast. The gentlemen that helped me was awesome! The room was clean and what we expected. The breakfast buffet was good, mix between hot and cold items. Overall selection was good, enough to keep you sustained to start your morning at park. The waffle machine was enjoyed by my family. Housekeeping did a great job, except for final day we found coffee spilled on the desk on our laptop, no damage thankfully. The distance to the park is great and there is a wal-greens, CVS and 7-11 close along with an affordable gift shop on the walk to the park. I would recommend and I would definitely stay again.

Just a short walk to Disneyland. Close to CVS and 7eleven.  The room was very clean, my daughter loved the towel animal left on the bed. The wifi was fast and reliable. The buffet breakfast had a good selection and was very tasty.  The employees were knowledgeable and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in an excellent location
Summary: A very good hotel. Room was very good and suited my family of four. The bunk beds were loved by the kids and had plenty of room for them and their bed stuff. The hotel breakfast was good. Plenty of options to choose from, though you had to get there early to ensure you got everything that was available. The pool was good, but got pretty crowded later in the day when families returned from the parks. Used the fitness center once. It had the basics and allowed you to get in a decent workout. Best aspect was its location to the Disneyland parks and other amenities. A 10 minute easy walk to the parks and very handy to other shops and eating places.

Pros of this hotel: Very close to Disneyland - just a short walk (10 mins.). Breakfast was pretty good (typical hotel breakfast buffet) and workers at the breakfast were very attentive. Room was clean and spacious. Restaurants and Starbucks within walking distance.  Cons: Didn't use pool 'cause floor of pool was noticbly dirty. Our room (116) was close to an outside door which opened and closed very loudly.

Walking distance 8 minutes to Disneyland- could be faster but we were pushing 2 kids on strollers.  Love the rooms and the hotel decor  Super extremely friendly staff  Free breakfast  WiFi slow but who cares if you’re gonna spend majority of day at parks  Beautiful hotel !!! We are not going anywhere else from now on  - will be staying here every year for our annual Disneyland trip

Summary Heading: The best hotel in Anaheim Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is just next door of Disneyland main entrance and its gorgeous, everything was excellent, from the staff in the lobby, managers, housekeeping, free breakfast.  They have new furniture, new LED lighting fixtures in 100% of the property, this is the best hotel definitely in Disneyland Resort District.  This hotel from the qualification of 1 to 10, they deserve 20 Stars  Everything was Excellent !!

Stayed while I was going to the D23 expo. Everyone on staff was super nice and helpful!!  Breakfast was okay but free so no complaints lol. Had a decent selection of food. Only thing I’d request more of would be fruit maybe? since the only thing was oranges when I went. Other than that it’s decent.   Room was nice - not much of a view but I wasn’t staying there for the view. It was clean and comfy.   It’s also super convenient in distance to Disneyland and the convention center. Both only a 5-10 minute walk. Will definitely be looking at staying here again when I go back next time!! :)

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, Cal. Adventure and The Anaheim Convention center
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms Hotel.  The pool was nice and warm, the rooms were clean and the staff very helpful and friendly.  It was a little pricey but had we had 4 to 6 people (instead of 2) it would be a good value.  Walking distance to Disneyland , CA Adventure and Downtown Disney as well as lots of good restaurants.  Glad we didn't have to get in the car to go anywhere.

AAA to the Dessert Palms for comfort, convenience, clean and Quiet. The hotel has really nice staff, easy check in and really good nights sleep and walking distance to Disney.  Even within wheelchairs can be rolled to Disney with only one street to cross ! Great for families with kids a pool and breakfast included   We will definitely stay here again!

Stayed here while being big kids going to Disneyland. Good clean rooms,  quiet as well.  Very helpful staff especially when we needed to change our plans . Only letdown? Breakfast, horrible , sorry but was all out of packets. Would I stay again?? Yes, certainly

Summary Heading: My stay was for a week, to work at the Convention Center - very close and convenient location.
Summary: In general, the hotel is well located, confortable, easy to commute and clean - just not get a better rate due to the breakfast quality - very poor. On my survey, about the breakfast, I´m suggesting them to pay attention and to improve its quality.

My stay was for just one night in Anaheim, but everything was fine. No complains. Absolute silence in the room. 5 min walking from the convetion center. Reasonable compromise between qualityh and price. Best suited for families.

We just stayed here, clean hotel, new carpeting and bathrooms looked new, furniture was a bit worn looking though.  Quick and friendly check in and when we asked we were upgraded to a family room on the 4th floor with a Disney view and a separate room with bunk beds from a 2 queen room on the first floor and no extra charge.
