Safe parking in the underground - no charge as we booked as a Disney good neighbor.  Breakfast was just ok but not horrible, you can make the best of it or go out for breakfast at Denny’s down the way.   All and all very happy with our stay would give 5* for hotel for what we expected gave a bit lower as the breakfast could have been a bit better.

I brought my daughter and two of her friends to stay here for VidCon 2019. We arrived on a Wednesday after 3:30 pm which is the check-in time according to the website. The lobby was very busy, but the actual line was not long. At check-in I was advised my Jr. Suite was not ready, but I was able to have a room with a kitchenette. As we had dinner plans that evening we needed to get ready for I accepted the change. I was also advised that due to using a debit card I would be charged the full amount of my stay plus in a separate transaction I would need to authorize $20 in case any incidentals needed to be charged to the room. This would have been fine, but they did not tell me was $20 per day and it would authorize separate transactions each day. The next day when   I went to the

The Desert Palms Hotel and Suites, was a very beautiful and clean hotel, the breakfast was very good with a lot of options. The swimming pool was nice and clean everyday and the overall stay at the hotel was beautiful. There was a lot of stores and restaurants around the hotel which made it very easy to eat and shop. I would definitely recommend  this hotel for anyone traveling to California or Disneyland.

There are a lot of hotels in and around Anaheim. It's a busy area around the theme parks so if you book in advance, you'll get a damn good deal at a great price. Yes I sound like I work there but I really don't. I'd never been to Anaheim and I went with mates purely to do an adrenaline holiday, nothing but theme parks, as many as possible in 10 days. We did it! This hotel is amazing, all the things you'd possibly need, the staff are really helpful and a pleasure to deal with. I'd definitely come back here again.

We enjoyed our comfortable suite here. Great it had a door and bunk beds for the room for the kids. Other guests here are pretty inconsiderate and extremely noisy at all hours which you can well hear and this would be my only minus. Staff were great. Breakfast was free and good. Location is excellent with a 5 minute walk to Disneyland or a quick ART bus ride. A great choice for us and would stay again here without a doubt.

Pictures on site are very misleading. We booked the family suite and the living area had a very uncomfortable couch that only sat 2 people. So the other 2 people had to watch the movie or relax after a long day at Disneyland at the kitchen table. The beds are horribly uncomfortable and the sheet is crinkly like sand paper. My baby kept waking up just with us making the slightest move. The staff is very friendly otherwise. It's close to the park. The free breakfast is great. If we go back, I'd look at staying at a different hotel just because the room was so small, and not comfortable.

Our Airbnb was cancelled on us and we found this great hotel at the last minute. Good rate and within 10 minute walking distance from both the Anaheim convention center and Disneyland. Perfect for our stay. The room was large and comfortable. Free breakfast and covered parking.

We planned a last minute trip to Disneyland last summer. This was the cheapest hotel with the highest rating we could find.  We typically stay at Doubletree down the street. I cannot say this hotel comes close to Doubletree. However it was clean, it did not smell and was perfect to just rest our heads at night.  It is definitely not the type of resort you want to hang out at. If you want a hotel to swim and relax at I might suggest a different hotel. The gift shop closes early which was an inconvenience as we needed to get some last minute toiletries.  Lucky for us there was a CVS no to far down the street.

Summary Heading: Just OK - Average hotel in Anaheim
Summary: With so much choice to choose from for a Disneyland visit, we picked this as we wanted something at a walking distance to Disneyland and wanted a hotel feel.  The bad: 1) Rooms were average. Disappointing linen and bed options. Bathrooms were refurbished and well lit but lacked the ergonomic factor. 2) This hotel must have many badly designed rooms. The front desk assigned a room that was claustrophobic with a wall outside and pump station noise. The alternate was equally bad. We were moved to a 3rd room. At night, we turned the A/C on and it made terrible noise. So at 10.30 PM we moved into the 4th room. This was reasonable but still had a staircase and wall blocking the window view. Weird design of the hotel from inside. The front desk staff is trained to get rid of the bad

When we checked in, the concierge asked why were in LA and we told him for our Honeymoon. He said congratulations and then proceeded to give us a terrible room. Room 210 is an obvious conversion from a suite. The adjoining door is still there and early one morning someone tried to forcefully open it. The room is also right next to the trash bins where at 630am the garbage truck would wake us up. We will never stay here again. The concierge knew full well that we were on our honeymoon and then knowingly put us in a terribly located room! We weren't looking for a room upgrade, but at least give us a nicely located room. Instead, the concierge went out of his way to ruin our honeymoon!

We stayed in the family suite, for five days, with six people. Worked out very well for us. Grandparents stayed in one bedroom, family of four in one bedroom. The two bathrooms were in the middle of of the two bedrooms.  Breakfast was good everyday. They do switch it up a little. Did have to pay $22 a day for parking, on top of the room price. Pool needs to be redone. Service was amazing. Employees were great! Restaurant had great food! Walkable to Disneyland. Probably 1/4 mile, took ten minutes, right up the street.

The hotel was clean and staff friendly.  Easy walking distance to Disneyland, which was important to us.  My only complaint was the quality of the breakfast buffet.  The oatmeal was too watery to eat.  The hot breakfast items were not very tasty and some items were gone shortly after breakfast hours began.

We love the room!! So spacious and the kids have their own space and TV The only thing we are upset about is that we have spent double the money at other hotels and the rooms haven’t been this nice!!  We for sure will be letting friends and family know where they should stay.

We stayed in one of they’re bunk bed rooms for 7 nights while visiting Disneyland with our 2 kids. This is our 3rd time staying here over the last 8 years.  Sadly this will most likely be our last.  In the past we’ve enjoyed the decent selection for breakfast and waffles bring one of our favorites. This time the selection was horrible and minimal (no waffles) and the hot food (eggs, sausage patties) were not good.   Our biggest frustration over this stay was coming back to our room close to midnight every night, to find that the cleaning staff had not made the bunk beds, but had put a clean folded top sheet & folded blanket on the top & bottom beds for us to make.  This is not a cheap hotel for us to come back at midnight after being in the park for 16 hours and want to make

Summary Heading: Perfect for families, great location to Disney.
Summary: Booked this hotel rather last minute for a family trip to Disneyland.  Pleasantly surprised.  We got a suite with a king bed and a separate room for the kids with a bunk bed.  Both were spacious and very comfortable.  My kids are tall so it was great that the bunk beds are actually doubles.  They had their own TV and a sliding door for privacy and quiet.  The area in between the rooms has a fridge and microwave which is great for snacking and light meals.  The complimentary breakfast buffet was quite nice with a selection of everything from eggs and waffles to fresh fruit, oatmeal and yogurt along with juice and coffee. The location was also great.  It is a pleasant, short walk to the theme park so you don't have to worry about parking, shuttles, etc.   Overall, a nice hotel,

Summary Heading: Clean, fairly new hotel near convention center that is affordable.
Summary: Attending convention yearly, so has gone through many price range hotels,  overall this one is best value.  Free so so quality breakfast, walking distance to convention center, fairly new hotel with friendly staffs and very affordable.

We stayed in the two bedroom and two bathroom suite which was great for a family of six. The rooms were clean and comfortable.   We picked this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland which was only a 10-15 minute walk away.   Another reason was the free breakfast, which was severely disappointing. The breakfast had little selection and unappetizing.   Overall the stay was good, but the breakfast was a big let down; especially before a big day at Disney.

I was looking for a nice, quiet hotel to relax at for a couple days but this hotel was unable to provide this environment. Caution: This is a family hotel and you will very well hear around the clock screaming in the pool area which literally echos in all of the surrounding room. In addition, I was charged twice for the cost of the room and didn't know till my card declined two days after checking out, which was extremely inconvenient. The manager, Jen, checked me out and didn't ask me how my stay was or didn't thank me for staying there. May sound petty, but after spending almost 500 for 2 nights, I expected to be treated like a valued guest, not a stranger. Lastly, the parking wasn't made clear to me before reserving the room. You will be charged for every day and every car.

motel staff were mostly very professional, efficient and friendly. dining room staff very friendly and kept bars well stocked. Front reception staff were a little untidy, could have had better presentation with clothing and appearance, but were attentive and helpful.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for Disneyland.
Summary: Desert Palms is located behind California Adventure. It's about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the entrance of Disneyland park. With kids it sometimes feels longer than that especially at the end of the day. The rooms are clean and housekeeping does a great job each day. The beds are comfy and not over worn. The hotel is an odd shape so some of the elevators don't reach every floor. It's easier to get around using the stairs if you can. Also, your room window can face a wall or the first floor of the parking garage (I've had bad luck with the views each time I've stayed here). Avoid getting an adjoining room if you don't need it, unless you want to hear everything going on in the next room. They do a great job with breakfast. Lots of different choices. If you are planning on

Summary Heading: Good location. Poor service and poor rooms
Summary: I been making reservations for the past year at this location. Lately I have found my self dealing with a poor hospitality experience and run down rooms. Not sure what prompted those changes. Before I gave them 4 stars, now it has come down to 2. Other than that good buffet and location.

Summary Heading: No manners,non caring front desk staff
Summary: The staff is less than caring. Would not help find my ID.I never got it back after my check in. When  I went to inquire  about it, I was told the staff would not have done that.  When I finally found a young man to help, low and behold, my ID was in the vault. Imagine that.

3rd family visit to Anaheim and for comparison, our previous holidays were at Paradise Pier and the Marriott Courtyard.  This was Spring Break so Paradise Pier was too pricey, and the Courtyard was already booked (we decided 3 weeks ago for a last minute holiday)  The suite size was a big factor, as well as having a fridge and oven.  We were in a one bedroom suite with a pullout couch in the living room. 2 adults and 3 kids.   Checkin was good but we were super early so opted to wait until 4pm for a room with a balcony. Super friendly front desk. We checked bags and went to get lunch.   No problem using the pool before the room was ready either.   It’s not a 5 star, but I figured that ahead of time. For the cost and space it was great! CVS, Walgreens, and other convenience

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for the money
Summary: This was our family’s second stay at Desert Palms after trying several of the hotels for family Disney trips over the last few years. What brought us back? A decent breakfast, friendly staff, and proximity to the parks that allows walking without wearing out our family’s littlest legs before we even got in the gates.   Since a lot of folks read reviews for what ISN’T good about a place, I’ll start with my gripes. First, the hotel has instituted a nightly parking fee that didn’t exist when we last stayed here. The front desk clerk told us the parking fee replaced a resort fee, so maybe it was a wash, but it was annoying just the same. Also, I don’t think I received the “prior guest” discount I was promised when I booked the room. The breakfast offerings weren’t particularly

Great location at the south end of California Adventure part of Disneyland. There’s a lot of food and stores within blocks to any shopping or meal needs. Rooms have a good sized refrigerator, but no freezer. There is a mid sized microwave in the rooms as well.   Staff was very courteous and knowledgeable. There was a cute towel elephant in our room upon arrival that we really enjoyed. Cleaning crew did an excellent job every day on our room. The pool and hot tub area is kept clean and there are small towels there to use.   Free breakfast was a huge plus for us. My only complaint was the lack of variety from day to day. We had a 6 day stay and the food was essentially the same every other day. The food quality was above decent and there was a wide selection of drinks including

Summary Heading: Great Property for Work and Disneyland
Summary: My stay here was great. The rooms are designed well with a fresh decor. The staff is nice and the location is great. You can walk to Disneyland easily. Store and food is close by and it’s an easy Uber ride to The Outlets and an easy Uber ride to Los Angeles.  The Oasis Bar is fun and service is good and the good in the bar are very entertaining.  The walls on the adjoining rooms are thin and the breakfast was not the best.   But it was clean and it well maintained.

We chose this hotel because they had a 1 bedroom suite which suited our family of 4, and it is a short walk (10 min) to Disneyland. There are a bunch of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. The room is nice: it is clean with decent furniture, a double bunk bed for the kids and the bathroom is nice. However the hotel needs some improvement. The free breakfast is pretty average (why do they put sausage bits in the scrambled eggs? Where is the bacon? Why is there only Coffee Mate for creamer?). The laundry is operated by a phone app that forces you to pre-pay in blocks of $5 and the app didn't work consistently (please just have guests pay with cash or card). The hot tub's water cleanliness is questionable. The hotel management should pay attention to the small details: get

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Beware of cancellation or change policy
Summary: Great room for my family of 6, great free hot breakfast, comfy beds and excellent location for Disneyland, Anaheim Convention Center, and restaurants.  I had to adjust my reservation a couple days before my stay due to a change in my daughter's tournament schedule, and sadly, they charged me $133 to make the change, even though I didn't cancel.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, close to parks, but no longer a good value.
Summary: We have stayed in this hotel 6+ times over the last 6+ years and have stayed at other hotels near Disneyland before that.  The first few visits in years past were great - it is close to the park, the rooms are clean and taken care of and it offered a great breakfast buffet.  However over the last several years our experiences have steadily declined.  The options and quality of the food decreased (still has eggs, sausage or biscuits and/or biscuits and gravy, cereal, fruit, waffles, toast, juices, etc), and their prices have steadily increased.  They are nearly double what they were 4 years ago and they now also charge for parking.  The wifi didn't work on all our devices (I do IT for a living), there were broken/bent towel racks, the shower temperatures varied from cool to warm

This is the hotel we stay at when it's a family trip to Disneyland. They have different levels of rooms to accommodate whatever size your family is. If there are only 4 of us we get a double Queen room. If it's more than 4 of us we get a suite. A hot breakfast buffet is served. The main course changes on a daily basis. They always have 2 different flavors of make your own waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea and several juices. The staff is helpful and friendly.

This hotel was clean and very close to Disneyland.  The breakfast was okay.  Coffee not great. But other than that the rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The walls are a little thin and the hallway is very noisy at night.  Other than that it was a pleasant stay.  I would return again.

Great location, close to the park. We walked to the front entrance and also around the other side of the block to go into the backside of Downtown Disney, easy walk. The room selection was great. We traveled with extended family and needed two rooms, we chose to get the two bedroom, two bathroom option and it was nice and a good setup. My biggest complaint was the noise. The room closest to the street had horrible road noise, all night. The room closest to the hall had a lot of noise from other visitors in the hallway.

Summary Heading: Property Okay - location saves the day
Summary: This hotel is the most convenient to Disneyland. Only properties closer are the Candy Cane Inn and Disney Grand if you don’t want to cross a busy road. Hotel is clean. Rooms are dark and noisy. Definitely want to be on the top floor. Staff is slow to respond. Beds are a little hard and the bathroom is small. Lighting in the bathroom is poor - makes you look like something from the Walking Dead. The upside is when you see your reflection once outside - you only look better. Pool and hot tub very small. Have to pay to park.

Summary Heading: Could've been better - next trip will stay elsewhere
Summary: First will start with the positive aspects of the hotel; the location is good if you're going to Disney. It's less than 15 minute walk from the park and several places around to eat. There's a pool, restaurant on site, and the breakfast is included with your reservation. Now, on to the issues. There is literature that claims complimentary parking for hotel guests, but when I was checking in, they asked me to pay for parking. Good thing I didn’t drive a car or keep my rental for the duration of my stay. After checking in and taking occupancy of the room, the toilet we tried to use wouldn’t flush. So this was immediately rectified by giving us another room, but the location was right in the main hallway where it was so noisy. Rooms 103 through at least 105, maybe a few others get

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location for Disneyland vacation
Summary: Stayed at Desert Palms for 4 nights. Hotel staff excellent and very helpful. The room was perfect for us with two beds and a sitting area. Breakfast was great. Good small swimming pool for the kids to take a break mid day from Disneyland..10 min walk to Disneyland and across from Walgreens and CVS for everything that you need. We loved our stay and would definitely stay again.!

Summary Heading: BEWARE $35 "early check in before 3 pm fee"
Summary: If you wanna check in prior to 3 pm, these, in my opinion, greedy extortionists charge a $35 "early check in fee". I was at 2:45 and they demanded $35 to check in 15 minutes "early". Obviously the rooms are ready since they strictly enforce their also ridiculous 11 a.m. check out time. This is pure predatory greed on the part of this hotel. I only stayed here because the Marriott was booked. Will not return.

Summary Heading: Great rate on a family room with bunk beds
Summary: We got an excellent rate on a very well-located hotel with the Desert Palms. Our 2 kids had their own closed-off area of the room with bunk beds, which they loved. We got a king-sized bed with refrigerator and microwave. Plus, a breakfast buffet that saved us the price of Disney food! What more could we want? Less than 10 minutes' walk to Disney, too. Can't really ask for more. We were a little let down by the low-quality food at the breakfast buffet, and we wish the bed linens weren't so scratchy, but those weren't deal-breakers for us. The staff were all very kind and the hotel was impressively clean and well-lit. The kids even had a good time in the heated pool. For a family of 4 looking for a decent (but not luxurious) stay while at Disney, this is a very safe bet. We liked

We stayed in a King room with bunk beds. The bunk beds were MASSIVE. well bigger then the normal 2 twins most places have. the room was comfortable, clean, and well decorated. Perfect fit for a family with 2 kids. or a family even more kids. Those bunks will fit 4 kids easy. The only issue I could find was the shower water pressure. wasn't the greatest, but, it worked just fine. Will stay here again with no question.

Hotel staff aren't the friendliest, the front desk people are always standing there but really aren't helpful.  I noticed when I walked by one morning there was a guest checking out and he wanted to store his luggage for the day, seemed difficult for the lady to help him, yet I could see the room they store luggage, it was full or peoples bags. Rooms are nice, especially if you needed the extra room for kids,  breakfast was decent. Location is good.

Great front desk. Great restaurant. Great location to disneyland. We stay for 3 days at a time once a year. I have never looked anywhere else. Early check in so nice to have when you have a big family.

The family and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. It was 2 adults and 2 children. We stayed in a king/bunk bed room and found it to be a perfect fit! The kids loved the bunk beds and I loved that it was in their own room right off ours with their own TV. I also appreciated the second sink outside the toilet/shower room as it gets crowded with 4 of us sharing a room. It was nice, quiet, and very clean. The microwave and fridge were convenient as well. The 7-11 next door made it easy to take snacks and water into the park. We wish we had brought suits for the pool and hot tub, but we saw a few people using them and it looked nice. My husband used the fitness room and said the cable setup was nice, but the selections of dumbbells was small...no big deal though

There is absolutely nothing bad about this hotel. The rooms were beautiful, modern and clean and every single staff member was very friendly and willing to help. The breakfast was also really good (oh my god, the waffles!!) If you're visiting Anaheim for Disneyland/the Adventure Park then this hotel's location is perfect. You can walk there within 10 minutes and you are also very close to shops, stores or food places. I am very happy that I stayed in Desert Palms Hotel & Suites and I will definitely come back.

Superb location and facility for attending an event at the convention centre. Walking distance with pool and hot tub with comfortable rooms and amenities. Very friendly staff. Not inexpensive but good for Los Angeles. Lots to eat close by.

Just spent three great nights at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites. The hotel was conveniently located about 8 minutes by foot to Disneyland, which was great given the crazy amount of rain we experienced. And right next door was a 7-Eleven and a CVS.   We stayed in a huge room with a two queen size beds. The hotel also had a pool and a hot tub which happened to be in use a lot by other guests. The room was always extremely clean and the staff was pleasant. They also had on premises parking for us, too.   For those who are staying for a convention, it was very close to the Anaheim Convention Center as well.   I would recommend any Disney goers to consider this hotel - it’s a great, affordable hotel.

Summary Heading: Awesome location next to Disneyland and California Adventure Park
Summary: Our family of 4 adults (senior citizens) had a great stay for 7 nights in the one bedroom suite with full kitchen.  The daily breakfast was okay but it had enough variety -- fruit, eggs, waffles, coffee, tea, toast, yogurt, etc.  The room was super clean and the property was well maintained.  The parking was sufficient and very handy if you want to walk to Disneyland or California Adventure Park.  The location was easy to find if you are driving from Los Angeles International Airport with a rental car, which is what we did.  I really thank the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, especially Mr. Phillip. We stayed in in Room 431 next to the elevator, ice machine and laundry room.

Heater in room did not operate correctly. room was cold and blowing air all night onto my head, causing a cold which ruined my whole trip. Pillows are wrong, one is too low and two are too high. The blankets should not be called "blankets" which imply some sort of comfort, instead they are something that should be given away at a gas station to wipe your tires with. Solution for the thermostat problem was to send the facilities person up who still did not fix the issue.   Room assigned to was not the room I made reservations for, staff said hotel was sold out so instead gave me coupons for the Oasis Bar. Did not realize Oasis has no edible food, Fried Midwest Food, a dry veggie burger, French Fries, salad is iceberg lettuce, unripe tomatoes, dressing with too much sugar in it,

Summary Heading: Beautiful and lots of rooms for families
Summary: Very clean and comfortable rooms. Calming and quiet atmosphere all around. The staff was friendly and helpful. The kids loved the heated pool while we were able to relax in the spa. We loved watching the Disney fireworks from our room.

We’ve stayed at the Desert Palms more times than I can count. The staff is always courteous and it’s our home away from home when visiting Disneyland. I love being able to fill our bellies before heading off to the park with their included hot breakfast. The walk only takes about 10 minutes to the park which isn’t too bad. I always recommend this hotel to family and friends. Ive never been disappointed. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!

Disneyland parks are very close to this hotel (5-10 minutes walk). When we stayed there parking was free, but they changed their policy while we were there. For new guests be prepared to pay 18$/day for parking. Breakfast is also included in the room rate and is simple but good. You will be saving some dollars here. Having breakfast at Disney can get expensive. With exception to the front desk (from poor to average score) the service was also good. There is just one thing I would add and that needs to be changed immediately by the person managing the hotel: breakfast runs from 7-10 am and when 10 am time is reached they just turn the lights off for a couple minutes to sign that breakfast is over. That is a very disrespectful behaviour to those still having breakfast. Wouldn’t it

Summary Heading: Very good hotel to visit Disneyland
Summary: We arrived at morning time because didn't want to miss the opening time of the park. The front desk staff was very helpfull and nice - let us to park in the parking lot from morning time, put some goods to their fridge and luggage room - great help. The room was so big - separate room for the kids with bunk bed, and another for the parents :) Unfortunatelly the pool still was not open at 9:00 next morning altought it should be open - and we had to go on towards Grand Canyon so our kid was sad but this is the only bad thing during our stay.

Easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland. It is located behind California Adventure so if you are are on floors 3-5 and facing the park you can see the fireworks. Clean rooms and friendly staff and there were enough towels. With a family of five, we always have to call to get an extra towel. There were more than enough towels for everyone. The heated pool and hot tub were located in between the buildings so we could enjoy the area without being exposed to the crazy wind we had for a few days. My new favorite place to stay near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice place for multiple rooms near Disneyland
Summary: We needed separate space for the young adults that were with us!  A separate bathroom was also very helpful!  Nice amenities and this hotel is a very short walk to Disney.  We were pleasantly surprised by this property!

This hotel is conveniently located in Anaheim just blocks away from a huge selection of Restaurants and many great attractions like Disneyland. They offer a variety of room style making it ideal for family travel. Clean rooms and friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was not excellent but they offered a variety of choices and had 3 waffle stations. We will definately return here.

Food was horrible, desk service was rude and imperious. Shutters in room were broken and not repaired during our five night stay. Store lights shone into our room at night. We finally used a towel for darkness. We will never stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great location however noisy rooms and breakfast is terrible
Summary: We found the location fantastic, an easy 7 minute walk to Disneyland and our room was very clean. The noise and breakfast were the disappointing factors that would prevent us from staying again. Our room looked over the indoor pool and was therefore very noisy with kids until 10 pm each night.  Also you could hear the loud footsteps of people in the room above us. The included breakfast was terrible and after the first morning we ate elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Nice, spacious rooms for large families.
Summary: We loved the wide array of room choices for large families.  The hotel staff are friendly and attentive.  The rooms are clean.  Love the warm breakfast in the morning and the kitchen staff are so hard working, we appreciated them so much.  We have stayed here four times and we have never been disappointed.

Summary Heading: The most disgusting breakfast in hotel history
Summary: The most disgusting breakfast in hotel history resides here.  I’m a world traveler never in my life have I seen a restaurant serves such disgusting food I would stay away from this place at all cost just for the food. If you think you’re going to eat decent food for a free breakfast you are dead wrong choose another place if breakfast is important to you

The hotel itself met all of our needs. Free Breakfast was ok.  The rooms were clean. Walking distance to Disneyland. Two complaints, the heater would not go down less than  67° which left us to sleep in a hot room. Our biggest complaint was that road construction has been going on apparently well over a year now. The walls/windows provided no noise barrier and a jackhammer ran all night one night, started at 4am another night. Take your earplugs!

We stayed at Desert Palms in December 2018 for 3 nights.  The place was easy to find, check-in was fast.  Parking was easy and free.  The room was smaller than expected, though it was perfect for the 5 of us.  We booked the King Bed + 2 the double-size bunk beds (one room, though segregated by a barn door & there were 2 TVs).  The kids loved it.  The room was clean and nicely decorated.  We had the free breakfast buffet all three days, it offered different foods as far as hot items (eggs, omelets, biscuits and gravy), cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, donuts, muffins, make your own waffles, as well as milk, juices and coffee.  It was a short, safe, 10 min walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  We came back to the room both park days to relax for a couple of hours and it was very

We stayed here during our Christmas Vacation to the Disneyland resort hotel is at a very Good walking distance to the park. AMAZING Service! employees are really nice and very welcoming! We stayed in one of their 4 bed, 2 bathroom suites. Accommodated perfectly to all our family needs.  The Lobby is very clean and great to hang out as you wait for family members or return from the park. employees make sure to always maintain it clean and make sure there's always coffee and keep the coffee station clean!

We stayed here on our last trip and it was just ok. Rooms were on the small side even though we had the separate bunk bed room. The thermostat only went to 67 degrees and it was HOT in the room with the queen bed. And that queen bed was very uncomfortable. Breakfast wasn’t very edible for me but the kid loved the waffles! Powdered eggs are not my thing and the fruit selection was crap. Coffee was terrible but I am somewhat of a coffee snob. The hotel staff at the front desk were a bit rude and never acknowledged guests when they came in, including us. Since we arrived early in the morning, our room was not ready and was told they could get us early check for $35. That’s a new one to us and we didn’t need it since they would just hold our luggage so we could still go to the

It is no Ritz but it was extremely nice for the price. We liked that it was well within walking distance of Disneyland, had a free breakfast, and was not nearly as expensive as the other hotel within walking distance. It was clean and nice, the breakfast was decent, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant is OUTSTANDING!!!! We ordered room service one night and WOW, it was delicious and not at all expensive... $12 for a huge and amazing cheeseburger!   PS If you are going to rent a car and will not need it for the entirety of your trip, do it through Alamo. Because there is one right next to the hotel, so rent your car to get there, return it when you arrive, then rent a car again to get back.... It will save you big time!!!

Summary Heading: Great location for a wonderful family visit to Disneyland.
Summary: Our family of 6 were able to walk to Disneyland and walk back for naps when needed.  We enjoyed the friendly staff and the breakfast each morning.  Overall a great experience to a for an exciting family trip.

This hotel does so many things very well. We arrived @ 9.30am from direct flight from Sydney. We were suppose to arrive @ 12.30pm but flight scheduled early. Alex at reception was absolutely awesome. We were able to drop off our bags and room was available by 1.30pm.  Our room was located on the 4th floor (room 461) and overlooked cars land (well the back of it) and we were able to watch the fire works each night. The room was all we needed. Had a great sized fridge, microwave, 2 dble beds, a sunken lounge and small table and chairs. This was great for us parents and 2 teenage daughters.  There have been a number of comments around breakfast. As long as your expectations aren't too high its fine. Ok it doesn't vary a great deal and for us Aussies the scones (or biscuits) with a

first time ever staying at this hotel  8 adults and 2 toddlers  the Kalahara Suite was perfect!!  loved the closet space and the bathrooms so spacious!!   loved being next to seven 11 to get our snacks and drinks prior to walking to park....so close!  Parking was excellent and covered  and the breakfast waffles were the best!   my entire family said this was the best hotel we have ever stayed at for our annual disney trips!!  and such great communication even pior to check in!  highly recommend!!

Excellent hotel for a family traveling to Anaheim to enjoy Disneyland! Excellent location and great variety of rooms available. The free hot buffet breakfast was great! Super clean tons of options. Will be staying again. Great hotel highly recommend.

Great spot, I have bad joints and this was close enough for us to walk to Disney everyday. Rooms well appointed and CLEAN, Breakfast was fine - something to start the day but not get excited about. The pool is small, but then its more a place for the kids after a long day. Staff were all friendly and helpful - except when we arrived 1 1/2 hours early, our welcome wasn't the best, the man on reception informed us it cost $35 +tax to check in early...we totally understood that if the room wasn't ready we couldn't get in, and I understand a late check out - rooms need to be ready for the arriving guests...it just seemed a bad first impression to charge for a room that was sitting ready, by the time the reception talked to us, stored our bags and then at 3pm returned our bags, and

My husband and I bounce between this hotel and the Red Lion across the street. It just depends on who has better pricing.   We enjoy the free WiFi , free parking, and best of all, the free hot breakfast. The dining room is clean, and has plenty of food. There are a couple of waffle makers as well. FYI though. There are lots of people with their wayward children in the dining room. Make sure you keep an eye out for the little ones. They will be underfoot.   This hotel has the best amenities and location. It’s a quick walk to Disney. No need to pay for parking. We always enjoy staying here.

We loved that we can walk to Disney, the clean rooms, bunk beds and the breakfast was great. Staff was very accommodating.  Rooms seems a little small but we did not spend a ton of time in them, their pillows are really hard - if you can bring your own pillow.

Only stay here if you are a family with children on a Disney vacation. They are not set up to accommodate adults or solo people there to do things other than Disney (or can’t fathom those possibilities)   There were problems with our room’s AC and the room routinely hit 82-83 degrees. Multiple complaints would fix this issue for a brief while and then we would be back to heat.   The staff uses some kind of vinegar based cleaning agent and the rooms and hallways smell strongly of it.   Not the worst place on the planet but if you have the means then stay elsewhere. The free breakfast is nice but not nice enough to make up for the other shortcomings.

This is a great hotel. The cleanliness and amenities, breakfast buffet included, walking distance to Disneyland...cant' be beat. We have stayed at a few different hotels within walking distance around Disneyland, this one is our new favorite. They do add on resort fees and parking fees at check-in, which I wasn't aware of when I made the reservation and weren't included then. So, I didn't like that, but our overall stay here was great and we will be coming back.

Great location with a Walgreens, chemist, 7-Eleven & Starbucks all within a very close walking distance. Disneyland is not even a 10 minute, pleasant walk away. There are a few homeless people that hang at the bus stop out front of the 7-Eleven next door - but they are harmless and did not affect our stay. The rooms are really clean, the housekeeping is brilliant & the rooms are spacious and the beds are firm but very comfortable. Also included is a free breakfast on the 5th floor - this is great. Cereal, toast, fruit, yoghurt as well as hot food and waffles! Would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Really a GREAT PLACE TO STAY.
Summary: Loved this place. Modern, clean, fine lobby, swimming and hot tub, nice room. Included a small kitchen area, fridge, small tv room, excellent place. So close to Disney! Easy!  They had a nice breakfast, and we liked the rom service.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed here a few times over the course of 10 years.  Great location. Close walk to Disneyland Resort.  Close to Anaheim Garden walk.    Comfortable beds and rooms overall.   Great parking.  Included hot breakfast is a must.   Love this place. Will look to stay again for our next trip.

Spent 4 nights at the hotel as a family with 3 young children.  Upon check in I was charged twice for the room, which appeared on my statement that day.  Staff oblivious to how it happened.  Charged an additional $1200! Had to wait 3 days for a refund which left us short for our last few days of our vacation.  Staff apologised but no offer of compensation for their error, not even a complimentary drink which is the least they could’ve done!! Breakfast was vile! Very little choice and by 8.15am very little choice as food was not replenished.  Plastic disposable plates, cups and cutlery were very off putting as were the ripped seats in the breakfast area.  Would not recommend this hotel I’m afraid, very poor customer service.  Plenty of far superior hotels locally for the same

Summary Heading: Excellent combo of location and quality
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights for a conference at the convention center and found it to be a great location - easy walking to both the center and Disneyland.  Rooms were clean, bed comfortable and showers good pressure. Only minor nit was the walls were a bit thin and a number of folks were loud in the hallway going too and from late into the evening. Other than that, it was good. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland, good bang for the buck.
Summary: Truth be told, we stayed at this hotel because the one we usually stay at was full for the Halloween week.  I am actually grateful that it was.  Desert Palms has a great location, within walking distance to Disneyland.  Breakfast, parking, bunk beds are amenities that we look for and they had all of them.  The room was great, TV was disappointing with channel and movie selections.  Just basic cable, no real movie channels.  We had a day where we needed to stay in and there wasn't much on TV.  The breakfast was a standard hotel breakfast, waffles, toast, cereal, etc.  Each day they had some variation of eggs, sausage and potatoes or biscuits and gravy.  Not much variety but it was included in the price of the room so in all it wasn't horrible.  The pool could use a makeover and

Summary Heading: Great Location to Disneyland, Good Value of stay
Summary: We are a family of five and I was excited to find a hotel that would sleep all of us without having to sleep on a cot/sofa sleeper. We got a two room (with double bunk beds). The room felt super claustrophobic/small. Not much space for all our luggage or drawers for our clothes. No lamps in the bunk bed room and lights on the bunk beds didn't work. But rooms were clean and nice looking. We did love that they did offer free parking and was only two blocks from Disney which saved us from paying for parking/shuttle. We felt pool closed a little earlier than would like with Disney hours open so late. After spending all day at the park, we would of loved to spend time in hot tub but found not much time to when we got back to hotel after we watched the parades. Keep in mind that

My husband and I stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites in October 2018.  We were looking for a hotel which offered breakfast and within a reasonable walking distance to Disneyland/California Adventure and we got both with the Desert Palms.  Our room faced California Adventure and was quiet and spacious.  It was a smidge dated in decor but the level of cleanliness was excellent.  The continental breakfast was offered in a large room 9n the 5th floor and there was indoor and outside umbrella covered seating for those who wanted to enjoy every minute of th3 great California weather - which we did.  The food offerings were the standard waffle station and alternating egg option each day.  The choices were family friendly and plentiful.  The breakfast staff were kind, helpful

This hotel has everything you need if you want to avoid parking fees and shuttle buses to the Disney parks. Rooms are clean, extremely average decor.  We did not use the pool.  It it looked rather small for the size of the hotel.  Breakfast room got a thumbs down from my family, but it looked like many others were satisfied with the offerings based on the crowd that was there when went to take a look.  Scrambled egg whites were a big turn off as well as the gray looking sausage; but there was a waffle maker and several varieties of cereal available so we probably could have found something to eat.  There is a Starbucks across the street which got our vote.  I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if you are looking for a resort experience, but if you just need a place to lay your head

We visited Disneyland and stayed at the Desert Palms for 4 nights. Our party of 9 (ranging in age from 7-77) had no trouble with the short walk to the park from the hotel, which we did a couple times a day. Breakfast each morning made the days easier to get going and there was enough variety for everyone to find something to eat. The staff we all friendly and the rooms were clean. We'd stay here again without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Great value hotel, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Every year, we take my daughters to one of the Southern California theme parks for their birthday trip. This year was Disneyland and California Adventure (again). This was our 3rd time staying at the Desert Palms and it's as good as ever.  It's about 1/2 the price of the resort hotels (or maybe even a bit better, depending on timing) and includes breakfast and parking with your room. The employees are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and have always seemed properly maintained. We usually get one of the 1 bedroom suites. This type of room has a king-size bed in the main area (also a fridge & microwave), and a separate room with a door with bunk beds in it for the kids. We can watch tv after they go to bed without keeping them awake. When it's time to head to the

Very decent hotel, and has great location - a few min to Disney Land on a shuttle, numerous stores right nearby or across the street. A couple of down sides: rather low water pressure in the shower, and lazy service. For instance, when we arrived there were 6-7 reps were chatting with each other and not eager to check us in, and when we left bags in the hotel they asked us to take the bags to the storage room instead of taking the bags themselves.

Summary Heading: Great way to combine business and Pleasure
Summary: I attended a TACA conference for continued education and was able to take my family with me. After  I was done at the conference I was able to enjoy the many local attractions with my family. Great location for business and pleasure.

Been going to Disneyland my whole life and had never stayed here. This time we booked through a travel agent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great location with a lot of stores near by for convenience. Only an 8-10 min walk to the parks Enjoyed the free hot breakfast, restaurant and bar! They also have room service though we never used it. Decent pool area.  Our room was a one bedroom suite with a separate living area with fridge, another tv and a sofa bed, which we were upgraded to at no charge. Quiet, clean, huge bathroom area and very comfortable bed.  All staff was very pleasant, from the front desk, restuarant, breakfast staff and cleaning staff. Our bathroom was missing a shower curtain and within minutes of requesting one, staff was up to install it for us. I would stay

We live in Long Beach so we are very local but we needed somewhere to stay while our home got fumigated. I chose this location because I wanted to be close to work. We stayed in the mini suite which has a bunk bedroom that locks off from the main room. We had an amazing time. The breakfast had a lot of selection. Way more than I expected. The staff was all very nice, and the person at the front desk was kind enough to give me two parking spaces for the entire length of my stay despite being originally told it would be based on a nightly basis. Excellent customer service. The pool area was very basic, the hot tub got a little overcrowded but when you only have one, what else can be expected. If for some reason I had to stay in the area but away from my home, I would definitely

Summary Heading: Enjoyed Desert Palms and all it had to offer!
Summary: My family and I chose Desert Palms for our Disney vacation in Anaheim. This hotel offers so much, such as free parking, complimentary breakfast, a pool and jacuzzi, gym and close proximity to Disneyland. It’s at the end of the block from Disneyland’s entrance and located right next to 7-11. There’s a CVS, Coffee Bean and other stores/shops across the street. Our room was beautiful and nicely kept and maintained. It was just the perfect hotel for me and my family and enjoyed every moment there. We will be making this our go-to hotel when vacationing in Anaheim. Mahalo Desert Palms!

This hotel is nice from a decor perspective. It’s clean and pretty well maintained but the amount of noise is outrageous. Every single night of our stay (8 nights), we could hear incredibly loud people above us. It sounded like they were stomping but we soon realized it was just because the walls were all paper thin. We discovered this because we happened to be in the room when house keeping was cleaning the room above us and it sounded like they were vacuuming in our room. Also, the street noise just adds to the noise collection. Being in a busy city like Anaheim, you expect street noise but these windows might as well not be there. All of these things combined with the fact that the fan has been programmed not to stay on make for a very noisy and sleepless night. This is a

Summary Heading: Excellent price fantastic staff beautiful rooms in the perfect location
Summary: When we arrived Manny checked us in so quickly and easily it made it so nice. Jenny and Alex we're so helpful throughout the entire visit!! The breakfast was delicious, with so many choices, five stars all the way!!  We were right next door to Disneyland and the convention center is directly across the street. The the room was so comfortable we were able to get one with a full kitchen a living room and a bedroom with two king size beds that were extremely comfortable and you would have thought being so close to everything that it would be noisy but it was surprisingly quiet all in all our trip was fantastic, wouldn't stay anywhere else.

This is day 2 of a 6 day stay.  My travel agent recommended this place and I’m glad she did. For starters our suite was spotlessly clean.  We ordered Instacart food so I worried about the frig size but their 3 d view on line showed a fulll size frig, and it is for a vacation. It is 10 cubic feet.

This was a wonderful place to stay. Perfect for families with generous sized suites. The two bathrooms per room are fantastic and the layout is perfect.  The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable and all staff were absolutely wonderful, not just the front desk staff but the maintenance and cleaning staff were all very friendly and welcoming.  Also a great location to Disneyland, just a short walk and you're there. I'd highly recommend this to anyone planning a trip to Disneyland its the perfect place to stay  Thanks to everyone for making our trip so wonderful

My family stayed at the Palm Desert for one night to attend the Disneyland Halloween event. We returned to the room late after midnight tired and ready to go to sleep. When I pulled the sofa sleeper out there were blood stains on the sheets, EW! I immediately went to the reception area and requested a room change. The gentleman was very nice but he offered new sheets which I decline and requested a room change. It was an inconvenience for us because we were super tired and we had to pack up and move to different floor. This proves that sheets are not changed after each use. Gross experience!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We loved staying here. Great room - decent sized bunks and comfy beds. Loved the complimentary breakfast. Close enough to the park for our little ones to walk and any other amenities you’d need including ART buses. Would definitely stay here again. Kids enjoyed the scavenger hunt and the pool/spa.

We had stayed here once before and loved this hotel. Close enough to walk to the parks, big family size rooms, great breakfast, nice pool area. This time when we checked in the manager decided to upgrade our room from the basic 2 queens to a bigger room with a king size bed and with a separate room with bunk beds for the kids. The bunk beds were full size so 2 small kids could have fit on the bottom bunk. It was completely unexpected and very nice! Also we checked out on Sunday and were going to Disney that day before we drove home and they let us keep our car at the hotel the rest of that day. All of the staff was super friendly and helpful from needing change for vending machines to questions about food close by. We love this hotel!

This was our first stay at Desert Palms. We usually stay at another hotel for our annual Disneyland trip. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The interior and exterior of the property are very clean and nicely maintained. Our room was comfortable and spacious. While you could hear some noise from other rooms from out in the hall, it was nice and quiet inside the room. Our room on the 4th floor had a fabulous view of the backsides of Guardians of the Galaxy and Radiator Springs Racers and we even had a birds eye view of the fireworks. The breakfast was decent, but one can’t complain about free. The staff kept everything well stocked and the breakfast room clean, which can be hard to do with so many little ones around. All members of the staff we interacted with were nice,

We stayed at the Desert Palm for two nights and three days at our Cali Trip and we loved the hotel & at its staff! They were extremely helpful and kind! The Breakfast was great! The staff at breakfast was very helpful as well. The room was exceptional. We are family of 6 ands kids could not be happier. Location is AMAZING!! we walked to Disney! There is a 24HR Walgreen right across the street and you can get anything there! I would highly recommend this place!!

We love this hotel, great location and walking distance from the Disneyland parks. Hotel is always clean and staff is super friendly. We can always count on a great breakfast to get our days started. Rooms are clean and housekeeping does a wonderful job providing extra towels or anything you need. We just love this place!

After many visits to Disneyland over the years, this was our first time staying at Desert Palms. The hotel Had great rooms, very nice and helpful stafff, and it is a very short  walk to Disneyland. I will definitely be staying st this hotel again.

Just spend 9 nights at this hotel. The hotel overall was clean, comfortable and did the trick for a hotel very close to Disneyland.  Rooms were clean, lobby was nice and the breakfast was well done for a continental breakfast. My kids loved the waffles.   Front desk staff were very accommodating and helpful at all times of the day.   We did find the rooms to be loud, as the windows and walls seem very thin so any noise outside or next door seemed like it was inside the room. Thankfully we wanted to be up very early anyways.   We didn’t use the pool as it seemed a bit small and cramped for the amount of kids in it    Overall a good experience.

We stayed here for 9 nights in March 2018. We had travelled in from Australia so on arrival we were excited but exhausted. Our room was not ready but the lovely helpful service desk gave us pointers where to head for bite to eat and shops. The room and beds were comfortable. The housekeeping was great always refreshed our room well. Only issue was the noise next door we had a very loud family who were very early risers we could clearly hear there conversation. I would recommend and stay here again good location for Disneyland and great shops close by.  We loved the breakfast waffles are amazing, the staff were very attentive and everything was clean and replenished as soon as empty.

We booked the Desert Palms via Hotwire and couldn’t be happier with our experience. The hotel is a short walk to Disneyland and the facilities are in excellent condition. The rooms were spotless and the beds were comfortable. The hot breakfast was excellent. Can’t get over that parking is included in the nightly rate! Other hotels charge $15-25 a night for this. We will definitely be staying here again

Like most people who visit Disneyland, Location is one of the most important factors when choosing a hotel. Desert Palms Hotel and Suites is only a short 7 minute walk from and to Disneyland and Disneyland's California Adventure. The staff is very friendly and rooms are easily accessible. It is family friendly and offer bunk beds for your children. You can also enjoy their complementary breakfast every morning.

We just got back from a 3 night stay at the hotel and we had a blast! We had 4 adults and 1 child in the 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite and the room was way big enough for the 5 of us. The employees were very friendly and the coffee and water available in the lobby all day was a nice treat. The breakfast was a nice bonus and saved us money on having to eat breakfast out. Many different items to choose from and fresh food. We walked to Disney with my 6 year old son and didnt have any complaining. So when they say it's a short walk to Disney they are pretty accurate. Overall our stay was great and we are already starting to plan our next Disney trip next year and we will be returning to Desert Palms. Thank you for making my family's stay enjoying and memorable.

Summary Heading: VERY IMPRESSED - AMAZING FIRST CLASS EXPERIENCE EVERY STEP OF THE WAY!!!
Summary: Although I only travel for pleasure nowadays, for twenty years, I flew constantly on business...once a week, often twice a week, all over the nation.  Because my workers or the companies that we did business with made the reservations (often for conventions or to visit companies in the area), the rooms were not always under my name, but I have been staying at this hotel many times over the years since at least 1992 or so.  As such, I was so happy that for this fun trip to Disneyland and Beverly Hills with my long-time girlfriend, I picked Desert Palms as I always liked it there and was feeling kind of nostalgic.  A place that you like is always even more fun to go to when one is not working.  This hotel has always been nice, but this trip really surprised me, it is now even

We booked The Desert Palms Hotel for our first Disneyland experience. Due to the good reviews and proximity of the location within walking distance. The price was hefty at $230/night but we thought it’d be worth it for the convenience. When we arrived, from our long travel day from Michigan, (We actually flew into SD and rented a car to drive up to Anaheim) the girl at the front desk was friendly but could not answer some questions that we had. We let it go, went to our room and walked to our dinner in Downtown Disney. We we came back from dinner, we were ready for bed so we could get a good nights sleep for our day at Disney. First thing I found was a bug in my room. Grossed me out, but I flushed it and went about my night. As we tried to fall asleep, all we could hear was

This hotel started off great at the beginning, great lobby and staff initally. The hotel environment is unsafe, lots of homeless people peering in windows and in the parking lots in the evenings and mornings. Some staff were very unfriendly and non-personable and uncaring. Some staff were great. The amenities in our room was less than stellar...broken fridge and microwave, bad plumbing. The accounting department made several errors in charging my 4-day stay at least 5 different times while we were there...it has taken them over a week to remove all incorrect charges. Watch your credit card during your stay, be careful of the unsafe parking lots and premises in the evenings.

We had reservations at a different hotel and once we got there we were not happy at all so we had to get another hotel at last minute. Desert palms was able to accommodate us very good and were amazing and nice. Definitely staying here again! Highly recommend!

We stayed here in July for 7 days... Hey is it perfect no but is it just adequate no... it is more than that.  The room we had was perfect for small families it had a queen or king bed in the main room and a double bunk in the kids room they loved it a double bed each....  The hotel is in easy walking distance from the Disney precinct and in easy walking distance from IHOP, The tea leaf company, Bubba Gump and the cheese cake factory... there is a CVS across the road.  The hotel includes breakfast daily and although not gourmet it is enough, a few hot options, cereal, toast, bakery, self cooking waffle stations and some fruit, coffee and juice all available saving you at least 1 meal per day.  The staff are friendly and helpful, the lobby shop is good and run by a helpful family

Hotel is always well maintained, very clean and staff is super friendly.  The location is one of the best outside of Disney park.  I love the Suite rooms.  We travel with older children and the extra bed is worth the small price!

Summary Heading: Was a Great Place to Stay for a Disney Vacation
Summary: We had an extended stay here as we took a Disney/Southern California vacation.  It was so nice having the hotel so close to the parks, literally less than a 10 minute walk.  We walked less than we would have parking.  You can also take a short shuttle if your feet are tired at the end of the night.  It was also a nice home base for the other places we went to in Southern California (Universal Studios, beach, etc.).  It's all Disney there, with special Disney only stuff all around.  The rooms were spacious enough, neat, clean, well kept up by housekeeping, etc.  Our kids loved the pool, which was great because it was hot.  The breakfast was decent, not the best I've had but not the worst either.  It is nice saving money on that, though.  The hotel staff was really friendly, too.

Summary Heading: I actually want to go back to Anaheim just to stay here.
Summary: It was a short stay but I was super impressed with the room.  Everything in the hotel was clean, fresh and well maintained. You can tell that whomever is managing this property gives a damn.   Really nice touches in the rooms like folded towels (in animal shapes) and a nice sitting area.  The only negative is the exit / entry ... it's a bit gnarly but not impossible you just have to be careful ... I was driving a Tahoe and it was a bit challenging, so would definitely recommend a smaller vehicle.  The gift shop was great. Got a few last minute gifts there before meeting the family. If they didn't know better they would have thought I bought everything at Disneyland.  Definitely will stay here again.

Stayed here with my daughter and her friend and we LOVED it! It was close to everything we needed, our room was so nice and clean, and the staff was super nice. We loved it here. Literally walking distance from Disneyland!

This was a pleasant surprise.  Had a problem at the Hilton was referred here.  Jenny at the front desk went up and above board to welcome and make our stay wonderful! She definitely went the extra mile.  Great experience !

Enjoyable. Underground parking, Friendly service. Our room was very nice. Full kitchen, including dishwasher, waste disposal etc, which we didn't actually use. There was, as is standard now, that fowl powdered milk substitute, yuck. The bathroom was a good size, spoilt by the dreaded plastic shower curtain. The aircon was very noisey. The bed was very comfortable. In the foyuer, you could help yourself to coffee, although with vanilla or hazelnut milk, not nice. There is a cramped gift shop, a full bar with outside seating, which was nice, and if you wanted, a very unexciting complimentary breakfast.  A short walk to Disney, and many great eateries.

I can't believe that this hotel rates a 4 star.  The breakfast is mediocre at best.  White or wheat toast,  cereal,  scrambled egg whites, sausage,  low quality food that reminded me of a school lunch room. We stayed on the 3rd floor which smelled of urine.  The room (king bed and a bunk bed) was clean but very small. The pool was VERY small and not well maintained.  The only complement that I can find,  is that our room itself was clean.   Spend your $265 per night at the Marriott across the street.

Our sink was clogged so we had to brush teeth in the bath tub. Asked for maintenance at 7 am and was told that maintenance was not available until 830 am. Very disappointed after an exhausting day. Sink was still clogged. Maintenance never came. No housekeeping during the entire stay. Trash was never taken out. Beds were not made. Tip of $10 was still waiting on the dresser.

Summary Heading: Desert Palms never lets us down.
Summary: I’ve always stayed here with my family since 2012 and this was the first year we got more of our family to book through them and the experience was great as always. Never a let down! We’re all going next year and it’s obvious where we’re staying. It’s a good less than 10 minute walk to the park (literally from the entrance of California adventure to RSR type of walk). You all won’t be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Great location! Great service! Great for Groups!
Summary: I am a HS band director and travel to Anaheim every 4 years with 150+ people in my group. This was our 3rd stay, and our best!  The Desert Palms staff is so organized. My group arrived and all room keys were there waiting for us. We checked into 56 rooms in 10 minutes. The rooms are newly renovated and beautiful.  The provided breakfast has plenty of offerings; something for everyone.  The breakfast room’s outdoor seating area overlooks Disney’s California Adventure Park. The hotel is so close to Disneyland! It’s only a 9 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance. You cannot find another location this close with such great service, rooms and breakfast. Highly recommended!

Fantastic location. Less than 400 yards from entrance to both Disney Parks. Packed with dining options nearby and a 7 eleven next door. Good pool, free wifi, clean rooms, on site free parking and a bar. Huge lobby area. The only criticism is that the breakfasts are average, and many of the chairs are torn. This is being picky.

I love staying at this property. I e been three times. The staff are amazing, breakfast is good and team keep it clean, rooms are good and walk to Disney is short. If and when I return again I’ll continue to stay here. They were even able to accommodate a first floor handicap room with early check in.

Desert Palms is a wonderful place to stay! Common areas are large, breakfast buffet is good, and staff is very friendly! The rooms are very comfy too! Gift shop and restaurant within hotel. Short 10 min walk to Disneyland. Convenience mart next door, and A Mart around corner for a large selection of reasonably priced Disney apparel, trinkets!

Came for the Dental Convention. Late arrival. Everyone was very accommodating, friendly. Room was very clean, good amenities, bed was comfortable but you may want to bring your own pillow. For my taste, they were a little too big and too hard. Free continental breakfast had good variety although, as a vegetarian, it was a little disconcerting to find pork sausage in the scrambled eggs. Since there were other options with cereal, oatmeal and waffles, etc., it was fine. Good job Desert Palm!

We stayed at Desert Palms during our visit to Disneyland. Our stay at Desert Palms was horrible. Our room was dark and smelly. The breakfast was horrible too, there were no decent options. Only high sugar cereals, fatty meats and make your own waffles with syrups. The breakfast room was filthy.  We got no sleep the entire time we stayed at Desert Palms, the staff were vacuuming outside our room at 1am. I asked staff for assistance on making an international phone call and they were no help at all. They told me “oh other guests did it and it worked so I don’t know.” They then organised us a transfer to Santa Monica and couldn’t tell us the price when we got there we are hit with a $160 transfer fee. Wouldn’t waste our money like this again. The hotel is too far away from

I spend mother’s day weekend on Friday and Saturday at this hotel and it as a very nice experience. Me and my adult daughters and 15 year old grandson shared a double queen room. Quick check in and check out. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Close to restaurants and stores and 8 minute walk to Disneyland entrance. Very good raspberry and mango margaritas in the lobby bar, awesome bartenders and good food. No parking fees and a delicious 😋 breakfast for guests. Nice pool but didn’t have time to enjoy it. We will book this hotel again in the future. I recommend this hotel to anyone 😊👍🏻

Our trip was last minute to Disney. The room was small but cozy and very clean. Hotel staff was friendly and Oasis restraunt/bar was nice.  Food and drinks were great.  10 minute or so walk to Disney. Would book again!

Summary Heading: Reasonable priced - great location. Good value.
Summary: With a large family, we found that the Desert Palms was very conveniently located for a family holiday to Disneyland. It is a leisurely 10 minute stroll from the entrance gates, easily done watch day. The amenities are reasonably basic but clean adn well priced - and overall, good value fro what you pay. Recommended.

Good quality, clean, comfortable rooms with good washing facilities. Excellent location for walking access to tourist spots eg. Disneyland as well as excellent restaurants. Good access to buses to wander further afield.

We just returned from a mini break here and we were not disappointed.  We had stayed here 2 years ago and it was just as as good as the last visit.   The hotel is walking distance to the main gate , clean , and safe.  The price includes parking , breakfast , with complimentary water and coffee in the lobby.    The front desk staff were helpful and allowed for an additional parking pass as my daughter met me at the hotel later in the evening.   The only draw back is that the room windows are not well insulated and we were woken at 6:00 a.m. by a rubbish truck and and a car alarm from the parking lot.   I would definitely recommend and return to this hotel for its quality and consistency.   Thank you for helping to make out weekend special!

We visit Disneyland at least once a year and sometimes we venture out from our regular hotels...and sometimes we have no choice because of vacancy issues. We always like as close as possible to the Parks. As our kiddos get older (10,12,14) , we find ourselves needing more space, especially for sleeping. We’re now looking for hotels with enough bedding for 5 people to sleep comfortably, without getting 2 rooms. That’s why we booked the Del Sol—it has bunk beds!  BUT we didn’t stay there. I must have messed up the reservation somehow because of our 3 nights, they didn’t have room for us on our first night. They were totally booked. As were the 3 Disneyland hotels, as I soon discovered, because I called as soon as I found out there was no room at the inn!  That’s what happens when

Summary Heading: Great location, clean, good breakfast, and free parking
Summary: We stayed here during our Disneyland trip. The location was great and we had no problem walking back and forth from the park every day. The breakfast was good and served early enough we could still make rope drop every morning. We stayed in the 2 bedroom adjoining suite. It was the perfect setup for us as we were traveling with Grandparents. We did have 2 complaints, the thermostat was in one room and at night when we slept we closed the door between the rooms and the AC ran all night in one room trying to cool the other down. So we were freezing in one room. Our other complaint was being woken up by the garbage truck at 630am in the room that had the exterior windows and overlooked the Alamo car rental. The windows are not insulated at all so it was loud when the garbage truck

We have been coming to the Desert Palms for years.  In years past we have always found the service to be excellent, but the hotel was aging.  Thanks to a new renovation, the rooms are now very nicely appointed.  The only complaint we have is that their prices have risen now.  The hotel offers several different options for family suites, so be sure to speak to the reservations staff about the different room layouts.  As before, the main interior courtyard is still very noisy due to the pool in the middle, so if you want a quiet room, ask for a room on an upper floor towards the back of the property.    There is ample parking underground and in the back.  The location is good, about a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland main gate, with conveniently located pharmacies and shops across

The location of this hotel is what's kept my family coming back. We've stayed here twice in the past year alone, and it really is a convenient hotel to Disney. We just returned from a big family Disney trip where we stayed at the Desert Palms. Having spent multiple nights here across multiple stays, I decided to share my opinions.  Pros:  --Walking distance to the park (10 minutes) --7 Eleven and Walgreens super close for snacks or drugs --Nicely sized rooms with suites available (Family Suite is great!) --Free breakfast and parking  --Great breakfast area --Early check-in (for a fee) --They'll hold your bags until check-in so you can go to Disney  Cons: --Resort fee (which basically negates the free breakfast and free parking)  --The pillows are horrible! Bring your own or buy

My family of 6 stayed here for 7 nights in April and it was a wonderful hotel. We chose the room with a kitchen and it worked perfectly for our family. It was a clean an updated hotel. Our room looked just like the pictures online. The pool was large and clean with lots of chairs for parents who may not want to swim to sit in. The breakfast was a nice bonus and started at 6:30 so we could still make it to Disney park opening. It is walking distance to the park. It looks like it may be far on the map but it took us less than 15 minutes to walk. It is also located next to many convenient places, 7-Eleven, CVS and tons of food places. The staff was very nice. This is my new go to hotel for Disney.

Hotel very nice. Staff very friendly. In house restaurant was fine. It would be nice if they changed the movie in the lobby on a daily basis. It is a walk to the Park. In the morning ok but after a day in the Parks - ugh! The bus they recommend was not at all convenient.

Summary Heading: We will no longer be staying at Desert Palms
Summary: Updated review: I’m so sad to say but we will no longer be staying at Desert Palms. My family of 4 recently decided to get Disney annual passes and had a few trips we wanted to book starting in February, March and May. We called on a Saturday afternoon and spoke to a young woman. We were told the room rates were double what they normally are in February and we must stay a minimum of 3 nights because “there’s a lot of conventions and we can charge that much”. Even after all of our loyalty and trying to book multiple stays at once we were not aloud to stay 2 nights in February without paying an additional $400 for a night we wouldn’t be there. The girl was highly unprofessional, and could care less that we were loooong time repeat guests. She said if you don’t like it call back

Room was clean, staff was friendly.  Chose this location for price, free parking and hot breakfast.  Hotel was close to Disney and other events and restaurants.  Would stay here again and recommend to others.

Hotel was over priced, very small, dark  room facing back allley. No windows. Tiny bathroom. They would not let me out of reservation knowing I was over paying way too much. Over $500 night! Was excpecting decent suite with view.

My brother and I stayed here for an overnight trip to Disney. The walk to Disney was very short (it's closer than the toy story parking lot), which was convenient for the end of the night and getting there in the morning. The continental breakfast was a definite plus, we loved the Belgian waffles. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating and the room was great for the price we got. We also loved the towel elephant that waits for you on the beds, it makes for a cute room companion. We'll definitely be staying here again!

We are in town for a convention and finishing up our stay and I have to say that I’ve been pleased with our hotel stay. Pros: Lobby has complimentary water and coffee Easy walk to convention center - 5 min Room is nicely appointed and comfortable. Room has a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee machine Bathroom has nice amenities and a blow dryer Includes iron/board We were allowed to park before we checked in so we could go to our convention. We went to the front desk and was given a permit. We were allowed to check in an hour early. Room service was quick and yummy. Breakfast was sufficient and they supplied ample seating.  Cons: It gets very loud at night and you can hear conversations clearly from the hallway.  When we checked in I was told we had received an upgrade and he

This is a great location! Less than 1 mile from Disney. Our room was large and appeared to be newly updated. Towel animals on the bed was fun! Breakfast is tasty and there is a good variety of food. The food trays always seemed to be full. Rooftop patio was undergoing maintenance so we weren't able to sit outside and have breakfast as we have done in the past. There was a huge crowd our last day there and they did open another other room so we could have a place to eat. Love the fruited water and coffee bar in the lobby for a quick pick me up. And don't forget to take your family picture with Mickey at the little kiosk in the lobby!  The only reason I am giving them 4 stars is due to the dishonest timeshare people they allow to be in their lobby. When we checked in, the front

The hotel would be good of familiar going to Disney (which most of the clientele is. I would not recommend it for business trips. The food in the Oasis restaurant is almost inedible, and incredibly slow. Go there for a drink, skip the food.

Summary Heading: Near to DisneyLand, OK for couples without children
Summary: Mentally preparing for trip to DisneyLand without children of our own, my husband and I hoped to find a nearby hotel that was both comfortable and didn’t make us feel weird to be there without kids. The Desert Palms Hotel and Suites managed to do just that.   About a fifteen minute walk from Downtown Disney and next door to all kinds of shops and restaurants, the primary draw of this hotel is convenience, but comfort and the breakfast buffet are close behind. We stayed at a really nice hotel in downtown LA the night before arriving here and the Desert Palms, while catering to families, was pretty great, too. The beds were big and fluffy, the bathroom spacious and comfortable, and with the added convenience of a refrigerator and microwave in the room. DisneyLand was expensive

I was attending an event at the Convention Center and avoided Disneyland. There are more convenient hotels for each, but the location seemed like a good compromise for both.
