Windows didn't open, the HVAC was finicky and I found it hard to get a good night's sleep for some reason. Just an average place in an expensive market, really.

Nice hotel in walking distance to Disneyland. The room was comfortable and quiet.  A nice quick breakfast is provided. There is a cafe/bar on site. The drinks were reasonable and food was good for a quick bite.  There are plenty of family type rooms.  Tip: Ask for a quiet room on the 4th floor.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but Bad About Leaving Messages and Returning Phone Calls
Summary: Stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites for the Jr. Spirit Nationals Cheer competition.  So of course there were tons of cheerleaders running around the hotel.  Although thank goodness we didn’t encounter a lot of running around and yelling from the cheer groups.  So I am guessing the hotel was able to contain them.    We had a couple packages mailed to the hotel and they handled them AWESOME. We were asked for id when picking them up.  Glad to know they won’t give them to just anyone that asks.  They were leis and I was so happy to hear from Sergio that they refrigerated them for us while they held them.  They said they called the room and the phone number we left to let us know that the packages arrived but they never left a message.  Leaving a message would have been

Summary Heading: Great place! close to everything! short walk to Disney, and I mean short!!
Summary: Very nice, and everything was right there! we really enjoyed our stay. Nice staff. Room was very comfortable, and quite! and there were a lot of kids! never heard them! slept very well. So close to everything, the gift shop people were so nice! The front desk people were very nice without being pushy..great coffee, Everything we needed was right at our fingertips! Loved it we will be back! Great customer service!

A recommended place to stay close to Disneyland. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room service food was better than expected. Children enjoyed the stay. Good bar and staff for adults to relax after long day. Decent family suite for a great price. Would stay here again...

Great price for a suite for a family doing Disney. About a 10min, very easy walk to the park entrance. No shuttle needed!! It was clean and room was spacious. One night we had family stop in for pizza after a day at Disney and we were able to have 9 people in the room, comfortably, because of the extra "living area". Perfect for a family with 3 young kids. The outdoor pool was heated and fun for an evening swim. Doesn't get much, if any sun, due to the fact it is in the middle of the building. The breakfast is just ok, the kids loved the homemade waffles! We would definitely stay there again.

We stayed for 7 nights, the beds were comfy and our room was quiet. Everything was immaculately clean and our towels were replaced daily and the room and beds were fixed up. The breakfast was great, there was lots of choice, including fresh fruit and porridge if you're watching your waistline. The laundry facilities were excellent and kept clean like the rest of the Hotel. The free parking and location were great too. The only thing I didn't like was the disposable plastic cups and disposable coffee cups, so much waste generated, surely there is a more eco friendly option?

Great suites at this hotel. The pool lacks but the rooms make up for it and we weren't there to swim! It was a full one bedroom apartment suite and we really enjoyed having all of the space and usage of the kitchen if needed. The breakfast was okay not exciting but it came with the room so it was worth it! it held us over until we ate in Disneyland and other guests really enjoyed it. I did like making waffles - my only problem is if I didn't eat carbs and sugars there is a limited selection.   Clean rooms and it was quiet - comfy beds too!!

Nicely appointed rooms. Simple menu in Resturant. Nice option. Short walk to Disney and convention center. Also easy walk to a number of resturants. Friendly staff. You can buy your Disney tickets in lobby for multi day stays. Same prices as gate, but may save you few minutes from waiting in line.

By accident we found this hotel after reviewing nearby hotels to Disneyland and it was perfect! The bunk room/king bedroom was spacious and served 4 adults and 2 toddlers. We requested a room overlooking Radiator Springs in Adventure Park and it was honored 😊. The hotel is spotless and any request was met with a smile and promptly. Rates were very reasonable for our stay. The walk from the hotel to the Disney parks was an easy one and we always felt safe walking back at night. I would highly recommend this hotel as part of your Disneyland vacation.

I've stayed in a few different motels around Disneyland over the years and this one was by far the best.  It's on the same block so you don't have to cross any streets to get to Disneyland, which is perfect when you're traveling with kids.  The rooms are clean, the staff is super friendly, and the buffet breakfast is not only FREE, it's delicious.  They switch between strawberry and cinnamon waffles everyday but always have regular flavor in case you don't want either of those flavors.  Their scrambled eggs were a little rubbery but the egg whites were delicious when you stick them on top of their sausage patties.  They have donuts, fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, cereal, milk, and three kinds of juices.  The pool is heated and in the middles of the hotel which is nice.  There is

This hotel is located very near Disneyland which is a good thing. If you book here make sure you get a room that does not face the streets unless you are a very heavy sleeper. This hotel is at the corner of one of the busiest intersections in Orange County. Even though we asked for a room away from the street, we were assigned one overlooking Katella (windows are signle pane). We spent three nights there and maybe got two hours of sleep a night. We tried the air conditioner for white noise but it didn't have a fan option so it kept turning on and off which didn't herlp matters. Try other locations if you're a light sleeper.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a Queen Suite for four nights, great spacious room for a family.  The beds were comfortable and the room was always cleaned when we returned from the parks.  This hotel offers a complimentary breakfast and free parking, and its a short walk to the parks.

The bunk bed suite we booked was unexpectedly comfortable and well equipped in this 'bed factory' hotel. Reasonable space and well equipped bathroom, comfortable beds - lots of towels and pillows supplied, nice touches like lights under the bunk beds and a microwave, this hotel was perfectly located for our 3 day trip to Disneyland. Lots of tea and coffee facilities. It also had laundry facilities which was great for travelers, and a reasonable pool although the pool probably needs resurfacing and tends to get full of kids later in the day. The hotel arranged transport for our onward trip which was very helpful. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast - but the one day we tried it, the dining room was packed and there was no food left even though it was early.

Room was nice and breakfast was good. I am rating low because they would not honor their discount. I am a repeat customer and the customer appreciation is certainly lacking! To bad you lost a repeat customer because of $50. The principle of customer service is as important and the money. Stand by your offers.
Manager Response: Hello Slinger911,   Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear that you felt that our offers were less than satisfactory. Upon reviewing your booking it shows that you were given a Special Discounted rate for repeat customer booking for multiple rooms which is a considerable amount.  We also applied a promotional discount for your room upon check out to ensure that our repeat guest have the absolute best rate.   As we offer multiple promotions on bookings, we let our customers choose the offers that best benefit them; however we are unable to stack up multiple offers on already discounted prices.  Hopefully this clarifies any misunderstandings that might have taken place.

Summary: This was our first stop on our first trip to the USA.  The hotel was fantastic, clean and friendly staff.  We had a one bedroom suite with bunk beds for a family of four.  Short walk to Disneyland and a lot of places to eat.  We had a hire car and there was no charge for parking.  Highly recommend 😊

This is our "place" when we go to Disneyland, which as annual pass holders, is a lot. We've stayed there more times than I can remember, and every time has been a pleasant experience. It's a short walk, or a cheap Uber ride to the parks. The size of the rooms is amazing...perfect for relaxing after a long day at the park, with plenty of room for everyone to have their own space.

Great hotel, the suite we had was large it slept,8 people easily.  There was 4 of us. the hotel had the bus passes there so it was easy to buy them there'.  They had a little store right in the lobby.  They had a restraint too . The store had some nice stuff and the restaurant was o.k. food,  but nothing fancy.  Across the street had several nice restaurants, and Disneyland was within walking distance.  The hot tub and pool were  great too.  The breakfast was o.k., and it had good selection.  I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel - short walk to Disneyland
Summary: We love the Desert Palms hotel and stay here every time we go to Disneyland.  The staff is friendly and the rooms are very nice, spacious and accommodating.  We enjoy the breakfast that is included in the stay - it makes it so nice to not have to worry about getting the kids fed before heading to the park!  This will always be our Disney trip hotel

The rate included breakfast, go early before it gets too crowded. Front desk was friendly, housekeeping did a great job. Overall it was quiet, comfy beds, and a close walk to the park. There is a shuttle but most of the time you can walk faster.

Summary Heading: Great hotel within walking distance from Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is at the southeast corner of the block where Disneyland is, so no need to cross the big streets, you can just along the street until the main entrance. If you have younger children, maybe you can walk to Disneyland and come back by Uber.  I made last minute reservation for the hotel, so didn't expect much, but the hotel had small but good enough swimming pool, breakfast good enough as well. I was able to park my car, go to Disneyland and check in later in the evening. I emailed the hotel about this, and they replied it is possible based on availability, of course, but the parking lot was big enough for the hotel that size.  Overall satisfactory stay.

Summary Heading: Big, modern rooms, perfect location for Disney
Summary: We loved staying at the Desert Palms on our most recent trip to Disneyland. The hotel is right on the Disney block and just an easy 10 minute walk to the front gate. The lobby and rooms are all recently remodeled and very clean and spacious. The pool is a bit small and can be crowded but it's heated year-round. Love the convenience of the free hot breakfast (the menu changes daily) served in a sunny penthouse dining room with a nice patio overlooking the back of Carsland. Also we appreciated the super thick glass to block out the traffic noise on Katella ave--we slept like babies. Overall the best stay in Anaheim for families.

Just got back from Disneyland and the Hotel we stayed at was a perfect choice.  Flew down for one night celebrating a birthday but would arrive before and after checkout and would have a rental car.   They let us park in thier lot and held our bags.  Called numerous other hotels who couldn't accomodate, or would charge.  Desert Palms gave of a Parking Pass early and held our bags.  Check in took seconds, bag check perhaps 1 minute, easy to find parking.    We have stayed at 5 other hotels on this side of the parks and this was the best value.  4 of the others were more expensive, (the one that wasn't was sketchy ) and none of them had rooms as nice or new.  This also had a better breakfast and was a really easy walk without crossing streets.    On a busy street, but we never

Summary Heading: Nice hotel within walking distance to Disney
Summary: This hotel was very nice and the staff was very helpful and accommodating to our large group of 24 people.  The pool was very fun.  The breakfast was delicious with many choices that changed daily.  We were about a 10 min walk to disney which felt a little far at night walking home but was still a nice location

Desert Palms is located about a 1/2 mile from Disneyland.  You can see the roller coaster from California Adventure from the parking lot.  Good walking distance or use the ART Bus which has stop right in front of the hotel (beware of the homeless lurking around the adjacent 7-11 and bus stop).   Hotel and room were clean and nice, however you can hear activity from the floor above (a lot of kids).  There is a refrigerator, microwave, and safe in room.  The bathroom is set off the room area which is nice when you have multiple people trying to dress while the bathroom is occupied.   Underground parking.   Offered standard breakfast fare of eggs, potatoes, fruit, muffins, cereal and make your own waffles.  Nothing special, but a great way to start your morning activities.    Great

The hotel was clean but outdated.  Location was great, central to many restaurants and an easy walk to disney parks (kids will say the walk back after a long day was too far!). Rooms were spacious and the complimentary breakfast was a nice option (although the food choices could have been better).  staff was really friendly and helpful.  Pool was great for a quick swim.  Hot tub was perfect for soaking sore feet and muscles after a long day at the disney. The fridge, coffee maker and microwave were a nice addition to the room.  Really liked the sitting area and table/ chairs.  Great for families

This hotel met all our needs. It had free breakfast, wifi, a pool/hot tub and a gym. The breakfast items rotate evert day. The room was decorated nicely and had two comfortable queen beds with a sofa bed which is old and uncomfortable. The room was too tight but it was a great location for walking to Disney. I highly recommend this hotel to Disneyland tourists,

We arrived early but the hotel allowed us to leave our bags in storage and park the car for free whilst we went to the Disney park all day. We checked-in later at night and were upgraded to a suite which was great. I was impressed with the suite which was spacious and very comfortable. The free breakfast was good. We walked to the parks which was only 10 minutes or so. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: came during thanksgiving. booked a two bedroom suite. Got housed on the first floor. Location: If you want to go to disney land, this is a prime spot. You can walk to disney land from the hotel. But going to anywhere else such as Getty or Universal Studios is pretty far. The bus stop and 7-11 around the corner attracts a lot of homeless and weirdos. Some of them are pretty scary and mentally unstable. Not sure if I want kids walking around during the night.  Room: Suite is clean, with one room facing the street. It is not too noisy. The bed is a bit soft, but that's expected for all of these hotels.   Fitness room: small but functional fitness room breakfast: OK breakfast, basically continental breakfast + eggs and waffles.  Overall wasn't bad.

We stayed here for three nights at the end of November. Our room was on the ground floor, facing the street - which didn’t end up being too noisy!  All the staff we interacted with were courteous, friendly and helpful. We ate at the onsite restaurant for dinner one night, and the food was tasty and reasonably priced.  The Disney parks, and plenty of other things, are within walking distance of the hotel. I Would definitely recommend this place and would certainly stay here again if I’m ever back in Anaheim. Thanks!
Manager Response: Dear Sausages85,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The air conditioner was noisy and inadequate. The bathroom was poorly designed. The room was inadequately furnished. The walls were thin. The breakfast was downright awful.  Sure, the tile looked nice, but everything else looked like a cheap motel in the middle of nowhere.

I loved this hotel. Rooms are nice and clean, lobby is spacious, the breakfast included had a good variety and had enough room for all guests. The staff was very friendly and helpful and Kristen made it extra special having a Birthday surprise for my son upon arrival. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Evetripp,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests. Thank you for your compliments to our team member Kristen. We are so glad to hear that your son enjoyed his birthday surprise!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed in the suite because we had 5 adults and needed the space. I am so glad we got the kitchen because the breakfast buffet really didn't work for us. 2 of the days they had powdered scrambled eggs with ham mixed into it, the other day and they had egg white patties! EWWW They had under cooked potatoes and sausage patties, DIY waffle stations, toast, 1 type of muffin, 1 type of fruit. I guess what I'm saying is my family needed more choices.But there are lots of good places in the area that uber eats will bring you food from!  The room was clean, the beds were comfy and it is super close to Disneyland. We used Uber to get to Disneyland! From the driveway to downtown Disney it was less than $9 for all five of us! We really wished the Jacuzzi had earlier and later hours so

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: My family and I stay here every year sometimes a couple times a year for our Disney trips. They are always good to us and seem to find a way to upgrade us what feels like every time. The location is great, easy quick walk to the park and across the street from Walgreens. The gas station next door is super convenient for waters and such. The staff is great always kind and accommodating not a single complaint in 5 years. The restaurant isn't 5 star but they try and for that we eat there at least once a trip. The pool is decent sized and very clean. As for the rooms very clean and remodeled to be a modern decor. Honestly can't find anything we don't like about Desert Palms, highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear gsmadonna,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests. We are so glad you continue to chose our hotel for your visits to Anaheim. Thank you for your compliments to our staff!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Just returned from a conference in Anaheim. This hotel was less than a five-minute walk to the convention center just down the street. It's also within walking distance to Disneyland if you are visiting the park. There were lots of families and I was a little nervous that there would be a lot of noise morning to night. The opposite was true as the Desert Palms has a Quiet After 9PM policy. The staff was super friendly and helpful, the room clean, modern and spacious.

The breakfast was so bad I can’t believe they serve this to humans. Facilities ok the pool was not bad it also had a spa. They have laundry and dryer facilities just ask for change at reception. About a 10min walk to Disney but the price on Sunday’s was so ridiculous we ended up moving hotels. The restaurant I think called oasis was not that good if you venture down towards Disney there are way better restaurants we mostly ate at Denny’s which was delish and so cheap!

We are currently staying at this hotel and we came back from a long day at Disneyland yesterday to find brown water pouring out of our bathroom ceiling. A toilet valve had broken in the bathroom above us and the bathroom was soaking wet. Although the maintenance crew were quick to respond and the front desk staff quickly provided us a new room to move to - we had damage to some of our possessions and lost an evening of our vacation while packing up and moving to a new room with no help from staff. After requesting a call from the manager repeatedly today, and being told she is in meetings all day - we have still not heard from anyone at 9:00 pm. We haven’t been offered any compensation for our damaged items or lost time from our vacation. I do NOT recommend this hotel if you are

Had three nights at this wonderful motel. The staff were very helpful and always polite, the room was clean and well maintained and the great thing about it, just a short walk to Disneyland. The local bus stops just near the entrance if you don't want to walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Les W,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed as a family of four in a twin queen room with the extra space for a lounge and dining table. The rooms had a bar fridge and microwave which was helpful for storing and cooking your own meals.  The beds were comfortable and bathroom roomy by American standards. The bathroom had a well lit mirror for those ladies applying makeup.  The room included free parking for one vehicle plus buffet breakfast each day. The breakfast was very basic and not really my cup of tea, but it did the trick of putting food in the kids bellies before heading off to Disneyland.   This place is super close to the parks and an easy walk. It's also close to many restaurants such as Denny's, IHOP, Tony Roma's and many more.  There is no free shuttle to the parks at this place, but the value for

Locationwise- it's perfect. On the corner of the Disney lot, you can actually see the California Adventure Park from the level 5 windows on the way to the breakfast room.  We got a courtyard facing room which was great for limiting external noise, but we still had a lot of noisy guests tramping down the hallway at all hours of the night and in the morning, and the door to the hall didn't seem to block any of that noise at all.  The room itself was clean, the bathroom was well fitted out. The towel elephant that greets you, was a nice touch, however, after I accidentally ruined it when moving it out of the way, it was never made or seen again.  The breakfasts were ok, nothing spectacular, but enough to fill you up. They did close the balcony which meant the breakfast room got

We stayed here on our disney stop of our honeymoon in a deluxe queen for 3 nights.  Check in was fine, but you can't check in until 3pm, they were happy to keep our bags though. Room was great, enough space for the two of us and a well appointed bathroom. Enough plugs for charging and good enough wifi.  Breakfast was just ok. the waffles were the best part. Pool is tiny and used by families A LOT!   Location is great, a 10 minute walk to Disney. If you're doing disney wear walking shoes (I did 33,000 steps in a day!). Lots of food options nearby and Anaheim Garden-walk about 2 blocks down, a great little shopping centre with some good restaurants too.  Will return with our 3 boys in a couple of years. It does the job for a disney holiday.

Pros: very clean room, very nice staff from housekeeping to front desk, decent hot breakfast items (can fill yourself up nicely before going to Disney), good location (short walk to Disney, several drug stores and restaurants nearby), negligible noise from adjoining/overhead rooms.   Note:  I did not talk to staff about my cons.  I could have, but for some reason I never complain at hotels.  Cons:  our room fronted Katella and it was NOISY.  All night.  Every single night there would be several cars that literally sounded like race cars zooming down the street.  Ask for a room that is on the other side of the hotel.  Also, there were no curtains on the windows, just shutters so the light from outside was intrusive. I ended up using the little decorative "runners" from the end of

We stayed for 3 nights in 2 suites and 1 king/bunk room.  We booked directly through the hotel and we'll in advance and I think that get you the best rates.  Property is very clean and the bedding is very comfortable.  I guess downfall is noise from the traffic on the street if you have a room on that side.  We live in the city so were able to ignore but you can definitely hear.  New restaurant on property - oasis grill - has decent food for when you return back.  Ate burger, fries, chicken fajitas all very good.  Like All of the other reviews, free parking plus easy walk to Disney makes it a great option.

Recently stayed here for 9 nights with our 3 children.  Had a suite on the 4th floor with views to Disney including distant fireworks. Check in was easy, room reasy on arrival , all amenities were great. Had an issue with faulty showerhead on arrival that was replaced within 30 mins of calling front desk. approx 15 min walk to Disneyland (easy walk) Pool was ample for our needs and always busy and lively Didnt eat at the restaurant but had waffles and fruit from the free breakfast every morning, these were fine Ive seen complaints about the Wi-Fi but to be honest out of the three hotels we stayed at throughout the USA this had the best wi fi, didnt drop out, speed was fine and didnt constantly ask you to log in Negotiated a cash deposit prior to arrival in order to avoid holds

We spent eight nights here recently, the hotel room and facilities were great however the breakfast left a lot to be desired, would rather pay for a breakfast than have what was served up as free, the scrambled eggs as an example I did not even taste, the presentation was enough not to want to eat.

Spent 12 nights here to visit Disney and Southern California, and to this end the hotel was perfect. 10 minutes walk from Disney and 10 minutes from Garden Walk's restaurants the location was perfect. Walgreens, CVS, Starbucks, coffee bean, a 7 11 and independent take aways are all across the road adding to the convenience. We were a little concerned when our room was right next to the lifts but in reality it caused us no problems as the living space was big and the bedroom was well away from any noise. House keeping kept our room spotless and the front of house staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has no real weakness. Other reviews have mentioned the homeless people at the bus stop next door, how ever they did not bother us one bit and having also visited a

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a visit to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is an easy walk to  Disneyland, the rooms were clean and well serviced, buffet breakfast was adequate.  The staff were friendly and helpful and  I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good value hotel close to the Disneyland.

We've been to Disneyland four times and have stayed at four different places. The Desert Palms ranks #1. There are always amenities at other places that would be a nice addition here, but I honestly can't think of one thing that I'd change about the actual hotel. The pluses include: location (perfect!), free parking, comfy beds, bigger mini-fridge (we packed lunched for the parks each day - saves tons of $$), clean rooms (great shower water pressure), quiet hotel, friendly staff, and free breakfast (lots to choose from). We were at the parks the majority of the time, but when we were at the hotel, everything went smoothly. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and would definitely recommend it and stay there again!

Overall the hotel is ok. The location to Disney Resort (Disneyland & California Adventure) is good. Complimentary breakfast was ok but lacked imagination .... how many times can you live off waffles. The pool area is good but could be open longer, especially for those who return later from their day travels. BIGGEST problem was the wifi. It dropped off after the first day and no one seemed to know how to fix it.

First thing you need to realize is you are next door to Disneyland.  If you are looking for a place without children and want absolute quiet then keep looking this is not for you.  However In saying that.  The hotel is clean comfortable.  The staff is almost most ghost like in that you don't really notice they are there until you need something.  I stayed with my wife for 4 nights in early September and really have no complaints.  The walk to the park is short and very easy.  Breakfast is quick and eatable.  It changes out on the day but if you're wanting a bit more IHOP is down the road or just bite the bullet and eat in the park.

Research no more ... Desert Palm Hotel & Suite was a the place to stay when visiting Disneyland. Its great, just a nice stroll to Disneyland during the day and night. In a great area with walking distance for restaurants and shops. The main lobby was welcoming, checking in went smoothing even for our late checkin. Our room was spacious, the window view was nothing (room 311), but heck only used room to sleep. The microwave and mini refrigerator help for our snacks. With our busy schedule we were only used the swimming pool once. Our kids enjoyed it, the pool area closes at 10pm sharp. The daily hot breakfast helped us greatly, variety of choices to gave a good kick start of the day. Overall we enjoyed our stay, highly recommend and definitely will come back.

Summary Heading: Friendly from the minute we walked in
Summary: I would like to say a big thank you to the staff of Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. We have just had a our school tour group stay for the last 2 nights of our New York trip. The hotel was so clean, beautiful rooms. We were lucky to have our group placed in deluxe rooms. It is a quick walk to Disneyland. Thank you to the very kind front office staff. I will definitely recommend this property to other groups and to our agent in Sydney. We will be back. Thank You.

We (2 adults) stayed for 3 nights in mid-September.  We flew into LAX and were only there to visit DisneyLand, so picking a nice hotel close to the park was our only consideration.  We had never been to the area before.  We are so pleased with our choice of Desert Palms!  First, how far to DL?  Just a very brief and pleasant walk under the trees!  It was about 7 minutes from the hotel to park entrances.  Second, the hotel...  Every member of the staff we encountered was very friendly.  Housekeeping kept the room clean.  The breakfast buffet, while not exceptional, was well-stocked (we appreciated that it included waffles) and could be enjoyed outside on the rooftop patio.  There is a small in-room safe.  And this is truly a hotel, with interior hallways and doors, so it is more

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Desert Palms
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms for 7 nights in late September, and were pleased with our stay. We booked through Expedia and had a well appointed Borrego  (since been renamed) suite, the room was quite large and had been recently renovated! We had no problems at all with our stay, the check in was seamless, our room was spotless, loads of space for 4 adults and 1 child, well stocked breakfast everyday, and adequate pool. We had a quick uber ride from John Wayne airport to the hotel, and were warmly greeted upon arrival. Our room was ready 45 minutes before check in (thank you! We didn't even call ahead to ask), our flight from Canada arrived early and we arrived ahead of schedule. We also requested a late check out, which is a very nice feature for 40$ Usd. Late checkout made for

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, easy and relaxed stay
Summary: We stayed as a family of six as our first vacation to the USA. I did a lot of research and for the price, location and inclusions you can't beat the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites.   We stayed in a kitchenette room. Kitchen includes all you need two element stove, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and utensils. The first bedroom has two large beds and the sitting room a fold out bed. The only problem we found with the fold out bed was the comfort of the mattress. We spoke to reception who helped make it more comfortable.   Housekeeping work really hard and the rooms are immaculate, always clean and spotless.   Plenty of free parking and there are plenty of nearby shops such as 7/11, CVS and Walgreens for supplies. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance or a short drive away.

Summary Heading: Our stay at the desert palms
Summary: We stayed this past weekend at the hotel. The location was great, you can walk to Disneyland if you want but we choose to drive from the hotel to the Toy Story parking lot. It was a quick 3 min drive and saved our feet from some extra walking (which is always nice after a couple of long days at the park).  The breakfast was much better than anticipated. There was a large variety with hot and cold options. I have 3 picky eaters and everyone was able to find plenty that they liked. The room was standard size and was in good condition. The 2 queens and pull out was enough room for a family of 5.  We also tried the restaurant and were again surprised at the quality and portion size. The gift shop is over priced so but if you need anything there is a convenience store next door to

We stayed at the Desert Palms in mid-September on a vacation with our 5 yr-old granddaughter.  This is an older property which has been remodeled and updated.  Hotel was found to be modern and very clean.  Staff provided exceptional service.  Covered parking on main floor or one floor down was free.  Kids activities on selected mornings.  Rooms--we had two queens beds with room of adequate size and bathroom also of adequate size.  Had minor problem with in-room safe upon arrival which was quickly resolved by maintenance.  TV had good quantity and variety of channels.  AC worked well.  Maid service was very good and worked around our schedule.  Had fresh towels daily.  Beds and bedding were quite comfortable.  Only negative was our view--opened to a solid wall some 7/8 ft away.

Summary Heading: Great stay in one of the Suites
Summary: Stayed a week during our trip to Disneyland.  We got one of the suites that had two queen beds, and a pull out sofa.  This was more than enough sleeping room for four adults and two children under the age of 12.  The room was clean, roomy and up to date.  The only gripe is that a single bathroom for that size of a room can get busy.  A split bath that has the latrine with a sink separately would have alleviated this problem. The complimentary breakfast as actually pretty tasty, and the hours allow for lots of people to take advantage regardless of wen they wake up.  The pool is small, but its clean and fun, the kids enjoyed it.  The staff was polite and check out was speedy, check in not so much. One gripe I would have is their up charge for early check in, if you have the

Summary Heading: A great hotel, but not perfect!
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 3 nights so we could visit Disneyland. The hotel was in a great location, the room was excellent and perfectly clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is a nice pool that is sheltered so was pleasant to swim in, in the middle of the day. Only a couple of negatives - as is with most hotel rooms in the USA the air conditioner was extremely noisy, we ended up having to turn it off mid way through each night as it kept waking us. The only other negative was the size of the dining room for breakfast, in proportion to the size of the hotel it was far too small, and the outdoor seating wasn't usable due to lack of shade. Only two very small negatives, otherwise definitely recommended!

Summary Heading: Worth the Money and great staff
Summary: Great hotel and fantastic location. The staff was wonderful especially a man with the night staff named Ramundo. He helped us out late at night one night and the job wasn't pleasant but he was. The breakfast was fantastic and was included in the price of the room. We had a suite with a room with bunk beds for the kids and it was great. 10 min walk around the corner to Disneyland. Our room had a view of the park over a wall. Well worth the price in my opinion.

I stayed at this hotel with my family to visit the Disney parks. In the past I have stayed in other facilities and am happy to have booked this hotel. The rooms are new, spotless and very nice. Very friendly and helpful staff. The buffet breakfast is varied, abundant and very good. The pool could be a little bigger however this is not a problem. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

This place is about a quarter mile walk to Disney, which means you don't have to take the ART shuttle. Worth it. CVS and a big 7-11 next door and across the street. Breakfast is in the top floor and there's plenty of seating. The suite we got was a good price for the location. But the second bedroom was sort of a weird arrangement in that it's an interior room with no window. But quite spacious, and the kids didn't mind at all. Very good service, cute pool.

Summary Heading: Good location and a lovely hotel
Summary: This hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Disneyland and california adventure. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious and clean. Nothing bad to say really. Standard breakfast, nothing special but what you'd expect here. The staff on reception is extremely helpful and polite. We'll return here when we next visit Anaheim.

About a 10 min walk to Disneyland, we enjoyed everything about this hotel. Staff is very friendly, water dispenser in lobby so you can stay hydrated on super hot days, free breakfast buffet which was above average compared to other hotels.  Typical breakfast has eggs, sausage, waffles, muffins, donuts, coffee, juice, cereal and fruit.  Very clean hotel and rooms are comfortable. Lots of eating options within walking distance.   Only minor criticism would be that wifi is not the greatest in our room and the walls are a bit thin. Could hear rumbling above us in the morning.  Overall, highly recommended to anyone wanting to be close to Disneyland but not stay in a motel and pay a fair price.  There's also a pool and hot tub available which I did not use but my niece and nephew

Loved the accommodations! Very clean, plenty of room and amenities.   Breakfast was a plus and easy access to Disneyland and California Adventure walking or shuttle to park. I chose a shuttle for additional cost.

We recently stayed here for 5 nights.  Excellent hotel, rooms were lovely and big, very clean and comfortable.  Parking and breakfast is included, the waffle makers were a hit with our family.  The hotel is in an excellent location, 10 min walk around the corner to Disneyland and California Adventure Park and 2 min walk to convenience stores.  Lots of places to eat within easy walking distance too and there is also a restaurant and souvenir shop on site.  No problems with parking and we were very happy to pay a small amount to have a 4 pm checkout on the day of our departure as we were not flying out until 10 pm.  Beds were super comfy which was much appreciated after some long days enjoying the parks.  Staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again

Summary Heading: Paper thin walls but otherwise good
Summary: The walls were paper thin and we could hear literally everything happening in the room next to us. ESPECIALLY the TV, and I've always disliked the sound of TV through the wall. Of course we had to be roomed next to someone who would blast their TV beyond midnight too. Also unsure if this is related to getting the booking through hotels.com, but my guest and I only required one bed but we were given 2-- if there were a cheaper rate available for just one bed I would've preferred that. The stay overall was great and I would be happy to stay there again if these issues are to be remedied in the future.

A GREAT clean hotel in a wonderful location!  Easy parking, walking distance to everything in need!  Close to shops, convenience stores, attractions, and everything else! I have never had a problem parking here, it's very easy parking in and out. Keep up the great work Desert Palms!  A++++

Second time I stayed at this hotel. Jenny the supervisor was very nice and knowledgeable. When we got there, to our surprise, they upgraded us to a kitchenette suite with a balcony. That was pretty awesome. The room was clean and big. Had a full size fridge, two burners, cleaning supplies under the sink. Breakfast was good.  Always hot, and never cold. Free parking. Great location from Disneyland. Your actually staying behind Cars land. About a 10min or less walk. Very close to the convention center and the Anaheim Gardenwalk. Overall, this is my new favorite hotel, and I can't wait to come back.

I love this hotel. It is in the perfect spot and has free under ground parking. There were plenty of spaces available.  You can walk to Disney Land, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney and you are an half hour away from gorgeous Huntington Beach. (Public)  We were upgraded to a kids' suite with bunk beds. The kids had an awesome view of the Gurdians of the Galaxy ride from their balcony. All the men working at the front desk were so friendly and helpful. My daughter was invited to do a Disney scavanger hunt to find characters hidden through out the hotel; she took this very seriously.  The pool is small but it is gorgeous. It is in a court yard and was never crowded during our stay. There is an on site restaurant that delivers and about 10 restaurants within a 5 minute

My new husband and I stopped here for 7nights for our honeymoon.  We chose it due to it's location to Disneyland (10-15minutes walk depending on how fast you walk!) and free parking.  It was clean, the staff were ALL friendly and the breakfast was great.  There was something for everyone.  The pool was small, but that was not an issue for us.  We went in it when we wanted an hour to chill out from being at the parks and there was hardly anyone in there if we didn't have it to ourselves.  Only thing was maybe that it could be a little noisy with children running about, but we hardly noticed as most days we were tired from being on park!  Also they no longer let you view the fireworks from their terrace as Guardians of the Galaxy block your view now.  We were a little disappointed

This hotel was fun. The free parking was handy. My kids were filled up from breakfast and then spent the morning swimming. Awesome for the money. Very close to Disneyland. We will be back next year for a couple days.

Summary Heading: Served its purpose for one night
Summary: I will say I booked this hotel through Booking.com then found a Groupon for a "super secret Disneyland hotel" that just happened to have the same pictures so I took a chance and bought the Groupon instead. Turns out I was right, they were one and the same! So I saved $57, which is the only reason I think it was a decent value for our one night stay (on a Tuesday).  Free parking was a plus, available crib was convenient, free breakfast was really only pastries and cereal and some egg and sausage patty things, but the last review was right - no blackout curtains in the room = poor sleep, pool area is tiny and shaded all day, and the elevator setup is super weird; you have to take one elevator to the rooms and one to the parking area .. NOT family friendly when you're juggling a

I stayed here in August of 2017. The hotel itself is just ok. The room was clean when we arrived but even when maid service was requested they did not do a great job cleaning my room during my stay. The breakfast was fine, I don't eat much for breakfast anyway and they had decent options each morning. The location was ok and we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go within about 15 minutes. The worst part and the reason I will never stay here again is the amount of noise you can hear in your room. From the hallway with people being loud and stomping down the halls to the visits to the ice machine at 2:00 am by other hotel goers to the annoying location of the pool in the middle of the courtyard. You will hear every single last person do every single thing. It was

I stayed here for VidCon 2017 and let me tell you it was great being so close to the convention center; it's only a five minute walk! It's a little farther if you want to walk to Disney but it's still manageable. The room was clean and modern and it was all in all a nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and they have a great concierge. The pool left a little more to be desired; it was pretty small and often really busy. If you choose this place solely because of the pool you may be disappointed. The complimentary breakfast is decent; there are basically two different meals they switch off every day. If your're a vegan you might have a hard time finding anything though. I would stay here again for sure if only for the fact that it was in a good location.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a good location, but disappointing pool area
Summary: The hotel is in an excellent location for Disneyland and offer free parking.  The service is good and the rooms are very clean and comfortable.  Wifi is ok - it was a little bit temperamental during our stay, but didn't cause us any issues.  The biggest disappointment for me was the pool area.  It is completely shaded and there are only 3 sun loungers for all the guests.  I have regularly stayed at hotels near Disney where it is good to relax in the sunshine after a day in the theme parks, however, this wasn't possible due to the completed shade and the limited facilities.  For that reason, I won't be staying here again, however, if you are not fussed about a pool area and sunbathing, the hotel would be just perfect.

We stayed here for 5 days in a two bedroom suite. The room(s) was better than shown on their website and was perfect for what we needed. The staff was friendly and the hotel as a whole was great. It was actually a pleasant surprise. The only things I could critique are: the breakfast was just okay. Wasn't stellar but wasn't awful either. Also, the pool was a little small but not horrible. All in all a great place to stay.

I bought Groupon for an Anaheim hotel and the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was the hotel assigned and I couldn't have been more pleased. We were probably the only ones staying there not going to Disney, but the activity of families and Disney "stuff" all around added to the positive environment. The hotel was very spacious. The room was much bigger than anticipated. We were assigned to a room with a full fridge, stove, sink, fold out couch, very comfy king bed and nice size bathroom. Really nice gift shop. All the staff was very helpful. Stayed here with my 16 yr. old daughter. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in the San Francisco area.

Summary Heading: Great Disney Location / Free Parking & Breakfast
Summary: Great walking distance location from Disney & California Adventure park. As a nice unexpected bonus we had been upgraded to a nice spacious suite. We would have stayed another night but alas, the hotel was booked solid for the next night. The one thing I wasn't crazy about was the parking policy that said the car had to be out of the lot by noon the day of check out. So no checking out, walking to the parks and coming back for your car. Having said that, the Mickey & Friends parking structure is just around the corner. I think it cost us $18 to park and they shuttle you to Downtown & the Park entries. Nice stay close to the park. Walk to many little stores surrounding.

Stayed here for D23. Pretty convenient. Clean. Comfortable.  Had a problem with getting a refund applied to my card, and a hands-off, "nothing I can do" attitude with one of the front desk staff. She was straight up sorry. I was extraordinarily angry.  THEN - I went back to the front desk the next morning to try my luck again. They handled my request, were apologetic for the lack of attention the previous day, and later they really went out of their way to make it up to me. I'll keep the details between us, but they earned their place in the hospitality arena.  I went from a guy who would never visit there again to a guy who won't hesitate to recommend, all because they came correct.  Nice service recovery guys. I really appreciate it.

First time staying at this hotel and we enjoyed it a lot! Great location if you are going to Disneyland or California Adventure. The customer service was great too, and the rooms were amazing (very spacious). We will be staying here again in the future.

We just returned from a stay at Desert Palms for 4 nights with our family of 5 which includes 3 teenagers.  This hotel was perfect for us.  It really is only a 10 minute walk to the park gates like everyone says.  There is a 7/11 next door and a CVS across the street for drinks and snacks, as well as cheap eats like pizza and subway across the street if you want to grab food before heading into the parks.  We had a Borrego Suite which was newly renovated and gave us a ton of room.  I actually looked forward to coming back to our room to relax in the hot afternoons before heading back to the parks in the evening because the room was so comfortable.  Breakfast was not great but who cares, the kids liked it and filled up on it which was the whole point.  In the past we have stayed

After roughing it around the USA the past three weeks, finishing our trip of here was an absolute breath of fresh air 😍 The room was modern and clearly freshly painted, access to free wifi, only a 10 minute walk to Disney, across the road from CVS and Walgreens with a 7/11 next door, and an $8 uber ride from the Outlets at Orange 😍😍 Our flight wasn't til late at night and we were only charged $35 plus tax for a late check out and the staff were more than happy to hold our bags while we went for a walk to lunch at the Cheesecake Factory just a 10 minute walk down the street. Perfect location and a lovely place to stay! Will be back :):)

We recently visited for 4 days and rented a air BnB condo within the palms. While this hotel is briefly away from the strip it's only a short distance and nothing Uber couldn't handle.  I can say we were a bit worried at 1st but it was an excellent stay. From the moment we checked in the service was perfect and professional. Whenever we needed extra towels or service it wax prompt. The room was clean, best air conditioning ever and I have no words to describe the view from our 30th floor balcony.  Definitely wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Loved this hotel.  We were 10 minutes walking from the park gate and that was walking with a six year old.  The suite was big, bright and nicely decorated, with a refrigerator, microwave and plenty of closet space.  We had four queen beds,  a large vanity with 2 sinks, and 2 rooms each with a potty and shower/tub.  Each room had a desk and plenty of counter space.  The breakfast that was included had plenty of choices to start our day and satisfied everyone from the 67 year old down to the six year old.  All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and professional.  If there was any negative it would be that the 2 televisions in the rooms were not good..  Every time we turned one  on we had to play with the cable.  We really only used them in the morning for the 4 kids
Manager Response: Dear Linda B,  Thank you for your excellent review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are also glad to hear that your family enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast. If you experience any problems with your room, even as small as a TV issue, please let us know during your stay. Our maintenance staff would be happy to fix anything for you quickly and we would love the chance to turn a negative into a positive.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Average Hotel - Probably won't stay again
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights at the Desert Palms.  Location is probably the best thing about this hotel.  It took our family only 7 minutes to get the park gate.  We had a family suite that included a king bed in one room and a set of bunk beds in the other room.  Beds were comfortable, but rooms are small and a bit old.  Pool is very small and not that inviting.  They charge a $10.00 resort fee which covered parking and Wi-Fi.  I hate resort fees - seems like a money grab as far as I am concerned.   The breakfast was very disappointing.   It is all about quantity and not quality - lots of canned fruit and a large bowl of yogurt.  Hot items consisted of brown round things (later identified as sausages) and pale yellow things (eggs). There was an abundance of donuts, which wasn't how
Manager Response: Dear B J,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback as it helps us to improve for all future guests and we strive to offer the best for our guests.  We hope you will reconsider visiting us again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights during our trip to Disneyland. Our room was clean, and our beds were comfortable. Breakfast was quite good in terms of selection, amount, and the dining space. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and friendly. It's a short walk from Disneyland, too.
Manager Response: Dear Luci S,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We work hard to ensure every guest has the best possible vacation with us and we are so glad that we were able to provide that for you. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The location is great. The suite is cramped, but clean and in great shape. I found it very noisy. You can hear water pipes in walls, people talking in other rooms, and in the morning, smells come through A/C vent.
Manager Response: Dear ConSand,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear you found the room to be clean and in good shape and you enjoyed our location, a 10 minute walk from Disneyland.   We hope you will consider us for your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This is my second time here and I had a completely different experience. This time was a later check in and just as smooth as last time. I almost got my favorite parking spot again. I don't use the car very much as we walk almost everywhere (just bring good walking shoes). My daughter and I were there again for the convention across the street, which is another story. The hotel upgraded their lobby coffee machine!! I wish that I could get one just like it!! We ate dinner at The Oasis (located off of the lobby). Good food. Good prices. The hot tub will always be my favorite thing there! Room was awesome, two queens, spacious enough for us to not annoy each other (bonus), fridge and microwave (comes with all rooms per the clerk) and a very small coffee machine which I never used
Manager Response: Dear Diane062016,  Thank you for another wonderful review. We were so glad you were able to come back and stay with us for another visit and that you had another great stay. We hope you had a great convention! Thank you for your compliments to our restaurant.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to seeing you again next year!

Summary: We have been staying at Desert Palm Inn and Suites every time we go to Disneyland for the last 10 years, I love it feels like home when we stay.  We tried other local hotels prior to finding Desert and will never stay anywhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Stacyhil,  Thank you for your wonderful review. It has been our pleasure to have you as our guest over the past 10 years. We are so happy to hear you call us your home away from home.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to many visits from you family for years to come!

Summary Heading: Great for families with young kids
Summary: Stayed with a family of 4, two kids aged 5 & 7 from Australia in a 1 bedroom with a bunk bed that the kids loved. Breakfast was included which was great before a day at the parks. 10 min walk to Disney so we could come back during the day for a rest. Pharmacy/convienience stores across the road for supplies. Take out food shops also in close vicinity. Clean and tidy rooms. We arrived sometime before check in and they found us a room straight away which was nice after such a long flight.
Manager Response: Hello Coco2711,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so happy to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us. Glad that your kids enjoyed the bunk beds, and that you found our rooms to be clean and tidy! We pride ourselves on our excellent housekeeping staff at the hotel.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We have stayed there about four times now since 2012 and just recently in April 2017. I can't think of a better place so close to Disneyland just about a 10 minute and breakfast included one less cost.  On our recent trip they have just renovated which look amazing. I have stayed in Deluxe Room, 1 Bedroom Suite with Kids Bunk and 2 Bedroom & 2 Bathrooms all rooms were perfect at the time of staying. All the staff were great. I would highly recommend you to stay there.
Manager Response: Dear Melina D,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We really appreciate you always choosing our hotel for your visits to Anaheim and are so glad to hear that you have had such wonderful experiences with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am also glad to hear that you like our new renovations.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to your next stay, and all that follow after.

Summary Heading: GREAT cost vs location vs property/features VALUE . . .
Summary: Decor updated in our 2017 visit from last in 2014.  It is a good 15-20 minute walk to the actual gate at a reasonable pace; some could do faster, but we had 2 small children 6 and 4 and my wife and I are in our late 50's with a few limitations (me w/ a tress fracture in a foot BEFORE arrival).  Very quiet rooms and has indoor access.  Very good hot buffet breakfast and parking included.  Could find nicer places farther away or the obscenely priced Disney hotels or some not so nice in my book lesser properties nearer the parks.  But this was ideal for us for the price as I am a VALUE first shopper.  I am sure it helped that we knew what we were getting, but would not have gone back if dissatisfied; think it has maintained quality and even improved.
Manager Response: Hello Ed,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for coming back and visiting us again. Glad to hear you liked the remodel!   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed in the kids suite, which consisted of a room with a King bed and a separate room with bunk beds.  The bunk beds had full size mattresses which was plenty of room for my girls, who are 11 and 16.   We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the pool, not the best view.  We had hoped for a park view, but no luck.  The room was long, but narrow.  The two rooms are separated by the bathroom and just outside the bathroom is a microwave and good sized refrigerator.   The room is a great place to sleep, but no space to really hang out.  The beds take up all the space, so the 4 of us kept bumping into each other if we weren't in our own beds.  When in the room, you can easily hear guests in the halls.  The walls are really thin and guests were loud all hours of
Manager Response: Dear JeepinTech,  Thank you for your review and for recommending our hotel to other travelers. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here and we hope you will consider visiting us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and pretty inexpensive
Summary: Hotel itself is quite good and close to Disneyland.  Couldn't close the door from the bedroom to the kitchen area because the bed was in the way.....not sure why you would set the room up in this way. I'm a light sleeper and we had a noisy fridge so that wasn't pleasant. The bus stop out the front of the hotel seems to be the meeting/sleeping place for homeless in the area so that's something to keep in mind. Didn't bother me so much but if I had kids with me they might be a little unsettled by it.....especially the old woman outside the 7Eleven on the corner who just yelled and swore at everyone and anyone. This is obviously not the fault of the hotel but it's worth mentioning here so there's no surprises. If you are after a relatively inexpensive hotel close to Disneyland then
Manager Response: Dear Craig M,  Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel for your visit to Anaheim. I am sorry to hear about the problem you encountered with your room. All doors in the room should be able to open and close and if you had let us know we definitely would tried to correct the problem during your daily housekeeping service. If you experience any issues during your next visit, even the smallest inconvenience, we always hope you would let us know so we can make your stay the best we can. We are constantly trying to improve our offering so our guests will have the best possible time on their vacations with us. Our front desk staff is happy to help!   Regarding property next door to us, while you are correct in stating that we are unable to do anything directly about this, we are working with the City of Anaheim on coming up with a solution for our guests visiting Anaheim. Our guests safety is our number one priority during your visit here.   We hope you will consider visiting us again in the future, and that we can earn a 5 star review from your next visit!

Summary Heading: Excellent service and very close to disney
Summary: Very good room. Great service by the staff. Good bath. 10 minutes away from disney. The breakfast is rich. It has free parking but the wifi is weak. We were on honeymoon and got a room upgrade. There are nice restaurants around such as the cheesecake factory.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: This is our second stay at Desert Palms and both times have been just as good. The place is probably a 10 minute walk from the parks and the rooms are nice enough. They do give you a free breakfast but it is pretty basic. That being said the hotel is a friendly well priced place that we will certainly stay at again.
Manager Response: Dear Glenn S,  Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We look forward to your next stay and hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Sure this place is a good choice for DL families
Summary: You can walk into Disneyland. Here is my short story advocating the 12 minute walk. My sons walked cuz we all knew it would be faster. We left in the car to drive to Mickey parking since we were checking out that day. They were inside DL in about 18 mins. We got inside DL in about 90 mins! We drove to Mickey and were diverted to Toy Story lot. We went thru many gridlocked intersections and waited in the longest bus line I have ever seen (over 100 visits to DL). Every step of the way was packed. Yes, walk from this hotel.  The rooms were very nicely renovated. The beds were good. The bunks were great for the kids. The sink was placed inside the bathroom instead of out in the room, which I dislike. The property overall is maximized to it's greatest potential. This older property
Manager Response: Dear Marcjenks,  Thank you for your review! We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Disneyland parking can be a bit chaotic more often than not, definitely much quicker to walk or take a shuttle there (walking still beats the shuttle too!). We glad to hear that you enjoyed our renovated rooms and free hot buffet breakfast as well.   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope we can earn a 5 star review on your next visit!

Summary: We had an amazing stay at Desert Palms! We have never seen customer service like this. Everyone went above and beyond for our family. This hotel was awesome. Will stay here for every trip to Disney land!
Manager Response: Hi Caroline,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are so happy to hear that you had a great stay with us. It was our pleasure to have you as our guest. I hope you had a wonderful birthday celebration while you were here!   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing your family again on your next visit!

Summary: My Family and I stumbled on the Desert Palms several years ago, and fell in love with it. The hotel is located at the back door to Cars Land. Of the many Hotels we have stayed in around Disneyland the Desert Palms has the finest Hot Full Breakfast. Every weekday morning they open at 6 A.M. - 7 A.M. on weekends. The dinning area is clean and spacious, and extends out onto the roof where you can dine and look onto the back of Cars Land and get a glimpse of the Disneyland experience prior to the Park opening. The rooms are one of the best kept secrets. They are quiet, clean and have plenty of space for that home like atmosphere. Following your restful night and delish breakfast it is just a short walk to Disneyland. When night falls and you are tired after a long day in the Park
Manager Response: Hello Steve,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us once again. I am glad you enjoyed our newly renovated rooms and free breakfast. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland. It is so close, that you can actually see some of the rides from the property. There was complimentary breakfast at this hotel, which was beneficial as you could have a bite to eat before heading to Disneyland. Would stay here again, as the prices were also good.
Manager Response: Hello YVR_Traveller_2016,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to seeing you again soon on your next visit!

Summary: The hotel was clean, quiet and very comfortable. We needed two rooms and were able to have them adjoining. It was close enough to Disneyland that walking was a good option, even for children. I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Carol,  Thank you for your great review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and are glad that you found our hotel to be clean quiet and comfortable.   We appreciate you taking the time to recommend out hotel to other travelers and we hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: We stayed in a two queen bed suite with full kitchen. The room was very clean and roomy. Nice having the kitchen to take a break in the day from Disney to rest and have a bite to eat.  Hotel is walking distance to Disney and California Adventure. Also close to other restaurants in the area. Service at the hotel was excellent. Everyone that we encountered was very helpful and nice. The hotel also has free breakfast in the morning which made it very convenient to grab a quick bite before heading to the park. Great family hotel. I would definitely stay again
Manager Response: Hello Schweitz2017,  Thank you for your awesome review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Location is great! Other then that not to much to rave about. Breakfast spread is not that good, if you want to check in early you have to pay.. Rooms are nice and updated, wifi worked good, TVs were not working properly, room temperature could not be regulated for both rooms.
Manager Response: Hello Jessicasphillips,  Thank you for your review. Our check in time is 3pm, we do offer early check in if available for $35 +tax. We are glad to hear you found our rooms to be nice and updated and you had a good experience using the wifi. If you have any problems with A/C, television, or anything in your room in the future please contact our Front Desk who would be happy to send someone up to the room to assist you. We try our best to make sure every guest has a wonderful visit with us.   We hope to see you again for your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Where to start. 1-this hotel is set up so weird and it gets confusing. for example- some floors aren't accessible by every elevator making it frustrating to try and navigate if you have to take the elevator. stairs are much more convenient for this. We had to wait well after check in time for our room because the maid service wasn't responding to the front desks call to determine if it was ready or not. Our room was decent, but the shower head was so harsh it felt like razor blades-not enjoyable at all! the walls between rooms are super thin!!! the continental breakfast is decent at best-but hey it's free. the view out our window was a wall to the outside of the hotel. the best thing about this hotel is that it is located just a few blocks-within walking distance- to disneyland

Summary Heading: Another good stay at Desert Palms
Summary: We took our 4 oldest grandchildren to a weekend at Disneyland the last part of April. We have stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel before and enjoyed our stay then too. We had reserved a room for 6 but they upgraded us to the family suite at no extra charge. Our room was next to the elevator but we didn't notice any extra noise from it. The breakfast buffet, while not fancy , is good and well staffed. Our room was clean and well taken care of every day. The kids enjoyed the pool after a day at the park as it is a quick walk to and from Disneyland. We would stay at Desert Palms again. Thank you to the hotel staff!

Summary Heading: “Great location near Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland! Good breakfast, clean room and free parking”
Summary: Really liked it and will be my choice again if I am back in the area for Convention Center and/or Disneyland. Was there for three nights while attending a conference at the Hilton/Anaheim Convention Center which is just a short walk away. FREE PARKING :) Room was nice.. Did not find time to use it, but the pool looked good. Check-In/Check-out staffs were amicable. Souvenir shop in the lobby. Clean Room, clean restroom and linens. Comfortable Beds. Breakfast was pretty good (Do not expect Embassy Suites standard though!). Dining area with indoor and out door seating options. Being so close to the Disneyland Park, there were lots of families with kids that were staying. Breakfast area was full with kids excited with their Disney experience and their positive energy in my personal

We chose this hotel on advice from a colleague and weren't disappointed. We were there for a two-night stay during Easter Vacation Week. From making the reservations over the phone, the service from the reservation staff was more than helpful, and encouraged me to call with any questions or concerns.  They were very clear about cancellation policies and how to make changes to the reservation.  When we had to add another room at the last minute, the website was quick and efficient in making the reservation. This is not a high-end hotel, but for a group of 30 middle school singers with adult chaperones, or families with children, this site was an excellent choice. The rooms comfortably housed four to six adolescents including the bathroom/shower needs.  The breakfast, included in

This has been our 2nd stay at Desert Palms.  Honestly this hotel meets all family needs when traveling to the disneyland parks.  I dont think there is another hotel that offers free parking, free roof top breakfast (lots of choices hot and cold), super quick walk to the maingate, pool, laundry, clean/comfy newly updated rooms, and the friendliest staff.  The people who run the breafast are seriously the nicest people.  One women helped my daughter carry her cereal outside to a table.  She had the sweetest smile on her face!  Yes wifi is slow but we are there to enjoy our family time so i was not at all bothered by that.  I highly recomend this place!!

good location for the price and nice updated rooms, one of our rooms was not ready at check in so they upgraded to a kitchen unit.  We were not prepared to use a kitchen so we didnt....but it was a very nice unit.

This was our first trip to Disneyland and first stay at Desert Palms in Anaheim. Our suite room with 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms was a great pick for 2 adults and 4 children. The two bedrooms are separated by a roomy area with double sinks and  two private tub/toilet combinations. This is one of the few hotels that actually would book a room for 6 guests.  There was no sitting/living area in the rooms, just beds, microwave,desk, TV, dresser and closet. Not a problem is you aren't spending a lot of time in the room. Soap and shampoo were a bit on the skimpy side, but we were provided with plenty of fresh towels and extra blanks when requested. The pool is quite nice and has a hot tub. Hotel complimentary breakfast was average, and the scrambled eggs were terrible. Plenty of

I was pleasantly surprised to find that my room was upgraded to a suite upon arrival. The extra room was so nice with my 11 month old. The beds were comfortable and room was quite big. The best part, this hotel is a very short walk from Disneyland, we walked to and from multiple times and found it quite manageable. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is because of the Breakfast. While yes, it's free, it wasn't worth it to me. There weren't many options that my family would eat, scrambled egg whites, turkey sausage, etc. The only decent thing were the waffles, unfortunately everyone else in the hotel wanted waffles too and there were only 3 machines, with no organized line. There were guests cutting in line and don't forget about the guests who made platefuls during their

A wonderful hotel walking distance to Disneyland, and breakfast included. This hotel offers everything you could need, even a friendly staff. A nice npool is available if you need to take a break from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: our families new disneyland get away hotel.
Summary: people at front desk very friendly and helpful. room was very clean beds very comfortable.great breakfast with many choices and the staff working the breakfast room were very friendly and helpful.also parking here was very easy. my family and i will stay here again the next time we visit disneyland. thank you all for a wonderful time.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to the "Happiest Place on Earth!!!"
Summary: This was our 2nd time staying at this hotel. This time around, it was a little more memorable because we were upgraded to a suite with two beds and a bunk. Also it was walking distance to Disneyland. The room was clean and looked updated. They also had free breakfast from 6 am -10 am.

This is a great hotel located near Disneyland. Easy walk to the main entrance, free parking, clean and comfortable room.  We have stayed at a number of hotels near Disneyland and this one is our favorite!  Great value as it is a higher end hotel but still affordably priced.

We had 55 people (13 rooms).  Good service, comfortable accommodation. Good pool, decent buffet breakfast.  Loved the bunk beds and rooms for six.  Easy walking distance of the parks.  Nice location (near 7-11, Walgreens, Pharmacy).  No complaints whatsoever.  Wifi was sketchy, but free when you could get it.

Just returned from a four night stay at the Palms and it was great.  Big, clean rooms with comfy beds. They handled our very large high school choir/band group with ease and friendliness. It was a 10 minute walk from Disney, so easy to go back and forth from the hotel.  Will definitely return with our family for another stay to explore the Parks!

The short story is: my laptop was in the room when I left, and not there when management went to look for it for me. A few hours later it dawned on me and I called in. The manager herself went to the room and couldn't find it. Assuming her best of intentions, the housekeeping staff stole the computer.   Otherwise everything nice about this hotel is wrapped up in its convenient location to Disneyland. The pool smells like feet. The food is standard, grab-and-go, 2-star hotel fare. The pillows will cushion you and cause you neck pain. The air conditioning sort of works. The ice machines are iffy (ours was broken and I had to go to a different floor after the staff sent me to the broken one).   But we will put up with a lot and be happy about it, if we are close enough to the

This is the 3rd year we have stayed at Desert Palm. Always a great experience, staff is very friendly and helpful. Love the buffet breakfast has a great variety and starts our day off right. Room is clean and comfortable. Highly recommend and we will stay here again.

We have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. I can not fault this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable and my bed was one of the nicest I've had the pleasure of sleeping in. The pool area is nice and the guest laundry was very convenient.
