The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, a little further to Downtown Disney. It was great to be able to pop in and out of Disneyland throughout the day and return to the comfort of the hotel. It is also very close to the Anaheim Convention centre which we had a competition at.  The staff were friendly and although the wifi was a little slow it met our needs. I also enjoyed the buffet breakfast which is simple but tasty.

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable, Safe and Quiet neighbor to Disneyland!
Summary: I spent a lot of time researching the hotels in Anaheim around Disneyland. There are so many to choose from it can be overwhelming. I made a great choice by selecting the Desert Palms. It is literally in the backyard of California Adventure. Our room was nicely updated, clean and comfortable. The hotel was reasonably quiet which I think is impressive considering during our stay a high school marching band and a number of high school dance teams were also staying there. We appreciated the extra space of the Deluxe Studio Suite which afforded us the ability to spread out. I do think that the room with just two queen beds would also be adequate for a family up to four people. The pool is small, and when the hotel is hosting high school teams it gets very crowded as does the

We have stayed here multiple times and are always happy with our stay!  we love the large room that can accomodate up to 8 people comfortably, the staff are friendly and helpful. we love the complimentary breakfast to get our day going.  easy 10 minute walk to disneyland

Summary Heading: great base for a Disneyland stay
Summary: A total of 10 adults, and 4 kids 8 and under were in our group, they all enjoyed their stay. The bunk beds for the kids were a big reason i picked this hotel. the breakfast was good, and literally a 10 minute walk to Disneyland...my only complaint was we never found a working ice machine. yes the pool area is small but we never used it.

Summary Heading: A really excellent well run hotel only 10 minutes walk from Disneyland and DCA.  Highly recommended!
Summary: Staying at this hotel greatly enhanced our family's Disneyland experience.  We were a party of 6 (4 adults and 2 children).  For us the rooms, food and facilities were perfect.  The king sized bedroom with a separate adjoining room that had 2 bunk beds were ideal for our son, daughter in law and 2 grandchildren.  The premium ("Bodego") room my wife and I had opposite theirs on the 4th floor with 2 queen sized beds was very spacious and comfortable.  This room could probably sleep 6 as it had a pull out queen sized sofa bed that could be separated from the other 2 beds by a curtain.   The rooms and bathrooms were clean, plenty large enough for a week's stay and well appointed.  Maid service was excellent.  Big and important pluses for us were micro wave ovens, refrigerators and

Stayed here for two nights. The hotel is convenient to Disneyland, of course, but will never return. The Internet speeds were horribly slow; felt like I was back on a dialup modem from 1995. Reported to the front desk who said they would investigate, but didn't see any improvement.  At checkout I inquired about the resort fee ($9.95/night) in connection with the poor Internet speeds and was lied to; the desk claimed this was a mandatory Anaheim city fee. In most hotels the resort fee is the cover for "free" Internet, like here.   Finally, tried to use a hotel dryer. It took my money, for sure, and registered it had started but never spun.   It's a two star hotel trying to masquerade as a 3.5 star.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland. I was impressed.  Some of the positives were having breakfast made so you could eat and go.  Also it was on the same block as Disneyland, so you didn't have to cross a busy street when you walked to the park. It was very close to both a Walgreens and Rite aid for those things that you forgot. I would have liked their pool to have been bigger. However that is a small thing as the main reason for the trip was going to Disneyland and not swimming in a pool. The rooms were nice and the staff did their best to get all of our rooms as close to each other as they could. We had 6 couples, some with children, so to work to get the rooms close showed us that the staff cared about us.  The next time we go to Disneyland, we will be coming

So I stayed here with my boys for a couple of nights during our getaway to Disney. First off, the front desk and everyone we encountered was nice. This hotel has lots of potential and seems to be well maintained for the most part. I had an issue that I didn't address because I didn't want to complain, but when we got to our room, our sink was extremely dirty. It left me feeling like the room wasn't as clean as it looked. I just washed and rinsed it and went through the room with my bleach wipes as I usually do. Breakfast and parking are both included, which is a plus if you are on a budget. I've stayed at a few other hotels close to disney, including a disney hotel where the rooms were a lot smaller than the one I was in. Towels were on the small side. I appreciated that there

Stayed here 5 nights on business. Great location, friendly staff, free parking, and hot breakfast buffet included are all perks. Convenient location near convention centre and a 10 minute walk to the gates of Disney. Room was clean and spacious. Would stay here again!

Very affordable accommodations within walking distance to Disneyland.  Room was clean and large with 2-queen beds, and bunk beds, and sofa sleeper in adjoining room.  Bright and large bathroom.  This accommodation is well suited for families.  Gift shop and free parking onsite.  Free breakfast included is typical American fare; not outstanding but gets you started.  Additional daily resort fee charged that I wasn't expecting, but the rate was still good. Some restaurants located within walking.  Very easy walk to Disneyland; no major streets to cross plus nice wide sidewalks.

Stayed for two nights with my group for a conference in the Anaheim Convention Center, which was right across the street. We also had the chance to walk to Downtown Disney afterwards, since it was also close by. Parking was complimentary with the reservation, so it was nice not having to pay extra. The staff was very welcoming, the room was clean, and the continental breakfast wasn't too bad.

Summary Heading: Comfort while working isn't easy to find
Summary: I loved the location and quite, service, room size, and cleanliness were spot on. Every employee had a smile and was truly dedicated. I felt right at home. I was impressed. Thank you for making our stay comfortable and relaxing.

We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel for 2 nights in January of 2017. It was an excellent stay. The staff was very professional, the Suites were very large, very well stocked with everything that was needed for our stay. The breakfast buffet had a large selection of continental breakfast items including waffles, breakfast meats and juices. From our table we could look out at the snow-capped mountains of Northern California as well as seeing Disney rides. I plan to make it back to Anaheim California with my husband and we will definitely stay at this hotel.

We recently stayed here for the second time. This time in a group. The hotel is clean, fairly quiet, handy to lots of restaurants. There are 2 pharmacies across the road, a seven eleven next door. There is a good self use laundry available. The pool and spa are in the centre of the hotel in a courtyard. It is an easy 15 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland. The staff were great and nothing is a problem. Higher floors can be better and lower rooms at the back can be noisy due to car park traffic. There is free car parking available.

After a long day of travel, it was nice to get to my room! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very nice and CLEAN! I love it when I don't have to do housekeeping job! Beds very comfortable and rooms are quite. I would define try stay here again!

Summary Heading: Very clean rooms. Outstanding staff. Well worth it.
Summary: They were extremely accommodating. Free breakfast buffet was okay enough. Parking is very limited but free. Those were the only two flaws and they really were not intolerable. The two Richards at the front desk were very friendly. About a ten minute walk to Disneyland. If it weren't for the kids running around the above floor it would've been a perfect stay. It didn't go on long and it is Disney so kids will be kids. I would stay here over any other Hotel in the area.

Summary Heading: would have gotten something closer to disneyland
Summary: the staff was good and I arrived early and the staff got the room within a half hour after I got there the breakfast was nice but no potatoes and the eggs were cold the room was nice but the a/c was on all the time tried to get the heater to work was a problem till you turned off the fan

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland Visit
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites for a three day visit to Disneyland. Not only was it extremely convenient (walking distance to Disneyland entrance), it was a really nice hotel. The room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was very nice.  I would definitely recommend this hotel!

The room was great, with a comfortable bed and very clean. Good breakfast with many choices. Easy walk to Disneyland, convention center, CheeseCake Factory, Bubba Gumps, etc. ART shuttle available in front of the hotel that takes you to many local areas for a fee.   The only downside of the motel is that the hallway noise is loud. Anyone talking in the hall in a normal voice can be heard inside the room very clearly. Much noisier than other similar motels

Nice hotel. Good location. 7-11 next door which is convenient and next door to that is the "A Store" which is a souvenir shop that has lots of Disney merch for cheap.   Huge lobby, gift shop, free buffet breakfast every morning and nice clean rooms. We stayed in an "accessible room" on the main floor. There is a small pool. If you forgot anything, there's a Walgreen's and a  CVS across the street. They have a restaurant on site but do not recommend it. Service is awful. I recommend going to the "Garden Walk" which is a short walk away which has "Bubba Gump" and "Cheesecake Factory".  Tip: Don't need to buy the Anaheim Resort Transit System tickets since you can walk to the main gate. Also, they have a person in the lobby trying to sell timeshares which they call themselves the

This was our first time staying at this hotel and it won't be the last. The staff is very helpful, the rooms were clean, spacious and updated. It's within a 15min walk to Disneyland and the hotel faces the back part of Car's Land. The bed was firm, but not so much so that it was uncomfortable. My only complaint is that the breakfast is so-so. But, it was hot, fresh and free, so really not much to complain about..... :) We have stayed in several hotels in the area and this by far was the best stay. Sorry hotel that got a good review last time, these guys did great!

Walking distance to Disneyland.  Free breakfast. Free parking. Free coffee and water in lobby 7-11 next door. Front desk friendly and very helpful. We stayed 8 days and housekeeping was excellent. The room was big with two queen beds that very were comfortable coming back from Disneyland.  We will be back.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, close to Disneyland.
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights for my boyfriend and my anniversary trip. Checked in at about 11:15am and got a room right away, which was very nice. The whole resort was very clean and housekeeping was good too. We were on the ground floor, right next to the street but couldn't hear any street noise. The resort is a 10-15 walk to the main gates of Disneyland with only 1 street to cross, great location. There is also a Walgreens and a CVS across the street to get the essentials like bottled water. The breakfast was decent to help start the mornings. I have 2 complaints the first was that the internet was awful and cut in and out a lot. The second was that we were in the second-thirdish room from the lobby and that side was noisy because there is tile in the the hallway and entry way, I

Great location for the convention center, you can walk to it very easy....it's across the street and about a block away. Disneyland is behind the hotel..The restaurant and bar area is very comfortable. The free breakfast is nice with eggs,meat, potatoes , fruit,cereal,toast, English muffin, waffles, plus morning juices, coffee and milk ....enjoy...the pool area is nice but full of kids ! The rooms are a little small, but clean, beds are on the softer side. Coffee and tea in room, refrigerator and microwave too. It's very quiet also !

Wow! Excellent service, close to Disney, coffee shop across the street, 7 Eleven next door. The room was big, two queens, comfy beds, coffee maker, fridge, 2 tvs, kitchen table,couch.  Breakfast in the am was lots of carbs but there was certainly enough food and lots of tables.  Underground parking was a nice touch too. We will return!

Summary Heading: Good location, but other areas need improvement
Summary: I got a really good deal for 5 days in this hotel from my union. We had never stayed at the DPHS but the reviews were mostly positive and the location couldn't be beat. With that said, here are some things I liked and didn't like about the hotel.  PROS: 1) Location. The hotel is right behind cars land and at most a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. It was also located on the same side of the street as Disneyland which was really nice because it eliminated one more crosswalk. 2) Free parking. We rented a car for two of the days we were there and the free parking was a very nice amenity. 3) Conveniently located car rental. National (and Avis?) were located right next door. That was really nice when picking up and returning the car. 4) Friendly staff. Everyone we dealt with was very

This was another shot in the dark booking.  We didn't realize we were traveling over President's Day Long weekend and a lot of properties had been booked up already. We ended up in a King Room with a Kitchenette.  We were so happy to have the Kitchenette because the complimentary warm breakfast was absolutely horrid! I wouldn't feed that to my dog. So a quick trip down the road to target for some groceries helped that.  The location of the hotel is good!  A CVS and Walgreens are right across the street.  711 is next door and a coffee shop is close too.  The walk to Disneyland is about 10 mins.  We found our room to be nice and clean.  We were on the busy side of the street which was a little noisy but tolerable.  The pool is in an inner courtyard surrounded by hotel rooms and

Our family stayed here for a trip to Disneyland the last week of January 2017, and stayed in room 421.  I found this place to be like a slightly upscale Best Western, similar decor and amenities ( depending on which BW ).   The staff were all friendly and helpful; we got towels immediately when we asked and maintenance was quick to arrive when I locked myself out of our safe. Front desk staff were always welcoming when we walked into the lobby and were happy to answer any questions that we may have had.   The breakfast that is included is not spectacular but it is warm and filling; eggs, toast, cereal, juice every day. They served potatoes on our last day there ( Friday ), maybe that is just a weekend thing, not sure since we were there Sunday night through Friday morning. The

We stayed at the Desert Palms this past weekend. First impressions were excellent customer service and updated decor. Upon arrival we were told our 2 bedroom suite was not ready yet but that was fine with us since we were about 3 hours before their checkin time. They offered us luggage tags and held our luggage until we came back that evening. That evening we were told our 2 bedroom had a leak so they gave us our own 1 bedroom suites right next to each other, which ended up working out perfect for everyone, at no additional cost! Loved and appreciated the fact that the issue was already resolved before we even checked in.’  The morning buffet was served daily from 6:30am-10am. It was pretty basic breakfast food but provided something that everyone liked. Some of the items served
Manager Response: Hello GoverauxTRVL,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We strive to offer the best service for all of our guests and are happy that we were able to do that for you. Thank you for your compliments to our bartender Russ! He is a great member of our team and we are lucky to have him.  We thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope that on your next visit we are able to earn a 5 star review with our services.

Summary Heading: Loved the location, the service, the room and the price.
Summary: This Hotel was right around the corner from the Disneyland Main Gate. Also close to CVS, coffee, and restaurants. Happy with my Suite and the price was right. The only black mark was that when I returned home, I got a call from my Credit Card Company that someone was charging over $300 on my card. The only place that I used that card was to pay for my room, which leads me to think that someone on the staff was stealing the info.
Manager Response: Hello Daffydaisy,  Thank you for your email. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I am very disappointed to hear that you believe someone at the hotel had access to your credit card information. All credit card information is kept secure and agents at the hotel only have access to the last 4 digits of the card. Since you booked online the card number went directly into our system and no agent would ever have had access to it. We take our guests privacy very seriously. I do see that your room charge was just over $300, possibly this is the charge you are referring? If you have any questions about our policies or about your final bill please call the hotel directly and ask to speak with a manager who will be more than happy to assist you.   We thank you for your excellent rating and hope that we can resolve this matter and have you as our guest again for a future stay.

Summary: I stayed there during a business trip (trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center).  The room is very simple, but it is clean, very close to the convention center, and the staff is great.   Also, they offer plenty of parking for hotel guests.  The free breakfast upstairs isn't that great, but there are so many other options around the location, it's fine.  For a comfortable, convenient place to stay, this is a good choice for the money.
Manager Response: Hello Lisa G,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other guests and we hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: Delightful stay!  We were a bit cautious upon first view of the building and extremely limited upper level parking.  The building is older and shows it's age on the outside and parking is not clearly marked (there IS lower level parking).  Once inside....VERY IMPRESSIVE!  The front desk team members were amazingly helpful and PATIENT (even after a barrage of questions about Disney tickets, etc.).  The family mini-ste (we were given an upgrade from a standard room) was immaculate and well appointed with very nice/new decor.  The breakfast was MUCH MORE than we expected and had attentive staff members cleaning/serving the area.  Would absolutely stay at this hotel again!  Definitely worth the $$!
Manager Response: Hello Wendy M,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us. We recently renovated the entire interior of our hotel and will follow with the exterior this year. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed our upgraded accommodations.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights. We found the family room was huge for 3 of us and it was very comfortable. The room was very quiet which surprised us for a very busy hotel. The service staff were great and kept the room very clean. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and keen to give advise.  The Hotel is very central and within walking distance to Disneyland.  The only let down was the American breakfasts as they were generally a bun fight and timing was critical if you wanted a table.... however we truly enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Darrin Helene W,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff and our clean rooms.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Where do I begin? I can’t say enough about the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. We’re a Disneyland loving family and have been going for 17+ years, so have stayed in many of the hotels surrounding Disney. We’ve stayed in hotels all the way up into the $300+/per night range in the area. The Desert Palms Hotel and Suites is definitely our favorite, hands down.   We stayed here once before in 2010 and had a great stay. We decided to check the hotel out again just this last week (February 4-7) because we got a fantastic deal. We checked in and were surprised to find out that we were upgraded to a suite with a king bed and bunkbed! They also gave us a welcome pack with water bottles, popcorn, and a lovely handwritten card welcoming us back to their hotel.  Such a sweet gesture! They
Manager Response: Hello SGAColorado9,  Thank you so much for your lovely review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We do appreciate you choosing our hotel once again and are glad that you enjoyed our repeat guests gifts, and all of the services our hotel has to offer. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope you have many more wonderful stays with us and look forward to seeing you again soon for the next one!

Summary: We stayed here our last trip to Disneyland.  Close enough to walk to parks, clean rooms, and free buffet breakfast daily. Staff very friendly and helpful.  We were upgraded to a larger room with bunk beds for our kids which was a nice surprise upon arrival.  Pool was clean and enjoyable.  Beds comfortable and quiet for sleeping at night.  Only thing lacking would be a shuttle to and from parks like the CandyCane Inn next door.
Manager Response: Dear SaltedTraver,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our rooms to be clean and enjoyed our free breakfast. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We do sell tickets for the Anaheim Resort Transit if you need transportation to and from Disneyland at a minimal fee, otherwise it is about a 10 minute walk to the main gate.  We thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and hope that you will visit again soon!

Summary: Spiffy hotel located right behind CarsLand, just a short walk through Downtown Disney and right next to a deluxe 7-11 where you can stock up for the day. Good breakfast, clean and modern. They don't charge extra for parking which always gets me madder than Scrooge McDuff.  We will stay here every time!
Manager Response: Hello Kevin A,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to offer the best for our guests and are glad we were able to do that for you. We are also glad that you did not get madder than Scrooge McDuff during your visit :). We are very happy to offer free parking to all of our guests unlike most hotels in the area.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and look forward to seeing you here again soon!

Summary: Our first trip to Disney we stayed at the Disneyland hotel and were surprised by the length of the walk to get to the park. The next trip we tried this hotel, which is about the same walk as the Disneyland hotel, but has free hot breakfast and free parking.  We thought we'd like the 'ambiance' of staying at the Disneyland hotel, but found we're really only there to shower and sleep, we spend morning till night at the park, and honestly, the ambiance isn't that much different.  The free breakfast is super quick, which means you can spend more time at the park and worry about one less meal. It's not the greatest selection of food, but it's super convenient and well rounded. The hotel is also literally next door to a 7-11, and a crosswalk away from both a CVS and Walgreens.  Plus
Manager Response: Dear Marwatk,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are very glad to hear that we are up to par with the Disneyland hotel in your opinion which I know charges much more per night. We always strive to offer the best value for our guests during their visits.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to welcoming you on your next visit!

Summary: the hotel is nice with all you need for staying . Very close to the convention center and Disneyland resort. The room are standards and not more , but commutable    There small fitness facility , bar, swimming pool and all regular amnesties   .
Manager Response: Dear Guli K,  Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We hope that you will visit again soon.

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, I liked that everything in the room was very modern! Around the corner from Disneyland, 10 minute walk, on same side of street. And every one likes FREE breakfast!
Manager Response: Dear Carlos O,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel to be very modern. We just finished a complete remodel at the end of last year and are glad you have found it favorable. We are also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free hotel buffet breakfast every morning.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other visitors and hope that you will visit us again soon!

Summary: Hotel front desk was very helpful and informative. The room has everything you need. Walking distance from Disneyland. Free parking, Free breakfast what's not to like for the price and the service provided. I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit and found our services and amenities to be perfect for your stay. We strive to offer the best for our guests and are glad we were able to do that for you.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Standard rooms with comfy beds and clean.  Tower or pavilion style hotel unlike most hotels near Disney which are motel style with only a few floors.  Pool is Indoors, so you won't be enjoying much sunshine if you like relaxing in the sun at the pool.  Tropical themed.  Nice, welcoming staff upon arrival.  Good 20 minute walk from here to Disneyland.  7-11 and abc mart are nearby.  Once witnessed police arresting someone at 7-11 with 6 cars.  Guy had a backpack, but looked like he was innocent, but still roughed up.  Good welcome to the oc for your family.  Also, about a 15 minute walk to garden walk where you can dine at the many restaurants there such as P.F. Changs and bubba Gump's.  Recently renovated in 2011.
Manager Response: Dear Mariedesjardins,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We actually just finished a full hotel renovation a few months ago at the end of 2016 and are glad that you enjoyed the upgraded rooms.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you here again soon.

Summary: We just stayed here at this hotel and it was great! I like the email they send our prior to your stay asking for any accommodations you may need. We arrived early and got to check in when we arrived, also were upgraded without asking. Very nice staff and clean hotel. The breakfast buffet was just ok but it was included in the stay so we took advantage of that. Nice walk to the park. The only other downside is that the traffic noise is loud. But overall, I would definitely stay here again! Keep up the good work!
Manager Response: Dear Maris444,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you liked the welcome email which is a new service we have started. Thank you for your compliments to our staff and hotel cleanliness. Our hardworking staff take great pride in keeping the hotel clean and beautiful for all guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel close to amusement parks
Summary: We loved that the walk to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney was less than 10min. The room was clean and fairly comfortable. Housekeeping staff tended to change the set temperature on the thermostat though. The comp buffet breakfast is a convenient idea, but not the greatest food. No fresh fruit, bad coffee and only coffee mate (yuck). Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. One of the front desk staff provided a map of the area and pointed out the close by Garden Walk mall that included a lot of good options for restaurants and entertainment.
Manager Response: Dear Chelsey1331,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We hope that you will visit again soon.

Summary: We arrived on Monday for a 5 night stay to visit Disneyland. We were welcomed with coffee, flavored water and a friendly staff. Our rooms were clean, bright and fresh with the cutest towel elephant ever! This entire hotel was just remodeled and the room shutters were my favorite! Breakfast was good and plentiful. Pool was heated and clean. We spent every single night in the pool and spa. Found parking easily each day. Enjoyed FREE parking, FREE breakfast and FREE wifi. My ONLY complaint was how thin the walls were but we just turned on our room fan and problem solved! Will stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Jashan5,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us! We try our best to offer the best rooms and amenities for our guests and are very glad that you were so pleased with all aspects of your visit.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon for your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here 3 nights and loved it!  The breakfasts were good with several options, and available for several hours so the kids could sleep in after a long night at Disneyland. Inexpensive gift shop and great staff!!  We called for extra blankets and the front desk had them up to our room within minutes.  The pool and hot tub were nice and I actually used the gym that was also great. Having a mini fridge and a microwave was so convenient, too!  My only complaint was the WiFi.  It's awful. You can connect with their password and the internet was incredibly slow, not only on our phones, but my laptop as well.  Besides that, our stay was amazing!  Will definitely go here again!!

This hotel was all around great! The rate was very reasonable. The hotel was decorated nicely, modern, spacious and very clean. Free parking, which is a huge perk as most hotels in the area charge a daily fee. This location is within walking distance to Disney. Several restaurants nearby. A complimentary full breakfast is offered. The food was very good and the servers were accommodating. Staying at this hotel is a great value because you will avoid hotel parking fees and Disney parking fee (if willing to walk), and enjoy a free breakfast. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

We absolutely loves this hotel.  Free parking, free breakfast, very clean, and the staff was friendly.  We had the bunk bed room and it was updated and very spacious.  The pool area is very pretty and the hot tub was nice after our RunDisney runs.  Everything is within walking distance.  Thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

I really liked this hotel. Free breakfast which included make your own waffles, muffins, fruit, cereal, bread. Sausages, donuts,  and Biscuits with gravy every other day. Free parking. Outdoor heated pool. Great service. Allowed us to have a late checkout due to the Star Wars 1/2 marathon without extra charge. Has a microwave oven and small  refrigerator which was so convenient. The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 because it is more than a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.

We have travelled to Disneyland five times and stayed at different hotels. The location is good, the front desk staff were also mostly helpful and polite. My travel plans suddenly changed and I had asked for my non-refundable one night stay to be waived.  The lady handling the reservations was rigid, cold and, in my opinion, not forthright.  Having gone through Booking.com (the process) to ask for this exemption their agent sadly informed me that she would not accommodate my reasonable request. The Booking.com agent was also surprised, as he told me this is common and the "vast majority of hotels are happy to accommodate such a request but that "it depends on the manager". Which puts the focus back onto a most unfriendly reservation manager.  Having gone down to the front desk
Manager Response: Dear Wallhead44,  We are sorry to hear that you had a change of plans. As you have acknowledged that you had booked a non-refundable rate and understood upon booking that it would be non-refundable, your room rate was understandably not refunded to you. We hope that you had a pleasant stay during your time here and are sorry to hear that you will not be returning. We advise that you choose refundable rates on future travel if you are going to ask for a refund.  Sincerely, Desert Palms Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Average hotel with rude staff = a poor experience
Summary: The hotel itself was adequate. Nothing great, nothing bad. However, a rather unpleasant run in with rude front desk staff made the experience rather less pleasant.   We stayed here during the Disneyland half marathon. We knew about the race, but we were unaware that the race meant we would be trapped inside the hotel until checkout at 11:00 am. We approached the front desk to let them know that communicating to their guests this information would have been helpful, we were basically told that Anaheim city posted a news brief about it in their website.   Now, perhaps this was just poor planning on my part, but I didn't think to check the city website to see if I could leave the hotel when I wanted to leave prior to booking my stay with Desert Palms. Thank goodness our flight was

We stayed for 2 nights at Desert Palms and loved our stay. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Room was spacious and clean. Buffet breakfast was on the 5th floor and the best part is the walking distance to Disneyland. The hotel offers free wifi and free onsite parking. They have kids activities on some days and a small pool/Jacuzzi area where one can wind down after walking for hours at Disney.

Summary Heading: Clean, complete and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Room was spacious and clean. Buffet breakfast was on the 5th floor kids liked the make your own waffles. Best part is the walking distance to Disneyland.

We stayed here only one night and then to Disneyland the next day & it was an AMAZING VALUE! The beds were comfortable, linen clean, counters & bathroom were spotless and an undisturbed quiet night.  The free breakfast buffet was a great way to start our busy day.  I can't say enough kind words on the staff.  I have recommended this hotel to my family and friends.  Love Love Love this gem of a hotel!

I was pleasantly surprised how much I liked this hotel!  It has been a very long time since visiting Disneyland, and remembered that the hotels surrounding the park ( yes, there was only one back in the day) were mediocre at best.  Upon arrival, the hotel felt like a resort property, with a lovely lobby, workout room,pool, on site restaurant & bar, and gift shop.  The rooms were clean and updated with a nice decor. Loved that it had a microwave and a nice sized mini refrigerator.  Didn't care for the toiletry products.  The big plus was that this was one of the few hotels that didn't charge extra for parking, and included breakfast.  The only negative is the limited parking on property.   Easy walk to Disney...no need for a shuttle.

A nice hotel. We had a nice and cozy room. We are a party of 6 and we had a 2 bedroom suite. Spacious and clean. The hotel is near in A walking distance to disney.  Nice staff in the lobby they let us check in 2 hours before.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for our annual winter trip to Disneyland. This was our first experience with this hotel and we were quite pleased. The room was clean and very modern. Shortly after we checked in, we had a maintenance person come in and fix a burnt out bulb. We didn't even have a chance to tell the desk, they obviously knew and just came to correct the problem. Due to our check-in day being a Monday, they allowed us to park early and go enjoy the park, and then come back to complete check-in. Very nice perk. The pool area was clean and my husband enjoyed a swim. The breakfast was good, lots of choices. Not top of the line quality, but it's free with your room and there are enough choices everyone in my group left satisfied. The walk door to door to Disney is about

I stayed here 9 nights with my family. The hotel was clean and quiet. Only time we heard anyone was if they were in the hallway by our door being loud. The pool was great for the kids to blow of steam or to soak in after a long day at the park. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was tasty and had a good selection for everyone. The staff were amazing, extremely friendly and courteous. They were very attentive to our needs. The free coffee and water in the lobby was a bonus. It's nice after a long day at Disneyland to come back to the hotel and have a warm drink.  The hotel is conveniently located beside a 7/11 for late night snacks and right across the street from 2 pharmacies for any incidentals you may have forgotten. There is also a small gift shop in

Summary Heading: Fun times at the Desert Palms!! Great location for Disneyland!
Summary: The Desert Palms was a good place for our family vacation to Disneyland.  We really liked the big rooms, the free breakfast buffet and the friendly staff.  Our only complaint was the slow service when we complaint about a beeping sound coming from the AC.  The sound started at 5:00 am and it was not fixed until 8:30 am.   This caused us to be overtired for our day at the parks.   I feel it would have been better to offer to switch rooms immediately or offer a credit for the night.  Even a gift card to use at a nearby arcade or coffee shop would have made a difference.   Showing care for the customer goes a long way. :-)  The employees were very nice and Richard at the front desk was superb!

Summary Heading: Check In experience with Staff was HORRIBLE!!!
Summary: Checked in with Jennifer "Supervisor" was given room keys. Once in room got a RUDE call from her saying my card was declined and I needed to come to front desk to use a different card. I assumed it was a fraud alert placed on my card so I immediately called my bank while on the line with the bank she tried to re run the same card and it went thru as a charge. I hung up with bank and she then informed me that she was trying to place a hold for $20 for incidentals and the card was being declined again. I gave her another credit card and it was declined. I insisted there was money on both cards and she said its not her system its my cards in a very unprofessional manner. Suggesting that I had no funds on either of the cards and my only other option would be is to leave $100 cash

We  booked  3 rooms for our family and had a fabulous time.  The rooms were large and well furnished.  It was very quiet as well.   We were upgraded to a suite with a kitchen which was a great gathering spot for the 8 of us.  Would definitely come back!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a quick trip to DIsneyland.
Summary: Really enjoyed this hotels rooms, free buffett breakfast and no charge for parking.  We were able to stay till 3pm and didnt' have to move the car.  Thanks for a great stay.  The Breakfast buffett had a great selection, breakfast burrittos, cinammon waffles, and all the regular breakfast foods and more.  What a bonus!  Nice breakfast room too.

Stayed here with the family to visit Disneyland, didn't enjoy Disneyland, but loved the hotel, they upgraded us to a suite, as our room wasn't ready , free breakfast, great wi fi. You can see the fireworks from the roof.   Next to a convenience store and only a few hundred metres from Disneyland.   Great place to stay

The staff at Desert Palm is one of the most helpful and courteous that I have ever met anywhere in USA. The recent remodel makes everything so much more comfortable and relaxing. The free coffee in the lobby is awesome too. Cannot beat the location. But it's the people that work there that make all the difference.

On our arrival we got upgraded to a suite & it was awesome!  The breakfast is typical hot breakfast that we have had in any hotel that serves a hot breakfast, but way better than a continental breakfast.  This hotel has the BEST coffee, if you like a bold coffee that is not bitter.  The beds were comfortable, the room was clean & the personnel was some of the best that we have encountered anywhere.  They were friendly & very helpful.  The ground parking was a bit crowded ~ thankfully we didn't have to move our vehicle once it was parked, everything was within walking distance (Disneyland was a 10 minute walk) or you can buy a pass for the bus for $10 for all day & get picked up practically right in front of the hotel.

The hotel is conveniently located close to Disneyland and the rooms were  decent size and comfortable. Breakfast was decent and efficient. Our only negative was that wE could hear footsteps at times from the floor above and the water pipes in the morning in the room we stayed in. However, we'd be happy to return  and stay here the next time we visit Disneyland.

Stayed here five nights reasonably priced about two blocks from Disneyland I suggest walking there it's faster if you get the art bus pass bus back it's the first stop. Rooms were nice and clean didn't go in pool but it looked nice seen a few people swimming. Breakfast wasn't amazing but it was good to get a bite before we headed off for the day. All in all I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: So convenient on top of being a great hotel.
Summary: We chose to stay at Desert Palms because of how close it was to the Disneyland Resort. This was our first visit so we didn't know what to expect, but we were more than pleasantly surprised. There was some light construction being done the week of 12/7/16, but it wasn't major and did not impede on our stay. The rooms looked like they had been remodeled. They were very modern and the bathroom had upgraded features. We stayed in a suite and had plenty of room for our 6 member family. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a highlight. I like to judge based on continental breakfasts, but this was a full breakfast menu that included eggs, waffles and bacon. Our walk to the front gates at Disneyland clocked in at 10 minutes so it was close enough after walking all day at the park.

We just got back from Disneyland and this time we chose to try staying off property to save some money since it's Christmas time. Having two elementary school aged kids (age 7 and 10), I really wanted to cross the least amount of streets possible so I researched the hotels that were on the same side as the Disney pedestrian entrance. I was going to book Candy Cane Inn but they don't have a restaurant on-site and after a long day, I knew that was going to be important possibly. So Desert Palms was literally the very next hotel entrance. We booked a suite with a drop down living room area. I am not a huge fan of the Disneyland corridor hotels that are more like motels with entrances that open up to the outside so for the area, the Desert Palms was good. It seems to be one of the

This is a great hotel.  The rooms were very clean and well arranged; the bathroom is separate from the sink area, therefore someone can shower while another is getting ready.  The staff is top-notch (very polite and professional). The restaurant food is not only good, but affordable. We ate there twice and THEN went into Disneyland.  It's within walking distance of not only Disneyland but Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. giving one better/more food options than Disney.     Great hotel, we will be back!

Summary Heading: Very clean rooms and hotel...loved the full breakfast too!
Summary: Our room and the hotel in general was very clean.  We had a king bed and it was comfortable with nice linens.  Room had fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.  The complimentary full/warm breakfast was great to start the day before heading off to Disneyland.  Eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy were all good.  Loved the cinnamon waffles!!  They had apples and oranges, but wish they had a little bit more fruit (maybe bananas?)  Definitely got your fill though.  All staff was very friendly.  Would stay here again for the price, value, and such a short walk to Disneyland.

Had a fabulous stay here. Very clean, beds were comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was nice. Room had fridge, micro and coffee maker. Very close walking to park, CVS across street.We will stay here again.

Outstanding service.  Extremely clean room.  Décor and comfort of room way beyond what I was expecting.  I couldn't help but notice that some of the rooms have fun custom built bunk beds.  If I was a kid, this is where I would want to be.  Bountiful breakfast that can  be enjoyed on outside patio.  I will definitely choose this hotel again the next time I am in Anaheim!

We decided to take a fun day trip down to Anaheim and wanted to stay in a hotel for the night. We booked this place at a great rate on the road. We were already in LA that morning, so it was a short drive and we got there too early for check in. The kind woman at the desk was nice enough to heat up our pasta that we had from a restaurant the night before while we fueled our batteries before going to the park. We didn't manage to check in until about six that night, and as we were staying only one night, we were upgraded to a lovely deluxe studio suite! It was such a nice surprise. The breakfast the next day had a great selection too. We'll definitely stay here again!

Love staying here the people are always realy nice and helpful rooms have been upgraded,beds are great you dont wake up with your back hurting:),breakfast is always great,if you are looking for a clean comfortable place to stay with family I would realy recommend this place.....:), 5 min walk into disneyland! And the manager who's name is Albina was amazing at helping us with our rooms .loved her she made us feel at home :) thank you so much:)

great hotel, great location, great service...the breakfast was better then I had image, staff was very friendly and helpful,, parking is a bit hard to find. the small snack shop was great to get a few items at night before going to bed.

Stayed here for three nights on a family of four holiday. Room was a Junior Suite and was spacious and clean. We had two large double beds, couch, table & chairs, two TV's, microwave & fridge. Staff at reception were friendly and after arriving from Australia at 9am we were able to check straight into a room. Easy walking distance to Disneyland. A Walgreens & CVS Pharmacy across the street. Plenty of meal options in the area including a Cheesecake Factory about 5mins walk away. Breakfast was provided which we didn't have. Overall & very nice place to stay to start our 6 week adventure.

Stayed here in November 2016 and it worked for our situation. Wanted to spend the week sight seeing and mainly in Disneyland, so we were coming home late and leaving early, so simply needed a place to sleep. 90% of the time this was fine, however the walls were a bit thin, on the first night the room next to us had a baby that cried, and we could hear the fireworks from Disneyland, and on another night we could hear the other neighbours TV, but the other 6 nights it was completely fine. The rooms are very modern, and the beds are very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern. However there was no room to store clothes for 4 adults in the room, but living out of suitcases wasn't that bad because we were never in the room. I would not recommend getting the breakfast if
Manager Response: Dear SammyC22,  Thank you for your review. We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff members Richard and Omar. They are great members of our team and we appreciate your kind remarks.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope you are able to visit again soon.

Summary: Great hotel!  Close to Disneyland.  Stores really close by.  Beds are very comfortable.  Nice bunk beds for the kids.  Breakfast is good.  Laundry facilities are easily accessible.  Front desk staff are nice.
Manager Response: Dear Whit1094,  Thank you for your great review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our rooms and service.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.   We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We loved our week at Disneyland! We will definitely stay here again. The beds were comfortable. The front desk staff always made us feel welcome. The cleaning staff was very courteous and never bothered us and always waited till we left and our room was magically clean when we returned. The breakfast area was well attended to and always stocked. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Bethyz2016,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. We are so glad to hear that you found our staff to be friendly and welcoming and were satisfied with the cleanliness of your room. We pride ourselves on offering a comfortable stay experience for all guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you here again soon!

Summary: We stayed here because it was so close to disneyland easy walk to the back entrance 5-10mins theres plenty of resturants, gift stores close by and a 711 right next door. The hotel staff were great and let us check in early which was amazing after a 17 hour flight  the room was also great
Manager Response: Dear Chelsea B,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are glad that were able to accommodate all of your needs during your visit and thank you for your compliments to our staff.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers.   We hope to have you stay with us again soon!

Summary: Overall the hotel was good, but we had a couple issues. We booked the room with the bunk beds because there were 6 of us and that room says it can fit 6. However when we arrived we found out that the couch that folds out to fit two had been removed from all the bunk bed rooms and in order to fit 6 we would have to put 4 on the bunk beds. I don't know about you, but my kids don't like sharing beds. In stead we put two air mattresses on the floor. This used up a ton of floor space and made it difficult to get around in the room. Fortunately we spent most of our time outside of the hotel. In hind sight I would recommend you only put 4 people in the bunk bed rooms, and if you have more, you should book the two queens with the sitting area because that would fit 6 a lot more
Manager Response: Dear Phppro,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not have an excellent stay with us. We value all guest feedback as it helps us to improve our high standards of quality and service. Thank you for your compliments to our staff.   We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay and great location to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during our recent visit to Disneyland. There were 3 adults and 3 kids. We booked the kid suite that has bunk beds and a king bed. I loved the separation of spaces so we could put the kids to bed and have some time to ourselves and also be able to bring the toddler back for a nap during the day. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bunk beds where double bed size so they fit 2 kids on top and my sister and the toddler on the bottom without any problems! The hotel is within walking distance from Disneyland so we didn't have to fight traffic and keep paying parking fees at different places. Breakfast was free and delicious and parking was free during our stay! Two big sellers for me! The staff was helpful and friendly! I have already
Manager Response: Dear AJ A,  Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for your compliments to the cleanliness and comfort of our hotel. I am also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and recommend to friends.   We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites in May 2016. Our room was newly remodeled with a microwave and a fridge. Very clean hotel. Hot breakfast in the morning was great. Had good variety and saved us the hassle of having to go out and find breakfast before going to Disneyland for the day. The hotel is located on the corner of the Disney property and is only a 10-15 minute walk into Disneyland. The swimming pool is small and in a shaded inner courtyard so it was chilly but then again we were there in May so maybe summer wouldn't be so chilly. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Mitch913,  Thank you for your great review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are glad that you found our hotel to be clean and you were comfortable during your stay here.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.   We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Arrived early and staff was very accommodating. Conveniently located. Walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure. Family type restaurants along the way which was way cheaper than eating in the parks. Free breakfast every morning saved our family on food costs. This was our 2nd stay here. Will keep coming back.

Love this hotel. Very close to DL. Close to shopping, restaurants. Room very comfortable. We got a 2 queen suite with and sofa bed. Great for 4-6 people. They have free parking and a free breakfast buffet. Will stay here again.

The hotel is a short walking distance from the Disney Parks. There is a large breakfast buffet. The pool area is pleasant and a nice break after the crowds at the Parks. They answered all my questions about airports, beaches, tickets, etc. Knowing in advance made for a better experience. We had a suite with separate room with bunk beds and sleeper sofa. Great for the 3 boys. There is a photo op in the lobby for pictures to email yourself and others.

About a 700m walk from Disneyland's main entrance (on the same side of the road) means the Desert Palms is very convenient.  Our room was modern and well appointed with two queen beds, kitchenette, large bathroom with a shower over the bath, large flatscreen TV, fresh decor and bedding.  We arrived too early for check in but could leave our bags and go have a late lunch while we waited.  The fifth floor has a lovely large breakfast room with plenty of tables and the option of sitting outside as well.  There is a generous selection of food on offer (multiple types of bread with commercial toaster, 3 choices of hot food in a warmer, cereals, juices, fruit, tea/coffee, and two flavours of waffles you cook yourself in a waffle iron, etc).  The ladies on duty keep everything

Fantastic hotel, everything included was perfect from the breakfast to the free parking. Rooms were in great shape, newly renovated and were perfect for our family.  Location was super close to Disneyland about 10-12 minute walk with 4 small children and was located close to restaurants for lunch / dinner.  The Oasis bar and grill had great food with great pricing.  Staff were very friendly and nice across our two week stay.

Grandma took big kids and grandkids to Disneyland and Aunti came too.  We found this hotel to be a great choice for all ages.  Check in was busy but after that we had only good times.  A hearty breakfast each morning (try to remember your tips as the staff sure deserve it)  We filled our bottles with lovely fruit flavored water from the water machines in the lobby and walked easily to the main gates of the Theme Parks with a 9 and 6 year old who are not used to walking very far.  Good shoes and socks are a must as we walked 6, 8 and 10 miles during a day for the 3 days we went on a hopper pass.  This included walking back to the hotel in the afternoon for pool time and a break away from the crowds and stimulation of the Disney experience.  Our advice is to get going early and

Close to shops, restaurants and disneyland...perfect! Comfortable rooms but careful not to stay close to the laundry as if someone uses it late it is noisy. Make your own waffles at the complimentary breakfast and take a swim in the pool or relax in the hut tub.

Staff, room, cleanliness, breakfast, location...all was perf!  So much fun to walk to the parks from the hotel, leaving the car behind.  If this hotel is not rated #1 it should be.  I will return and my hope is that will be very soon.

Summary Heading: Awesome staff, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: I first stayed at this hotel in March of 2016. I had one of the suites. I was very happy with the staff and amenities at that time. Fast forward to October 2016, when I went back for my 55th birthday. There was a lovely welcoming note, bottles of water and free drink coupons to welcome me back. What a great touch! I wish the price of the hotel wasn't quite so high, as I'd return much more often.

Stayed one night. Everything as nice and clean. Staff was very nice. Morning breakfast had nice selection and was well stocked. The only downfall was the elevator situation. Not all go to every floor. And there is no air in them so they are super hot to ride in. Other than that the stay was amazing

Summary Heading: Great Place and Close to Disney parks,
Summary: Desert Palms was a great place to stay for our 5 night Family vacation , with 4 adults we had a 4 queen bed suite with 2 Bathrooms , Staff was very helpful and Friendly. we arrived before check in so we stored our luggage in the hotel., and wandered around until we could check in,   It is only about a 10 minute walk to the Parks and lots of places to eat close , with a CVS pharmacy across the street for what ever you need,  We would stay here again next time we visit Disneyland,  thanks to Richard at the front desk ,

The only major problem I had with this hotel was the whole place ( including a few of the rooms) smelled of paint. I understand renovation was in progress but that was not ok. On the plus side we did get a full refund. If this hotel wasn't being renovated, this place definelty would of been a nice place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great location for both the Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: I was down for a conference and also planned on spending a couple of days at Disneyland.  I found the location perfect for both of those activities.  The hotel was clean and modern and the staff were friendly and responsive.  When my family plans our next Disneyland vacation we will certainly stay here.

Our 3 nights at the Desert Palms Hotel were great. The hotel is nice and modern. The rooms were very comfortable. I think the bed was the best we have had yet in our trips to Disneyland. The complimentary breakfast is ok, not spectacular, but it's free so what do you expect. The walk to the park is quick and my 7 year olds managed it just fine even after a long day in the park. Overall I would definitely stay here again the next time we come back.

Summary Heading: Great for family trip to Disney
Summary: Overall a great experience and we would very likely stay there again. We had the King suite with the extra room for the kids which was the best part, it was a perfect set-up for our family. The kids had their own space and they thought it was really cool. The location was excellent with only a 10 minute walk to the park. Very nice not having to deal with parking or shuttles. Breakfast was good as well. My only complaints were that the wifi was painfully slow, basically unusable in our room, and the pool was too cold. I had to use the business center computers downstairs to do anything online and our kids, who normally love the pool, only spent about 15 minutes in there because they said it was too cold. Others there were saying the same thing. But for a close hotel to Disney at

Summary Heading: Great hotel very close to Disneyland
Summary: I was very impressed at the size if the rooms and how clean they were. One of our rooms was not ready at check in so they gave us an upgrade, which was great! The staff were all very friendly. It was an easy walk to Disneyland. We did not get to swim, not enough time but the pool looked nice.  The breakfast was ok, pretty standard for hotel breakfasts. They let us keep the cars at the hotel on check out day which was a big deal for us as we were going back to Disneyland for the day.

Within a 10 minute walk to the park. Hotel staff was very helpful whenever we had a question. Clean room, good selection on the free breakfast. AC worked fine. Front desk helpful. Free wifi, free parking and free breakfast make the price of the room affordable.

Extremely good staff, good breakfast and nice rooms. The location is great for the Anaheim convention center, Disneyland and Disney's great adventure. The breakfast is on the top floor and offers interior and exterior dining.

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel great staff but still needs improvement!
Summary: this hotel is really nice and clean and the service is absolutely wonderful. They have re decorated all the rooms and it looks very pretty. However there is one thing I'm not happy about and I have been at this hotel several times. The only issue I have with this hotel I have two issues...The hot tub and the breakfast buffet. They have a very small hot tub in the swimming pool area. The reason why I stay at this hotel is because I take my family to Disneyland. When you go to Disneyland you all know that you probably walk a average of 11+ miles per day. The first thing you want to do is relax. The tub is too small and visitors do not want to get up and give anyone a chance to sit down.  They need to have more variety in the breakfast buffet not have the same serial over and over

Summary Heading: Great hotel great location. Friendly staff.
Summary: We booked this hotel a year in advance through getaway today. Upon check in they could not find our reservation. The clerk at the front desk was named Omar who was able to resolve the problem and find a solution. He turned a nerve racking situation into a pleasant experience. The hotel room was spacious and clean. The hotel staff was friendly and provided us everything we needed. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

This was a nice hotel and a good base for visiting Disney and California Adventure. We just got back after staying 4 nights here. The room we had was comfortable, clean and quiet. There is free parking both above and below ground, free wi-fi and free breakfast buffet. The buffet is some type of egg dish each day, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, seasoned potatoes, self-made waffles, donuts, cereal, breads, fruit, yogurt, etc. It was not anything fancy but good and plenty of it. The hotel is within walking distance of the entrance to both parks - about 10 minutes, as well as many restaurants and fast-food places. We parked the car the day we arrived and never used it again until the day we left. There is also a small heated outside pool and a jacuzzi. The staff is very

Summary Heading: Great place, but no after service for disputes
Summary: Stayed in this property, prepaid by travel agent.  Hotel took credit card authorisation on arrival, just for any incidentals, said a holding.  Guess what the full amount of the stay has been debited to the card, plus a further night taken twice.  We no longer have access to our funds whilst on holidays.  So disappointed.  More disappointed that the hotel is unable to fix or reply to our emails.  Loved our stay there and the staff were great, however this has ruined the remainder of our trip.  Advise is to give a card that you do not wish to use.

This was our third stay at the Desert Palms in the last 3 years, and besides the odd elevator situation, we are extremely happy with our choice. I believe we've stayed on the second floor during every visit and despite the elevator concerns, we continue to enjoy staying on that particular floor (go figure!).  There were two concerns, not necessarily issues that we have:  The first is minimal, but after a long 7 hour drive we were beat! And we were looking forward to a nice warm shower and a hot cup of tea before bed. Alas, there were no tea bags in our room; however, when I went down to the front desk to request some, the front desk staff immediately turned around and pulled out a handful from a cabinet behind them. I was very happy with the quick response.  More importantly of

Summary Heading: Great location, comfortable rooms, excellent staff
Summary: One of the best hotels close to Disneyland! Room was outstanding, beds were extremely comfortable and definitely a great place to crash after a long time in the parks. The hotel staff was amazing from the second we walked through the door until the moment we left. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Still the best place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: This is the best place for your money if you want to visit Disneyland and California Adventure.  Location - It is a very short walk to the entrance of both parks.  I'd say it's just as close as Paradise Pier.  The only negative is that on the corner bus stop, there's always several homeless people.  Not the hotel's fault, but something to be aware of.  But it is a great location.  Room and Amenities - We have a family of five and the Yuha kids suite is perfect.  It has a king bed in one room and two bunks and a pull out sofa in the other.  Both rooms have their own TV.  Lots of space.  You also can't beat the free breakfast.  3 kinds of waffles, eggs, sausage, potatoes, cereal, donuts, toast, juice, you name it.  Way better than spending a fortune in the park.  Price - It's the

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We usually stay at the Fairfield Inn when we go to Disneyland but need more space for our family of five.  A Disney travel rep recommended the Desert Palms for our family.  We stayed in the kids suite with the bunk beds and hide a bed. The hide a bed seemed pretty uncomfortable, but one of our kids slept on it.  What do you expect, it's a hide a bed?    With the complimentary breakfast and and free parking,  we will never stay anywhere else. The kids enjoyed making their own waffles every morning.   Other than the waffles, the breakfast was fair but their were always eggs, breads, cereals, yogurt, fruit, etc available.... a little something for everyone. The rooms have been renovated recently and our room was spotless upon our arrival. It's a I have already made reservations at

We loved our stay at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites! Everyone working there is so friendly (shout out to Omar who was especially sweet and helpful!) The place is beautiful, warm and welcoming! They were remodeling while we were there, and the design is spectacular.   Our rooms were so nice and clean and comfortable.  They have a little cafe grill in the hotel which is perfect after an 8 hour drive in.  Our food and drinks were perfect. The breakfast was good - cold and hot cereal, eggs, bisquits and gravy, waffles etc etc.  It gets crowded so be ready for that, but nothing too bad.  I wish the pool was in a different spot, but they did well with what they had to work with.   The walk to Disney is easy and there are a bunch of restaurants to choose from around the hotel and of

The staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating. The hotel was clean even with some construction going on. Our room was spacious and the beds quite comfortable. The breakfast had a lot of choices though perhaps some more fresh fruit would've been great. Aside from that, there is more than enough choices for even the pickiest eaters. Loved that parking and wifi as well as breakfast was included in rate. Also enjoyed the walkable distance to the Disney parks - it was safe and well lit. I would absolutely stay again.

It was what we expected. Nothing more than a couple of days stop over. Couldn't and wouldn't spend a week here. Pool is ok, rooms are clean, staff are good. Should have paid more money to be more central in the city and in a better hotel that is suitable for kids. Not a lot for kids to do at this hotel.

This hotel is great.  The room we had was a one bedroom suite with full size bunk beds for the kids.  Enough room for 2 adults and 2 kids.  The kids had their own room/space.  The breakfast was decent.  Only a short 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  The hotel was in walking distance to all restaurants.  The staff was great.  No issues with this hotel.

Good size room with fridge,microwave and Tea/coffee maker. Rooms at the back are quieter. 2nd floor upwards are better. Very clean room and bathroom newly refurbished.  Front desk staff were really good and helpful, thanks to Richard especially. Disney tickets can be bought at the front desk for a very small saving and helps beat the queues in the park. Only a 10-15 minute walk to Disney, excellent!  Only shortfall is the breakfast, not great, fresh fruit would have been nice, also why plastic cutlery one day and metal the next! Very strange, keep it all metal.

Summary Heading: Great location near Disneyland very clean and friendly
Summary: Very happy with our stay at Desert Palms hotel & Suites.  Easy walk to Disneyland. Our family of 5 spent 7 nights at the hotel and our room was cleaned daily. If we ever have the chance to come back to Anaheim we will stay at Desert Palms hotel & Suites again. The free breakfast made it easy to start the day and head off on our adventures. We had a kitchen suite and the full size fridge gave us plenty of room for fresh fruit and snacks we purchase down the road at Food4Less.  The friendly staff at the Food4Less called a taxi for us to return to our hotel. On our last day we checked out and the lovely staff at front counter stored our luggage until we returned in the afternoon for our airport transfer.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, quiet and perfectly convenient for Disneyland travelers!
Summary: Some girlfriends and I travel frequently together, so we booked the 8 of us 2 rooms at the hotel for a 3 day Disneyland trip. Upon arrival, they kept our bags until our rooms were done (we checked in early, our rooms were still occupied) and we headed over to the parks! Later that afternoon, they smoothly got us in our rooms and that's when I saw how beautiful they were!  Clean white linens, cool and calm room decor, a nice big entry way that had full mirrored doors on one side going to a giant closet.   The breakfast had a phenomenal view of the parks, if you're curious to see what it looks like behind the scenes, not to mention the food. It's a pretty darn good breakfast for the prices you pay on the site for the rooms.   The parks are within walking distance for SURE, and
Manager Response: Dear 506shaunae,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so happy to hear that you had a great stay with us. I am glad you found our rooms to be beautiful and clean and am glad to hear you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers.   We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We had a very nice stay. We were a family of 8, and we got the family room with 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms for 4 nights. The beds were very comfy, and the room was clean. The whole hotel was nice clean. No complaints at all. Breakfast was good. It was about a 10 minute (easy) walk to Disneyland, so wasn't far at all. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Sharryj13,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for your compliments to the cleanliness and comfort of our hotel. I am also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast.  We appreciate you taking the time to share you experience here with other travelers and hope you will visit again soon!

Summary: Less than 10 minutes walk to the Disneyland park gates. This well priced suite style hotel suited our family of four for 8 nights. We had the kids suite - the rooms were a little smaller and darker than we liked but they were clean and well serviced. The pool was small and a little cold unless the sun was shining. The free cooked buffet breakfast was very average quality. The staff were very friendly but may have been new as did not seem to know much about the area. Located near 711, CVS and Coffee Bean shops.
Manager Response: Dear Kristina790,  Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you again on your next visit.

Summary: We Loved Our Stay At Desert Palms. We Were Able To Check In Early And They Even Gave Us An Upgrade! Talk About Awesome Service. The Rooms Were Impeccably Clean And Very Modernized And Comfortable. We Will Come Here Again The Next Time We Go To Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Alysse B,  Thank you for your awesome review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our rooms and service.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.   We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Very reasonably priced, the suites are the star of this place!
Summary: I have to give this place five stars simply for the comfort of our room. We had a two room suite with two queen beds in one room and a bunk bed and sofa in the other. Each room had its own TV and plenty of storage space for clothing. everything was clean and the housekeeping service was very good. The hotel is in an excellent location in Anaheim with a 7/11 next door, a CVS across the street and numerous restaurants within walking distance. We did not go to Disneyland, but lots of people from our hotel did and it seemed to be within walking distance. Being on the main road, it was easy to get out to explore the wider area by car and we went to Newport and Huntington Beaches, each about 30 minutes drive if there is not traffic. W also travelled to Santa Monica in an hour early on
Manager Response: Dear BarbrainLondon,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. We are so glad to hear that you found our hotel to be Clean, spacious, and quiet for your visit. We pride ourselves on offering a comfortable stay experience for all guests.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you here again soon!

Summary: This hotel was well worth the money, we stayed here for 3 nights, the photo with Disney at the entrance was a great idea, you can share on Facebook or email etc, the pool and spa were inviting and the complementary breakfast a bonus. I highly recommend this hotel, we had 3 adults and 2 kids ages 7 and 9 and we thoroughly enjoyed this place, would definitely go back.
Manager Response: Dear Darren W,  Thank you for your great review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are glad that you enjoyed the photo station and our free hot buffet breakfast. We strive to offer the best for all of our guests and are glad we were able to do that for you.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and we hope to see you again soon for your next visit!

Summary Heading: excellent value for attending a convention in anaheim
Summary: almost 1/2 the price compared to staying at the hotels literally next to the convention center and it was a 10 minute walk to the convention center. also great if you're attending disneyland because it is literally down the street so it provides the best of both worlds when some family need to go to the convention center and others need quality time with mouse and duck
Manager Response: Dear Robert G,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are indeed ideally located for both the Convention Center and Disneyland Travelers so we offer a great middle ground for Anaheim travel.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers.   We hope to see you here again soon!

Summary: We took our daughter to Disneyland for her 10th birthday. We wanted a location within walking distance to the park. Found this hotel based upon the reviews. Upon checking in to the hotel, I informed the front desk that we were here celebrating my daughter's birthday. After arriving in our room, we received a birthday gift bag for my daughter - she was thrilled.   The hotel is clean with modern rooms and the staff was very friendly and helpful – politely answering any questions we had about the area. Breakfast was included with our room rate and served daily and included eggs, waffles, fruit, etc. The hotel is about a 12 minute walk to Disney or you can catch one of the many ART buses for a daily fee of $5/Adult and $2/Child. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and you
Manager Response: Dear Scott L,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.
