I am glad your daughter had a great visit for her birthday and that she liked her birthday gift bag.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope you are able to visit us again soon!

Summary: Hotel staff were great and upgraded us to a better room Breakfast choice was good as well Great location to both Disney parks was easy to walk there Parking was also good  Pool was ok including the jacuzzi  Price was great considering how close to doing Disney
Manager Response: Dear Danwant,  Thank you for your great review. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and you liked your upgraded accommodations. We strive to offer the best for our guests and we are so glad we were able to do that for you.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you here again soon for your next visit.  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary: The room was adecuate for our family of 4. The only thing I would say I didn't like were the pillows (very hard pillows).  You can have free hot breakfast, it doesn't have variaty but its enough (you don't have to spend more outside). The hot breakfast is better if you go before 8 or after 9, else is too crowded.  Also the Sands Restaurants it's ONLY open from 4 til 10 pm.... so if you like to take dinner at 10, be prepared to go somewhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Dora G,  Thank your review. We are so gald to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. We strive to offer the best for our guests and are glad that we were able to do that you.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope to see you here again soon for your next visit.  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary: I stayed here with my niece for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. The staff were very friendly from the moment we walked in the door and were also able to help me out when I had forgotten my travel adapter.  The rooms were standard hotel size, however clean and comfortable. The air con was a little loud and the room was either very cool or very warm, there didn't seem to be a medium.  There wasn't much selection at breakfast, however there was enough to fill you up!  This property has a 7/11 next door and CVS and Walgreens across the road, so there are plenty of options to go and get food. It's also only a 10- 15 minute stroll to Disneyland which helps.  Would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear t_la1982,  Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We are glad you found our rooms to be clean and comfortable.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you again soon for your next visit.  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary: This hotel is right next to Disneyland, is very clean with a secured hotel lobby you can only enter at night with a keycard. Pool is very clean and the hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Cleanliness, service and room was so nice I won't need to look anywhere else next time I want to stay in Anaheim. Amazing job Desert Palms.
Manager Response: Dear Ross T,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff and our hotel cleanliness. Our housekeepers work very hard to make sure everything in the hotel is kept in top shape.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we look forward to seeing you again for your next visit!  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff, Cold Pool, Terrible Included Breakfast
Summary: The good: Hotel was easy walking distance from Disneyland. The staff was nice and eager to help. The free parking was very appreciated. There was always fresh, flavored water in the lobby. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable.   The bad: Pool was cold, I couldn't swim in it and my 4 yo son was shivering as he tried. The included breakfast was terrible. My son even commented on how bad the food was. The in-room coffee was the worst I've ever had, no exaggeration.   So, if you're not interested in swimming or enjoying the included breakfast/ coffee, this is a good budget option that is close to Disney. Unfortunately, I don't think we will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Fritzee24,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that your stay with us was not up to your standards. Thank you for your compliments to the Front Desk staff. I am sorry to hear you did not enjoy our free hot breakfast. We will definitely check with our Food and Beverage Manager to make sure our food quality meets our high standards. We keep our pool at 82 degrees year around. I apologize if something was not working right during your visit as I see it was back in August, but we have just checked the temperature after your review was published and it is at 82 degrees.   We hope you will consider us when planning your next trip to Anaheim.   Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary Heading: My Favorite Hotel When Visiting Disneyland!
Summary: My family has visited Disneyland 5 times over the last 15 years and Desert Palms is by far our favorite hotel.  Excellent location, terrific staff, free breakfast and cozy rooms.  We booked a family suite and comfortably stayed with 6 of us.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Misopiso88,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. It means so much to us that you consider us your favorite hotel for visiting Disneyland. Thank you for continuing to stay with us throughout the years, we are so glad to hear that you had a lovely stay with us again on your last visit.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to greeting you on your next visit!  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel, Super Close Walk to Disneyland!
Summary: I was blown away by this hotel from the size of the queen suite room that we had to the free hot buffet breakfast and all of this within walking distance to the park! The queen suite can easily fit a family of 6 thanks to its 2 queen beds and large sofa bed in the separate living room. Very impressed with their breakfast buffet, lots of options and always something new each morning. Great swimming area for the kids, which is awesome for those afternoon breaks from the park. The location is great not only because of the 10-15 minute walk to the park entrance, but there is a CVS across the street and several other restaurant options which you can stock up on drinks and snacks (also will help save you money). Staff here are awesome and will out of their way to ensure you have an
Manager Response: Dear Brad N,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. We are so happy hear that you had such a great stay with us. We are so glad that you were able to take advantage of some of our great amenities such as our hot buffet breakfast and pool area. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.  We hope to see you again soon for your next visit!  Sincerely, Team Desert Palms

Summary Heading: Great deal, and very close to the park!
Summary: We go to Disneyland several times each year, and we've stayed at a different hotel each time because we can never seem to find one we like enough to come back to.  This one checks off almost everything on our wish list!  First of all, the room was updated, clean, comfortable, and quiet.  The kids' bunk room was set up very nicely, with easy to climb stairs to the top bunk and full size mattresses.  The bathroom was located in our room, which made it much easier to stay quiet at night.  The free breakfast was actually very nice, considering that many of them are just meh.  Plentiful food, lots of places to sit (including an outside area), and choices for everyone.  The employees that work in the breakfast room do a great job!  They're polite and helpful, and keep the food stocked
Manager Response: Dear ldfinder,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our Breakfast room team members! They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: We just visited this hotel with our family.  They are in the middle of upgrades, our rooms were nice, but the elevators are confusing.  Very kid friendly and helpful staff.  Breakfast design with kids portion in mind.  I would go back again.
Manager Response: Dear Rick426,  Thank you for your review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We have just finished renovations to all of our rooms so we are glad to hear that your your rooms were nice. Our breakfast is a buffet so everyone can enjoy as much of it as they like.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope that you will visit us again soon!

Summary: I've stayed in queen suites in other hotels in the neighbourhood but this hotel has by far the best.  If you are a family of 6 you must stay here.  Clean and comfortable rooms, delicious and healthy breakfast options, friendly and helpful staff and it's a short walk to the parks.  I also liked that it was across the street from the CVS where we could pick up food and drinks for our room and for the parks. Other great features include the private outdoor swimming pool, underground parking and a nice-looking restaurant that I unfortunately did not get to try but I'm sure it's wonderful.  I don't smoke but I noticed they have a pleasant smoking section on a second floor balcony overlooking the pool.    Seriously, the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites will suit your needs at a reasonable

I am very glad that you had such a great visit with us.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope that you will be able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice and clean hotel, great staff, great location
Summary: We stayed there for 3 nights to visit Disneyland.The rooms are nice, big and very clean.This hotel is about a 10 minute ish walk from disneyland, free onsite parking and a breakfast buffet.There are a variety of restaurants very close by.
Manager Response: Dear Kapil S,  Thank you for your review. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff and our hotel cleanliness. We appreciate your kind feedback.  We hope that you will be able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We arrived a few hours early and had to hang out in the lobby.  A gal with long orange fake nails was behind the desk and not real friendly. Eventually we were given a room on the second floor which was in the older section.  It was kind of dated but livable for the nights we were stayed. There are two elevators and the one to the second floor didn't go to the 5th floor where the free breakfast was.  Fridge in room never worked right. Beds hard an a bit uncomfortable. The breakfast was poor to average - thankfully they offered fruit and cottage cheese otherwise lots of bad looking scrambled eggs, donuts, breads and carbs..  While we were there the first floor was torn up with a construction project.  Pool small but our grandson had fun.  Two long blocks to Disneyland.  Walk

We hope you will consider staying with us again and experience our usual high level of service.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: VERY CLEAN! VERY AFFORDABLE! I never write reviews but this hotel and staff deserve the good word. If you are on a budget like me this is the place to stay. I booked through Groupon. The staff was helpful and very friendly. I tipped the maids and the breakfast workers daily because I thought they did an outstanding job. Breakfast was more than your average cold cereal and donuts. We stayed four nights and every day breakfast was a little different, always hot. The room cleanliness shined. The restaurant and the gift shop are not overpriced like some. There is a 7-11 next door which can have some questionable people at but we never felt bothered or unsafe walking to and from Disneyland early morning or late at night. This hotel sits on the back side of California Disney. My 13

Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: My family is very happy on stay in USA. This hotel is good. The room Sahara with kitchen  offer a big space.  The breakfast is diversified. The pool is good for the kid. Not for the baby. The personnel is happy is ok for help. Disneyland is near Hotel, just 10 minutes. Parking free. I recommend this hotel.

We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I researched all of the hotels in the area as we have always stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, but it's too pricey to stay there every few months. I'm so glad we ended up staying at the Desert Palms! I can't say enough good things! Their rooms appear newly renovated and always squeaky clean when we arrive. There is plenty of room for all of us to spread out and not feel on top of each other. The room we had on our first trip had an amazing view of the fireworks. You also can't beat the free wifi (which actually works really well!) parking and breakfast, which is one of the best we've had at a hotel.  The best part of staying at Desert Palms is the kindness and attentiveness of the staff. Kristen in guest services is a gem and has always been available if I had any questions or
Manager Response: Dear Vwahlers,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. It was a pleasure to have you stay with us again. Thank you for all of your compliments about our hotel and staff, including myself. I am so glad that the team and I was able to make your visit magical!   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We look forward to many more visits from you in the future!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: The Stay it was very good. The hotel, breakfast, the presentation on the trip is complete.the personal are very good. It was my first stay in USA and this hotel it was very good.Disney is very near Hotel. Just 10 minutes and you can have a magic experience

Summary: Overall a very nice hotel, great staff, great location. Love the room the breakfast and the free parking. Only a 10 minute walk to Disney.CVS and Walgreens across the street. Very convenient to alot of good restaurants.

Summary: My husband, 19 year old and 16 year old stayed in a bunk room suite which was perfect. There was plenty of room for the four of us. The pool is good and my kids had a great time in it while I sat and read in the spa. It was an easy walk to Disneyland and handy having a 7 11 right beside the hotel with a CVS across the road. There are plenty of places to eat in walking distance.

Summary Heading: Our home away from home when we go to Disneyland

Summary: We are dance group with 32 dancers, plus parents, instructors and chaperons that stayed in Desert Palms in August for 5 days. So in total our group was over 60 people.  I have worked with Julie Gomez in the organization of our stay and she was phenomenal.  She gave as a group discount, helped with room selection, answering all of my emails and phone calls prior to our visit, making sure we have extra space for breakfast as well making sure that rooms are available before check in for our group. Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, breakfast delicious, roof top for breakfast always available, having lemon water in lobby and coffee fantastic idea. Even though we were a large group the staff was always super polite and accommodating in any questions or request we had. Special

Summary: Was very impressed with this hotel from the start. The staff on arriving were very friendly, inviting and helpful.  The room was great with a little kitchenette and full fridge. Would be great for a family with a longer stay.  Quick walk to Disney but also right on an ART bus route for when the feet are all Disney-ed out!!! Handy to Garden walk restaurants and also a few shops for last minute or forgotten items. Happily stored our luggage for the day after checkout while we had another full day at Disney.  Great staff and hotel overall!!

We look very forward to welcoming you back for your next stay in Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is really great.  We started staying here on our disneyland trips about a year ago.  This hotel is about a 10 minute ish walk from disneyland, free onsite parking and a breakfast buffet.  My kids love the bunk bed room.  So nice for them to have their own space separate from ours and makes bedtime so easy!  No fighting over which bed!  The staff is very friendly and has always been welcoming.  Flavored water and coffee in the lobby is great also!  Our next stay there is in October!
Manager Response: Dear Amanda L,  Thank you for your great review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.  We look forward to seeing you again in October!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights to visit Disneyland. The hotel was excellent! All round great atmosphere, the staff were pleasant, the pool was great. The family suite was excellent and comfortable, roomy and clean. Meals were excellent and right next door to Disneyland . Would definitely stay here again

When we checked in, we found that transients,and what I would call unstable persons were coming in and out of the hotel and causing a scene, as well as acting suspicious and nervous. One subject proceeded to take a active key out of someones file and more blank keys and hand them out to transients outside the building when the attendant wasn't paying attention BUT was still behind the counter. This suspicious person also went through files and a information codex on the counter and looked at guests personal information. He was in and out of the hotel the entire time we were checking in.   Once the front desk attendant handed us our keys, I asked him if this is something they deal with often and

Our family of six went to Disneyland for 3 days and we booked our hotel with Desert Palm Hotel and Suites. The staff was amazing. They welcomed us in and made our stay relaxing and fun. We ended up arriving before chick in time and they held our luggage for us so that we could go explore and have fun until check. Even after we had checked out we had time to kill before our flight so they let us borrow some towels to take to the beach and when we returned they were welcoming of us staying there until our shuttle ride came. The kids did a scavenger hunt in the lobby, they gave us a family Disney photo, and were extremely helpful when we didn't know the area. The complimentary breakfast was very very good and we had so much to choose from.The breakfast room is located on the fifth

Summary Heading: Great location, comfortable and friendly hotel - great place
Summary: The location is fantastic, family friendly for Disney and surrounding shops and restaraunts.  The hotel staff are friendly and very accommodating and put the H in hospitality.  The rooms are great, a little noisy if facing the street but not too bad and certainly not enough to put us off. 2nd time we visited Anaheim and very pleased we came back to the same hotel, yes there is a lot of choice and hard to compare as we have only stayed here but based on value for money, location, comfort, there is no need to look elsewhere.

Summary: This place is a bargain compared to other hotels near Disney; its only a 10-15 minute walk to the street enterance.  We stayed here a few years ago and felt the rooms needed upgrading.  Well on this trip the rooms were up graded for the better: new mattresses, furniture, paint, Tv.  The free breakfast was good too.  One item of concern is the AC setup:  We booked a Yuha(sp?) room where the kids sleep in bunks in a second room.  Well their room is where the AC unit is and the thermostat is in the other.  When we set thermostat to 72, the AC unit remains on until it senses 72, but when you close the door between the two rooms, the kids room becomes a freezer and our room was about 78-79 and we slept on top of the blankets.  We had to order extra blankets for them.  Open the door

It is our goal with each guest to provide a memorable experience and the desire to return to property.   We look very forward to welcoming you back for your next stay in Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights. We arrived early and there were no rooms available to check in but they let us use the pool while we wait and store our luggage which was awesome. The parking is free. They have a little scavenger hunt in the lobby for the kids and once they are done they get a prize. The rooms are nice and big and very very clean! And the cleaners always arrived early everyday so our rooms were always made up when we got back. The staff are great, the hotel is very convenient. There is a cvs/pharmacy (where you can pretty much buy anything) across the road and a 7 eleven right next door and a small mart to buy cheap disney things before you visit the parks. Right across the road from the convention centre, bout a 10 minute stroll to the front doors and about a 15
Manager Response: Dear Haze A,  Thank you for your five star review! I am so pleased to see that you had such an enjoyable stay and experienced our hotel amenities and services. It is our goal with each guest to provide a memorable experience and the desire to return to property.   We look very forward to welcoming you back for your next stay in Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Very friendly and attentive staff members
Summary: Okay, this is not a super fancy hotel. However, our room was clean. The location was very convenient. The breakfast was solid. Having a warm breakfast, parking, and Internet were useful amenities.  The highlight was the staff. They were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. I had my 13 month old daughter with me, and the buffet staff were incredibly sweet to her as she walked around the breakfast area. They always said good morning to her and made her smile. The front desk staff offered her a Disney pin, which she loved. It was a good experience overall.
Manager Response: Hello Lynne V,  Thank you so much for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your wonderful feedback on our staff members. I am very glad they were able to make your stay a special one.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I took my family for a conference and also to visit friends/family in Anaheim.  Our suite could easily fit 6 adults (we had two adults and 3 kids).  It was two rooms with a sliding door and two tvs, so we got a bit of a break from the family.  The best surprise at this hotel was that by staying on the back of the hotel on the 4th floor, we had a spectactular view of the fireworks at Disney every night.  I mean--it was nearly front row seats.  You should try to get on the back of the hotel 3rd or 4th floor to get this nightly treat!!
Manager Response: Hello Anita B,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you got to enjoy the fireworks view suite. We do have select suites in the back of our hotel that face the fireworks. A great way to end your Disney day!  Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences with other travelers. We hope you will come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown, Guest Services

Summary: Great location- right at the doorstep of Disney.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Rooms spacious and clean.  Pool and gym facilities- great way to keep fit.  I would definitely stay at Desert Palm hotel again
Manager Response: Dear Nasimacarrim,  Thank you for your wonderful review. I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that our amenities and location were to your liking. Thank you for your compliments to our staff!   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I was in Anaheim for a conference. Anaheim is a bad place where to stay- if you are not interested in walt disney attractions. The hotel is poor, housekeepers don't speak english, fees are high, they don't provide any bath robe and bath liquid soap or other set for the bath. The furniture is old, the entrance is really poor, the pool is poor and so small that you can't use it. The gym is a nightmare. Don't go in this hotel if you travel to Anaheim for work. They provide breakfast.. But it is awful - just sausages, eggs, apples, and preserved pineapples. The only good thing is that there is a cvs just opposite the hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Veronica,  I am sorry to hear you did not enjoy your stay with us. We are not a full service hotel so we do not provide we luxury bath amenities. We are a 3 diamond hotel perfect for family and business travelers, conveniently located next door to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. All of our rooms have been refurbished and remodeled as of July 2016 and feature all new furniture and modern amenities. Our free hot breakfast buffet includes sausage, eggs, potatoes, biscuits, gravy, pastries, make your own waffles, croissants, muffins, toast, English muffins, yogurt, oatmeal and fruit, with some items rotating daily.   We hope you will reconsider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Desert Palms Hotel

Summary: Too many "other people's" strands of hair in the room,  so not clean. Room layout not comfortable. No access to natural light.  Otherwise,  staff is nice and WiFi works well.  I'd look for another option next time.
Manager Response: Hello Len0x,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. We have a high standard of cleanliness in our guest rooms and we will definitely have our housekeeping manager speak to our housekeepers to ensure that standard is being upheld. Thank you for your compliments to our staff.   We hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great rooms, but hard to have proper food.
Summary: PROS   This hotel is closely located to Disneyland, and it is on one of the key Anaheim avenues, close to 7/11 and other shops.  Rooms are great, clean, bed is supercomfortable, silent (I asked for a room which was not facing the main road) etc.  Service is very nice, front desk efficient and helpful    CONS Breakfast is free but poor quality, food does not taste good.  Internet in the room goes on and off continuosly  There is no on-site restaurant or bar so if you want to have lunch you have to go out (the sandbox restaurant at the hotel opens only at 4pm) Swimmingpool is about OK
Manager Response: Dear GiulianiE,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to the Front Desk staff, I am glad you found your bed to be super comfortable. I am sorry to hear you did not enjoy our free hot breakfast. We will definitely check with our Food and Beverage Manager to make sure our food quality meets our high standards. We do have the our onsite restaurant the Sandbox Bar and Grille, open from 4pm - 10pm Monday - Wednesday and 12pm - 10pm Thursday - Sunday. There are also a variety of restaurants very close by.  We hope you will consider us when planning your next trip to Anaheim.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Great place! Walked in last minute and they gave me a great rate. Excellent staff. Great location. Pool was busy with large group but clean and well kept. Pizza in the bar was great as late snack and they delivered to room.
Manager Response: Dear Pleppers,  Thank you for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am also glad you were able to enjoy a meal from our hotel restaurant.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope you will visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Parking is HORRIBLE! no joke, If you can even find a place to park it's usually hard to get into or out of the spot it's packed like a sardine can. One plus was we got a free upgrade to the room with bunk beds for the kids. So now to what's wrong with the room, a slab of granite fell off the back of a bench in the room and hit my daughter in the back, we only got a few channels on the TV that we were actually supposed to get after incoming the front desk they half way fixed it and we got most of the channels. My wife and daughter were both blow drying there hair at the same time and blew all the fuses in our room, when we check in the linens were stained and the bathroom wasn't cleaned properly. The halls stunk and were hot also the air conditioning in our room sucked. Bathroom

This hotel was excellent for our stay!  Short walk to Disneyland, etc...  Convenient to cvs, Walgreens, gas station.   Amenities were great and the breakfast each Morning was a plus-   Clean and spacious rooms-   Restaurant in  lobby  is a bonus too-  Helpful friendly staff.   Pool and hot tub available also, but it is small.    Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Jerae W,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am very glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. I am also glad to hear you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast and hotel restaurant.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel probably at least a dozen times over the past 5 years during our stays in Disneyland. As always, it was a wonderful experience. The staff is always courteous and respectful. The hotel has always been clean and well maintained. The room comfortable and accommodating. The pool area large and inviting. The hot breakfast, included in the price of the stay has always had variety, allowing everyone in our family to fill up on something they enjoy before a full day at the Disney parks. I recently stayed this last weekend in July, and again, was wowed. My interaction with the staff far exceeded my expectations and the customer service was top notch. I will always continue to look at this hotel for any future stay because I've always had the best experiences and
Manager Response: Hi Jeanine,  Thanks for your wonderful review! It is always a pleasure to have you stay with us. I am very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us once again and we hope that you have many more!  Thank you for share your feedback with other travelers, we look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Our experience was wonderful this year. The staff was amazing. Very nice and efficient. We stayed last year (2015), and the staff was very rude. But this year (2016) they changed their staff, though it seems, and they were amazing. Our room last year (2015) flooded and we had to clean up the mess. The hotel did compensate us this year (2016) and gave us an upgrade, due to our unfortunate stay last year. What a whole new experience. We were very happy with our overall stay this year. The room was very nice, and  the Breakfast buffet is Amazing and Very Delicious! I enjoyed the Breakfast Buffet.

This is a great hotel! The rooms are newly remodeled. Very clean. Pretty spacious. Our family of five slept comfortably. I had heard the walls were a bit thin so we requested a room on the top floor. No problems. The pull out sofa mattress was droopy and uncomfortable. We took it off and laid it flat on the floor instead and that was much better. That is the only thing I can find to complain about. The pool was clean and warm. Plenty of towels. Free hot breakfast was tasty and fresh. The kids liked making their own waffles in the morning. The restaurant staff kept the place clean and the food stocked. Ten minute walk to Disneyland. 7-11 was right next door for water and refreshments. Rite aid was just across the street as well. Hubby bought inserts on day three for his shoes

The hotel was nice. We had a suite, so the extra bedroom and kitchen was great when travelling with small kids. Only a block from Disney, which was very convenient.   Complimentary breakfast was a bonus. Good selection (hot, cold, fruit, yogurt), and the food quality was ok. The pool area was nice as long as there weren't a lot of people around (a bit small), but the pool and hot tub could be cleaner.   Overall it was a reasonable hotel for the price.

Summary Heading: Not bad but wouldn't necessarily choose again
Summary: Room nicely appointed and clean. Restaurant room service said it would be 45 mins and after 1 hr and still no food I called down and it was going to take another hour.  Canceled order.  Free parking is definitely great compared to other hotels in area that charge for it but it was packed and lots of cars parked along "no parking" signs and hotel didn't seem to care.  Bet the fire marshall would! Didn't use Disney shuttle since for just $4 more I can park at Disney and have flexibility. If it was free I might have used it.  Breakfast was bare minimum to call it a "hot breakfast" but sufficient enough to save time vs. going to a restaurant.  Loved the bunk bed room kids suite and it was less $ than other hotels with similar rooms.  A/C though was lacking in the main room if kids

Desert Palms Hotel & Suites is a wonderful hotel for families going to Disneyland. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which had a king bed in one room and a bunk bed in the other room. The bunk bed had full size mattresses on both the top and bottom and featured reading lights as well as outlets which made playing gaming devices in bed convenient. The room came with a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, and free wifi. We were concerned about how noisy a family hotel like this would be, but did not hear much noise at all. The hotel had free breakfast (on the 5th floor) but was not anything special. We appreciated the free parking. In addition, you can purchase your Disneyland tickets at the hotel which beats waiting in line at the park. It took us 12-13 minutes to walk to

Summary Heading: Room upgrade saved this from being 2 star
Summary: We stayed at this hotel having not been able to get in at our preferred choices. The receptionist  was less than welcoming, he didn't smile once. He was helpful in terms of doing his job efficiently but not a happy chappy! Our initial room was basic and frankly depressing- not at all what the web page projects. However a different very helpful receptionist upgraded us when we complained and we moved into a suite which was much nicer with views looking out to the Disney parks. The rooms were very clean. The breakfast was revolting and clearly cheap food. We did not eat here at all. The swimming pool is in the middle of the hotel so does not get all that much sun apart from the middle of the day when its directly ahead. It was also very cold. The best thing was the short 10 minute

My fiancé and I stayed here in March of 2016 for a 6 day Disneyland and Los Angeles adventure. We had a very positive experience.  First, this is a "Good Neighbor Hotel" meaning they work directly with Disney and Disney Travel Agents to offer you park and hotel accommodations. We used a DTA and the hotel had all of our park tickets and other items ready for us at check in which was very nice.  The staff here is great! We arrived at 10:30am on our check-in day and were able to store our suitcases safely behind the front desk to go and enjoy the parks. The hotel front desk always had little granola bars or snacks, which were nice to grab on our ways to the park.  Rooms are newly updated and comfort able! For a hotel housing many families, it's very quiet. We slept great every

Very easy walk to Disneyland, about 10 mins to the entrance. Staff were helpful. We were a tad jetlagged on day one, so chose to head back to the hotel from Disneyland for rest and swim, then headed back. Great place for families.

Construction trailer parked next to my car in hotel lot. They spattered spackle all over the driver's side of my car and left a chip and crack in windshield across the same side. I reported it immediately after discovering it upon check out and filled in an incident report with manager Albina. (She was busy with other complaints upon my checkout as well unrelated to the construction.) I was told I would be contacted within 3-4 days. Over a week later I finally got a different manager Katie to return my calls to update me on the status of this incident request. She offered to reimburse for detailing my car but not the windshield. I appreciated this but later she never followed through calling me back with the construction company's information and corporate offices never followed

Summary Heading: The friendliest place and the most for our money.
Summary: They helped us when we got stranded with cancelled flight from Southwest Airline. The staff was wonderful to us and the room was just what we needed to sleep six . The breakfast was good and the beds slept good too. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. I was impressed and that takes a lot since we always stay on Disney property. It may be an older place but the location was good and I can't say enough about the staff. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.😊

I thought the breakfast was great. Did not use the pool. Location to Disneyland is great. Could use some type of transport for those days when you open and close the park. Staff was friendly and worked to make experience a great one. I recommend going in the morning and coming back to the hotel in the afternoon for a nap then resuming your park experience. The Location of Dessert Palms makes this possible. Also there is a 7-11 next door for snacks.

We had the family room for 7 days with bunk set in one room which was a great option for family. Comes with American style breakfast of eggs, waffles , doughnuts cereal etc. and changes daily. A pool to cool off in, and a gym if you ate to many doughnuts. The staff are always cleaning and always pleasant. Rooms and public spaces are in good shape. Wi fi only works about 50% of the time in the rooms which is a pain but good in lobby. Convenience stores and buses right outside and 10 min stroll to Disney. Would stay again.

The best thing about this place was it was in walking distance to Disneyland. The room size was adequate for our family of 5. Having an extra sink and mirror outside the bathroom was a plus with so many people.  For the price range, I have stayed in many better hotels. The decor is outdated and worn. This is actually a relatively minor thing to me but gives the hotel a 2 star feel.   Parking- underground parking tight, not always easy to find a place Breakfast- lack of fresh fruits or healthy choices.  Internet- very slow and pretty much nearly unuseable during peak hours

The staff at Desert Palms made our stay a fantastic one.  They were efficient and gracious making us feel so welcome the moment we walked through the doors.  We stayed 5 nights, the rooms were quiet and clean.  We stayed in the kids suite with the bunk beds in another room as well as a sleeper sofa.  The beds were comfortable, with crisp, cool, clean linens.  Each night we would return to our clean room, exhausted from a full day at Disney and California Adventures.  The pool facilities were clean and well maintained.  A great spot to sit and watch the kids cool off.  The free breakfast buffet was a plus, and there was a good selection each day.  The walk to the Disneyland Park was about 7 minutes.  We enjoyed ourselves and would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great price and amenities, with few issues
Summary: I recently stayed in this hotel for a trip with my teen daughter that included the Disneyland Parks area, and single-day trips to both San Diego and Sequoia National Park. This hotel was nearly perfect, exceeded my expectations based on other reviews I had read over the past year (I booked this hotel over a year ago, so was watching closely). I have very little complain about now that I've returned home.  Check-in was painless. The entire check-in process probably took about 5 minutes. They answered all of my questions. Everything was explained, including fees for the safe and the checkout policy and procedures. Our room was ready and available on-time.  Our room was bright and clean. It had a huge window with an obstructed view of the pool area. I was concerned about the pool

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay while at Disneyland!
Summary: We had a very pleasant stay here in July 2016. The staff i met were helpful and friendly. This hotel is a short 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland. They had 2 types of fruit infused water and coffee in the lobby and a well stocked little store. In addition there is a 7-11 right next door and a CVS and Walgreens right across the street. We stayed in the yuha kids suite which was very nice. The beds were clean and comfortable but the pillows weren't great. The bathroom was spacious, very clean, and always had plenty of hot water. The room we were in had the parents room right as you walk in the door and the kids room in the back which means we could hear lots of noise from the hall.  A couple of nights this was almost an issue when a family a few doors down spent 20 minutes loudly

Wonderful!  We usually stay in the numeric motel near Angels Stadium, but I wanted a three star, free breakfast and parking, next to Disneyland and I got it!  At hot wire dot com for $141 plus tax and fees $190, on a Saturday night in summer.  We booked it at 7pm online for that night.  Check their website also, they say the prices are lowest and you get a 10% discount.  They have a small swimming pool that is outdoors with a jacuzzi.  The breakfast was hot scrambled eggs, home fried potatoes, sausage patties; waffles, white or wheat bread and English muffins; oatmeal cereal packets near the hot water & coffee.  Also had a variety of cold cereal-did not ask for non-dairy milk, but I'm sure it's available.  Also had peaches in yogurt, fruit cocktail and cottage cheese.  The king

Great location. We had a Yula room, 2 separate bedrooms. 1 room had great size bunks for our 15 and 18 year old children. We had king size bed, nice bathroom. Only issue was noise from a room next door, not very good sound-proofing. Great location for Disney and food outlets

Summary Heading: Stay here for Disney with Families
Summary: This place is great.  It has 2 separate rooms.  One with Bunk Beds for the kids and one with a king bed for the adults.  There is a barn slider door between the two rooms.  The door doesn't provide much privacy if you feel the need to get amorous with your significant other, unless your kids are heavy sleepers, then you should be fine.  A nice sized fridge and microwave in the rooms.  The bathroom is a normal size.  The pool was a bit chilly for my liking, although my kids were great with it, because they are not as wimpy as their dad is.  I didn't mind sitting around the pool with a beer watching my kids turn blur from the water temp.  I just told my Daughter that Else was Turing the water to ice and she was fine after that.

Over the past several years my family and I have chosen Desert Palms because of the location, breakfast, and friendly staff! This time around we found blood stain on the pull out bed and when removed the sheet it was covered with hair! Next we noticed my nephew had multiple bug bites for the several days! We were asked to change rooms, we did, then their was no cable, and the closet door was broken! It was taken care of but this all happen over long days at the park! The reason I am given this poor review is because not once did upper management call to apologize or check on our stay status! I was told several times that they would be contacting me!! We will not be staying here or recommending anyone! I do have photos but will not be posting!

It was my first time in Anaheim (we were there for a convention) and I couldn't have been more pleased. With check in we were a little bit early and we were offered an upgraded room because our room wasn't ready yet. This room was awesome, had king, bunk bed, fridge and microwave. Completely appreciated after fighting jet lag, getting rental car then LA traffic to get there. Rough! Staff very helpful and friendly. Even with minor renovation in the lobby this hotel was clean and inviting. Pool and hot tub was good. Parking was free, just need tag from desk. Breakfast bar was best I've ever seen. There is a 7/11 almost on site. The convention center was across the street and Disney is in the "backyard". Had view of the castle from the 5th floor. Cool!  We watched some fireworks

Our kids High School Band traveled to Disneyland to perform with the Disney Performing Arts program, and this was our hotel.  The hotel was doing renovations on several rooms/floors so when we arrived discovered rooms where on 2 different floors (we had hired security guards to keep tabs on all the student rooms) and on the second night, managed to juggle a few rooms to have all the students on the same floor and in the same area.  Our room (for my Husband and myself) had a king bed in a corner room.  Renovated, modern with fridge and microwave, a bit on the smaller side, but bathroom very new and modern.  Bed was very comfortable and and made for a great sleep after long days in the parks.  There was a safe in every room as well as laundry facilities on each floor.  I went into

We were here with a dance group appearing in the Friday Disney parade and need rooms with lots of beds for lots of kids.  This was one of the few hotels that offered multiple bed rooms!  On check in room 306 smelled of mould in the bathroom.  As a former landlord you learn these things. We thought oh it is just something else, but after a couple of days the smell got worse.  It was emanating from the bath room, so my guess would be there is a leak behind the newly renovated shower panels.  In any event they moved us without any questions into a newer section of the hotel and a bit bigger room 316 that fit us all with the grandson whose crib now fit into the sink/closet area.  The beds in both rooms were the same top quality beds and linens.  Both rooms were relatively quiet

Arrived to check in and the swing shift female front desk rep was putting on her uniform next to her car in plain view of everyone arriving to the hotel. We don't want to see you get dressed for work. Restroom was grimy all around. Hair in tub, handles dirty, door frames scratched, stained and generally dirty. Got a family of 4? Try showering with 1 tiny vial of shampoo and 1 tiny bar of soap. The bathroom ceiling fan was noisy...clankety clank clank...obvious the housekeeper didn't report it to maintenance. Which brings me to the theft in my room. We PURPOSELY left behind a $40 dollar necklace after checking out to test the honesty and integrity of the staff. It took the lost and found email 4 days and 3 calls to get answered. First call during business hours was unanswered and

We got the double queen suite. Room was spotless. Bed was comfortable. The buffet was pretty good. Pool could have been cleaner. Free wifi and free parking. Good location cvs and 711 right across the street. Walking distance to Disney depending on your child's age. My daughter is 5. It was a little far for her especially after doing a day in Disney,but I guess it depends on the kid. Ended up taking an uber back and it was only $4.00 from down town Disney to the hotel. A place to do your laundry which was great. Concierge was informative about other things to do in the area. I would stay here again , it was worth the price and the staff were nice.

We stayed here during the VidCon event. It was right down the street from the Anaheim Convention Center (<10 minute walk.) The free hot breakfast had a lot of variety from eggs, biscuits & gravy to making your own mini waffles. It is also right across the street from a CVS and a variety of restaurants. The pool at the hotel is enclosed and heated which was great. They have free parking and free wifi. The wifi seemed slower at night. There was a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker in our room. It was very affordable, but we had a VidCon discount. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Dee_DA71,  Thank you for your great review. We were so happy to have you here with us for VidCon and we hope you enjoyed the convention. Thank you for your compliments to our hotel, I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast and free parking. We do have a repeat guest discount year around if you want to come back and visit again before next year's VidCon!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you again next year for VidCon...or sooner!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here a couple years ago and are back for round two. We enjoyed it the first time and we were happy to see it available again. They have remodeled our room and it looks great (although it still smells like fresh paint). The room used to have a full range and oven. That has been removed. There is a two-burner stove and a nice microwave now. We anticipated using the oven for a couple meals, so we had to make adjustments. Not a big deal, but something to be aware of. On both stays we had to request additional plates and silverware. The staff was happy to provide them, but I'm not sure why a room that sleeps 6 only has 4 place settings standard. The hotel is a quick walk to Disneyland which had been fantastic. We pack our lunch and walk to the parks. In the evening it's
Manager Response: Dear Chad W,  Thank you for your great review. We are indeed just finishing up a remodel of our complete hotel and I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your updated guest room. Thank you for your feedback on the number of plates in the room, we will definitely relay this to housekeeping.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers.   We hope to see you again soon for a third visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We absolutely love staying at Desert Palms and will continue to do so anytime we are visiting Disneyland. The rooms are roomy and always very clean. The hot waffle breakfast is the best. Great vacation spot.
Manager Response: Dear Christina D,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you had another wonderful stay with us. Thank you for always choosing our hotel for your visits to Anaheim!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I went to this hotel the second week in June, with my two children for a getaway vacation to Disneyland, it was under construction. The staff was friendly ,hotel was OK they have a breakfast buffet, poor to mediocre , Walls were thin ,   Room was dimly lit. And the kids area that they advertised it was closed so my kids were bummed about that. The room i recieved was next to a family that had a baby cried and I was up some nights ,unable to change rooms man at the front desk said that they were booked I was on the first floor behind all of the construction so in the daytime I did hear some construction noises . The location was good walk to Disneyland was quick less than nine minutes would only go back if I was going to Disneyland for the location of the hotel nothing special
Manager Response: Dear Toronji C,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not have an excellent stay with us. We are currently finishing up our hotel remodel. We have remodeled all guest rooms and are finishing up on common areas. We hope you will be able to visit us again after our renovation is complete to see the new hotel. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot buffet breakfast. We are always improving breakfast items so hopefully on your next visit you will be able to enjoy it.   We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Very nice hotel was very please with the room.    lots of room and space stayed in a suite.  Who is kind of small and planet top in the middle of the hotel kind of strange no hot tub was not impressed with free breakfast not good at all didn't need it after first day otherwise very very friendly staff very helpful.   I would stay here again just not eat the free breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Juanita H,  Thank you for your review. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am very glad you enjoyed your suite. We do have an outdoor heated pool and hot tub that I hope you were able to take advantage of during your visit.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: The hotel is fantastic!  Staff is very friendly and helpful and the location is GREAT for anyone looking to visit Disney.  It's an easy walk to the front entrance (we had a few people in our group that have trouble walking far distances and this wasn't a problem for them).  The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the staff is quick to accommodate any needs or questions.  I've had other family members stay here and we will continue to do so when in the area.
Manager Response: Dear rachelsB1410HU,  Thank you for your fantastic review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for your compliments to our staff! They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am glad that you found your room to be clean and your bed comfortable, and that you found the walk to Disneyland to be an easy one.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location in proximity to Disneyland
Summary: A friend and I took a "Mommy" trip with our 4 combined children earlier this month. We stayed in the Borrego Suite and it was plenty of room for us (2 adults, 4 children). Our room was on the 3rd floor and we did not have issues with noise, like some guests have mentioned. The Hotel and room were clean and comfortable. The walk to Disneyland was about 10 minutes, our kids had not problem with the walk...even after walking around the park all day (this was one of my favorite things about the hotel)! The free continental breakfast was OK, I have had better, but it served its purpose and saved us some money. The lobby was undergoing some renovations, which didn't look nice, but really didn't affect our stay. The staff at the desk were very kind and helpful. My friend and I would
Manager Response: Dear smom58,  Thank you for your great review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is great to hear that you found the hotel to be clean and comfortable and enjoyed our convenient location. Thank you for your compliments to our staff! They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We hope you will come back and visit soon to see the hotel completely remodeled!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Not sure I can give this place a complete review...we didn't eat the complimentary breakfast, didn't use the pool...but it's literally .5 miles from the entrance to the parks.  We walked back and forth each day...we as in 2 adults, 2 teens, 2 preschoolers.  Bring a stroller...preschoolers were always sacked on the walk back...so we carried each preschooler.  There are a ton of restaurants around...a CVS right across the street...and a 7/11 next door.  Although we didn't eat the breakfast, we saw plenty of people taking it back to their rooms...a full breakfast...pancakes, scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, fruit, etc.    The room was comfortable for sleeping, but the one small bathroom was difficult for all 6 of us.  That's not a REAL complaint...just an observation.  The room was
Manager Response: Dear Ellisak77,  Thank you for your great review. I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I am glad that you were not inconvenienced by the renovation of the lobby. We will finish up the complete remodel of our hotel very soon and we hope you will come back to see the finished hotel! Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you again on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: So glad we decided to try out the Desert Palms. Our stay was great. Rooms were nice! Appeared to be recently remodeled. Rooms had full kitchen, dining table, sitting area and then the bedroom. All were separated by doors for privacy. Rooms are very spacious. Great customer service at check in. Breakfast was good. Eggs, eggs with ham, sausage patties, biscuits n gravy, home potatoes (VERY GOOD), waffles, pancakes, cereal, fruits, yogurt, juices. About a 10-15 minute walk (depending on pace) to Disneyland security checks. Lots of food options around. 7-11 and CVS located right next door and across street. Rooms appeared to be sound proof. My son was crying one morning and my parents next door couldn't hear him at all. Lobby was being remodeled during our stay but didn't bother our
Manager Response: Dear Wildkat520,  Thank you so much for your awesome review! I am very glad to hear that you had a great stay. We did indeed finish up with a remodel of all of our rooms last month so your room was brand new. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. I am so glad that you received great customer service. I am also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast. I apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with the free Wi-Fi. We are working on it to improve for all future guests thanks to your, and other guest's, feedback. Thank you for letting us know.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you here again soon for your next visit to Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Hotel under construction, checked in and it looked like a crime scene with the yellow tape all around.  Workers sanding drywall, drywall dust going on us while waiting for the elevator.  Room was nothing like the pictures.  Staff works like nothing is wrong, no one apologizes for the work going on.  We saved for this vacation and our first time to Disneyland four out of six of us had headaches from the construction of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Do not stay at this Hotel
Summary: Hotel is under construction and some negative points to note which made our experience an unfortunate  visit==pool ice cool (even though it said heated) refrigerator did not work(frozen or warm is your choose) Washers do not work (no signs on machines), Water links in room, no towels and wash clothes in room daily, safe do not open and you have to wait 5 hours to have someone to your room, no manager on duty and they would not answer phone calls from staff, Wi-Fi nerve stayed up longer than 20 minutes at a time. Location from Disneyland great but not worth the headache. I'm struggling to come up with at least one positive thing about this hotel..  Oh yes, they had a great breakfast.

My young daughter and I stayed for three nights and I have to say this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The distance to Disneyland cannot be beat and I didn't feel unsafe at all walking to and from, especially at night, after a long day at Disney. Our room was recently updated and it was extremely clean, my daughter loved the bunk beds in the separate room from mine. Breakfast was good, even my picky daughter liked it. We will definitely stay there again when we come back to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Amanda V,  Thank you for your excellent review! Thank you so much for your compliments to our hotel. It is a high honor to be one of the best hotels you have ever stayed at. We just completed renovation on our rooms last month so your room was brand new, we are so glad to hear it was well received!  I am also glad to hear you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great Location!  Delicious Breakfast! Nice Staff!
Summary: I brought a group of students with special needs and staff to Disney in June from Alberta, Canada.  The staff was very welcoming and they made sure that we had the accessible room.  The room was very clean and we loved having a kitchen!  We could easily walk to and from Disney as needed throughout the day - the location really could not have been better!  My only complaint is that the pullout couch was not comfortable at all but I haven't slept on a pullout that is!  The breakfast was a huge hit every morning even having basic options for my student who is gluten and dairy free.  We also loved the touch of the cold refreshing water as we came into the lobby! Well done :)
Manager Response: Dear Lorie S,  Thank you for your great review! I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff.  I am glad you got a great welcome upon arrival and you found your room to be very clean.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and hope that you will visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for three nights last week.  First let me start with the positives.  This hotel is beautiful and clean.  We were very happy with our room, a king with the bunk bed in the separate room.  The bunks were awesome...top and bottom both full size mattress.  The pool area was adequate, but a little small.  The continental breakfast was decent and changed every other days (eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy); there was always cereal, waffles, and toast.  The staff was always friendly and helpful.  Parking was available at the back and also in a underground garage (though it did seem to fill up quickly come evening).  The walk to Disneyland was do-able, but a bit of a hike...maybe 10 - 12 minutes each way).  The only real negative was the noise level.  The walls are
Manager Response: Dear FAMVACLasVegas,  Thank you for your review. I am very glad to hear that you found our hotel to be beautiful and clean and were satisfied with your guest room. Thank you for your compliments to our staff! We were happy to serve you during your visit. I apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with the noise during your stay. Being mainly a Disneyland hotel we do sometimes get some noise at hours other hotels might not. We will definitely check the sound proofing of our rooms. Thank you for letting us know.  We hope you will reconsider staying with us again on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, ridiculous resort fee.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a graduation event and Disneyland trip. Wanted to check in early to get ready for the graduation cereminy. First they said no, no rooms were ready (1:00), then she double checked and found one for us. Perfect! The room was clean, roomy, but window coverings let in too much light. Breakfast is really a good deal and pretty tasty. Wi-Fi was OK in speed, thankfully free. Parking is a little tight, but it's free and conveniently located downstairs. The location is really great for going to Disney. Just two blocks from the front gate , 7-Eleven next door, and tons of restaurants are around. I do have a complaint though. They charge you a $10 a day Resort fee which is ridiculous. The pool is really small there is a Jacuzzi however most people are there
Manager Response: Dear Cherispear,  Thank you for your review. I am very happy hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I am glad that our Front Desk was able to find a room for your before check in time when you arrived. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are almost finished with our hotel remodel and hope you will come visit us again to see the finished hotel. Repeat guests do get a 10% discount on their next stay when they book directly.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and we hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: With a week long trip to Disneyland planned, we thought the convenience of this motel would be ideal...WRONG!!...the walls allow room noise from every angle, we were all up most of the time, every night because of this. On the 3rd night, at 4:00 AM, we were awakened by the people checking in the room next to ours. The noise went on for 30 minutes until I called the front desk. Every morning, we were awakened by thumping on the floors above, as well as a 6:45 AM "music boom" wake up from a car outside! The last morning, there was NO HOT WATER for showers, and we waited an hour for a luggage cart in which we had to ask the front desk 3 times for availability, because in a hotel this size, they only have 4 LUGGAGE CARTS!! The only bright spot in this stay, was the from Omar at the
Manager Response: Hello Charmaine M,  I am very sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. We will address all of your feedback with our managers to try and resolve the issues you encountered during your visit. We have already added more luggage carts since your stay with us thanks to your, and other guest's, feedback. We appreciate all guest feedback as it helps us to grow and improve our services and offerings for all future guests, so thank you for sharing with us.  I hope you will reconsider staying with us again on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: This hotel is so close to Disneyland.  We walked everyday.  The rooms was great, you can get a suite with extra beds.  Breakfast was good.  You do pay for parking and there is a resort fee which we wish was just added to the room charge.  But great location!!
Manager Response: Dear Krg999,  Thank you for your great review. I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. While we do have a resort fee, we do not charge for parking. We do offer free parking, free Wi-Fi, a free hot buffet breakfast to all of our guests. If you have any questions about your charges, please contact the Desert Palms Hotel directly and a guest service agent will be able to assist you.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other guests.  We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: For the $200 per night cost with resort feed and taxes, I expected better. We stayed here three nights. We only ate breakfast once as it was so poor. The outdoor pool is very small. The hotel was clean and staff friendly, but I would recommend staying at another hotel nearby for a lower cost. The good thing about this hotel was the free parking and close vicinity to Disney and the convention center.
Manager Response: Dear Aron-UK,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. I am glad that you found our hotel to be clean and thank you for your compliments to our staff.  I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot buffet breakfast. We do currently include sausage, eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, ham, muffins, donuts, croissants, Danishes, oatmeal, yogurt, waffles, toast, English Muffins, and fresh fruit included in our breakfast, with some of those items rotating daily. We are always trying to improve our breakfast selections and introduce new options often so hopefully on your next visit you will be able to find something you enjoy.  We hope that you will reconsider staying with us again.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I stayed here late February/early March whilst attending the Religious Education Congress just across the road at the Los Angeles Convention Centre. The location was ideal. The hotel had security doors after hours and all the rooms were located from the main foyer via enclosed passageways which reduced noise considerably (compared to other hotels we have stayed in).  We arrived quite early after a long flight and we were welcomed and received graciously and offered our room immediately so we were able to shower and rest which was appreciated immensely. The room faced Katella Avenue but with double glazing there was no noise at all. The room was clean and offered lots of space to unpack our bags, hang clothes, store cases and get some work done. Wifi was excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Tinkannabelle,  Thank you for your wonderful review! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks for playing trivia with us! So glad to hear you enjoyed. Thank you also for your compliments to our staff!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again next year for the Religious Education Congress!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: A very comfortable hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is well located, and very comfortable. The rooms are well fitted, spacious and the beds truly excellent.  Free car parking, and moderately helpful staff. I say moderately as we arrived early after the onerous flight for Australia, and they were quite happy to watch us in the foyer suffering from 21 hours of travel and made no attempt to find a room earlier than the 3pm check in after we arrived mid morning and could go nowhere else. Perhaps they had no solution to that problem. Other than that bit of bureaucracy we were very happy.    Excellent free wifi, quiet room, powerful shower, a moderate pool with heated spa on the side. Breakfast included in the tariff is nothing to rave about but it is food. And to mention the beds again, they are truly as good as you will
Manager Response: Dear Mmcin719,  Thank you for your review. I am very glad to hear that enjoyed your stay with us. I am sorry to hear that you were not able to check in until 3pm. We do try to accomidate early arrivals whenever possible but we do not always have the rooms ready before our check in time. Thank you fo your rave review of our beds, which are brand new from our renovations.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here to when we had plans for Disneyland. It's only a short walk to the front gate so it was great. We had a big room and very clean with a great price. Parking wasn't difficult at all and we felt our car was secure. We'll stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Tcoy01,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am very glad to hear you had a great visit. I am very glad that you took advantage of our free parking and you found your room to be large and clean.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Above and beyond my expectations.  Probably the best hotel I have stayed at.  When we arrived, we had to park underground, I have a very large SUV and was having trouble parking.  One of the staff members saw this from about a hundred feet away, ran over, and guided me in to the parking spot.  He then ran and grabbed us a luggage cart (I didn't ask him too), loaded our bags, and rolled us up to our room using the "secret elevator" avoiding having to roll thru the lobby.  Totally blew me away (he got a good tip).  Then the room was awesome.  Loved the seperate living area with tv and a curtain that could be drawn so I wouldn't bother my family while they were sleeping since I am a night owl.  Everything about the hotel exceeded my expectations.  Well Done!!!
Manager Response: Hi Grahambo0101,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am very happy to hear that you had such a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff member Jose. He is a great addition to our team and we are lucky to have him. Thank you for sharing how helped you during your stay.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: The rooms were very clean and Housekeeping did a great job The Breakfast was great Overall the Hotel a great value The hotel was under a renovation so it will be a better experience in the future I recommend this hotel when you plan to visit Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear Mosborne719,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our hard-working housekeeping department. They really appreciate the praise. I am also glad that you enjoyed our free hot buffet breakfast every morning!  We really appreciate you taking the time to share your excellent review with other travelers. We hope that you will visit us again soon to see our new hotel, post-renovations!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: Room was recently decorated - very noisy air conditioning unit. Room was clean with safe and comfortable beds. Noisy room which looked onto pool - awful breakfast. Horrid breakfast area and food.  Ate out mostly did have meal in hotel first eve but meal was awful.  Wouldn't go there again
Manager Response: Dear janis17656harris,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found your room to be clean and comfortable. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot breakfast buffet. We appreciate all guest feedback in order to improve our offerings for future guests.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences at our hotel with other travelers and hope you will visit again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Sufficient hotel, walk to Disneyland and very clean room. Good just for room use. Pool super small and shaded and breakfast was low quality but probably OK for most Americans if they don't eat healthy. Most likely will look for another hotel next time just so I can use more then just the room.
Manager Response: Dear Starigo,  Thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. I am sorry that you were not completely satisfied with our offerings. We appreciate all guest feedback as it helps us to improve our future offerings. I hope that you will give us another chance on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Love staying here! IT's only about a 3/4 mile walk to the entrances of the parks. The full breakfast is always good and the hotel is clean, with friendly staff. We stay here almost annually and have never been disappointed.
Manager Response: Hi Disneyfreaks01,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! Thank you also for being a repeat guest! We are so happy that you always choose our hotel for your Disneyland vacations and you have such great experiences here.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences at our hotel with other travelers and we look forward to all of your future visits!  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: The rooms were clean and roomy. the hotel staff were very helpful and courteous .Excellent location to Disneyland. Plenty of restaurants within one short block. The only issue we faced was the lack of parking underground and behind the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Robert,  Thank you for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you had such a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are currently undergoing a remodel that is almost finished so some of our parking spaces are housing construction equipment. I do apologize for the inconvenience during your visit. Next time you visit there will definitely be ample parking for you, as well as a brand new hotel experience!  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope to see you again on your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Easy walk to the park, yummy breakfast, and beautiful rooms! I definitely would be happy to stay here every time I come to enjoy the park! The room had everything we needed! Thank you again for a great weekend!
Manager Response: Dear Andrina S,  Thank you so much for your lovely review! I am so glad to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us. We have just remodeled our guest rooms so it is great to hear that you thought they were beautiful!   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience at our hotel with other travelers. We look forward to having you back to stay with us again and again for all of your visits to Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Clean, larger suite with two queens and a pull out couch that slept our family of 6 great! Very comfortable beds and linens.  Our teen boys liked the room divider to separate themselves and the pull out couch area giving them a mini suite.  Great selection at buffet breakfast - eggs, breakfast meats, waffle bar, fruit, juices, etc...Easy, comfortable 10 minute walk to Disneyland entrance. Family friendly restaurant on site, and several others on the walk to Disney.  Pool & spa are a bit small and close at 10 pm, but heated and clean and great after walking all day. Free wifi, free parking and super friendly and helpful staff make this a wonderful choice - we had a great time.
Manager Response: Dear Michmon6,  Thank you for your fantastic review! I am so glad to hear that you had a great time during your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff! I am so glad that they were able to provide your with excellent service during your stay.
