We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: For our Disneyland experience, we chose this hotel as it provided the amenities we were looking for as a family of 6 travelling together.   It offered 2 bedroom hotel rooms that it made it easy for the Grandparents to join us and give them some privacy.  My only small grip (and very minor), the rooms had an odd layout.   When you walk in, you immediately see a room with 2 queen beds with no windows, you then enter the bathroom which is the corridor to the next room with 2 queen beds and windows.  It would have been nice to have a sitting area to relax in but to be honest, we were so exhausted, we literally fell into the comfortable beds!  The hotel provides a wonderful continental hot breakfast which is included in your stay.  This was another feature that we were pretty set on
Manager Response: Hello LBesson,  Thank you for your great review. I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are pleased we could accommodate your family in one of our larger family suites. Thank you also for your compliments to our staff! They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and we hope you will visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: The rooms are very comfortable and close to Disney. Our room had a view of the fireworks :) I loved the separate area with the bunk beds. So nice to have 2 TVs so the kids could watch what they wanted in their own area. Loved the separate sink area.
Manager Response: Dear Anoopsterj,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you had a lovely stay with us. We do have a handful of kid suites at the hotel with a Disney fireworks view so I am pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy that during your visit.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and we hope to see you here again soon for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here with family , the rooms are nice sized with a clean kitchenette . Be warned though, no bus to Disney and it is only kind of walking distance.  With little ones you will look longingly at the bus from neighboring hotels. The breakfast is awful, we ate it once out of four days. The pool area is very small, no wading pool or deck area for kids. There are better choices for a Disney vacation
Manager Response: Dear Aunt H,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you found our rooms to be large in size and clean during your visit. I am sorry that Disneyland was too far to walk for your family. It is about a 10 minute walk from us and although we do not have a hotel shuttle, we do have a shuttle stop for the Anaheim Resort Transit, which takes you straight to Disneyland, right outside our hotel. We sell the tickets at the Front Desk for 1, 3 and 5 days. Hopefully that will be a better option for you next time rather than walking.   I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot buffet breakfast. We do currently include sausage, eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, ham, muffins, donuts, croissants, Danishes, oatmeal, yogurt, waffles, toast, English Muffins, and fresh fruit included in our breakfast, with some of those items rotating daily. We are always trying to improve our breakfast selections and introduce new options often so hopefully on your next visit you will be able to find something you enjoy.   Thank you for sharing your feedback of our hotel with other travelers. I am sorry that you had a less than stellar stay and I hope you will give us another chance on your next visit to Anaheim.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: GREAT stay for a group of 30!
Summary: The entire staff there at the hotel was wonderful…from check-in until the moment we left! Julie G. handled our group reservation and she was fantastic! Communication was excellent and timely and she worked hard to make sure we were accommodated in every way that was needed for a group our size. We got in very late (~2am) and were immediately greeted with keys and room assignments, making the whole process extremely fast and efficient, which was awesome since we were all ready to climb straight into bed and rest up before a marathon day in the Disney parks! We were there as a group, celebrating the retirement of a fellow teacher. Julie and the entire hotel staff made sure that our guest of honor was well taken care of and were flexible in making some last minute changes to our
Manager Response: Hi Anythng1ce,  Thank you for your wonderful review! We were so happy to have your group stay with us, you were a pleasure to have at the Desert Palms. I am so glad to hear that you had such a great stay with us. Julie is a great asset to our team and we love hearing your high praise for her!  We appreciate you sharing your groups experience here with other travelers and we hope that you are able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: We booked this hotel using Expedia.   We were looking for a suite with two bedrooms and a common area.  We were placed in a suite with two bedrooms with two bathrooms between the connecting bedrooms.  In other words the passage between the two bedrooms were the bathrooms.  This worked okay for us since we were family but would have preferred having a common area to visit.  However, the price via Expedia was good.  Only a bit over $200 before tax. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly.  There was adequate free parking and a breakfast came with the room plus wifi.  All this was good.   I should also mention that the hotel is walking distance close to the Disneyland entrance which was great for us.  About a 10 minute walk. One should know that not all elevators in the
Manager Response: Dear Skyloran,  Thank you for your great review. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for reporting the problem with your guest room door to the Front Desk. The best way for us to improve is through guest feedback. Maintenance was able to fix the lock on the door based on your feedback, I apologize if it was not done in a more timely manner during your visit.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We hope you will visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Staff was excellent, beds comfortable, and room very clean.  Grandpa, Grandma, Uncle and twin 5 year old boys made this our home for 5 days.  We stayed in a Yuha Kids Suite that had bunk beds. The suite is not huge but very doable. Breakfast was good with a changed in entrees daily lots of room to sit and was kept very clean.  Pool was not large but kids don't care they just  want to splash around.  About a 10-15 minute  easy walk to Disneyland and on the same side of the street so no crossing busy roads. McDonalds, 7/11, right by the hotel for a quick snack.
Manager Response: Dear Paul K,  Thank you for your great review. I am so glad to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. We were so happy to serve your during your stay.   We appreciate you sharing your experiences here with other travelers. We hope you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for your Disneyland experience!!
Summary: Our family stayed at the Desert Palms when we went to Disneyland and it was great!!  It is conveniently located and an easy walk to the park.  The hot breakfast is a great way to start the day.  The property was well maintained and clean.  The staff was super!!
Manager Response: Hi Wheetin,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks for your compliments to our free hot breakfast and to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I stayed one night for a business trip. Staff was extremely helpful. We stayed in a suite with full kitchen. The room was nice and clean. There is a restaurant located on site. Hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center as well as popular restaurants. They also offer a breakfast which we took advantage of. They do appear to be doing some remodeling but we did not hear any noise related to this as other guests have stated. We were on the 4th floor. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Toddssan,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so happy to hear that you had a great stay with us and our hotel services and amenities were satisfactory. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are indeed remodeling the hotel. I am glad that our remodel did not effect the quality of your stay, I hope you can visit again once we are finished.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Ok for just going to Disneyland (and being able to walk)
Summary: First of all, the staff here is excellent. BUT they are doing all kinds of remodeling right now, and if you end up on the 2nd floor (which has been remodeled), using an elevator during the hours of 7-5 is almost impossible. And frankly, even though that room was brand new, it didn't look much different than a room on the 5th that hadn't been remodeled.  Another good point was the bathroom mirror. It's really nice for applying make-up. On the bad side, when in a room on the 2nd floor, we heard pounding and carpet being ripped up at 7:30 am. We were getting up at that time, but if you have time to sleep in, ask where the construction is going on and ask for a room completely away from it.
Manager Response: Hello Carrie012,  Thank you for your review. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We are indeed remodeling our hotel right now, replacing everything in the room with modern and updated amenities. All furniture and carpets are changing and the color scheme has been updated. Not sure if you were in one of the newly remodeled rooms but they do look very different as far as what is in the room, the layout however has not changed. I do apologize for any inconvenience you encountered with the remodel during your visit and I hope you will visit again after our remodel is complete and you can fully enjoy the upgraded experience.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Family of 5, including 3 teenagers; we stayed at Desert Palms for 13 nights and although not a huge suite, we were comfortable and the location is very handy to Disneyland.  Also opposite new, large CVS pharmacy which is very convenient for food, drinks, toiletries, medications, etc you may need.  Close to many different restaurants and staff are very helpful.  Only real issue was shower which if the shower head wasn't in a certain position, water leaked onto the wall then the floor.
Manager Response: Dear Erino578,  Thank you for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found us to be conveniently located to Disneyland. We always try to provide the best for our guests and I am glad we were able to do so. I will definitely have someone check out the shower head in the room you occupied. I apologize for the problem you encountered with it. If you ever have a problem with anything in your room during a future stay please let us know and we would be very happy to help you however we can.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and we hope to see you again soon for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Always a great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: they have a number of different kinds of rooms and suites that offer lots of choices for families or groups. They offer a nice breakfast buffet with ample seating inside and outside.  The staff is friendly, professional and helpful. Whether we take the whole family or just the two of us, we love to stay at the Desert Palms.
Manager Response: Dear Peggy A,  Thank you for your excellent review! We are so glad that you had a wonderful stay with us once again! Thank you for your return visit. We appreciate your high rating and great feedback.  Thanks for sharing your experiences here with other travelers, we hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We had a Yuhu Suite which was smaller than what pictures show. The walls are paper thin and I could hear the man in the next room snoring. Lots of cheerleader, choir, dance groups so they are up early and noisy. You could here conversations through walls. The staff themselves were ok and the distance to Disneyland was good but unless you like to wake up early every day (5.30am) then this not the place for you.
Manager Response: Hello Karen2970,  Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear about the inconvenience you encountered during your visit. Our management has been informed and will reevaluate our offerings to better serve all future guests.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and we hope you will give us another chance on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This was our second stay at this property. This time it was only the wife and myself so we stayed in a Deluxe King room. This had a small sitting area separate to the bedroom, which we found very handy. The hotel is undergoing an upgrade while we were there, but this did not impact on our stay. Our room appeared to have been updated but the furniture was a little worse for wear, we noticed on the day we were leaving that workmen were bringing in new furniture into the building. Despite this, we found that the bed was very comfortable and could not fault the housekeeping. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to Disneyland but we chose to use the ATR buses to get there, the return stop is right outside Desert Palms.
Manager Response: Dear Sandgroper57,  Thank you for your excellent review! We appreciate you choosing The Desert Palms Hotel once again for your visit to Anaheim. I am so happy to hear you had another great stay with us. We are indeed replacing all of the furniture in our guest rooms with a new modern and updated look, I hope you will be able to visit again after we are finished with the remodel.   Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I stayed there with my two children ages 12 and 15 and our stay was very comfortable. The staff is very courteous and helpful. It is so convenient to have free parking because we were just able to come and go as we pleased without having to make any stops, plus parking was never hard to find. Also Disneyland is about half a block away and there are many restaurants at walking distance. I liked it a lot. Even though I saw a lot of families there was never too much noise.
Manager Response: Dear Dancinsh0es,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am so happy to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback of our hotel with other travelers. We hope to see you again soon on your next visit to Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary Heading: Pretty average for what is advertised.
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here because it was walking distance to Disneyland. They lobby is okay however when you reach the accommodation floors, they are quite outdated and require a revamp. To be brutally honest here, this hotel's buffet breakfast would have to be the worst I have ever experienced in my time of staying in hotels all over the world. Very limited choices, extremely bland, undercooked and highly processed. After the first time visiting the 'buffet' we chose to eat down the road at either Denny's or The Cheesecake Factory. If we return to Anaheim, we will be sure to choose a much nicer place to stay now that we know the layout.
Manager Response: Hello Fergo5,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not have an excellent stay with us. We are currently undergoing renovations to improve all of our guest rooms and common areas so I hope you will get the chance to visit us again after it's completion.   I am also sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot buffet breakfast. Our breakfast line up currently includes Sausage, potatoes, eggs, ham, biscuits and gravy, waffles, toast, oatmeal, english muffins, yogurt, cereal, fruit, danishes, muffins, coffee, and juice, with some of those items rotating daily. We do change our breakfast every few months with new items so I do hope that if you stay with us again you will be able to find something at the breakfast you enjoy.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and hope you will give us another chance on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel right in the centre of things!
Summary: Perfect spot for the family to set up for 2 weeks. Walking distance to Disneyland and tonnes of shopping malls nearby. Would defiantly go back again. Friendly staff and great free morning breakfast. Nice pools too :)
Manager Response: Dear Shauns_Travels,  Thank you for your great review! I am very glad to hear that you had a lovely long stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff and breakfast.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and can't wait to have you stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Not the Ritz, but for the price it was nice
Summary: We have stayed here twice. We have 7 kids and needed lots of space and wanted free parking and free breakfast. The rooms were nice and clean. The breakfast has lots of options, but nothing super healthy. The breakfast gets very crowded since lots of families stay here, but my kids were able to eat and it kept us full. The first time we stayed we got two connecting rooms and the second time we got a room with bunk beds and a pull out bed for the kids. Both were nice. I like that it is close to Disneyland and that we could walk to the park. I would stay here again to be able to stay for a budget price.
Manager Response: Dear Mindy G,  Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel for your visit to Anaheim once again. I am very glad to hear that you had another great stay with us. We are indeed not the Ritz, nor do we claim to be, but we are the perfect place for a family Disneyland Vacation, only about a 10 minute walk to the main gate. We are currently remodeling our hotel so we hope you can visit again after the completion in July to experience our all new offerings.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences at our hotel with other places and look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I stayed there in March 2016.  The rooms were clean.  Breakfast was your average hotel buffet.  Staff was helpful.  We parked in the underground parking and walked to Disneyland so that saved $18 per day!
Manager Response: Dear Mickeymaniac1,  Thank you for your great review! I am very glad to hear that you had good stay and you found our rooms to be clean and our staff helpful. We do offer free parking which as you mentioned in your review is a great way to save, by skipping the Disneyland parking, as Disney is only about a 10 minute walk from us.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences at our hotel with other travelers and hope to see you again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We booked the room as a family of 4 visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is a short walk to Disneyland so it served it's purpose.  The rooms are very large and comfortable.  Unfortunately the rooms are noisy.  The door handles are very noisy and you can hear it very loudly when other guests enter and exit their rooms.   The booking came  with breakfast but it was disappointing.  A cheap buffet with no healthy food.  I think I had orange juice and an apple.
Manager Response: Dear Greghare,  Thank you for your review. I am glad that you found our rooms to be large and comfortable and I apologize for any noise you experienced during your stay. We are currently remodeling our hotel so we will have maintenance check the door handles to make sure they are correctly installed. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free hot buffet breakfast. Our breakfast line up currently includes Sausage, potatoes, eggs, ham, biscuits and gravy, waffles, toast, oatmeal, english muffins, yogurt, cereal, fruit, danishes, muffins, coffee, and juice, with some of those items rotating daily. We do change our breakfast every few months with new items so I hope that on your next visit you will be able to find something at the breakfast you enjoy.  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope you will give us another chance on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We only stayed one night here to visit the Disney Oark but found it ideal. We had a comfortable room with twin double beds, and really nice bathroom. Breakfast was also just the ticket for us and there were plenty of restaurants nearby for dinner etc. It was only a 10 minute walk to Disney but there is a bus stop right outside. Would recommend to anyone visiting the area
Manager Response: Dear Weebanana,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I wish you could have had a longer stay with us, but I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed the night you were able to spend here. Thank you for your feedback on our guest rooms and breakfast.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and for recommending us!   We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We visited Desert Palms Hotels and Suites for the second time in early April.  As with our last stay this hotel continues to exceed expectations.  We felt welcome the moment we walked into the hotel and were made to feel right at home our entire stay.  All staff greet you with a smile and a warm greeting.  All staff should be recognized for their true commitment to providing true hospitality (something you don't see that often.  Clean rooms, excellent breakfast and polite front desk agents.  Must must also say that maintenance does an excellent job also as the property was well maintained and all items worked properly in our room.  We look forward to our next visit.  Keep up the great job!
Manager Response: Dear JD K,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! We were so glad to have you back as a repeat guest with us. It is wonderful to hear that you had another great stay with us. Thank you so much for your compliments to our staff! They are a great team and work hard to ensure all of our guests have fantastic stays.   We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Very clean and comfortable, roomy room.
Summary: We booked this hotel for the free parking and free breakfast buffet along with the proximity to Disneyland and it got higher ratings on cleanliness.  When we checked in we were upgraded to a suite.  The room was extremely clean and comfortable.  The free breakfast buffet wasn't great but the free parking and easy access to our car was appreciated.  The walk to Disneyland was longer than we expected but not bad.  This was a really great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear _johnphylliso,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am very glad they you enjoyed your upgraded room and convenient parking. We are about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland but we do also sell tickets for Disneyland's shuttle, the Anaheim Resort Transit for a low cost at the front desk. That might be a better option for you on your next visit.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay for our weekend getaway
Summary: We drive down for the weekend to enjoy the food and wine festival at Disneyland and stayed here. The room was spacious and clean.  We used points from one of our credit cards.We found the room rate to be reasonable as opposed to what other hotels were charging for the same if not more points. We would come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Dap1967,  Thank you for your awesome review! I hope you enjoyed your time at Disney's Food and Wine festival. I am very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and you found the price reasonable.   We appreciate your taking the time to share your feedback with other visitors and do look forward to seeing you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Good hotel, we stayed in a two queen with step down living area (must of been an upgrade because we only booked deluxe room) easy walk to Disney, good breakfast. There was some remodeling going on in our hallway. Overall a good choice for visiting the parks, would definitely recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Casey L,  Thank you for your great review! I am very glad we were able to upgrade your room for your stay and you were comfortable during your visit here. We are currently remodeling all of our guest rooms so I hope you will be able to come back again after its finished to experience the new hotel.  We appreciate you sharing your experiences here with other travelers and for recommending our hotel. We hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed one night and when we checked in they upgraded us to a suite. The room was very comfortable and it was a perfect walk to Disneyland. We were very happy with the room and the service; we would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Janice P,  Thank you so much for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your suite upgrade and you had a great stay with us. It is always great to get positive feedback from our guests so that we know we are on the right track. Hopefully next time we will be able to earn a 5 star rating from your stay!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and look forward to seeing you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great hotel that's right behind Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for four nights in a suite. The room was a really good size. The separate kids area was great. There was plenty of room with a king bed in the main room, a bunk bed and a sofa bed. There was a good assortment of food in the breakfast area- eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereals, waffles, breads. Having free parking was also a great benefit.
Manager Response: Dear VADisneyFan,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and you enjoyed your suite and our free breakfast and parking.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with others and hope you can stay with us again soon!   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Stayed here a few times in the past. The rooms were very nice with plenty of space. The seperate step down area with coich and TV are a real nice touch. The morning breakfast was not half bad. Good walking distance to Disney parks and food.
Manager Response: Dear OrlandoTravelingFam,  Thank you so much for your great review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for coming back to stay with us for your visits to Anaheim!  We really appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights for spring break.  We stayed in one of 2 bedroom/2 bath suites (Kalahari Suite room 429).  Right after we checked in, when my dad turned on the tv in the room closest to the door, the tv in our room (closest to the window), wouldn't get any of the channels listed on the channel list.  It was like they didn't see the dish/cable hookup.  I went down to the front desk and told them and they said they would send maintenance up to look at it.  It ended up after about an hour of working with it that the splitter in the front room needed "resplitting".  After that it would work on all the channels except about 4 when the tv in the other room was on the certain 4 channels would "pixel" out.  (One thing, make sure that you have the same brand of remote that
Manager Response: Dear Germ539,  Thank you so much for your detailed review of your stay with us! We love that you took the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. I apologize for the trouble you encountered with the TV in room and we do appreciate you letting us know.   We do offer free parking at the hotel, and we charge a daily resort fee of $9.95 per night plus tax for the city of Anaheim, which is included in your total if you book directly with us, and is listed as an additional fee if you book with a 3rd party company. It is not a parking fee as every guest is charged the resort fee regardless of whether they have a vehicle or not. I apologize for any miscommunication regarding the resort fee.   Thank you very much for sharing your feedback and we hope you will be able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay at. Very close to Disneyland. Although a little further than my parents would have liked to walk. The housekeeper's do an amazing job keeping the rooms clean around you. The breakfast was fantastic they did a great job mixing it up from day to day so it didn't feel like you were eating the same thing everyday . Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who was staying in Anaheim for their vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer P,  Thank you so much for your fantastic review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our housekeeping staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am also glad that you enjoyed our buffet breakfast, we do try to mix it up from day to day.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: We have stayed here multiple times over the past 5 years - most recently in January 2016.  I have never had a bad experience staying here.  It is our go to hotel.  I enjoy that the corridors are inside as opposed to the other hotels near Disneyland - it makes me feel a bit safer.  The hotel is clean and the people are always friendly - from the front desk, maintenance people, breakfast room staff, and custodial staff - everyone is friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Dawn P,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We do appreciate you choosing us as your go to hotel in Anaheim. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, we are so happy to serve you!  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and can't wait to see you again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland but tired and dark rooms
Summary: Only the rooms on the top floor have any sunlight. Mine was like a cave and would have been claustrophobic for a family despite having room to sleep 5 people. I was alone and the room felt cramped. The bathroom was recently renovated and nice. But the furniture, bed and linens need to be refreshed.
Manager Response: Dear Jamie92014,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your guest room during your recent stay with us. We are currently remodeling all of our guest rooms, as you saw the bathroom in your suite was already completed. Our remodel of all guest rooms will finish this summer.   We do hope you will give us another chance on your next visit to Anaheim!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: WE stayed at this hotel for a recent Disney visit.  The breakfast while free is anything but delicious.  The rooms are OK and the bathroom is pretty nice.  I guess it's an OK value for it's close proximity to Disney but beware of the hidden cost of parking and room taxes and so on.  Parking was a nightmare.
Manager Response: Dear Nonnie30,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not have an excellent stay on your last visit with us. We appreciate your feedback as it helps us to improve for all of our guests. We do have free parking and do not charge guests to park their vehicles at the hotel. We are, by law, obligated to charge State and City Tax on hotel rooms and do include this information at the time of booking. I apologize for any confusion you may have had with your bill. Please contact a customer service representative if you have any questions about your stay.  We do hope you will give us another try on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: We wanted a hotel close to Disneyland with free parking, rooms that would accomodate our family of 6 in one room and that offered a free breakfast. Oh...and a pool for the kids. We found that in the Desert Palms. The rooms were great as a home base to re-charge and rest between 12 hour days at Disney. The breakfast was good but not great, but it was much better than what we have had at other hotels that offer a free breakfast. It's a hot breakfast with cold choices if you prefer. The pool area was nice and well maintained and the staff were very friendly and responsive. The walk to Disney was just about 10 minutes and the free parking on site was a fabulous perk. We had been told to ask for a room at the back of the hotel away from Katella Ave. to cut down on the noise. We did

Summary Heading: Great location to a great price!
Summary: Stayed here last weekend... We had planned a day at Disneyland and then to do some sightseeing. We really enjoyed our stay - the room was spacious and the beds comfy. We loved having the heated pool and that both breakfast and parking was included! Also, perfect location  if visiting the parks - just a short walk!

My employer felt worried about this place but I'd definatley request we stay here again. Things looked fairly new and modern. Everything was clean. I felt safe. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Pool was small as was the gym, but I didn't have time for either of these things. There's a restaurant on site which is nice, but I didn't eat there due to business obligations. Really close to Disneyland and the convention center.

Summary Heading: great place good for family and clean, walk distance to everything
Summary: this hotel is great for family and walk distance to everything. if i get a chance to go back to Anaheim I would definitely stay to this place. great place to stay walk distance to food and disneyland and California adventure

Nice hotel with a very good location to Disneyland Park, works very well for a large or small group. Rooms are spacious with different layouts to choose from staff is very friendly. Nice outdoor seating option for breakfast. Overall very good experience!

Summary Heading: Worst Stay we have ever had
Summary: Starting with the thin, rock hard, springy mattress, we already knew we were in for a rough night. Then we had a handful of teenage girls from a tour group running up and down the hall screaming all night. Staff was very unattentive to the issues as well. Unfortunately we still have another night to go. At this point we are actually giving strong consideration to eating the money loss and going to the Double tree to finish our trip.

Eight of us from my company recently stayed here for a convention.  It is a simple hotel that is currently renovating many of the rooms.   We like the hotel because it is within walking distance to the convention center and the staff is very nice and helpful.

We recently stayed at the Desert Palms for a family trip to Disneyland. Staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Breakfast is hot & a great start to a long day in the park. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk and close to CVS pharmacy. Our hotel room was clean and housekeeping did an amazing job cleaning it up everyday. Kids loved the pool. They have fruit water in the lobby, which is always nice to have after a long day of walking.   My only complaints are the shower in the room was terrible. We couldn't figure out how to fix the shower head. We also like to sleep cold, the room wouldn't go any cooler than 69 degrees (for some people that might be fine) and due to construction the hotel room we were in was quite noisy. That was very frustrating considering we had a toddler who
Manager Response: Hello Lhenman,  Thank you for your review! I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our staff was friendly and welcoming. I do apologize for the inconveniences you encountered in your room and will definitely have maintenance service the shower head. Please feel free to contact the Front Desk if you ever have a problem with anything in your room during future stays as we have maintenance staff on hand 24/7 to make sure everything in your room is operating properly.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and look forward to seeing you here again for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean and a great value
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel a minimum of a half dozen times and I haven't been disappointed yet. This particular visit was just for my husband and I to visit Disneyland without the kids. We keep coming back to this hotel for its convenient walk to Disneyland and free hot breakfast. We don't mind the walk, which is only about 10 minutes to the Disneyland property. Additionally, breakfast is ready when we are. No trying to get a table at a restaurant and wasting time waiting for food prep. The food is great and offers a wide selection and takes the guesswork out of "what's for breakfast?"  We get a filling first meal of the day and can head to our destination with full bellies. The pricing is reasonable and the property and rooms are always clean and well-kept. I feel confident
Manager Response: Dear Jeanine,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! I am so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us again. We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your visits to Anaheim.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers. We look forward to seeing you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here while travelling with a dance group. I have stayed in the area many times before, but this was the first time to this hotel. Our check in was quick and painless. The front desk staff was both efficient and very pleasant. All of our group were roomed within close proximity of one another. Very nice! I had phoned ahead to make arrangements to have a birthday bouquet of flowers delivered to a friends room at 7am the following morning, They were delivered to her room promptly and with a smile. Greatly appreciated! The breakfast room is quite large and seats a fair number of guests, as does the outdoor eating area. The breakfast is definitely one of the better ones, with something for everyone, and the staff is very good about keeping it well stocked. It was nice to
Manager Response: Dear Penny G,  Thank you for your review. I am very glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. I apologize for the condition of your room during your stay. We are currently remodeling all of our guest rooms with all new furniture, carpeting, and new bathrooms. Since you did have a great experience with other aspects of the hotel do hope that you will give us another chance on your next visit.  We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with other travelers and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: It was ok but we'll stay somewhere else next time.
Summary: Check in was easy.  Room was poor for something called a  "suite". The dresser was straight out of the 70's with all the lumps to prove it.  Air conditioner didn't work.  I went down at 3 in the morning to ask to be moved or have it fixed.  Stopped the next day at the desk and said the repair man was in at 8 am and said it worked fine....  We were in the room until 9:30.  Breakfast is a disaster.  They don't let you eat outside but 1 day a week and the hostess was a total wretch.  Yes we were there a week....  The laundry is disgusting.  The washers need updated and they smell.  You CAN NOT see the Disney fireworks from the balcony.  Plus they don't open the balcony except for that 1 day for breakfast.  Yes we were there a week. The beds, pillows, and pull out couch are
Manager Response: Hello Stacie O,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel. We are currently undergoing a renovation which will be completed in July. As you correctly stated unfortunately guests are unable to see the fireworks from our breakfast room patio as the Tower of Terror at California Adventure blocks the view. We appreciate your comments as they help us to improve our quality standard and service.   We hope you will give us another try on your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Decent place to stay very accomodating & helpful. Didn't like their kitchen equipped rooms prefered the family room with bunk beds. Hotel is old and needs a renovation. Breakfast was lovely. Laundry room needs new machines. On the good side it was very close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello Jezysou,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are currently undergoing renovations and all rooms will be completed by July.  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. We hope that you will be able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: This hotel hits a home run!
Summary: We were extremely pleased with all the amenities this hotel offers: the location is a 10 min. walk from Disneyland, the rooms are very comfortable and clean, and the service was great! we stayed in a family suite that sleeps eight people comfortably for a very competitive price. It also has a wonderful breakfast consisting of omlettes, biscuits & gravy, yummy hash browns, waffles, plus all the regular items. I was impressed that whomever made the room assignments ACTUALLY looked at the requests and noted that we had asked for a quiet room on the top floor, and that was exactly what we got: our room (#562) was one of only two rooms on the top floor and faced the back parking lot, away from both boulevards. Even though it was near the breakfast room we never heard a thing-- it was
Manager Response: Dear Judy P,  Thank you so much for your great review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We do indeed have free parking for one vehicle per room, if our guests happen to have a second vehicle we will either allow them to park the additional vehicle with us as well, if we have enough availability, or refer them to an offsite place to park. I am glad that we were able to accommodate both of your vehicles during your stay.  We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience at our hotel with other travelers and we look forward to having you stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Amazing value and fantastic location for Disneyland.
Summary: I booked this hotel through Hotwire, thinking it was going to be a Holiday Inn. I couldn't be happier I stayed at the Desert Palms. The staff were amazing, always friendly and helpful at every moment. The buffet breakfast was also surprisingly great. The hotel has free parking, and is only a 8 minute walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. We had a very spacious suite that included a TV area and a kitchen, it could have slept 4 comfortably (it was just the 2 of us). The pool area wasn't great, it's in the courtyard area of the hotel and surrounded all around by the hotel so there is very little sun in the afternoon, and the hot tub didn't look all that clean but that's honestly the only negative comments I could share about this hotel. If you're going to Disneyland, it's
Manager Response: Hello vancity_bc_2010,  Thank you so much for your fantastic review! I am so glad to hear that you were pleasantly surprised by your stay at our hotel. Thanks for your compliments to our staff. They always appreciate the positive feedback for exemplary customer service. I apologize if you found the hot tub to appear uncleanly. Our maintenance staff cleans our pool area every morning before opening. I will definitely make sure they double check the hot tub to continue to uphold our high cleanliness standards at the hotel.  We very much appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers and hope you can stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I have stayed here twice while vacationing at Disneyland. I decided to give it a try since the price was so much cheaper than other hotels around. I was scared it might be a "you get what you pay for" place, but definitely not! The hotel was a very short walk to Disneyland, the breakfast was much better than most and offered a lot of options, the rooms were very clean and the decor was updated. Parking was included, which is rare to find, and the hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. The second time I stayed they even upgraded my room when I had already got a great deal through Groupon! I will definitely be making this my go to every time I'm in town!
Manager Response: Hello Malloree O,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. I am so glad that you enjoyed your upgraded room. We always try to give our returning guests room upgrades, if they are available on the day of arrival, as a thank you for visiting us again.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here during our visit to Disneyland.  Our room was clean, spacious, and quiet.  The breakfast (which is included in your stay) is just what you need to start your! They have fruit, cereal, waffles, and coffee... we were not expecting eggs benedict!  The staff is very friendly as well.  After researching all the hotels near disney, this meets all of your needs.  Free parking, free breakfast, short walk to the parks, clean and comfy!
Manager Response: Hello Hollie G,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and our hotel amenities and services were perfect to fit your needs.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here with other travelers and hope you can visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Couldn't ask for much closer to the Park than the Desert Palms.  Comfortable rooms ( two queen size beds in each room for us) , friendly service through out the hotel and a free breakfast as well.  Staff were very accommodating. We asked for an early check in and they were able to provide a great spot for us.  Spacious eating area with both inside and outside eating for breakfast. Did I mention free parking???
Manager Response: Hello Minerva49,  Thank you so much for your great review! I am so glad to hear that our hotel was a great place for your family's Disneyland Vacation.   We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with other travelers and hope you are able to visit us again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This hotel was very close to disney land, but getting correct information about bus service from the front desk was hit and miss. Breakfast brunch was adequate but nothing special.  Housekeeping forgot to give us coffee, and hand towels... front desk did not apologize for this.  Lots of kids, so noise level was kind of high.  All in all it was an okay choice.  The "heated" pool was very cold.
Manager Response: Hello Charley R,  Thank you very much for your review. I am sorry to hear about the substandard level of service you received from our Front Desk staff. Please know that this is not our usual standard of service we expect to be delivered to our guests and we will be hosting a staff meeting to review and reinforce customer service policies.   We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your experience so we can continue to improve and provide excellent service for all of our guests.   I hope that you will consider giving us another chance on your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland with Free Parking
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here.  It is set up nicely to be a comfortable stay while you enjoy Disneyland.  We liked that we didn't have to pay for parking (hopefully that is still true as you read this). We enjoyed the breakfast and filled up before walking to the park.  In the evening the park closed earlier, the kids liked the swimming pool.    We walked to and from the park but there appears to be a shuttle for anyone who might have tired legs and feet at the end of the day.
Manager Response: Hello Jared S.  Thank you so much for your great review. I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are a comfortable walking distance from the park but for anyone that needs it we do sell tickets for Disneyland's shuttle that stops right outside our hotel.   We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences at the hotel with other travelers and we hope you are able to visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Being a Disney annual pass holder have been staying in several hotels and by far Desert Palms is the best one I have no complaints everything was on point from registration room and breakfast and also the location close to Disneyland highly recommended
Manager Response: Hello 0audrey1,  Thank you so much for your outstanding review. I am so glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and that we are the best hotel nearby Disney that you have experienced. Thank you very much for that high compliment.   We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers and can't wait to see you again for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: The room was nice and the bath was big. We were quickly moved off third floor, bad air quality because from bath rono's.   The new room was ready and we moved without a problem.  The biggest problem is the so called breakfast.  I know it's free and not to expect much, but I did expect food that looked or tasted like breakfast.  2nd day we went elsewhere.  Sat. AM we tried again (they have higher room rates on weekends). Not much had changed.  The lobby is large and nicely decorated.
Manager Response: Hello mrd102,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free buffet breakfast. We appreciate all guest feedback as it helps us to further improve our quality standard and service.  Thank you for sharing your experience with other travelers and we hope to see you again for your next visit to Anaheim.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I was at ANOTHER convention, which is always tiring & full of unpleasantness, staying at this property made all of that better. Close to the convention, EASY to access & NICE rooms don't always come with staff this pleasant! You owe it to yourself to stay at this great property.
Manager Response: Hello DM69769,  Thank you for your excellent review of our hotel! I am so glad that you were able to improve your convention experience by staying with us. We appreciate your compliments to our staff and our guest rooms.   Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with other travelers. We hope to see you again the next time your convention is in town... or better yet on your next vacation!   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Desert Palms is where we stay for all of our Disney travel trips. It's close to the parks, (about a 7 minute walk), and it's always clean and comfy to come "home" to at the end of a long day. There's plenty of room to spread out in the suites, which is nice so the little one who wants to run around with her toys, while not being totally in mom's way. The breakfast is delicious, and the fruit water in the lobby is always fun, too! We've stayed here many times, and we will stay here many more!
Manager Response: Hello Eandds,  Thank you for your wonderful review. We so very appreciate you choosing our hotel for your Disneyland Vacations and are proud to be called your home away from home during your stays.   Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experiences here with other travelers.  We can't wait to see you again for your next stay!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Stayed here with a group of young basketballs on a tour and the staff were sensational catering for a large group, the rooms were clean and spacious and the location was superb. I would not hesitate to recommend the Desert Palms.

Within 5 minutes, I knew I was in trouble.  Even though I had a written confirmation in hand, the front desk staff told m plus a manager, for them to figure out that we DID have a reservation for 8 days!   Next issue was the noise in the room directly above us.  It was reported to management every single night, sometimes twice, and was never resolved in 8 days.  If you decide to stay here, DO NOT stay anywhere but the top floor so that no one is above you.  There is absolutely NO soundproofing in this hotel.  We were there on business and needed quiet at night so we could work and then sleep. Our room on the second floor took 2 different elevators to get to breakfast, which was annoying.  Breakfast was decent, but you could tell they used leftovers from one day to the next.

Summary Heading: Lovely stay at the Desert Palms
Summary: Attended CHA in Anaheim and stayed at the Desert Palms for the first time.  Plenty of free parking in the garage below the building, great breakfast every morning, a very reasonable rate per night, and a friendly, happy staff made it a great stay.

Close enough to Disney by foot roughly a ten minute walk, hotel was clean in appearance and service at desk was good and professional by staff. Hard to fault, had a 2 bedroom suite that gave kids their own beds but was quite cramped not a great deal of room to move around. Breakfast wasn't good. Certainly not fresh and healthy and with many families as expected sharing the room it certainly was noisy and was well compared to a school camp eating experience frenzy. Parking was good and secure. The walk to Disney was safe once you passed the homeless at the bus stop outside the 7/11. Just felt it lacked atmosphere and class. Although the service was good at the front desk the entire hotel seemed like a holiday camp location with lots of families and simple pleasant service without

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but not great
Summary: I was expecting the same level of cleanliness/room decor/space as an Embassy Suites/Residence Inn or something of that ilk. What we got was a tiny, depressing room with terrible lighting, scuffed walls, old bathroom, hard beds (I got a rash!), no space for my kids' suitcases in their hovel of a side room (it felt and looked like a jail cell/no joke) and an OK breakfast. The only reason I didn't freak out and move us is that it was December at Disneyland (too many people!) and the fact that we literally only slept in the room. That said, we would have liked to take a break during our long 10+ hour days - but this is NOT the hotel to do that. It is also very LOUD - you hear everything. The restaurant on site is terrible - slow service and makes Denny's look like 4 star dining. I

We stayed 6 days and 5 nights and was a great experience.  Everyone was very nice and we felt welcomed.  It is  close to Disneyland so we did not had to wait for buses since it was closed enough, we walked.  My family will definitely stay here every time we visit Anaheim/Disneyland.

Summary Heading: For what you pay, you really can't complain.
Summary: We chose to stay at Desert Palms based on 1) Price, 2) Facilities and 3) Location.   We had one of the rooms with the full kitchen.  We didn't actually cook, but it was great to have plates, cups etc and be able to wash them up in a proper kitchen sink.  The room was fine, the beds were comfy and overall it was quite spacious.  My only complaint would be the shower, it was terrible (I didn't complain because I didn't want to change rooms, the other benefits of the room we had far outweighed the shower issue).  House keeping did a great job, our room was always spotless after their visit.  For the price we paid we were satisfied, we knew we would spend every spare moment at the Disney parks, which we did, so we didn't see the point spending a fortune on a higher standard

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Close to Disneyland at a Reasonable Price!
Summary: We had been planning our Disneyland vacation since the Spring of 2015, so we did our research, booked early and saved. I was very pleased with our hotel choice! There were 11 of us (2 families with a total of 5 kids plus the grandparents) so we got 3 separate rooms and stayed for a total of 5 nights. Our room was conveniently joined with the grandparents, so we could open the door between us and have access to both rooms. The rooms were clean, comfy and presentable, the maid service came every day, the lobby is big and inviting, the staff were friendly and helpful, the pool/jacuzzi area is located outdoors in the center of the hotel and it was a bit small, but it was still nice and the kids loved it! There's a cute little gift shop in the lobby that has better prices than

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but I've stayed in a lot better hotels
Summary: We booked a family room to fit two adults and three teenage kids. It was meant to be two rooms, but with a noisy glass door between the two rooms, there was no privacy at all, and the second room was tiny, leaving no room for suit cases on the floor.  The first room they gave us smelt so bad that we requested a room change, which they happily allowed. I'm not sure what the smell was, but we couldn't put up with it.  The second room was clean and the cleaning staff were good, but five nights in the hotel was more than enough. Granted, we were at Disneyland most of the time, but there was no space in the room to do anything but shower or sleep.  The rate includes breakfast which is handy, but the food choices are limited. Two toasters for the whole hotel is inadequate,

The soundproofing is terrible as other reviewers have mentioned.  I even asked for a quiet room and they put a screaming toddler in the room next to us.  We had to use the heater as it got very cold at night and our room smelled like something was burning and the smoke alarm went off in the middle of the night.  I wanted to be compensated for this for the cost of our room for that night and was told "no" even after speaking to management.  We did get some $ off but not the entire night which I think is unacceptable.  Hot breakfast is decent, nice way to save some money and time. Rooms are a bit tired, carpets are in need of changing, as is the furniture.  Good location but maybe worth a few extra $$ to stay somewhere nicer?

Summary Heading: Not ADA Friendly & Beware of Bed Bugs
Summary: This was the 1st time staying here. As I had a scooter I immediately  noticed there was no access to open the doors to go in or out of the hotel. Even knocking on the door the clerk looked at me but wouldn't  come to open the door so I could get inside. Fortunately another guest came and opened the door.   The lobby was large and clean. There were plenty of luggage carts. Parking is underground so someone would need to get out and meet you if you wanted to use it. There are elevators which is nice.  The pool is small for the capacity of guests but nice. Lots of lounge chairs.  The room we had was a king bed, bunk beds, and a sofa sleeper. The room was ok. A little small. No room to walk between the bunk beds and sofa sleeper when pulled out into a bed. It had a clear door  so

We've stayed at many of the hotels around Disneyland and haven't been too impressed with some of them. The Desert Palms however, really did impress me. It wasn't anything fancy, but it was clean, comfortable, and had all the amenities we needed.   Pros:  -Free parking!!! Parking is very difficult around the Disneyland Resort area, and often it costs money even with a hotel stay. Even the Hilton across the street charges a nightly parking fee.  -Breakfast! They had plenty of options including hot foods, and a fun patio to eat where you can see California Adventure. It wasn't cooked to order or anything, but it was decent, filling, and free. -Location is excellent. It is an easy walk to the entrance to Disney as well as an easy walk to the Convention Center if you're there for a

Not my ideal stay but was close to Disneyland. No insulation in the rooms could hear everything in the next room and in the halls. They started to vacuum and clean rooms at 6:30 in the morning. They were doing construction which also started that early. No sleeping in. The convenience store next door was a little scary, people hanging out at the bus stop were smoking pot and sleeping on the benches, and there was human feces on the sidewalk next to it. The employees were very nice and helpful. The air conditioning did not make it through it the adjoining room so one room was freezing and the other was hot.

So I did a ton of research on this hotel. Found many positive reviews and many negative reviews. To the point I almost switched hotels. But I kept it, and was glad I did. We had a good experience. Our flight was an early flight and we wanted in early. But our room wasn't ready until closer to 3. Which is when they are due to be ready. So that's understandable. After checking in I notice we got upgraded from a double bed room to a kids suite with bunk beds. This was awesome as it was me and my two boys. The one negative about that room is the ac unit. I like to sleep colder and like the sound of the ac running. (I sleep with a fan every night) so I was disappointed when the air all blew in the kid's room. And it was a ac unit that went off and on to stay at a certain temp. I

This place is horrendous! We booked here because the obvious.... Walking distance to the parks and from the pics it looks great. The rooms are average, but appeared to be clean. However you better hope you are getting up by 0630 and getting ready to go to the parks because you will hear everyone on your floor going in and out and walking up and down the hallway. Zero noise proofing.  The breakfast.... Well of course it is free because I do not think they could legally charge for it and call it food. My five year old said on the last morning "Let's go up stairs and eat breakfast where the stinky food is!" Ha! He can't even be fooled. The scarier part is that everyone there seemed to be accepting of the horrible food. Like it's a given to pay $209-253/night and eat crap.  The

Summary Heading: good place to stay for disney park
Summary: good location, very close to Disney park. We got a deal with Groupon. It will save you parking cost for Disney park. A lots of kids could cause noise above/next to your room. Nice thing about this place is that small kids in the family could come back from Disney for nap and return for the afternoon/night activities.

We had a package deal with Disneyland and I chose this hotel and was very happy with my choice.  Room was clean, bathroom clean, lobby clean.  I liked the room set up with the door separating the two rooms and a tv in the kids bunk room they could watch from their bed.  It was also very close to disneyland and several restaurants,  Never need a car the four days we were there and if I went aging with two kid would pick this hotel again in an instant.

Walking distance to Disneyland and California park, and many restaurants,   we had a lovely suite, very family friendly. Breakfast provided in the main dining room. Our suite was nice and quite, towards the back of the complex.

We made this reservation using Groupon and were VERY satisfied.  Sure, the hotel is dated, but it was immaculate and you cannot beat the location.  When we checked in, we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with a king bed and a kitchen.   The breakfast was great and they changed it slightly every morning so there was always something new.  The mini waffles were fantastic!  Our only complaint was the taste of the water, but I expect that's beyond the hotel's control.  It would have been nice to have faster wi-fi, but a slow connection is to be expected in a high density hotel.  If you don't need a 4 star experience with a soaker tub, this hotel should definitely be on your list.

Walking distance to Disneyland. We had a nice suite even with only two of us, we had two queen beds, an additional room with bunk beds, a sofa, tv, kids table and chairs!  Very nice breakfast buffet, ate three mornings slight variation each day. Nice pool and hot tub. Will stay again! Could not  see fireworks

How this place is rated so well is bewildering. This property has seen better days. They do a nice job presenting it on their website, but it falls way short in reality. The location and breakfast are great. It is a short walk to Disney with the kids, but the walls, furniture, tile, wallpaper, amenities etc. are beat to heck. The walls are thin and you can hear every kid running down the hall upstairs and every door slam. We even changed rooms and it was still noisy and run down. The new room didn't even have toilet paper and there was an old apple that was frozen to the shelf inside the mini fridge. The front desk never even managed to send up any more toilet paper either. Good thing we snagged some from our old room. The hair dryer didn't work. One of the remotes wouldn't turn

Summary Heading: Close to the park with breakfast in the morning... Meets the basics for the family holiday without many frills
Summary: Our family of 4 (two adults and two young kids) stayed at the Desert Palms. The hotel has separate kids rooms with bunks and a doors to allow for quiet nap time and early bed times. This was a positive and there was breakfast every morning with a mix of warm and cold options. It was a carb load but had eggs and fresh fruit and yogurt which was a plus..  So the positives: Only a 7-10 minute walk from the park The disney express from the airport and ART stopped close by There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and it was close to pick up wine or beer. There are  separate kiddie room with bunk beds and tv was great to allow some space during bed times. There was breakfast with hot options and the room had a fridge and microwave The restaurant (the sand box) was a
Manager Response: Hello Aaron M,  Thank you for your review of the Desert Palms Hotel. I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We have updated our TV Channel listings and starting last week we offer kids channels as well as many others. I am sorry to hear about your experiences with the Front Desk staff, Management has been informed and the appropriate action will be taken to make sure every guest receives outstanding service from all agents. We appreciate you letting us know.   Thank you for your compliments to our Sandbox Bar and Grille and our Server Russ! Russ has been with us for many years and is a great member of our team and we will definitely pass your compliments onto him and his manager.   We hope you are able to visit again soon and experience our usual high level of hospitality and customer service.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland with free breakfast buffet
Summary: Desert Palms is located within walking distance to Disneyland (however its still 3/4-1 mile to front entry gate).  Rooms are small but are clean & updated, beds comfy, with fridge & microwave.  Baths are small but again has been updated & is clean, towels are good, shower pressure is bad, very low pressure.  Breakfast was great, hot waffles, eggs, sausage/ham/bacon (meat changes daily), donuts, yogurt, apples, oranges, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, apple & orange juice: Breakfast was a great start to day!  Didn't use pool but it is outdoor (sort of) with hotel rooms surrounding it in a courtyard, slightly odd & small.  Staff was super friendly.  Wifi was terrible.  Hotel offered what I was looking for in hotel, walking distance to Disney, free breakfast & fridge however just an
Manager Response: Hello JMMcLaughlin4,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am very glad to hear that you had a great stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are great team and we are lucky to have them. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences with other travelers.   We hope you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Probably good for most families visiting Disney
Summary: Clean hotel within walking distance of Disney. Works well for just visiting Disneyland. Pool is simple but works for kids. Free breakfast does it job but isn't great. Oddly, the bunk beds are in the room portion of the suite and the king bed is in the common area portion and that the bedroom door locks from the outside (I.e., you can lock your kids in their room—how the fire marshal allows this, who knows). I wouldn't stay here here if it wasn't close to Disney but for a Disney visit it totally works well.
Manager Response: Hello NathanSeattle,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I am very glad to hear that we were a great place to stay for your Disneyland vacation. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Me and my family have stayed here during our last two Disneyland vacations. Sep '14 & '15. It is clean, pretty basic but definitely nice enough for a trip where you really are going to primarily be at the park.   Check ins both times were quick and easy- we did have an incident with our plumbing one night but the staff quickly made other room arrangements for us at our request. It was really odd- there was some sort of blockage in our sink plumbing. Not really anyone's fault though I guess.   Distance to the park is a real perk, quick 7-10 mins. Close to a 7-11 and CVS , lots of eating options around as well.   They have a free buffet style breakfast with basic options- my kids like the fresh waffles. Good way to carb-up before a big day at the park, haha! My wife loves the
Manager Response: Hello Michael N,  Thank you for your review. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your second stay with us. Thank you for choosing us for your visits to Anaheim. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers!  Hope to see you again soon for your third visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I give this hotel 3 1/2 stars.  The greatest selling point is its convenient proximity to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center.  As a hotel, it is about average.  Breakfast is included in the room price, but you get what you pay for: breakfast was greatly lacking, with eggs apparently made from a powder, and cheap options taken at every opportunity.  They have a very small pool, which might disappoint the legions of kids who stay here.  It was sometimes noisy late at night or early in the morning, due to the legions of children who stay here for the Disney parks.  It is an easy walk to Disneyland/California Adventure--I'd say about half a mile.
Manager Response: Hello RebelVirginia,  Thank you for your feedback. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate you taking time to share your experience with other travelers.   We hope you will come back and visit us again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: 3.5 rating. Great location & room options but not a "Resort"
Summary: I waffled between giving facility a 3 or 4. I think the 4 over-sells it but the 3 seemed punitive since we did enjoy our stay overall. Liked: Stayed in bunk bed room – having separate bedroom area for the kids was a life saver and everyone slept in; Room was clean and there was no noise problem; some hot breakfast options with waffle makers, eggs, potatoes - I did not care for the piles of food but kids happily ate it; hotel is in easy walking distance of Disneyland and several restaurants like Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, Dennys, etc. Front desk service was always pleasant.  Didn't like:  Tiny cramped pool area and hot tub for such a large facility; A daily "resort fee"charge- having a scavenger hunt and crafts available for young kids does not make you a "resort";  lots of
Manager Response: Hello Travelingfatcat,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your feedback regarding our free breakfast. We always appreciate our guests letting us know how we can improve as we strive to offer the best quality standard and service.   We hope you are able to stay with us again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Read the reviews. Was nervous about; noise, cleanliness, safe being robbed, being outdated and poor customer service. Having read some of the reviews we cancelled then decided to re-book. Glad we did!!!!   What we got was very modern, extremely clean, very quiet and very safe - just very impressed given that we usually stay at 5 star hotels (better than the Beverley Hilton we stayed at prior). However, we did get a call from reception at 6.30am telling us to pipe down (my 4 year old was quite loud apparently - whoops!).   We were on the fourth floor by memory. Had a room with a bunk for my four year old and a separate areas for myself and my wife to sleep. We overlooked the car park and had a great view from our balcony of the fireworks. Wifi was great!   Free and easy parking.
Manager Response: Hello Justin jt j,  Thank you for your excellent review. I am so glad to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you very much for your comparisons to other hotels you have stayed at. Being compared to the Beverley Hilton is certainly high praise.   We thank you for your stay with us and hope that you are able to visit again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This place was so close to Disneyland, and the staff was very helpful.  Upon arrival, they initially gave us a room too close to the elevator, and when I asked for a different room they upgraded us to a suite!!!  It was so comforting especially after the long days at the park.  On the second night, we were even able to enjoy the fireworks from the room.  The only thing is that the restrooms probably need to be updated, but other than that it was a great room.  Even the breakfast was amazing.
Manager Response: Hello Teresa O,  Thank you for your wonderful review. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your suite upgrade. We actually are renovating all of our rooms including a wonderful new bathroom design which I am sure you and your family will love. We hope that you will come and stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Hotel was great, rooms good size, wonderful breakfast, great pool and very helpful staff.  Could be a little noisy if full of kids but the rooms are set up for them so works great for families.  Very close walk to Disneyland
Manager Response: Hello Bailey340,  Thank you for your great review. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, they are a great team and we are lucky to have them. I am also glad to hear that your room layout worked out great for your family.  We hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Located within a few hundred feet of both Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center the hotel is superbly located. The rooms are spacious and appropriate for a 3 star hotel. The workout room is modest (but it's California, go run outside) and the pool is at least inside and has adequate towels. Best is the excellent breakfast included with both hot and cold choices including eggs and some breakfast meat as well as make your self waffles. Desk staff were under-trained to handle changes. Upon arrival I explained that I was extending my stay for day. Alas, on the last day my key no longer worked, I needed to pay and rebook an additional day.
Manager Response: Hello GiveBlood,  Thank you so much for your great review. i am so glad to hear that our hotel was convenient for your needs in the area and your room was up to your standards. Also glad to hear you enjoyed our free breakfast every morning.   We hope you are able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Nice place to stay for families with kids. Easy walk to Disneyland. Friendly staff willing to help even in the middle of the night.  It was nice to start our Disney day off with a good hot breakfast at the hotel. I also love the 3 pm check in time so we could get over to Disneyland earlier for a fun night at Disneyland. Most of the other hotels in the area have a 4PM check in time.  We have stayed at the Desert Palms 6 times and will stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello 111christianr,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. We appreciate you always choosing the Desert Palms Hotel for your visits to Anaheim and taking the time to share your feedback with others. Thank you so much for your compliments to our staff, I am very glad they were able to assist you whenever you needed it.   We can't wait to see you again for your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Pros: Down the street from Disneyland (15 min walk) Familly suites with all needed amenities. Last minute availability.Clean! Free parking!  Cons: Hotel so big it lack coziness as a whole. Parking far from room.  Breakfast is cafetaria quality
Manager Response: Hello FranH78,  Thank you so much for your great review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.
