We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience at our hotel with other travelers and we hope you can visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Aloha! We loved the location of the hotel. It was close enough for us to walk to Disneyland. I had booked a shuttle service for my family but ended up never taking the shuttle. The staff were friendly and helpful. When I made a request they fulfilled it quickly without asking questions. Like providing extra blankets, (even though there were some in the closet & I never noticed). We'll book here again on our next trip. Mahalo!
Manager Response: Aloha Myama808!  Thank you so much for your excellent feedback! We do appreciate you sharing your experience with other travelers and am so glad you had a good stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We hope you are able to visit again soon!   Mahalo!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Reasonably clean, about as close to Disneyland add you can get, comfy beds, but the attitudes of the front desk really brought down the score for us. I had called two days in advance to request early check in; 1 o'clock vs. three. We arrived exhausted after driving all night, shortly after two, and was told by one of two snarky front desk clerks that our room was not ready, despite my request for early check in. Any time we had to deal with the front desk, they were unfriendly almost to the point of being rude. The nicest staff member was the young man who had to come fix our toilet. We would not stay here again.

located about 8 mins walk to Disney parks also handy to several restaurants,seven eleven and huge pharmacy.our room was on a corner block so we had good light however others in our group had the yuka kids suite the adult area was rather dark.the air conditioners in both rooms were noisy.staff were generally friendly.the cleaning staff did an excellent job keeping the rooms tidy and clean.the free breakfast was just ok,scrambled eggs with various side dishes,limited cereal choice,toast and waffles,tinned fruit.the area was always crowded and very noisy.this is your average 3 star hotel.pool was clean but rather small. foot note; because the hotel is located next to a 7/11 the area has a number of homeless people who hang around and sleep at the near by bus stop.not the most

This is our 3rd trip to Anaheim but our first at The Desert Palms and by far the best. The friendly staff were very helpful and the whole complex is FANTASTIC, from the free breakfasts to the Disney backback filled with goodies for our son in our room when we arrived. We will definitely be back and I would highly recommend this place to others. Thanks for making our stay wonderful!! 😀

I have stayed at all the major upscale hotels in the Disneyland area for many, many years. When this hotel accepted my Priceline bid last August, I wasn't thrilled, but figured at least it's really close to Disneyland. Well, it exceeded my expectations...our room was small, but very nice (apparently, newly remodeled), the breakfast buffet was fabulous (quality of food just as good as the River Belle Terrace in Disneyland where I, usually, have breakfast) and the short walk to the parks was very pleasant! I hope to stay here many more times in the future.

Favourite hotel from my USA trip, although the walk to disneyland felt like ages (we were there when it was ridiculously hot) it was located within walking distance. Located next to 7/11, opposite subway and other food stores and CVS pharmacy which is handy. Would recommend this hotel, rooms are clean, staff are nice enough, breakfast each morning was quite good.

Hotel is very nice and clean. My room had 4 beds and 2 bathrooms, I guess a suite?  Room was fairly clean, you could see its age. The shower was horrible, the faucet had three laser like streams that came from it that turned to mist by three feet. Needless to say it was impossible to wash shampoo from hair and you couldn't even get your legs wet. I understand water conservation but this is silly, I could fill the tub up for a bath why can't I with the shower head, just plain stupid.  Lucky for me I had two showers. I tried the second one the next morning and it had 6 laser streams slightly improving the ability to wash hair but good luck getting your body wet as it still turns to mist.  Room comes with free wifi but the speed was nonexistent. Ended up using my phone as a link vs

Summary Heading: 1/2 mile walk, not directly across like I thought
Summary: This was a nice, clean hotel and I wouldn't say anything negative but wanted to share this information that might be helpful to families. The hotel website states, "With a prime location to stay less than a block from the gates of Disneyland® Resort. ". This is misleading. I thought this hotel was the Anaheim Desert Inn, which is less than a block from the Disneyland entrance. I paid at least $40 more per night than other similar hotels thinking that it was truly close. A 10 minute walk (roughly 1/2 mile) walk isn't so bad unless you've paid more and believe that you are closer. Rooms were nice, clean, and they had a great breakfast. Just know that you aren't less than an average block away.

We found this hotel to be a perfect place to stay for our two day visit to Disneyland. About a 10 minute walk to the main gates, next door to a 7-11 for snacks, free parking for our rental car and self-service laundry machines. It won't suit everyone though - the pool is very small and our room was dark and a bit dated. Reception staff were super friendly and the chilled water in the lobby was great to come back to.

I'd like to say that the staff at Desert Palms is incredible. I came in for a convention and stayed at a "H" hotel the first two nights. I wish I'd stayed at DEsert Palms for all three. Not only is the front desk staff friendly and competent, they went above and beyond to rectify an issue I had with my reservation. The great atmosphere and food at the Sandbox Grille was a great experience. Freddy and Russ are two of the best bartenders I've come across and the burgers/wings were tasty!   I would not consider staying anywhere else if I'm back in the area.

We have used Desert Palms for two of our yearly Family Vacations. We get together to remind us how lucky we are to have such a being and loving family. There is roughly 45-50 every year.  Desert Palms were so accommodating for our massive gathering, I don't know how we could have done it without them this year.   From the great breakfast, to the swimming pool, to the clean rooms and great staff,.  They helped us through every obstacle  that comes with a group this size.  I have recommended Desert Palms for my friends and will definitely comeback again.... Thank you Desert Palms..The Benson Family-Utah

We have been going to the Desert Palms for the past 6 years since we are annual pass holders at Disneyland. This hotel is the best deal around - great prices, nice rooms (my kids love the kids suite!), underground parking, close walk to Disneyland and many restaurants, free breakfast... what more could anyone want! We have turned a lot of our friends onto this hotel and we highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Great Location and elephants in the roof.
Summary: I don't like leaving bad reviews but I will let you decide. We stayed here in on New Years eve for 5 days. We paid extra for a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suit. I was not impressed, rooms are run down, musty smelling, mould growing in bathrooms, my son broke out with a rash all over his torso. Beds were uncomfortable and rooms were dark.  Our room was right next door to the elevator very noisy. we could hear every footstep the person on the above floor made and it sounded like elephants stampeding.When we checked in we were approached by a girl who was trying to sell time share rubbish which we didn't get our $25 deposit back. I didn't complain as it as New years and I thought they would be fully booked.  Location was great walking to Disneyland, Great restaurants walking distance,

We reserved a Borrego suite as we were staying for 11 nights and I wanted somewhere other than a bed to sit. It was a lovely room. Large bathroom with great water pressure. 2 queen size beds, a sunken living room with comfy couch and 4 person table. 2 Tv's as well, along with curtains to separate the rooms.  The check in staff were pleasant, the breakfast room ladies were lovely. Please remember to tip them. Speaking of breakfast, it was impressive. Lots of variety, well kept. Eat in inside or on the rooftop patio.  The pool area was small but adequate. We used it a few times. There was always clean towels. The lobby area was well kept and the fruit flavoured water provided for free was very refreshing. A close walk to Disney, lots of restaurants, the CVS was very handy.  The

This hotel has a location right next to Disneyland.  It was easy to walk to and from the park even late at night.  It was quiet and very welcoming.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and quiet

My wife and I have stayed there 2years in a row and will be staying again next year. The staff is very polite and knowledgeable about the area. The room we stayed in are standard hotel style but kept very clean. Love the hot breakfast on the roof top every morning. Last year our flights got cancelled due to the blizzard in NE. The hotel stall was very understanding and worked hard to find room for us to stay. It ended up being an additional 2 nights and the manager was kind enough to give us a discount due to out situation. That was very kind as. We were stranded and had no place to go. Thank You

This is a Motel 6 with crown molding, reviews are absurd! Do NOT trust Misleading pictures, fooled us...., Clearly old, worn out, poorly kept, staff at desk distracted and not terribly interested in guests. The furniture is old and needing repair, refinishing. Breakfast was done as cheaply as possible, carb centric low quality food and seemingly reworked muffins (old pasteries and donuts blended together, then rebaked ) although the staff there worked hard, but hey the coffee was good!

The service was excellent as was the location. The room was very clean and comfortable. My only complaint was that the bed was too hard so I didn't sleep much.  It would be wonderful if a memory foam mattress cover was available to guest on request. Other than that, it was a very enjoyable visit. Its location is fantastic, close to restaurants, Disneyland, etc. and the ART was just around the corner to take you to Disneyland. No need to drive anywhere. Parking is limited but if you check in early you can certainly find a spot.

Stayed here for 8 nights during Disneyland's 60th Celebrations.  After 4 full days at Disneyland, it was a treat and a welcome relief to come back and get some rest.  The Yuha Kids Suite was brilliant with a separate room with a bunk bed and TV.  Whilst the room itself is not big, it does enough and has just enough space for a family of 4.  The buffet breakfast was great.  Eggs, waffles, fruit, pastries, bread, juice, coffee.  We're not big breakfast eaters, but what was on offer was more than enough.  There is a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf across the road which I frequented to get a good espresso before walking to the park...which is a casual 10 minute stroll down the road.  Other than the fact the decor is a little 1970's and there was no toaster in the room, if I was to come

Summary Heading: Mid range offering at upscale price
Summary: Stayed here for business while at Disney. Location is good with a lot in the area. Room was recently upgraded with new carpet and furniture which was nice with comfortable beds. Breakfast was offered on the 5th floor in a cafeteria setting, it was good but very busy as you would expect. There was some construction going on which cannot be helped right outside my window...even with Priceline this is a spendy hotel.

You can't beat the location of this hotel a short 10min walk to the Magic Kingdom. Restaurants to cater to all budgets in walking distance. CVS pharmacy , 7-11, gas stations, shopping everywhere. Rooms basic clean and large with microwave oven and refrigerator, free parking if you register to boot. Friendly staff. Internet can be slow, walls not perfectly sound prof but adequate. Breakfast very basic, it doesn't change from day to day, eggs tasted like it came out of a carton, but you can make your own waffles and pancakes. Overall a decent stay.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, I had my check book gone throught in the safety box that I had thought I had the only key. Who ever the employee was they took my routeing & account numbers made some checks with the info and wrote out $ 1900.00 worth Also once I was home I found that had some cloths missing about 100.00 worth  and then few days later I found out about the  money missing I would never stay there and I HOPE NO WILL spoke to a manger and she just disregared me did nothing about it SO Don't Stay.

Great service! Great hotel close to disneyland! Walking distance! Very clean and helpful staff!!!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to disney. This is a cheaper hotel for those who want to go to disney but doesn't want to spend a lot money on a hotel in the Disney parks.

Clean suite room, 3 adults and two teens. Breakfast was good, the waffles best! Nice hotel for family trip. 15 minutes walk to Disney gate or take the Art for $5, convenience was great. Don't drive and park. Hotel is nice and reasonable priced. They are in the process of renovation. Didn't effect or stay. I would definitely stay here again.

We have finished our 4 night stay, great hotel, facilities great, breakfast brilliant and the location goes without saying, less than ten min walk from Disneyland. We arrived at 1.30 in afternoon after travelling 22 hours to be told can't get in room, so sat in foyer until we could, we get our room which felt like it was in the basement(120) a view of the underneath of cars in carpark greeted us, room was clean and bed comfy, room also was an adjoining room, so child screaming day and night was clearly heard in our room, being a couple in our 40 &50s and booking room 12 months in advance, would have thought that a better room could have been offered. In short, it's a shame that every single staff member did not offer any kind of care that you were there as their guest and really

Room appeared, for the most part, to be clean. Chair in the room was dirty. Bathroom was very clean. Lobby chairs needed a good cleaning but floor was vacuumed.  Breakfast was good and staff seemed helpful but some times seemed to get in the way. Pool and spa was a bit run down and dirty.  Hotel staff helpful and friendly.  Warning Bums Hang Out at the Bus Stop Near to the Hotel.   We stayed for a week and did not experience any variation to posting above.

Our family enjoyed our stay at Desert Palms.  Our room was clean and the layout for us as a family of 6 was great.  We thought the breakfast buffet was very good.  The variety of items was very good.  We were happy with the location as we were able to easily walk to Disney. We would recommend your hotel to our friends and family.

Good; close to Disneyland, bunk beds for kids with separate room and sofa bed, two sinks. Bad: sinks clogged, crowded room space, door separating kids' room not sound proof. Overall will stay there again.

I always enjoy my stay at Desert Palms. A short 10 minute walk to Disneyland park. The staff was very polite and accommodating to our needs. Our room was quiet, clean and modern. The breakfast in the morning was fresh and hot. The waffles are always a hit and something that I look foreword to in the morning. It is always a pleasure to stay at Desert Palms Hotel.

Pros: Free Breakfast, Good location with regard to Disneyland  Cons: Rooms are small/congested, floor was sticky, furniture was old, bunkbed REEKED of urine, hallways were stuffy/hot/poor ventilation, people in room above us were making a ton of noise late at night and management wouldn't do anything about it.

We had zero complaints about our stay at Desert Palms.  For the price we booked, I was expecting a sub-par experience, as the price was cheaper than many other hotels in the area.  However, our experience was excellent.  The front desk staff was polite and accommodating, allowing us to store luggage before check-in and lending me a pair of scissors when I needed them in a pinch.  The lobby itself was spacious and very well air-conditioned, and the fruit-infused water available was a nice touch.  Our room had two queen beds on the first floor, and it was very clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was delicious!  No, it's not gourmet, but it had a lot of options and a great outdoor seating area overlooking California Adventure!  I am looking forward to staying at this hotel again.

Chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland but there are others that are probably better and just as close. Whilst the service was adequate it certainly wasn't friendly, I don't think I saw one front desk person smile. It was as though we were putting them out by checking in. We were given a room different to what we booked and when I questioned as to why I was told that they don't necessarily give you the room you book. Huh?? Not good enough. They did try to change the room for us but were not all that happy about it and gave us a room over the electrical room in the hotel. There was an almighty humming noise in the room and the floor actually vibrated. I asked to switch rooms again and was told that I am the only one to ever complaint about that room. Somehow I don't

We chose this hotel since it was close to the Anaheim Convention Center as our teenaged children were attending Vidcon . We found and booked the room through the Vidcon website. This hotel has a lot of amenities and reasonable rates.  We arrived late on Wednesday night, check in was easy, quick, efficient and we were very pleased to find out that we had been upgraded to a suite which was great as it gave us a little extra room for the 4 nights we would be there.   The lobby is well laid out and clean, the front desk associates were very pleasant and helpful. Our room showed signs of 'wear and tear' but nothing out of the ordinary for a hotel and was very clean and comfortable. There are two parking areas with plenty of parking.  Breakfast was good and there was a variety of

My mother, 2 year old and I were looking for a quick getaway from our home in San Gabriel Valley for my mothers birthday. It was a last minute decision and Desert Palms Greeted us immediately with open arms and worked with us on a great price. We are annual pass holders so we only stayed 2 nights but they made us feel right at home almost as if you were dealing with cast members at Disneyland. The breakfast was so good and worth it an I Loved that the walk isn't far at all to the parks. We will be back this September Yay!! Thank You Desert Palms. Such Good Prices.

Summary Heading: DISNEYLAND VISIT WITH MY DAUGHTER AND 2 G KIDS
Summary: They had a nice breakfast buffet and pool and the rooms were fine. Not enough towels for 4 of us and the biggest thing I wished they had was a shuttle to the park. Too far for me as a senior with leg problems to walk just to get there but I rented an electric cart and that made things ok.

We are once again on our way to Disneyland and to our Hotel, Desert Palms Hotel and Suites.  We stay here every time to come to Disneyland.  This time we stayed in the 2 rooms suite.  It was great because both family's had their own privacy.  It was nice, clean and the staff were as great as anyways.  And the breakfast is fabulous!  Cant wait to come back again.  This trip was to short.

The good thing about this hotel is the location.  It is very close to Disney and plenty of restaurants.  It also has laundry facilities. The hotel staff is very friendly and nice.  They go out of their way to assist guests.  The breakfast was monotonous and uninteresting. My greatest problem is that the carpet in the room was very  old, nasty and dirty.  It does not need cleaning.  It needs to be removed. The bathrooms were quite clean.  This hotel is currently being renovated and  it would be a great idea if they could somehow include a sitting area in the two bedrooms/two bathrooms suites and a window in each bedroom.

Was visiting Disneyland with the fam for the weekend and decided to stay here as a result of placing a bid on the travel site Priceline.com. The upside: hotel is literally next door to California Adventure and the balcony of our suite provided a prime sitting spot to enjoy firework show. The free breakfast was good and provided a good enough variety to satisfy my kids. The staff were great and very accommodating, especially Jenny. The downside: the suite that was advertised as close to 1100sf turned out to be more like a standard room divided by a barn door. Everyone woke up the next morning to numerous bites on our legs and lower extremities. The breakfast room/patio was oftentimes rowdy & chaotic with the workers allowing all the natives to run wild n free. Resembled a 60man

We had a wonderful stay. They let us check in early and check out late. They upgraded us to a family room which was perfect. A room with a bunk bed for the 2 kids and a king bed for us. 2 tv's too. Breakfast included every morning and a good range of food. Perfectly located, a short walk to Disneyland, restaurants, supermarket, fast food, everything in easy reach. Stevie at reception was wonderful. Friendly service and always fulfilling our requests. We had a wonderful time. Would highly recommend.

Have a family of 5. We stayed in the family suite. Was great because had 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms. We were right across from the pool & I used their small gym around the corner. Had big selection at the free breakfast. Couldn't complain about anything.

We purchased a guest room for our daughter's wedding trip.  We were all staying at the hotel and visiting the sites that only Disney has to offer.  Upon arrival, the hotel immediately upgraded the Newlyweds (at no charge) to the wedding suite with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting in their room.  I have pleasantly stayed here before, but the amount of extra effort that the hotel provided was astounding.  This was a busy holiday week and we are treated as if we were VIP's.  I have traveled the world and rarely see this amount of extra effort.  Hats off to the staff!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: We booked this hotel months ago for the D23 Expo, mainly because of its location. We had a great stay. Our stay was Aug 11 to Aug 19. It took around 10 mins to walk to Disneyland and around 5 mins to the Convention Center. Staff was very professional and the breakfast in the morning was great. Our room was located on the 1st floor and had been updated mainly in the bathroom. The room was clean with a comfy beds. One thing is the channels offered on the TV are not the greatest. The underground parking was a nice feature and never had an issue about getting a spot. I would defiantly recommend staying at this hotel and I would stay here again.

The hotel is very conveniently located near Disneyland and the staff was great too.  We were pleasantly surprised that when we parked our minivan when we first arrived that it was there to stay until we checked out four days later.  There were a variety of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel.  We used our double stroller more than ever on this vacation.  And the hotel pool was a huge hit with the kids.  Definitely we'll be staying here again the next time we come back to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location but not nice staff
Summary: Stayed in this hotel for a Disney vacation with my family. The location of the hotel is great and very close to Disney ( 7 minutes walking) and there are so many restaurants and shops around it. The breakfast Buffett is horrible they don't have a good food selection. The only down side to this hotel is their staff and the front desk. They are not friendly and not nice! We experienced a problem and it was the hotel fault but they did not apologize or handle it professionally!  It would be nice if they hired a nicer, friendlier staff

Our stay was awesome! We were very impressed! All staff was nice and friendly. The pool was perfect with not-tiny towels.  The suite was spacious and clean. Huge refrigerator. Comfy bed and pillows. Great AC. We had parking up close. Great hours for breakfast with big selection. Great deck on roof to eat breakfast. Tasty water in the lobby. Nice bartender. Concierge was a sweetie. Very close and safe to walk to Disneyland and restaurants (we walked back to take mid-day naps.) Well stocked gift shop. I wanted to watch the 9:30 pm fireworks from the roof deck but it was closed. Not a big deal though. I watched them through the fifth floor window.  We'll definitely be back!
Manager Response: Hello Jillh761,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We always strive to offer the best for our guests and we are so glad to be able to do that for you. We can't wait to see you again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: 4 star hotel with uncaring unprofessional front desk Management that leaves guest stranded
Summary: Overall as a hotel one would be very pleased with the hotel accommodation's and the comfort with regards to all the rooms. Four days into my stay I decided to extend another two more days and this is where my nightmare has commenced with no help from the front desk management. Due to excessive use on my credit cards during this vacation my bank decided to temporary freeze all my debit cards preventing me from posting the $20 incidental charge to check into the hotel . After explaining this nightmare to the front desk manager I was so politely told without a $20 authorization on my credit card I will be unable to check into a room that was prepaid prior to the temp freeze on my cards. Trying to explain I will be receiving a western union with a few hours I was told there's
Manager Response: Greetings Ken C,   Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking your time to write a review.  I am glad you enjoyed our hotel and its comfort. As for the issue with the card for incidentals, it is in fact our hotel policy that our guests most provide a card for incidentals whether the room is prepaid or not, and to protect our hotel and our amenities the policy is strictly enforced by our Staff and Management.   We do appreciate your feedback on the matter and we hope you will stay with us again.  Sincerely,  Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Desert Palms for four nights for the D23 Expo recently. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and the Convention Center. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and a 7-11 and CVS next door for anything you need. The hotel offered room service and has a pool (which we did not get to try out). We loved the complimentary breakfast in the morning. The staff was extremely helpful, and the rooms clean and a good size. My only (tiny) issue was that during the day, housekeeping would shut the air conditioning off, so the room would be 85+ degrees when we came back. However, after I talked to the front desk the matter was solved. If I might make another suggestion to management: it would be lovely if the hotel opened
Manager Response: Hello JacksBee,  Thank you so much for your great review. I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us during your visit for D23. We really appreciate you sharing positive feedback of our hotel with other travelers. While I do agree that the breakfast room patio would be an awesome place to watch the fireworks from, unfortunately our view from there is blocked by the Tower of Terror ride at DCA.   We hope that you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We spent six nights here. Four stars overall based on the location. What I liked was the ten minute walk to both Disneyland parks. There are also a number of cheap eateries across the road for those on a budget plus a 7-11 next door and a CVS pharmacy across the street. Both these places also sell wraps, salads and sandwiches for easy meals. The bus also stops right outside.  Free guest parking too. If I was just evaluation the hotel it would be 3 stars.  Our room was a bit tired and dark but you are hardly going to be hanging out in your room.  Having a free breakfast is great.  My husband and daughter loved the waffles and every day their was a new item at the buffet.  I would stay here again and would recommend it as a family friendly hotel..
Manager Response: Hello Rodgersx3,  Thank you for your review. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the location of the hotel and hope that you will stay with us again after we are finished with our remodel and hopefully you will enjoy your room more as well. We hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for one night along with family. It was a nice stay. The breakfast was very good. The rooms are big in size. The linens were very neat and clean. I had a very comfortable stay in this hotel. I hereby recommend this hotel for every tourist to disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello Vivekjha2015,  Thank you so much for your great review! We really appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. Thank you for your compliments to our rooms and breakfast. We hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: We wish we could live here full time!
Summary: We stay here 2-4 times a year and we don't even look anywhere else.  They have made themselves available anytime they are needed and go above and beyond to help out.  The rooms are nice, the breakfast is great, and it is close to where we want to be.
Manager Response: Hello F4239XOjasonc,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We wish you could live here full time too! We really appreciate all of your stays with us and always look forward to having you with us. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, close to Disneyland (but should have done the ART bus!)
Summary: Got a better deal by calling hotel instead of booking online at any of the sites.   Booked a suite (4 queen beds with bathroom in middle).  Was perfect for our trip (6 adults - 4 of which were 'kids').   Great to have 2 separate bathrooms with showers.  The sinks/mirror area was separate.  The girls could get ready while the boys were showering.     Loved having it close to Disneyland but the walk was longer than my poor body was use to (perfect for the 'kids'). I should have looked in the ART bus.   We were only there 2 nights/3 days but if we go again we'll stay here (and for longer).   Great for going back to in the middle of the day to take a nap.  A/C worked too well (was either too cool in our room or too warm in their room when we closed the doors between the rooms).    I
Manager Response: Hello TECA64,  Thank you for your great review. I am so glad to hear that you  enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your positive feedback on our rooms and breakfast. I am sorry to hear that the walk was a little to long for you. The ART Shuttle is a great service. They stop right outside the hotel every 20 minutes and charge $5 per day. Hopefully you are able to utilize them on your next visit. We look hope to see you here again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location, great breakfast, great room
Summary: We wanted to visit Disneyland, and also do other LA stuff too., this hotel was perfect for us., we walked the block and it took us 11 / 12 minutes door to door, which meant we were able to get in Disney early at 8am go on loads of rides before the queues got too bad, then skip back to the hotel for a swim in the pool and a rest, nip back to Disney for the parade and a few more rides, leave again and grab a takeaway from the cafés on The strip opposite the hotel, Chinese, pizza, subway, burgers etc... , have a shower and go back for the evening.  7-11 and pharmacy  across the street, selling drinks sandwiches, gifts and loads more.  Fabulous buffet breakfast served, definitely not worth missing and just as fresh at 7am  and 10am.  Complimentary  iced water and coffee available in
Manager Response: Hello Jayel70,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your positive feedback on our rooms and buffet breakfast. I am glad that you were able to get everywhere you wanted to go in the area with ease. I hope that you are able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This place was alright. It is close enough to walk but an ART pass makes live much easier the hotel is an older one, a bit on the worn side. We had a family suite, two double room on a double bath, comfortable a bit noisy. The pool was nice the location was convenient, close to CVS, 7-11, and Subway. Overall a good experience.
Manager Response: Hello Btj1972,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate you sharing your feedback with other travelers. I am so glad to hear that you had a good stay with us and hope that you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We were able to park our car in the hotel lot before check in to visit the parks. We had ART passes which worked out great. But yes, you are able to walk. When we returned at about 10 pm to check in we were given a nice upgrade to a suite. It was perfect! Everything was nice. The breakfast, the room, the location and the employees were great!! I booked through Costco Travel. A few Disney extras were included if you chose their good neighbor package.
Manager Response: Hello PAdisneyfan,  Thank you very much for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We always strive to offer the best for our guests and I am glad we were able to do that for you. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them. We hope you are able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here for four nights and we were very satisfied. The free breakfast was great, free WiFi was much appreciated. The halls can get noisy early in the morning with excited children heading to Disneyland. About a 10 minute walk to the ticket windows at park, good place for an afternoon swim break and nap. The check-in was easy and there were no surprise charges on my bill. Room was clean, housekeeping did a great job. Highly recommend as a family option for Disneyland, it is right behind Cars Land and you can see the fireworks from hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Casinoroadwarrior,  Thank you for your review. I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you are able to visit again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I can't really say enough nice things about the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.  First, the location can't be beat.  An easy 10-15 minute walk to the front door of Disneyland Parks.  The parking was free which it wasn't at most of the nearby hotels, in addition they had an AWESOME free hot breakfast every morning.  The breakfast had waffles every morning, eggs, bacon or sausage or other and was a good start to our day.  The free breakfast allowed us to stock up and then we didn't have to spend that much money on food while at Disneyland.  Our room had a sunken living room that was very comfortable- easily the room could have slept more than 4 people.  The room and the bathroom was very clean.  It was a great place to come back to after our long days at Disneyland one of my favorite
Manager Response: Hello Amychuck,  Thank so much for your wonderful review! We really appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and that we were able to assist you with getting back your lost item. We can't wait to have you stay with us again on your next visit!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great location and suite was perfect for family of five
Summary: Room: We were in a kids' suite with two rooms, the first with a king bed and the adjoining room with a bunk bed and sofa bed.  The kids' room was larger than we expected and included a desk and separate tv. The hotel is nothing fancy- no art on the walls and a little dated, but was clean and it worked great for our family with three teenagers and the fridge and microwave were handy.  There was also a safe which was perfect for locking up laptops and cameras when we were out.   Location: Awesome! It was basically a block from the convention center, a block from Disney and on a street with lots of activity and restaurants.  The only time we used a car was to go to an Angels game (and that's about a mile away so also very easy to reach).   Food:  We thought the included breakfast
Manager Response: Hello Buckeyemom91,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your room during your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff! I am glad that they were able to help you locate your lost item after your departure. We hope you are able to stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - just a few minutes walk to Disney!
Summary: Our family met in Disneyland and stayed at the Desert Palms. It was superb! The staff was courteous and inviting, the rooms were very clean! It was great to walk to the Disney parks in a few minutes! The accommodations do not have to be a normal hotel room! We had three different room types: one with a sunken living room; one with a living room & kitchen - which had a bedroom door that let the little ones sleep in private; and another with a separate bunk bed suite for the teens. The free breakfast was hot and included: more than the usual cold options! It was a dream vacation and the Desert Palms was an additional pleasure!
Manager Response: Hello OHIOMEB,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to take advantage of the quick walk over to the Disney Parks. Thank you for your compliments to our staff. They are a great team and we are lucky to have them.  We hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good enough for a Disneyland stay
Summary: Desert Palms is a perfectly adequate place to stay during a Disneyland trip. It's about a 10-minute walk from the park, so you get tons of families here. Rooms were clean and had decent amenities. The Desert Palms looks nice and tries to be upscale, but doesn't quite hit the mark, which is fine; we weren't here to hang out in our room. The pool looked small but nice, although we didn't use it. Ice cold strawberry, cucumber, and citrus water in the lobby was wonderful. Ask for a room away from busy West Katella Avenue to avoid traffic noise.  Our room looked like it had been recently remodeled. The bathroom was really nice, as well as the little kitchen sort of area with a small microwave, coffee maker, and refrigerator. The chair at the desk, however, looked like it had been
Manager Response: Hello Andrew F,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate you sharing your feedback for other travelers. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your room during your stay and that you found our hotel to be clean and comfortable. We are currently remodeling rooms (beginning with bathrooms which i believe you noticed in your room) and hope that you will stay with us again next  year after our renovations are completed.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We are a family of four and we stayed for four nights. The staff were friendly and the location was perfect for going to Disney, only a ten minute walk. The room was spacious and clean. Beds were comfortable and the room was quiet at night. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, so we spent a couple of hours at the pool while we waited. The hot breakfast had plenty to choose from and we enjoyed it very much. The only grievance being that on the Tuesday when we had Early Magic Morning Hours available to us at Disneyland the breakfast area was not open early enough for us to have something before we left for the park.    The only other thing about the hotel that I found strange (and I experienced this at every hotel we stayed at throughout our California vacation) is that we
Manager Response: Hello BRBC,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! I am very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I am sorry that housekeeping did not leave enough supplies in your room daily. We will definiltey have a housekeeping meeting to correct the issue. We do appreciate your feedback and can't wait for your next stay with us!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Within walking distance to the convention center.  Probably could walk to Disney Parks, but may be to far for young children and elderly to walk.  We stayed a Friday and Saturday night.  We were considering staying on Thursday also, but when we called to ask the price for Thursday, the price was about $100 dollars more. They would not give us the same price as the Friday and Saturday price. We arrived at 9:30 am and asked if we could check in early. We were all tired from traveling.  We stayed by the pool and in the lobby until they finally let us check in at 3:00.  Would not have been to hard to ask housekeeping to ready the room instead of making us wait all day.  We stayed in the Kalahari Suite and paid a total of $730.00 for 2 nights.  The hotel was booked and noisy and we
Manager Response: Hello Mwchrisco2,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay with us. Our check in time is at 3:00pm and we are only able to allow early check in based on availability, our large suites do take longer to clean. We also offer free breakfast to all of our guests, no matter how they book.   I do hope you will give us another try to extend our usual quality standard and service.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Hotel is well located near to Disney park, just 5 minutes walk. You will get all types of food outside hotel, Indian, Chinese, Italian, American etc. Staff is very  courteous and friendly. Checked out the room in morning, planned the luggage in locker room, roamed around and picked the bags in evening to catch flight. Nice arrangements. We took family room, so that two family can stay, we were for adult and two kids, rooms were clean and breakfast is also good. Recommended for a family vacation....
Manager Response: Hello Mani_onThe_Road,  Thank you so much for your excellent review! I am so glad that you enjoyed your room and our free hot breakfast during your stay with us. We appreciate your stay and hope that you are able to visit again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: If you stay here then its probably to be near disney. Its a basic, no frills place where the rooms have the essentials and comfy beds but  not much more going for them. The  check in staff were great, very helpful and went out of their way to accomodate.  There is a bar/cafe that serves good fare, ot much more. Oh, and it is literally 5 minutes walk to disney. its also only a $15 taxi to angel stadium if you fancy a baseball game.
Manager Response: Hello Mook M,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We appreciate you taking time to let other travelers know of your experiences here and hope that you are able to stay with us again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This hotel while close to Disneyland is probably one of the older properties in the area.  I was in Anaheim to watch my daughter dance in the Disneyland parades, so it was an extended stay. Because this was my first time to Anaheim I took the advice of the trip coordinator and booked at the Desert Palms Hotel.  The room was not as advertised (of course it looked bigger online)  Also, we had an issue with the bathroom sink being clogged for 2 days straight.  They did change our room but it seemed smaller and their consolation was that we had a deck.  Which was only a ledge, not enough for two people to stand on.  There are a lot more options in the area and I would suggest booking there until this hotel updates its rooms.    One bright spot - FREE BREAKFAST.  Great sausage but
Manager Response: Hello JoAnn B,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I apologize for the inconvenience that you encountered during your stay with us and hope you will visit again after our renovations are completed next year to enjoy our usual quality standard and service.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Don't believe the excellent reviews you will see on this site for the Desert Palms.  We stayed there for a week and our room was in desperate need of a renovation.  The carpet was awful and really should have been changed several years ago.  There were stains everywhere on the carpet, and along one side of the bed, it was very sticky like someone had dumped syrup on it.  The walls and furniture were beat up, with scratches, dents, and paint chips.  The mattress was old and hard.  Thankfully, we brought our own pillows so we didn't have to use the ones provided.  The hotel provides free WiFi, but it is useless because the speed is so slow, it times out before it is possible to even connect.    It's a shame, because the location was great and the public areas of the hotel were
Manager Response: Hello Danarcha,  I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your room during your stay with us. We are currently remodeling all of our guest rooms and hope you will be able to stay with us again once our renovations are completed.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I was very impressed and would definitely consider staying again. Breakfast was good each morning with great variety. We arrive about 2 for check and was surprised when the front desk told us we had been upgraded to a suite as a thank you for arriving early. Beds warm very comfortable. Hot water nice shower.  Close to Disney. Still recommend you get the act passes. Nice gift shop and don't forget the complimentary hotel photo in the lobby. Great staff very attentive.
Manager Response: Hello Debbie H,  Thank you so much for your excellent review. We are so glad to hear that your enjoyed your suite and all of the amenities we offer. We hope to see you again for your next visit to Disneyland!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We loved staying at Desert Palms Hotel when we visited Disneyland. The location was perfect walking distance for a family of four with two kids who were so excited to get to Disneyland. The walk from the hotel was only 5 to 10 minutes long and was faster than taking the Disneyland shuttles since they made more stops before the park. We also liked that we we had a microwave and small fridge for snacks at the hotel room or preparing lunches to take to the parks in case the kids got hungry. They also provided a great breakfast every morning we were there and parking for our car during our stay at no extra fee. My kids loved all the options during breakfast time and being so close to Disneyland and the beach. We had a great stay at Desert Palms and plan to come back when we visit
Manager Response: Hello Hildadunford,  Thank you for your excellent review. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I appreciate your positive feedback on our location and free breakfast buffet. We can't wait to see you again for your next visit to Disneyland!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We never stay anywhere else! The free breakfast is off the hook good! Something for everyone. All the years we have been coming we have never been sorry. Always clean and always friendly! They even helped surprise my sister and her new husband for their honeymoon! They went out of there way this last trip. They helped us make memories for a lifetime. I am more than greatful. The beds and pillows are comfortable too. Just a short walk from Disneyland or the Convention center makes this the best choice for your stay. I was so happy last time that I turned around and booked a room for this coming week!
Manager Response: Hello J786LTsandram,  Thank you for your awesome review! We appreciate you always choosing the Desert Palms for your visits to Anaheim. I am glad to hear that your sister and her husband had a great honeymoon with us. We look forward to seeing you here again very soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We were very pleased with our five night stay at Desert Palm.  We were there for an event at the convention center which was just across the street.  Also visited Disney which was right behind us.  We walked everywhere we went.  Our room was nice and clean and comfy.  The morning breakfast was a nice plus and we did enjoy some time around the pool.  Oh...Russ...in the lounge was an awesome bartender!  Would definitely stay there again.  Great value !
Manager Response: Hello Cheryl L,  Thank you for your great review of our hotel. I am glad to hear that we provided a comfortable place to stay during your time at the Convention Center and Disneyland. We hope to see you here again soon.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Good for quick stay for Disneyland
Summary: The room was good sized for the four of us (two queen beds) and pillows/mattress were great.  I thought the breakfast buffet was terrible, though.  I understand 'free' or 'included', but really if you are going to have food quality that low, why bother?  Oatmeal and yogurt funny, eggs/ham dry,waffle maker broke for one we tried to use, and of course we ran out of time to start over.  It is open at 0630 and for those trying to get it together to be at Disneyland by 0730, it's not a lot of time.  But the room was more than adequate:  clean, quiet, good location.  OH - and good drink and bar food for night before if that's important!
Manager Response: Hello JustaDinerTempe,  Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We appreciate your feedback. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our free buffet breakfast. We will definitely look into improving those items that you mentioned in your review. We hope you are able to stay with us again soon.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disney
Summary: Desert Palms Hotel and Suites is a very clean place to stay and only a ten minute walk to Disney.  They offer a fabulous complimentary breakfast every morning and the staff is very hospitable.  We have stayed there four times over the last ten years and have never been disappointed.
Manager Response: Hello Sonifam,  Thank you for your excellent review! We appreciate your continued visits to our hotel and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Spent 8 nights at the Desert Palms.   It was quiet (Room 227).  Cleaning staff was excellent, as was the Front Desk and breakfast room staff.  All were courteous, effecient and helpful.  Breakfast was always good and well appreciated, and a much better selection than other hotels in the area I have stayed in.  About a 8-10 minute walk to Disneyland. No parking issues either.
Manager Response: Hello Liana M,  Thank you for your great review. I appreciate your comments on our staff and breakfast selection. We are so glad to hear you had a great stay with us and hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great and convenient place to stay
Summary: We stayed at this place last year and had no hesitation staying there again this year.   Staff were really helpful and friendly.  We arrived at a round 9.00 am when the check in time is 3.00 pm.  The guy at the counter realized we have just traveled for nearly Sixteen hours and without any hesitation prioritized our room preparation and made it available within an hour.   Location is within walking distance to key attractions and they booked our day trips with no extra charges.   Breakfast was free and that included a good variety of hot and cold food.  Strongly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Hello Lalyas,  Thank you for your excellent review. I am very glad to hear that our Front Desk Agent was able to get your into your room early since you definitely had a long journey here. We hope you are able to visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Pros:  central (walk to Disneyland and Convention Centre, CSV across the street), various room sizes for families, nice lobby, hot breakfast, fridge and microwave in room. Cons: the rooms need renovation.  Furniture in my room was beat up, peeling paint,  carpet looked bad.  Room was really dark, especially the bathroom where I was sure the light must be burnt out but that was just how it worked.  Linens weren't plush or soft.   Gave a small shampoo but no conditioner. Pool was small and surrounded by walls of hotel so somewhat prison like.  Not what you imagine for a pool In California. I would not go back.   For the price, you can find better.
Manager Response: Hello GilliGorilla,  Thank you for reviewing the Desert Palms Hotel. I am sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with your room during your stay. I hope you will consider giving us another chance after our renovations have completed next year.   Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Great amenities but the hotel is showing its age
Summary: Nice hotel  - great amenities, but the hotel is really starting to look tired.  Here is a list of pros vs. cons  PRO's -  Location - 7 min walk to Disneyland.  5 min drive to Target (we bought our water & groceries here, very affordable).  30 min drive to beaches. 10 min drive to Outlet Malls. Housekeeping staff- They were amazing!  They cleaned our room every days and provided us with fresh towels!  They also did a fantastic job keeping the pool, laundry, and fitness room clean. Free Coffee & Water - Coffee & Water are provided for, at no cost, in the lobby. Nice perk! Free Wifi  - Fairly good WiFi at this hotel. Free Parking - Parking is free but some people had very creative ways of parrking - almost a bit hazardous.  But we always found a spot. Free Breakfast:  Breakfast was

Desert Palms was in walking distance to Disneyland which made it easy for us to go back and rest for a couple of hours before going back in the evening. The grandkids enjoyed the pool after a long day at Disneyland. The facilities were clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was very friendly. The free breakfast was good and there was a large assortment of goodies. My husband and son found the hotel bar and they made them some awesome Long Island Iced Teas.

A very clean hotel with complimentary breakfast, water, and coffee (all day in lobby). Loved our room with door to separate bunk bed room from main area.  Fast elevators.  Wish pool had been bigger with more sun.

Summary Heading: A great stay in a great location
Summary: Firstly I just want to state that I don't give 5 stars easily so my 4 stars is not a reflection on Desert Palms. Having visited Anaheim last year we noticed Desert Palms and decided to stay this year based on location. Our first impression when walking into the lobby was how well presented everything was and how friendly the reception staff were. We chose a Borrego suite to offer our family of three a little extra space which is exactly what it offered. The living area gave us room to move and somewhere to store our 3 large suitcases.  The beds were very comfortable and although being on an intersection we experienced no traffic noise. The furniture is starting to look a little outdated (not a major concern to us)but the hotel is undergoing a refurbishment program from what I

Summary Heading: A Decent Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: We, 2 adults & 2 kids, stayed here for 3 nights in June.   Our room was a bit dated and had a view of a wall. It was very clean, it smelled clean if you know what I mean, had working wifi and comfy beds. For a place near Disney you don't really need anything else because you're not there for a spa experience.  The breakfast was an experience, that we o my went through for one day.  I am sure there are better hotels near by but for the price I can't complain really.

I rented this hotel as part of a package with GetAwayToday to go to DIsneyland with tickets. The lobby is nice, they have refreshing fruit infused water in the lobby. The breakfast is included which is very nice. It is served on the 5th floor, with roof top tables available. The breakfast is from 6:30 to 10 am. This is very good for vacation people. They have waffles, eggs and potatoes, fruit, and yogurt every day, with a rotation of biscuts, sausages, bacon etc. The front desk staff is very friendly and patient. There was no charge for parking which is different from most of the area hotels that charge at least $20 a day. The pool is on the main floor and has windows to the lobby and elevator on 2 sides and hotel rooms on the other two. It is a salt water pool, which is nice,

Summary Heading: Always a great stay at this hotel!
Summary: We really like this hotel. This is our 3rd stay in 18 mos. It has everything we look for, free wifi, free parking, free breakfast.  The staff are amazing.  Jessica at the front desk was brilliant, she always seemed to be at the desk if we needed anything, and she just knocked our socks off every time. And with a smile on her face.  I had to rent a scooter this disney trip, and the whole front desk staff went out of their way to help me store it, charge it, even gave me tips on driving it. Amazing!  The breakfast area does get busy with families, so make sure you go early during peak times, or plan to go a bit later. We love sitting on the roof eating breakfast and looking out over the back of California adventure.  We will definitely be back, as well as, recommend this hotel to

We were exhausted after a day at CA Adventure so we were happy with the easy fast checkin, spacious room and nice beds. Breakfast was really good and free 😊 with lots of choices. Clean and close enough to walk to Disneyland.

This hotel was very nice, spacious, cozy and extremely clean. The elephant towel on the bed was a big plus for my daughter. It is conveniently in a centralized location close to many shops and amusement parks. I would highly recommend it!

It took 30 minutes to find a parking spot and many people doubke park making it difficult to navigate. We checked out and two cars were blocking us. They were able to get one owner to move but it took a couple hours before they called a tow truck to move the other car. The room was outdated and the outlets in the bathroom did not work. The outlet in the hall sparked when we plugged in a curling iron. The carpet in the room looked dirty and the pillows were flat and hard.  We are stuck here right now like the Hotel California song. We can check out but we cannot leave. I will never stay here again due to parking issues alone. The staff wants me to try to manuever around the car. There is absolutely no physical way it will work with a van parked next to me over the line. If I hit

The Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was a great place to stay when we went to a graduation at Chapman University and Disneyland.  We were upgraded without asking.  My two boys enjoyed their own room with bunk beds.   They even had their own tv.  The breakfast was great.  Everyone was pleasant.  It has free parking.  Only downside was the construction and we weren't able to be with the rest of the family.  Great place to stay and would stay again.

My family and I stayed at the hotel last weekend. June 12-13 2adults 2teens and 2kids. We picked the hotel due distance to Disneyland, breakfast, space in the room and parking. I wasn't disappointed at all! They are in the process of remodeling rooms so some sections of rooms were blocked off but nothing that that affect our stay. Staff was great! Very friendly and easy to get things done. Distance to Disneyland wasn't far but after a long day it seemed like a long walk. I was pleasantly surprised with breakfast. It had a little bit for everyone. Coffee was fresh and always filled. They had eggs, yummy potatoes,biscuits and gravy, make your own waffles, cereals, yogurt, and donuts. The room had two queen beds and a queen pullout. Plenty of space. Clean up was well done! Everyday

Summary Heading: Please don't believe the positive reviews for this hotel! It is terrible.
Summary: This hotel is completely run down and filthy. You will be paying premium prices for a low budget hotel. Filthy carpets, paint scrapped off the walls, closet doors falling off. I could go on and on about how awful this hotel is. I don't usually leave reviews but had to write to hopefully save others from an awful experience.

I got this hotel through the discount that my corporate office supplies for us. When we got to the hotel it was late and the parking is super tight and extremely limited. (Not happy). After getting checked in the front desk informed me of an additional fee i needed to pay for resort fee, ( Not Happy). We went up to our room and the lights are terrible you can't see anything at all what so ever so dull in the room, one of the TVs had such terrible reception it only had one channel, called maintenance for the light bulbs being so dark, they told me that's just how it is nothing they can do. (Not Happy). The restroom SMELLED SO BAD LIKE MOLD AND PEE, FLAT OUT TERRIBLE (NOT HAPPY). The breakfast was alright because it was free, I'd rather pay to eat something else honestly. (Not

So I got this hotel on Hotwire and was happy because from the website, it looked like nice hotel and I got a great deal. Well it was nice until I got there. We had a late check in. In a nutshell, when I went to park there were no more spaces so I called the front she said I can park in a red zone as long as I wasn't blocking anyone and I won't get towed. Ugh. People were in the parking garage were smoking pot and it smelled so bad. I was also with my nine year old son who I had to explain what the smell was. So we are hustling carrying all of our bags to get inside. Then we take the elevator to our room to find out we took the wrong elevator and can't access our room from the main elevator. We finally find the right elevator and get to our room. Bed was as hard as the floor,

The thing about this hotel is the location. It could not have been better! 200 metres from the entry of Disneyland and was perfectly safe walking to at night with all the people around.  The staff could have been a bit more friendly but were fine. There was one night where the fire alarm went off at 4:30am which was a bit frustrating and when it was blamed on smoke from the kitchen it seemed it bit strange... The room itself was clean and quite large. A bit more range at breakfast would have been great, but since it was free it was good.

Summary Heading: Everything you need and more for a visit to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 4 (two children 12 and 10) stayed for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland and we would stay again.  Location is perfect with Disney only a 10 minute walk down the road with plenty of family friendly restaurants in-between (ihop, dennys).  7 Eleven is right next door for those quick snacks and CVS pharmacy opposite.  The complimentary breakfast gave us a good start to the day, beds comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. ATM in foyer is handy.    You generally don't know how good a place is until something goes wrong.  So when our toilet blocked and flooded just before we headed out for the day you knew you were in good hands when it only took minutes for a response to fix and clean and we could get on our way.

Our stay was ok.  Average to Excellent customer service. Average was bartender/waiter in the attached restaurant. excellent were most other folks especially the male hispanic concierge.  Prices were ok, the "Suite" was a little silly and a little small for 4 adults and 2 kids but we made it. Great location. Easy walk to Disneyland There are some things you could do ... Help with bags to the rooms Change your carpeting.. yuk Get an elevator that goes from the basement parking to the top floor. The breakfast was nice but no meat on saturday?? unless you call the little ham chunks in the eggs that turned gray, yuk again. NO NEWSPAPERS what the heck.

Summary Heading: Convenient to DL and free breakfast!
Summary: This hotel worked out fine for our family of five. Our room had two queens and a sofa sleeper. The free breakfast was a big plus...eggs, sausage, waffle station, fruit, pastries, juice and coffee. With the cost of food in DL, it was great not having to worry about buying breakfast out. It was about a 10 minute walk to the parks....very convenient. The staff was very helpful. When we asked about bus tours in LA, the front desk staff helped us reserve spots. Pool and hot tub felt great after a long day in the parks. Free parking was also a plus. Only downside was that the furniture in the room was a bit worn and in need of some updating. I also had some concern about the door's safety lock. It was very loose and needed to be fixed. All in all, we were happy with the accommodations.

My family loved this hotel. It was clean, close to Disney and the rates are reasonable. The bedding is all white and spotless. The towels were plush and they did not hesitate to give us more when we asked. The breakfast is edible and offered a variety. We all started our days at Disney with a full belly, which saved us a lot of money. The pool is not giant but it is clean and my small children loved to play in it while i relaxed in the hot tub. The staff were all helpful and kind to my entire family. The free parking, microwave and in room fridge also helped us save money!

We chose this property for our Disneyland vacation for the price, the ability to walk to the park and the free parking.  Our room face the park so we were able to see the fireworks and Hollywood Tower Hotel ride.  The room was spacious with 2 Queen beds and a step down sitting area that had a sofa bed thus the room would accommodate 6 comfortably.  The beds were comfortable  and the bathroom was large.  The property includes morning breakfast had warm and cold selections.  There was something offered for every type breakfast eating.  The breakfast area was very large and also had room top outdoor seating as it was located on the 5th floor.  Each floor had a sitting area by the elevators and though not used there was a well kept swimming pool. Another nicety was the ice water in

Summary Heading: Best hotel experience in Anaheim ever
Summary: I have stayed in 10 different hotels around the Disneyland Parks over the years.  This hotel has been the best experience from any other of the places I've stayed.  I highly recommend it, especially if you have children.  Felt extra safe with security in the premises.

My family and I stayed at the Desert Palms for one night before a full day at Disney Land, which is a short 15-minute walk from the park. It was a "surprise" hotel for a Groupon Getaway, meaning you do not know the property until your purchase is confirmed. Upon check-in we received the room type we requested, with two queen-sized beds. We did notice how humid the room was. Don't know where all the moisture came from, and perhaps we could have done something with the AC, but the humidity contributed to a less than ideal night's sleep. Our room was in need of renovation; perhaps it was one that had not had the updates yet?  On another note, the room rate did include breakfast, which is on the 5th floor. There were many options which satisfied everyone in my family. I also

This is a very nice motel, with a decent breakfast.   Very close to Disneyland.   I caked the motel directly and received the best price available.   It's worth the money to stay here.   Free pictures next to the front entry way, free lemon water, exercise room is OK.   Very nice over all.

We had a total of 2 families staying in a suite: 2 adults, 1 kids + 2 adults, 2 kids. The suite we stayed in had 2 rooms and 2 bathrooms. The room was laid out in a long hallway. One room, as one of the reviewers had mentioned, had no window so I was not taken by surprise. The room was listed as non-smoking but we had holes in our bed sheets that look like cigarette burns.   Pros: - Hot breakfast included. This was convenient. - 15 minutes walking distance to the disneyland resort  Cons: - No toiletries provided. When we called to request it, they dropped off one SMALL bottle of shampoo and one bar of soap for ALL of us (yep.. for 4 adults and 3 kids). They dropped off a couple more bottles of shampoo the next day when we run into housekeeping on the way out. - One thermostat

A very nice hotel, within walking distance of Disneyland. Super clean, well maintained, cute towel art, two room suites with bunkbeds, among other rooms. Nice restaurants within walking distance. Personnel were helpful and friendly.

Nice Hotel, walk to Disneyland Park. Gave us a free upgrade for a view of Disney park, free hot breakfast buffet . Helpful people at the front desk. Good for Families. I would recommend this hotel for Disneyland visit.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel near Disneyland! Above and Beyond Costumer Service!
Summary: I stayed here for the first time April 26th with my husband and our children. The hotel is very well kept. They have a very good breakfast with eggs, sausage,waffles, etc. The free parking was a huge bonus! The location was close to Disneyland, it took only 10 minutes to walk to the front entrance with two babies in strollers.   On our first night we encountered a problem. The room assigned to us was not the suite with bunk beds we had reserved. We called the front desk, and were told that the suite they had planned to give us had been deemed unfit for rental. They explained that another suite with bunk beds would be available the next day, and to leave our suitcases by the door so they could move the to the new room while we enjoyed Disneyland. When we returned our bags were in

I found this hotel by mistake and am so glad I did. When searching for hotels for the Disneyland area I found this hotel has real family suites. Two rooms both with their own TV's. We got the room with one king bed and the kids room had bunk beds and a pull out bed.  The hotel was clean, staff wonderful, parking was free and they even had a reasonably priced restaurant on site, one that also delivers to your room.  As for location you could not get better, five minuet walk from the gate, and free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for 60th B-Day Celebration!
Summary: 3 of us stayed 4 nights to celebrate our 60th Birthdays. Very nice hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff! We were so happy to get a free room upgrade so that each of us would have our own bed!  We also really appreciated that you arranged for our  private taxi/shuttle to the airport after we checked out. The price was reasonable and the driver was excellent!  We especially liked that this hotel was so close to Disneyland!

I stayed here for 3 nights in April and liked it very much. I had one of the larger rooms . Things I liked: - Good location with reasonable food options nearby - Pretty good breakfast -Free internet ( the Sheraton still charges) - Small pool - The hotel was spotless  - Close to a 7-11 which has 2 pizzas for $10! - Free business center - Free parking  The only thing I have is they charged us a 'resort fee'. The hotel should just include this into the price. This is not the 4 Seasons on the Beach c'mon. We paid $130 per night. Another small thing was that non of the cleaning staff spoke a word of English. Overall we liked this hotel. Try to negotiate them to waive the resort fee.

We had to wait for a room, even though we were there at proper time.  Was hard to find parking space sometimes.  Restaurant was TERRIBLE both service and food.  Beds were extremely uncomfortable.  Wireless internet was very weak.  Had to hang out in corner of the room hoping to get a signal.  TV didn't work upon check-in.  Had to wait for service tech to repair.  2nd bedroom with bunk beds and sofa bed was super tiny.  When sofa bed was opened kids couldn't get out of the bed.  Room was SUPER loud and we complained to the front desk multiple times and nothing was done about it.  The noise went on past 10pm on multiple nights.  Worst stay ever!  We cut our vacation short because the beds were uncomfortable. Room was not the cleanest.

We had a great stay. Our situation with check in was a little complicated, but the front desk was able to help us out even more than we expected.  Breakfast room was large enough that there was always somewhere to sit. The food was good. Large, comfortable lobby. Flavored ice water was wonderful. The front desk always answered our questions and responded to requests for extra blankets, questions, and other help.  The room was great. We didn't use the pool, but it seemed to be popular with other guests. Within walking distance to Disneyland and multiple restaurants.

Summary Heading: A little worn out but good layout for families
Summary: We stayed here one night last weekend.  They were working on one wing of the hotel.  Put us in a room right next to the elevator and pool (2nd floor). We heard the Disneyland fireworks very loudly, people walking by/in and out of the elevator, people above us using the bathroom late at night.  The alarm clock in the room wouldn't light up so it was impossible to see the time in the middle of the night.  Plus, it was really stuffy and there were no windows to open up in the front room.    We must have been assigned a two bedroom/bath suite.  The room had four full-sized beds, two complete bathrooms with showers.  Beds were fine.  I had to wake up early to run the Tinkerbell Half Marathon and was able to close the door on the 2nd bedroom so as not to wake the kids.  Wifi was free

When looking for a hotel to stay for our Disneyland weekend, this hotel had all my must-haves: close distance to the park, free parking, free breakfast, pool and free Wi-Fi.  It was clean, somewhat updated decor.  Located on Harbor Blvd and W. Katella Ave, e walked back and forth to the park; about 15 minutes.  We had good weather so we didn't mind; saved us the parking fee and there was fruit flavored water in the lobby to help us hydrate. The breakfast buffet included eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, cereal, make-your-own waffles, fruit and pastries.  We requested a top floor room and it turned out to be the 4th floor because the 5th floor is where the banquet rooms are.  I didn't hear any street noise.  Staff were friendly. Across the street is a CVS and the Anaheim convention

Everyone was helpful. We were there early, so they allowed us to store our bags while we went to Disneyland. Once we checked in, the room was very nice. Had 2 queen beds, which were comfy. The only thing the complimentary breakfast wasn't too good, but there are plenty of restaurants to choose from around the hotel area. I would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Nice family place close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland/California Adventure.  It is a short walk to the park and a good value for the money.  We stayed in the family suite with the 2 queen beds and kitchen.  It was a nice space.  The beds were comfortable.  The hotel is not really quiet, though.  We were on the side facing Katella and you could hear the traffic noise.  In addition, I could hear kids running around and stomping in the room above us and one night someone on our floor burnt popcorn in their room and you could smell it for hours.  The room itself was clean and comfortable.  The hotel staff was great, very helpful.  I asked for extra pillows and they were brought immediately.  In addition, the TV wasn't working and someone came within 5 minutes to fix the problem.

Summary Heading: Expected a better hotel for the rating
Summary: This hotel was rated a 4 star so we were really excited to stay here.  When we first got to the room, it was smelly and the decor was dated (at best).That is something that is liveable. The problem with this hotel is when the sun sets. The room was loud - we may as well have been asleep on the sidewalk. The bed was hard and old and uncomfortable. The view from our room was a wall and yet there was so much light coming into the room. Suffice it to say we didn't get much sleep that night. This hotel is a 2 star at best - not a 4.

I've stayed at this hotel and various hotels in the area many times and when I can get a great deal I will come back here every time! This Hotel may cost a little more but the savings on breakfast makes it worth it and you actually save when you come as a family! This last trip we had 2 rooms, one room had an issue with the fridge not working in the room when we checked in and the front desk had maintenance replace it and it was done quickly! We also needed to upgrade our room and the front desk worked with us and gave us a great deal!  The location is just around the corner to Disney, breakfast is better than others in the area, and the staff is very accommodating!  I would recommend this hotel to many and do, when you see the price and compare it to others take in to

The Desert Palms Hotel is the ONLY hotel we stay at when visiting Disneyland! Look no further, it is a great hotel! The staff has always been super helpful and friendly. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. There are shuttles though that pick up and drop off in front of the hotel. There is a 7-11 and a market right next door. Parking is free. Wi-fi works great and is free as well. There is a great complimentary breakfast. While we stayed they served eggs, sausage, biscuits, gravy, potatoes, waffles, donuts, fruit, and cereal. There are great in room safes, microwaves, and fridges. And the price is great. We had a great trip.. Thank you Desert Palms!

My family stayed at The Desert Palms at the tail end of Spring Break.  While certainly not a 5 star luxury hotel this is a nice place to stay.  The staff was friendly and check-in/check-out was a breeze.  Even when running into staff in the halls they always had a smile and kind word.    I have a family of 5 and had the family suite.  I believe it's called the Yuha.  It was large enough for us to fit into and move around in and plenty or room for everyone to sleep in.  Yes, the room needs updating but that's cosmetic.  The bed wasn't as comfortable as I'd like, too soft for me but was clean.    They offer a free breakfast on the 5th floor.  It was better than I had expected with eggs, potatoes, sausage, all kinds of breads to toast and a waffle station.  Free parking is a huge
