Summary Heading: Worst hotel at Disneyland is Desert Palms
Summary: This was by far the worst stay at Disneyland ever, we had a group of 30 and everyone thought the same, with the exception of the breakfast staff who were great everyone else was rude and uncaring, in particular Jesus on the desk provided the very worst customer service I have experienced in 40 years of travelling!  Our room was dark, dingy, noisy, out of date, unclean and had appliances that didn't work. Pool was very small and unclean, dirty tissues all around the outside and no towels, upon asking for them they took over half hour to arrive. Will never stay here again and would never recommend. There are lots of closer better hotels for your Disney stay and this one certainly took the magic out of our holiday.

We had five adults in our party.  Our room had two separate bedrooms and also two separate bathrooms.  Worked great for our situation!  Also we were able to just walk to the nearby theme parks.  The staff was very friendly and helpful - - - with one exception who must have been having a bad day.  :-)  We would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Looking for best accommodations and value
Summary: We are a family of 6 (two teens two toddler my hubby and I) so we definitely needed a good size room. We didn't expect the size of the room we got it was big very comfy and lots of room for us all especially with our play pen two strollers and luggage. The overall value and location was perfect as well. We enjoyed our stay, the staff was very helpful the breakfast was delicious. Especially their salsa. We will stay here again.

I've stayed at many hotels near the Disneyland Resort and this one was fantastic. Breakfast was hot and delicious, and the room was great. The staff was very helpful and friendly to deal with. For the price I would definitely stay there again.

A very good location near Disneyland, about a 5 minute walk.  It  close to many restaurants and   there is a 7-Eleven next to it.  The Wifi worked and the breakfast was basic but good. The room was a bit outdated but clean.  The only issue was the shower head did not work so taking a shower took a long time.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  All in all, a good place to stay.

My family and I had a great stay at Desert Palms Anaheim.  So many good things to say: Rooms were very clean and beds were comfortable. Having the drop down area for the second tv and table/chairs was great so the kids could go to sleep and the parents stay up without bugging them.   Absolutely loved having breakfast at the hotel and the food options were good.   Pool was small but nice and thank you for having pool towels as we forgot ours!!   Great walking distance for Disneyland and the Garden Walk for dining options. The staff was very nice and helpful.  Would recommend others to stay here.   Thank you.  McIntyre Family

Summary Heading: Great location and value for the entire group
Summary: The hotel is very clean, beds were comfortable and after the included breakfast and a 10 minute walk from the spacious lobby, one is at the resort entrance ready for action and fun (shorter walk to the Anaheim Convention Center).  The concierge was very friendly and helpful.  For those that get the suites, there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance (IHOP, Dennys, Tony Roma's, Chesecake Factory, Downtown Disney,etc) as well as a 7-11 right next door, a CVS Pharmacy across the street and a liquor store next to the 7-11.  Our stay was in April 2015.  Weather was great.

The staff at this hotel are top notch.  Everyone was a pleasure to speak to and they were more then happy to help with any thing that came up.  We stayed here for an event at the convention center and couldn't have asked for a better location.  It's also very convenient to Disneyland.  I will definitely look to get a room here first the next time I go to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great place to relax at the end of a long day!
Summary: This is not the first time, or the last time we'll stay at this hotel. It's a quick walk to Disneyland/right behind California Adventure. Walking distance to the Garden Walk, which has a bunch of good places to eat. The rooms are giant, which is nice after a day of carrying stuff around, to be able to just toss your things down, and still have room to relax without being in a big pile of "stuff"! Staff is always friendly and willing to help. This is our hotel of choice for all of our Disney trips...which is a lot!

We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was clean and very quiet.  It is a short 10 minute walk to Disneyland and right next to the Garden Walk.  The pizza at the Sand Box Restaurant was delicious!  All of the employees were friendly and courteous.  We will book again!!

Stayed at this hotel for a week. Upon arriving and checking in the employee at the front desk was very unfriendly.  The furniture in the lobby was old and worn.  This was the same in our room it was old and run down, the walls needed cleaning and painting.  Don't take your shoes off.  The bathroom needed a update, spaces between the tiles filled with silicone. The Internet was terrible it didn't work 80% of the time.  This hotel needs a make over.  The pool is small, I developed a bad rash I assume from the hot tub.  The positives ; the staff really tried to keep things working.  Breakfast was alright, the ladies that work the breakfast worked very hard to keep things running.  The water in the lobby with the fruit in it was very refreshing after a long day on your feet.  Upon

After six nights in a hotel room, the Desert Palms was a nice respite offering the extra room to stretch out.  It is very convenient to Disney, in fact a short, safe walk not necessarily longer than some walks I've made from the parking lot of Disney World in Florida.  It was a very good place to stay for a family with lots of eating options available off the property.  The breakfast was most certainly fashioned after Hampton Inn, and offered ample food and seating.  The only negative about the hotel was the location of our room.  We were on the 4th floor, evidently directly under the kitchen (breakfast was on the 5th floor).  I was awakened every morning at 4:00am as I am a light sleeper.  It was just the sounds of busy people moving things across the floor in preparation for

We appreciated and enjoyed our stay very much at the Desert Palms Hotel.  We stayed in the 2 room 8-person connected suite.  It was nice for all the family to be together.  I really appreciated the ease of check-in and how seamlessly the hotel reservation had gone since we booked it with a third party package deal. I appreciated the water containers in the lobby and how refreshing that was as we were coming or going to the various parks. We enjoyed the breakfast and felt like there was a good variety for all the members of our party. The room was very clean and the maid service took care of things very well. The room above us seemed to have a lot of jumping going on before quiet time, but after that it was not noticed.  The light in the bathroom was somewhat dim.  I don't know

We went to Disneyland this summer and stayed at the Palms.  We booked the hotel in a rush and not knowing much about it. To be honest: we would not do it again.  We felt the hotel was overpriced and didn't care much about the guests.  We asked for a double room that was expected to be big enough to allocate 8 people (4 adults + 4 kids) and we were given a small double cubicle in which we had a hard time to even store our suitcases.   Needless to say that it wasn't cheap, but we'd had been glad to pay more to get some more space. We just felt that what we got did not meet the expectations that the booking was selling.  As a side note - an eat as you can breakfast was supposed to be included in the price, but it was extremely crowded and you had to fight to get something despite

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: The two room suite with a king and two bunk beds worked well for our family of five. The second room with the bunk bed also had a pull-out couch bed. We tried the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) but that turned out to be a horrible experience. We had bought the ticket at the hotel and since we weren't able to use it they applied the amount toward our room. It's only about a 10-15 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland/DCA with kids in tow so we went with that.  The full breakfast at the hotel was perfect and included lots of different food which is good for my kids since they all have different tastes. My kids also loved the pool. The staff was very polite and helpful.  The negative that bothered me the most was that the wifi was pretty flaky. Speeds were slow, or at times

Very helpful staff, welcome atmosphere and safe environment. With the hotel used by families visiting Disneyland it felt safe and happy to be there. The breakfast is quite varied with cereals, pastries, fruit and waffles which was great. The rooms are more or less cleaned everyday which was great to come back to after a day out! The location is perfect for Disneyland, just a 10 minute walk around the corner(literally) and for the business centre a little way down the road taxi's are reliable from the hotel. The noise level at night was very low, if any, as hardly anyone was out very late. The only noticeable noise was in the mornings when excited children were running down the halls ready for a day out.

Very convenient location to Disneyland & I-5, hotel's ad said 7 minutes from front gate, must have not have a 5 yr old walking with them. Room was clean but carpet & bathrooms were aged. Beds & pillow were comfortable.  We had a 2nd floor Kalihari suite that overlooked the pool that was very noisy until 10:00PM. The elevator setup was not very convenient as you had to either go to the main lobby from the 2nd floor or go to the 4th floor & take the stairway to the 5th floor where the breakfast was served.  The complimentary breakfast was ok, the usual scrambled eggs, sausage, fruit etc. Overall ok place to stay for location.

I had a great stay, but didn't like that we had to wait till 3pm to get a room. Also I was not charged Resort fees by getaroom.com, so I was surprised when the Clerk told me I would have to pay $11.00 a day.  And don't stay in the 2nd floor of this hotel, the elevator system is bad. You have to go down to the 1st floor from the 2nd floor, get on a different elevator to go to the 5th floor to eat breakfast. Then to get to the basement parking garage you have to go to the first floor get on a different elevator to take you to the basement.     In all the room was clean the food was excellent and the staff were courteous. We would definitely return ! Just not to the 2nd floor : ).

The front desk people could not have been nicer. Especially Jessica. Very helpful and friendly. The walk to the park is about 10 to 15 minutes depending on your walking speed. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable.  The carepet  could  stand to be a little cleaner. My only complaint would be the breakfast.  While it was free, not very many healthy choices.  More fresh fruit and some unsweetened yogurts and ceral would be great. We ate one night in the hotel restaurant,  sorry to say I would not recommend it. Food was slow to come out as was the service, and not very good, plus on the expenise side. Belive it  or not the hot food from 7 11  next to the hotel was  much better and way less expensive. Try the bbq wings. Nice to have free parking and free wifi. Overall would stay

My family and friends always stay at the Desert Palms for our Disneyland trips. We like the amenities and Disney pass discount. It's close to the park and budget friendly places to eat for our family.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location, very good value, would stay there again
Summary: We stayed here at the beginning of March, our first time to Anaheim. I actually booked the hotel through Hotwire and paid £50 absolute bargain as it included parking and free hot breakfast !  Public area's are very clean , staff pleasant, didn't use the pool but it looked nice enough.  We were given a suite overlooking the Tower of Terror and CARs ride, first impressions were very good, spacious, clean , wifi , 2 tv's etc.  However when my kids came to get into bed their bed was wet !! Upon inspection i could see 2 layers were soaked with pee, the bed had been made up like that as the top was clean and dry there is no way house keeping did not see this !! My husband went down to reception and they sent house keeping up asap to sort it.   Other than that we had no issues,

Great family holiday the location couldn't be any better for visiting Disneyland & California Adventure, 10 minutes walking distance, so no parking fees!  Our room was very nice & spacious cleaned everyday. Great cold A/C.  Breakfast also a bonus. Great free wifi too!

We spent 4 days at this resort. Freindly staff and great location to the parks. We walked each day to Disneyland and California Adventure Park (Approx. 2 or 3 blocks/ 5 minute walk). My kids enjoyed the adventure park much more than Disneyland. Being we are from Florida and have been to Disney World a bunch.Here is the best kept secret, request the family suite on the 5th floor. There are only 4 suites on the entire floor and you are across the hallway from the complementary breakfast room. (The breakfast is quite good with lots of choices from waffles, eggs, fruit, donuts, cereal, sausage and coffee). I purchased a hot travel mug from the 7-11 next door to the hotel and had free refills until 11 am. when breakfast closed down. We brought the breakfast back to our room and

The staff at Desert Palms Hotel are extremely helpful and will put every effort in to make your stay there your best experience. The hotel is very conveniently located on the corner of the Disneyland block. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable and there is a bar/restaurant on the property.

I have stayed at the Desert Palms several times. The price is right, Disneyland is just down the road with only one easy light to wait for, walking is no problem even when tired! The rooms are clean, not the modern up to date furnishing but clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I asked for extra pillows and they were there in minutes. The blow dryer quit working and was quickly replaced without my morning routine skipping a beat. The breakfast has many options to choose from. Overall I highly recommend the Desert Palms!!

We stayed in this hotel for our trip to Disneyland. We were very glad that this hotel was close to Disneyland and we could walk their. I was also glad that there was WiFi so I could stay in touch with my friends and sent them pictures of my trip. The breakfast was something I was really happy with. There was a great variety of different things I could eat for breakfast, I especially enjoyed the waffles.

We took our 2 (*ages 4 1/2 & 7) to Disneyland. Arriving at 9:30am we were delighted to be able to leave our car for the full 2 days for free! It took us 10 min to walk to the maingate. Arr.back at 9:30pm where, the boys were thrilled that they had their own room with bunkbeds, couch, kid table & chairs, & their own TV! Our 4 1/2 yr. old said "This is the BEST trip ever!"  The rate also included a breakfast.  The staff always had a smile when interacting with us and never failed to be accommodating.  We wouldn't hesitate to refer OR return to the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites!

we have stayed at the desert palms numerous times. we do not even bother to check for other lodging when we go to disneyland. the staff and facility is top notch, a fantastic value fort he price. very clean,quiet and convenient. the desert palms suites suit our needs perfectly!

I was very impressed. The hotel was clean, beds were very comfortable. Large room with large closet. The hot breakfast was to die for. We will be staying here every time we visit Disneyland. I would recommend it.

Close walking distance to Disneyland, free parking, nice breakfast. Large rooms, clean hotel, very nice staff, especially Jessica at the front desk. Convenience store next door and across the street.  Attend Disneyland twice a year, always our hotel of choice. Whether there are 3-6 of us, there is always a room size to fit our needs.

Solid hotel that is family friendly to the cost conscious.  Large rooms with refrigerators and microwaves make it easy for families to have items on hand for evening snacks/gatherings.  The included breakfast covers all the basic bases for all members of a family.  Free parking is a real plus.  I wouldn't hesitate returning.

This was our first time staying at the Desert Palms, and it was a delight! The check-in clerk was so friendly and allowed us to check-in early without question. My husband had to work remotely, so this was so nice and much better than him having to make conference calls in the car. Great location- the walk to the park was short and the CVS across the street was a nice perk. The free parking and breakfast were fabulous. What a nice, full spread for being complimentary!   The rooms were nice and well kempt. We stayed in the 2- bedroom, 2-bathroom suite. One concern we had was that the one room of the suite had to be freezing in order for the other room to cool down; it would be much better to have dual temperature control. Also, the bathrooms were not well ventilated and the light

Our stay at the Desert Palms was super!!  We travel for pleasure quite a bit and didn't have one complaint and that is saying a lot!!  The walk to Disneyland was perfect, only a few blocks away. Front desk staff was very accommodating and our room was a suite which gave us some extra space to unwind. Would stay at Desert Palms again!

Our stay with Desert Palms was wonderful! The front desk staff were friendly and eager to help. The room is nice, a little outdated, but overall comfortable. Breakfast was an added plus. A good variety of hot and cold items.  Disneyland is a 15-20 min walk away.

Summary Heading: Fantastic value, but a bit of a walk
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed in a kitchenette suite for 7 nights February-March 2015. The staff are fantastic and the room was quite nice. The kitchen was fully stocked and it was nice to see a full-size fridge/freezer. Parking and wifi are free. Wifi wasn't the snappiest; we didn't have to enter any passwords to connect so I suspect this is due to numerous piggybackers on their network.  We have 2 young boys who can't survive full days in the Anaheim sun without their afternoon nap, so it's critical that we have a hotel that is close to the main gate. The usual Inn we stay at was fully booked so we gave this place a shot. I can't rave enough about this place, the people that work there, the amazing complimentary breakfast, and the overall bang for your buck...   But I MUST tell you -

Our Daughter's family and my husband and I visited Disneyland Feb. 16-19th and stayed at the Desert Palms.  We had two connecting rooms which were extremely clean and very comfortable.  The room decor does need updating and I was informed they are scheduled for this in the coming year.  The breakfast was plentiful and compares favorably with other hotels in this category.  The pool was a big hit and was well maintained.  We greatly appreciated the hot tub after hours of walking at Disney  We were disappointed in the internet reception. In room internet was extremely slow or non-existent.  However we got good reception in the lobby.    The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  We ate one meal in the small onsite restaurant.  Although the staff was very nice we'd advise

Easy walk to Disneyland without having to cross any streets. Conveniently located next to a convenience store and cheap souvenir shop (1/2 price of what you'll pay inside the park!). Rooms were clean, breakfast was included.  Rooms are larger than what we've typically found in this area. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Look no further. Desert Palms is #1
Summary: Our trip to Disneyland was great, but Desert Palms made it even better. Its not fancy but it is clean, and comfortable. You are 8 minutes walking to the "Happiest place on earth". Come back to our room in the afternoon for a nice rest or jump in the pool. Refreshments upon entering the lobby. It couldnt have been better. No parking fees, close to some fantastic restaurants. It was great. Friendly staff, hard working cleaning staff, Desert Palms is on our hit list for our next Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: A one time stay for me
Summary: We stayed here for my daughters cheer competition this past weekend. While the customer service is good, the interior leaves A LOT to be desired. The rooms are on the larger side, but the decor is very used and old, lots on scratches,dings, and such. The pull out couches are very hard to sleep on.  The amount of condensation that great on the windows is crazy, there was so mildew growth by window next to floor. The breakfast may be the saving grace for this hotel.   For the amount of money paid for rooms, I definately accepted much more.  Next time I will stay either at the Embassy Suites, or Candy Cane Inn.  Not a very satisfied customer..

We stayed here again for a business convention at Anaheim Convention Center which is conveniently located in the next block, so no parking fees!  The hotel had lots of guests bound for Disneyland, which again is right around another corner, so no parking fees for them, either!  This is a very well run hotel, with everything you need for a very nice stay.  A good breakfast, good coffee, nicely appointed rooms.  And, I am Mrs. Clean and there isn't a speck of dust or dirt in the whole place.  The pool is sparkling, the windows are sparkling.  The staff is friendly, efficient and helpful.  Another thing about those kiddies staying there bound for the nearby Disney Parks--the walls must be insulated very well because in the room you couldn't here a thing going on outside of it--so

In my recent visit to Anaheim, my family stayed in Dessert Palms Hotel  My overall experience, staying at the Dessert Palms Hotel was great!  The hotel is conveniently located close to Disney land within few minutes working distance.  . The hotel rooms are nicely cleaned, spacious and full with basic facilities We stayed in spacious double queen room. The beds and  mattresses were very comfortable. However the bath is not that great as hot water and cold water mixture does not blend rightly together .AC/Heater was newer & worked great. Room was at end of hall so pretty quiet. Windows were well insulated. Noise from street was minimal. Breakfast is great. Complementary tea & coffee is available around the clock The staff is very friendly , helpful and courteous. The laundry and

They had everything we needed for a relaxing stay. They were able to accommodate us and our 4 kids comfortably in the suite. Free wifi was a great benefit. There seemed to be unlimited amounts of food at breakfast. Great way to enjoy Disney.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and excellent service
Summary: I was unsure about staying here, given the busy location.  I was attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center and also wanted to be close to Disney.  It proved to be a great place to stay with excellent service.   Everything exceeded my expectations, including the professional and caring service of front desk staff, housekeeping, breakfast servers and the folks in the attached restaurant.  I travel a lot for work and this was one of the best places I have stayed.  I appreciated the focus on professionalism and making us feel welcome and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Best Value, Service and Conveniently Located
Summary: My overall experience, staying at the Dessert Palms Hotel was great! There were some minor maintenance issues, but for the money I spent... I would book my next stay at your hotel in a heartbeat.  Everybody that I met that worked at the hotel was helpful and courteous. The hot breakfast was fabulous as well as the free parking not to mention being right outside the entrance to Disneyland.    I will spread the word with my family and friends regarding my stay at your hotel.  Keep up the hard work,

Hotel is a couple of long blocks off the Disneyland entrance which is a good walk to get you warmed up. It is self service ( No Valet, No Bell Person) you haul your own luggage to your room and have limited number of luggage carts so good luck if it's a busy time. We stayed in a family suite with two rooms two queen and it was pretty comfortable. Although the layout is kinda weird to me because you have to enter through the first room to get to the second room with a shared double sink area in between rooms. However it has two bathrooms which is great! Bathrooms were very clean, I'm impressed although it does have its minor flaws like the shower pull lever switch on the bath faucet is hard to pull so I had to do it for my kids and wife and the toilet paper is a bit to rough

Summary Heading: Close by Disneyland; Great mid range hotel and VERY friendly staff
Summary: I don't need a lot of amenities at a hotel when I visit Disneyland, because I spend all my time at the park.  My priorities are:   o A clean place   o Comfortable beds   o Reasonable Price with breakfast to help with my budget   o Parking (Free wifi)   o Close to the park, so I can get off my achin' feet quickly after leaving Disneyland.   I got this and more at the Desert Palms.  The plusses were: o  A knowledgable staff that knows the property and immediately moved us from a room with a noisy exterior door to a better room. I didn't even ask, Jessica did it automatically. o  A great breakfast that consisted of more than just pastries, waffles, toast and cereal.  This was a full breakfast with sausage, fruit, eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy as well as the pastries, waffles,

Stayed in spacious double queen room. It and bath were mostly updated and mattresses were very comfortable. AC/Heater was newer & worked great. Room was at end of hall so pretty quiet. Windows were well insulated. Noise from street was minimal. Breakfast room was very spacious but the breakfast food was heavy on carbs with nothing fresh except apples & oranges. Yogurt was served out of a big bowl, eggs were scrambled, oatmeal watery, only 2 types of dry cereal (nothing healthy), mediocre pastries and make your own waffles. Hotel staff were great and responsive. Pool was nice, parking was free and easy to do. Hotel was a bit of a walk to Disney entrance but very near a drug store and eateries. Resort & room safe fees jacked up room prices/night by $12 + tax.  Over all it's a nice

Summary Heading: Better Business Stay and Fun Atmosphere
Summary: My business plans required I be near Anaheim and I was looking for a good rate for a couple of days.  I found the Desert Palms via a search and thought the location looked convenient and surrounded by things to do.  On arrival, I spoke with Victor who understand I wasn't at the hotel for too much of the typical Disney visit.  I planned to spend a full week at the hotel and for this I was rewarded with a very nice room with plenty of work space and outlets.  Breakfast each day was very high quality with friendly staff keeping the food refreshed and coffee brewed.  This is a hotel that I'll return to for business and bring the family for the Disney adventures.  I highly recommend the hotel.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Desert Palm. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hot breakfast is a huge plus. The sandbox is a nice place to grab a drink, food is a priced on the high side but the quality is good.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff H,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, we try our best to make sure all of our guests feel welcome during their visit. I am also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free breakfast buffet!   We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: We stayed here a week in February during a family trip to California centered around Disneyland. We stayed in a Kid’s suite which has a separate room with bunk beds. We also had the complimentary breakfast which at best was cafeteria quality. We skipped it after the first day. Check-in was quick and painless as was checkout.   Pros: Location, Location, Location – You can walk to Disney and California Adventures and also Downtown Disney.  Friendly Staff – Everyone was very accommodating and helpful Family Centric – They know where the bread and butter is this close to Disney – They cater to families.  Parking – Easy no-hassle parking. A lot of resorts around Disney really ding you for the parking.   Cons:  Family Centric – I know, I know, I listed this as a pro and I love my kids
Manager Response: Hello Topherallen,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with other travelers. I am glad to hear you had a great stay with us and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: This property had all the amenities that I look for on my pilgrimages to Disneyland!  Stand-out items are the free underground parking, keeping your car safe and cool; and the complimentary hot breakfast served in a cheery room with a veranda overlooking Disney's California Adventure Park.  There is also a cute little gift shop, pool, exercise room, free Wi-Fi, and a restaurant.  We found the staff to be delightful and our room was perfect.   As a travel agent who specializes in selling Disney, I like to try out different properties in the surrounding area, so that I know which hotels offer the best value and experience for each client's needs.  I'm happy to say that this property covers almost everything for every type of traveler.
Manager Response: Hello Rhonda A,  Thank you for your review. I am so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, we try our best to provide excellent customer service.   We hope you can stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Inexpensive family option for Disney travel
Summary: We chose to stay at this property while on a business trip in order to save some money. I quickly referred to it in jest as shabby chic. For a family on a budget, it offers some nice amenities like a decent free breakfast and free parking. It is also very close to Disney and the convention center (walking distance). Unfortunately the hotel is a little dated and there was mold on my bathroom wall and in the exhaust vent. My coworker did not have the added bonus of mold in her room.

Summary Heading: You won’t need your “Cars” to get to Radiator Springs!
Summary: I just returned from taking my 4 year daughter on her first Disneyland trip for her birthday. You can’t beat the location of Desert Palms. It’s an easy walk even after a long a day at the park. Conveniently located next to 7-11 and CVS made it easy to pick up last minute snacks and supplies.  I found the staff to be very pleasant and was thrilled that our room was ready when we arrived at 11:30am. After a long drive there is nothing like an early check-in when you need a little nappy.  The breakfast was what you would expect for a continental style set up. Not the best but it served its purpose. We loaded up on waffles every morning to make sure our bellies were full before hitting the park. This definitely saves time and money from having to go out to breakfast every morning.

I requested a handicapped room and was given a regular room on the third floor. I requested it a month in advance. I was told my request doesn't show up when booked through Orbitz. How is a person to know this? The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable so it wasn't a complete loss. Beware of the bus stop to Disneyland. It is a second home for the homeless! It's very nice to have a stop right in front of the hotel, but every day we had to contend with homeless asking for money and often drunken behavior. I have to say the breakfast is a plus! I will just have to think it over if I really want to stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Family Accomidations and Close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel has a great set up for families. We stayed in a room that had an attached bunk room.  It had a door that closed it off from the rest of the suite.  We were traveling with 4 teenage girls so this was a great setup for them.  They had privacy and so did we.  It would work equally well for people with small children.  You could put them to bed, after a long day at the park, and still be able to do what you needed to for the rest of the evening without fear of waking them,  And what kids don't love bunk beds? The location was very near Disneyland.  It was a short walk there and probably not much longer than from some areas of the paring lot.  We checked out before going to the park so I was concerned about being able to leave the car on the property for the rest of the

Summary Heading: This is the only hotel you should stay in, when visiting Anaheim!
Summary: I am so impressed by this hotel and it's staff. The rooms are amazing, comfortable, and just feel like home. The breakfast in the morning was great and filling! I like that they allow you to take it to your room on a tray and enjoy in  your pajamas if wanted! Great location to Disney, and other shopping. The parking is great and there are so many great things to say about this hotel. Well done!!

Pleasantly surprised at how great the room was. The staff was friendly and attentive. The breakfast was hot and plentiful. I would have gave it 5 stars but the carpet needs some attention. Will definitely stay here again.

We really liked this hotel!  The free parking was fantastic, and the free breakfast was great!  Your typical fare: eggs, toast, cereal, yogurt, fruit, muffins, but some added bonuses that changed each day (sausage or hot oatmeal or biscuits and gravy).  The staff was excellent!  We asked if we could get a room with a view of the fireworks because we had our little one with us and knew we'd never see them.  They were able to upgrade our room to a suite with a partial view for no extra charge, which we thought was really nice of them to do.  If you do book with them we'd definitely recommend upgrading to the suite.  It was so spacious and comfy, and would be excellent for anyone travelling with kids!  The only thing we'd recommend if you're staying at this hotel is good walking

Summary Heading: Don't stay here. Save yourself the stress and money
Summary: This hotel looked ideal: close to the Disneyland entrance, kitchen suite ideal for families, next to 7-11, free parking, pool and breakfast was included.   But our stay was disappointing and extremely expensive. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.   AIR CONDITIONING When we first arrived and UNPACKED EVERYTHING. We noticed the fan was making weird sounds. They called maintenance and the issue could not be repaired.   We had to pack up everything again and were offered no apology or help moving.   BREAKFAST was ok. There were no healthy options.   KITCHEN We wanted a kitchen suite to prepare meals. However, there is no dishwasher house keeping does not clean dishes due to California law.   When on vacation I don't want to have MORE WORK. I want to enjoy my time as a family.

What a great family hotel.  The rooms were spacious, we are a family of 5, 2 Queens and sofa bed.  It is only a 10 minute walk from Disney Land.  Being able to have breakfast daily was a bonus.  The breakfast was great.  It is exactly what we wanted, we were there 3 days and our plan was to visit Disneyland for the 3 days, the hotel was a place where we can recharge and do it all again the next day  This is was absolutely the case.

We stayed at Desert Palm December 15th to 22nd. We were very lucky that a room was available early in the morning after a long flight from Melbourne Australia. We stayed in a Yuha Suite and found it to be always clean.The extra bedroom was fantastic and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was nice and sitting outside was great looking over Tower of Terror and the back of cars. The walk to the Disney area was safe with only one road to cross and it only took about 10 minutes. The take away restaurants across the road were handy and cheap and the CVS Pharmacy sold everything you need. We dined one night in the Sandbox Bar & Grille and found the service to friendly and the food was enjoyable. A great family place to stay close to Disney.

Clean hotel. Complimentary breakfast, wi-fi, and parking. Walking distance to Disneyland...no need to pay $18+ for parking at the Disneyland parking lot. For big families they have bunk beds along with pull out sofa which was neat. Friendly staff.

We recently stayed at desert palms hotel and suites and our family had a fantastic stay. The hotel is close to the parks which is a huge bonus. The daily breakfast was great for my family. Room were clean, the maid service was great. The front desk staff was fantastic, accommodating, and helpful!we loved our stay and our vacation! The staff made our stay so much better with all of their help.

We have stayed in a lot of hotels. I realise you get what you pay for but this hotel was awful.   The rooms are small. Tue walls are paper thin as are the ceilings. We could hear everything the people upstairs were doing. Anytime anyone had a shower in the hotel you could hear the water running through the pipes very loudly.   Breakfast was awful. I honestly felt like I was being served food in prison.   Very close to Disneyland. Walking distance and close to restaurants.

We watched the Disneyland New Years fireworks from our room, such a great view. The walk to the park is such a short distance its not worth using the ART bus. The buffet breakfast was very good, the staff bussed the tables quickly and food was hot and plentiful.

I come to Disneyland a few times a year and most often stay at this hotel.  I find it clean, safe, and comfortable.  I believe I have written other reviews on this place before, but this review will focus on the service and care the give you as a frequent stay-er. I called to make my reservation and they had me in their system.  They gave me a tremendous rate compared to what I had seen online for this hotel.  Thank you so much. I also carry their card with a note and a future  discount from a past stay. I arrived early in the morning knowing my room wouldn't be ready.  I checked in to a familiar face and handed my special card over.  They gave me a parking pass and I walked to the parks for the day.  I arrived back at 3 and checked in.  They then lowered my rate, again

Decent rates, breakfast, vibrant pool facilities, close to Disney and comfortable rooms. We had a great time staying here and the hotel staff were very polite and helpful. The concierge was also very helpful providing us with a map and a free entree at Bubba Gumps! We were there on a busy weekend but other than that, we had a fabulous stay here. Would definitely stay again!

I booked this hotel through Hotwire and I was glad I did. The hotel is just down the street from Disneyland and California Adventure, the free breakfast was absolutely delicious, and the room was huge. The only problem I has was when I checked out they charged a $40 reservation fee, which is the first I've ever had to pay, and I frankly thought i shouldn't have to pay it for simply making a reservation, but other than that it was a very pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, loved the bunkbeds and proximity to the partk
Summary: So we stayed here last year and I absolutely loved it.  The holel is nothing super especial but I have stayed at so many properties in the area and I find this hotel to be a great value. the price was moderate and our room was rather large. We had one of those suites in which the queen bed is in one room and the kids bunkbeds (plus a second TV) is completely divided. this allows families to have privacy and not overspend on extra rooms nor go crazy when spending the same room wtih the children.  Location is great because there is a 7/11 accross the street so we were constantly buying snacks there so we saved a ton of money on snacks to bring into the park or for late night.  You also have the ability to cross the street and take the shuttle without having to wait the 15 minutes

The Desert Palm Hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the Disney theme parks.  The lobby is clean and large.  The staff are helpful and friendly. Parking and Wifi are both free.  Our room was clean and everything in it functioned well.  The beds were comfortable.  Still though, this is a very plain and ordinary hotel with very simply decorated rooms.  The odor many comment on is very apparent.  Tap water in the hotel room tastes terrible and we didn't drink it. If price is a big factor during your vacation stay here (or go to the Candy Cane Inn next door).  It looks nicer.  If you are comfortable paying more, stay at 1 of the 3 Disney properties.  Even the most basic Disney hotel (Palace Pier) is a nicer though more expensive facility.  You don't get as much as the Desert Palm

Our stay was great, breakfast was also a plus but on our way out we checked out the gift shop in the lobby bought 12 pens/key chains, great price but didn't realize the total turns out the tax was just as much for the souvenirs we bought, once I realize what she did we were already on the road. So beware, use CASH, I think that was my mistake using my card.

Summary Heading: Good value if that's what you want
Summary: I attended a meeting over at the convention center and waited until the last minute. Location great for that and for going to Disneyland. Hotel itself ok...rooms are dated. Reminds me of 1960's motel rooms. Nothing fancy. Breakfast ok...lots of families so if you are there for business, go early before the kids overtake the place. Would I stay there again, sure if I was paying for it and wasn't planning on staying in my hotel for the majority of the time. Good value, clean rooms, nice staff

Summary Heading: If convenience and easy stay is what you're looking for this place is a must
Summary: This hotel like many others looks great and flawless on its pictures, but it could have been better. 2nd floor was disconnected from the rest of the hotel,.as you had to take a separate elevator to get to the lobby or the 5th floor breakfast area. The room had its flaws as some of the electrical plugs were old and didn't hold the plug in place. WIFI was spotty but sufficient. The fridge and microwave was a plus,but be careful with the electrical switch as you would mistakenly would press the reset button and the fridge would power off. The staff was great no problems there. Free parking was great as other hotels in the area charge. The location is the best part of this hotel. Located on Harbor and Katella, the hotel is close to restaurants and fast food and also CVS. Although no

Summary Heading: Go to place when going to Disney!
Summary: We always stay in the Suite with 2 Queen beds and the sunken living room with a pull out sofa.  We absoultely love the Hot breakfast, is another reason why we love this hotel.  Very Clean Rooms & Great Staff.

If you are cramming as many people as possible into a room, be advised that the hide-away bed will likely be the most uncomfortable thing you have ever slept on.  The privacy curtain was a great idea,  Room 353.   Your room will be clean, but hardly spotless.  I believe they vacuum, as opposed to Febreeze-ing everything, which was a plus in my books.  The room, towels, pillows smelled clean, no body odour/musty/dust issues.  Your staff will be professionally pleasant, but not legitimately friendly or inclined to go an extra mile for you.  The noted exception for me was housekeeping, who were nice to chat with.  I'm so sorry I cannot remember her name.    Your complimentary breakfast will have the basic staples such as an egg dish, an additional protein of some sort, toast,

Summary Heading: Tried something new...I wish I hadn't.
Summary: During this particular trip, my mom and I were surprising my sister, who lives in Iowa, with a trip to Disneyland that was completely paid for. I had originally booked the Anaheim Plaza Hotel and Suites, which I have stayed at 3 times before. But my mother and I were worried that my sister might not like it as it wasn't as nice as this hotel said it was. So I cancelled my other reservations and we booked at this hotel which was quite the mistake.  First impressions mean alot but this hotel staff was not told this. My mom and I had driven from Morgan Hill, CA leaving at 6am to beat the storm that was coming in (also the reason we were driving and not flying. We cancelled our flights because of the severity of the storms.) So we arrived around 12pm, my mom walked in to check us

Summary Heading: Good location for Disneyland. Good for family. Not much else.
Summary: Good location. If your looking for somewhere close to Disneyland this is a great option. Just a 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland with a few dining options along the way including a steakhouse, Denny's, pizza, subway and chinese. Good for a late night option after Disneyland I guess. This is a family hotel no doubt, so expect children, in the pool, in the arcade pretty much everywhere especially at Christmas. If your not good with this stay somewhere not so close to Disneyland. The hotel is clean is is well presented, small arcade but that doesn't really matter when there is a massive theme park around the corner. Includes a gym, where basic equipment is provided including small weights. The pool is small with a hot tub which is always full with people.  Now the rooms. I'm

My family and I stayed at this hotel during our Disneyland vacation. The staff was really nice and helpful. They were happy to help with any questions we had. The hotel was nice - very well kept and clean. We stayed in the suite that has a kitchen and loved the convenience it offered. The room had a separate bedroom and living room, which was great for putting the little ones to bed. The location is awesome! It only took us about 10-15 minutes to walk to the Disneyland entrance. They offer a pretty good breakfast every morning, which always included COFFEE(!!!), juice, waffles, eggs, sausage, potatoes, and pastries. One day during our stay they had breakfast burritos, which I enjoyed. It so was nice to leave for Disneyland with full stomachs. I would definitely stay at there

We booked this hotel through Costco as part of a Disneyland package. There is plenty to say, good and bad, about this property.  I'll run it down by category:  Location:  It doesn't get too much better, other than staying on property.  10 minute walk to the gate, and no crossing a major street with the kids.  Added bonus, there is a CVS pharmacy right across the street with anything you might need close at hand.  A full grocery store (Vons) is just a 3 minute drive to the south.  There is a strip mall on the opposite corner with a Subway, a pizza place and a Chinese takeout.  A 7-Eleven shares the same corner as the hotel.  Parking:  Ample free underground parking on site.  Elevator directly to the lobby.  Spaces are plenty large enough for your full size SUV.  I never had to

The hotel is clean, reasonable considering the locale,  a free breakfast is included, and only a 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland.  Bus passes are available for purchase at the front desk.  We were exhausted because we stayed all day and left the park around midnight!  The bus drops you off right in front of the hotel.  We had 3 kids and 4 adults so booked 2 rooms.  My only complaint would have to be the shower.  It needs some maintenance and updating.  Staff was pleasant. I would stay again because you spend so little time in the room.  We had a fantastic time!

Great location. Good value. Only 5 minutes to Disneyland. A good family hotel. The breakfast is ordinary but atleast it's something!  The rooms are comfortable. I would recommend based on location as everything is walking distance & what isn't is a quick taxi or bus.

On-line pictures are deceiving.  We stayed in a kid's suite which looked quite roomy on line.  However, in reality, the king size bed took up the entire room with a small walking space in front of the bed, the twin beds and the pull-out sofa entirely took up the other room.  There were 5 of us, two adults and 3 children under 11 years. There was a possibility of another adult and child joining us and I called to ask if we could have a roll away and was told there would be no problem - it would be $10 a night. Fortunately they didn't join us as there was little room to walk and absolutely no room for a roll-away.    The breakfast was sub-standard - make your own waffles which never fully cooked, inedible eggs which were cold and rubbery, greasy fried potatoes, etc.    I

I stayed here with a music group from New Zealand. We were based here for 5 nights as a part of a North American tour.   The rooms were ok, a little dated but nicely appointed. They were certainly spacious enough.   The pool/spa was good. No complaints here.   The breakfast was ok, nothing special.   Probably the best thing about this hotel is its vicinity to Disneyland. It's a very easy 5 minute walk, literally around the corner. It also has a 7-11 next door and a food court across the road.   Definitely worth considering if you want to stay in the area.

We spent 5 nights at this hotel.  The staff was very kind, helpful and courteous. Check in was quick and simple.  Our Deluxe room overlooked the palm trees on Katella, and was was very quiet.  The room was clean, quiet and comfortable.  no funny odors, and the towels were soft.  The little fridge and microwave was a very nice touch.  the tv was nice and uncomplicated to use.  Our bed was very very comfortable, and the sheets were soft and clean.  We loved the wood blinds, they really blocked the lights, cold and the sound.  We didn't use the pool because of the rain, but it looked clean and inviting.  the breakfast was delicious!  The staff kept the breakfast room clean and well stocked with fresh delicious food.  The breakfast kept us full most of the day, while walking around

We booked this hotel through Costco travel. They listed it as a mid range hotel and the reviews put it between 3 1/2 - 4 stars but I say more like 2 1/2-3 stars.Here is a list of pros and cons 1. Old hotel, the roof leaked so much it required a 5 gallon bucket. There are only 2 areas to do laundry and one was broken the whole 8 days we were there. The lobby looks nice from a distance but when you get to those nice leather chairs you see they are in desperate need of a good cleaning, I didn't want to touch the arm rests.     1. The rest of the hotel was kept very clean and updated some of the interior 2. Pool area very small and the building is built around the pool so the sun does not actually get to the pool area.   2. Sorry no plus for this one, very disappointing. 3.

I've stayed here twice and enjoyed it both times. I LOVED the breakfast they have in the mornings, country potatoes and waffles were my go-to. The rooms were clean and the beds and pillows were so comfortable, the front desk was always super accommodating. We stopped at the gift shop for tylenol and looked around, they had cute gifts.. obviously cheaper than the park.   We had a beer at the bar next to the entrance and there is also a 711 right next to the hotel on the corner. Cheaper than staying on harbor and it's probably nicer too! Great option for disney

Summary Heading: A short stroll to shops and Disneyland with great rooms and service.
Summary: Conveniently located to restaurants and Disneyland, all within walking distance.  Our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. We enjoyed our daily breakfast which was a good start to the day. The service was great and very helpful.

Summary Heading: Nice place close to Disney and Convention Center
Summary: This hotel is very convenient to the convention center but not as expensive as some of the other options. The breakfast was a nice touch. Walking distance to Disney. Would stay there again. Overall, a good value for the money. Also, several eating options close by.

I stayed here with my husband and daughter for a trip to Disneyland in November 2014.   First off, we booked the wrong hotel. We were looking for Desert hotel that is across the street from Disneyland. But that was our fault because we didn't check the address.  My daughter just turned 6 and the location is basically behind California Adventure. So it's too close to take one of the shuttles that the city provides (at an additional fee). And it's just a little far of a walk at the end of a long day in the park for that age range. She practically ran there in the morning. But she was so pooped at the end of the day, it was a hard walk back. So either take a stroller or be prepared to carry your child that far.  Second, we stayed in room 101 or 102, I can't remember. The room was

We booked 5 rooms at the Desert Palms hotel (18 people total)  for a 4 night stay in November. The location of the hotel was great, we were able to walk to Disneyland and to the restaurants that surround the hotel and area. Check in at the hotel was pretty easy, they tried to accommodate all of our rooms together but we did end up having one room on the opposite side of the hotel. The hotel lobby is beautiful. There is a Mickey Mouse in the lobby and you can take pictures in front of it, that was fun for the kids. I would recommend avoiding the concierge though, we thought she was helping us with restaurant locations and the next thing we knew she was trying to get us to go to some time share thing. For the most part the rooms were nice, we had one deluxe studio suite, 3 kids

We stayed here for 8 nights in November (2 adults, 2 kids) We just had a deluxe room but it was plenty big enough for the 4 of us and all our luggage. The layout of our room was different to the photos on the website so maybe our room was larger than normal?  Staff were very friendly and we couldnt fault the service or cleanliness at all.  We arrived at 9am after travelling for just over 24 hrs (home-aiport-flights-hotel) and was just hoping to be able to drop off our luggage until check in time, but the lovely ladyat the front desk must have seen how shattered we looked and let us check in there and then!! Yay for hot shower and a quick lie down :)  Breakfast was great - saved us a LOT of money not having to buy breakfast every morning - so quick and easy!   Location is perfect

Summary Heading: Not the best but definitely great for families!
Summary: We are a family of 5 and stayed in one of the family suites which worked great!! Bunk beds and fold out couch in one room and a king bed for mom and dad in the other. Right beside 7-11 which was very convenient and very close to Disneyland and a nice selection of restaurants. the complimentary breakfast every morning was really great too!! Kids made their own fresh waffles.  My only complaint was the courtyard pool which was small and most of the time, no direct sunlight, and the hotel itself was a little dated otherwise this is a great family hotel!! Staff were really friendly too!

The Desert Palms hotel is a good hotel at a good price.   The room was clean, and an easy walk to Disneyland.  Pros Short walk to Disneyland, a theater, CVS pharmacy and Alerto's Mexican restaurant.  Cons We had no hot water at the sink only the tub.   TV was pretty new flat screen, but poor quality picture.  Neutral I want to really be clear on the free breakfast.   And on the explanation it calls it an American breakfast.   I think I would call it more of an 'Americana' breakfast.  To those visiting from some parts of the US, and probably most foreign countries I would call this breakfast a slice of Americana.  There are a large amount of donuts, pastries and muffins.   Make your own waffles and  flavored waffles.  High sugar cereals with 2% milk.   Sausage patties, and home

We stayed here for 10 nights with our family of 6 in the Yuhu Suite. Although the amenties are great for our size family the room was way too small, we would stay again but I would opt for a larger room like the Kalahari, the Yuhu Suite would be more suited to a family of max 4, the walls in this hotel are very thin, when we returned from a trip to disneyland at 8.30pm the floor below starting banging on the roof - hello - if you dont want any noise from children dont stay in a family friendly hotel !! Kids had fun in the pool and jaccuzzi. Breakfast was a bonus when travelling with 4 children, they all especially looooved the waffle machine and sausage patties. Hotel is within walking distance to disneyland - 10 minutes, with 7 eleven and an ABC store next door. The cheesecake

Great hotel.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The standard rooms are well maintained and have a microwave, coffee pot and refrigerator (great for chilling water bottles to carry to Disneyland) and for cold drinks when you are in the room.  Our rooms were on the second floor.  There was an oddity with the elevators.  If you are staying on the 2nd floor, you have to go back to the first floor to get an elevator to take you to the fifth floor for the breakfast buffet.  Buffet was great:  sausage, eggs, ham fries, oatmeal, yogurt, cottage cheese, sliced fresh fruit, whole fresh fruit, make your own waffles and toast, cold cereal, coffee, tea, orange and apple juice.  Disney park tickets can be purchased at the hotel.  Hotel is a 10 - 20 minute walk to the parks and Downtown

Summary Heading: Appalling and unpleasant stay (to say the least)
Summary: Upon arriving at this hotel, I was greeted by who seemed to be a welcoming staff member.This staff member then began to offer my wife and I some "deals" which sounded pretty good to begin with. As the staff member delivered more information of this "deal", I immediately caught on and realised that this was a scam, thanks to my studies in Business and Psychology. I think that this is an awful way to greet guests to any hotel, and this is quite unacceptable.  When my wife and I arrived to our room, it smelt of feces and marijuana, then while looking around our room I noticed that their was excrement in the toilet bowl. This was absolutely repugnant and I unfortunately regurgitated. I then noticed that there was hair in the bathtub plug, but I decided to ignore this as I've seen

From a bad stay at Sheraton Downtown LA, we moved up to Desert Palms Hotel & Suites since we were heading to Disneyland for a couple of days! We had 6 massive luggage and when we arrived after a long day, we found out that they don't provide porter service so we had to get the trolley ourselves and get all our luggage up to our room! This is the first ever hotel I've been to and did not provide such service! I do feel sorry with a family or kids that are running around and trying to get all their things together. We had to drag all our luggage to the car since all the trolley was unavailable!  The room 411 is right in front of the rear lifts, by the third day you should be used to screaming kids and adults! and the sound of the housekeeping staff talking or cleaning. we found 2

Summary Heading: Great place, awesome for 4 kids, 20 minute walk to Disney entrance
Summary: For a larger family (2 adults, 4 kids (11, 9, 5, & 3)), this is one of the closest hotels you can stay in to Disney (it's on the South East corner of the Disney block). Hotels closer to this have a maximum of 3 kids or 5 total people that can stay in them. From the hotel you can see the back of the California Adventure Cars ride and Hollywood Tower of Terror from the hotel.  We stayed Mon thru Fri the week of Veterans day 2014 & went to Disney Wed/Thurs & California Adventure on Friday.   Parking: Parking is in the rear (North) of the hotel on two levels. Upper level is the main level of the hotel while lower level is covered parking beneath the hotel. If you want to get a good spot, get there early. The spots were few & far between when we arrived on Monday and people were

Summary Heading: A Short Walk to Disneyland and Fantastic Customer Service
Summary: This was the first time that we stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel. My husband, 3.5 year old daughter and I stayed for 8 nights in September. From the moment we checked in, we were shown just how fantastic the staff really are. I had been playing a trivia competition on the Desert Palms Facebook page in the months leading up to our stay. I was handed upon check in a $30 dinner voucher to be used at the Sandbox Grill during our stay. Thanks Kristen for such a great surprise. Our accommodation was on the 5th floor next to the lift. I was a bit sceptical at first, being on the floor where the breakfast room was and having a lift right next to our room. However, the room was very quite, no noise from the lift, nor of a morning as people were walking past to breakfast. The Sandbox

This is the second time we have stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel, & both times our experiences were awesome! From the friendly & helpful front desk employees, to the spacious rooms, nice pool, incredible breakfast, & even the housekeepers, who left little towel animals on our bed each night-this is a great place to stay. And it's right next to Disney parks (took us seven minutes to get from the hotel to the park entrance), & walking distance to the Garden Walk where there are several fun restaurants to enjoy.  We love the Desert Palms Hotel, & we always know that there will be nothing to worry about when staying at this hotel, except not wanting to get up & out of the comfy beds to go eat their yummy breakfast!

Summary Heading: Save yourself the trouble of researching every option - this place is great!
Summary: Free awesome hot breakfast, free wifi, free parking, free work out room, free day planning service, free pool, free hot tub, free luggage lock up, free late check out... And they offer kid suites with military discounts - I mean, for the money we just could not do better for our trip.  Quick walk to Disney, and the staff at the hotel have Disney quality demeanor - super fun, friendly, helpful and professional.  Lots of dinner choices across the street and clean comfortable beds.  I seriously have not been this happy with a hotel experience in a while.  Don't stress your trip, just stay here and know you'll be good to go...

We stayed on february.I think we were unlucky about the room.because it was parking view in the ground and the room had damp smell.and the price was different than we booked from booking .com. Than we changed our hotel...

We have stayed at this hotel 6 or 7 times now, and would stay there again!  It is super close to Disneyland, not even having to cross a major road to get there (an easy walk!).  The rooms are super clean and comfortable (we have stayed in many different rooms with different setups and our favorite is the Sahara suite), and the complimentary breakfast is very good, with plenty of choices!  There are convenience stores nearby, a little gift shop in the hotel, plenty of restaurant choices, and it feels like a nice, safe place to stay.  The people at the hotel are exceptionally friendly and helpful, and we feel like family when we stay here. We look forward to going back!

We had a 3 night stay at Desert Palms and found it to be well located to Disney Parks and clean and comfortable. Spacious room, clean, comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet was very good with range of choices. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

This hotel was in a good walking location to Disneyland.  The complementary breakfast in the morning was really good you could make your own waffles and they had loads of indoor or outdoor seating.  The rooms were clean and the front desk staff were helpful.  There was a convenience shop next door, a CVS across the road and plenty of restaurants to choose from.

We had the Yuma room (king bed, separate room with bunks). Our room was on the 5th floor, so super easy access to breakfast in the morning - and what a breakfast! The staff made sure the food was always available - both hot and cold items.  My boys (6 & 4) loved eating there.  We always walked to Disneyland for the four days we visited the park.  Not once did my boys complain that it was too long! The only bad thing we found was that it was a little noisy - outside noise - as we faced the opposite to Disneyland. There was some construction going on across the street and they started working at about 6 am - however, it would only wake up my husband and I, while our boys slept and didn't wake up until later.

This hotel is a very nice and clean hotel within walking distance of Disneyland.  They have a hot breakfast every morning.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  I have told many friends and family how great this hotel was.

Our room was on the third floor. Our kids (8 and 9) were in the bunk room and just loved it while my wife and I were in the front half of the suite with a king bed. Whilst the rooms are a little on the small side, there is enough drawer and wardrobe space to unpack everything and store your suitcases in a corner of the room. The beds were on the firm side of things but after busy days this didn't stop us from getting a good nights sleep.  The rooms were serviced everyday and the hotel was always clean and tidy.  Breakfast is a good solid meal - nothing fancy but a good way to get you through to lunch on a busy Disneyland day. There are some healthy options the like fruit and yogurt but if you want some more variety then there are plenty of good cereal options in the new CVS

My husband and our 2 children aged 9 & 11 stayed for 7 nights in a kids suite. The beds and pillows were all comfortable and the shower worked well. The room was kept clean by the staff, yes the hotel is a little bit older but it is really clean & tidy. The hotel was a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, California Adventure Park and Downtown Disney.  The swimming pool and spa were both a huge hit and were open late every night. Staff were all very helpful and nothing was a problem. The restaurant/bar right next to the reception has great food and the prices were reasonable as well. The 2 little criticisms would have to be the free breakfast and the free wifi. The breakfast was not very appetizing and being from Australia we don't normally eat donuts, waffles, muffins etc for

Great hotel close to Disneyland (10 minutes). Staff are so friendly and helpful. Best rooms in our opinion are on the 4th floor at the back looking towards the back of Disney California Adventure Park. Each night we could see the Disney fireworks (at least the higher one's). Breakfast was included and though fairly simple was enjoyable and enough to get us going each day. Thoroughly recommend the hotel for any family visiting Disneyland. Great place to base yourself if going beyond just Disneyland. Free parking available.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for four nights this past week and were really looking forward to it.  Especially for the fact that we reserved the Yuha Suite thinking we would have a separate room from the kids to chill quietly after a long day at the parks.  Nope.  It looked much larger on the pictures.  It worked out fine if everyone was in their own beds and not walking around each other.  Here are my pros/cons  Pros: Housekeeping staff was great and room was always clean The kids enjoyed the breakfast each day - especially the potatoes, those were a favorite Decent walking distance from Disneyland - about a 7 minute walk to the gates of the park 7-11, Ihop, Subway, CVS all within a 2 minute walk Parking is easy and convenient We were able to see the firework show from

Summary Heading: A great location and friendly front desk staff.
Summary: My wife and I and another couple arrived at 10.30 am after a tiring 15 hour flight from Australia. We could gain to access our rooms after a couple of hours wait which and we stayed for three nights. There were cold drinks in the lobby and an independently staffed information desk which we later utilised to plan our days activities in Disneyland and California Adventure Park.   The breakfast set-up and outdoor eating area on the roof was very good, with an ample selection from which to choose. It was an easy ten minute stroll to both of the parks. The  separate internet room was quiet and functioned well for us. There is also a nice restaurant that can be entered from the hotel lobby. Even though it is not a new establishment, and a little dated in places it is clean well

Recently we stayed at this hotel while we visited Disneyland.  Our room was clean and very accommodating.  The staff was very helpful.  Overall, our stay at this hotel was a breath of fresh air.  My family and I really enjoyed our stay.

Recently stayed at here while visiting Disney and other parks.  Our room was big and well kept up and clean. We enjoyed having the extra sitting area (as some family members like to get up earlier then others). The breakfast was good. The food was average but it was very convenient to have before a long day at the parks. The sitting area at the top overlooking the parks was a nice touch.  Having parking (underground even!) included was very convenient (at no additional cost). The wifi however was hit and miss at best, but we were not at the hotel very much. The traffic noise was minimal!  The best thing about the hotel is the staff. I happen to work at  hotel and I thought their staff were amazing. They were well prepared for the questions they were asked. We wanted directions

Accommodations were great. They were able to put our rooms on the same floor. We ended up with 7 rooms. Their suites were nice. The standard units with two beds were stocked adequately. Daily maid service was exceptional. It was always clean when we returned from a long day at the park. Breakfast was a great variety every day. Loved the different flavor waffle batter that was changed daily. We appreciates the extra touches with the free pumpkin craft, daily flavored water I'm the lobby and just an overall clean hotel. Yes it's old and needs caulking and minor repairs but overall it was a great place to stay and somewhere I would recommend if you're looking for a nice place to stay while visiting Disneyland or anywhere in the Anaheim area.

We stayed in this hotel for for 6 nights.....when we reached hotel our room wasn't ready option was not much just we have to wait but when receptionist realise we are coming after 15hr flight he upgraded us....kids have great time in there own very clean room and swimming pool was great after long hot days in disney...ART stop in front of the hotel..!! Can walk to/from disney but with kids it is handy and very much recommend to use ART... breakfast was typical hot American...next visit we are back in this hotel again...Staff was very helpful

I was looking for a hotel close to Disneyland that was well within my budget and still offer plenty of room for my 2 daughters (10&12), my aunt and myself. This hotel offered all that and more with the Yuha suite. The suite came with a full kitchen, including full fridge, oven/stove, pots and pans. There is a sign that lets you know you will need to do the dishes yourself; however every time we came back to our room all the dishes were cleaned ; ) The pull out sofa is just that a pull out sofa; however I have slept on worse. There was plenty of room, even with the sofa pulled out. Parking is free and there is plenty of it, only once did we need to park in the underground area and that was because we got in after 10p. The front lobby is always clean and they offer ice water with

This was our 4th stay at the desert palms in the last ten years or so.  As always, great service and well appointed room.  This stay was a three nighter with my daughter and her two boys. A 3 year old toddler and a two month old newborn.  Upon arrival we encountered our first room which was not ready for use.  I went downstairs to ask for a different room, and the attendant quickly assigned us to a new room, which was adequate for our needs.   The staff are friendly, the free breakfast is great...fresh fruit, make your own waffles, eggs, bacon, hash browns, loads of coffee and orange or apple juice, plus donuts and oatmeal.  Done indoors, or choose an outdoor patio table on the rooftop.  I love the fresh water provided in the main lounge, always cold and infused with

We stayed at this hotel while on vacation to Disneyland, universal studios and sea world.  The room was very nice and a great size. Bathroom was clean and well looked after. The breakfast offered every morning was fantastic. Loved being able to sit outside and enjoy the view of the parks. Having parking was a huge bonus as well My only complaint was the wifi didn't work half the time. Other then that we very much enjoyed this place and would return again (and we have stayed at several places)

We stayed here for five nights as we enjoyed both disneyland and California Adventure parks. The hotel has great rooms for families. We stayed in one of the Yuha Suites which was perfect for me and my wife and our three kids. The kids room actually has a door that shuts (read - shuts out  the kids noise). The breakfasts were included in the price and were above the average "continental breakfast" which is what most hotels are offering. The quality of the food is average but welcomed prior to spending a 12 hour day in the park.  On the down side, the rooms are a bit worn and our room specifically seemed quite dark. We took the lamp shade off of the desk lamp to brighten things up. This wasn't a huge problem as we weren't in the rooms much. However, it is the first thing we

We stayed in the Yuha suite on our recent family vacation to Disneyland.  We selected this hotel based on the available family suites and the complimentary breakfast.  The room we had was large and had plenty of space however, it was a little run down and the furniture was of poor quality and showing some wear & tear.  The a/c unit was located in the 'kids' room which made it difficult to keep the rest of the room a comfotable temperature without it being freezing cold in the 'kids' room.  The complimentary breakfast was actually a pleasant surprise, it's certainly above average with a variety of hot options available each morning. Location to the park was very convenient, just a 7 minute walk to the main gates.  Overall, the hotel provided good value given our needs of simply a

I booked this hotel based on the reviews and rating I found on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed.   Let's be clear, this is not a luxurious hotel with all the bells and whistles but if you are after value for money then I highly recommend this hotel.   The rooms were clean (although a little dated) and the staff were friendly. My son and I especially enjoyed the restaurant attached to the hotel and their hamburgers were amazing. My son still rates it as the best hamburger he had after his trip overseas (and that's after having burgers from Wendy's, Fatburger, A&W, and any number of other hamburger joints across Canada and the US).  The breakfast buffet is average but adequate. Yes, it's busy but the food and drink were good and served it's purpose to fill your belly before

Rooms are big and clean, very very old and run down, staff are soooooooo not friendly, after following on Facebook I thought this was going to be a friendly exciting hotel - it wasn't.  Great position close to Disneyland, pool is tiny and very cold - in the shade most of the day.  Breakfast was horrible and you had to fight to use the two washing machines.  Not sure I would recommend this hotel - even though we stayed here on a recommendation.

We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites in Anaheim over a weekend, for the purpose of visiting Disneyland. We searched many hotels within the area, including the Disney resorts and found that the Desert Palms was the best value for money in the area. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and comfortable. I would stay there again if I was in the area, for any reason.

Our family of eight stayed here when we went on a family holiday to Disneyland. While it is certainly very tired in it's décor, it was certainly very clean. My husband and I were upgraded to a king room with a full kitchen, fridge etc so that we could be on the same floor as our children and grandchildren. Location is excellent for walking to Disneyland and lots of eating places. The grandchildren made use of the swimming pool, which was good for them after being at Disney in the heat of the day. Breakfast could be improved on but having said that we never went out in the mornings feeling hungry. There is a CVS store across the road where you could purchase cereals etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On returning to the hotel after being out in the heat, it was lovely

We stayed three nights at the Desert Palms. I chose this hotel for the location near Disneyland and overall value, including free breakfast.  The hotel met our needs just fine. A bonus was the 7/11 next door — a great place to load up on cheap(er) snacks. The room was nothing special, but it did have a microwave, mini fridge and air conditioning. The breakfast wasn't as good as a restaurant, but was just fine for a hotel freebie — plenty of seating and lots to choose from: eggs, sausage, biscuits/gravy, DIY waffles, fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, etc. The pool, located in an interior courtyard, is small, but my kids enjoyed it and I loved the hot tub.  The lobby was spacious and attractive, with lots of seating and ice water.  We were able to leave our bags at the front desk

We stayed here for 7 days during our summer vacation.  Location is good with walking distance of 10 mins to Disney but rooms are outdated.  The staff are super nice and accomodating as we had changed our rooms 2 times over the course of our stay.  Breakfast was average and needs improvement to the menu items offered.  It was the same food every day which can get tiring.  Bought this as a vacation package with flight and hotel so the price was a good deal.  Would not stay here again.  Probably better options out there.

Everything at the desert palms was just so so.  The food was edible, not saying much.  The room was clean(ish) but clearly in need of updating.  Staff were friendly, but why is our hotel trying to sell us a timeshare?  The restaurant in the hotel we ate at the first night, and did not go back (no major complaints, just not impressed).  Essentially, this place excels at mediocrity, if that's even possible.  We stayed there for proximity but ended up taking the ART most of the time anyway, because with 2 kids, even a ten minute walk was too much at the end of a long day.  Next time we do DL we will stay farther away someplace nicer and more up to date.

Desert palms is across the street from a CVS, a few blocks from Bubba Gumps, and under a 10 min. Walk to DL. Some days the side entrance to CA Adventures was open (next to Alpine Lodge) and we hopped on a bus that took us to the main entrance. The breakfast was warm and filling and the rooms sufficed for the small amount of time we were there. We will definitely stay there again.
