We just spent 5 nights at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.  We had a great stay.  We stayed in one of their suites.  Great room and we were very comfortable!  We were there to go to Disneyland. It is a short walk to the main entrance.  Actually two days we went to the park, had fun and walked back to the hotel for a rest.  Then we walked back to enjoy the park again.  It was a great location for our family...from 3 years old to 66 years old.

We stayed at the desert palms for 3 nights in late September. Our room slept the 5 of us with two queens and a sofa bed. On the first night our air conditioning was not working. Staff sent up maintenance and they said we had fiddled with the controls. Not true . This happened again on the second night. Same response from staff. On the third night they sent a different maintenance man up and he discovered the fan was broken. After my complaining they gave us a second room to sleep in whilst our original room was being fixed.  We slept in this room. The next day we went to Disneyland and on our return we discover that my sons Ridz remote controls car he made at Disneyland , my daughters new costume plus a few other incidental things were not in the second room. The staff had taken

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced, good hotel to stay in with a family
Summary: The location was perfect for us with a short walk to Disneyland and the 7 eleven and ABC market close by. The room was clean and whilst it wasn't huge it fit the 5 of us in comfortably the kids had their own sectioned off area with TV and bunk which they were happy about. I was disappointed though that the first night whilst my 2 youngest climbed into the bunk my eldest went to use the fold out and we discovered the last persons sheets hadn't been changed (probably missed as its not obvious its been used) ..however they rectified it quickly. Housekeeping more than made up for it later on in the night when my son threw up all over the fold out (missing his sister luckily) housekeeping was fantastic. the lady was so kind and helpful offering more sheets and telling me not to worry

I was recommended this hotel by a friend and I couldn't be happier. This is a true family basic hotel. This Hotel is a five minute walk from Disneyland, we would go back for lunch and a quick swim each day. It is next door to Seven Eleven and surrounded by take away and restaurants which supplied plates and cutlery with the take away. No Bell boys, a great buffet breakfast is included, great WiFi and a pool and hot tub.

My niece and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend of Sept 27 till Sept 30, 2014.  This was our third time to stay here and we loved it.  Free Wi-Fi,  free breakfast, free baggage hold.  We arrived before check in and the staff held our bags for us until we got back to check in at 4 pm.  The check in process was easy.  We had a fantastic room with a bunk bed for my niece.   She felt like she had her own room with a TV and I had my room with a TV.  She loved it.  Breakfast was great.  We had eggs, sausage, burritos, cereal, doughnuts, oatmeal, and waffles to choose from.   The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  There is a 7-11 next door and ABC Market next to the 7-11.  Across the street, a new CVS just opened.  This is great since the room has a refrigerator and a

Great spot to base your family Disneyland experience. Good facilities including laundry and pool. Reception staff very helpful. Lots of restaurants to choose from including take away and convenience stores all in walking distance.

We staying in the Borrego suite from 19th Sep for 6 nights using 2 queen beds and the pull out sofa-bed for 5 of us.We really enjoyed our stay here .Not a 5star hotel but we had no complaints at all and considered it great value. We were on the 4th level.We had no view but this didn't concern us (we were hardly in the room anyway) The room was a bit smaller than anticipated but sufficient.We did not experience any noise issues at all .The breaky was basic but kids loved making waffles each morning.Staff were great and room serviced daily with no issues.Great location within walking distance to Disney and lots of great eating places/restaurants.7/11 and ABC store right next door so very handy for drinks/snacks.Huge pharmacy about to open across the road which should be a great

We stayed here in Sept 14. It was a great place to stay. It was an easy walk to Disneyland and there are heaps of family friendly places to eat nearby. The kids loved the pool area.The breakfast was average but it was for free.

Summary Heading: Pretty Good Hotel!  We would possibly stay here again.
Summary: Our stay here was pretty good and we would possibly stay here again.  The staff was great and very helpful.  The free hot breakfast was pretty good and the all-day ice cold beverages in the lobby were fantastic!  The location to Disneyland, restaurants and stores is great!  We also really appreciated having 2 separate air conditioners in the 2 bedrooms because there is a divider door between the 2 rooms. The only reason I couldn't give this hotel full marks was because our room hadn't been cleaned very well when we checked in and everyday, there was never the full amount of towels or supplies left for us.  This is not a life-and-death issue, but we had to stop by the front desk every single day to get towels, coffee, glasses, soap, etc. and guests should't have to do this every

Summary Heading: Excellent location to go with excellent service at excellent hotel
Summary: Staff were super friendly and helpful from time we checked in at midnight. No matter who was working hotel was clean, friendly, excellent service and excellent value for money. A bonus was having hotel only 400 metre walk from Disneyland and California adventure parks gates. Also very handy to lots of awesome restaurants and eateries. Bus stop for theme parks right near hotels entrance way

We always love the staff at the front desk.  They are willing to help us with any difficulties.  The hotel is close to the front gate of Disney and we walk to and from daily.  We enjoy the breakfast and the waffle special flavors this visit.  Yummy. The Borrego suites work especially good for our family as we can sequester a little one in the step down room.  This marks our 6th stay at the Desert palms and we will be back for more.

Had a great 8 day stay in September with a 10yr old and it was the perfect location. Only 10 minutes easy walk to Disneyland, the buffet was good and the iced water in reception was a relief each day. The staff on desk were helpful and despite an early arrival from Australia we were able to check in with a short wait. The pool is on the small side but adequate after a very long hot day walking around. There is a car hire place next door so made hiring cars easy. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance and convenience store right next door for last minute needs. Would stay again next time without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Perfect family destination - close to everything!
Summary: My family, including a 6 and 8yr old, all enjoyed our recent 4 night stay at this hotel.  The buffet breakfast was a big hit and a great way to start the day!  The hotel was close to EVERYTHING!  Walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure Park, McDonald's, Subway Restaurant and many other family restaurants.  The 7-11 right next door was very handy.  The staff were friendly and helpful and were able to allow us an early check-in, which was very much appreciated after a 13 hour flight!  The rooms were lovely (we had the Kids Suite).  The pool was a refreshing end to a busy day. I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in the Anaheim area.

We stayed in the Yuga Suite which had a queen bed in the room you first walked in to and a bunk bed in the back room.  The rooms are small which makes somewhere to put suitcases problematic but I've given it a very good rating as it's an easy walk to Disney for both the six and nine year olds,  the iced water in reception is a nice touch,  the reception staff were friendly and the pool albeit small was great to refresh in at the end of the day.   The on-site cafe was good for those days when we were so tired after theme parks that we didn't want to go out and they do room service at no extra charge.   Right next to the hotel are two little conveniences stores which we used alot.

First off, we experienced great service from the front desk, to housekeeping (Our AC worked fine and was never turned off by housekeeping), to the attached Sand Box restaurant (which we loved). We also felt that the included breakfast was a great value! We could go to the parks and not even feel hungry until dinner time. It is a short walk, but after a long day it does feel like quite a ways.  The things that made our stay less enjoyable were the fact that our room was on the second floor...it only has one elevator that only goes between 1 and 2. Breakfast was on the 5th floor and contrary to other reviews there is only laundry on the 3rd and 4th floor. We just used the stairs, it was easier than going up and down on different elevators. Our room looked out to the street and was

We were given a suite on the first floor with the bunk beds. Loved this hotel.  We have stayed here before and cannot complain.  The breakfast was good for a full tummy to head out to Disneyland.  The rooms were spacious and check in was quick. I would recommend this to any family.

Summary Heading: Aging building continues to decline, customer service in decline as well
Summary: We returned to this hotel again after staying about 2 years ago, on another trip to Disneyland.  Unfortunately, our experience this time was not as positive.  We had 4 adults and 2 children, and stayed in two suites.  First the good.  The location is very good.  For the proximity to Disneyland, it is surprisingly quiet (away from the pool area), and the rates are still good as well.   There are larger rooms available that are spacious enough for families.  Versus the other comparable Disney "good neighbour" hotels in the area, the Desert Palms is still good value for anyone looking for a suite.  Now for the bad.  Last time we stayed, the customer service was a strength, indeed it made up for a number of shortcomings.  I am sorry to say that is no longer the case.  The customer

We stayed here 1st September to the 7th September, and returned to the hotel again on the 11th after we stayed in Las Vegas for four days. Was a great hotel, very clean, breakfast could have been a nice full English but it did us fine as was included in the room rate so saved us money and hassle of having to find anywhere else to eat. It's right on disneys door step with just a short walk away, down the road from the hotel is a large rang of cafes and eateries. Local shops are just right next door to the hotel. I can Highly recommend the hotel restaurant which is called the sandbox, really friendly staff in there and you don't have to wait long for food, wide range of choices too. Swimming pool could have been a big bigger as it did get very crowded more so we we returned on the

Summary Heading: Close to the happiest place on Earth
Summary: We stayed as a teenage family, and found the Desert Palms to be good. In a great location, with an easy 10 minute walk to the Disney theme parks. We had a family room with a king & 2 bunk beds, which was adequate, but slightly too small. Easy access to local convenience  stores & an array of local restaurants. Breakfast was included within the price, but the Sand Box bar attached was also too small for relaxed dining. We were mainly there for Disney, so it was great.

My friends and I attend Women of Faith every year at the Honda Center.  We have always stayed at the Desert Palms.  The rooms are great and the service is excellent.  We like that they have free parking and free breakfast every morning.  This hotel is also very close to Disneyland.  You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel.

We wanted a hotel near Disneyland, with breakfast, parking, pool, Wi-Fi and air conditioning. This one ticked all the boxes. Just 10 minutes walk to the park gates, good hot and cold breakfast buffet, underground parking (great when the temp is 94 degrees F) and heated outdoor pool and hot tub. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of places to eat within very short walking distance (including the Cheesecake Factory). Our room and facilities were fine and the air con was not too noisy at night.

From the moment we checked in we where made to feel welcome. The can do attitude of the staff was a real bonus. Desert Palms was an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland and is located next to National and Alamo car rental hire. Also 2 convenience stores next door as well was great. Breakfast was included in the price which was fantastic and a real plus. I recommend this hotel to couples or families...

We stayed here for the Disneyland Half.. It was close enough to walk.. The staff was very friendly. They also let us check in early. Which wAs really nice... People complain about noise. But we just heard kids running up the hallways, which you kinda expect. But we slept well....

Summary Heading: Most adequate accommodations we have had in Anaheim
Summary: Because our kids are bigger, we appreciated the Kids Suite for this reason.  We also had a room facing the rear of the hotel but high enough we had a direct view of the fire works.  The breakfast was one of the best free breakfasts I've seen.  Free parking.  Free WiFi.  They also gave me a card for 10% off the next stay, I just have to call them directly.  I will do that!!

First trip to Disneyland....hotel was conveniently located (only 6minute walk with small kids) to main gate.  Hotel is clean and staff were friendly.  They honoured our request for an upgrade to a suite upon check in as we were staying 6 nights.  The suite had a separate area with bunk beds for the kids so it was ideal for a long stay.  Hot breakfast buffet included was good - would recommend they offer more variety for the hot food (same food was rotated every other day).  Pool is small & cold (unfortunately it is in shade most of the time). Restaurant in hotel is reasonably priced & food was good.  Having 7-11 next door was handy for snacks, drinks, etc. A fair amount of restaurant options was also available within a 2 block radius.  **I have to make special mention for front

This hotel is located within walking distance of Disneyland (approx. 10 min).  The suite we stayed in was roomy and clean.  There was a full kitchen with a refrigerator, stove, oven, and microwave.  There is a daily breakfast buffet with make your own waffle stations.

Summary Heading: A spectacular destination that excels in both prices and customer service.
Summary: Me and my wife surprised our kids and took them to Disneyland for the Labor Day holiday. When looking for places to stay our main objectives were to find a place that we could afford, close proximity to Disneyland, and something that could fit our whole family. The location could not be beat, it was only a five minute walk from the park and we also got to save money on parking, which was great. Also, the staff was beyond helpful. They were very accommodating especially in regards to how many times we asked for extra towels since my kids wanted to go to the pool all the time. Kristen, who was our reservationist, did a wonderful job in helping us find a room where me and my wife could have our own place while the kids shared bunkbeds, which they loved. As an avid Disney fan I will

Summary Heading: Great price, good hotel, excellent location!
Summary: I have traveled countless times to Disneyland, mostly on a budget, and have stayed at many different hotels.  We have a small child, so wanted close proximity to Disneyland for prompt walks back to the hotel for naps, etc.  We also were not interested in waiting for buses for trams.  This place is not perfect, and not for the super picky, but it was PERFECT for us!  It had a delicious, hot breakfast every morning that pleased everyone in our party of six.  We swam in a the pool several times, which was small and cramped.  The rooms were dated, but very comfortable.  Our room had a larger-then-average fridge and a microwave, which made snacking and leftovers great!  I was incredibly pleased at getting everything we wanted at such an affordable price!  If you want resort-style

Stayed here for 5 nights to be close to Disneyland and liked the idea of a separate room with bunk-beds and free breakfast each morning.   The hotel lobby is a litlte random and the pool is small and enclosed by walls so not a lot of sun. The front desk staff was friendly but we were under the impression we could get a good deal on park tickets but they only care if you are gonig for multi-day. So we had to print out our own tickets in the business center.  The gift shop looked cute and was open late. There is a 7-11 right next door which was very convenient. The breakfast was ok..... The kids were happy with it so that is fine. Free parkkng in the garage underneath was good and there were always spots available when we could come back late at night.  Rooms could have been

Our start-to-finish experience with Desert Palms was fantastic.  I booked three rooms several months in advance at a very good rate (kudos #1). My travel plans changed shortly thereafter, meaning I needed to cancel one of the rooms.  It was a smooth, hassle-free process  (kudos #2).  When my party arrived at the hotel, we were pleased to find that they kept our rooms adjacent (kudos #3), which hasn't always been the case with other places I've stayed.  In order to do so, the hotel provided us with a complimentary upgrade to suites (kudos #4)!  The rooms were some of the cleanest I've seen in quite a while and were spacious and well-appointed.  What was really one of the major selling points for me, though, was the continental breakfast.  We saved quite a bit of money not having

If you're planning on staying here, it's probably because you're going to Disneyland - it is only a 5 minute walk. That being the case, the Desert Palms is ok for that purpose, since the rooms are dated, the walls are very thin and they could do with a new mattress.  A 5 star resort this place is not, but I don't think it's trying to be. It's aim is towards families or those travelling on a budget, since it's at least half the price of staying in a Disney resort. It also comes with a buffet breakfast included in the price, which has your standard buffet breakfast items of scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles, toast, cereals, jusce and coffee etc. A solid meal to keep you going all day at Disneyland I say.  We were initially showed to a room on the 3rd floor, overlooking the pool

We booked this place based in part from tripadvisor ratings and we feel completely let down. Booked in for a week pre paid through expedia so aren't going anywhere or we would be gone. This place is yuck.   Positives decent walk to Disney -doable with kids. Lots of restaurants nearby. Has a pool but it's small! Can see fireworks from room. Free wifi but it's spotty. Breakfast free but it's bare bones. Most staff have been friendly.  Kids bunks and separate area were attractive to us but room with king and bunk room feels really small.   Cons. It's really old. Carpets are old and overall not fresh. Worst bed I've been on in 10 years! Kids bunks better than ours. Feels like a pullout mattress. Pillows are crap. People say it doesn't matter as you are at Disney and come home tired

Summary Heading: So tired I barely noticed the thin walls
Summary: Overall the Desert Palms is an average experience.  My family booked the Yuha suite for two nights on our last Disneyland trip.  The Yuha suite has a main sleeping area by the door (with mini fridge and TV) and a kid's sleeping area (with a bunk bed, sofa and TV) toward the back end of the "room" separated by a bathroom with closing doors.  A decent amount of space for what we paid, and quite a lovely first impression.  Unfortunately, first impressions don't guarantee a good nap time or good night's sleep, which is where the rating comes down.    The walls are thin, and the ceiling/floor above is thin.  Mixed with the fact that it's a relatively small hotel with elevators/stairs on every hall, and you hear walking and talking all day and night.  Our suite was on the first floor,

Summary Heading: "Extremely friendly, professional and very clean hotel"
Summary: Our family revisited Desert Palms last November and will continue to return!  The employees are so nice and pleasant.  They want to make sure that you are satisfied with your stay and feel at home.  Housekeeping is great, the buffet is great, the swimming pool/hot tub is great and very relaxing.  Our room has always been clean and cozy.  Location to Disneyland is a straight shot and convenient walk to the Park .  We are definitely going to come back to this hotel.

Party of 5 from age 15 and up stayed in a two bedroom room with two bathrooms.  The hotel was clean, friendly, well equipped, comfortable and a fantastic location for Disney.  Would recommend without hesitation.

Last week we had the pleasure of staying here.  Not only is it within walking distance of the convention center and the amusement parks, it was just a nice place to stay.  Clean, pretty, nice staff, very good breakfast buffet.  The coffee at the buffet was excellent, the food was plentiful.  We will go back when we stay in the area.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Within Walking Distance to Disney Parks
Summary: We stayed here four nights for a visit to the Disney Parks. Booked several months in advance, when I checked in they said they had upgraded our family to a suite with 2 bunk beds for no extra charge (I presume a Yuha suite). Our kids were absolutely thrilled to be able to sleep in bunk beds, have their own room and T.V. The room was on the third floor and had windows with an interior view. That was a little disappointing but OK with us - wasn't a deal breaker. The layout of the room had the king size bed nearest the room's door, bathroom in the middle and the bunk bed room in the rear with the window. I had no trouble with noise being that close to the hall. There are five floors total but the fifth floor contains the breakfast room and banquet facilities - no guest rooms on

We stayed here last Dec when we visited Disneyland. The place is great! And the staff are really helpful especially when you are with kids. They are all smiles every time we ask them a question. Its a good 10-15 min walk going to Disneyland, there is ample parking and the breakfast is pretty decent and heavy. A good way to start the whole day in Disneyland.   The rooms are not that flash but it still serves its purpose. Nice and clean :)  Overall i would recommend this place to our friends and will definitely be coming back when we visit Disneyland again in the future.

We stayed at Desert Palms mainly for it's close proximity to Disneyland, only about a 15 minute walk. When I booked the hotel about ten months ago I did request a higher floor with the hope of getting a view of the fireworks at Disneyland, this request was not met perhaps due to check late in the evening. The staff at the front desk weren't particularly friendly, maybe it was too late for them! The lobby is quite large and it was good to see fruit infused water on hand for guest to help themselves as it was quite hot this time of year. The room itself was a good size with two queen beds that we found comfortable and the level of cleanliness was good. The rooms could do with a spruce up, carpet was worn and tired. The wifi was very weak and kept on dropping out or at times was

Summary Heading: great location very poor value and experience
Summary: dark tired rooms looking into the center of the hotel, the worst hotel breakfast I have ever experienced (but included in the room price), the room price is not good value for two, and could only be justified by the very convenient location - and easy walk to Disneyland.  I would not return here.

The beds are very uncomfortable and hard! If your room is on the 1st floor, it will be loud. You will hear everything from the parking garage to the lobby. I can't say for other floors, we stayed on the 1st. The location was convenient for walking to disney land, but I will probably never stay in this hotel again. Not worth the price at all.

Summary Heading: Mattresses hard as concrete, needs remodeling badly, and not even remotely worth what we paid for room.
Summary: I chose this hotel because it seemed to have good reviews. Very disappointed.  The mattress was very uncomfortable.....like sleeping on concrete.  It was so bad that my husband ended up sleeping on the floor on pillows.  We spent the day at Disneyland and we were very tired and looking forward to a good night's sleep.  Didn't happen.  Rooms very outdated.  Hotel needs to be remodeled badly. We ended up checking out after one night although we had booked two...that's how bad the bed was.  Then when I complained to staff....no apology...nothing. Not even close to being worth what we paid for room. We paid over $200 for a miserable night.

Reservations were done 2 months an advance and upon arriving at 9 AM the hotel desk provided us an upgrad to a larger room at no extra charge since we had arrived earlier and our original room was not ready. One of the front desk reps- Jessica was VERY knowledgable in the area and assisted us in planning our 5 day stay. We were able to purchase our Disney tickets at the front desk and she was able to provide us with the best recommendations to get our monies worth. The breakfast was OK and can't complain. It was free and they made sure that it was well organized I enjoyed the food and outside sitting. FYI our room was by the elevator and pool and it was  NEVER loud. Disneyland was about 10 min walk 7elven on corner and the gift shop next to panda and subway has really good

Very good location and price.   The hotel is nice and walking distance to the parks and the convention center.  I attended a convention and choose this hotel.  It is more favorable for the parks than a convention just because it is more family friendly.  Seems like to get a lot of traffic and it shows a little in the rooms.  But bedding was very clean.

When we arrived early after a 13hr drive they were accommodating to store our luggage until check in, which was appreciated. We checked in later that evening, exhausted only to have the room be dirty, the mini fridge not working, no dresser drawers big enough to actually put clothes in, the T.V. having very few channels, the bathroom door hanging off it's hinges, and uncomfortable beds! Our room was by the pool and the elevator..LOUD!! We were staying for 9 days/8 nights and we paid for an expensive suite to be able to be comfortable. The ONLY reason we stayed, everything else in the area was full and we did need the space for 7 of us, this suite had 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms in one full suite which was what we needed and that's why we chose this hotel. We were very

We arrived from our road trip after a very disappointing day at Six Flags Magic Mountain.  we needed a bit of a pick me up, and the hotel gave us it.  We have visited the area twice both quite a  few years ago and we had previously chosen to stay in the Howard Johnson.  This time we booked the Desert Palms for a change and wasn't disappointed.  The hotel was a lot larger than I expected which made it feel slightly more snazzy.  It was convenient for the drive in and for Disney which was a ten minute walk.  The breakfast was ok, had better and had worse but it was well organised as you would expected for a hotel near Disney.  There is a 7-11 literally next to the hotel which is very handy, and is a short walk from Bubba Gump's and other restaurants, which is very convenient.  We

Smells like mold and mildew, not very appealing. Woke up early and stayed out late just to avoid the hotel. Had a tough time getting into bed at night because of how disgusting it made me feel. Breakfast was appalling, my family couldn't even eat there. We will not be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Just perfect for our family needs
Summary: It is all relative.  The Disney Grand Californian Hotel in August 2014 costs $800+ daily for a room with 2 queen beds.  It is gorgeous and Disneyland is at your doorstep.  We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites for $234 a night.  It is a 5-minute walk from Disneyland.  We (3 adults and 2 children) had a "suite": one room with a king size bed, microwave, refrigerator; and a smaller room with a bunk bed and a couch with a hideaway bed and free breakfast.  It was not gorgeous.  But the more we thought about it, the happier we were with our choice.  We had almost instant access to the park; we could keep snacks and leftovers in our refrigerator; the breakfast was generous: make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, and the usuals.  The only surprise was that there were

Summary Heading: Short walk to Disney. Good family hotel. Fit the bill.
Summary: Desert palms is only a 10min walk to the parks & short drive to the highway for LA or San Diego. We stayed 6 nights and did some tray trips to LA as well. Sometimes that took an hour, sometimes 2.5 hours with a lot of construction traffic. The hotel has a great location with a good few nice restaurants within walking distance.. There's a big buffet breakfast, it's only ok but kids liked it & keeps you going. Laundry facilities in each floor. A pool that doesn't get sun but nice for a dip after a day in the parks. Coffee shop & bar in the lobby. Great, friendly, helpful staff. Disappointed with our room as it was much smaller in reality than picture & a little shabby on appearance but was clean. We had the Yuma suite. But there were 6 of us so if you had family of 4 it would be

Choose this hotel for walking distance to Disneyland.  Wasn't disappointed.  Good Location.  Nice free breakfast every morning.  Nice family hotel.  Small pool, however, that wasn't a priority for us. Would recommend.

We come to Disneyland once a year with our three teen girls. This has been our best stay yet. We usually stay directly across from the parks or on property but choose this hotel on a whim and we are so thrilled that we did.   When we arrived they gave us a permit to park so we could go to the parks while waiting for check in. All the staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean.  We stayed in the Yuha Kids Suite and it fit our family perfectly, there was plenty of room for all our stuff. I loved that there were indoor corridors at this place. (Generally am not a fan of motels) There is a door separating the two rooms which allowed my husband and I to sleep while our teenagers watched t.v. our kixs reaooy enjouyed the bunk beds and my 14 year old had no comolaI utilized the

We came in early and they prepared out suite for us right away.  The front desk was very friendly and helpful.  The water was a big hit with my daughter.  My son loved that he didn't have to share a bed.  Housekeeping was friendly and our room cleaned everyday.  They also filled our request for extra pillows immediately.  We were in room 455 and it was quiet with a partial view of the fireworks.  Breakfast was fine.  Just what you expect from a free hotel buffet.  They kept the food supplied and were very busy taking care of everyone's needs.  It is a short walk to the park and parking was very easy with underground parking.  Would stay here again without thinking twice.

Excellent experience. Guest services to house keeping were amazing. Always greeted by housekeeping whenever we saw them. Rooms and hotel were extremely clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely book a room here for our next trip to Disneyland.

Our family of 4 had a great stay at the Desert Palms. We arrived on an early flight, and they were very acommodating, allowing us to park and hold our bags so we could go out and start exploring.  We had a Borrego Suite facing the park, up on the 4th floor so we could see the fireworks. The location of the room was great, at the end of the hall, very quiet, just one quick flight of stairs up to breakfast, and a laundry room a ways down the hall on the same floor.  A small living room makes this a suite, with a blackout curtain dividing it from the bedroom.  We really liked the extra space - especially for a longer stay, a regular sized room would have been cramped. In comparing prices with other hotels, I felt we got a pretty good deal on our 4 night stay rate.  The WIFI worked

Summary Heading: LIVE ROACH FOUND IN BATHROOM MNGR OFFERED 50% DISCOUNT
Summary: On a last minute getaway we checked into Desert Palms at 9:30pm 8/9/14. Lobby was clean, underground parking a bit tight, elevators took forever to work, so we ended up just taking the stairs. Got into our room and we were pleasantly surprised how spacious the rooms were. We were in Guest Rm 425, Suite overlooking the pool area. Having a back round in hospitality I did my usual sweep of the room, especially the sheets...Seemed clean enough (I know too much about hotels, to be completely trusting lol). Bathroom had really poor water pressure, and I was disappointed with the A/C unit. The way their cooling system is designed it has the wall A/C unit in the main room, then a fan that transfers air from one room to the next, problem is the back vanity area, bathroom and left side of

Summary Heading: Second Stay as Good as First
Summary: This was our second stay here. Once again this is a loud hotel, but the noise is not of place, it is families coming and going and kids having fun. Location is excellent and is a nice easy walk to the parks with no streets to cross. Breakfast buffet is just o.k., but the waffle bar is great and with some creativity (we brought our own jam and fresh chopped fruit as Target is just a few blocks away) was magnificent. We stayed on an upper floor on the back side again and can look into the park at night and see the fireworks. Great view from the outdoor breakfast patio. Friendly and competent staff...all in all a great place to stay! We hope to get a good rate and stay here again when we return in March 2015.

Summary Heading: Not so good Buffet. Great Front Desk and Rooms
Summary: Not so good buffet here, its free but its nothing to brag about. The rooms are very nice. We stayed at a suite after our booking 2 queen bed was not available. They upgraded us at no charge. Very cheap price for the location. We had a ok view to disneyland. Walking distance about 15 min walking. Underground parking and they seem to have a small arcade at the main lobby. They have a small bar but it was closed when we got there. I would give it more stars but that buffet gots to get revamped and gots to go... NOT bad for the price thats for sure. We attended for May 4th be with you!

We just returned from Anaheim where we spent 2 nights at the Desert Palm Hotel and 4 nights at the Embassy Suites.  Both hotels were priced the same.  Desert Palm had small, dark rooms and a horrible breakfast.  Embassy Suites had spacious rooms, a light and airy atmosphere and a great breakfast.

My wife and I stayed there for three nights in July. We booked and PRE-PAID through Travelocity. We enjoyed everything about the property (price, location, cleanliness, ect.) and had a very good experience until my credit card statement arrived in the mail. Upon check-in I was asked for my credit card for any other needs I might have during my stay. We did not have any fees owed except resort fees of around $40. When viewing my card statement I had an additional charge of almost $450. I called Desert Palms and explained my situation and was transferred to two different people. I could never get an explanation and was even told they had no record of us staying there until I became agitated and my info was miraculously found. I was then told I would have to speak to someone the

If you are looking for a hotel close to the parks, consider this one.  I did a lot of research on hotels near Disney and I narrowed it down to this one, Candy Cane Inn and the Carousel.  I liked the suite offered at the Desert Palms with 2 bathrooms and 4 queen beds- that worked well for my family of 5.  I thought the rate was reasonable for the room.  The breakfast buffet was exactly what I'd expect a Disney area hotel breakfast buffet- the standards like eggs, breakfast meats, danishes, waffles and fruit.  I wasn't disappointed or overwhelmed.  It was exactly what I expected. The room was dark but functional.  We weren't really staying here to lounge around in the room all day.  We spent our days in the parks.  The two things my kids loved about this hotel: the water in the

The staff were friendly, the rooms clean and tidy, breakfast was good and always plenty of food no matter what time you arrived.  Rooms serviced daily which was great after a long day at Disneyland.  Small walk to the wonderful Disneyland excellent location.  We had a late check which was so helpful as we were a group.  Could not of been more helpful.  The pool was good and always plenty of clean towels for everyone.

This hotel was totally awesome.  They helped in every way possible.  I didn't get in to my room until 3am but was still greeted with a smile.  They made my grandkids stay magical   The breakfast each morning was totally fantastic.  They held my luggage on day of departure so that I could enjoy one more day at the theme park.  And yes the gift shop prices were the same as the ABC Mart and 7-11 stores..and very convenient.  You can walk to Disney in a short 20 minute walk (with 3 grand kids 12 and under)..I will definitely be back

Summary Heading: the good, the bad, and the Disney
Summary: The good: good service and management.  Housekeeping did their best with what they had.  Location is great, you can easily walk to and fro from Downtown Disney and take breaks with the kids during the day.  Lots of places to eat within walking distance, including Garden Walk area.  We have two kids, 2 & 4 and a double stroller was fine for the walk.  The bad: We booked the bunkbed suite thinking the kids would love it.  well... they did but I didn't like the rooms at all (other than the partition - quiet enough for kids to sleep while we were up late watching movies).  The reason for not liking the rooms is this, they are depressing - dark, all brown, all monotone.  This is Disney for heaven's sake!  Brighten up the rooms for the kids, add some color, etc.  Also, a child who had

Our stay at the hotel was great. We originally booked a deluxe room with 2 queen beds but end up with the luxury suite w/a living room. It was pretty roomy. I like that every time we came back from our day at disneyland, our room was always clean with the beds made, new sheets, new towels, empty trash, and etc.  It's pretty quite and the hotel staff was friendly. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it.

There is so much that's great about the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites, location being first and foremost.  The walk to Disneyland is just a few minutes and with a 4-year old was a plus.  The breakfast was consistently good and the bar served great finger foods in the evening.  We actually were in town during the World Cup and spent one morning watching a match in the bar, unfortunately we were the only ones so the atmosphere wasn't exactly electric.  We were able to watch the fireworks in the evening from our room and that was fun!  The only two things that I would say were a downside to the hotel was that 1- the rooms are a bit in need of maintenance; we had the Yuha Suite and the A/C venting worked in one room and not the other and the sink was running slow, 2- the room itself

This was our favorite hotel when we were visiting California. This hotel is walking distance to Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure Park. The hotel has "family" suites that have a separate kids room! It was awesome to have a few nights for both us an the kids that were we could chill and not be in the same room. The rooms have a mini fridge and microwave and are spacious and comfortable. The hotel has an incredible buffet with eggs, sausage, bacon, many types of fruit, breads and drinks. From our fifth floor hallway we could see the Disneyland fireworks display. The hotel has a restaurant onsite and a store with all of those things you may have forgotten and the prices are actually reasonable. Great staff and great stay!

The Desert Palms is our favorite (after Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian). Good suites, excellent service and fabulous location to walk to the parks. The only thing I would wish for would be a lounge or seating area to visit in. We had multiple families traveling together and would have liked to sit in the outdoor breakfast area in the evenings.

It was my children's first trip to LA and Disneyland so were very excited except when we arrived at Desert Palms Hotel!  We had a "Deluxe Suite" with two Queen sized beds.  The room was dark and dirty and our view was of a brick wall and carpark!  The room was noisy and we had a vending machine right outside our room which was extremely noisy.  The shower didn't work and the toilet got blocked.  The carpet was absolutely disgusting - very dirty.  The breakfast was sub-standard and served on "plastic plates and cups".  We will never return to this Hotel.

I and my family consisting of one adult daughter and our two teen daughters had a blast at this hotel.  Everything seem to be at our fingertips.  Immediately when we arrived at this hotel, we were upgraded surprisingly from a deluxe 2-Queen beds bedroom to a Jr. Suite and at no extra cost.  We all loved that our hotel room was conveniently located on the first floor by the lobby, which offered its complimentary, very refreshing, cold and tasty, strawberry, orange & lemon pure water.  What a treat!    Our suite was spacious and very clean, plus supplied with a microwave oven and a refrigerator that had a larger capacity than most refrigerators in suite hotels which are rather small.  Also I liked how the pool area was just right outside our suite and surrounded by the buildings

I booked this room as the ratings were supporting this hotel to be very good. I booked this trip in February for my son's 10th birthday. I called the hotel and requested a room that over looked Disneyland... The lady I spoke with was excited that we choose this hotel to stay to celebrate my son's birthday and his 1st trip to Disneyland.. She reassured me that we would have a room with a view of Disneyland. When we arrived today at 5pm...Our room was not ready! What...The room was to be ready at 3pm...we were tired from traveling from Denver..  I asked the front desk if our room over looked the park and the front desk said yes... OH MY GOD... The person needs to learn the rooms of this hotel.. Our room over looked the car rental place...far from a view of disneyland. When  I

Having scheduled another Disneyland vacation, we again choose to stay here.  This trip we noticed things we didn't see before. We've been to the hotel during major renovations, such as a carpet swap and major interior painting. This time, we noticed more of the up-keep type stuff. For example, we did notice in the morning an employee notating places on walls that needed paint, and coming back in the evening, seeing wet paint signs hung after the issues had been addressed. Ongoing maintenance prevents things from getting out of control so it's nice to see they are on top of things.  This trip, we had ordered a standard room, but this time we did not get an upgrade. The hotel was quite full since this trip was right after July 4th and is part of the summer peak season for

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for Disney Land
Summary: My family and I had a great stay at the Desert Palms. We are a family of 5, 3 who are teenagers we stayed in a Yula Family suite. It was great as you could close the door to the kids room. We were on the back of the hotel and had a perfect view of the fireworks at Disney every night. The breakfast is plentiful although could do with a few more fresh fruit options, although for the price I am not complaining. There is a 7/11 right next door, a fridge and microwave in the unit. Disneyland is just a short walk away. You can start early, have a break by the pool and go back for more. Highly recommend to families.

Desert Palms is a great family base to visit Disneyland.     Disneyland main gate is about a 10 minute walk away.  We also arranged bus tours to SeaWorld, Universal Studios and Knott's Berry Farm. The rooms was comfortable and serviced daily.  Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with good, strong coffee available. The pool is a bit small but just big enough for a dip after a long day.  The spa was a welcome bonus! The ABC convenience store just around the corner is a great place for souvenirs and grocery basics. The bus stop across the road services the local ART bus as well as being the pick-up point for LUX Tour Buses.  The hotel front desk sells day trip tickets for the ART buses. There are plenty of places to eat nearby.  California Pizzas, also across the road, has fantastic

We have tried multiple hotels in the Disneyland area and this is now my least favorite.  We were so disappointed with the Desert Palms.  We paid for a Yuha suite to allow ample room for our family of 5.  We were surprised to find this bought us two tiny rooms with an all-glass shower-type door linking them together.  What???  Part of the reason we pay extra for a suite is to allow our children to nap and sleep while the adults are still awake.  A hinged glass door completely defeats that purpose, neither blocking noise nor light.  The bunk beds in the suite were fine but the sofa sleeper was ridiculously uncomfortable.  My oldest son found it so bad that after the first night he asked to please sleep on the sofa rather than making out the bed.  The breakfast was fine and the

Summary Heading: We love staying he everyone is nice and very helpful.
Summary: Desert Palms is located in a great spot. There is a 7-11 next door and Subway and other food places across the street plus it is only about 2 blocks(5 min) walk to Disneyland. They have an Awsome free breakfast every morning! You have a lot to try in the all you can eat ( scramble eggs, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, sausage patties, muffins and donuts are only some of the goodies) to choose from. Everyone that works there were very nice to us. This was our second time staying there because they took good care of us last year.
Manager Response: Dear Disneyland13,  Thank you for your excellent review! I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, we try our best to make sure all of our guests feel welcome during their visit. I am also glad to hear that you enjoyed our free breakfast buffet!   We appreciate you choosing the Desert Palms for your visits to Anaheim and can't wait to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a last minute trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is very close, and they offer underground parking.  $11/day for resort fees to basically park there and use their facility--but we were told all hotels charge a fee.  Free breakfast was great for a meal before hitting Disney.  Room was smallish, but fine for the 3 of us.  Front desk accommodated our request for a King rather than 2 Queens.   Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Howell08,  Thank you for your excellent review. I am happy to hear that you had a great stay with us!   We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: Room service leaves something to be desired... Items on the menu are not available and requested substitutes (that are available) are rejected by the order taker with a snide comment like "you can go order somewhere else if you don't like what we have."
Manager Response: Dear Noroom S.,  Thank you for your review. I apologize for the inconvenience you had with our room service during your visit. I will personally talk to our Food and Beverage Manager and make sure that a higher standard of service is delivered from the on site restaurant.   I hope you will give us another chance to offer you our usual high level of service during your next visit.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services

Summary: We, a family of 4, stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The reception staff was not helpful at all. The rooms were clean and quiet spacious but the bathroom was small and the windows in the room don't open. The breakfast's quality wasn't good and there wasn't a lot of choices. The location however was ok. It's roughly a 10 min walk to disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Yasmin A.,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and I apologize that our breakfast wasn't up to par for you. Our Food and Beverage Manager welcomes all feedback in order to constantly improve our breakfast selection.  I will definitely let our Guest Services Manager know of your feedback so that he can talk to all of our staff and make sure that they are providing the excellent customer service that we are known for.   We hope to see you again during your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Service Coordinator

Summary: We go to Disneyland multiple times a year and this is the hotel we always stay at. The service is amazing! The rooms are large and always clean. Parking is free and you get a hot breakfast buffet. The location is perfect as well. Whenever I get asked where we stay when we go to disneyland, I answer desert palm inn and suites without hesitation! Thanks for being awesome! See you in September!
Manager Response: Hello Jencal82,  Thank you for always choosing our hotel for your visits to Anaheim! We appreciate your excellent review and all of your stays with us. I am so glad that we can be your home away from home for your Disneyland visits and thank you for recommending us to others, we greatly appreciate it!  We can't wait to see you again in September!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services Coordinator

Summary: The hotel is very nice. The hotel do sent have a shuttle to Disney or from Disney (but they sell tickets to Disney) and there was no shuttle from the airport. I  got a 2 bedroom hotel separated by a matte door. And there's a pull out bed and inside there was Dorito 's in the bed. ThereThat was my only complaint the hotel has very nice amenities. And was a great stay for me and my family.
Manager Response: Hello Tiana S,  Thank you for your review, I am glad to hear that you had a great stay with us! While it is true we do not have a hotel shuttle we do sell tickets for the Anaheim Resort Transit which stops right outside our hotel and can take you to many attractions in the area including Disneyland. We hope you get to check it out on your next visit. I apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with the sofa bed. Our housekeeping manager has been notified and will talk to all housekeepers to make sure that it does not happen again. We thank you for your feedback as it helps us to improve our services.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary: I was in town for three nights to visit friends and was very happy with my room, the staff and the downstairs restaurant. Lots of smiles and helpful staff. The breakfast in the morning was hot and tasty - great way to start the day! My room was specious and reminded me of The Venetian in Vegas.   Great Location as you can just park your car and walk to everything.
Manager Response: Hello Rudy S,  Thank you for your Review! I am glad you had an excellent stay with us. We appreciate your compliments to our staff members and are happy to have provided you with great customer service during your visit.   Also, good eye! Some of our rooms were modeled after the Venetian at Las Vegas.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services

Summary Heading: Excellent Property, we use it every year!
Summary: Close to the park.  VERY clean and nice room. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the Borrego or Sahara Suite, lots of room for a family. Breakfast is included and it is very good.  We stayed at the Grand Californian and  there was nothing better about that hotel than this one. It is really a great value. Comfortable. Right next door to a 7 eleven and ABC stores so convenient for late night needs as well.
Manager Response: Hello Onna V,  Thank you for the Excellent rating of our hotel! We appreciate you taking your time to share your feedback with others. I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to provide great customer service and value to all guests and your feedback lets us know that we are doing our job well.  We hope to have you stay with us again soon.  Sincerely, Kristen Brown  Guest Services Coordinator

Summary: Great Staff, wonderful room loved it, Jesus at the lobby was just wonderful but so was everyone.  Great family trip thanks you so much to the staff at desert palms.  Close to Disney but we still used the transit and that was great too.
Manager Response: Dear Reyes O,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with others. I am so glad that all of our Guest Service Agents were able to provide you with great customer service, especially Jesus, who is a great asset to our team.   We hope you can visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Kristen Brown Guest Services Coordinator

Summary: My family and I go to VidCon at the Anaheim Convention Center each year. This is the first time we've stayed at the Desert Palms and we loved it. The free hot breakfast buffet, free internet and free parking are all things we didn't get at other hotels. Rooms have microwave & refrigerator and there are coin laundry facilities available too. All these are especially important to us since we stayed for 4 days. In addition, the Sandbox restaurant was excellent, the pool and gym were great and easily accessible, and the staff were all wonderful. It was the friendliest and most enjoyable hotel and I will certainly be back.
Manager Response: Hi Kch917,  Thank you so much for your stunning review! I am so happy you choose our hotel for your visit with the VidCon Convention. We hope to see you again soon on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great location for your Disneyland trip
Summary: This hotel is a short walk to Disneyland parks, close enough that you can come back for afternoon naps if you're travelling with small kids.  The free hot breakfast is a great way to start your day and there are plenty of restaurants near by for dinner.  The rooms are quite large and very clean and include a microwave and fridge.  Free parking is a plus,  staff were great  we will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Hello Joanna V,   Thank you for staying with us and writing such a wonderful review. I am so glad to hear that you had a great time during your visit with us. We can't wait to see you again on your next visit!

Summary: if they had 10 stars i would rate it at a 10 this is a awesome hotel!!! comfy, clean, friendly, close to Disneyland awesome air conditioned, pool and spa. i can not say enough great things about this hotel the only thing is it is pricy.
Manager Response: Hello Sarah L,  Thank you for your awesome review! I am so glad you had a great stay with us.  Make sure to take advantage of the additional 10% off discount for repeat guests the next time you book. You can get your special discounted quote by calling our Reservations Center when your ready to book your next stay. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We have been an annual visitor to the Desert Palms for 10+ years. The wonderful care and excellent staff always ensure that our need/concerns are addressed. They are very helpful. The money we save on the complete breakfast is just icing on the cake!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your excellent review. We appreciate you choosing our hotel as your home away from home for your Disneyland Vacations. Thank you for your compliments to our staff, I am so glad they are always able to take care of you during your visits. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: My family recently stayed at Desert Palms for a week. We were in Anaheim for a mini family reunion and 16 of us stayed at the hotel. We were extremely pleased with the accommodations from the friendly hotel staff to the grand lobby with complimentary flavored water to the reasonably-priced Sand Box Grille to the free upgrade to our suite to the clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. The room rate was incredibly reasonable and the free breakfast buffet each morning was the best part, especially for a family with many children to feed. We could not have asked for a better place to come back to at the end of a tiring day. The check-in, check-out process ran smoothly and the underground parking was convenient. The location of the hotel is ideal. All said, we will be back again the

We loved staying at this hotel. It had everything we needed from the pool and hot tub to a hot breakfast every morning and even an espresso bar down in the restaurant which I used every day!!! Your restaurant served delicious food, your waitress Olvia was so very nice! All of your staff were great! We used the laundry service and it was so worth the $29! Add to that only a 10 minute walk to Disney and DCA....well, the only thing better would be to stay in Cinderella's castle. Thanks for everything. when we come back, we will definitely stay here!

Pros: The location is every bit as good as a Disneyland Hotel without the sticker shock. It’s a very short walk to the park without crossing a major street. The suite we stayed in had a comfortable sitting area and provided my girls a little privacy with a curtain that divided the room from this sunken area. Two TVs made it really nice too! Comfortable beds and better than average breakfast. Eggs, sausage waffles and all the expected sides with some really tasty potatoes. Fridge, microwave and coffee maker in room helped after a long day of theme parking. Free parking is a big perk this close to Disneyland.    Cons: There is some room for improvement with the hotel itself. The pool was in a strange area that got chilly as soon as the sun fell behind the building. The hotel needs

Rooms clean, comfy beds, swimming pool, continental breakfast has a great choice. guest laundry available.  Restaurant downstairs good value and nice food. Location is great, 10 min walk to Disneyland, Bubba Gumps for dinner, Cheesecake Factory.  Angels Stadium about a 10min cab ride and for great shopping the Outlets at Orange 15 - 20 min drive.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Big thanks to Wendy for organising our return booking and I hope we are back there soon.

Summary Heading: Great and friendly service with a great room!
Summary: My family and I stayed together at this fine hotel for our family vacay to disneyland. Service was great, along with room, service, and accommodations! Will definitely be back here again! Morning breakfasts were great and plentiful. Pool and hot tub were very nice, as well as overall location and short distance from disneyland, stores and restaurants! I am planning to come back here on my own in april 2015 for a star wars convention (nerd, i know!), and will not hesitate to look into this hotel first and foremost, because of my previous experience and it's even closer proximity to the anaheim convention center where this will go down!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Big Room, Good Breakfast, but High Taxes
Summary: This hotel is an easy walk to Disneyland. The hotel is clean and the rooms are big. Everyone was kind and accommodating, allowing us to park the day we arrived was great because we saved on parking and it allowed us an easy return for baby nap time. The breakfast was average.  The only problem was the high taxes we were hit with upon check out. Our rate was around 180 per night but the taxes were a additional 45. I was not ready for this....they should let people know the real price.

Summary Heading: Just as good, second time around
Summary: Stayed here on a similar trip to the US around 2 years ago, and as this hotel met our expectations, thought it easiest to stay again.  Go with what you know, so to speak.  As usual, it didn't disappoint.  Got a great rate through Air New Zealand holidays, and the room was newly (soft) refurbished.  Immaculately clean, nice furnishings, and everything functioning as it should.  It's literally just around the corner (10 minute max walk) from the entrance to Disneyland / California Adventures, and you have all the major car hire companies, as well as a large mall and restaurantsall within a block or 2 walk away.  Staff were friendly (in fact friendlier than last time), and although we didn't need to use all the facilities, it has everything you need.  Even though we had a room

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disneyland - Even without kids!!
Summary: Loved this hotel - huge room, with 2 dbl beds and large lounge area, overlooking California Adventure Park. Great service and housekeeping! Awesome breakfast with full hot selection and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Next door to a 7-11 and ABC store, easy stroll down to Disneyland. Highly recommend! Ample car parking too! $360 for 2 nights and well worth it!

My family was visiting Disneyland.  I reviewed a lot of hotels.  This one advertised free breakfast , internet and parking.  I saw mixed reviews concerning dirty carpets, loud rooms, confusing hallways and dirty bathrooms.  I didn't find any of this to be true. The hotel was clean quiet and comfortable. My teenager slept on the pullout couch for a week with out one single complaint.   Our room backed up to Disneyland couldn't hear any noise from the park . We did get a perfect view of fireworks every night.  It is about a ten minute walk to the park.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

We have stayed at the Desert Palms several times, now, and love it there. We have recommended this hotel to everyone we know that is planning a Disneyland trip. Location was the first winner with us, but the breakfast is my husband's favorite. The staff is so nice and welcoming - we won't stay anywhere else.

We found this hotel  great.  Staff on reception were very helpful and welcoming when we arrived.  We got an early check in which was wonderful.  We found the reception staff always helpful and friendly.  The rooms were always kept clean.  The location was awesome not even a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  This hotel is certainly value for money.  It is not a 5 star but we did not pay for a 5 star so very happy with what we got at the hotel.  Would definitely stay again.

this hotel is in very good location , short walk to disney land , family room was big small , breakfast was nothing to talk about , there nice little cafe on side hotel make good coffee , stuff was so helpful there was mixup with subtle bus back to airport and they done everything they could to fix up ,

Summary Heading: Great location to walk to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed for three days and it was very convenient to walk to Disneyland.  The beds were very comfortable, breakfast had a good variety with plenty of seating room for all guests both inside and outside under umbrellas.  The convenient store located in the lobby was very nice and reasonable prices to pick up last minute supplies for Disneyland.  Great hotel, I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Just spent a week at the Desert Palms hotel and suites in Anaheim. Was there with my daughter and 2 granddaughters for a promised visit to Disney. Had found the hotel on line through Trip Advisor and booked it early getting a great rate. When we checked in they had upgraded us to a suite which was even better.  We were so happy to find out how close we were to the Disney Park, just around the corner and approximately 2 city blocks from the entrance without having to cross a busy street.  Breakfast in the morning was a bonus too as there weren't any decent restaurants in the area for breakfast. Granted donuts were a hit with the girls, but then they were on holidays! The pool was ok, although a bit shaded and cool some days. The girls enjoyed it after a long day of walking. The

We have stayed at a number of hotels in the Disneyland area over the past 2-3 years and recently tried this hotel for the first time. Here is my unbiased and honest review (Keep in mind I have worked in the hotel industry for many years so I am very detailed):  Location: One of the closest hotels to Disney (walking distance). We could see in to the park from our room and we had an amazing view of the fireworks at night. Hotel is next door to a 7-11 which is convenient for snack runs without having to drive.  Rooms: Hotel offers standard guest rooms as well as suites catering to families. We reserved the "Borrego Suite" which slept 6. This was a large room with a sunken living room area that had a full size sofa sleeper. The room was separated by a railing and a thick curtain

Summary Heading: We didnt have a good rest. Noisy and not draped room
Summary: We chose this hotel for our trip to Disney because of good comments on Tripadvisor. 3 nights with 2 kids. Clean room, and spacious enough only for overnight (what we were looking for). Not bad beds. Breakfast (included in price) is average.  Negative things: There were no curtains and the blinds let the light into the room. I hate being woken by light. Our room in ground floor had the view of the parking. In this parking there was a car with a very sensitive alarm. Every night we "listened to the music" of the alarm sounds. Really annoying. I hoped to not to hear the car alarm every night, but I heard it every night. Perhaps I should have requested other room, but we reached the hotel really tired and not fancy to change the room. There were no good free wifi network coverage in

We stayed here for 10 days for our California trip. Check-in and out was very fast. The lobby has a Disney feeling so kids loved it. Parking is free (actually you can park underground which was very convenient). It is super close to Disneyland (with 2 little kids it took us 10 minutes walk to Disney gates). Hot Breakfast is included but the menu does not change so you get tired of eating the same thing every day. The rooms are clean and cleaned everyday. Also, it comes with free-wireless which was very convenient. My only concern was the water/shower/bath sound that comes from other rooms. They truly need a good upgrade on their water pipes because it is too noisy. Overall, it was a great stay.

Unlike a few previous reviews, We had a great stay! We were there for 5 nights and found everything to be just fine for our first time to Disney. This is not a "resort" hotel, do not expect it to be, it is by no means Motel 6 either though. With all the choices to be made, I highly suggest staying at the Desert Palms. The breakfast is hot and there are enough choices to last you thru the week. Besides, we are home now and does it really matter what you ate last week if it got you thru? We could have spent more for less at any other hotel. It is a bit of a walk to the parks, but for us it was part of the adventure. If you are planning your first trip and am unsure with all the choices. I believe that you will find this hotel just fine and the breakfast will save you at least

Summary Heading: YUCK!  Not enough room here to complain
Summary: This hotel is an OK distance from Disneyland BUT Rooms are dingy and the hotel is "cut up" its like walking through a maze.  rooms are small and stuffy, NO comforters on the beds AND I called for blankets and was told we don't have any more  UGH!  The front desk staff could care less about any issues, kind of rude. I was supposed to have a view and balcony, THAT WAS A JOKE!  It was a small step out with a view of the cars and a large brick wall. Over yonder was the back of one of the rides.. OH I am STILL mad about this!  The restaurant down stairs has like 6 tables and is like a bar with tables.  Breakfast that everyone brags about but the coffee cups are like kids tea cups and NO real cream, only powder creamer stuff YUCK!  I could go on bu this place gives me a headache!

This hotel was awesome. We booked it for our trip to Disney land and i was a little hesitant but it was great! The lobby is beautiful and clean and the staff are very welcoming. The room was great nice and quiet even though it was on the first floor you couldn't hear a thing. They provided a crib for our toddler which was great! Room def. looked better in person then online and bathroom was nice and clean and great working shower. The pool is small but good enough for a quick swim with the kids and it gets warm from the heat but keeps you out of the sun. The breakfast that is included is great. Nice variety of food and the staff keeps the tables clear and clean. Although it gets packed there is always a seat available. The hotel also has a bar/grill attached which is nice and

Summary Heading: Decent hotel fairly close to Disneyland
Summary: Our family stayed at this hotel in May. The elevator from the parking garage to the lobby was not working so we had to haul all of our luggage from the garage up a flight of stairs to the lobby to check in. The lobby is nice and spacious. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds. The rooms are very small. My biggest complaint is that there is absolutely no counter space to keep your toiletries on in the bathroom. Not even a toothbrush and toothpaste. It was just a tiny sink. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked really well in the room. If your family likes to swim a lot at this is not the hotel for you. The swimming pool is really tiny it didn't have enough room to fit all the kids that wanted to swim so we only attempted that one time. The breakfast is

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff.  Free breakfast, parking, wifi.
Summary: This is our second time staying here as we were happy with the hotel the last time around.  We booked a standard 2 bed room for a week and upon arrival, the friendly front desk upgraded, free of charge, our room to the one with the suncken living room separated by a curtain and 2 tvs.  Since we were staying a week, the extra sized room made our stay much more comfortable.  The room, although a little dated, was clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job each day.  The location of the hotel is about 10-15 min walk to Disney with plenty of food options nearaby and a 7-11 right next door.  The breakfast was the same everyday but provided alot of choice including eggs, waffles, potatoes, etc.  It was always busy but we always managed to get a table without waiting.  The free

Summary Heading: Can a breakfast make up for the room?
Summary: We just stayed at Desert Palms two weeks ago for 5 nights.  I was looking for something different than where we previously stayed and thought we'd give it a try... and we won't be back.  Since we have 5 kids, we got the bunk room with the fold out.  Once you fold out the bed it serially hits the bunks!  There is NO room!  They were on top of each other. And the foldout is like a hammock!  The  head end is high and the feet low! There is NO cable, so the kids had NOTHING to watch to keep them from being on top of each other! We had the king bed in the other room, which was mysteriously traded out for a queen on our 2nd night?!  That WAS where the baby was sleeping.  There is NO room for suitcases!  Rooms are small.  We had 2 large and 2 small, and only 1 fit in the closest

Pros: free parking, walking distance to park, free breakfast, refrigerator in room Cons: terrible coffee (as in, not drinkable), outdated rooms, awkwardly placed tiny pool  This hotel was adequate for our trip to Disneyland.  We'd stay here again.  If this hotel was in any other location (ie. not walking distance to Disney), we would not not pay that much for a room.  The room was outdated and the towels thin.    I'm not sure what it was about the coffee that was so off.  Perhaps the pots need to be replaced.  The taste was so terrible that even with extra sugar and milk, I still threw my cup out.  I am not a coffee snob, but this was just beyond gross.

Summary Heading: Desert palms hotel, located with easy walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Desert palms in April. We have two boys aged 12 & 13 and booked the Yuha suite to give us more room. The room however was not as big as we had thought, it is long and skinny, the main bedroom had very little room around the bed with one bedside table not sitting beside the bed as the wall jutted out. Perhaps if a queen size bed was in the room you would have more space.. A dresser was provided for clothes and the tv stood on top. The space between the King bed and the dresser was limited. The bed was very comfortable. This part of the room was also quite dark as all the light came in the far end room , because of the doorway between the childrens room and the main room the natural light did not make it all the way through. The bunk beds in the

Summary Heading: Great location, easy access to Disney
Summary: The hotel is good.  It is within an easy 10 minutes walk of the front gate to both Disney and California Adventure park.  The ART (Anaheim Rapid Transport (Buses)) runs past the hotel frequently If you can't be bothered walking.  The hotel itself is large over four levels.  Our room had two double beds and a sunken living room.  The size was great and the separate living area is a must.  Two TV (one bed area other living room) separated by a curtain which is great.  At night, stops the light from the living room but of a day can be drawn back to let the natural light in.  Window also opened.  The bed was comfortable and pillow fine.  Room was clean but you could tell it was well used.   Bathroom was nothing great but fine for what we needed and clean.  On the lower floor you can

We spent 6 night here in April 2014. A comfortable room for 2 adults and an 8 year old. We found the room was well maintained and spacious enough for our needs and friendly staff throughout. The reception staff were most helpful as we had a personal mishap with medical needs which they promptly sorted for us. We would definitely stay again when we next visit Disney.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for large school groups
Summary: My family of 6 stayed at the Desert Palms in Sept 2012 and loved the location, breakfast and friendly staff so I didn't hesitate to book this hotel for 48 high school orchestra students.  Breakfast room was huge and extends outdoors and the variety of foods offered was appreciated.  The rooms were large enough to accomodate 4 teenagers and the lobby (where we would hold our brief meetings) was enormous.  It's a 10 minute walk to the Disney park entrance.  Two convenience stores are right next door and a variety of fast food restaurants are across the street.  Garden Walk Mall is also very close.  This hotel is ideal for large groups.  It's a little noisy at night.  I will stay at the Desert Palms Hotel every time I visit Disneyland.  Julie G. was our coordinator and had

The worst customer service I ever experienced. We made our reservations 5 months in advanced over the phone because their online reservation system sucks. We had to upgrade when we added people to our party. We had to ask for an email confirmation because it's not a regular practice for a lowly hotel like this. We got the confirmation via email and where it listed "Room Rate: 1178.00". Assumingly, we thought "great deal" on a Yuha Suite (up to 8). When we checked in they gave us a higher rate and told us to bring our confirmation letter at a later time. When we brought our confirmation down, we spoke to Jennifer, supposedly a manager on the night shift. She was very nice and said she was confused by the rate on our email and said she would have an answer for us the next day when

Had a 7 day stay and it is one of the better hotels i have stayed at,,,,service was great from the front desk, always kind and helpful.  The room was always cleaned promptly, the towels are always replaced.The location can't be beat, it is only a 10 - 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The breakfast was free, and when there is four of you then yo manage to save at least 5o bucks a day alone on breakfast, thats $350.00. They have lots to chose from,yes, its repetitive but at least they have choices. The room is always busy but never had a problem finding a seat as we could sit outside too. The parking was free, always found a spot and the WIFI was free also ( hard to find a combo of free parking, wifi and breakfast ). The pool was small but i didn't come there to swim, or soak in the

My daughter, two grandsons, ages 2 and 4, and I spent 3 nights and 4 days here and found this hotel a perfect place for us.  We had a 2 queen bed room, which was large enough for us.  The hotel is in walking distance to Disneyland and close to stores and restaurants.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  They have an excellent self service breakfast buffet, swimming pool and hot tub.  I recommend this hotel to families going to Disneyland.  The hotel keeps fresh fruit flavored iced water in the lobby which is a refreshing treat upon your return from the park.

Summary Heading: Started off great!!... ended in tears
Summary: Good: Nice front desk staff, great little pool, super clean rooms, decent buffet selection, general good vale for the dollar, especially for families, and great location.   Bad: very overworked buffet staff, a cup of ground pepper on the potatoes (so people won't fill up on them!?!), and a useless fire and burn hazard of a stove in the Sahara Suite.   Worst of all, my daughter stashed the contents of her backpack in a drawer, didn't tell us, and we flew home without her childhood stuffy, her trip souvenir stuffy, art supplies, and $300 worth of kids electronics... Staff claimed nothing was left behind, and my daughter and I were devastated! It was a whole drawer full of childrens things, impossible to miss. Staff blatantly kept it for themselves, even though we left a tip and

We stayed here for a three-night stay at Disneyland with our 6-year-old twins. I called about a week ahead to request a more recently updated room, and the receptionist said they'd all been updated at the same time.  However, she offered to put in a request for a room with a view of the fireworks visible over DCA, and we did indeed get a room with that view. To my dismay, Disneyland's fireworks were not scheduled during our stay. I also asked if they had any special treats for birthdays, as our kids' actual birthday would occur during our trip.  She said that yes, they had a complimentary gift bag for them, and it would be delivered to our room that morning.  Unfortunately, that memo didn't get through, so it wasn't there in the morning, but balloons and some cute Disney goodies

We stayed here 7 nights! The kids suite was absolutely perfect for 2 adults and 3 kids. Having the separate space was such a life saver!
