Super close to Disney, Definitely withing walking distance or easy to jump on/off the shuttle with little tired feet.! Breakfast is a full buffet, not a continental breakfast. Great value! The pool was so much fun! Rooms were clean and staff was so wonderful. Needs were met immediately. We were very very happy and will most definitely be returning.

We stayed here 7 nights, and were concerned the room would be a bit small for 2 adults and 2 teenagers for this length of time, but it worked out ok. One room with a QS bed, and another rooms with bunks and a couch/sofa bed, which gave the kids their own space and TV. Separated by a door, and the bathroom. Bar fridge and microwave provided. Housekeeping each day was good, but they did not always restock the teabags or cups. Breakfast was plentiful and they kept restocking. Not really to our taste, as a lot of sweet stuff, but we managed on tea and toast, and the kids enjoyed the waffle station. Breakfast room was busy, but we always managed to get a table. Reception were helpful, and there was a little side table that had a variety of things, such as protein bars (not all the

Our family of 6 six stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves . Great walking distance to Disneyland. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and clean. Excellent value as breakfast was included each day. Kids loved the pool. Our room had a view of the fireworks. Our family can't wait to return.

We have just stayed here for 5 nights and, overall, enjoyed our stay. It's biggest asset is it's proximity to Disneyland - an easy 7-8 min walk around the corner and you are there! The rooms are clean and comfortable but certainly not modern. They have a bar fridge and microwave which is useful, especially considering there is a 7-11 store right next door! The breakfast provided is very basic - certainly not an extensive selection but you get what you pay for!! My biggest issue with this hotel was the noise from the hallways and from the room above. It seems the walls are very thin! We had a one bedroom suite which was a queen sized bed in the main room, then a set of bunks and a sofa bed in the second room, which is separated from the main room by a sliding door. Two

Been staying here for 8 years.  Ideal place for Disneyland.  Walking distance where you can go back to the room for a quick break.  Free parking and free breakfast.  Nice friendly staff.  Will stay again in the future.  Most hotels in area charge parking up to $15 a day.

We stayed here at Desert Palms last year in December.  The staff were ok but what was great about this place is that it was very affordable with a decent room.  40" TV with a microwave and 2 queen size beds.  They also have normal size pool and Jacuzzi.  Their fitness center needs an upgrade.  The best amenities was the free continental breakfast on the 4th floor roof top every morning.  Food was delicious.  Desert palms is in walking distance to Disneyland.  Theres near by local shops for souvenirs and such.  A perfect place to stay if you want to save money and still have a great time.

We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.  That said we had set up an early check in, and confirmed with the hotel that we would be on the same floor as our cheer team via phone and booking.com.  This was not true upon arrival and not only were we assigned the incorrect floor but we were unable to check in until 4:30 so late after travelling all night with my 80+ year old grandfather.  What saved the hotel is that after some go around with an obnoxious front desk girl, we had someone else fix it and put us on the correct floor, plus upgrade us.  Without that this review would have a very different tone.  Rooms on the fourth floor were gorgeous, maids did a good job, and location simply cannot be beat.  Parking worked well for us, and was very handy in the area.  Pool

Check in was great, location was awesome.  So close to everything.  Conveniant service station next door to top up your water and snacks for the day in Disneyland.  The room was really nice.  Kids suite was fabulous for the boys.  We could easily walk to the parks each day.  Took us about 8mins with a  5 and 9 year old.  Bad things, its very noisy all day and night.  Parents allow their ankle biters to make so much noise day and night.  There is running up and down the hallways, yelling, screaming, crying and slammaing doors to the their rooms.  The bed was so close to the door you could hear everything going on outside.   Our last night we heard a huge argument going on next door.  Oh dear, not good.  Maybe we were put in a bad location but the noise was not good.   Smell of

Great place to stay , great location , great rooms , awesome suite .  The reception had very rude people but other than that all good . Disney land was close , 7:11 close by . The staff needs to be more friendly & get customer service training . Thanks

Friendly staff.Check-In was a breeze, complimentary parking, complimentary breakfast buffet, complimentary wi-fi. about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Great experience, CLEAN rooms, nice space -seperate living and sleeping space, makes for nice time to relax with hubby while kids knock out. Room was always clean when we got back from Disney. Great hotel will be back for such a  great experience.

Summary Heading: Great Location very Close to DisneyLand Parks
Summary: Nice Place, very friendly Staff, nice pool, free parking, nice rooms but the family suite was rather small,  the included breakfast was also not very good,  but overall priced very well & is an excellent location.

Stayed in a bunk room. It was great for a family of four. Easy walking distance to Disneyland and the complimentary buffet breakfast was a bonus! Loads of restaurants close by for a quick snack or meal.

I stayed here in March with family after reading the positive reviews online.  We were very pleased with our stay.  The staff were friendly and helpful and even gave us a room upgrade which was a pleasant surprise and worked out better for us overall.  One of the housekeepers even went out of her way to direct and help us find our room which was greatly appreciated.  The room was very clean and nice - two comfortable queen beds, sunken living room and a nice  bathroom with a fan that actually cleared the steam, from the shower, quickly so you could use the mirror right away.  There was plenty of drawer and closet space, two T.V.'s, which we didn't use, a microwave and refrigerator.  They thought of just about everything you would need for a home away from home.  It was about a

I have stayed here several times and will continue to do so. The staff is fantastic, as is the proximity to the convention center & Disney Parks. LoVe the free parking, internet, and daily breakfast buffet. Rooms are always very clean and well kept. I highly recommend staying here if your travels bring you to the area.

We chose this hotel because of the free parking, short walk to Disneyland, free breakfast and rooms that could accommodate our family of 6.  We spent very little time at the hotel because we maximized our time at Disneyland.  The sofa sleeper that 2 of my kids slept on was horrible.  Of course most sofa sleepers are, but this was worse than most.  We ended up taking the mattress off the couch and just putting it on the floor.  We were so exhausted after spending all day in the park that my kids didn't care that the mattress was on the floor.  Our king size bed was extremely comfortable and my 2 other kids who slept in bunk beds had no complaints.  The free breakfast was great.  The breakfast room gets very crowded in the hour before Disneyland opens, but there is lots to eat and

Summary Heading: The hotel that you just can't have everything
Summary: Average. Pool small.  Lots and Lots of foam in the hot tub. Not great for little ones.  Booked over two months ago, recd a room with the view of a wall and across from a pop machine, we then got missed by the maid. Won't be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Our go-to hotel when we go-to Disneyland
Summary: After a "spur of the moment" trip to Disnelyand in 2006, upon heading back in 2008, we thought we'd have to  shuffle between hotels until we lucked out at ended up selecting the Desert Palms Resort. We were so pleased with that first stay that we've stayed there every time we've returned to Disneyland since then, which sometimes has included several trips per year.  During out various stays, we've received room upgrades, and have as a result experienced almost every room offering they have.  On our 2008 trip, we brought along a lot of family and hence had a big group. The Kalahari suite was absolutely perfect for our needs. This was the only time we've booked this kind of room.  We've twice been upgraded to a Borrego Suite, which the kids absolutely love sunken living room with

We really enjoyed our stay.  The room was updated/modern, a perfect setup for a family of 4, with the little stepdown sitting/eating room area with the black out curtains separate from the sleeping area!  When the kids were exhausted and headed to bed, we could still feel like we could stay up without bothering them with lights, etc.  Beds were fairly comfortable though not the "pillow top" variety many hotels at this price range now have. Lots of linens...nice to not have to ask for extra for a change!   The front desk was helpful.  We checked out lots of hotels with similar ratings and cost, however this was one of the few that included breakfast and parking...the included breakfast had one of the best varieties we've seen in the Anaheim area, and boy were the staff ever kept

I wasn't going to write a review, but in light of recent events I thought I would put my opinion forward.  I was travelling with 3 other adults and stayed in a Kalahari Family suite for 7 nights, which was great. With 2 bathrooms it was almost like having 2 rooms. We made good use of the microwave by buying some cheap frozen meals from a nearby supermarket. The room was spacious and clean.  The supplied breakfast was basic but edible. The pool and spa were great to relax in after a long day out and about.  The location is great for Disneyland, just a short walk away. Also easy to get onto the I5 in order to get down to San Diego for a visit to Sea World or to travel in the other direction to get into LA or to Universal Studios.  We hired a car for the first couple of days in

The staff at the hotel especially on reception are fantastic, kind and helpful.  The rooms are a little dated and small (esp the ones with the bunks in them).  The double rooms that have been renovated are good and big.

Summary Heading: One of the Best Values in Disney
Summary: Let's face it - Anaheim gets expensive.  After you buy the Disney tickets, you want to be sure you have good value in your room.  And this is the place.  Located quite a ways from the Disney hotels, you only have a short walk to the main entrance on the other side of the park.  So that's a plus.  You also have restaurants and convenience stores right there, which can be a blessing.  You can walk to anything you need, including local rental car places or the convention center. The rooms are large, well-appointed and have everything you need.  The breakfast is free and it is a hot breakfast, including some great make-your-own waffles.  The staff is very helpful and the place offers free parking, which is a rarity in this area.

We loved the hotel and would def stay there again. The only thing I did not like were the sales people to the tight of the check-in desk trying to get us to buy a time share.  Whenever I walked in or out of the hotel, I avoided eye contact with them! Otherwise, I loved the place and fruit infused water in the lobby wad a nice little bonus after a long day at the park. The all-you-can-eat breakfast was great too!

Summary Heading: Great friendly hotel with all u need for a fun holiday with family and friends
Summary: Staff very helpful! Great location..easy walk to Disneyland or food just across the road. Easy pickup location for other parks!! Highly recommend. Rooms good size.. Breakfast room great for families and a good start to the day!!!!!!!!!!!

This hotel is perfect in every way! We absolutely loved our week long stay. I'm coming back in June but unfortunately I was told by our travel agent that there was no room available for us. Whoever gets to stay here you are beyond blessed!!

Summary Heading: Great location and service in Anaheim
Summary: I brought a high school band on our biannual trip to visit the Disney parks as part of the Disney Performing Arts program. It was a GREAT choice of hotel! The rooms are spartan but well-appointed, clean and in very good condition. The lobby was large, inviting and clean, and our group was able to use it as a meeting area when we came and went to the parks, as well as for a place to socialize between trips. The staff was courteous, friendly and went out of their way to meet our needs. I will definitely plan to use them again when we travel to Anaheim in the future!

We were here for a large convention, but could not be happier with the cleanliness, friendliness of the staff and size of the room. We booked a deluxe queen and had a great room on the top floor (4th) with a refrigerator and microwave. The location is close to the convention center, and was a good stop to visit Disney at Night (free) for just people watching and listening to all the musicians who play at night. Great restaurants within 3 blocks like Bubba's Shrimp, Cheesecake Factory, Roys, California PIzza and IHop. No problem with noise but then this was a very large adult convention. We plan on booking this again next year without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Quick - 3 Night Disney Stay! Perfect for what we needed!
Summary: My friend and I were traveling with our two 13 year old boys. We wanted a hotel that was a good value, and close enough to walk to Disney. It is located right behind Radiator Springs (in California Adventure) too bad we couldn't jump the fence. Ha! It was about a 15 minute walk from our hotel door to the front gate of Disneyland. We found the hotel easy to find, convenient safe-parking (and plenty of it), a friendly welcome, nice lobby, clean rooms and a wonderful breakfast and atmosphere. The only thing that was hard with two mom's and two teenagers is that the sink/vanity, toilet and shower were all in the same room! It's nice to have the toilet and shower seperate, but it worked out just fine. I'm not complaining. The rooms were great, and I do consider myself a hotel-snob,

Summary Heading: Good choice for a family of four going to Disneyland
Summary: We decided to stay here because of the AAA rate, 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland, free parking, and free breakfast. We arrived 30 mins before check in time and they were able to give us an upgraded room!  I had sent an email prior to arrival letting them know that it was my son's birthday and anything they could do to make him feel special would be appreciated. The next evening, after spending the day at Disneyland, we came back to a gift bag for my son with candy, games, and a couple balloons. Very thoughtful!  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland.
Summary: I organised my own holiday using Expedia and I was very happy with the price and location. I don't think I would have liked to have been in any other motel.  The children enjoyed the pool and it was so close to Disneyland.  When our windows were open you could hear the people screaming on the rides.  This added to the atmosphere of the motel.  While we were there the motel were playing a 'find mickey mouse' game within the motel.  Easy walk to Disney with children.  Breakfast was Ok.  The staff were very helpful when I needed to organise a trip to Hollywood.

We did not expect to see such a nice hotel.my wife and kids loved It.great location.we will go again.great location just walking distance from Disneyland. Hotel is very clean and the breakfast bar is great. Wonderful place to stay with your family would highly recommend this Hotel to any one.plus shopping and restaurants.the garden walk.we go once a year.me and my wife have 6 kids so we could only afford to go once a year.but we go all out.we really do have a great time when where there.I think next would be me and my wife only.plus the hotel is very affordable.the rooms are a good size.with a kitchen, a fridge,dishes, a stove.we got the imperial deluxe.I think next year we will the one with the bunk beds.theres really nothing else to say but whoever goes will have a wonderful

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel was a fantastic place to stay while on a week long tip to southern california and Disneyland. It's a very quick - 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland itself which helps quite a bit. Free parking was great and the free breakfast was quite good as well. The rooms that we stayed in were satisfactory and great for a place to sleep in at night.

Stayed here for a business trip while attending an event at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Great location -- 10 minute walk to the convention center. Room and bath were clean. Nothing fancy -- basic room with comfortable beds and additional sofa and table with chairs (very basic and not so comfortable).  Small suite type accommodation suitable for a family.  Small refrigerator and microwave.  Good coffee for sale in the lobby bar in the morning. Water with fruit available in the lobby all day -- very nice.  Breakfast provided but I did not try that.  Would definitely stay here again. Quiet hotel preferable to most of the motel type accommodations nearby.

Our main criteria for a hotel for our Disneyland stay was a place within walking distance of Disneyland, had a free breakfast and free parking, all at a reasonable price. We also wanted a place that had a room with a separate kid's bedroom (for my daughter and grand-daughter) and a room with a king size bed for us. I researched many hotels near Disneyland and this was the only one that offered both free breakfast and free parking. It was just a 10 minute walk to Disneyland so it was very easy. The rooms were nice and quiet, the bed was fine and we slept soundly all three nights we stayed. We appreciated the helpfulness of the  front desk staff when we had special requests. They were friendly and helpful to meet our needs. We would definitely stay again. We have stayed at many

We had a wonderful vacation with our grandchildren. The stay at the Desert Palms was great  The rooms were clean and the service was great. It was only a short walk to the Disneyland Park. I would definitely stay here again.

I have stayed at 3 different hotels for our Disney family trips and this year we tried out the Desert Palms. I lasted half an hour before deciding that if I stayed here my week would be ruined. I walked into our room and felt like I was staying in a basement suite,  It was extremely dark and dingy. I probably could have handled the room, if the pool was acceptable, but it was extremely small, the perimeter wasn't very wide,  and the towers surrounded the pool area made it feel even more cramped. The hotel itself is in desperate need of a renovation. On a positive note the staff was friendly and helpful.  The front desk did show me other rooms to see if they were brighter, and when I decided to check out they were very accomadating. Also,The Desert Palms is at least a 10-15

Great place to stay. Walk to Disneyland without much effort. Gave us a heckuva deal, better than close, comparable places. Breakfast (not continental) was a bonus, so it made the deal even better. Staff, custodial, everyone there was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were always cleaned and a pleasure to come back to after a full day of magic. I've been to Anaheim many times and this is the best place, value and everything, I've stayed. Look forward to staying there again. Even their follow-up after we got home was commendable. 5 stars without hesitation. You should check it out.

Summary Heading: There are closer hotels to disneyland
Summary: The hotel inside the rooms is very old.  Had to use thongs in the shower to feel comfortable. Bed was comfortable. Approx 10 min walk to disneyland. Free breakfast a plus. Customer service were young women who were not friendly and seemed more interested in chatting to others than helping guests.  I would stay elsewhere when I returned, there has to be something better for the money.

My family of five are Disneyland/California Adventure Park pass holders we go at least four to five times a year so we have stayed at many hotel/motels near Disneyland including the Disney resorts and believe or not the Desert Palms is the place to stay.  It's not a great place to stay but you get a full breakfast.  Not just pastries and fruit but they have a full breakfast buffet.and free parking.  We are planning to return to Disneyland in few months and will probably be staying at the Desert Palm.

Our travel group was my 3 children, ages 17-20, and my boyfriend.  Great location near park entrance, very easy walk.  We chose the Kalahari Suite, because it had 2 full bathrooms which worked out really well.  No one had to wait to use a shower.  Nice on-site bar and friendly bar tender. Very good breakfast buffet.  One morning there were scrambled eggs with ham cubes and it was really yummy.  Only hitch at all was a late return to the hotel.  It was after 11 and the front doors were locked.  The posted directions on how to access the doors after hours were not very clear.  We finally got the attention of the night clerk who buzzed us in.

Summary Heading: A Birthday and Disney Land All In One Trip
Summary: What a wonderful hotel!! The only thing better than the rooms was the staff. I can not praise the staff enough for going above and beyond that which is normally expected from a hotel staff.  We were giving a beautiful room that far exceeded our expectations. The room was spotlessly clean and very well appointed. There was even a gift basket waiting for my wife who was celebrating her birthday.  This hotel is but a short walk to Disney Land and all that the parks have to offer. We were able to purchase our tickets at the front desk of the hotel which eliminated waiting in a long line at the park.

We stayed 4 nights in January using 2 of the larger Yachats family rooms for 9 people ages 10-71. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We used 2 scooters rented from a local company and delivered to the hotel. The front desk staff kept the scooters securely stored and charged day and night with great attitudes. The breakfast was ample and the room was well maintained. This was our second stay, about a year apart, and this will continue to be our first choice for future trips.

Summary Heading: PLEASANT STAY I LOVED IT!!!!! from Quiroz Family
Summary: I loved our stay my family as well enjoyed the choice we made. The staff make it so nice and pleasant. Rooms are impressively super clean and  beds are very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel to every one. I had been staying at another neighborly Disneyland hotel for several years for many many years but they gave me the run around this time and I decided to make a change and I picked Desert Palms and I am glad that I did the change.

My family just got back from a 4 day stay and had a great time.  The free breakfast exceeded all expectations  The room was very clean, Plenty of sleeping space for all the kids.  Only a short walk to the entrance to Disneyland, and when you're all walked out, less then a $5.00 cab ride from the gate back to the lobby.  Plenty of restaurants withing walking distance. All the staff from the front desk, to the cleaning ladies, and the breakfast staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.

I was so excited to find a hotel so close to the parks with free parking and free breakfast. And after looking at the photos online, I was hoping for a very nice, clean room. This is what we found.  1- The Yuha Kid's Suite is almost as advertised, but smaller than it looks in photos. It was clean, and the kids' beds were comfortable enough, though. 2- The carpet is worn and felt gross under bare feet. It's time to re-carpet the rooms, folks! 3- The king bed was horribly hard. It felt like sleeping on a wooden board. My back hurt every morning. 4- The bathroom is a basic, no-frills cheap hotel bathroom. Some grout was missing, some of the caulking was nasty, but overall it was about what you expect for a relatively inexpensive hotel. 5- The breakfast was good, if a bit bland. The

Summary Heading: Family of 5, Fits 5 fun Days in Fantastically
Summary: This is a great place to stay!  Clean, friendly, efficient.  Breakfast was delicious every morning and the woman restocking the food and cleaning tables worked endlessly, nothing ever ran out!  Our room was normal but worked great for us (Bodego Suite) with a curtain to separate the sunken living room (second room).  We were able to check in 3 hours early, and the hotel will store your luggage for you before or after check in if you need.  We stayed on the 4th floor and had a view of tower of terror.  We were gone from 8am-12am every day at Dland and so tired that we could have missed any noise coming through the walls, but I didn't notice anything:)  Bonus 7-11 right next door.  We did NOT have time to  try the hotel restaurant but I assume the same cook made the breakfast eggs

We stayed here the first week of December 2013 and it was a great stay.  The beds were very comfortable beds, the rooms were nice and clean and it is  a very short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  .We were so impressed with the breakfast offered but I seldom am.

Summary Heading: Three family, one-week stay for Disneyland trip
Summary: I coordinated a 3-family 6-night stay the first week of February at the Desert Palms.  The staff were very helpful, and we got rooms on the same floor (4th floor) with the two, double queen rooms next to each other and the Sahara kitchen room close by.  The rooms were clean, nice and everything worked.  One room's view was the side of the building, LOL, but we weren't in the room long enough to care.  The Sahara kitchen room was a little smaller than we had hoped for (6 in that room) but was adequate.    There was a self-serve laundry room close by for our floor that was utilized gratefully by two families.  The full breakfast every morning was substantial and enjoyed (I think we gained weight), and on-site parking was a plus; and we never had a problem getting a parking when we

I have no idea how this is one of the most highly rated hotels in Anaheim.  Either people who have stayed here have very low expectations or the hotel is providing fake reviews on this site.  Good:  The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location is convenient to the Convention Center and to Disney.  Bad:  There doesn't seem to be any sound insulation between the rooms.  I could clearly hear the conversations of people in the rooms on both sides of me, as well as footsteps from above. The bathroom had mold in several locations. The beds were uncomfortable. The hotel as a whole had an odd smell.  It may have been the cleaner they use. The heat/air conditioning system was very loud.  As soon as a room was available at the Hilton across the street I moved there for

My family and I absolutely LOVED this hotel. From the moment we walked in we were treated with first-class care and customer service. We arrived at the hotel earlier than the check in time, so we ate at the hotel's fabulous restaurant "The Sand Box" to kill some time. After eating we came back to the front desk to see if our room was ready and it was not. Since our room was not ready the front desk upgraded us to a suite with no extra cost to us!!! We loved the suite. I will definitely come back to this hotel!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Disneyland or wants to get away for relaxation.

Summary Heading: Great place if you're visiting Disney
Summary: We stayed in a Yuha Suite, which was perfect for us as the kids had their own 'room' with a sliding door in between. It's a great location about a 10 minute walk from the Disney parks and at night we could see the Disneyland fireworks from the window. We were probably one of the few rooms where we could do this and we booked that room by accident. There are some imperfections - the doors are super heavy, the breakfast is nothing special, we could hear the people next door a bit. However considering the location, the room configuration and the free breakfast, we would happily stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

I take my Adult Transition class of students every year to this hotel.  Everyone is helpful and wonderful.  They make sure our rooms are close together so the teachers can help when necessary.  The rooms are wonderful and the hide-a-bed really helps.  I believe the breakfast is wonderful.  It was also a great learning experience for the students to learn to leave a tip at a breakfast buffet.  Thanks so much

I returned to Desert Palms for my yearly visit. It was as AWESOME as I remembered it from last year. The suites were very clean and I like how a top sheet was put over the blanket so when I was watching TV it was very comfortable to sit on. The breakfast was much improved from last year! I loved the waffle maker and the the size of the waffles were great so that I could enjoy the rest of the buffet and not be stuffed! I travel by the OCTA and the location is withing walking distance of Disneyland which makes for a perfect vacation.

The hotel is very clean the staff are all very friendly and helpful,the free breakfast is good for being free ... Could be worse, no complaints there really.  About 10 min walk to park.  Only negatives were beds Super uncomfortable we both woke up with aching backs.  The walls are super thin can hear everything in the rooms next to you so don't plan on sleeping later than 6-630. And the pool could be open later (at least for adults)due to the fact that you get back from disney late and would like to soak in the hot tub.

Summary Heading: All you need, but nothing special
Summary: So nothing spectacular here. Just a good solid experience at a reasonable price.   The rooms are a little tired, but really you are out doing thing. They are for sleeping and showering in. They were clean. Girlfriend and I never felt unsafe here.   Check in was available early at 9am which was great after a 15 hour long haul flights and staff were friendly and courteous.   Breakfast is basic, but make your own waffles is cool and the hit selections did seem to change throughout the stay. Sufficient variety for whatever your tastes are and failing that, it's free so no loss, just go down the road to an abundance of places. Think some other reviews are a little harsh -'do you expect a 3 hat dining experience at a free hotel breakkie?  Coffee was terrible but as an Aussie we drink

Julie Gomez, the group sales coordinator I dealt with was able to help me book 15 rooms and suites to accommodate my group of 90 students age 11-14, and 15 chaperones.  She was quick to respond to her e-mails, and answered all of my questions in a timely manner.  She even contacted me when there was a change in two of the rooms we had requested. The rooms were spacious and we had no issues with parking our two charter busses.  All the staff was courteous and helpful. This is our second time using this hotel, and we will be using it again in the future.

The hotel is in a great location, very spacious rooms, and the friendliest staff!! Leslie and Jessica made our stay extremely enjoyable! Their service far surpassed any other Disney hotel I've ever stayed in.

The hotel was well appointed with friendly staff. Booking was simple over the phone, and the room was clean on arrival and every day throughout our 6 day stay. Location is fantastic, a short stroll to the front gate of Disney and California Adventure Park.  The breakfast was ok, a greater range would be fantastic.  The Yuha Kids Suite was perfect for us, we would stay here again.

Every year the service at this hotel gets better and better. Great people, friendly service and a real welcome. For the Namm Show the bar and restaurant has music and a good atmosphere....why stay elsewhere?

This hotel was reasonably close to Disneyland. The room was smaller than the picture. The breakfast was just ok. There is a corner store next to the hotel which was handy. The room slept 5 comfortably.

We stayed at Desert Palms during our TinkerBell Half Marathon weekend and received great service.  The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and bigger than we expected. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely choose Desert Palms for our next stay.

The Desert Palms has become our "go-to" hotel for our convention needs over the past 6 years. It is easily accessible to the convention center with a decent bar/restaurant onsite as well as a free breakfast buffet. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and willing to go the extra mile. I am looking forward to our return visit to the Desert Palms for next year's convention.

We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting disneyland.  We stayed in the yuha suite that has the bunk beds for the kids.  This is not luxury but adequate lodging.  The design of this suite is very poor as there is a giant frosted window between the kids bunkbed room and the adult room so that if you put the kids to bed early (the whole point of this room) they cant get to sleep because of the light from the adult room.  We found ourselves having to watch tv in the dark so the kids could sleep.  However this was nothing compared to when a noisy family moved into the suite above us.  It literally sounded like a bowling ball was being tossed around above us.  Im sure the kids were jumping around on the bunkbeds and slamming the door.  This is when you get an idea how THIN the walls

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, good breakfast
Summary: If like us, you would rather staff off-site Disney to reduce your accommodation costs, but still want somewhere close enough to take a break during the day, this is a great hotel.  We booked a family suite, and while initially a little disappointed because the room was a bit tired and due a renovation; however it was clean and tidy and great for putting our weary heads down each night.  The breakfasts were included in a great rooftop buffet area.  The quality was good, and provided fuel for all that Disney walking.  Would consider staying here again, but would request a recently renovated room.

This hotel is in a great location, handy walking distance to the Disney Parks and Resturants in the Area. The Hotel itself was clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had booked a kids suite, but found it a little cramped for a family of 5 once the sofa bed was folded out.  The 16 year old found the sofa bed uncomfortable, and when we told the staff they bought up a fold out bed for her. Breakfast included was a bonus but did get a little boring after a couple of days and we ended up eating out a few times. All in all a good place to stay for the price.

The hotel room was very nice and clean. We had booked the deluxe room for a girls vacation to Disneyland. We had 4 girls in one room and it was plenty big enough. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would defiantly stay here again. s. sepe

Summary Heading: the best get away of a lifetime!
Summary: My husband and I ran away for our 24th wedding anniversary to the Desert Palms inn .It was incredible! The room was big and so charming! The Staff was so helpful!! Shirley at the front desk had the most beautiful smile to greet us after our long drive. And Dylan got us checked-in in a matter of seconds . Then Olivia gave us a list of things to do and times to get to he festivities in the area. We could even get tickets to Disneyland at the front desk! We have stayed here before with the family but this time it was just the parents and boy did I feel like a spoiled kid!! If you want a great place for the Best price for sure It will be Desert Palm Inn & Suits

This is our second stay here, and again we were very happy. We had a two-room setup with bunk beds and a sofa in one and a king in the other. The room was clean and comfortable. It was located at the end of the hall and was very quiet. As I reviewed before, the staff at the front desk was amazing! Always so helpful. You can't beat the free hot breakfast with scrambled eggs with ham or sausage, plus loads of other choices. We meant to try out the pool but just didn't get around to it although it looked very inviting. We'll be back!

Our family had a great stay. Very handy to the Disney Parks. Great value for money and the house keeping team very good. Had a twin room with four queen size beds. Very comfortable beds especially after a long day at the parks.

Can't really fault this hotel. We had a kids suite which was clean and spacious. I particularly liked the fact there was an extra bathroom sink, great when travelling with kids. Substantial breakfasts and easy walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good family accommodation close to Disney
Summary: If your family wants to be within walking distance of Disneyland, Desert Palms is a great choice. Certainly it is not a brand new, top of the range hotel - but it is comfortable and had everything we needed.  The sitting room at one end of the room was great, and came complete with a fold-out couch bed which meant that my daughters didn't have to share a bed. It can be curtained off from the rest of the room. We asked for a quiet room, and that is what we got - on the 3rd floor, from which we were able to see the fireworks.  The breakfasts may not be gourmet, but there is a wide range of options so everyone should be able to find something they will enjoy. There is both indoor and outdoor seating, from which the children can look out towards Disneyland and identify some of the

We loved the little "sitting room" at the end of our rooms--it fit our needs perfectly.  We had 11 of our immediate family members together in three rooms for a long overdue reunion--so we appreciated all being on the same floor.  The hot breakfast was good before a day of running around. We liked the handiness of the local transportation to and from all the local attractions, and the helpful staff to show us how to use the public transport.  Good value for our money.

We had originally booked a Holiday Inn in the area and the room was too small.  Our travel agent was able to book us into the Desert Palms at the last minute without any additional fees.  The lobby area was large, clean and comfortable.  My wife and two teenaged children were assigned to a Kalahari Suite.  It's pretty much two rooms put together.  The door from the hall leads into a bedroom with two beds.  (not sure if they were doubles or queens).  The other bedroom was the same setup but was separated from the first room by a large vanity area with two sinks.  There were two bathroom with shower/tubs in the same vanity area.  Our room had a view of the back of Cars Land and we could also see the ferris wheel and California Screamin'.  The room was large and clean with decent

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay!
Summary: My family had been planning this trip to Disneyland since my daughter was born. She is now 6 and I thought this would be the best memory she could ever  experience. I wanted the best possible vacation along with great value. I read up on my reviews on many different sites. I have to say that the reviews where in the middle for this place. I will tell you this place is 4 1/2 stars. It started with a free up grade to a suite for my family! This was amazing and I appreciate this from Parveen! The facilities were clean and safe on site. Moreover, it is safe and close in walking to the Disney Parks during day and night. We walked every day back and forth and felt safe. I would stay there everything time I am in the area.

Have stayed at your hotel several times but wanted to try something a little closer to the Disney entrance! Choose the Anaheim desert inn, worst mistake ever! Horrible customer service! We have always had great interactions with the staff at your hotel! We will be making a reservation with you for our next Disney trip!!!

This has now been our 5th trip to Disneyland and 4th time in a row staying at Desert Palms Hotel & Suites! It has been a very nice clean place to stay with great breakfast buffet! It is a short walk to the resort which is a bonus! All Staff members are very friendly, front desk very professional, and the housekeeping does a very outstanding job cleaning the rooms! I would recommend this place to stay and will continue to stay here for our trips!

Hotel was very clean.  Loved the water in the lobby.  Most of the customer service was good, however sometimes it seemed they weren't listening to our requests, just quoting from a list of responses.  The lady in the gift shop was really nice and helpful.  Be wary of the timeshare salespeople in the lobby.  Getting run down - needs a proper renovation rather than a coat of paint.  Walls between rooms must be quite thin as we could hear everything going on next door.  Breakfast was just okay but there aren't really any healthy options - we ended up eating breakfast elsewhere most days.  For the price, there are better hotels in the Anaheim area, so I recommend shopping around.

The best thing about this hotel is the location and that's it. The room rate was expensive for the kind of room we had. The breakfast selections were all unhealthy, the carpet has an old smell, the pool is small and although they tidy the room everyday the shower fixture was really bad. The fridge was making some noise and it's the smell of the carpet that's really bad. Won't come back to this hotel ever.

As we learned the hard way this past week, if you book a standard room, there is no such thing as a room with a view. Did I expectr a room with panoramic views of Disney or Anaheim, not at all, but i also di not expect the room to have a view of the stairwell well 10 feet from the window. We did ask the desk to move our room, te response was we could have the same view but one floor down (no thanks) or a room 1 floor down with a slightly better view. The slightly better view consisted of a room 1 floor above a parking lot and facing the wall of another building.  Sadly, this seems to be a property that knows it's proximity to disney guarantees high occupancy rates that they don't feel the need to invest in keeping the property up to date. Lots of very old funriture in the rooms,

My family enjoyed the time in the area and the hotel hospitality was part of it. The staff members are willing to help you. Room was a little noisy, but nothing too serious. My family enjoyed the time in the area, and the hotel hospitality was part of it.

Summary Heading: Wish I had gone back to the Ho Jo.
Summary: I think this hotel has taken its close proximity to Disneyland for granted and stopped trying.  We stayed for two nights, and chose it for its location.  On our last visit we had stayed at the HoJo and loved the cleanliness, facilities and pirate pool, but with it being late November, we chose location over the pool, oh how I wished we had stuck with what we knew.  Check in was OK, we had a good parking spot on the ground floor, and there was no help to the rooms, just trolleys to get your stuff up to your rooms.  Our room was opposite the lift so really noisy, and we were told the hotel was full and so we couldn't change rooms.  We left for Disney at 8am and returned after midnight, so was unable to change rooms the second night. The window looked out on to a wall and stairs,

We stayed here in July 13. Great location for Disneyland and that is where it stops.  Gym equipment did not work, missing parts to weights machine.  Treadmill not working. Filthy floor.  Room carpet disgusting, do not wear white socks on this floor.  Room was so noisy we might have slept on the freeway.  We were moved the next night.  This room the phone did not work, the fridge leaked all over the floor and we lost all our food in our fridge. Postage stamp sized pool. Breakfast was yellow and was not edible by health conscious people. Travel agent recommended this hotel,  we won't be using the agent again.

Our review starts with the ease of checking in.  We were blessed with our room being ready even though we arrived in the morning well before check in time.  We were able to take a nap while we waited for the rest of the family to get there.  We were connected to our Sons room which made it easy for the grandkids to go back and forth and we could help with bath time.  We loved being on the corner with the corner windows.  The king bed was very comfortable and a nice amount of pillows.   Breakfast was amazing.  Loved being able to make waffles in the morning having the fruit with pastries, cold cereal if you wanted it, eggs and biscuits with gravy.  I would have liked cranberry juice along with the apple but that is certainly not a deal breaker.  We had the best time while in

We stayed in the Yuha suite and it worked well for our family. The kids loved the bunk beds.  The pool was a bit crowded, and a bit too deep for our 5 year olds, but we didn't spend much time there. The walk to Disney was just fine. Our only real complaint was the breakfast.  The food was pretty brutal, you could never get a table, and the coffee was so so so bad! Aside from that, all was good (including parking) and we'd consider staying again.  Just buy your coffee when you get to Disney!

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: Positives: -location to disneyland -7/11 next door -lots of local restaurants to eat at -nice coffee shop and pizzeria, quiet  Negatives: -run down -small crowded pool -charging for safe use ($1 a day) even though it was part of the room fixtures -very simple breakfast with limited tables so you had to get in early -after a 13 hour flight, we had to wait an hour for our room to get ready and even then the staff forgot to notify us it was ready

Summary Heading: Decent hotel next to Disney and the Convention center
Summary: This hotel is dated but is in a great location. Disney is behind the hotel and the convention center is across the street. Decent food, good service, and a good price. Great for families. There are several good resteraunts within walking distance or you could drive to many others nearby.

I was in charge of planning a family reunion and I chose this hotel. I am always nervous when I am in charge of making decisions for other people because I never want to disappoint them. Thankfully  this place was a great great match for everyone!!! My dad said he will never stay anywhere else again. Free breakfast is great, rooms are comfortable, tram is the most convenient thing ever. We really loved everything about this hotel. We already have our next trip reserved.

Booked this for holidays just after christmas. This time I thought I 'll treat ourselves with nice hotel when going in to watch Anaheim hockey and Disneyland. Okay I can only blame my self for this, not reading other people comments. The price not correspond to the level of accomodation you expect, its way overpriced. Breakfast is lousy, couldnt eat it, just took coffee. Rooms are olddated thinwalls, you can hear your neighbour in his toilet. Really cant recommend this because there is better quality motels aroun there.

Staff was great, very friendly and accomodating.  Liked:  Water carafes in the lobby, filled up our water bottles for Disney every day, saved a few pennies :)  We had a Yuha suite which was great, my son and I were on the bunks and my mom was in the main room.  Safe in the room, easy to use, charged $1 per day but no big deal.  Room service menu was decent and prices were not overinflated.  Coffee/liquor bar in the hotel just off the lobby, good for a morning cup of coffee as the coffee with the complimentary breakfast was pretty bad.  Wish it stayed open past 10pm as I could have used a drink once my son went to bed and out of the room from my mom!  Pool was great and my son couldn't get enough of it.  It was only about 17 celcius when we were there but the pool was heated and

The location of this Hotel is great for exploring the Disney parks. But other than that the Desert Palms was a let down. The rooms were tired looking - albeit relatively comfortable. The walls were very thin and we could hear everything going on in next door rooms. The plumbing was very noisy and woke us up numerous times. Breakfast was included but after the first of three breakfasts we preferred to eat elsewhere. The food was not great in quality and served with plastic plates and cups. Would not stay here again.

easy walk to Disney, great staff and nice room. Pool and hot tub ok. wish they were in a sunny location and larger.  breakfast ok at best. same stuff   every morning, but a lot cheaper than Disney. We had a room with two beds and a pullout, the pullout was in tough shape and bathroom was a little dirty when checking in. Overall good value

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland, great for kids
Summary: Our stay at the Desert Palms was good. We started with a check in issue that was not the fault of the hotels and they did all they could to fix our travel agents mistake. The hotel is clean and comfortable, it's biggest asset is it location to the parks and restaurants. The pool is also great if your having a day off Disney. The breakfast is included with the deal but if your staying longer then 3 days you'll be craving fresh food pretty quickly. By our 4th day even the kids did not want doughnuts and processed food for breakfast. Not to worry, Disneyland has good food as do many of the restaurants near by. Overall I'd recommend this hotel, especially if you have kids.

We stayed at the Desert Palms in a Yuha kids suite for 2 weeks. It was absolutely wonderful. We are a family of 5 (kids are 13, 9 and 5) and we all felt safe and secure for our holiday overseas. The bunk, sofa and king beds were all excellent quality and very comfortable. We had 2 televisions, which was fantastic to help settle the kids after a long day at Disneyland. Desert Palms has excellent staff who keep the hotel immaculately clean at all times. We had an excellent view of the Disney fireworks from our balcony each night. Thank you Desert Palms for making our holiday dream come true!

Summary Heading: Very clean, pleasant, helpful staff, good valur.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay.  The free breakfast, wifi and parking were welcome benefits. The staff were so friendly and helpful.   Someone was always cleaning inside and outside.  We would definitely go back. The room was smaller than it appeared on the website but was still very nice.

This was our third stay in a year at the Desert Palms, which should say a lot in and of itself. The Desert Palms has a great range of accomodations for families, including suites and some that have kitchenettes. The included breakfast has a good variety and is a welcome way to save some money on food. The location in relationship to the Disney parks is great! It's easily walkable, making a midday nap for the little one doable. I will say that since there are many families with small kids, it can be a bit noisy. That doesn't bother us because we have a little one, too. Don't expect tons of perks. It's not a luxury hotel, but we make it home when we visit Disneyland. In fact, my daughter said on our last trip, "This is our Disneyland home."

The most impressive feature of this hotel, apart from its large and well equipped rooms, is their staff! Always friendly and welcoming, they went out of their way to help us out with our travels. Specifically, each day the staff searched for detailed directions to the various spots who wanted to visit in and around LA. This was an extremely helpful feature as we were new to the challenging roadways in this very large city.  The only areas that could use a bit of improvement would be adding a few healthy options to the very hearty breakfast buffet, and having softer mattresses (That said, this did not impair sleep very much).  The hotel is also impressively keen to get your feedback and the rooms are kept very CLEAN by the diligent housekeeping staff:)

This is the second time we have stayed at Desert Palms! We enjoyed the upgrade at check in and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a nice size and love the refrigerator and microwave. The breakfast foods have improved! Great place for the family and within walking distance to the parks! Also love the free parking! Will stay here again!

They were very profeasional and everyone was  Very nice from the front desk to the service maids. It made my trip with my family that much better. Being that close to the park helped us save money on parking and their indoor pool was very well kept. The breakfast was good and they kept it stocked.

This is a good hotel that is close to the park for walking, but my family still took the bus. Breakfast were good; however could have been ealier.  Rooms were normal for most hotels, but had pretty good beds.  Would stay here again.

Not super fancy, but it's super clean, and has very good beds! Even the pull out couch is nice. Close to Disneyland and California adventure. Would stay here again. The breakfast is fantastic, and you can make your own waffles. Big breakfast area, so it isn't crowded.

Checked in late when l got to my Room I find it is not what I had booked. I have been disappointed before and wanted to be sure it was correct so I called ahead and confirmed . So much for planning ahead. Room is old rundown poor quality. Called front desk and requested -room change,only to be insulted by Robert the front desk clerk. Called AMEX disputed charges.  Moving Hotels tomorrow what a hassle. Bath fan sounds like jet , faucet leaks ,bed is shot

I took my family to Disney Land the beginning of this month because they had never been during Christmas. we arrived at the Hotel about 4:00pm the staff was very professional and friendly our room was ready as promised and it was a very nice suite, it had a separate bedroom and living room and a full kitchen. it was more than what we expected and for a very reasonable price and it was walking distance to the front entrance of the park. the restaurant off the lobby has great food and atmosphere. we got up the next morning after a nice quite night sleep and enjoyed a free breakfast from the Hotel. overall experience was excellent. we did not try the spa but it looked inviting.

Room was out dated.  Bathroom was dirty and moldy (bathtub).  Glad I had with me my own hair dryer as the one in the room started to smoke and had a rip in the cord.   Goods parts - son loved his own space with the divided room and his own bunk beds.  He even had his own TV in that space.  Free Parking, Free WiFi, and Free Hot Breakfast in the morning were very helpful.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, OK by us
Summary: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights Nov/ Dec. We barely stayed in the room, apart from sleeping and showering and for that it met our needs.  The carpets were a bit aged and being on the ground floor the room was rather stuffy. We could have opened the window up, but being the ground floor that opened on to a car park we decided not to risk it. Everything else was clean and functioned well.  On the corner is a handy 7/11 and also next to that is the ABC Mart which we frequented for ATM usage, little purchases and also for souvenirs.  As I am lactose intolerant for me breakfast was a bit hard going. I would have loved some cereal or yoghurt, but alas it wasn't meant to be. I had the scones (biscuits) dry as there was no jam, only apple and grape and apple jelly which didn't

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, then downhill from there.
Summary: The room was booked with a promo rate from a 3rd party, so the price was reasonable for the area. Our room was a standard room with 2 queen beds and a mini fridge. When we first got in the room, it was a little stuffy, so I tried to open a window. The windows were screwed shut. I called the front desk, and they said we should be able to open the window about 2 inches. When I told them they were screwed shut, they said it must be because we faced a street and that's why they wouldn't open. We were on the 3rd floor, so what difference would it have made if we faced the street or a concrete courtyard? Besides, who can squeeze through a 2" opening? This didn't make me feel safe in case there was an emergency and if the hallway was blocked. I was thankful that the A/C unit in the

Stayed for 5 nights with my family of 5. Was surprised with a free upgrade. Kids enjoyed the extra space that came with the upgrade.  Food provided during breakfast was the same on alternate days. No complaints about that because kids enjoyed them. Sink in toilet emits a smell when tap is turned on. When you ask them to make up the room, make sure nothing of your personal belongings are placed on the bed because they could end up in the laundry. My little girl's bedroom socks and comfort pillow went missing. We only managed to retrieve the comfort pillow from lost and found. Overall, its very comfortable and convenient place to be in. Would definitely stay there again.

With so many hotels in the Disneyland area I was very weary about which one would be the most welcoming and comfortable for my family of 5. We ended up choosing this hotel because of its location and listed amenities, particularly the kitchenette because we wanted to cook most of our meals. This combination is hard to come by. The price was right for this hotel but I should have been more picky and opted to pay more. We stayed in the sahara suite because it was the only one with the kitchenette.   Ok here it goes. Very small room that was suppose to be a suite. Pictures were very deceiving which I should have expected. Dirty and cheaply unkept. The bathroom sink did not drain to which we called and this is the only reason it deserves 1 star, because of their timely arrival to

Summary Heading: Great for Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: We attended an event at the convention center but also wanted to spend our downtime in the evenings in the park. This was a perfect location for just that. It is a bit of a walk to the park entrance, but it's very doable, especially with how much you're going to walk anyway. This wasn't the greatest room I've stayed in... Right next to the loud vending machines and the windows "overlooked" a kind of creepy service entrance area, so we never had our blinds/windows open. All in all though the room itself was good and we had a nice stay.

Summary Heading: I don't know where to start with this review, There is a first for everything!
Summary: I decided to stay at this hotel as it was a mystery deal with Webjet Australia.  Check In/Registration was smooth and friendly.  I was travelling with my 18 year old daughter and we had two queen size beds.  I went to bed and fell asleep in my bed and woke up damp and not from myself.  My leg was damp from a previous guest who had slept in the bed.  Unfortunately to my horror it was someone else’s urine.  My clothes were damp from laying in it and I moved to my daughter’s bed.  I was quite traumatised from this as I was quite shocked.  I again looked at it in the morning and the sheets were stained yellow.  I went down to check in and asked to speak to the manager but she had not arrived yet.  The supervisor on duty was understanding and quite shocked.  She immediately offered

I had stayed here twice before and enjoyed my stays, but I was pleasantly surprised during this particular stay as they had fruit infused water in the lobby each day when we returned from a day at Disneyland. They always had two choices. I tried the strawberry water and lemon water, but the cucumber water was my favorite. I even stared doing it for myself once I returned home!

I had read mixed reviews about this hotel so i wasnt sure what to expect. The hotel is about a 10 min walk to disney which is great. If the walk home is too far for little legs you can get a shuttle for a small fee that stops right outside the hotel. We stayed in the kalahari suite. We travelled with 5 of our children aged between 2 to 17. we found we had enough room and it was clean and comfortable. The kids loved the pool although it did get rather busy just after the parks closed. The staff were more than helpful at all times.  The breakfast was fine all kids found something they liked. The room does get very busy though so some days we just skipped breakfast. We will definetly stay there again next time we go to disneyland. the only compaint i would have is the room we had

We picked this hotel for the 4th night free and good ratings.  We were not disappointed.  Convenient to dining, 7 minutes to Disney, large clean room, free breakfast.  Will use again next year if we go ,

Returned for my second stay here. Room wasn't top quality but good and better than some other places stayed and paid more.  Staff were friendly. Good location as you will have read, but also we used local buses and stops were all close by. Surprisingly no Disney channel on TV. When leaving room for day (especially if returning before 4pm) to change sign on door from 'Do not Disturb' to 'Service my Room'. Didn't try breakfasts.

This hotel ticked all the boxes. Close to Disneyland, right next to a corner store, complimentary breakfast ,iced water in the lobby, great sized family rooms , close to some amazing places to eat like the Cheesecake Factory and non-Disney gift stores. The breakfast was very American, with doughnuts , but nice to have something available to eat each morning. Would definitely recommend it.

The beds are comfy, the rooms are reasonably clean, The breakfast is better than most.. but the best part are the employees. They really go out of their way to make sure that you have what you need. I asked for a blanket and they had it to me in less than 2 minutes. We get the family suite for  my 4 kids and they all have their own space noone has to sleep on the floor. We were greeted with the cutest little towel folded elephant.

We found this hotel to be family friendly, close to Disneyland the walk took us approx. ten minutes each day the staff were very friendly and helpful the pool was clean the room was clean and very comfortable, you could eat as much breakfast as you wanted we were more than happy staying there and will do so again in the future.

Summary Heading: Did not live up to expectations
Summary: Although the front desk staff are very nice and extremely helpful we had a poor experience. We were upgraded to a king size pool overlooking the pool. The whole floor stank of vomit and the pipes in the room from the floor above made so much noise that you couldn't hear yourself talk. Yes it's cost effective but to be honest I would rather pay a bit more for somewhere better. Also the the noise abatement past 9pm was not enforced with loads of kids in the pool. I'm not that bothered about it but don't say you will enforce something like that and then clearly don't.

Stayed here the first week of November 2013 with kids between 7-17. We had a Yuha Suite(room 344) the breakfast was sufficient, the rooms clean, staff friendly. The pool area was shaded ALL day long, but the area itself was very nice and clean. The walk is borderline too long to Disneyland, about 15 minutes. There is a 7/11 right beside the hotel and Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump Shrimp Company are a 5 minute walk away. Having bunk beds for the little kids was nice. If you want a view of the park ask for rooms 316-324 or 416-424. Overall a nice hotel, but not sure if I would go back. Somewhere closer to the park next time I think.

Had family from outside the country to stay near Disneyland and we couldn't be more pleased. This hotel was more then we asked for. Great location, Great Employees attending to all our needs, everything is around and walking distance from here. I would live here. If you decide to stay here ask for Manager-Jessica Lizardi, she is the best and will make ur stay feel like a blessing.

Location is very good!  Hotel overal is acceptable.  Recomend as good hotel near Disney Parks in CA!!  Breakfest not good at all. It is better to find other place to breakfest!!  Good thing is not worry about transportation or shuttle to the parks.

We spent three days in the hotel in early October.  OK part - Location was really good, Disneyland is a few minutes walk away. - Pool was rather small, but the water was warm and the kids enjoyed it  Bad part. - Bar/restaurant in the hotel is not really kid-friendly, only a few tables, basic menu and rather loud TV in the background - Breakfast at the hotel was poor as well, with some stuff (like oatmeal and fruit selection) finished by 9 am even though breakfast should be served till 10 am. Breakfast food selection was limited. - I forgot my laundry quarters in our room on the table in the morning of the second day, and they were gone when we came back (with the cleaners, presumably, as nothing else was amiss)  Ruin-your-vacation part There was an awful smell in our room in the

The hotel location is very good maybe a 5 minute walk to Disneyland or the shuttle picks up and drops off almost in front of the hotel. The shuttle is $5 per adult and $3 per child but that's for all day hop on and off cheaper to buy day ticket from hotel than on the bus per ride. We stayed in a family suite with 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms and found it to be very comfortable, the hotel is a bit tired and could do with a revamp to bring it up to its star rating, we didn't really stay in the room much so its not a huge problem. The breakfast is very average and we ended up eating at the I Hop across the road even though it was free in the hotel, long waits and the food was very average. All in all the location makes up for the shortfalls if Disney is your only real destination.

I spent about a month trying to decide which hotel to get for our latest family trip to Disneyland.  I settled on the Desert Palms because I like the set up of their Borrego Suite (I have small kids and it allowed my husband and I a place to hide while they fell asleep).    Unfortunately, the weirdness started when we checked in.  Parking is kind of ridiculous.  There is a garage underneath.  You get to take an elevator to the hotel lobby, then walk a little bit to another elevator to get up to the rooms.  For some reason, I always turned the wrong way to get to the second elevator (not their fault just it was weird).  Our first room was on the 5th floor.  We exited the elevator and this horrible, acidic smell hit me.  I spent to length of our stay attempting to discern what in

Summary Heading: Family Vacation to Disneyland  C & T Radk
Summary: Desert Palms hotel and suites consider this place when going to disneyland, We stayed here twice now and it was amazing. Very clean , friendly staff, Family friendly. Just a nice short walk to the disneyland entrance. Tour bus and shuttle service pick up in front of hotel.Awesome complimentary breakfast served daily something for everyone.We would definately stay here again. Great for business travellers very close to conventions and a quiet relaxing stay.Contact the friendly staff at Desert palms hotel and suites to book your next stay.

We had stayed next door at Candy Cane Inn, and found it very limiting for our special needs daughters, especially our oldest, who uses a wheelchair for mobility.   Not so at Desert Palms! The accessible room was far better than expected with lots of places for the wheelchair to turn around and be stored out of the way.  The bathroom was large and made for a wonderful stay! We had a room facing Disneyland, so saw the fireworks over the buildings, which was terrific!! The breakfast on the top floor was very good, and the hot options kept our girls and us going all day.  Staff was very friendly, and made every effort to help when asked.  The only negative was the small courtyard pool and hot tub, but we never saw it too busy, and you don't come here to swim.  Tons of reasonable

We checked in all seemed good. The first down fall we noticed was that the free wifi was very poor and only was well accessible in the hotel lobby.  I had to do some business while on our trip so this was a bit frustrating at times.  We had a suite with bunk beds for the kids which they loved. I really liked that the bunk beds had stairs going up to them and not a ladder which can be dangerous for Toddlers. The tv in the kids room also a nice to distract the kids while we could watch mommy and daddy tv shows. We were here for 5 days and only had 1 morning for about 2 hours that we did not have hot water. Was a bit disappointing and the excuse was a "burnt out fuse" I was disappointed about all the coupons and deals for Disney and the surrounding amenities the hotel staff wanted

Amazing experience. Allowed to check-in early, great rooms, great service!  We were given parking passes for 2 days while we spent our time at Disneyland and allowed to check-in 5 hours early. Room was very clean and very nice.

Desert Palms is a great and convenient place to stay for a a Disneyland Resort vacation. The prices are quite reasonable for being so close to the park. Hot breakfast, comfortable rooms and friendly staff. Parking is free and well secured. The walk to the park is only one stop light away, basically 2 blocks and the same side as the park. Great options for restaurants are a reasonable walk away.

Read a lot of reviews online while planning my trip to southern California. This hotel offers FREE parking and FREE breakfast. The location is within walking distance to California Adventure and DIsneyland. Even after a full day in the park the hotel was close enough that no one complained. The free breakfast was delicious.... great waffle bar and items changed each and every day. I was impressed by the care that was placed into the food. THe pool is small but was a good size... we enjoyed the hot tub. I would recommend this hotel to families looking for a place close to disney to stay and to people attending conferences.  Overall GREAT experience.

Great hotel with great service, the front desk was always helpful. Walking distance to Disneyland and all restaurants. Heated pool, laundry. Big rooms. Would definitely stay again.They serve a great buffet breakfast with a big variety.

We checked in Oct 23rd for a 4 night stay with 3 rooms taking our children and grand-children to Disneyland.  When we arrived the clerk offered us an upgrade to a suite, not just for one room but for all 3 rooms.  This worked out so great since the first night we ordered pizza from Papa Johns and had a table with 4 chairs, couch, chair, and coffee table to all be together.  Papa John's did not bring plates or napkins but the restaurant at Desert Palms offered paper plates and napkins.  The room was clean and spacious.  The refrigerator is larger than most hotel rooms and there were 2 flat screen TV's.  We were so surprised when we heard a popping noise at 9pm and realized they were fireworks from Disney that we could easily see out our window on the 4th floor.   Desert Palms had

Our family party of four adults and one child, grandson of seven years of age, planned a four day trip to Disneyland, October 7th to 11, 2013. Based of the review of others on Tripadviser, we chose to stay at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites rather than staying at the Anaheim HOJO where we had stayed on a couple of previous occasions and which we found to be excellent! On retrospect we should have stayed at the HOJO! We booked a Kalahari Suite, consisting of two queen bedded bedrooms connected by a hallway with two bathrooms. This sounded like an ideal type of accommodation fo our party of five. At time of reservations made by phone,  a fourth floor suite was requested based on the tips on the Tripadvisor reviews. The person taking the reservation indicated that this would be

I recently had one of our student groups stay there (116 people in all) and have never experienced such good customer service. Everything was taken care of in a timely manner, had great assistance with the luggage and all of the rooms were ready on time. The students also appreciated the close proximity to the park. Easy walking distance.This is the first time our group has stayed there, but it will not be the last. The Group Sales Manager, Ms. Julie Gomez is definitely on top of her game. Recommend this hotel highly.

Summary Heading: dont stay if you sleep light
Summary: This hotel is an easy walk to Disneyland, which is great when you have tired children.  There is a 7-11 on the corner and an assorted range of restaurants if you choose.  The hotel room was clean but small.  They have not sound proofed their walls or ceiling, so we were kept awake with people thumping around directly upstairs and in the early hours of the morning, so don't expect a good night's sleep.  The breakfast is adequate, though the room is small.  The Wi Fi will not work I your room, but its ok to sit in the foyer.  You can purchase tickets to Disneyland I the hotel, which is great to avoid a line.  All in all, it was an ok hotel if you are a heavy sleeper.  Avoid is you don't sleep well at night.  Walking to Disneyland, there are a number of hotels that you could look

I had high hopes for this hotel because I do a lot of research when choosing a hotel and this one had pretty good reviews overall.  Let me start with the only positives...It is not far from Disneyland and is walkable (we did it to/from for 4 days with 2 young children).  Be careful walking by the 7-11 on the corner.  Fairly decent odds you could get robbed if not careful! The breakfast is free, but isn't great (and there were long lines and they ran out of hot food and coffee often).  The coffee was some of the worst I've tasted when they did have it. Okay, now for the rest...We were in one of the kids "suites" that is set up where the kids have their own bunks and a door separating the room.  Good idea; however, the room was TINY.  The walls are very thin and the people above

We just stayed here and found it to be within a decent walking distance. Takes about ten minutes to get to the park entrance. Plenty of restaurants along the way as well as two small convenience stores right next to the hotel. They offer to purchase tickets to the park at the front desk which is very convenient as the line to purchase tickets at the park can be very long. Small pool and hot tub right off of lobby. The only negative thing I can say is the room looked a little tired and could use some updates :)

Just round the corner from Disney. Clean rooms of decent size. Cleaned every day. Good sized breakfast room can get a bit noisey with excited children but thats part of the fun.  Lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance.  A decent sized gym and a swimming pool on site.  Plenty of space to park your car round the back of the hotel. Staff on reception were always smiling and very helpfull.

Walking distance to Disneyland parks; complimentary breakfast was pretty good; nice pool and hot tub; very nice, large, and clean rooms (we had a large suite with separate living room for just two people, for only $83/night); free parking and ability to buy Disney park passes in lobby were added bonus

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and great for Families
Summary: We stayed 7 nights in the Yuha Kids Suite.  Room was great, allowed children to be in one room and parents in the other.  House Keeping was fantastic and we noticed the little things they did such as placing the childrens snuggle toys on their beds once they were made.  No request was too much trouble and you only had to ask once and it was done.  Reception Staff were helpful at all times.  Walk to Disney was a flat level walk done at all times of the day with young children.  The Breakfast Room was clean and the food on offer provided us a great start for the busy day ahead.  Our kids enjoyed swmming in the Pool after a busy day at the Disney parks.  ABC Store, 711 and Garden Walk Restaurants all close by.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, will be coming back!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and then left for San Diego. This was a wonderful hotel, very clean and friendly staff. Very close to Disneyland, took us 5 minutes walking there. Hotel also provided a shuttle there but there was no need. We were a family of 5 and had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa mattress, all were very comfy and clean. Will be coming back next time we visit !

We travelled as a family of 7 and stayed 9 nights at the Desert Palms hotel in Anaheim and had a great time, the rooms were spacious and clean and the breakfast every morning was a real bonus and had something for everyone. The walk to and from Disneyland was done easily by all of us aged from 5 years to 69 years, and we did this most days. The front desk were always very helpful, with any directions we needed to get around Anaheim.

We love the Desert Palms hotel in Anaheim and return there every time we go to Disney.  It is close to the park and makes walking with a stroller and kids a breeze.  the rooms are clean and the suites are great for extra cribs and kids.  the breakfast is good.  The front desk has been particularly helpful for us.

Really had high hopes for this hotel based on other reviews,  but I was pretty unimpressed when all was said and done.   First off: avoid room 105- it was the smallest room at the hotel, the size of the bathroom was a joke.  We were happy that there was a free daily breakfast, until we ate there.   Gray sausage patties, eggs that required a knife to cut and bread that would break teeth; we ate there once and bought breakfast the rest of our stay.  If you need reliable Wi-fi, don't count on it here.   When we checked in, we noticed a kiosk with two women manning it, who gave the initial impression that they were providing Disneyland information.  Turns out, they were trying to sucker people into a tour of the Wydham Resort, which required a $40 deposit!  While we were eating

We first found this hotel in 2011 as we planned our first next-generation family trip to Disneyland. We had a lot of small tots in our group and finding a walking-distance location for easy nap time breaks was essential. We also wanted a suite where we could prepare basic meals to save some money and avoid dining-with-tired-kids stress.  The Desert Palms fit the bill 100%!  We've now stayed there twice - first with a three groups in our family and then in 2013 with a total of 6 groups of family and friends and we've referred several other friends there too - no one ever comes away disappointed!   The rooms are nicely appointed, clean, and the beds are comfortable (A must after a long day at the parks). We've booked Sahara Suites both times (the one-bedroom, condo style suite)

The hallways are stuffy. The first room we had, looked at a brick wall you could touch and to the hotels credit they moved us to a different room, that however is where the good ends. The refrigerator was broken and so was the replacement. Our bags were searched through the first day we were out. The carpet was filthy. The shower had mold in it.
