The TV didn't get most of the channels the hotel advertised. The heater in the room set off the fire alarm... when we called the front desk for help we were told that was because they were never used and never cleaned, just turn it off, did we need extra blankets. We did stick it out (the fire alarm was on our last night) and did like the parking. We will not be going back and cannot recommend anyone stay there ever.

We were upgraded to  a room with 2 bedrooms 4 queen size beds and  2 bathrooms. More space than we needed but not complaining as it meant we weren't under each other's feet. Beds extremely comfortable. Rooms cleaned regularly Staff were extremely helpful at all times If this hotel has anything that let's it down then it's the pool size which they can't do much about. Plus the breakfast which they can do something about.  Food is poor and they could take into consideration that not all folk staying at this hotel have small children in tow and perhaps have an adult only eating are That said we would stay here again. Location wise it's brilliant

Summary Heading: Good family hotel for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: We recently had a good stay at Desert Palms. In fact, we didn't complain once. Our room was nice. It was a suite where the kids room had a wall and bunk beds (TV on kids wall). It was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was about what we expected. It wasn't great, however, it wasn't bad either. I guess if I had one compliant it would be that the cafeteria was often jam packed in the mornings. They opened a room down the hall to accommodate everyone, which was nice.  We took our 8 and 5 year old and brought no stroller. We didn't think we'd need it. This made for some long walks back to the hotel carrying tired kids. It's about .5 miles to the entrance of the parks, and then you're walking all over all day long. We had to carry the 5 year old a lot. In hindsight we should have

Summary Heading: Good mid-range Anaheim hotel well suited to families
Summary: This hotel was exactly what I expected. It's not perfect but it ticks a lot of boxes if you're looking for good value Disneyland accommodation. First the positives, the location is nice and close to Disney, they have family suites with separate rooms for kids, there's a decent pool, the staff are very helpful and it's good value for money. The downsides are that although the breakfast is free, it's pretty terrible, the rooms are not very spacious and our room was slightly musty. Still, the positives far outweigh the negatives and I'd stay here again if I was visiting Disney.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel - close to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 10 year old twin boys in a Yuhu kids room.  The stay was great.  The kids loved having a separate room to us with a bunk and there own television and air conditioner. The room was spacious and clean. There was a small fridge to store drink bottles and things in and the room had a safe. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, so it was easy to return during the day and change clothes and take a break. The buffet breakfast was not bad.  Not too many options, but some hot foods, cereal, waffles, toast, fruit and donuts. The service staff were not great, at one time I stood at the counter (with another gentleman) and we were ignored by at least two staff members. (A little acknowledgement goes a long way!) Overall, wer would recommend a stay

Just got here and for what I paid, it is not worth it. Room is very small and old. Slight musty smell. Noisy cooler. Pool is small. Not at all what it looked like on the website. Ten dollar resort fee. So disappointed. I paid a lot for this room. Never again. Could someone help me out and tell me a reasonably priced hotel not too far from the park that is worth it? Thanks.

We have stayed in several hotels around Disneyland and this one was one of the best for the money. Plus FREE parking!  It took less than 10 minutes to walk to Disneyland and there were several national chain restaurants within walking distance.  A 7/11 on the corner was handy for buying snacks and water.

This place has some good qualities. Close to Disneyland and restaurants. Free breakfast (not the best, but it's free).  Friendly and helpful staff.  I love the cucumber water in the lobby.  The pool is not great, but my kids swam in it every day while we were here.

We booked the room with joining rooms.  When we got there the 2nd room was not clean.  They put us in a clean room and on 2nd day cleaned the joining room.  Breakfast is not that great.  Eggs some times sausage.  Hotel has a funny smell.

Summary Heading: Great experience at Desert Palms Anaheim
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights at the Desert Palms Anaheim and it was the best accommodation that we had on our trip.  Unlike most Californian accommodation, it was well suited for families having a king bed and two singles as well as coin operated laundry.    The hotel is conveniently located close to DIsneyland with parking included in the price.  The included breakfast is basic but adequate.    Overall we found the hotel to be great value for money and we would definitely recommend it to others

Great location, Disneyland and number of restaurants within 10 minute walks, helpful staff, family had a great time. Meals area could do with an upgrade,  a bit more family friendly. Check in and out was hassle free. Staff very helpful when child needed medical attention.  Rooms cleaned daily. Would definitely stay there on our next trip.

This hotel is perfect for a family to visit Disneyland. The sell the park tickets right at the front desk, the bus stops right outside or you can walk ( we usually walked to the park and took the bus back to the hotel). The rooms were clean and comfortable; we had a 1 bedroom suite and it had a king bed, a bunk bed and a sleeper sofa so the room could sleep 6 pretty comfortably. The complimentary breakfast was very good and they had a great variety of foods. They had a pool and area to sit around the pool, this made for a great break from the park before nap time. The staff was very nice and willing to help. I am a travel agent so you can call me for additional advice 888-409-2616

i booked this hotel online and got great value for money. the staff are very friendly and hotel and are always willing to help with bookings and directions. we arranged a late check out, which was no extra cost to us.  the rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. right near Disneyland.  free breakfast and internet.  when we arrived we took a taxi fro LA lax airport to anaheim which costs us over $100, the hotel staff gave us a number for a shuttle service to the airport when we checked out which saved us money,

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for the location and price range
Summary: This is not a super fancy hotel. However, for the price and the location, we couldn't find any better deal near Disneyland. The location is right at the corner of Disneyland, a walking distance of about 10 minutes. We paid $125 a night before tax, $156 after tax and resort fee. That's with free wifi (although we don't need that since I have my data plan), free breakfast and free parking. Most hotels that are at the same or higher level would charge for those things, making the final price much higher. The price of Candy Cane Inn right next door was a little less, but the condition was not as good IMO.  We spent 3 nights there. The check-in and check-out process was a little slow, but not a huge deal. The hotel room was clean. The most amazing thing is, we got a free upgrade! We

Summary Heading: Weekend at Desert Palms Hotel & Suites
Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much. The  staff is very courteous, friendly, and helpful.  Rooms were quiet, fully stocked with linens and clean. We enjoyed the pool and also had a great breakfast on Saturday morning. Over all the Hotel has a very pleasant atmostphere and is located  close to  attractions and restrauants. We have already made our reservations for next year.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay - Very Close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a standard room and it was very comfortable and quiet.  The service staff and front desk staff were wonderful.  My husband got really sick and we had to stay another night, despite being booked solidly they made arrangements for us to stay another night which was wonderful.  We loved the pool!  The restaurant/bar was terrific too, nice priced meals and lovely cold beer after a very hot day at Disneyland.  The kids loved the arcade type games in the lobby.  The only thing we were not impressed with was the breakfast, it was so packed out and kids were running around like crazy which was dangerous with people walking around with hot drinks and food etc.  We were so underwhelmed that we didn't bother going on the second and third days.  We would defiantly stay here

We have just arrived back to New Zealand after staying here for a weeks holiday with our 3 kids. Was recommended hotel by our travel agent and was not disappointed. Room was clean had 2 bathrooms and 4 queen size beds. The staff were very helpful and friendly nothing was a problem. Location was great only a 10 min walk to Disney Land also next door was a 7 elven and over the road was a few restaurants including subway. We needed return transport to Universal Studios and drop off to LAX, we were able  to save a lot of money by using the Hotels shuttle service. Would highly recommend this hotel.

I booked this hotel because it was close to Disneyland and all the reviews talked about how great the staff were. Whilst the hotel is only 5 to 10 mins walk to the parks, depending on the speed at which you normally walk, the reception staff were generally not that welcoming or helpful. We arrived a little early for check in and were told to leave the luggage in storage until rooms became available. We were not welcomed with a smile, no information about the hotel, no information about the parks (opening hours, maps etc for that day) just a waved hand towards the luggage store. This was a room, open to the public to come and go with storage labels we had to fill in ourselves and zero security. When we did get allocated a room later that day it was a really horrible room on the

This last stay at Desert Palms was our fourth in the past eight years. We love the Hotel service and staff. They take great care of you and always keep a clean facility. If you want a great Hotel with a great location and good friendly people, Desert Palm is the right place for you. Hope you enjoy it as much as we have for the past eight years.

Excellent hotel ,very near to Disney land ,price very reasonable ,Internet and parking are free as mentioned , only there is no one to help for loading and unloading your baggage to your room or your car.

My family (2 Ad 4 Kids) just finished a 2 week stay here. It was recommended by our travel agent and it was a great choice as far as value for money goes. Easy walk to Disney and heaps of restaurants etc. great pool and spa, rooms are not super modern but are clean and comfortable (especially the beds). Breakfast was good enough for a free breakfast. The kids loved it and it filled them up. The staff are Super friendly and accomodating. My only complaint would be a bit of noise at times from the floor above and the hallways, but we never lost sleep. Would definately stay again.

I stayed there on a business trip and only needed a nice comfortable place to lay my head. The room was large with a step down living room space with couches, Dining table, and HD T.V. Felt like home away from home for the 9 days I was there. With a free breakfast in the morning and little bar and grill called the Sand Box? were the food was good! drinks even better!. seriously the bar tenders where great and the services was great also! The only downfall is you have to be aware it is located right next to Disney. so expect to hear children play:) but don't worry thier usually aa sleep by 10PM:)

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, dated rooms, awful management
Summary: From the outside and lobby area this hotel looks like a gem. Too bad it was downhill from there. I checked in for one night using the hotels "Stay & Eat" Package. According to the reservation page, it states Stay 1-2 nights and get a $20 dining credit (I added a photo of the reservation page below). Upon check-in the desk agent informed me that since I was staying only one night I would get a $10 credit instead. This is clearly not what is stated so the check-in person got a manager to clear up the situation, After showing her the same picture that I listed below she informed me that there was another link to click that would tell me the complete rate details... a link that was NOT accessible from the mobile site but only the desktop site. The manager then informed me how when

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for Disneyland value
Summary: When you start pricing the cost of staying close to Disneyland you quickly find out that 7 days in Anaheim can really set you back some serious coin, we came across the Desert Palms and we were pleasantly surprised both with the hotel itself and the cost considering it was a pleasant 10 minute walk from the gates of Disneyland. The location is quite good to restaurants and shopping centres etc. Breakfast was handy, plenty of cereal, toast, scrambled eggs and other pastries, rooms were comfortable without being 5 star, only complaint was the air con was a little under the pump with the heat during our visit. Overall we enjoyed our stay, staff were very friendly, check in and check out very well organised and we would stay again next time we are in Anaheim. Thanks to all for a

Stayed here for 4 nights with 4 kids, room was lean and tidy, location was a nice short walk to Disney land and also a short walk to the gardens where there are several nice restaurants. Nice to have free Wifi, free parking, use of a pool and a complimentary breakfast which was not to bad to start the day. also it is great that there is a washing machine and dryer on each floor for a small fee, very handy.

Summary Heading: Beware of thieves amongst the maids!
Summary: Pros: - Convenience with location near Disneyland and shops - Good customer service from most of the staff - Clean rooms with tea and coffee making facilities - Self-use laundry  Cons: - We had lots of change in a bag left on the table. It went missing after the daily housekeeping. So please watch out.  Apart from that, I recommend this hotel! :)

We stayed here to visit Disneyland. The hotel is a very comfortable, flat 10 minute walk to the main entrance. We were impressed  with the free parking, and also with the fact that we were able to check in and leave the car a few hours early. Reception staff very efficient and friendly.  We stayed in a Yuha Kids suite which had the advantage of a separate room with door. Not large but large enough.  Not the latest decor either, but clean and basic. In fact we were pretty satisfied with this hotel, until we decided to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast. In short, don't bother. The atmosphere was like an animal feeding time and while there were some options, they all seem quite processed e.g. yogurts all coloured and flavored, eggs seemed to be out of a bag or box. Of

We stayed here for 8 nights with 4 adults in one room. The room was big enough for the 4 of us however we wish we had have upgraded which was offered to us at check in we discovered this after we'd stayed a few nights. Our room was very basic with a fridge with no freezer & coffee maker. The bathroom was clean however the carpet felt sticky? The pool and spa were great and the park was terrific. This hotel is about a 10 min walk to the Disney entrance and 5 mins to the restaurants strip. Staff were okay however not to friendly. Also be mindful if you use the safe provided in your room they charge you for this which you're not told until you check out. Overall this hotel was in a great location and I would stay here again on my next visit.

Stayed here for a week whilst we did Disneyland.   The hotel is very convenient to the parks.   It is surrounded by food outlets that offer a great choice.   There is bus stops right outside the front door, making travel very easy and convient.   The hotel is very much family oriented, so expect plenty of kids astound.   The breakfast is included in the price and it is a good way to start the day.   The rooms were comfortable and a good variety is available.

We were looking for a hotel that would comfortably fit 5 people (3 adults, 2 children) and would be close enough for those of us running the Disneyland Half Marathon to walk to the weekend's events.  This hotel met those expectations and so many more!!  We arrived about 4 hours before check in, and though we couldn't physically check into our room, we were able to get our parking pass which was extremely helpful!  When we did get into the room, it was clean, modern and even had a towel folded like an elephant on the bed!  The beds were unbelievably comfortable, which was so wonderful for the runners!  Our room (the Borrego Suite) fit all of us with room to spare.  There was a curtain to separate the adults from the kids.  The walk to Disneyland was a little more than 5 minutes

Comfortable and clean rooms, what you need after long day at Disneyland. Has a nice pool for dipping when it's hot. About 10 min slow walk to both park entrance. Close to some great restaurant's 6 min walk, highly recommend Roy's  and The Chesse Cake Factory. The only thing that wasn't great is the breakfast not very Australian . Waffles with syrup , donuts , fruit loops , but all edible ..

We booked this place as it was a short walk from Disneyland. Our room was quite spacious as it had for double beds and two bathrooms, bit of overkill for two people but not complaining. The room was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The only down side is that the rooms are not very sound proof as you can hear the people above you when they walk in their room. The breakfast was plenty and you would not go hungry This place is set up for kids and is a great place to stay if you intention is to go to Disneyland as the walk is no more than ten minutes to the entrance Would be happy to stay here again

This is a great location for Disneyland guests,a really good family hotel.There were 4 of us,2 adults and 2 kids lots of room.The room was clean.The staff were great,when we arrived they put the kids on a hunt in the lobby for a hidden Minnie.The hotel also offers free parking,which is a big savings for anyone traveling in California .It also had free Wi-fi and a free breakfast.This hotel is just a short walk to the from gate of Disneyland.(15min0

We've now stayed at Desert palms twice. Each time was with family including grandchildren. The position is great, so close to Disneyland but also close to a bus to Disneyland if you're a bit old and tired like me. Our rooms were perfect. We, three adults, had a Borrego suite which meant we had lots of space two Tvs, and a view of disneyland fireworks.  OUr daughter and son in law had a Sahara suite. Separate bedroom, full cooking and fridge and a balcony. The tariff was so reasonable and the staff on reception were friendly and helpful at all times. Highly recommend this hotel especially for families.

My husband and I stayed here with our two small children (5 and 1). We were so happy with our stay! We arrived early so couldn't check in, but the staff member couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Our room was on the third floor.  It was large enough for our three suitcases and stroller.  The beds were very comfortable.  The decor is dated, but pleasant. The bathroom was serviceable,  and although the fan and a/c are noisy,  it was not unpleasant.  The pool area was a big hit with the kids, with pool lights keeping it interesting in the twilight hours.  It was an easy ten minute stroll to Disney land.   The restaurant had yummy food,  and friendly staff.  The breakfast on the 5th floor was ok, enough choices to keep everyone happy, especially with rhe waffle making

Summary Heading: Good family hotel that's close to Disneyland
Summary: This is a very good & clean family hotel that is close to Disneyland.  It has a full breakfast every morning (though gets very busy) and food is a bit repetitive but there is lots to choose from.  The rooms provide you with a small fridge & microwave.  The coffee pot is so small that it is fairly useless but there is a restaurant in the hotel where if needed you could get all the special type coffees.  There is a 7-11 and another store side by side that are right beside the hotel.  This is great for kids/teens for snacks/fruits/pizza/hot dogs etc.  There is a swimming pool in the hotel but again it gets very busy.  All in all I would recommend this hotel for families.

Summary Heading: Not as good as it used to be
Summary: I've stayed in this hotel several times in the past 6 years or so and this time may be the last.  While the location is great and the price is fair, the hotel seems to be in a state of decline.  The front desk staff were very nice and helpful.  The two people did carry on a personal conversation in front of us that was a little unprofessional, but the girl that checked us in was very nice.  We got a room on the 3rd floor right by the elevator.  I was worried about noise but it was not an issue.  We never heard anyone coming off the elevator or any noise in the hallway.  They gave us a suite with a stove, microwave, 3/4 size fridge and a sink.  I didn't ask for all that but it was nice to have the extra room.  The room was pretty clean and had plenty of room.  The bathroom was a

I stayed here for close to one week, during the mid-summer among the peak traveling season. Nice points: 1. I asked for a high floor room with Disneyland park view, and was granted a free upgrade to a family suite overlooking the Disney park partially.  2. The room was very cozy, big, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Able to see the nightly Disney firework from the window.  3. Breakfast selection was nice, with the omelette and fruits.  4. Very short walking distance to the Anaheim convention center. I noticed that there was also a shuttle bus stop to the Disney park/downtown. 5. Close to eatery and shopping mall.  6. Very reasonable and lower room rate compared to higher end branded hotel, but with more free facilities: breakfast and wifi.   I definitely recommend this hotel for

My family stayed here for 3 nights in August, 2013.  The rooms were great.  We stayed in the Yuha Kids Suite w/ Bunk Bed.  The kids had their own separate bedroom with a TV & sleeper sofa. It was a little strange that the room overlooked a rooftop area which meant that we had no natural light in the room however, as a result,  the room was quiet and everyone slept well.  The beds were a little soft for my liking but someone else may not mind.  My only complaint is breakfast.  There was a definite lack of variety here.  It was pretty much the same food every day.   Also, the coffee tasted like instant and the OJ has a strange aftertaste. The hotel is very convenient to Disneyland and was about a 7 minute walk. Many restaurants are nearby for either a sit down or counter service

This was a pretty good hotel for a 3 night stay in Anaheim. We visited Universal Studios and Disneyland during our stay. The hotel is in a great place; right next to a 7-Eleven and within 10 minutes walking distance from Disneyland.   The hotel lobby and breakfast room were very nice and spacious. The front desk service was ok. I never got my free drinks that came with the room. They weren't very helpful.  The rooms were ok; a lot smaller than I would've liked. The rooms were pretty clean (except for the carpet). The microwave and fridge were very convenient. Overall, this was a good value for around $100/night.

If you need a place to crash within walking distance to disneyland and need some extra room for your family this is a pretty good option. The staff was nice. The free breakfast is what you would expect for a free breakfast at a mid range hotel. The room was pretty worn. Mold in the bathroom, incredibly loud bathroom fan, chipped furniture, paper thin walls ( if your planning to sleep in our plan a nap for a child during the day good luck we heard everything especially from the hallway). We were traveling with our three small children (2,4,6). We walked each day to disneyland and California adventure we didn't feel the need to deal with a shuttle.  We didn't spend much time at the hotel,we left early(we attempted to sleep in one day but there was too much noise) and came back

Summary Heading: Perfect choice for any reason from Disney to a conference.
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 days and were extremely happy with our experience. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, everyone from the check-in to the bar staff. The rooms were comfortable and clean, a very nice welcome when returning back from  2 full days at Disneyland and California adventures. 10 minute walk from door to door to the parks. Free breakfast, a nice selection to choose from. Free parking. All around great stay.

Summary Heading: Great Start To Our Family Vacation
Summary: The staff were very friendly and helpful when we needed information, the facilities were clean, and our room was spacious enough that we didn't feel crowded for the week that we stayed here. The hotel was in close proximity for everything we had planned while we were in Anaheim, we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay here again when travelling in the area

Great hotel for the family, staff was great, very clean, breakfast is also very good and changes a little bit each day. Free parking etc which is also great. Is a little bit of a hike to Disneyland, not an issue if you're spending the entire day. If youre going back and forth a few times, as we did, to grab a sweater etc for the evening it gets a little inconvenient. They could benefit from a small shuttle bus as a number of the surrounding hotels have. The Sandbox restaurant is also very good, it looks ind of plain when you pass by but the food & the guys who work there are outstanding. All in great value and the place was amazingly clean. We would definatly stay there again that is for sure.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay at the Desert Palms
Summary: My family and I had a wonderful time while staying at the Desert Palms! The layout of the room was perfect for a family with 2 young kids (5 and 3) and a teenager (13)! They loved having their own space and TV! Mom and Dad also loved having their own space and TV!   The breakfast was awesome and was a great way to start the day off. It really  had something for everyone. I loved the eggs, the wife loved the waffles and the kids loved the cereal.    The front desk staff was always pleasant and helpful whenever we needed assistance, which thankfully was not that much.   The housekeeping staff was very accommodating to our differing schedule, even though we got in their way a few times.  Free parking was also very much appreciated and saved us money as well!  Don't hesitate in

Summary Heading: We had a lot of room in the family suite and the staff was friendly and helpful.
Summary: Great place to stay in Anaheim, especially if you are going to Disney! Within easy walking distance of the parks and the free hot breakfast is a great way to start a long day. We were very pleased with our room and the staff were helpful and friendly. The flavoured water in the lobby was a great extra too!

Summary Heading: Good location and staff very profesionel
Summary: We spended 3 nights in the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites. We enjoyed this time. The staff was very friendly and profesionel(special thank to Edourdo at the reception) A very good adress, nice room, etc Nice pool, good breafast; free parking,

We stayed in Aug 2013, and had a really good experience.  Our rooms were upgraded to suites which was nice. The hotel staff, all of the staff, were above and beyond helpful and friendly.  The beds were firm, but our sheets were soft and clean. We loved the extra pillows and blanket already in the room. The breakfast served each morning had alot of variety, and was not bad. We have a fussy family, and everyone found something to their liking. I thought of it this way, at least we didn't have to go somewhere else for breakfast and pay 10.00+ per person to eat. The suite area had a fold out couch and a curtian that would close it off so my teenager could watch what she wanted and stay up late without bothering us. Loved that the hotel was in walking distance of D-land, and we could

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay near Disneyland!!!
Summary: I stay at this hotel every time we go to Disneyland or the Anaheim area.  Every one there is so nice and helpful.  The hotel is very clean and safe feeling.  The breakfasts are great with a big variety. And the breakfasts are free.  A great place to stay with a family.

Summary Heading: Old hotel with great staff and free breakfast!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel in Aug 2013 with my two daughters (10 year olds). This hotel is nothing special but then again, not a dirt bag either. It's a couple steps up from a motel. Bad: it's old...carpet old and musty, towels rough and dry, linen/bedding is rough and beds are not comfortable, furniture is chipped and old (drawers kept opening by themselves), tiny enclosed pool. Good: kids loved the bunk beds, rooms are sizable, 2 free drinks at the bar, free breakfast, staff was exceedingly nice and helpful, location right next to Disneyland and walking distance to restaurants. Overall, it's just okay, especially for kids. But I won't be staying there again.

The hotel was within good walking distance to Disneyland. Amenities were minimal and rooms were sadly run down and in serious updating. carpet was stained and dirty looking as well as bed covering. we stayed in a suite which included bunk beds for the kids and a sofa couch. you couldn't move around in the kids room with the sofa couch open and the rooms were very small. picture a regular 2 queen bed room and make it smaller and that is what you get. considering the amount of traffic that these hotels get it is understandable that there will be lots of wear and tear but some effort needs to be put in to update. if you are only going there because it is close to the park, accomodates kids and has breakfast and could care less about the actual room itself, this is the place to go.

First stayed here back in Aug 2011 and the only complaint I had on that trip was the front desk staff were somewhat on the harsh side. We decided to stay here again as we knew where we were going and what we were getting.. This time however, staff were awesomely friendly, helpful and welcoming -  one friendly staff member we encountered on our first trip - Dylan - is still working there and as friendly as he was the first time we stayed. Got upgraded to a suite on the 4th floor overlooking Katella Ave which was an awesome unexpected surpirise, no noise issues what so ever from the street or inside the hotel. Suite was clean and tidy,and very roomy If we come back this way, we will definitely stay here again.  The only thing of note is that if you use the 7-11 on the corner be

What a fantastic trip! We stayed here for 3 nights to visit Disney and also ventured to Universal (about an hours drive). The location is fantastic, we had views of Disney from our window, the hotel staff are friendly and the hotel itself is very clean and welcoming. We would recommend this hotel very highly. The only thing which prevents us giving this hotel 5 stars is the breakfast.. It just wasn't to our taste as it was mainly mini muffins, doughnuts and waffles. However, you don't come to this place for the breakfast so make the most of the great location, free parking and helpful staff!

I spent a lot of time reviewing the hotels near Disneyland Resort and decided on the Desert Palms after reading good reviews and seeing how close it was to the parks.  Here are my thoughts:  Room:  We stayed in one of the Kalahari Family Suites with our two sons for 4 nights.  The room was laid out well so they had their own room and we had our own room (with an extra bed that we used for storage, which turned out to be very necessary as floor space for bags was limited).  There was a shared bathroom in the middle with two sinks and two separate showers and toilets (which was also convenient as we could have one adult bathroom and one kid bathroom).  The rooms were in good condition and clean.  Only complain about the room was the noise of the A/C - it was quite loud.  However

I had the unexpected pleasure of staying at the Desert Palms late June of 2013. I was part of a group of college students whom were participating in a business competition just a couple of blocks away at another hotel. The staff were able to accommodate our group of 45+, no fuss. The breakfast was good enough to get you through your day (waffle machine and scrambled eggs with ham were my choice). A few blocks away from Downtown disney was also a plus. I felt so satisfied with my stay at the Desert Palms, that It will be on top of my list when staying in Anaheim.  PS: I had left a priceless possession in my room and did not realize until I made it back to Florida....as soon as I landed I called the front desk and they were kind of to find, package and mail it to me. Much

Stayed 5 days, was concerned at first from reading some of the reviews, but was very satisfied after seeing for myself that it's better than the some of the reviews. Breakfast was ok, but could of had more flavor. Otherwise very happy. No noise in the hallways, slept very comfortable. Would stay again.

We just took our first family trip to Disneyland and the Desert Palms Hotel was a great place to stay. The staff was helpful and friendly. The variety of breakfast each morning was nice for the kids. It is very convenient for walking to Disneyland. About a half mile from doorstep to gate. Checkout was as easy as saying goodbye. The flavored water in the lobby was a nice refresher after each days walking or if we came back for a break.

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: My teenage daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Desert Palms Hotel.  Fabulous location, just a five minute walk to the Convention Center and 10 minutes to Disneyland.  Loved the free parking in the garage under the hotel.  We were especially concerned about safety, and felt quite safe at all times.....even at night when walking back from Disneyland.  Hotel staff members were friendly and helpful.  We really appreciated the full breakfast buffet - scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, make your own waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, and pastries.  The breakfast area was clean and well-attended to.   Our room was clean and orderly, shower pressure was low, but we survived :) We hardly heard any noise from other guests. We enjoyed one meal at the hotel's restaurant, Sandbox Bar

Summary Heading: My new hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have just had a great nine night stay at the Desert Palms Hotel.  We were fortunate enough to be upgraded into a Borrego Suite which meant we had 2 Queen Beds and then a lower seating area with an extra TV in the room.  In fact, we were so happy with the room that we had a booking at another hotel for some of our stay based on our experience there last year but we ended up cancelling that and staying at the Desert Palms the whole time as we loved the place so much.  The beds were comfortable, the room was very well appointed and modern in it's look and feel.  We had plenty of space and given we were doing a three week road trip, we had a fair bit of luggage that was easily accommodated in the room yet still gave us plenty of space to walk around.  The shower wasn't quite as

My family and I went to Disneyland last week from Tuesday, August 6th - Saturday, August 10th - we had a fantastic stay!  great rooms, full breakfast was awesome - just a great overall stay.  I would highly recommend staying there.

Summary Heading: Good location & helpful staff - rooms just okay
Summary: Hotel is an easy 10 - 15 minute walk to the park. Nice lobby and front desk staff is very good & very helpful. Rooms are just okay - not super clean but not dirty - just okay. Travel party included two adults and two teenagers. Booked the Kalahari suite which has two bedrooms with two beds in each room. The two bedroons are separated by two full bathrooms and common counter with sink. Perfect for my group. Paid $389 per night total including tax + fees - over a weekend. I called the hotel directly and received a better price than was posted on the web site. A basic room at Disneyland Hotel in the park was $550 per night total that same weekend for room with two queens. Hotel is a little loud in the mornings but most people are getting up anyway to head to the park. Free

This was the best place to stay if you have kids. We stayed is a room that had a seperate room with bunkbeds so the kids had there own space. Loved the pool in the middle of the hotel. Very safe and secure!!

We stayed at Desert Palms for 7 days because of the location from Disneyland.  We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Nice pool, nice hotel staff and our room was very clean.   The lobby is beautiful and we really liked the water station in the lobby.   It was nice to have a free wifi, microwave and fridge in our room.  Also there's lots of nice restaurants nearby.  We would definitely stay at Desert Palms again.

This hotel was booked by family who planned our trip but then were unable to join us. We stayed 3 nights in a Borrego Suite and were sad to leave. The pull out queen sofa and extra tv in a curtained off area was especially appreciated by our 2 girls who loved having their own space. The room was very spacious and comfortable for 3 adults, 1 teenager and 2 children.  The room and bathroom was very clean. The fridge was a really nice size to hold drinks, snacks and leftovers.   The free breakfast was very good and a great way to start the day. As for the comment about "sneaking food out", we took food out of the breakfast area and to our room so the kids were able to sleep in and be well rested for a long, hot day at Disneyland. Not everyone is able to be up and ready for

The hotel suited our family (3 kids) perfectly, with an adjoining room with bunks & sofa-bed to sleep the kids - however we had to stay 4 nights in order to get this room.  Nice and clean - the décor is a bit tired, and the service sometimes a bit perfunctory, but no complaints.  The breakfast buffet is free and quite average, but the kids ate up.  Just a short walk down the boulevard to Disneyland Parks, which was great when we took breaks from the park and swam in the hotel pool.  We bought our park tickets at reception, and they were very helpful.  Would recommend for a family holiday to the parks!

Traveling to Anaheim is something I do at least twice a year, sometimes more often.   For many years, I have been a customer at another hotel property in the area. However, even though I was loyal to that particular property, I kept thinking about making the switch to the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites. Finally, this was the year and we are so glad that we made the change.   The Desert Palms is first class in every way…the lobby, the quality of the sleeping rooms, the complimentary WiFi, tasty breakfast each morning, hotel location, etc. After one day, we kept thinking what took us so long to make the change? In the future, our Anaheim home will be the Desert Palms. It has everything we could possibly want and has earned our business.

I stayed here for 2 nights and highly enjoyed my stay. The staff at reception/concierge were excellent and very helpful!! I had a room on the 3rd floor (301) and probably would recommend having a room further down the corridor as it was right across from the laundry and ice machine so had a bit of noise (and alot of kids running up and down the corridors). The room was big and nice with a fridge and microwave and large wardrobe. I had a window facing the pool and spa and heard the noise from there. Pool and spa were also excellent with complimentary clean towels available all day long!! There is also a gift shop, gym and games corner and the free breakfast. I was slightly disappointed with the breakfast and only had it 1 day- some cereal, pancakes/waffles (that you make

Summary Heading: Clean, family friendly and close to the park
Summary: Have stayed here a few times now and each has been a positive experience. The suite with the step-down living room is wonderful when traveling with the baby. We're able to draw the curtain and give him a quiet nap time without having to be in the dark ourselves.  The "basic" room isn't as nice, but still clean and comfortable. Very helpful having a fridge and microwave. Bathroom is  decent size.  Breakfast buffet on the roof is a great way to start the day (can usually at least get some eggs or oatmeal for a heartier breakfast). Have hot and cold foods available. View from the patio lets you see the back side of DCA.  I think this is becoming our preferred place to stay when we visit the park. It is indeed a walk, but it's very doable.

Summary Heading: Very clean, great location, and breakfast ROCKED!
Summary: My family frequents Disneyland and I am always a little hesitant to try new hotels. This hotel came recommended by a family friend so I thought we should try. I was very impressed by the service, hospitality, and cleanliness. The bunk bed suite was a family hit and had plenty of room. The Hot breakfast was a great way to start the day. We will definately be back soo!

Summary Heading: The location, the personnel and the rooms are all are great.
Summary: Our family loves the location of the hotel.  The personnel have made everyone one of our stays great especially our last one, so much that we added another night.  The rooms are comfortable and clean. And of course the breakfast they provide is enough to get us started on our fun filled day.  We just love Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.

The staff was so polite and the facility was very clean.... The family really liked the rooms and breakfast buffet. Great for a early start before hitting the park. We also spent time in the bar and lounge at night - This was great being that it was right in the center!

Summary Heading: always the best place to stay
Summary: we always book our hotel at this place as we go to disney 3-4 times a year, we have a large family and the suites are plenty big enough to handle our crazy boys. the best breakfast which actually fills up the kids and helps save on food cost at the parks.

My family and I have stayed here the last 4 years! This is a great place, very clean, breakfast is wonderful, pool is nice, within 10 min of walking to Disneyland, and couldn't ask for a better customer service then Desert Palm!  NIghts are quite, so if you have little one's they will sleep through the night!  Rooms are very nice and lot's of space and very clean. Room services do a wonderful job, and front desk are very professional and courteous!

Summary Heading: A 10-minute walk to the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: Check-in was fast, efficient, and pleasant. The staff was friendly and attentive. The free breakfast was.... well, free. The location was close enough to walk to Disneyland for those fit enough to make the walk after 16 hours of walking and standing in lines. We found it really interesting to see several hotel guests sneak outside of the hotel with trays of free breakfast food. This was especially odd since there was plenty of space to eat, both inside and out. This is rare at hotels that offer free breakfast. Were they feeding the homeless, perhaps? I mentioned it to the front desk staff since this type of thievery raises costs for all travelers. Parking was almost always near capacity, but we were always able to find a space. There were definitely cars there that were not

The location is great, its near disneyland and the staff are very helpful and the suites are roomy....the suites have all the amenities that you need, a fridge, microwave and comfortable beds...the air conditioning is nice and cool. My family and I have been coming to Desert Palms Hotel & Suite's for the past 7 years, so you could say we really enjoy our stay. The Times we have stayed we stay in the Yuha kids suite, it accommodates up to six people, great for big families. It has one king bed and bunk beds in a separate room. Very clean and the breakfast is absolutely awesome!

You could not ask for a better location if your destination is Disneyland or the Anaheim Convention Center.  They are reasonably priced, have a very complete complimentary breakfast....not just sweet breads and coffee... that is served from 7 to 10.  The room in which the breakfast is service is big enough to handle lots of guests.  The lobby is new and absolutely beautiful with lots of comfortable seating but this is a "refurbished" hotel so the rooms themselves, although clean and roomy with refrigerator, microwave and morning coffee still show signs of a bygone era.....window type A/C which is very noisy.  They have an on site restaurant and bar but I did not have the occasion to use it so I cannot critique it at all.  Free WiFi, fitness room, a pool with spa and underground

Summary Heading: Location, rooms, and breakfast are great. The staff is not very bright.
Summary: PROS - The location is great. It is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and the rooms are really nice. The rooms have a fridge and microwave and we had a full sitting area. I was in room 347. The breakfast has waffles, eggs, hash browns, oranges, pastries and more. There is also free parking and the hotel is a pretty good price. $134/night on Priceline.com  CONS - The staff is not very bright. I booked a room for a friend and when I called the front desk to be connected to her room they insisted she was not staying there. I knew she was and made them look repeatedly. Eventually they realized they had entered her name wrong (they spelled it without any vowels) even though the booking was right and so was the paperwork when she signed in.  The second incident took place in my

Friendly staff, really close to Disney and many restaurants. We had not problems at all during our 8 nights stay. 7-11 just next door which is very convenient. Barely used the car being there. Overall a very good experience.

We stayed at the beginning of our 5 week road trip and at the end before returning home.  We were greeted by a delightful young man who certainly made us feel welcome. Our room was ok.  It was dated and in need of a spruce up but comfortable and clean.  The door had a 2-3 inch gap so not much sleep had as it was like sleeping in the hallway.  We had been upgraded on our return and that was certainly better.  Really nice place to stay, housekeeping good, central to everything, friendly, helpful staff and a nice bar/restaurant attached.  The breakfast provided is ok.  All in all it was good and the staff excellent.

We found the hotel an excellent base for the disney andLA area. When a review says ten minutes from Disney you may be inclined to take it with a pinch of salt but believe this is exactly how long it will take you to get to the gates. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable and our kids loved the pool.  Breakfast had plenty of selection and was constantly topped up.  We really couldnt fault it in anyway and it helped make our holiday more memorable.

We had the most amazing stay.  Very clean and the friendliest staff ever.  Day or night front desk staff where so helpful and always smiling.  Fabulous locations to buses and walking distance to shopping and my favorite resturants Bubba Gumps and PF Changs. With 7-11 right next door we could buy water by the case since rooms all have fridges and microwaves.  Thanks Desert Palms we will most definitely return and recommend you to our family and friends. See you in jan 2015.

Summary Heading: Will never go back to this hotel ever!!
Summary: Total waste of money. Poor room service, poor breakfast. It's not even that short walking distance to Disneyland. I hate the rooms. Bathroom is too small. TV is old. There's only few channels and there's few channel for the kids. AC is not working well. It tends to become hot esp in the afternoon. I will not recommend this place to anyone ever!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when coming to Disneyland
Summary: We love this hotel, we've been staying here everytime we come to Disney for the last 6 years. As soon as we think Disney we think Desert Palms Hotel, the rooms are awsome specially the suites if you have a family of 4 plus . The breakfast is so good to start the day so full of energy and one of the best things location location location ! just around the corner of Disneyland and the pool and jacuzzi are very relaxing. I recomend this hotel to friends and family when I hear they're coming to Disney "The Happiest Place On Earth"

I read many reviews about this place. Some of it is true, but you get what you pay for. We arrived on a Tuesday. The traffic getting there was terrible. But once in the room we were able to relax. The traffic can be heard inside the room. But I can't imagine any hotel in the area that doesn't have this problem. The roads in the Disney Resort Area are several lanes wide. The breakfast was fine. Not great, but beat spending money that I needed to buy lunch and dinner with. A slice of pizza in the park is $7, a burger $10, a cookie $3, and none of it comes with a drink. I like how they had cold fruit flavored water in the lobby. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk from the lobby to the gates where they scan your ticket.  We were glad that we didn't buy the extremely expensive

Stayed for 5 nights in a kids suite (Yuha Suite). Room was clean. Small fridge with a tiny freezer section. King bed in half of room with a sliding glass door? wall? separating the bunk beds & sleeper sofa. Kids area was very cramped with the sleeper sofa extended. We packed in 3 adults, 3 kids and an infant. Scheduling the use of one bathroom was an effort (next time I'll spend more). Housekeeping was really nice about leaving extra towels every day. The toilet wouldn't flush on the first night, but maintenance showed up within a few minutes & swapped out the handle (I was scared because of some of the negative reviews on their service).

My husband and I took my parents to Disneyland recently, and stayed in a 1 Bedroom Suite for 3 nights. The room was very spacious, especially for 4 adults. We opted to sleep on the pull-out couch, while my parents stayed in the bedroom (even though there were 2 large beds in the bedroom). It was a great way for all of us to have our own space. The kitchenette was a great help when we were getting ready early in the morning, or having an afternoon snack.   On our last morning we checked out the complimentary breakfast which had a great selection! The cold water in the lobby was a bonus as well especially coming back from the warm heat of Disney.   It took approx. 10 minutes to walk to the Disney ticket gates each day, and there's a 7-Eleven, ABC Market, Subway, Pizza Place,

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay - Extremally recommended
Summary: The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the park entrances. Free undercover parking. Our rooms were renewed, clean and comfortable. The water in the lobby with the lemons or strawberries was a plus. The hot breakfast is delicious. We have been there for 8 years in the row and believe me, it pay the value for your money. There is a very clean pool area with a excellent jaccuzi, both in a great size, very organized and pretty. The staff is nice and always willing to help, managers, housekeeping, food employees, little gift shop stuff, restaurant End of conversation, we will be there next year again!!!!

We are a family of 4 traveling from Australia. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the park entrances. Free undercover parking, very good value at around $130 US a night. Don't base your booking on the free American breakfast as that was a huge disappointment. All incredibly bad food choices. Nothing healthy. $2 washing machines a hit though.

This was the first time we stayed at the Desert Palms.  When we arrived we were told, “Oh by the way, your rooms were upgraded to suites.” Our two regular rooms were suddenly suites!  It was awesome.  Our rooms were clean and comfortable.  I love the water in the lobby with the lemons or strawberries.  The hot breakfast buffet was great. Everyone in my family found something to eat (cold cereal, oatmeal, bread and bagels, waffle bar, eggs, sausage patties, coffee and juice). There was always someone cleaning, restocking food, and making sure tables were ready for the next guests.     My only complaint would be that the pool is small.  However we did swim and we did enjoy it.  Everything was clean and every staff person was friendly.  We are Disneyland fanatics and visit at least

We stayed at this Hotel in June 2013. We chose this Hotel for it's position and value for money. We were not disappointed on both accounts. Nice and close for all locations we wished to walk to but very peaceful at night. Considering it's proximatey to Disneyland excellent value for money with breakfast included! Exactly what we wished for. Parking within the Hotel was freely available and the staff were pleasant. No complaints and would again stay at this Hotel should we visit again. Remember if you want everything 5 Star then you pay 5 Star prices!

The one advantage this property has is that it is very close to Disneyland. We were would got to the Parks in the morning, return for a swim in their great pool, and then walk back to the parks for the evening. Breakfast was good, loved making the waffles. The Staff were very helpful. I just think that it was a little expensive, but it is very handy.

For housing families visiting the "Happiest Place on Earth," the front desk staff at this hotel need a little refresher on customer service and hospitality.  Our receptionist couldn't have been less enthusiastic.  From there, we entered our room...the furniture was dinged up, the shutters broken, the bathroom had mold around the tub calking, the carpet turned our socks brown and the floor felt like you were walking on concrete.  The continental breakfast opens at 7am, a hour before the parks open.  The line was outside the main door each morning.  Given DL and CA suggest you arrive at least a half hour before the gates opens, there is very little time to inhale breakfast and rush to the parks.  On the bright side, the poor quality resulted in us spending more time at the beach.

My husband and two boys stayed at the Desert Palms for 9 nights. We stayed in the family suite which was quite good. There was a main bedroom with queen bed, television and desk  for us. The boys had bunk beds in a seperate room with television and sofa bed. The hotel was a 10 minute walk to disneyland, very close to a shopping mall, ihop and cheescake factory. A 7-11 is right next door which was great for last minute needs (the boys loved the $1 pizza slices!) The only negative I have of the hotel is that it is very noisy, admittedly it is a family hotel, so noise is to be expected, however the walls seemed paper thin!

The hotel was very close to Disneyland and California Adventure which was really awesome.  The hotel room was very spacious and had nice blinds.  The room was a suite with a good size refrigerator / freezer, a kitchenette, small dining table for four, living room furniture with a good size TV, and a bedroom with two full beds with a good size TV on the dresser, and two closets.  We also really liked the cucumber, lemon, orange, and strawberry water that they provided in the lobby.  It was really refreshing.  However, I wish they could do better in some areas: the bathroom had unpleasant mildewy smell, and some mildewy spots, the AC was blowing on your face while you were trying to sleep, the kitchen utensils cleanliness were a bit questionable that we had to re-wash them, and

This was our second time staying at the hotel. The Staff was wonderful and very friendly. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding! The swimming pool was very clean and had towels available on site. Parking is free and the location is secure. We will defiantly stay at the hotel for our next trip to Disneyland.

We recently stayed at the hotel for a Disneyland high school graduation/birthday celebration vacation. I was always treated with respect and requests were promptly attended to. The hotel even had a gift bag sent up to our room for our daughter's birthday! The breakfast was excellent, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, the pool was fun and all in all- the hotel was above and beyond our expectations. I highly recommend staying here!

Recently spent the weekend at this hotel. Very nice & clean rooms, prices were good and customer service was awesome! Swimming pool was great and parking was very convenient.    *****5 star rating*****   My trip to Disneyland was great and hotel was great. I highly recommend for anyone going to Disney or anywhere else in Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Dirty rooms not meeting basic cleanliness
Summary: I saw that the bed skirt was not just very dusty or a little dirty but littered with short black hairs and small black specs.  Luckily nothing was moving but it was so beyond the standard of normal cleanliness. I checked the other bed and it was in a similar condition.   That one also had an assortment of Disney buttons, mardi gras type beads and a croissant that was ancient  My point is, it wasn’t like these were from last week or last month, but rather the bed skirts must not have been changed for months and the floor not vacuumed under the beds in months if not longer.  Then I looked further and in plain sight on the flap of the bedskirt  facing the room was a gross stain of some unidentified ickiness. They changed us to another room & it again had dirty/gross bedskirt stuff

I have stayed at your Hotel about 5 times and each time I felt like I was at home. Loved the great breakfast for free !!! I have stayed at other hotels & find myself wanting to stay back at your hotel. I will not stay anywhere else. Our family loved the view so we could see the fireworks from disneyland at night from our room.

I stayed at the Desert Palms with a grop of my students from Western Australia. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were courteous and easy to deal with. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. The hotel was well positioned for access to Disney, and there were lots of eating places very nearby. it is also serviced by many of the tour bus companies. All together a pleasant experience I would happily have again.

We spent 5 days and the first 2 days we weren't thrilled with our 2nd floor room but after speaking to Jenny the night desk clerk (who was Great) we were able to get an upgrade to a suite. And that is what I call great service. We enjoyed the rest of our vacation and wish there were more Jennys' out there.

Just had 8 nights here as family of 5 (kids 11, 9 and 7).  We had the Yuha kids suite which was ok as we didn't spend that much time in it except for sleeping but once the fold out couch was opened, not much room left.  Nice and clean, comfy beds.  Front desk staff were very helpful and courteous.  Breakfast buffet a little disappointing.  Not a lot of choice, high in sugar.  It was ok though as lots of eating places very close by.  711 next door.  Pool area is a definite plus.  Pool sheltered by hotel walls surrounding and very warm.  Laudromat on few floors, only 2 washers and dryers though in each.   Our room had a small balcony which looked over back car park but had a view of fire works.  Would stay here again.

I loved EVERYTHING about this resort! As soon as I stepped out of the elevator and took a deep breath, I knew I was going to enjoy my stay and be comfortable.  I work in a sterile part of a hospital and the smell of the hotel was sooo clean! That's how I judge a hotel's cleanliness. The room was the same, clean.  We had excellent maid service the whole time we were there. She would display our son's newly acquired stuffed toy on his bed. It was a wonderful surprise and an exciting time for our son coming back to our suite after a long day of sightseeing and visiting theme parks. The maid in charge of our room (343) was outstanding.  She provided excellent service from 6/16 through 6/20.  I wish she could be recognize for her hard work.  You get  more than your money's worth.

Summary Heading: OK, But not the place to stay
Summary: We just came back from a Disney vacation and spent 7 days at the Desert Palms Hotel.  We were a large group with 13 people staying here.  We rented a 15 passenger van for everyone to travel in.    Upon arrival Saturday I noticed the parking for the van was terrible.  Their parking terrace below ground only allows vehicles with a clearance of 6'7" Our van was 7' so we had no choice but to park in the above parking.  Each time we left with the van it was a gamble if we would have a place to park when we returned.  They should require compact cars to park underground to allow for the larger vehicles enough parking up top.  Also there were many large bus vehicles parked in no parking zones by the entrance so we often had to squeeze through with only inches to spare.  There were also

Summary Heading: Great Service, Excellent Location, Efficient and Friendly Staff
Summary: Our stay at the Desert Palms in room 447 was great.  The front desk staff were extremely accommodating, from ordering us a taxi to looking online for the nearest sushi restaurant, to just being a very friendly staff, always willing to please.   The person responsible for cleaning our room was also wonderful.  Every day after being out, we came back to a very clean and organized room.    We have two sons 22 and 24, so breakfast worked out very well for us as they can eat a lot.  They both loved the waffle machine, as I’m sure many of the guests will agree.  Personally I enjoy porridge with a bit of brown sugar and pineapple on top.  I will also say that the coffee was excellent!    We will definitely recommend this hotel and if we are in the area again, we would stay there.  It’s

My experiences with the hotel staff and their wonderful Group Reservation Representative, Julie Gomez, was such a treat!!!  We had a lot of details with over 23 rooms and a lot of changes...all workable with such a great staff.  From the wonderful breakfast in the morning, to the wheelchair availability for our needs....let us just say it was great!!!!  I had already recommended the hotel to another big group before we even made it to the hotel, just from dealing with Julie and the staff!!! I will probably be bringing my whole troop back again as we do this every two years with a group from 45 to 75 people!!!  Thank you again for making our family feel so welcome and at home..  From Jo Benson and the Benson Clan

Summary Heading: Our Choice for the past 15 years!
Summary: As a family, we have been staying at the Desert Palms for well over 15 years. We have watched it grow from a small 2 story motel to the wonderful property it is today. The staff is always very courteous and tends to our every needs. If ever there is a problem, they are very quick to remedy it. The past 5 years, we have had an 8th grade graduation trip to DIsneyland and group sales has been a tremendous help in the organizing of all the guests. They make me look good and I always get positive feed back from the parents. Thank you for always making our graduation celebration a huge success!

It was an ok hotel, if you can find a sale or promotion. It was a pretty standard mid-range hotel for the area, similar to a Best Western category. The amenities were acceptable. Their restaurant (not where they do the free breakfast) was pretty good. They do NOT have a shuttle to Disneyland, but are about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the Disneyland front gate (which seems like 30 after a long day in the parks).  Breakfast was such a zoo we actually skipped it after the first morning, even though free breakfast was one of the things we were looking for in a hotel. If you're a coffee drinker, take your own coffee cup with you. The Styrofoam coffee cups they had were so small, I don't even know where they found them; I've never seen Styrofoam cups that small. And of course, no lids.

After leaving another hotel in the area, we were able to book a room on super short notice and get a great rate. All the staff were super accommodating, helping us with luggage storage (we had 5 bags inc ski bags), booking a tour to hollywood for us and of course Disneyland. I cant thank them enough for all their help.   The room was spacious and comfortable, and the breakfast and wifi was an added bonus.  It was 10min walk (if that) to the entrance of Disneyland and in short walking distance to other restaurants, except most nights we ordered take out from the restaurant on site which was extremely well priced and good food.    We had a fantastic time and would stay again without a doubt.

Great deal for the price!  Could accommodate all 6 of us in one room.   Clean.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  Hot breakfast was very good.  Staff friendly and WIFI was good.  However, sharing one bathroom was a challenge.  Getting to our room was a bit confusing.  Will stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great place and could walk to Disneyland
Summary: Our Disneyland trip was wonderful, in part thanks to such a great hotel!  The free breakfast included eggs, fruit, cereal, sausage, oatmeal, pastries and waffles! The food was replenished often and tables cleaned constantly. It was so nice to sit outside and have breakfast. It was a 10 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland and we felt safe (just me and my girls) walking back to the hotel after midnight when the park closed. The pool provided a nice break during the day and hotel restaurant/cafe had a special for a large pizza for $10. Cheap and convenient lunch! The room was nice and clean and the microwave and fridge made it easy to keep and reheat leftovers. We will definitely be going back!

My husband, 3 year old, and I had a fantastic stay and look forward to future visits!  A couple highlights for us was the friendly staff, WIFI worked great, the pool was very clean, free parking, and ice water in the lobby with orange or lemon slices. Also, it was so nice to have a free hot breakfast to start your Disney travels off right! They even had a large setting area outside.  The Sandbox Bar & Grill, which is apart of the Hotel, came in really handy.  We had lunch there when we first arrived and than we had food and margaritas delivered to our room on the last day.  It was so nice to be able to enjoy affordable/yummy food and relax in our room after a long day at Disneyland.  Stay here and you won't be disappointed!

Great beds. Comfy. Family suite with bunks are worth the extra $$. Great place to relax after a busy day at Disneyland. My kids loved having their own room and bunks. Great for families. Definitely will stay here again.

LOVED LOVED LOVED IT!  What a wonderful hotel, the rooms were great we were given a free upgrade upon arriving to a fabulous suite, which was very welcomed with 3 children in tow. The staff were very keen to go out of there way to make our stay even more enjoyable. The grounds were very clean. Room service was exemplary. Only a short stroll to Disneyland so location was great.The breakfast was included and the kids thoroughly enjoyed this. I would have liked a little more variety for the adults as we stayed for 2 weeks, but this is just nit picking. Everything was wonderful.I really couldn't find anything to fault. We made sure the management knew of our wonderful experience, especially of a particular front desk staff member who really was terrific. If we are ever fortunate

We have stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites twice in the last two years. We were very impressed with the hotel and the staff. The front desk staff is always friendly and helpful, and the housekeeping team is top notch. The free continental breakfast offers a large variety of food including cereal, eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, fresh fruit, pastries, etc. The hotel is within easy  walking distance of Disneyland's front gate. There is a 7-11 next door to the hotel and another small market around the corner, making it easy to pick up necessities without using the car. The hotel offers underground parking for regular-sized vehicles and surface parking for larger vehicles. I would definitely recommend the Desert Palms for any family heading to Anaheim for a Disney vacation.

We stayed at this hotel in June and it was the very best we could ask for. We stayed in a 2 room suite with 2 baths. There were 3 children and 3 adults.Very near Disneyland and a bus line.There was a free breakfast with everything you would want, a great pool and very quiet at night. The staff was wonderful.We would stay here again and recommend it highly.We stayed at the Disney Pier a few years ago which was more expensive and not as nice.

We had a wonderful time staying at the Desert Palms in Anaheim. The hotel was close enough to Disneyland for us to walk. Our grandchildren were able to go back to the hotel in the afternoon and swim and get rested and then return to the park to play all night. It was so nice to come back to a nice clean room after a fun, but tiring, day at Disneyland. The breakfast room is very large. There was always plenty of seating and it was great to start the day out with a filling breakfast--enough selection to keep everyone happy. We will definitely return to this hotel. Free breakfast, free parking, great location and a very friendly staff. What more could a person ask for?

This is the ideal location for travelers with kids doing the Disney adventure!  We stayed here as part business trip, part vacation and our daughter absolutely loved the pool, which had kids her age to play with.  The room itself was one of the smaller suites, and included a separate room for us to put the kiddo down while we were able to stay up and surf the wireless (also very good) and watch a little TV.  The bathrooms are spacious and we found the extra area on the far side was fantastic for storage.  The continental breakfast was awesome, one of the best I have seen, with many choices for protein, fruits, etc.  I would without hesitation suggest staying at this hotel.

Great location. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. We loved the bunk bed and separate room. Rooms could use and update but we were out most the day so that didn't matter so much. We enjoyed the free breakfasts too!

Summary Heading: Comfortable Hotel, moderate walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel rooms are large and each has it's own ensuite and television. An excellent complimentary hot breakfast is served daily. The maid staff are excellent. The front desk staff were slightly uninterested in their job. You will see homeless people near the hotel, however, most hotels will be experiencing this due to the economic times. The walk to Disneyland is approximately 1km (20 min) and is on flat, level ground (wide footpaths with well kept gardens beside). This hotel is well worth the walk for families and those looking to save a few pennies.

This rooms could do with a bit of an upgrade, but the location was fantastic.  Only 1 bus stop to/from Disneyland and plenty of yummy restaurents close by like Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs and California Pizza Kitchen.  Breakfast very basic but good that is included in stay

We loved the kids suite, it worked out really well and there was lots of space in there. Parking was free and the staff was very nice. We even complained a few times about loud kids in the room above late at night and they quickly quieted that down. The free breakfast was a bonus but there was limited options and long waits at times. Although what do you expect when it's free? So, we managed fine w/ that. The only thing I would be concerned about is the pool. It looked tiny and without much sunlight. We were there in February so it wasn't a concern however I would not stay here in the summer when pool R&R is in order. Overall, we were happy with the location, cost and accommodations.

Recently returned from a seven night stay at this hotel.  Although the room was a little dated and could do with a paint job, it was super clean housekeeping did a fantastic job and the king size bed was super comfy, the kids said the bunks weren't that comfortable, they didn't seem to have any problem sleeping.  Rooms weren't noise proof could hear people in rooms above and next door.  We had the yuha suite and view of disneyland could see the fireworks from balcony.  Location was fantastic we walked to most places and the children 4 and 11 coped well even after long days at the parks.  7-11 very handy next door, and pool great at the end of the day although a little crowded at times, staff friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was okay and served our needs can't complain when its

Desert Palms Hotel & Suites (DPHS) will be our home away from home while in Anaheim. The staff was so accomodating even before we arrived. There was always fresh fruit water in the lobby which was so refreshing whenever we left or came. We had 2 borrego suites which comfortablly accomodated our party of 10. The rooms were always so clean. I actually felt sorry for housekeeping each morning with our kids. We made sure we left extra tip each day. The layout of the rooms was perfect! I loved that each room had 2 TVS and a curtain to seperate the beds from the sofa, it was like a second room in a room. The kids could watch something and we could watch something else- Perfect!!! Everyone's Happy!!!  We did great to see the Sahara suite and it was really nice. If you plan to cook,

Summary Heading: Great value hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Got upgraded to a Yuha Kids' Suite upon arrival. My daughter loved the bunk bed! It's an easy 10 minute walk to and from the gates of Disneyland, so it's great value compared to staying at the Disney Hotels, which can be three times the cost of staying here.  Parking is free, and they even gave a birthday gift to my daughter. Thanks Desert Palms! :)

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, value for money
Summary: Booked a double bed to accommodate 4 persons. Space was a little tight for 4, but given the price, it was understandable. We loved the convenience of having 7-11 just next to the hotel, and Disneyland was a quick 10 minute walk. The only downside we could think of was the slightly noisy A/C and the freezer in the mini fridge was not working, so our ice creams were melted.  Front desk people was very friendly though, and offered valuable advice when we asked about transportation options. We would certainly book this hotel again if we're visiting Disneyland.

Clean and comfortable.  Nice hot breakfast.  An easy walk to Disneyland.  We visited with our 3  teenage children and there was plenty of room for us all.  The A/C worked great and kept the room super cool after a hot day at the park.  7-11 right next door for quick snacks. Free parking.

This is our second time this year staying at the Desert Palms. We liked it the first time, but this time we had a kitchenette suite and loved it. The room was updated, very clean, and spacious. We will always try to book a kitchenette suite for future visits. The hotel is about a ten minute walk to Disneyland and the only street you cross is that where parking lot busses enter the park. We are not crazy about the buffet that the hotel provides so we bring our own food. My only complaint is that the light in the bathroom was not sufficient for the entire bathroom as the shower was rather dark and the fan in the bathroom that comes on with the light was incredibly loud. Other than that, we loved the room and will definitely stay at Desert Palms again.

We had the room right outside the pool pump which came on at 4am every morning!!! Wasnt what we thought we had booked looking on the website, pictures dont represent what the rooms look like, very dated and dark and shabby. Close enough to walk to Disneyland tho, good super7 on the corner.

We took our HS band to Disneyland, and stayed again at the Desert Palms.  It was the same experience as two years ago.  Great staff, great rooms, and the breakfast was fantastic.  It's very close to the park, and I'm going to head back with my family next year.  Thanks again for the great stay!

Pretty close to Disney parks.  Short walk or you can take the ART which stops right outside the hotel.    Rooms were clean enough.  So were the common areas.  Breakfast area is very busy and needs to be staffed heavier during the rush.   Had some trouble with rooms keys constantly not working. Most front desk staff were very helpful.

Very close to Disneyland,  free breakfast, free parking. It was a good hotel. The breakfast was alright. Nothing fancy, but free.  The rooms were decent. We coukd hear everyone above us walking and jumping around. So that wasnt too cool. Its close to Disneyland,  but we would stay closer next time we go. Having to walk a half mile after walking all over is hard with three little ones who are tired.

The room with bunk beds in a separate room was great with two teenage boys.  The room had everything we needed, was quiet and was spotlessly clean.  The breakfast which was included was complete with something for everyone.  We enjoyed the small but nice pool.  Disneyland was a short walk away.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Also, there is no extra charge for parking which can be expensive at some of the hotels.  There is a restaurant/bar on site with a limited menu but prices are reasonable.

Summary Heading: Really helpful staff, great set up for the family
Summary: Very good value for the price.  Rooms easily accommodated a family of 5.  Very clean and well appointed.  Bunk bed was a big hit with the kids, and the ability to close the door on the kids room was perfect.  Fridge and microwave were great for keeping leftovers or snacking at odd hours.  Convenience store and 7/11 right beside.  Short walk to Disney, without having to cross any major streets, and close to the Disney transportation hub if you wanted to adventure off site.  Pool and hot tub were clean and well kept.  Staff were great!  Concierge was very helpful.  Also, I had left something in the room at checkout, and the hotel manager packaged it up and helped me FedEx it home.  She really went out of her way and I appreciate it.

Summary Heading: Best Family Stay for the Price
Summary: The staff was so amazingly friendly! The room was updated and immaculate! With four kids the morning complimentary breakfast buffet was the perfect start to our Disney Day! Will definitely be back next year!

Summary Heading: Great family stay for the price
Summary: We had a great experience with Desert Palms.  We were there for Disneyland and had a very short walk to the park.  The rooms were clean (nothing special to them) and housekeeping came everyday to clean and change linens, and the daily breakfast was good.
