All the staff we interacted with (reservations, front desk, housekeeping) were very friendly and helpful.  I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good price with decent accomadations.  We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to the Happiest Place on Earth.

The staff at this hotel is one of the best I have ever come across. Very friendly and accomodating, even during very busy times of the day. The breakfast is great! the rooms are nice and spacious. It is such a quick walk to Disneyland it made it very easy.

We arrived early, however it wasn't a problem for the staff.  Everyone was very courteous and helpful at all times.  Main entrance area and room were very clean.      For a family wishing to visit Disneyland, this is the best location.  You can wall to the Disneyland entrance from the hotel.  It's even close enough to come back from the part for a short rest before the evening parade.    Parking is a little tight, but considering how close you are to the Disneyland park it's well worth the effort.    A small mall is within comfortable walking distance.  Quite a few good restaurants are withing a couple of blocks driving distance.    A good experience

Summary Heading: Nice place for family to stay
Summary: Resort (more like a hotel) is around the corner from entrance to Disneyland, Cali Adventure and Downtown Disney.  Took us about 10 mins or 20 min round trips to get from the Palms to the parks.  There are many hotels farther away and several closer too.  Room was outdated, but comfortable and cleaned each day. outside pool was nice and warm at night.  Breakfast is good, but recommend eating before the crowds of families show up.  Between 7 and 8 am seemed to be best time to eat.  Parking was free at the Palms and you can park underground which is nice.

Summary Heading: Great family friendly place to stay!
Summary: Location was ideal within the same block of Disney! Loved that they included breakfast in the morning, we took advantage of this everyday. Staff was friendly. The convenience of walking to and from the hotel was great for a family with small children. We could bounce between the park and the hotel with convenience. The hotel was clean and our family loved it!

We have just returned from our Disneyland experience in the USA.  Please see my report on TA http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g29092-i65-k6507356-Trip_Report-Anaheim_California.html This is a great hotel for families. When we were there if was full of families. The rooms are a decent size. Our family of Hubby myself teenage daughters aged 16 & 19 and son aged stayed in a 2 room suite. We stayed there on two occasions. The first time we were in a large room near the pool. If you are going to stay there during summer or when the weather is warm I would suggest you ask for a room not near the pool as people can still be swimming till after 9pm. The second time we stayed there we were in a smaller room, still 2 bedrooms, on the 3rd floor. No problems checking in both times and

Summary Heading: Nice hotel reasonably priced and close to Disneyland.
Summary: We rented the Kids Suite that has a bedroom with a King bed and a kids bedroom with bunkbeds and a pullout sofa bed. All the beds except the pull out were comfortable. The pull out was a bit hard with a thin mattress. The rooms were clean and they cleaned and resupplied things daily. They also serve a complimentary hot buffet style breakfast. The only negative of the trip was that our room was a short distance from the breakfast room and that meant loud noises of people heading to breakfast early each morning.  The hotel is also located right next to a 7-11. This was very convenient for grabbing drinks or snacks on the way to or from Disney.

We had a five day park hopper ticket to Disneyland and the walk to the entrance was easier than expexted. This trip was on our bucket list as previous trips had been only day trips. Enjoyed the in room refrigerator and cheap beer prices at the next door 711 and ABC store.Free parking was a plus and the free breakfast saved time and money.The in house restaurant, the Sand Box, served us the best California Burger we ever ate.

Summary Heading: An Excellent Hotel for Disneyland School Trip
Summary: When we were looking at hotels for the Disneyland Trip for our school music department, we had so many concerns.  Will the students be safe?  Could they get to Disneyland easily?  Could we supervise them easily?  Could we park?  What about the buses?  All these concerns were excellently handled by Desert Palm Hotel and Suites, our pick after looking at many hotels in the Disneyland area.  They listened to our concerns and worked with us to make things work out for our group, especially with special requests, like parking the truck overnight carrying the instruments.  Free parking was also a huge plus.  Having a refrigerator and microwave in every room meant that people could warm up their food from the outside.  This was very helpful to our group.  The 80 students who stayed in

Summary Heading: Good location and good for families!
Summary: Quite a nice hotel in close proximity to Disneyland.  We have a 4 year old and it tooks us 10-15 minutes to get from the hotel to the park gates.    We had the "Sahara" suite. 1 bedroom (2 double beds), pull out couch, bathroom, and full kitchen.  The pull out couch is quite old and uncomfortable, but the beds were nice.  Our room was facing the street and it was quite loud.  However, we got used to the noise eventually. There is a construction right across from the hotel and it on the days when park opened at 10 am, we were awaken earlier by the construction noise.   The fridge and microwave came in quite handy.  There is 7/11 right by the hotel and we grabbed snacks and water and brought them to the park. The room is a good size, and we were comfortable in it with 4 adults and

Once we arrived at the hotel we were make very welcomed there and Staff was very friendley, and did a great job with meeting our needs and Jeniffer went abouve and beond to help us plan out six day trip very smooth, and she also helped us with the diffrent room, it`s onley ten minutes walk to disneylands parks and there are a lots of great resturants in the area, the breakfast was great too, our kids are seven and nice and they loved the pool too.

Very nice hotel close to disneyland (10min stroll). Next to 7 eleven and close to shopping mall. Breakfast is not great, so don't book because of the free breakfast. We ended up at ihop across the road. Pool is small but wasn't too busy when we visited (May 2013). We were upgraded to a family room with 2 rooms. Air-con was quite loud but still able to sleep. Overall it wad a good stay and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for familes visiting Disneyland!!!
Summary: We stayed here 4/27/13 - 5/3/13 and absolutely loved it!    It was a really nice hotel with a lot of perks.  We walked to and from the park with a toddler in tow once or twice a day for 4 days and it took about 10-15 mins to get from the hotel to the park gates.  I would recommend a stroller if you have younger kids.  No sense in burning their energy on the walk there when they will want to walk all over the park.  Our daughter fell asleep twice on the walk home when we left the park for the night so, having the stroller worked out great.  The FREE breakfast spread is good!  Waffles, sausage, eggs, cereal, fruit, toast, donuts etc. There is a lot of indoor and outdoor seating.  Most mornings we took our breakfast back to our room to eat while we got ready.  It's nice to not have

I booked a Kalahari Suite directly with the hotel for my family of two adults and two children for an eight night stay the week after Easter.  The hotel was busy with regular guests and also cheerleading competitors and their families.  We arrived quite early in the morning, and because I had booked the night before we arrived, we were able to access our room straight away.  I had emailed the hotel the week prior to our arrival to request a quiet room that faced Disneyland in order to see the fireworks from our room.  I was informed that none of the Kalahari Suites faced Disneyland.  No matter, I thought, as long as we have a quiet room.  We checked in quickly and were allocated room 229.  There were no bellhops; however there were luggage trolleys available to help get our

Summary Heading: **GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN DISNEYLAND AREA**
Summary: We recently spent 8 nights at the Desert Palms in a Yuha suite which comprised of a king bed and 2 single size bunk beds in a separate room (which also had a sofa and another tv). At first I thought it was very compact, but it was great for our stay here as we hardly spent any time in the room anyway.  Our girls are 17 & 16 and the bunk beds were great for them, and they also had a bit of space for themselves.  The staff were all very nice and helpful, but one in particular always went out of her way to help and that was a lovely young lady called Stevie.  So thanks Stevie, you do a great job and the hotel should be grateful to have you working for them. We were on the 4th floor and because our bed was right next to the door, we did often hear noise in the corridor at all hours,

We chose this hotel as you can easily walk to Disney in under 10 minutes.  Room spacious and kept very clean.  Couple of times we had to ask for extra towels etc. and was dealt with promptly. No complaints there.  Breakfast was on top floor and you can eat out on terrace with the Hollywood hills in the distance. Food here fine for breakfast - waffles, toast, egg, cereal, fruit etc. Only complaint as we backed onto pool area it became very noisy at night and kept us awake.  Would recommend for families who don't want to pay to park at Disney.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were very impressed with the service, cleanliness and the breakfasts we received at this hotel.  I also got up in the mornings and used the exercise room which was very nice.  Just a nice walk to Disneyland and back no problem with our 3 yr. old grandson in a stroller.

Summary Heading: Family friendly hotel with a short walk to Disneyland
Summary: On arrival to Desert Palms we were made to feel very welcome and kindly upgraded to a Kuha Kids Suite at no extra cost. It was great to have an 8-10 minute walk to both Disney parks which meant we could get there for opening times. The room was great, the pool a godsend for the kids after a day at the parks and we were close to many if the local restaurants and Downtown Disney. Easy to park our hire car also. The only negative would be the breakfast, which although plentiful was a little bland or 'manufactured' but given what we were paying for the room, a nice bonus.  This is a good hotel at great value.

My husband, four growing children and I stayed here for a week to do the Disneyland thing.  Desert palms is very comfortable for a family our size.  We had two rooms with two queen beds each and most importantly two showers/toilets.  This accommodation is located 10 minutes easy walk to Disneyland.  We used to walk home from Disneyland to enjoy a lovely relaxing spa or swim in the pool.  I felt that the hotel was so big and had such a high turnover of customers that there wasnt a lot of personalisation (we were just the customers in room 315!) - but that was fine.  Coin laundry on our floor was convenient.  The maid service starts too early.  A couple of times we returned from breakfast and the maid was already fixing our room.  Breakfast, what can I say......you get what you

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We recently undertook our fourth visit to the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. We are a family of two adults and two children (5 and 8 years) and find the Desert Palms a nice 10-12 minute walk from Disneyland Resort (although people with older children or teenages could cover the distance quicker). We stayed in a Borrego Suite which provided that additional space for the kids to play in as well as a seperate bed for each child. The free breakfast provided lots of hot and cold options (great for fussy children) and the free wifi allowed us to keep in touch with home. Didn't get to play in the pool on this visit but we have enjoyed it in the past. During our last visit plenty of other guests appeared to be having heaps of fun. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the gift

We stayed in a Sahara Suite, which has a fully equipped kitchen. The first night we stayed in a room that faced onto the road.  It was very noisy, so we asked to be moved the next morning.  Staff were very accommodating and our new room faced inside into the pool area.  No noise except the usual of people going to and from their rooms, but as mostly families stay here there was no late night noise.  Walking distance to Disneyland and several restaurants including Bubba Gump's, IHOP, Denny's & other fast food outlets.  Right next door is 7eleven & Alamo Car Hire. Breakfast was fairly average, except the waffle making machine which the kids (15 & 12yrs) loved.  They did have scrambled eggs and some American breakfast favourite called "biscuits and gravy" which we stayed away from.

We all enjoyed our stay, the front desk staff was very friendly. It is a close walk to Disney & the convention center. We will stay again next year, the kids loved the pool area & it was great to have a restaurant/bar area in the hotel though I think it should stay open later in the evening. The breakfast was great for the kids but I think it should be open later as well. Overall a great experience!!

We really enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is very clean and the staff couldn't be more helpful.  Only thing that may need improvement is the complimentary breakfast.  Not the healthiest cereals and the oatmeal was much too runny.  Great location for walking to the Park even with small kids. Thanks for everything.

Summary Heading: Average quality and would not stay again.
Summary: Incredibly noisy.  I cannot emphasize this enough!  Got up in the night thinking my kids were crying but it was not my child.  The maids woke us up to clean room very early too.   The breakfast is terrible!  I could barely choke down the food.  Bread for toast was not edible.  My kids even thought the fruit loop cereal tasted gross.  Never a free table it is so crowded. The walk feels very long after a full day at the park.  Took a $6 cab ride back twice.  Pool small and always full. Had kids yuha suite which the kids loved but couldn't keep their door closed as AC was in their room.  The room felt so small!  Sun coming through shutters woke my kids up every morning. Toilet made horrible water chugging sound for hours after flushing. Surprised at lack of channel choices/ kids

We stayed for 6 nights during our Disney trip. We were given a beautiful suite with a great view of DCA. Front desk staff was very friendly. Breakfast was always crowded, but they don't have much controll over that. Pretty close walk to Disney. We could have stayed closer, but we would have had to comprise quality.

When we arrived the staff were very friendly and obliging.  Our room was not ready, but we could leave our luggage there.  We had a room with two queen beds and there was a separate area with a tv, sofa, chair and coffee table.  You could pull a heavy curtain across the area to separate it from the bedroom.  Breakfast at the hotel was quite basic.  Mainly sweet items although there were powered scrambled eggs and cereal.  We requested a taxi to be ordered for us and they provided a mini van at the same cost we had anticipated for the taxi.  Most of the places to eat around the area are burgers and pizzas.  We ate at Denny's which is across the road from the main gates at Disneyland. Here there was a variety of meals at very reasonable prices.  The only bugbear was they only

Summary Heading: Okay hotel but i would not stay here again
Summary: We stayed at this hotel on a family vacation with my husbands side of the family and had total of 15 of us. This was the best priced hotel that we could find that could accommodate all of us and our needs.  We stayed in the Kids suite with the king bed and my kids loved having a their own room with their own bunk beds.  However, the rooms seemed really dark and smelled somewhat musty AND one night there was a cockroach on my pillow!! You could not leave on the bathroom light without the loud bathroom fan being on as well, which was kind of annoying because i like to leave on the bathroom light at night, just in case my kids get up and need to find their way around a unfamiliar place. They also have weird placing of outlets ( like by where your child lays there head on the wall

Perfect position for Disneyland visitors.  A 10 min walk around the corner and we were at the front gate.  Great for after a long day at the parks.  The room itself was very small for the 5 of us that stayed (2 adults, 3 children) but unfortunately they didnt have anywhere to upgrade us.  The room included a small dining table & chairs, kitchenette, toilet/shower room and the vanity was outside the shower room door.  The room got very stuffy in the nights, no windows would open the the aircon was too loud to sleep through.  The foldout couch took up all of the loungeroom when open and the table & chairs were crammed into a corner.  The room charge did include breakfast which was great (loved the make your own waffles) and the roof top dining area gave us a great dose of fresh

Basic accommodation but for the price you pay you wouldn't expect anything more. The desk staff were more than helpful and catered to our needs. The big plus for this place is the location. Easy walk to Disneyland, many places to eat in the immediate area, 7-11 type shop next door for basic items. I would stay again if I am heading to Disneyland.

The staff was accommodating to switch our original room which was right on the main drag(loud) The first room eas well worn an slightly smelly(musty) . The second room was better......just a basic room. The free breakfast was good, the reason we stayed there was the proximity to Disney. The hotel seems to have an identity problem....the front lobby and outside facade have been redone but the rooms are so-so.

Summary Heading: It was all started with a Mouse.
Summary: My friends and I drove to Anaheim for the night to go to Disneyland. I didn't book the room but I believe we had a suite. The room was Huge! We also had a microwave and mini-fridge. Lots of room for 5 women. We had a sleeping area and a little living area with the pullout couch. There were a decent amount of plugs for charging electronics. The bathroom was a bit small, but big enough to get the job done. Water pressure in the shower was great, and towels were normal hotel towels. Beds were pretty comfortable, I didn't have a problem sleeping. The hotel was older but it didn't prove to be an issue. It was nice and clean. We got there around 3pm and were able to quickly get checked in. The hotel is set up a little weird so it seemed like a maze to get to our room. There is a small

very good experience with the desert palms hotel and suites. Used to stay across the street from dineyland and the rooms were to small. These rooms are very spacious and fits my family of five comfortably

We stayed here while visiting from Alaska and loved it. It provided enough room for our entire family, the beds were comfortable, they had enough towels in the room for all of us and the breakfast was great! We will definitely stay here again.

** Dont confuse this place with the Desert inn which is closer **  Just before I start- there seems to be people confused which hotel this is- The Desert INN is actually pratically opposite the Disney entrance.This hotel whilst still close is at least a 10-15min walk away!! (just saying ) ** We found the walk was quite pleasant. Just take your time if you are tired and remember that a bed is waiting for you just around the corner!!   After much reviewing on tripadvisor, I have come to the conclussion that most hotels in this area are similiar!! They are all ok, a place to sleep whilst you get out and see the attractions. Don't expect too much.   We arrived very late one night and was put in a lower floor room with 2 x QS beds, nothing wrong with the room other than it needed

Summary Heading: Terrible furniture and customer service, but the location's good and it's clean.
Summary: This hotel does a good job of making you want to leave all day. The furnishings are horribly uncomfortable and the concierge was rude at best ( the woman, not the man-he was unfortunately so helpful to the couple in front of us that we had to wait 15 minutes until the woman came in). The coffee situation is horrible, too, styrofoam cups and powdered creamer-nasty stuff. The tv was broke, although they fixed it the next day. They weren't good at replenishing our toiletries, either. The breakfast was ok, just don't expect "real food", the juice is tang and the eggs taste powdere and the oatmeal was like glue.  Can't say I'd recommend this place to a friend.  Maybe if you paid under 70.00 a night it would be worth it.

The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and have a range of options for large groups.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family going to Disneyland
Summary: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the parks and being able to get a suite with two queen beds and a sofa bed. The room was huge! It also had a table and chairs, perfect for a meal of take-out after a long day at Disney. It is really close to the parks, no need for a shuttle, and it is right by the 7-11 and a convenience store so you can buy water before going to the parks. The pool was fun, they have a huge beach ball in it; although it is chilly! Our only complaint was the breakfast; it was not good at all. We ended up buying cereal instead. It doesn't compare to Holiday Inn Express breakfasts. We would stay here again, it's close to restaurants as well as the parks without being right in the crowds.

Summary:   More of a 3 and 1/2 but I rounded up based on the customer service.  Rate:  $150 Pros:  Location (7-10 minute walk to entrance of parks), Room Size, Customer Service Con:   Elevators, directions to elevators from room, bathroom sink outside of main bathroom  Obviously, the location is key.  7-10 minute walk to the park.  Right next to a 7-11 if you need basics.  Area seemed safe and relatively quiet.  I had good customer service experiences particularly employee Dianda who helped out a lot regarding the printing of our boarding passes.  The free breakfast was fine.  Had a decent amount of choices and was warm and pretty tasty.   The room was large.  It had a separate room with a couch bed and its own tv presumably the kids room.  We did not use the couch bed so no

The staff is helpful regarding the local area.  However, staying on the second floor, is a study in frustration.  One has to take the elevator down to the lobby to get the elevator that goes to the fifth floor to get breakfast.  Seeking ice from the second floor is also a bit much.  The only ice machines are on other floors.  The swimming pool is an oversized kiddy-pool.  The gym has one treadmill, and three other machines.  When opening the bathroom door, it's a study in frustration, if your partner, or you, left the closet door open.  It will lock you into the bathroom, unless you break down the closet door.  Whoever designed the rooms should be made to stay in one for a weekend. Other than the super-friendly staff, and perfect location between the Convention Center, and

[iminent=MJLducgUWfOB]  I really don't know what H J was talking about. Our room was great! Though we didn't have bunk beds in our room for the kids, we did have a nice CLEAN room. Getting in and out of the hotel parking lot is a little on a dangerous side, but so is the downtown L A FREEWAY! The staff was very nice. Felt like a royality, what ever we asked for they were there to help and make our stay there as happy and comfortable as can be. As for the breakfast, really didn't have much, but what do you expect it's grub, not a fancy resturant.If I wanted a fancy resturant I would go down town to one. I thought of it a really nice place. Swimming pool was heated, people friendly, the were plenty of elevator, on just about every corner you walked in the hotel. Disneyland!

My baseball team stayed here  for 5 days while we played in the Lions Tournament.  Julie Gomez did a great job helping me coordinate the rooms for my players and their parents.  It is a great location....only a few blocks from disneyland and there are many places to eat and shop within a few blocks.  The rooms were good and the breakfast upstairs was not bad.  The pool and jaquzzi are downstairs  and the small restaurnant that is downstairs has very  good food and their pizza is very good...a large will feed 4-5 people easily and for only $14 bucks it is a deal.  We will stay here next year! Thanks to Julie Gomez and the staff for an enjoyable stay. Coach O'Ravez

Staff were great and very friendly. Rooms very clean compared to other hotels we've stayed around disneyland.  Location is also very near just walking distance to disneyland and the gardenwalk, you can find fastfoods justa block away

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim for family, fun
Summary: We had a great long weekend at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. We arrived early afternoon and were able to arrange for an early check-in, very quickly and easily. The entire front desk staff was very cordial and helpful during our stay. Breakfast was filling and the food was good and plentiful. Some of our party used the pool and thoroughly enjoyed themselves.  The onsite bar and grill is small, but provided quick, pleasant service and a nice relaxing atmosphere. The hotel is very conveniently located, easy walking distance to Disneyland, the Anaheim Convention Center and numerous restaurants, but still maintains a nice, sedate environment.  On past trips to the Anaheim area we've stayed at value hotels located across from Disneyland, but our future trips will be return stays

Summary Heading: Great value for a Disneyland trip
Summary: Just got back from a few days trip to DL and stayed at this hotel.It`s very close to the main gate  ( 2 blocks = 7 min walking). It has about 7-8 restaurants w/thin 1-2 blocks distance , such as PF Chang,Cheesecake Factory, etc.It has also its own restaurant,but it looked pretty empty ( mid-week). It`s nothing very fancy but good enough for what you payed for.It`s clean,got an outdoor pool (really weird located, since it never gets sun over it), breakfast is mediocre but it`s complementary,parking as well (it could get crowded at night but if feels safe), fridge and safe-box in the room.Walls are thin and you`ll hear stomping/voices all the time but keep in mind that people come here to have fun and that has nothing to do with the hotel but with their upbringing.If priced right,

I think this was the worst hotel I've ever gone to. So, we wanted to go to a nice, clean hotel near Disney. That's what we thought we were getting. We walk up to the door of the hotel and it reeks of smoke. The parking lot was super dangerous as well. We walk in and they tell us to come back later for a room. We come back and are astonished at the terrible room we are given. We walk in and there is a terrible stench of lemon ammonia. I walked into the children's room which has bunk beds to see if it's any better. We walk in and see a dinky little room with a dust speckled bunk bed & a ripped up orange couch. That's when we decided it was terrible. We were tired and decided to look at a different hotel for the next 4 days. We found a Sheraton which was located across the street

Summary Heading: Good location, nice staff, great location, just ok ammenities
Summary: We stayed as a family of 6 in the Kitchenette Suite. There was enough room for all of us to sleep comfortably and not feel too crowded when we just hung out in the room. There was a stove, dish ware, a regular size fridge. The hotel has a really good and reasonably priced restaurant/bar called the Sandbox. The pool was small, but it was not too crowded at certain times. The breakfast buffet consisted of cereals, fruit, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, toast, waffles, etc. The area was big and the ladies who worked in the breakfast room kept everything clean and replenished. The hotel is within walking distance to the Convention Center and the Disneyland Resort. I docked a star mainly because the room could have used some upgrades and replacements and the sink backed up every once in

We stayed here for 2 nights to go to Disneyland California Adventure Park. Only +ve is the free parking, its proximity to Disneyland and also a slew of restaurants within walking distance (kids love Bubba Gump). The hotel is clean, and the best description would be "servicable". It has several washing and drying machines on 3rd and 4th floor so its very convenient. Breakfast is on 5th floor, lots of cereal, coffee, make your own waffles. But think in terms of cafeteria food and you wont be disappointed. I would not choose to stay here again. Overall, in terms of the price paid, was probably the WORST value of 6 hotels we stayed in US on this trip. Only reason they can charge what they charge, and still get business is because of Disneyland. Like I said, think in terms of paying

There's a reason there was vacancy during spring break with no advance planning. Room was ok but we were on the first floor, corner. Could hear everything going on above us, around us, and through the nearby exit door. But the fan on the air conditioner helped block out some of the noise.

We loved our stay at Desert Palms! The hotel staff went out of there way to get us whatever we needed and made us feel more than comfortable. The hotel was so clean as well. The walk to Disneyland was so easy we could bring our kids back to nap. We like it so much we will keep this as our Anaheim regular hotel!

We spent three day's here and couldn't be more happy with the hotel and the location.  The rooms are a bit dated but very clean and roomy.  Hot breakfast was served every morning on the fifth floor with plenty of room for everyone.  pool is semi indoor with towels down at the pool with plenty of seating.  Overall I would recomment to anyone, because the distance to the entrance to the park (Disneyland/California adventure) is a nice walk maybe a 1/4 mile in a very safe area.

We stayed at Desert Palms for 4 nights in Nov 12. We chose Desert Palms due to its location so close to Disneyland. Short walk to Disneyland (10-12 mins) which was great, got splashed on a few water rides so we could just duck back to the hotel to get changed. Rooms were basic but tidy and quite roomy. Car parking was a bit of a problem with a large car and only being able to use the upper car park which was always full. Breakfast was sufficient but could do with more fresh fruit.   Overall a good experience, great location and value for money. Will stay again.

Hotel was convenient and in walking distance to the entrance to the Disneyland resort and walking distance to downtown Disney.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The pool was under construction during our stay so we didn't get to use the pool (which is why I am giving this hotel 4 stars instead of 5)  They had a free buffet breakfast which was very good and sure helped saving the wallet when feeding 5 of us.  The room was comfortable, clean but worn.  You can tell this hotel has been around for a while but would highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Convenient, helpful, affordable, excellent service, only 10 min walk from Disneyland.
Summary: I have had a very good experience with the hotel , after leaving some clothes behind, they have been extremely helpful, in assisting their return. Our three day stay was great, we were upgraded to a room with a small living area, as we were sharing with 3 adults. The location is fantastic for getting to Disneyland and California land. The breakfast was generous, and the staff at the front desk very helpful. An excellent place to stay.

Fantastic Resort - location & staff excellent. From the time we booked on the phone to the time we checked in, the staff were very helpful and friendly. Would def reccommend to others for their Disney experience

We've been coming here for nearly eight years.  Always have a wonderful experience.  Great location (baseball, Disney, beaches, etc.), clean rooms and friendly staff.  Don't forget the free breakfast.  What more do you need.

Summary Heading: ideal location for a vacation to disneyland
Summary: If you are on a vacation to disneyland this is the ideal location for that trip because it is a 10 minute walk away they also serve complimentary breakfast on the 5th floor consisting of waffles fruit eggs bacon sausage or eggs with sausage in them, eggs, biscuits and grave and always waffles donkey would be proud

What a wonderful hotel. We were there for spring break, so it was busy.. but the staff still went out of their way to make sure your trip was wonderful!! This was our children's first trip, and a surprise trip at that. They put us at the back of the hotel, we surprised the kids with the news while watching the evening firework show.  There is 2 adults, and 3 children in our group. It was perfect!! Rooms are very clean, well kept.  Breakfast was great to go pick up each morning, it had lots of choices. And close by it was an easy walk each day, we came back to the hotel for lunch/ break each day before enjoying the evening shows.   Would definitely stay again, and would tell friends too.

I had come to run in the Tinkerbell half marathon.    The hotel was EXCELLENT.   The staff was friendly and helpful..    and the food in the bar was good too.    Also the pool was nice and was not dirty.     I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

We recently stayed here for a last minute mid week trip. When we arrived about 1pm and tried to check in was told no rooms were available and to come back after 3pm. They did however offer us a parking pass and got us all signed in took care of last minute ticket we needed as well as ART (bus) passes. We went and did some shopping and returned about 2pm, yes still early but after driving 6 hours really wanted to get into a room before heading to disney. The clerk remembered me by name when I walked in which was a plus to me. The clerk began calling housekeeping to find out what rooms were available and there were a few ready to go! She then told us she would upgrade (first time ever upgraded) us to another room that was ready. I was pleased with this, once parked and unloaded we

We stayed in Anaheim purely to go to Disneyland, and this hotel was perfect. It was about a 10 or so minute walk to Disneyland but the weather was pretty good so I didn't mind. The rooms were clean and the staff we so nice!  The only downside was that we had a family with a baby in the next room who like to stay up until about 2am, and the walls must be thin because we could hear them very clearly through the wall. As long as you don't have a noisy neighbour then it's fine! Good hotel and I'd reccomend it for Disneyland

Summary Heading: Reasonable hotel in the middle of everything in Anaheim
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a convention at the Anaheim convention center. The convention center is about a 5 minute walk, and I believe it would be a reasonable walk to the Disneyland gate too.  The room was on the small size, but it's adequate and clean.  The hotel internet service was OK, as was the free breakfast (although the breakfast room was overrun by families with screaming kids, which shouldn't surprise anyone, so I generally ate out on the terrace, which was fine too).  Service was pleasant.

Summary Heading: Desert Palms Easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms Early Feb 2013. It's an easy 8 min walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating. The free breakfast was good, buffet style. 7/11 is next door, we would stop each morning and load up on snacks and drinks for the day, just don't buy a drink in glass as they don't allow glass in the parks. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again. I booked our room direct with the hotel and it was very easy.

We got a very comfortable room with a King bed. Our daughter and grandson got a larger room with queen beds. Our other requests were for a coffee maker, microwave, fridge and free parking. Even the swimming pool and spa were heated in March!! The hot breakfast provided something for each of us. The area was clean and continually restocked. Their restaurant The Sandbox Bar and Grill has great and reasonably priced food! All this within a 10 minute walk to Disneyland!!

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Clean Within Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms. It was our first trip to Disneyland and I read all the reviews of the various hotels in the area and settled on this one. I am very glad I did. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. We stayed in one of the kids suites (our boys are 5 and 2) and there was plenty of room for all of us. It was nice to be able to put the kids to bed and close a door and my husband and I could stay up a little while longer and regroup.  The continental breakfast, which is included, was great each day. There was always hot and cold choices and the selection varied each day which was nice. The staff in the breakfast room were quick to keep the eating area clean. We also enjoyed two meals at the in-hotel restaurant. The staff at the Sandbox Grille were

Our stay was very pleasant, made even more so by the wonderful customer service provided by their staff at the front desk. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was plenty of room for the 3 of us. I appreciated the microwave and fridge very much. The breakfast was always hot and provided many choices. It was also convenient to the Convention Center and local attractions, too. And there were many quality restaurants within walking distance.

Love this hotel, friendly staff and great location. Clean and great breakfast! Wish there was better parking but a big bus was there at same time, an employee actually gave up her spot for me.....was GREAT! Wish I could stay more often!

Summary Heading: Super friendly staff, very clean, and family friendly hotel!
Summary: Our family of 4 injoyed our stay. The very friendly staff answered questions when we had them. The suite we were in was very clean and roomy. Also very convenient with microwave and mini fridge. Perfect for warming and storing bottles for my 9 month old son. And leftover dinner from the night before. I was also impressed with their breakfast, it was a great fresh selection of different things you could pick from. That was perfect for my picky 2 year old daughter! Overall we had a wonderful stay and a great time!

We stayed in a queen room for 4 nights and just checked out a couple of days ago. The hotel needs some renovations. The beds were nice, but there is an ugly orange color on the door to the room and one of the walls. The room we were put in was facing Katella and the noise was so loud at night it sounded like the window was open. Also, we came back to rest during a long day at the park one day and a man (I'm guessing part of housekeeping) was knocking on every door on our floor. We could hear vacuum cleaners, but I'm not sure what they were doing. It was late in the afternoon. The next day we asked to be moved to the back of the hotel and the staff moved our belongings while we were at Disneyland which was nice because we didn't have to go back and do it ourselves. It was a lot

first impressions of hotel were great, the staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. the rooms were clean and inviting, the breakfast was great a lot of options, the sandbox bar and grill had great food and the portions were a lot bigger than expected. the food was also priced very well. we were a little disappointed that we did not get to enjoy your pool as it was under construction, but no big deal. I do want to state that this was our very first family trip, and it was our very first time ever going to Disneyland. we enjoyed it so much that we are planning on returning sometime this November. based on our experience with your Hotel, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else..

We recently stayed at this Hotel for our trip to Disneyland.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite that included the frig, microwave and living roonm with sofa sleeper.  The sofa sleeper was in poor condition, very uncomfortable and I felt badly for my daughter and son-in-law.  The queen beds were average, sheets seemed older.  The bathroom was a good size but towels were very thin and seemed older also.  It was really nice having the refrigerator for water and my grandson snacks.  We did not use the microwave or the stove.  The TV was newer which was nice.  We did have a suite that was located right next to the elevator which was good but really bad for noise.  We were on the 3rd floor and the upstairs was noisy also.  Staff seemed really friendly though.  We tried to have dinner

My first stay and I will surely come back again!  Hotel is clean, rooms are nice and the hotel staff is great!  I have always left a small note in the morning to thank the cleaning staff.  It wasn't until last week, at this hotel, that I received a response back - nice!! Location is close to convention center.  Convenient store right next door.  Walking distance to many restaurants.  I appreciated the morning breakfast adding some different options each day.

The Borrego Suite was perfect for our trip! We had 4 adults and two children and had plenty of space for everyone.The tv room was a great addition as well as the mini fridge and microwave! I have an infant and would have been in big trouble without it!! The staff was super friendly and helpful, even the house keepers were great help! The complex was clean and safe. The restaurant had GREAT food and good pricing.The extra bonus was the free breakfast. They had eggs, sausage, cereal, burritos everything that would suit anyone! I would definitaly stay there again as well as recommend it to friends.

Summary Heading: Don't book this for the free breakfast buffet… but the rooms are decent
Summary: Here are the good points about this hotel: -Clean rooms, decent size -Easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland -Next to 7-Eleven for convenient items -Small restaurant in hotel -Just a couple of blocks to shopping mall area with nice restaurants -Friendly staff -Affordable  Here's what we didn't like: -The buffet was horrible.  Crowded, stuffy eating area.  Limited food items.  Cheap, low quality food.  This wouldn't be that big of a deal, but this was one of the primary reasons we booked this hotel, for the free buffet breakfast. -Small pool area with limited seating.  Very crowded feeling with any more than about 3 families using the pool at one time. -Stuffy hallways -Poor lighting in the rooms

We stayed one year with a group, next time tried another hotel.  Not a good move...  This place not only was it Very clean, it had Great food and everyday upon return from our adventures out. The wonderful people caring for our room did extra things for our daughter to enjoy.

We stayed here briefly during our trip and it was quite a mediocre place to stay. The hotel lobby is okay, but the rooms were quite outdated and dark. Our room was nicely sized and the beds were comfortable but the bathroom was a hassle to shower in due to the pressure and placement of the shower head.  I only attended the free breakfast once and was not impressed at all. The downstairs cafe was okay, but the waiter there could not understand anything I was saying despite repeating myself and speaking clearly for him, and all of our orders were messed up. I would probably look elsewhere if I returned.   Great location however as it was only about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, but it can feel like so much further when you have been walking around the park in the heat for

Took our family to Disney, but didn't want to stay at one of the Disneyland hotels.  Decided that this would be close enough to walk, but not with the cost of the park hotels. We were very pleasantly surprised when we checked in. Jessika helped us check in and was wonderful. Very nice and professional. Told us everything we needed to know about times, places, and even Disney. Got to our room and it was a great two-room suite with a pool view. It was perfect for our family. The kids had bunk beds and were able to sit and watch tv or play, and we were able to go to our "room" and relax after the long day. It was great (and clean!). We will definitely be going back soon!!

Summary Heading: Pretty good hotel...only thing is that the shower pressure sucks!!
Summary: Stayed here for a few days when visiting Disneyland.  The location is great, because there is a 7-11 next door and Disneyland is within walking distance.  There is free parking and wi-fi which was nice :)   There is a free breakfast every morning that was always crowded.  They had coffee (which tasted terribly watered down), oatmeal (which also was greatly watered down), and your standard cereals, juice, eggs, meat, potatoes, pastries, and waffles.  It seemed no matter what time my friends and I went down for breakfast, it was always crowded.  For two days we couldn't find any seats so we took our food upstairs to our room to eat...which wasn't so bad because it was almost like room service :)   The pool was always crowded, and then was closed for 3-4 days for some

Summary Heading: Excellent value for a Disney trip
Summary: We stayed 4 nights at the desert palms and were really happy.ok it's not the Wynn but for the price it represents excellent value for any family visiting Disney.it really is the easiest walk to the park along nice big sidewalk and not even 10 minutes.there are nearer hotels but they won't be any better than the palm as the Service is great.ignore the bad reviews-the staff go out of their way to help-we had to change rooms as our street side room was too noisy for me (I'm a very very light sleeper) and after already upgrading us at check in, they moved us to a fab 2 bed room on the internal pool side and moved all our stuff while we were at the park!they let us look at rooms first too and never pressured us into choosing.breakfast is typical mid budget hotel choice-scrambled

This hotel has a great location to Dland main gate. Free parking and free breakfast among the perks. The Dland shuttle stop is right outside the front of the hotel, so for $5 a day you have continuous shuttle to and from Dland and DCA, well worth it especially at the end of a long day. The Yuha kids suites are great and have plenty of room, king bed+bunk beds+sofa sleeper. Clean and nice. The breakfast is nothing to write home about-avoid the baked eggs and sausage and potatoes. The waffles, cereal, fruit and muffins are fine. Otherwise a very friendly staff and great location!

A 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland and 5 minute walk to most restaurants and a Subway across the street. The room was a decent size and it was clean. The hotel rate, complimentary breakfast and free parking was super convenient. Overall, a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: 10 minute walk to Disneyland, overall a good hotel.
Summary: The proximity to Disneyland is pretty good. It's about a 10 minute walk. The carpet in the rooms seems pretty worn down and there were quite a few stains on the carpet in our room-looks like it should be replaced. Other than that, the hotel lobby and the rest of our room was very clean. The rooms are pretty good size and the beds are pretty comfortable. Overall, the hotel is a good value. I would stay here again.

Jenny helped me change my reservation when I needed to leave town at the last minute. She was so helpful and really made the stay! The room was decent and close enough to walk to the convention center. Free parking here was also nice!

The first night I was very pleased with this hotel.  The lobby area was inviting.  However we woke up to a sink that was backed up and bubbling.  I called the front desk to alert them that for nO reason our sink was pushing up water and other people waste from our drain with out our sink running.  We were told they would send maintenance up in an hour.  I advised him we could not wait as this was a continued overflow. Our family packed up and was placed in a temporary room with broken shutters. It was early morning and this had no privacy as it was the first floor to the Parking lot.  The hotel did appear to redeem when they upgraded us to a suite. I was happy and willing to forget about it.  Again another night. This time our toilet would not flush. It was backed up then

Myself, my husband & our 2 young children just got back from our Disneyland vacation! I chose this hotel after extensive research on TripAdvisor.com & price shopping. We stayed Mon. - Fri. 2/25-3/1/13 & payed a total of $286.74 (awesome deal for a nice hotel 5 min. away from DL). I found that bookng with the hotel directly was the cheapest. We arrived Mon. morning at 9am & as expected our room wasn't ready but they gave us a parking pass to park our vehicle while we were at Disney Land. We were upgraded to a Borrego(?) suite with a sunken living room for free & enjoyed the extra space. The room was clean & updated & the beds were comfortable:) Our only complaint was the obnoxiously loud fan & unfortunately it was directly tied to the bathroom light. Laundry room on the 3rd floor

Summary Heading: Made our first trip to Disneyland wonderful!
Summary: We flew into Anaheim around 11am and knew we were a bit early for check-in. We drove to the hotel first so we knew where everything was. I went to the front desk and asked about early check-in. The lady was very nice and said the rooms weren't ready yet but saved a particular room for us that faced Cars Land. We drove to Target which wasn't too far away and shopped for food and supplies. By the time we got back, probably around 1:30, she said our room was ready. We were very excited cause we were planning on hitting the parks that very day. We got the Kids Suite which had a bunk bed and a sleeper sofa in a separate room (its just separated by a sliding door) and we had also asked for a crib which fit perfectly in the other room. Each room had its own TV, which was nice. The

Summary Heading: Not the best not the worst
Summary: Only thing this hotel has going for it the front desk staff and location. Rooms are small, restaurant is nothing to write home about , breakfast is gross , pool didn't work and got ripped off by the private tour they set us up on.My advice do not use Regal Tours , racists and rip off artists

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, warm welcome and great loaction!
Summary: We booked this hotel after reading many good reviews. We arrived and found the hotel staff very pleasant and friendly. Checking in took less than five minutes. We had a suite which had 2 bedrooms (one King, one bunk beds and a sofa bed) with sliding door and a good size bathroom. Our room had a partial view of the park. We were told that we could see the fireworks from our room but not sure how true that was since we saw the fireworks at the actual park.  Our rooms were cleaned everyday and they gave us more towels than we needed (there were 3 of us) which was a good thing.  We used the Sand Box on the night of our arrival, the staff were very friendly and the food was good and the price was also pretty good. The Hotel brochure also featured a number of local restaurants which

This hotel was adequate to our needs.  We had a very small kids' suite, containing bunk beds, a foldout couch and a double bed.  Since we were only there to sleep it was ok.  Staff were generally polite, although we were ambushed by the concierge after a 13 hour flight - offered a free lunch, which it turned out we had to sit through a two hour presentation to accept. By the time we got to that bit if news, we'd wasted a lot of time.  The free breakfast was worth what we paid for it, and not a penny more!!  The location was convenient to the Disney precinct, but next time, we'll look elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Not sure how this hotel is ranked high?
Summary: The rooms are way outdated, smelly, dirty, non functional. I was checked into my first room and the door handle didnt work. The second room was on the bottom floor with a window directly into the parking garage. The third and final room was so gross I kept my sandals on at all times.  Had things falling apart and breaking on me daily, the door stop, the TV, the shower rod. Service doesnt have a clue what they are doing there at check in either. I wouldnt have paid more than 60 a night had I known what the hotel was like. Never stay there again.

We had an awesome stay and my kids loved the room. It was an easy walk to disney and the stores next to the hotel were a plus. We had a few problems but I gotta say they didn't bother our stay thanks to the staff. As soon as we called the front desk they send someone to fix the problems right away, they were always friendly and courteous. We will definately stay here again next time we go to disney.

Great staff, they were all very friendly and kind. Rooms were clean and neat. The room wasnt very big but i had eveything i needed, breakfast was delicious as well. Made my trip to Disneyland even better. Everything was great, definitely coming back.

Summary Heading: GREAT Service and Location!  Clean and friendly!
Summary: Our visit was wonderful!  Terrific hospitality and great customer service!  The staff was helpful with any questions, the morning lattes were great to pick up on our quick walk to Disney, and the towels sculpted into animals made it extra special.  We have stayed multiple times in the Disney hotels (Californian and the original), but value can't be beat here.  We even had the bunks for tee kids in a separate room with a door from ours!  Lovely suite to relax in each evening.

Summary Heading: Good enough for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: The check in staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was small but clean. We're glad we chose a Yuha Kids' Suite as the children had bunk beds in a separate room.  The bathroom fan was very loud and the shower a bit weak. The heating a/c fan was very loud too. Overall we were happy with the room, but the only real disappointment was the breakfast.  The breakfast room was far too small to accommodate the number of guests, and there were not enough tables forcing us to eat outside, which must be pleasant in the summer but it was too chilly in February. The choice of cereal and hot food was very limited.  The location of the hotel is great, and if you are happy to breakfast elsewhere, the hotel is good enough for a trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: ok not the happiest place on earth to stay
Summary: looked long and hard for a hotel to fit our 17, 15,14,12 kids and us parents.  Took all the reviews with a grain of salt but after staying for 4 nights we decided to check out and not return :(  A noisy hotel for sure.  It did accommodate our needs and possibly being in a top floor room may have helped. Having 4 queen beds was great and two bathrooms were a blessings.  It was in easy walking distance of disney for our kids so that was good.  Having the two convenience stores next door was handy.  The room had mold in it disappointing for sure, but otherwise was surface clean.  Breakfast was predictable as the reviews state.  The staff were mostly great.  Having someone on the front desk with several piercings I dont think is professional though.  The pool was shut down for two

Desert palms hotel was a blessing to find. Our family ha never been to Disneyland before and choosing a hotel we really did not know anything  about was nerve wrecking! Luckily we chose the desert palms and we are very happy with our stay. We stayed in the kids suite it had two queens and bunk beds plus a sofa sleeper. We were up on the 4th floor which was great! Over all the room and the breakfast was great. Staff at the hotel are so helpful and nice! Stay here for good value and good rooms.

Summary Heading: Good Prices, Great location, and helpful staff
Summary: With so many choices while visiting Anaheim to go to Disneyland, I opted to stay at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. The hotel was very unique in appearance. It was a very relaxing atmosphere. The lobby was huge and was a great place to sit and meet with clients I have in the area. The breakfast was great for the kids with lots of variety. Disneyland is just a 15 minute walk away but they also have a shuttle that saved us at the end of our long day at the park. The hotel staff was superb. For a new hotel in Anaheim, they did a great job winning my business. I will be staying with the Desert palms again for business or pleasure.

We stayed as a family, 3 nights.  It was reasonably priced, but there were some frustrating elements about the place.  Parking was compromised by guests who parked in Fire Lanes and made exiting difficult; I prayed the fire lanes were not needed.  The hotel does not enforce them.  And the breakfast was marginal; a bit of a feeding frenzy, and food quality? Who serves scrambled eggs, and scrambled eggs with ham bits.  A money saver for the hotel, but not so good as a guest.  It was convenient to Disney attractions, and that was nice.  Front desk staff was competent, pleasant, and explained potential charges for safe and other amenities.  Maid staff did a great job while we were there, but not so sure previously (I found a "little blue pill" under the edge of the bed--really?).

Summary Heading: Nice stay right next to Disneyland
Summary: Our family stay here, on a recent trip to Disneyland, for two nights. We have 8 in our family and there are not many places to stay that will comfortably accommodate large families. We stayed in the Kalahari Suite. It was very spacious and it was great having two full baths. There was more than enough bed space. The beds were average, what you would expect in an average hotel. In other words not as good as home but good enough after tromping all over the park all day. Upon arrival in the morning they did not have any rooms ready yet, but they gave us a parking pass so we could park the van there and go right to the park. The breakfast was perfect for six picky youngsters. There was plenty of variety. It's best to get to the breakfast room early, if you have a lot of kids, to

We stayed for 4 days and had a great time! After arriving exhausted the receptionist who checked us in (Jennifer) was extremely pleasant. She asked how our drive was and if we were celebrating anything while on vacation. I told her it was my daughter's bday and later on in the evening there was a complimentary bday goodie bag for my baby. Great location to get a nice walk to and from Disneyland and the buffet breakfast was a great way to start our mornings!!

Stayed here with my family of 5 (me my wife and 3 young kids) for a family trip to Disneyland.  The location is great.  Easy walking distance to the park, nice access to snacks, supplies etc at the 7-11 next door.  On site restaurant is pretty good.  Daily breakfast is a nice option and saves money.   We stayed in a "Yuha" suite which lists 6 for its capacity.  We were able to sleep five but there certainly wasn't any extra room for moving around.  The size was constrained but the price and convenience made up for small size.

I was very impressed with the cleanliness and look from our arrival to this hotel. Was a bit disgruntled with my initial dealing with a staff member at the front counter which made me and my family avoid her from then on, however, the other staff members were a pleasure to deal with for the rest of my trip. The room was a bit disappointing but I must say that the housekeeping staff were very good at their jobs and I was always very happy with the privacy they provided and the clean room I came back to every day. The food I felt could have been a lot better but at least it was always there. The staff at the restaurant were shocking so this made us go looking elsewhere. Penny is an absolute credit to this hotel and without her I'm afraid I would have gone looking elsewhere for

I'd actually say the hotel itself is 3 stars, but the location and included hot breakfast bump it up to 4 stars.  My husband and I took our 3 kids (ages 6, 5 & 5 months) as well as both of our moms, so we had 7 people total.  We booked the Kids Suite w/ bunk beds.  The room was small for 7 people, but any room would be small for 7 people.  The location was an easy walk to the park, even with the kids and those nearing Senior Citizen status.  The hot breakfast in the morning was a great way to fill up prior to a really long day of walking.  The pool wasn't fancy, very enclosed, but my kids spent several hours in it the first day we arrived, so it was a nice option to have.  The staff was very friendly and the young man that checked me in spent a good 10 minutes with me making

My room felt like more of a 2 star. The carpet was kind of gross and the bed's were okay. I must have been on a super noisy floor, because we could hear everyone around us yelling until all hours of the night. It was okay, but there are better places to stay in the Disney area.

Summary Heading: All the reviews are correct! This place is awesome!!!!
Summary: The lobby was super impressive and everything is very, very clean. Our room was larger than I thought it was going to be and also very clean. Housekeeping did an amazing job everyday. The free breakfast was the best that I've ever seen offered at a hotel. Everything from wafles, eggs, sausages, yogurt, doughnuts, toast, fruit, coffee, juice. About a 5 min. walk to Disneyland (1.5 blocks). No problem for my 5 and 8 year olds.

If in need of a place to stay near Disneyland this is for you! The lobby is very welcoming and the staff goes out of their way to make your stay a pleasant experience. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfast was exceptional, and if you are in the mood to work out the gym is for you! I also liked the gift shop with snacks and souvenirs to purchase. I loved my stay and highly recommend it.

What a great convenient hotel to stay at. Comfy and close to California Adventure.  Delicious breakfast, clean rooms and very spacious room.  We will stay again.  7/11 store right on the corner for any thing you forgot or snacks for the room.

I brought my class of adult students with special needs to this hotel for them to learn how to pack for themselves, get up using alarms, and learn how to go to the pool or gym themselves.  What an amazing experience.  Everyone was wonderful.  All of the facitilies were clean and ready to use.  The full American breakfast was also loved by all.  The food was hot and plentiful.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone needed a hotel in the area.  If you get a suite, you will have an extra pull out bed with a curtain to close off the area.  Please consider this hotel.

Summary Heading: Very good stay for family of 4
Summary: The hotel grounds and lobby were well kept and nice.  The front desk people were always very helpful and checked us in quicnkly.  The Kids Suite room that we had was a little small than we anticipated but it work nonetheless.  The bedding on the king bed was OK but I would have really enjoyed another warmer blanket, but that is just my prererence.  The bunkbed in the kids room was good except that I am not a fan of those duvet type comforters.  Always makes me wonder how often they wash those???  Other than that the room was well appointed with a frdge, microwage, in-room safe and great TV's.  The bathoom was OK but I think a new tubsurround would go a long way to updating this bathroom.  Plus, the fan (which is connected to the light) is super loud.  It was quite annoying!  If

After really nice day at the park it was great coming back to go to a comfy bed. I loved your guys breakfast to keep us fueled all day. After spending time at the park all day we needed to work out at your guys indoor gym. I had fun hanging out with my friends in our hotel rooms. Your guys lobby chairs and couches are very comfy.

We loved this hotel!  The convenience of the location - a close walk to both parks and Downtown Disney - made this a great choice!  We loved the the breakfast in the morning.  It was a great way to get fueled for a full day at the park!  The workout room was a added bonus!  Some of the students still had energy to burn after being at the park all day so a workout was just perfect!

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly, and lots of extras
Summary: This hotel is older and I was a little concerned about cleanliness based on other reviews, but I took a chance and was very pleasantly surprised. When we checked in the prices they had in their records were $30-$50 per night higher than what I had booked.  I had a copy of my reservation email confirming the prices and they were quick to make the adjustment and upgrade me to a suite at no additional cost.  The room included a fridge and microwave, was a good size, clean, and the beds were comfortable.  I think my only complaint is that the towels were thin.   Included in my reservation was $30 worth of free food in the restaurant.  When I checked in they not only upgraded my room and gave me the $30 coupons for free food, but they also gave me coupons for two free drinks, the

Summary Heading: Great location for the Convention Center
Summary: This was my second stay at Desert Palms - both have been work trips. The hotel couldn't really be much closer to the Convention Center (it's only a brisk 5 minute walk away), so thumbs up there, and there are plenty of restaurants and stores within 10 minutes' walking distance.  The rooms are clean, bright and pleasant, with all the amenities you could need for a stay of up to a week or so, although this year I had one with windows that didn't open, so it got a little stuffy at times. The air conditioning was LOUD, too.  However, the complimentary breakfast was perfectly fine, the pool is a nice touch, and the staff were courteous, friendly and helpful at all times.  I would definitely recommend Desert Palms to other business travellers, and it's so close to Disney it's got to

Summary Heading: Awesome Disney Birthday for our Son
Summary: We had a wonderful time with family in Anaheim celebrating our sons Birthday and his first time at Disneyland.  This Hotel is extremely accommodating and Desert Palms made this a very memorable trip.  The rooms fit each different family unit and we had a blase.  Recommend for anyone traveling to the area.

We have stayed at the Desert Palms 3 times and will not stay anywhere else.  The location is prime to get to Disneyland, we love that the hotel sells bus tickets, and the bus drop off is right in front of the hotel.  We love getting a suite, it gives our family plenty of room on our trip.  The rooms are always immaculately clean, service is excellent, parking is easy and the free breakfast is an outstanding bonus to get our day started.

Summary Heading: Favorite place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: We have been going to Anaheim every year for 34 years. Each year seemed to be a toss-up of where to stay until we found this hotel. It is in the perfect location for everything Anaheim. Next door to Disney. Across the street from the convention center. A very short walk to the "boardwalk" area where there are numerous restaurants and entertainment facilities to occupy a night.  This hotel is very clean, the rooms are large and comfortable, and the hot continental breakfast has saved my family lots of money since we just eat breakfast at the hotel now. Oh, and the breakfast area is on the top floor so you can look out over Disney while you enjoy eggs and waffles.

Our Family stayed at this hotel in December of 2012.  The hotel was very clean.  The room had a kids area with a bunkbed and a pull out sofa and for the adults there was two queen beds.  The breakfast was not bad at all, all of the food was fresh.  It was about a little under a 1/4 of a mile to walk but we did not have to cross the street.  The hotel is right behind California Adventure land.  The staff was very friendly and the gift shop was small but had everything you need.  I thought the price was perfect for all of us a family of 7, 4 adults and three kids in one room.  We will try a hotel a little closer next time but this location was not bad if you don't mind a little walk.

The best location, close walking distance to convention center and disneyland. It is alway clean and the staff is very friendly, the rooms our spacious and the free parking and breakfast really makes this the best value in Anahiem, the last time we stayed we got a free upgrade to a really nice suite!. This is alway our first choice when we visit Anaheim. We have stayed at most of the hotels in this area and they are the best by far.

Stay here every year for NAMM show - great rooms and great service. Location fantastic and staff very helpful. The room is very good sized and with Disneyland being so close it provides an excellent place if also on vacation.

Excellent staff, service, cleanliness, and value. We booked through a travel agent for a trip in the off-season (January-February). We had ordered groceries online from Vonn's and had them delivered. When we arrived we found put that we received a free upgrade to a suite and they had already put the perishable groceries in the fridge and the rest away in the cupboards. Eduardo at reception was very helpful, friendly, and legitimately interested in making sure we were enjoying our stay and having a good time. The housekeeping staff were helpful in making sure we had extra towels, a crib and all extras we needed for travelling with a baby. There are laundry facilities for guests. $2 to wash and $2 to dry.  The Sandbox Bar and Grill has great food, and the hotel is conveniently

I can't say enough about this hotel. We had 3 rooms, it was a birthday at Disneyland for my 4 and 5 year old Grandsons. The rooms were clean, very roomy, enjoyed the restaurant, gift shop, free parking, hot tub  and they made the day very special for the boys, leaving them a "Cars Bag" with balloons and filled with fun stuff for them to come home to after a long day. We will go back its a great location. You can walk to the Park.

We had a pleasant stay at the Desert Palms in June 2012.  This was a four day stop on a two week "out west" trip.  We visited several places in the area while staying at this hotel.  LA, Long Beach, and of course a day at Disneyland.  The seven of us stayed in a suite with a full kitchen, although we never really utilized the kitchen other than using the full size fridge to store left overs.  Some great features were the family atmosphere, the breakfast served on an upper floor, the location and it was fairly clean.  The walk was slightly further than we expected to Disneyland, but armed with a stroller for the littlest one(s), we did just fine.  Since we were travelling with my parents we were able to come back around dinner time and leave the younger ones with them and take

I've stayed at the Desert Palms for many a year whilst visiting the Namm show. Shirley and the team always make our stay most welcoming. The hotel has great amenities, large clean rooms, and the location is great for the convention centre, disneyland (which you can see form some of the rooms) and a hodst of nearby, walkable restaurants. I'd recommend the Desert Palms to any traveller for business or pleasure.

Fantastic staff and service in all areas, when booking online there was a sleep and eat option same price but got a $10 food voucher for each night booked for Sandbox bar and grill. Eat here excellent food try the seared ahi salad! Pool is good size and temp for kids, hot tub great as well. It says 50yards or so from disney which is true but it is the back of Adventure land so you still have a 15min easy walk to the entrance.  A 711 on the corner for picking up snacks for disney so you can take in your own food. Pipes were a bit noisy, breakfast is an excellent selection nice sunny room, make your own waffles, good value for a family.

We arrived for our 5 night stay before noon and they had no problem letting us check in early and we loved our room. We had the bunkbed suite and it was perfect for our family. The staff were so helpful for whatever we needed need it be directions or anything. The breakfast was pretty decent my kids were happy with waffles and fresh fruit. The sandbar had a coffee bar so I was able to get a latte every morning for our walk to the park. It was also affordable to get food there to take up to the room for some downtime. There are many restarants in the area and we were walking distance to Disney. For a great place to stay with your family I recommend this.

we just arrived home from a 6 day vacation at Disneyland with our son and his family.  We have stayed at 10 different hotels around Disneyland.  This was our first stay at Desert Palms. but it WILL NOT be our last.  This hotel is VERY clean and the staff were GREAT, we checked in late on our arrival and was given a handicap room our first night,  the next morning I asked if we could change rooms and was given a suite and NO extra cost.  The breakfast was wonderful for the children and my husband and I, the only thing that was some what wrong is having the breakfast same thing every other day.  But the staff kept EVERYTHING filled and were VERY helpful.  Will be back in March, and you can be assured we will stay here.

Enjoyed the stay, The rooms were cleaned throughout each morning, the staff was very pleasant and provided excellent service throughout our stay.  Breakfast was great and the selection was more than adequate.

Summary Heading: Just as Great the Second Stay
Summary: We returned to the Desert Palms for a second time and it is a great place to stay.  It is conveniently located, clean rooms, has a helpful and pleasant staff who is very accommodating, plus has a very good hot breakfast.  Nine of us (supposedly mature women) came for a bachelorette celebration.  Two of us had a room with two queen beds that was much larger than most other hotel rooms, and the rest of us stayed in a two-room family suite consisting of 4 queen beds with two bathrooms.  The suite was roomy enough for us and all our stuff.  The only thing that would have made the room better would be if the toilet and shower were separate from the sink/mirror area, but there was a hallway with a large closet with mirrored doors.  We really enjoyed our stay and when we came walking

My most recent stay at the Desert Palms was the 12th year in succession....the staff are wonderful and extremely helpful and welcoming. The rooms are great and the location is excellent. Nothing is too much trouble. A real pleasure to stay there and I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Anaheim...FIVE STARS!

Summary Heading: Excellent stay in the Yuha Kid's Suite
Summary: We were a party of six including three young adult girls, and an autistic 5 yr old. The hotel staff - from the front desk to housekeeping, were friendly, efficient, and always ready to assist at any time. The seperate sink and mirror outside of the bathroom was a great plus with all the young women getting ready every morning. The breakfast was excellent and there was a good choice of items - right up to the end of breakfast service. Our suite was clean, comfortable, and just fine for being away all day....the proximity to Disneyland was a great perk and an easy walk to make. (our autistic son's challenges required his meals in the room, so we appreciated the closeness of the hotel to the parks) We would recommend the hotel to anyone, especially those who want to walk to the

We have stayed here 2 times now.  It is close enough if you are up for a walk to Disneyland.  They have a nice free breakfast on the top floor so can can see Disneyland as you eat.  The last time I asked for a upgrade I am not sure if I got one or not but it was definitely bigger than a standard room.  It's a good location and the price is usually very good although you must check it seems like sometimes they are way higher than at others.  The parking gets quite crowded and is a little hard to find sometimes, but overall it's a good place to stay.

What a great plalce to stay for 5 nights.  Front desk so friendly. Ya gotta love that Sand Bar - those fish tacos were the best!!!! The service at the Sand Bar was excellant. They are so friendly and accomodating.  It was like being at home staying at this facility.  Altho my heater in the room was not working, the engineer followed up to be sure he got it fixed and the even on the next day, he wanted to double check everything was fine............NOW that's what I call a nice touch.  I definitely would recommend this place.  I didn't make use of t he spa so can not provide any comments but that pool sure looked inviting.  Breakfast was fabulous - a large clean seating room with some outside seating. Some good healthy choices to start your day. Thank you Desert Palms.

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly, but a few drawbacks.
Summary: Front desk staff, very friendly and helpful. Rooms and breakfast area very clean. Room was small (we had the king bed/bunk bed configuration). Real plates and silverware would have elevated the breakfast considerably. All that trash being created, and trying to eat with those flimsy forks and knives... And the coffee...sigh. Coming from the Pacific NW, the coffee in the breakfast room was terrible. The"in room coffee" was also a joke. A single serve coffee maker with only one serving of coffee (also terrible). The ABC market around the corner had Seattle's best which saved us. The breakfast had a good selection, but after a few mornings, the scrambled eggs seemed a little contrived. Fresh fruit was whole oranges and apples. Internet was slow during busy times. 10 minute walk

We arrived early in the morning after a long flight from Australia and were advised our room would not be available until appox 12 noon. We went across the road to Ihop for breakfast and returned a short time later. The lovely girls on reception, who could tell we were very tired, advised us they had upgraded us to a room that was available. We had a fantastic time, Disneyland was in walking distance, room was fantastic and breakfast was great. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenage children and would definitely recommend Desert Palms.

My sister and I ran a race in Disneyland this last weekend, and the Desert Palms was the perfect place for us to stay. Close enough to the park, but not right in the thick of things. We got a wonderful upgrade to a larger room (bonus!), and the room was clean, quiet, and well appointed. The shower water pressure wasn't great, but it was plenty hot! Having the fridge in the room was nice, as we kept water and snacks in there. We slept through the night (couldn't hear the neighbors, which is rarely the case in hotel rooms), and the staff couldn't have been sweeter.
