We got free parking (again, bonus!), and it was just what we needed. The breakfast was a little lacking, but for such a great deal, we didn't really care.

I stayed here (while 8 months pregnant) with my 3 yr old son and 62 yr old mother for 3 nights. We rented a 1 bedroom suite with kitchen.  The Good: Clean, well appointed kitchen with a nearly full sized refrigerator, walking distance to Disneyland, decent pool, friendly staff, reasonable prices (used AAA rate). Comfortable beds. Plenty of room. Free full breakfast! :)  Not so good:  While it is walkable to Disney it was a little far for a 3 yr old, 62 yr old and 30-something old prego. We walked it both ways the first day and took the city shuttle after that. The pull-out couch sofa is horrible to sleep on. The pool is a bit small but this really didn't bother me because we didn't spend much time there.  Would I stay again? Absolutely! That being said, I am going to try and

Comfortable rooms.  Stayed in a double suite ( 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms)- worked great for a mom,dad, 2 kids and grandparents.  Super friendly staff - very accommodating!  Allowed us to keep our luggage in storage until we could check in.  Parking easy.  As well allowed us to leave vehicle after we checked out so we could finish off another entire day at Disney. Good walking distance fr Disneyland - a comfortable walk and nice unwind when comin back fr the park. Breakfast great - scrambled eggs, sausage, fresh waffles, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereal. When busy could use more stations and tables (do have an overflow room but a little ways away. Ordered food through room service -was fast, good and inexpensive ( had a $10 pizza deal at the time). Would absolutely stay there again.

Stayed at the hotel for business in January every year for, at least, the past decade.  The hotel is exceptional with friendly, helpful staff and excellent services.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.  We will continue to return to this hotel year as I don't think the value, service and location can be beaten.  Thank you so much for years of excellent service.

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable, and Close to Disney!
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our whirlwind trip to Disneyland in October. When looking at accommodations I wanted three main things: 1) close proximity to the parks, 2) a suite with separate sleeping area for the kids, and 3) a place that was clean and reasonably updated. The Desert Palms Hotel & Suites delivered on all counts, and had free daily breakfast included as an added bonus (not gourmet, but definitely ample and good enough to get us going in the mornings).   Location is great - right across the street from California Adventure and a well-lit, quick (even with a 3 and 5 year old on foot) walk to the main gates. We spent three nights in a Yuha Suite, and loved the layout with the kids in bunk beds separated from our bed by a wall/window and sliding door. Our 4th floor room

Stayed here while on our trip to Disneyland. The location was very close and on average took about 10 min to walk from the park to the room. We stayed in the suite with the kids bunk beds. Since we were with my inlaws we gave them the queen bed in the other room and my wife and I "slept" on the pull out mattress. The pullout was extremely uncomfortable. You could literary see the waves in it from the gouging support beams. Mid way through our first night I had to seek refuge on the bunk bed which actually wansnt too bad. I would recommend staying here just dont be the one to sleep on the pullout. PS the breakfast is a good meal that will keep you full.

Summary Heading: All the amenities you need & a close walk to the parks.
Summary: This hotel is clean, staffed with friendly people & has an on site restaurant. Great for families with children. Close enough to walk to the parks & the complimentary breakfast has a large variety with plenty of seating. We have stayed at every Disney on site hotel & in comparison, this one is a much better value. You won't get the huge pools & Disney themed rooms that the on site parks offer, but this allows for more spending money at the park.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great location for an adequate family friendly room
Summary: This was our 3rd stay here and the first time in the Kalahari Family Suite.  The room had 2 bedrooms connected by a hallway with two bathrooms in it. It was a bit of an odd layout but it was nice having 4 queen beds and 2 showers.  We had 4 adults and 3 kids there and had adequate privacy and space.  Breakfast was included in the price and featured eggs each morning as well as waffle makers and fruit.  Nothing spectacular but it satisfied the family.   The main complaint is the noise.. windows facing the pool get noise until the pool closes and in the room closest to the hall it was easy to hear all kinds of conversations from passers by.   Stay here if you want a family friendly layout with breakfast and a very easy walk to the park entrances.

We spent two nights and enjoyed our visit.  The hotel staff are polite and go out of their way to answer our questions and to accommodate us.  We changed our mind on the room we wanted and "it was no problem" with a smile from the desk clerk.  We wanted directions and the young lady left and came back with a map.  The breakfast was yummy and we had 2 different breakfasts those two mornings so we had variety.  The breakfast room was warm and had a view.  The location is close enough to walk to Disneyland and restaurants.  There is an indoor pool that kids played in and a fitness room.  Would go again to this hotel on a future trip.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as part of a 10 day Southern California trip. We are a family of 4 and we stayed in the 2 room kid suite.  Pros: Staff very friendly, allowed for early check in and assisted us with locating a lost cell phone from Disneyland. The free breakfast was a great way to start the day, there was plenty of variety and the kids loved the mini waffles. Location was perfect and we easily made the treck to Disneyland twice a day. The 7-11 and ABC  next door were very convenient. The beds were quite comfortable and the linens were nice.  Cons: Noisy, noise from the bathroom fan, AC vents and hallways. There never seemed to be any quiet times. The room layout felt very cramped for a two room suite, with no seating in the main room accept for the bed.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, close to disneyland, friendly staff and comfortable beds what more can you ask for.
Summary: My daughter and I had the opportunity to stay here for a two night getaway. The hotel staff was fabulous.Our room was amazing. The 2 queen beds were extremely comfortable. we had a mini living room,fridge,safe and two tv's. Disneylands fireworks could be viewed from our window.  After a quick check in  and getting settled in our room we decided to go eat. The concierge went out of his way to give us idea's on places to eat. The hotel has a lounge where you can get drinks and food. If you dont want to eat in the lounge you can get it to go or order room service. One evening we decided to go to Downtown Disney ESPN Zone for dinner, it turned out to be a 5-10 minute leisure walk from the hotel. We can't wait to go back. Karen P.

I had really done my research prior to making our reservation. I read some really good reviews on this hotel so we booked it. Our stay was good! It was great that we asked for a room with a view of the Disney fireworks and we got one! It was great and the view was perfect to see the fireworks. Good when you have little ones that are too tired to stay at the Parks and watch from the room. We stayed in room #458 and there was no one above us so the we didnt have any noise above. I have heard about the noise being heard from other rooms bt that was not a problem for us. One annoying thing was the people below us complained 2 times about noise we were apparenly making because they were trying to put their kids to bed at 5:00 pm, and we were simply WALKING around our room! I told the

From our entire family: the stay was terrific!    The first time we stayed with here a few months ago, we were having a horrific day and just needed to get away. The upgrade we got and the wonderful service turned that right around. Right then and there we decided that when we would stay in Anaheim again it would be at this hotel.    Our recent stay was another last minute thing. The only issue was we were given keys to a room that was already occupied. Was just very awkward to walk in and see luggage and food sitting there. BUT, the front desk was super apologetic and upgraded us to a 5th floor room, which my 12-year-old niece LOVED! Being an only child, she had never slept in a bunk bed before and had the best time. You'd think she was at Disneyland.    Unlike other hotels in

stayed at this hotel with the whole family and enjoyed every minute of it. first of all the staff here is very friendly the room was super clean and perfect for my family.The location was great not to far from the Disney parks and lots of good restaurants around it. I recommend this hotel for anyone traveling with the family really nice hotel.

We stayed for 4 nights in early January.  We were travelling with 4 children (6,8,8 and 11) and found the kids suite worked well for us.  The staff were friendly.  The kids enjoyed the pool after a day at Disney.  We walked to Disney in about 10 minutes.  We went for the free breakfast 3 out of the 4 mornings and it was sufficient to get us going for the day.

Summary Heading: Great place to go with very nice people highly recommend this hotel to everybody!
Summary: I love this hotel and I would definitely come back! Everybody treats you great and if you have any complains they take care of it right away! Most places don't pay as much attention but they made everything feel like home.

We stayed here for 9 nights in Sept/Oct on our first trip to the USA.  Nice place, clean, friendly staff and only about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland which was great for the kids.  Breakfasts were awful, not what we would normally eat or be used to staying in a hotel and we usually just ate elsewhere (nearby IHOP).  Pool was good for an afternoon swim for the kids.  Some issues with the phone being faulty and woke us up at 5am one morning.  We disconnected it, but was difficult to keep in contact with other family members saying on other floors.  The phone never got fixed but no big deal.  Would definately stay here again.

The staff, location, and room where excellent.The staff, location, and room where excellent. The staff, location, and room where excellent.The staff, location, and room where excellent. The staff, location, and room where excellent.The staff, location, and room where excellent.  John R.

Good: Breakfast was included.  They always have a waffle station, oatmeal, frosted flakes, fruit loops, milk, coffee, tea, water , OJ, grapefruit juice, whole apples and oranges.  They alternate with either scrambled eggs, sausage potatoe wedges OR scrambled egss with diced ham, biscuits and gravy.  The hotel is within walking distance of Disney.  There is a convenience store right next door.  Rooms clean and comfy.  The suite included a full sized fridge, microwave and stove. Bad:  It was a bit cold.  I turned on the heater.  The heater started smoking and smelling really bad.  The smoke alarm went off.  Called maintenance - they said that since the heaters rarely get used it was common.  Ok... maybe the cleaning people could turn it on for a minute or two to avoid this in the

Dear Sir/Madam,     Thank you for your interest in how our stay was with your hotel.  This was our first time staying at the Desert Palm Hotel.  Our stay was plesant and the hotel is clean and well appointed.  I would recomend your hotel to friends and family.  We look forward to our next stay at the Desrt Palm.  Thank you and happy holidays!!!

We all enjoyed our stay at Desert Palms Hotel.  It would have been nice to have more seating in the two-bedroom suite, though the two bathrooms worked out great!  And, the proximity to Disneyland is excellent!  We also ate at the restaurant, which was quite good.  We just wish we had more time to enjoy some of the amenities.

We had a wonderful stay…your staff worked overtime to be sure we had everything we needed.  The rooms were comfortable and clean…the only draw back was the thin ceilings, we had very noisy stompers upstairs.  The children loved the pool, and your breakfasts were very enjoyable and had a lot of variety to choose from.  We would definitely consider staying with you again.  Thank you

We stayed at the Desert Palms in a Yuha Kids Suite from December 31, 2012 to January 6, 2013.  Hotel check in was quick and painless.  Room was as described in photos/text seen on their website; clean and tidy.  Nice to have a sliding door to seperate the kids's area from the adult area.  Two sinks (one inside the bathroom and one outside) were very handy.  Beds were OK for comfort, but the pillows are really terrible.  Sheets were OK; towels were not very fluffy and kind of scratchy.  We had a microwave and a fairly large fridge in the room (the fridge was kinda noisy, but it seemed to work well).  The in-room safe was on a high shelf in the closet - I could hardly reach it and had to get my son to reach it for me.  For a $1.00 a day, I should be able to reach the safe myself.

Summary Heading: A great way to start the New Year!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights the first week of January.  We arrived earlier than the check-in time, but the staff at the front desk were very friendly and said our room was ready.  We had the kids suite with the bunk beds, and though a little smaller than it looks in the pictures, it worked out great for my 2 girls aged 11 and 15.  They loved having their own space and tv, and we liked how they could keep all of their "mess" contained in their own space.  Our room was very quiet, and we were able to see the fireworks from the small step-out outside our window. The complimentary breakfast was great.  Good selection for everyone, and the staff made sure everything was kept well supplied.  Though the dining area would fill up, they opened up the adjacent ballrooms and

Summary Heading: Outdated rooms are forgiven by wonderful staff and location
Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to start our month-long USA holiday. After a 14-hour flight from Australia, the staff at the front desk were very accommodating in letting us check into our room early. They also helped us book our Disneyland tickets and were generally friendly throughout our stay. The location is great and about a 10-minute walk from Disney. It’s not the best location (i.e. right across the road from Disneyland) but it’s certainly not the worst. The only downfall is that the rooms are very outdated and tired looking. However we were at Disneyland all day so it didn't matter too much.   Desert Palms Hotel is a good choice if you want a short walking distance to the park and friendly service. I paid less than $150 per night, so the value for money

My family and I visit Disneyland often and we always stay at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites.  The location to the park is Ideal as we can walk to the park from the hotel.  The hotel is very nice , clean and we feel safe there.  The hotel also offers a continental breakfast which is Fantastic and Yummy!!  I highly recommend this hotel to any and all.

Summary Heading: The worst breakfast I have ever had!!!!!!
Summary: I am staying at the Desert Palms as part of a world trip. I am travelling as part of family group of 6. We are staying here for a week. The first breakfast was the last breakfast they served the breakfast on plastic plates and plastic knifes and forks and foam cups. And as for the "scramble eggs" which look as if it was cooked and left in the warmer all night. It look great on the website but I could see nothing that had any resemble to the pictures. I would not recommend this to any body.

This is a very nice hotel, really nice rooms that are very clean, ( good job housekeeping). Excellent continental breakfast, the best I've ever had at any hotel. Staff is very nice and friendly.. This will be our third year back at this hotel of choice! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice comfortable experience.. I'm a very hard one to please and this hotel exceeds all expectations:) thanks desert palm staff for making the stays enjoyable!

My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed for 3 nights.  A friendly gentleman check us in and gave us a parking permit.  There is ground parking as well as underground parking. We stayed on the 2nd floor in a 2 queen room. It was clean, overlooked the carpark (so it was a bit noisy at times).  A couple minor complaints: there were only 3 shallow drawers to put our clothes in so our family didn't have enough space to completely unpack; but they did have a lot of hangers in the closet so we did utilize that space, too.  The other minor thing was that the coffee provided was enough to make one cup of coffee, but this was offset by the fact that they offer coffee in the lobby all day and night.  There was a microwave and refrigerator in good working condition.  The hair dryer was

If you're on a budget, this hotel will work for you.  The staff is friendly and accommodating...we asked for our room to be located in the back so we could see the fireworks from our balcony as suggestion by other reviews here on Trip Advisor which they did, however, there isn't a balcony..only a step-out.  The overall impression of the hotel is very dated and worn-out.  Would not stay there again.

Great Hotel to stay for our family of 5 (kids ages 8,14,16). We had a room (think called sahara suite) with queen bed Tv bathroom and door to kids room with bunks, pull out sofa and another TV - great to have seperate room of sorts.  Hotel a tad tried but very clean.  All staff very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect.  A Seven11 and ABC store next door which was perfect for getting supplies of bottled water and stuff  and only a 10 min (feels like5) walk to Disneyland - not far at all.We cant believe people complain its to far to walk - they must be lazy!!  Loads of restaurants to choose from all located close .Breakfast included each morning which was good. We would definitely come back and stay here and recommend it.

Summary Heading: Good Location to get to Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel is located at a reasonable walking distance (10-15 mins) to disneyland. Stayed here with my family of 3 and enjoyed the casual ambience. The hotel staffs were very helpful and courteous. The hotel provides free american breakfast which you should have before you take that walk to disneyland. If you drive, this hotel provides free parking. There is also a small outdoor pool that we didnt really use because it was often crowded. Next to the hotel, you can find a convenient store that you can stock up your daily necessities and snacks. The best thing I like about this hotel is that it is well suited for families and you can find eating places nearby. We enjoyed our stay here.

We are a family of 6 so finding a place to stay is difficult. This place was way above our expectations! From the phone call to make our reservation, to the minute we checked out, the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is just steps from the Disney Parks, which made it convenient and saved us money on parking. The room was super clean and very spacious. There was a delicious hot breakfast included, with plenty of choices for our picky kids. I have told all my friends and family about this place and will definitely be staying there again soon!

On the exterior this hotel looks wonderful, but if you stay for even one night you'll find that the staff are very unfriendly and blunt. The free breakfast sounds like a great deal but the breakfast room is dirty and so cramped you wonder whether or not it's your arm grabbing your food or the person's behind you (not to mention the food is all reconstituted from powder form). If you have any kind of technological needs AVOID this place like the plague. I've never in my life been to a hotel (or anywhere for that matter) that had a slower Wi-Fi connection than this hotel. In order to remedy this problem I asked for a Cat-5 cable which the staff promptly told me they didn't have any. Shortly after this conversation, on the way back to my room I saw an employee walking down the

I cannot give an "excellent" because I don't feel I was really there for long enough (just long enough to sleep). The room was very clean and had a good set up, but as with many hotels, it was easy to hear the neighbors. The staff was amazingly friendly. We didn't eat breakfast because the beds were just too comfy and we could not wake up :) I would stay here again.

We really enjoyed our stay. The room was lovely. We didn't get to use other facilities, like the pool and gym, because we were at Disneyland full time. But would have liked to. The breakfast was great - lots of choice, excellent value. We would recommend the hotel to anyone coming to Disneyland. It is less than 10 minutes walk from the front entrance on the same side of the street. Also, there's a 7/11 right next door so you can buy food there for lunches, etc.  The hotel was very kind with parking. We arrived early on our check-in day and they allowed us to park in their carpark and go to Disneyland. We didn't actually check in until we got back from Disneyland after 9pm. The same thing on check-out day. We were allowed to leave the car there all day and pick it up after 9pm

My family and I stayed here last year (Dec 2011) and had a pleasant enough stay to warrant a second stay this year. Last year we stayed in a Sahara Suite with the kitchenette and the room was clean and comfortable.  Staff was always friendly and our only comment was that the hallways were always uncomfortably warm. The breakfast provided was a great start to the day and the complimentary parking was a very nice perk. It is about a 10-15min walk which we didn't feel was an issue.  Jump to 2012 and we just returned from our trip two days ago. I now have a baby in addition to my toddler so my circumstances have changed a bit. This time we stay in the Kalahari suite. The first night was no fun.  Granted my kids are young so they go to bed very early and I understand that most people

We stayed for four nights during our visit to Disneyland.  It was very convenient, about a 10 minute walk to the entrance. We were a family of five kids and four adults.  The two rooms we reserved was perfect.  Each room had two queen beds and a step down suite with a convertible queen size sofa.  The room also had two LCD flat screen TV's. Breakfast is also included.  The first morning I was very disappointed in the breakfast, it was inedible.  The following three mornings were much better.

This was a business trip and the location was close to the Anaheim Convention Center.  Not a bad walk, but not real close either. We didn't rent a car and were disappointed that there weren't more restaurants in the walkable area.  T  he rooms were clean, but very dated.  If this place was rennovated it could be real nice.   I didn't eat breakfast, but a co-worker said it was average, lots of kids and always full.  They need to move the main food further back in the room.  It causes congestion in the hallway entry area.    There was one gentleman at the front desk on several of the evenings we were there that was very helpful and personable.  Too bad they all weren't.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, OK for price we paid.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 12 nights in a kids suite.  The room was a little smaller than the photos show, nevertheless, we were really only there to sleep and base ourselves whilst we explored Southern California and Disneyland.  It was not too far for us to walk to Disneyland, we actually enjoyed it.  It would be too far if you had small kids unless you had a stroller or pram.  Throughout the stay, our door handle, both inside and outside fell off and needed to be fixed.  It was fixed quickly, but still I do not think this should have happened at all. Pros: Complimentary parking and breakfast. Location.  Cost.  Excellent shower temperature and pressure, beds were very comfortable. Cons: Walls very thin and towels so thin that they were see through.   After reading some

Summary Heading: Good Quality and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We spent 2 nights here and found the quality of the accommodation was good and the closeness to Disneyland and some decent restaurants was great. The included breakfast wasn't great, but it didn't detract from our stay. Would stay again on the next trip.

So this isn't The Ritz, but for the money, it is a great place for families on a budget. We were a party of 8 - two of us (older folks) in a double queen room and a family of 6 in room 460, a room with 2 queens and a sort-of separate space (divided by a curtain) with a sleeper sofa. Plenty of room for a wild bunch of kids - that is why grandpa & grandma opted for a separate room. The rooms were older, but clean and I really inspected the place. The beds were fine, but you may want to ask for additional blankets if you get cold at night and I always bring my own pillow no matter where I stay. The rooms were very quiet. Again, a good value for the money.  The free breakfast was exactly what you would expect, waffle stations, fruit, eggs, donuts, cereal and the staff was always

We are a family of 4 and can really recommend this hotel.  Very close to Disney, 15 min walk.  Free parking, great location.  The rooms were a great size and or a high standard for the money.  The family room was awesome with 2 TV's.  The free breakfast was great.  Offered excellent value for money.  The only negative was our fridge was quite noisy in the middle of the night, which I'm sure is fixed by now.  free Wi-fi :).

Our stay at the Desert Plams was great!  Our kids had a fantastic time and loved the breakfast (we did to, but they are harder to please).  We especially liked having the 2 TV's in our suite (that way the kids and dad did not fight over what channel to watch). We enjoyed the walk to and from Disneyland, it was really nice not haveing to take the shuttle.  Thanks for making our hotel stay wonderful.  Staying in a nice, clean place makes for a better vacation.

Summary Heading: F-A-B-U-L-O-U-S Hotel! Clean, Relaxing and Fun
Summary: This is a fabulous hotel! We have stayed in several area hotels for Disneyland, and this has by far been the best! This was our first year staying at the Desert Palms Hotel during the first of December (we stayed 11 days), and we will be back next year. From the very moment that you walk through the door, you are greeted by welcoming and caring staff and a beautiful foyer. Check-in was a breeze. We stayed on the 4th floor in the deluxe suite. The interior hallways were a plus. We were greeted by a cute little elephant constructed of washcloths on the bed! The room was fresh, clean and inviting. All looks recently renovated. The ART shuttle stops right outside of the hotel, but you can save a boat load of money by just taking a short 10 minute walk to the park just down the

The Desert Palms was a great place for our family to stay. We had one suite and one regular room and we were happy with both rooms. The staff were great and the complimentary breakfast was very good. Within very short walking distance to Disneyland we would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, father walk from Disneyland that we thought it would be
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in the condo suite with our 2 kids ages 5 and 9. It had 2 queen beds and it was nice to shut the door to the living room for privacy for them or us, if anyone wanted extra sleep. It was great to have a fridge, stove, and microwave. Also, the vanity was separate from the shower/toilet, which is good for getting ready in the morning. We ate at the buffet breakfast 3 out 5 mornings, and the kids enjoyed it. We would also stop next door at 7-11 before going to Disneyland and pack our backpack with bottled water and snacks, very convenient. My husband and kids used the pool once or twice too. The only real complaint I have is that with kids it is about a +/-10 minute walk to Disneyland. In the morning, not a problem. But after a long day, more so.
Manager Response: Dear NoCali-momof2,  Thank you for your wonderful review of Desert Palms Hotel. I am glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay in our Sahara Condo Suite.   I wanted to inform you that the hotel does offer a shuttle to Disneyland and am very sorry that this was not relayed to you properly at check-in. The Anaheim Resort Transportation Shuttle picks up at the 7-11, right next door to our hotel every 20 minutes. Desert Palms Hotel is on Route 9 and All-Day shuttle passes can be purchased at the Front Desk.  With this in mind, we hope to see you and your family again next time you are in Anaheim!  Fred Brown, General Manger Desert Palms Hotel I& Suites

Summary: Need a Hotel Desert Palms is the place to stay! My family and I  were very happy with the staff and rooms. They also offer  complimentary breakfast which is wonderful. When we go to Disneyland we stay at Desert Palms :)    Erik

We stayed in the Kids' Suite. The room was much smaller than I anticipated. It was very narrow. This room is designed for up to six guests with a king bed in one room and a sofa bed and bunk beds in the other room. There were just four of us - two teens. I can not imagine how six would be able to share this space. That being said, the staff was very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was nice. Considering the age of the hotel, the room was clean. The walk is two long blocks from Disney and very manageable. However, after walking all day at the parks, it would have been nice to have a shuttle as an option. Next trip we will stay a bit closer or at a place that offers a shuttle service.

This is the 7th year I have stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and once again, it was a great experience. The hotel is clean and they offer a hot breakfast each morning from 7-10am. The hotel is located within walking distance of Disneyland which is very convenient.

Summary Heading: My 8 yr old Daughter's Favorite Hotel
Summary: We had a GREAT stay at the Desert Palms Hotel.  We’ve stayed here every year for to celebrate my daughter’s birthday.  We had the best room with a view of the fireworks at Disneyland.  This year, they surprised my daughter with a gift bag filled with special treats.  She was so happy!!!  She said it is her favorite hotel.  Even though it was raining, we still had a great time in the pool and jacuzzi since it is kind of protected by the surrounding walls.  The front desk staff (especially Jenny) were just amazing.  The housekeeping staff and ladies that helped at breakfast were also very good. My kids just love making waffles and being able to get their own juice.  Plus, it saved us a lot of time and money every morning to just go upstairs for a nice, healthy and hot breakfast.

Good stay from the minute we arrived - friendly staff on reception, always good when coming from a long flight. We stayed in a two bed/two bath suite which was spotlessly clean. Complimentary breakfast was very good, good hot food choices and the cook-your-own waffles a nice touch! Would recommend.

Summary Heading: Location is good, but that's about it.
Summary: Recently, we spent 8 nights at this advertised boutique hotel near Disneyland.  Don't be fooled by the pictures, the beauty ends where the elevator starts (only the lobby is nice).  We were given an upgrade from a king room to a 2-queen room with a kitchen.  The room was clean, but not comfortable.  The sofa was hard, the beds were even harder.  Even the pillows were hard.  The fan in the bathroom sounds as though a jet engine is taking off, and the furniture is practically falling apart.  The breakfast buffet was completed disgusting.  They don't put out anything healthy at all, unless you consider canned fruit healthy.  The front desk staff was nice and did their best to make us comfortable.  This is a true testament to why I never pre-pay hotel stays.  Lesson learned.  The

It is within a 10 min walk to Disneyland, 7-11 and ABC mart next door for snacks and water, subway, Chinese and Mexican take out across the road. Convenience plus! We (husband, me and 2 teens -17 and 19) stayed 3 nights in a Sahara suite. The sofa bed was not too comfortable but I haven't come across one that is. The free breakfast was appreciated, not the fanciest but toast and coffee normally does me. There were waffles, cereals, scrambled eggs (could be powdered), breakfast sausage patties and fruits as well. The time we were there, the hotel was full of excited kids and excited kids tend to be noisy! It is a Disneyland hotel after all. The staff were super friendly and we asked for and received an early check-in (12 noon) as we had just arrived from Sydney that morning. We

So this isn't The Ritz, but for the money, it is a great place for families on a budget.  We were a party of 8 - two of us (older folks) in a double queen room and a family of 6 in room 460, a room with 2 queens and a sort-of separate space (divided by a curtain) with a sleeper sofa.  Plenty of room for a wild bunch of kids - that is why grandpa & grandma opted for a separate room.  The rooms were older, but clean and I really inspected the place.  The beds were fine, but you may want to ask for additional blankets if you get cold at night and I always bring my own pillow no matter where I stay.  The rooms were very quiet.  Again, a good value for the money.  The free breakfast was exactly what you would expect, waffle stations, fruit, eggs, donuts, cereal and the staff was

This Hotel is decent-ish, but the beds are hard, hard, hard. We chose a "Kids Suite", good thing, I'll be sleeping with my 4yr old tonight, his bed is softer than mine. The staff is excellent, but the beds and hairy towels are hard to miss.

Summary Heading: Desert Palms Hotel is a good place to stay
Summary: The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Disney, CA adventure and down town disney.  We enjoy our stay very much.  The hotel was clean and the beds comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was excellent.  The only suggestion we had is to start the breakfast buffet at 6:30 am instead of 7.  If you choose this hotel you will be satisfy.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family
Summary: The Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was Outstanding... I am one of those travelers that is always worried about the accommodations whenever I travel. The Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was beyond my expectations. From the moment we arrived at the front desk at about 6:30p, the staff greeted us with friendly smiles and helped us get situated in 3 different rooms as there was 17 of us traveling together. All three (3) of our rooms were clean, looked great, and were all on the 3rd flr. Not sure who our maid was in room 345 on Nov 2 - Nov 7, but Thank you for making sure our room was clean everyday we returned to our room late in the evening from Disneyland. We asked for an extra blanket and pillow and by the time we came back to our room it was already there.  I read some other reviews

Just left the Desert Palms after a one week stay while visiting Disneyland.  Chose this hotel because of great price we got and rank on trip advisor.  This was our fourth trip to Disneyland from our home of Canada.  We have found that all the reasonably priced hotels within walking distance are nothing to get excited about and this hotel is the same. Great that it is right next to 7-11 as it was a convenient place to pick up a drink or snack before or after the park.  Walk was about 10-15 minutes to park entrance - liked this end of the strip of hotels on Harbour Blvd better than the end closer to I-5 as it made it more convenient to walk to restaurants at Anaheim Garden Walk and back to hotel at the end of the day.  Hotel was clean enough but very basic - again expected because

This was our first tme staying at the Desert Palms but would not hesitate to recommend it to family and friends! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the accomodations were better than other hotels we have stayed at in the past! It is a little bit of a walk to the Disney main gate but worth every step :) I would like to offer a special thank you to the staff that looked after the breakfast crowd as they do a fabulous job with very little thanks from the guest.  Stew and Laurie Bellamy

For location The Desert Palms ticks all of the boxes. It's an easy walk to the Disneyland Parks.   The train station, bus stops and restaurants are all within easy reach. There is a 7/11 and ABC Stores right next door.   The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room wasn't large but it was comfortable.  Unfortunately that's where it ends.   We have been travelers for 20 years. After the 2nd night of zero sleep because of the excessive noise we contemplated checking out. A week later I'm still shell shocked by the sound of the blasted doors clanking shut as far away as 10 rooms down the hall. We have never had this happen before traveling all over Malaysia, the Pacific Islands, Thailand and South East Asia.   The Hotel did publish a policy of quiet time after 9pm.   We

Fantastic everything! Loved our stay here (: everything was perfect, location was perfect, no complaints whatsoever. I only wish we had more time to stay. We only had time to stay one night but I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else. Definitely the perfect place to stay!

We usually go ever year to Disneyland. This was our 8th year staying in this hotel, and always wonderful and excellent customer service, food and the rooms are clean and covered with new items like nice tvs, new carpet and everything else. The stuff helps you asap. This is a honestly experience off a wonderful visit.

Summary Heading: Amazing hospitality and service for fair prices
Summary: After a horrible two days at the Days Inn down the street I called 1800hotels and was referred to the Desert Palms Hotel. We were greeted by Nevine who was awesome letting us check in early and giving us an upgrade so we had more than enough space for our triplet girls. The staff was so gracious, the room beautiful, and the breakfast was amazing.  Just a short walk from Disneyland, this is now the only place we will stay. We recommend this hotel 100x over!!!

Summary Heading: Good choice for the Convention Center
Summary: I generally find convention hotels expensive and bland, and so look for other hotels within walking distance. I was very pleased with the Desert Palms. I arrived early and my designated room was not ready. I was shown a smaller room which I declined and offered to wait. I was upgraded to a Borrego Suite which was great. The fridge was large and microwave convenient.The room was spotless and I did not experience any of the noise other reviewers experienced. I needed to ship some boxes by FedEx and the receptionist offered me a cardboard box and tape without asking! It is an easy 10-15 walk to the Convention Center and the adjacent Hilton and Marriott Hotels where many meetings are held. It is also a short walk to downtown Disney or GardenWalk for shopping. There are no

Summary Heading: Comfortable, Quiet and Easy trip to Disneyland by foot or shuttle
Summary: We stayed in Borrego Suite and really enjoyed the set up of the room as well as the quiet in spite of the busy street next to us.   It was a 10-15 min walk to Disney or an easy shuttle trip.  Tip if you take the shuttle...pick it up across the street in front of the Garden Shopping Center instead of at the stop outside the door... The Garden Shopping center is the last stop before Disneyland so you won't have to ride the full loop.  Desert Palms is the first stop (on Anaheim Resort Transit) after Disneyland making the shuttle home a nice quick ride.   Another tip: buy the unlimited use ART pass to allow for easy on/off and easy midday breaks if desired.

Stayed for two nights- was able to check in early because my room was available.  Parking was free and there was tons of it, even if we returned late back to the hotel. Had no issues with Wi-Fi (worked great). We had two queen beds and a little living room area. Loved that the room had a fridge and microwave.  Lobby has a fun little arcade.  Breakfast was convenient - only complaint is that the OJ was extremely sweet (did not taste like real OJ).  The breakfast room was very nice though and the waffles were delicious.  They also had a really nice deck where you could eat outside. Perfect location, very close to downtown disney/disneyland. Would definitely stay there again.

Great place to stay, staff was great and informative. A ten minute walk to Disneyland or hop on the ART. Breakfast was great. Pool and hot tub were good. Thanks Nevine for you r help. Lobby and rooms were clean and the room service ( maids) were kind. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Like A bottle Of Fine Wine.
Summary: My family and i have just completed our twenty fourth year at this lovely hotel. There are many reasons we have stayed at this hotel. Location,walking distance to Disneyland,Convention Center,Restaurants.Transportation, right out your front door,public transit,and tour buses.Car rentals right  next door.Shopping centers South Coast plaza,Main Mall,Brea Mall, just to name a few.If your choice is to relax, then take in the pool you can order food and refreshments from the sand box, this is also a great place to eat,or you can have it delivered to your room. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and comfortable. Elevators are fast and plenty of FREE parking. And last but not least the staff.They are always so friendly and always so accommodating.FIVE STAR.

we have stayed here on two differentholidays with our kids. The hotel is a short walk yo disneyland. The hotel offers a great breakfast,located on the top floor where you can eat outside and enjoy the great view. Their is also a pup in the hotel.   The rooms are clean and comtorable. very enjoyable.

As a mom you want you family vacation to be great, safe and reasonably priced. This hotel made our trip just that! We had a fabulous experience there. The staff was amazing. Our room was spacious and clean! We stayed in the Borrego suite. We had plenty of room for our family to spread out a bit and relax after a day at Disney. Our boys loved the bunk beds! The location was fabulous and very close to Disneyland.  So close we were able to walk back for lunch and a rest in our room. We felt safe walking to and from the park even at night. The free breakfast is very yummy and has a bit of everything for everybody. No question we are going back to Desert Palms next time!

Summary Heading: Meet my expectation for the price with free parking, breakfast, walking distance to Disneyland.
Summary: Look for many hotel online and want a hotel with free parking and walking distance to Disneyland without having to pay $25 for parking at Disney or shuttle service which other hotel charge $4 per adult and $1 per child. Also wanted a hotel with free breakfast and Wifi. Having a 2 years old baby and knowing she need a nap from 2:30pm to 5:00pm, I book 2 night. We drove there from San Diego after my work and got there at 10:00pm Thursday. Plan to sleep early so we can go to the park early in the morning after a free breakfast. So when we first came in the room, I was satisfied. Room was average clean, white bed sheet, 2 queen beds and the sofa bed was separated with a small kitchen and dining table with 4 chairs. Great for the price. This place is not like the Hyatt with high end

I have stayed here on two separate occasions with family.  The location is excellent, within walking distance from Disneyland.  It is also situated amongst many restaurants and shops, with a fabulous 7 Eleven next door for all supplies. In addition, the area is very safe and one can happily walk around late in the evening, alongside all the families with children. The rooms are also large and well maintained and the free breakfast is good value. I received great assistance from the front desk when organising day tours and shuttle buses. The lovely receptionist at check-in also let us into our rooms quite early in the day.

Last May (2012) was the 2nd time we have stayed at the Desert Palms. The only complaint I have for this last trip was that they changed the pizza place on your room key, last time we stayed (Oct 2009) It was the bar downstairs and it was great food, this time it was Asians who owned an Italian restaraunt, they brought our BURNED pizza and garlic bread and refused to refund our money I had already paid over the phone. Horrible. We also stayed in a "suite" which was 2 normal rooms with a connecting door, they charged an arm and a leg for that which I think is ridiculous. It was on the bottom floor facing Disney, but since there was a huge brick wall we couldnt see any fireworks from our room. I was happy to see it had been remodeled since our previous visit, AC worked great, room

Stayed here 4 nights...with a family of 6... A little squeezy but very clean and comfy beds... A little dated in look....King,bunk and double pull out sofa...Bathrooms clean...has a safe in the cupboard, hairdryer and iron/board....Walking distance to Disneyland about 10mins....resturaunts close buy....cheesecake factory..yummy....buffet breakfast here was average..if your an Aussie I suggest buy some cereal and take it with you...all looks okay but not what us Aussies are used to for brekie!!! Sugar coated donuts...waffles..very sweet bread...very sugary juice...and the coffee is def not like ours at home! All staff are polite and helpful...sand box resturaunt here is average...head out you will get a lot nicer food....pool and spa  is good open until 10pm at night.....there's

We stayed in a Yahu suite for 4 nights. Was happy with the hotel. Easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland, friendly staff and clean room. Only drawback was thin walls. This could be a problem if you end up with loud neighbors or are a light sleeper.    Kids loved the bunkbeds and having their own tv and couch. The room easily fit our family of 6 and a small stroller. Microwave, AC and fridge were all in working order. Room showed some normal wear but was clean.  The hot breakfast was a big bonus with this hotel. It included many options including eggs, sausage and waffles. It was busy every morning but the staff really works hard to keep the food full and the tables clean.   Pool is small but clean and is stocked with towels. On-site restuarant had good pizza. Convenience store next

The hotel was very nice. About a 10 minute walk to disneyland. Breakfast was included and a pretty good selection. Parking was also included and the staff were very friendly. We will likely stay here again on our next visit.

Dear Kristen Brown  and the entire Desert Palms Hotel Team   our stay was great in the hotel , we enjoy and want to thank all hotel team becuase they make our vication magic.   the location is in the center of active place, very close to disyney park, close to 7-11 supermarkt, close to many resterant. the room was large , clean, and beds are comferet . the breakfast is in the 5th floor , there are open and close are to enjoy different weather, the food varieties are enough for the family.  best regared   mulhim

Hotel was walkiing distance to the parks.   Breakfast was good.   Rooms were clean.   Housekeeping was excellent.   The front desk was excellent.   We were a little disappointed that the day after we got there the pool was closed for maintenance and by the time it did open, it was cold and we were leaving.  So the kids really only got one good swim day during our 6 night stay.  It would have been good to know before we booked that the pool was going to be closed.   The rooms were a little noisy with road noise and showers above. It was nice that there was a 7-11 right next to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Our favorite Neighbor Hotel for Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is our favorite place to stay when not staying at a resort hotel. The breakfast is hot and the Kids love it!  They are able to feed a great amount of people without the guest feeling overwhelmed.  There always seems to be plenty food.  The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly.  We always walk to and from the park but this trip I did notice a bus stop just in front from the park. The rates are great and the hotel is great.  All-in-all it is a great value for us.  We really enjoy the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites in Anaheim, CA

Summary Heading: Great family hotel and walking distance to the Disneyland Park
Summary: We just booked our third stay with this hotel because it is has a lot of great perks that other hotels can't match.  They have free parking, wonderful breakfast buffet, free Wi-Fi and is a very short walk from the entrance to Disneyland.  Kids enjoyed the pool to cool off and take a break each day from the Disneyland parks.

The proximity to Disneyland and the staff were the best things about this hotel. The AC does not work properly, the walls are very thin and you can hear the people above walking around. The fridge and microwave did not work, nor did the AC in the gym. If distance to the park is your priority this is a good place. Personally, I'd have rather stayed down the street and taken the shuttle to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms for 8 nights just before Halloween on a family trip to Disneyland and Legoland. The hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland, turn the corner and walk towards the park gates. The daily breakfast is a great value, make your own waffles and a selection of other hot foods that varied by day. A couple of days we hit the breakfast at the wrong time and had to wait for space to clear out but the wait wasn't long.  We selected a kids suite allowing our boys to stay in a little room with bunk beds, a couch, and their own TV.  That allowed us to watch something other than Disney Channel while they crashed after a long day of walking around the park.   On one side of the hotel you have access to a 7-11 and on the other side is Alamo car rental. That

We stayed five nights in this hotel and the Free Wi-fi throughout the entire Hotel was a real draw card for us travelling over from New Zealand.  It allowed us to keep in touch with family and friends back home.  The Free Buffet Breakfast was also a bonus.  We found the front desk Staff very helpful and would highly recommend this Hotel and it's location close to Disneyland and a 7-11 right next door as well as bus stops restaurants and so on.  Would definitely stay again if given the chance.

Second time staying here because of very good experience last year.  We stayed in a Yuha suite this time instead of the Borrego.  We liked the Yuha better because of the bunk beds and seperate area but it was a little less roomy than the Borrego.  The walk to the main gates or Downtown Disney is about the same and very quick.  Unless I can afford one of the resort hotels someday, we will definately always stay here.

Summary Heading: Okay if you get the right room.
Summary: The good:  the breakfast is nice, it has a large eating area and variety.  They have a make your own waffle station which surprised me since that left a lot of hot waffle irons around young children.  But no accidents when I was there.  The bad:  Communication.  The reservations I made did not match the room I was given. The hotel tried to give us a tiny room on the first floor directly in front of the door to the pool. When I tried to change the rooms they said they could accomodate but it would take a 1/2 hour.  After 45 minutes we got into our room.  It doesn't sound like a lot but I was planning on changing into our halloween costumes at the hotel for the Mickey's Halloween party and now we were missing the opening time.  The room they gave us was nice, large suite.  It was

We stayed at this hotel last week with family. Three adults in one twin room (grandparents) and Mum Dad and 8 yr old in a suite. The suite had a king size bed and bunks and a TV in an adjoining room. Breakfast was included in the tariff. Nothing was too much trouble to the staff. they helped with everything, booking Disneyland tickets and trips. The $5 suttle to Disney is great, easy and efficient. Good restaurants nearby and a seven eleven store next door for snacks. Rooms had microwave, fridge and coffee maker. We loved it.

My adult daughter and I come to Disneyland frequently and have stayed at many different hotels.  We cannot say enough nice things about our stay at this hotel.  Location, of course, is terrific ... walking distance to the park, to great restaurants and convenience stores.  The staff at the hotel, especially Nevine, were terrific and our room was more than we expected.  We realize that most places are very family friendly because of Disneyland, but the hotel was quiet and clean.  Drinks at the bar were terrific and, altho we didn't eat here, the food looked so good I wouldn't hesitate to do so on the next trip.  The free breakfast had lots of choices ... albeit the same every day and could benefit from a few more fruit choices.  The staff there tho were very good and very

Summary Heading: Excellent stay especially so close to Disneyland
Summary: The staff were especially helpful to our family.The complimentary breakfast was great every morning of the 6 we were there. The room we had was perfect for our needs. We were even able to watch fireworks from Disneyland on the balcony of our room, much to the surprise of our 4 yr old son. We have stayed here multiple times & enjoy coming back. Nevine must be mentioned as she went out of her way to help us when we needed it, thanks for all your help.

Summary Heading: Wonderful to stay whilst at Disneyland
Summary: First visit as a family to Disneyland, so wanted something comfortable, breakfast included and walking distance to the Disney Parks.  Booked the Bortega Suite, which was fantastic and suited our needs wonderfully.  Rooms were clean, beds very comfortable.  Bathroom / shower very good.  Pool was good, but in late September in shade in the afternoon.  My only criticism (but only small) is the breakfast.  Same every day but at least there was coffee and juice.  Fresh fruit and cereals.  Unfortunately the eggs were terrible (substitute eggs).  Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, because of the rooms and more importantly the location, 7-11 and convenience store next door.  Restaurants down the road and within walking distance to Disneyland.  You could catch the ART if

Our stay at your hotel was way MORE than what we bargained for. The hotel is clean and ALL the staff were very professional and nice. We even got to speak with Annabel who is the housecleaning personnel. Annabel was very nice and helpful and our 4 year old son thought she was the coolest (in which she is). :) The hotel restaurant was good to and the bartender Russ was also very awesome and great company while enjoying our drinks. Not many bartenders can make a Long Island with no coke taste like a hard lemonade and he definitely did the drink justice.   Thank you again for the awesome stay and free upgrade. We truly appreciate you guys making our stay as awesome as ever!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Family Reunion to Disneyland Resort
Summary: We had a wonderful stay.  We booked four rooms as we took our three adult sons and their wives and/or finance's;' and, our two grandchildren.  Everyone enjoyed their room and the wonderful breakfast.  After a long day at the theme parks it was really great to come back to a wonderful hotel room.  We enjoyed being located to restaurants in the area.    With this being our second annual family trip, everyone said we should come back here again.

Summary Heading: Great Staff and convenient to both the Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: I came from Minnesota for a national conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I am not a regular to California but my stay at the Desert Palms was pleasant and enjoyable.  The rooms were comfortable and it was very convenient to both the Convention Center and Disneyland – where I spent my entire five day stay.   While I did not bring my five children, I found the Hotel to be very family friendly.    The breakfast was quick and good.  I did want to mention the staff who work in the breakfast room.  They are very quick at cleaning up and keeping everything well stocked.   It seemed to be crazy and wild at times with all of the small children running around and I witnessed one of the staff persons (a male) stop a very small child from getting hurt in the back kitchen.  A very

We were rarely at the hotel, but when we were it was pretty nice. Decent beds after a long day at Disney, clean, and the staff was courteous. Be prepared to walk 10 minutes to Disney which is no biggie, however, after 12 hours a day of walking, it's no fun going back especially with crabby tired kids. You can purchase tickets at the hotel for a shuttle back, but it ends up costing close to twenty bucks (cant remember). We just sucked it up and walked back most nights, and it doesn't take that long. Other than that, it was a nice hotel, decent price. I wasn't wowed by the hotel, but like I said we weren't there for the hotel, just a place to sleep. They have free breakfast which saves money. All in all, if the price was low again next time we go, I'd definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Family of six stayed in the Yuha Suite
Summary: We go to disneyland about every two to three years.  Have stayed in four different hotels over the last ten years.  The Desert palms hotel was good, not great.  The price was fair for our stay (everything is overpriced in Anaheim, but what do you expect)  Overall it was a good stay, no bells and whistles, but very comfortable and decent.    The Good-  Location was really nice for a walk to the parks.  Free parking was nice.  The room we stayed in was completely quiet even though the hotel was pretty full for the entire week we were there.  We stayed in a yuha suite at the end of the hallway.  Most other hotels we have stayed in have been noisier than this one.  Beds were comfortable with the exception of the hide a bed.  Employees were nice.  The breakfast was free.  One evening

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at Disneyland!!
Summary: We go to disneyland twice a year and we always try a different hotel each time! We love this hotel. We had the kid suite, which was wonderful. The bunk beds were very nice, the sofa couch was ok. My 9 y o, liked the couch, but for an adult it would not be very comfortable. It was a plus having breakfast each morning, eggs, sausage, potatos, waffels, cereal, yougert, pastries and juice. The ladies did a great job with the breakfast and kept the area clean and the food coming. The breakfast is the same each day.  The only compliant we had was the pool, it is not heated. The kids wanted to swim in the evening, and it was just too cold. Also, the ac was not very cool, our room seemed warm. Over all , we had a great stay and in the future would stay agin.

Everything was fantastic.  Clean room - had a room ready for our very early check-in.  Would stay there again when returning to Anaheim.  Thank you.  Now onto the 200 word minimum requirement - that makes this absolutely absurd - hopefully I am at 200 now or I am not going to do a review.

Summary Heading: NZ Family of Four loved this hotel
Summary: Thank you for a great stay at your hotel.  The room and hotel were exactly as we expected from photos and reviews.  Your staff were very helpful with requests both via email before we arrived and during our time at your hotel.  Our room and the hotel was clean and tidy and every staff member we met were friendly and helpful.  The breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items.  We loved that you were only 10 minutes walk from Disneyland and close to many food outlets.  We will recommend your hotel to others without any hesitation.

We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and it is always clean and the staff are curteous. It it fairly close to Disneyland and they have a couple of different room sizes to accomodate families.

We stayed here with or 4 young children. The kids had there own room (set of bunks and a rollaway). In the room we had, there would be no room for a cot if the rollaway bed is out. This hotel is close to Disneyland. It was very clean. We expected it to be noisy given that it is a family hotel, but it was quieter than we thought it would be. We had a room on the 4th floor. Breakfast wasn't great, and it was disappointing how much rubbish was created (polystyrene plates, cups, plastic knives and forks). It would be nice to have some healthier options at breakfast - more fruit and a healthier cereal. Would definitely stay here again. Some rooms had kitchenettes (so could self cater breakfast). Some room have a view over Disneyland, so you can watch the fireworks from the balcony.

Summary Heading: Wonderful! Best place to stay with Family for Disneyland
Summary: We LOVE This hotel. It is so convenient and has more than you could ask for when visiting Anaheim, especially Disneyland. The walk to Disney is super short, and the value and condition of this hotel compared to all the other hotels within walking distance is just way above and beyond. Breakfast included in the rates with a rooftop area that has a view of CA right next to it is a huge plus. The rooms are very clean, very nice, and fun for kids and families. To our surprise we were upgraded on arrival to a suite with a full kitchen. It worked out so nice for the kids, the baby could sleep in the bedroom, and we were able to bring tons of groceries and cook in the room and use the fridge to save tons of money. The pool is easy to get to, right in the middle, enclosed from traffic

The perfect location for Disneyland, only a fifteen minute walk away. 7-11 outside as well as many restaurants with in walking distance! Free breakfast was perfect and clean! Only downfall was the noise.  Checked in earlier then check in time so were placed in a room near the elevators so heard all sorts of noises including children running through the hallways at 3am? All in all great value for money and location!

Great location close  walking distance to Disneyland. Good selection for breakfast, kids loved the waffles. Very handy having the 7 eleven next door which catered for all our needs. In there every day. Also Alamo car rental next door was very handy. Very clean hotel  no mould in bathroom and all staff very helpful.  Stayed in room with separate bunk bed room for the kids which was great and my wife and I some much needed time out at the end of the day.

This hotel more than met our expectations.  Hotel was clean, had beautiful, spacious rooms, and a good breakfast was included.  The staff was great too, from the breakfast area to the front desk girls.  We had a problem with our transportation shuttle vouchers and the front desk staff went out of their way to contact the shuttle service company for us. Ten minute walk to Disneyland.  We plan to stay here again!

First hotel in a 5 week family holiday around the states so not sure what to expect. My family of 6 stayed in a borrego suite which was adequate. Room probably could be updated but no complaints , except for the pull out sofa which had a very poor mattress & springs and not really adequate as 3 kids ended up sleeping in a queen bed rather than 2 share the sofa. In hindsight probably should have complained about that at the time.  Lovely buffet breakfast to fill up on, go early as the waffle makers get a working over. Took us a while to get used to donuts for breakfast Great location, just a short walk from Disneyland which the 2 youngest easily did and plenty of choices for takeaway or sit in. Kids enjoyed the pool, especially coming from a cold NZ winter. Only real downside was

Was lied to during the reservation process. They told me that I could charge my car and then when I checked in told me that I could not   I'm very upset about as I went through a lot of work to find a place I can charge and am now stranded. If you want honest service  from a place that stands behind their committments, don't stay here

I stayed here with my Dad and my 2 kids for a short trip to Disney.  I booked the hotel on priceline and got a great deal.  I had called the day before we arrived just to make sure that my room was booked and we were good to go.  I was told my room was booked and that I had the room with 2 queen beds which is what I had selected.  We got to the hotel earlier than we could check in and they were very friendly and held our bags in their storage room so that we could enjoy the park.  Later that evening when we checked back in to get our room our bags were just the way we left them.  We got to our room and realized they had upgraded us, free of charge to a family suite.  We had 4 queen beds and 2 bathrooms.  This was a nice surprise.  The room was VERY clean.  My kids spent time in

Summary Heading: nothing fancy, but good for money.
Summary: It was a very basic hotel with no frills or fancy services, but great room layout and space. We had a king size bed along with a pull out sofa and two bunk beds, so plenty of room for the kids.  Breakfast was nice, but go early as it did get picked over later in the morning.  Service was good and everyone seemed to be helpful.

Our family has stayed at the Desert Palms many times and is our absolute favorite place to stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The free parking and complimentary breakfast can't be beat. A small walk to Disneyland, not bad at all. We love the Yuha kids suite! After a long day at Disneyland the kids can relax in their own room and the parents in theirs. The Desert Palms gives you the best value for your money, especially when traveling with a large family. We will continue to book at the Desert Palms.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for our family
Summary: We had our family of 9 all together for our vacation to Disneyland and the sights of Los Angeles. This hotel was very convenient to Disneyland and the walk from the hotel to the entrance wasn't bad at all for us. It probably depends on how old the kids are and how much "gear" you have to take. It was a 10 to 15 minute walk for us. The hotel was clean, the rooms were more than we expected and all of the hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating.  The breakfast was good and plentiful and the on site restaurant was a welcome sight for us when we arrived after flying for most of the day to get there.  All in all, it was a great place to stay for us.

Summary Heading: A fantastic location for Disney park access..average accommodation
Summary: The location is great ! You can walk to the park precinct in around 10 mins, but then again, there are a host of accommodation options within this range. The rooms were fine, and the check-in process was also easy. It's not an expensive place to stay, and given you spend all day at the Disney venues, with the rooms clean and tidy, this place presents good value for money. On the down side, the "complimentary breakfast" is worth giving a miss ! Do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to eat in the morning. There a few eating spots close by. There is a 7eleven right next door, very hand for you to pick up your little goodies.

Summary Heading: A great place and good bang for your buck!!
Summary: We had a family of 13 and this was the closest most cost effective place I could find near Disney after all my research. I thought it was going to be closer than it was…..definitely a good 15 minute walk. It includes parking and a continental breakfast which is why we choose it. The breakfast is just the basics but it was good enough for us. The scrambled eggs were my only complaint, they tasted rubbery. The only charges we had to pay extra were for the safe which was something like $1.00/day. Other than that the staff was great and the rooms are nice and clean. Good location as well, we had quite a few fast food and restaurant options. There was a Target close by where we stocked up on water bottles and fruit to pack in our backpacks. All in all a great place and good bang for

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet and Convenient to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel offers various room configurations.  Ours had a small living room and kitchenette with separate bedroom.  Our friends stayed in a room that had bunk beds.  If you're looking for a special arrangement, would recommend you call the hotel directly.  Our room looked onto a courtyard so it was very quiet although you could hear people walking (either above or in the adjacent room...couldn't tell).  Room was very clean and comfortable.  Parking was convenient and it's about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and good restaurants nearby.  The pool (we didn't use) is in a small courtyard area.  People looked like they were on top of one another and there's not much room to roam around.  Since it's surrounded by five stories it's not a very sunny or inviting place although the kids

My family flew into LA on the red-eye from Hawaii and reached the hotel at about 9:30 am, way too early to check-in. Nevine at the front desk was nice enough to store our luggage while we went to eat breakfast on the 5th floor. She even took our cell phone number so she could call us if someone checked out early and someone did so we were in our room by 11:00 am. She also gave us a room with a view of the fireworks. We stayed at the Desert Palms on a recommendation of a friend and we could not have been happier. We stayed for 6 nights and all the employees at this hotel were very friendly, pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast served every morning. It really helped us get off to an early start to Disneyland because we didn't have to go searching for

Summary Heading: Don't let the cover fool you.  This hotel is better than it looks.
Summary: Normally, I book all of our vacations, but, this year I got busy.  My wife booked our Disneyland portion of the trip for the hoppers/hotels.  After seeing the property in pictures and up close, I had my doubts.  The service was adequate and we were placed on the first floor...overlooking the back parking lot.  Ugh!  But, wait!  Don't judge a book by its cover.  The first floor was a blessing in disguise.  No waiting for elevators, and easy access to the FREE underground parking garage, pool/jacuzzi, front desk, bar/grille, front door.  The walk to Disneyland is a brisk 10 minutes or 15 minutes with little kids.  We bought the ART all-day passes for $4/adult and $1/children for the evening.  Don't be mistakened.  The buses are supposed to run every 20 minutes.  Several times, we

Stayed for 7 nights. Very helpful front desk, clean tidy rooms - not luxurious but perfect for our needs. A short walk to Disney was so convenient. Free parking available. Breakfast in the morning was good. Recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service outshines property showing its age
Summary: Like most hotels within walking distance of Disneyland, this is not an especially modern property.  Though recently renovated, its age shows right away.  However, over a six night stay, the less obvious but equally important features shine through, the most significant of which is the outstanding customer service.  The property is generally clean and well-maintained.  There is a rather basic breakfast available which is plain but consistent.  Some of the units and interiors could use upgrading.  The hotel conveniently located, about a 10 minute walk from the park entrance, which for Disneyland is as close as you can get without going to a Disney resort hotel or being directly across the street.  As noted by other reviewers, there is a bus, the "Anaheim Resort Transit" or "ART",

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed 3 nights here and were very happy with our stay. The front desk was always helpful and friendly. The room (we had a kids suite) was on the small side for what it was, but perfectly adequate and extremely clean. Plus the bunk beds were a huge hit with my kids and the balcony, though too tiny for even a chair, faced the park and I think if we had been up in the room at the right time we would have had a great view of the fireworks. I am a light sleeper and easily bothered by noise, and I have to say I thought the noise level was excellent here. Unlike places we've stayed in the past, we did not hear noisy doors opening or people talking in the hallway. The air conditioning and bathroom fan were both nice and quiet.  One neat surprise was the pool. While totally drab and

We stopped at Desert Palms for three weeks in Aug Sept 2012. We had adjoining rooms which were comfortable and well maintained. Staff at the hotel were always very friendly and helpful. Coming from England they offered plenty of 'local' tips. Breakfast was good. Pool a little small. Overall we would not hesitate in stopping again and had a great holiday.

Summary Heading: A good base for your Disneyland stay!
Summary: We spent 6 nights at the Desert Palms (this is the second time we have chosen to stay here).. The location is good - a 10 minute walk to the main gates of Disneyland - a shuttle is available if the walk is too much at the end of the day ($2 per person)...   located next to a 7/11 which had plenty of supplies such as food/alcohol etc. Within walking distance is also plenty of dinner options (The Cheesecake Factory being our favourite!) Onsite parking was a bonus - as we hired a car just to get around the area a bit further (shopping, universal studios, LA etc) as the shuttle service offered is quite expensive compared to car hire. The pool was great for everyone to unwind - it was a heatwave when we were there! The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom exhaust was linked

Group of 10 with a 3 room reservation, We stayed 7 nights, Front desk service the moment we arrived was Awesome.... welcoming with Great smile, awesome imformation and instant service. I thank you !!!! and we will be back!!!! Rooms are smaller, but very comfortable for family of four.... older decor, But clean and comfortable... Free WIFI, let us download our pics everyday!!! Great!!!  In suite safes great value to keep your valuables safe, only $1 day. Included breakfast buffet was great!!! Make your own waffles!!!! Sit outside on roof top fresh air first thing in the morning was a great start to our day. Housekeeping staff polite and helpful.  There were a few hiccups like one of our rooms was not ready on time, So we were to be able to drop our luggage in one room that was

We stayed in this hotel for 6 days for our disney vacation. We found this hotel to be great! Since this was our second trip to disney, we had high expectations considering the last hotel we stayed in was a total dissapointment. We had the 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms and 4 queen beds. This room had SO much space! With our family of 5 (one teen and one pre-teen) this room worked perfectly. Having 2 full size bathrooms was definitely a plus. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job daily. The included breakfast was good- kids really liked what was offered, and there was plenty of room to sit in the dining area. Sandbox bar and grill was also good. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again.

Our stay was over the weekend of 09-29-12 to 10-01-12. The staff friendly and helpful, Jenny the desk clerk, went out of her way to make sure all of our needs were taken care of, very mindful to my family. Pointed out places to eat, bus routes, shuttle information, just a top shelve stay. The hotel is very clean and neat. The staff is always making the place tidy and with all the families that were at the hotel this is a tall order to fill, but they did so in a timely manner. Public or open bathrooms were always clean. The rooms have plenty of space, the TV were new and upgraded to watch a DVD or play stations. The breakfest was great, nothing to turn away from, fresh hot and best of all included in the price of the stay. Our room was by the pool and we did not notice any noise.

Summary Heading: Convenient, centrally located to Disneyland and food outlets
Summary: OK, so the title can apply to a myriads of hotels along Katella Avenue but this is my first time to Anaheim so for what it's worth, I found the Desert Palms hotel to be well located (7 minutes walk to Disneyland/California Adventure Park; and a few minutes' walk to food outlets).  The room I had was a 2 bedroom suite, 1 queen and 1 set of bunkbed which suited my requirements perfectly.  It's clean but the walls are a little thin so you can hear people coming and going in the corridors. However, this is common in many hotels so it didn't bother me too much.  Breakfast is standard fare and is self service in the dining room - self cook waffles and toast along with cereals and a couple of hot dishes.  Lots of children in the hotel but I guess that's its designed for this as we are

Staff very friendly, we stayed in a a family suite that can accommodate a family of eight very efficient for older teenage children as they had their own area.  Easy walk to Disneyland, the 711 came in very handy just been next door. Plenty of choice for breakfast especially the waffle station would highly recommend  this hotel.

From the moment we booked our reservation to the moment we left, the staff was extremely courteous and helpful.  The hotel was very clean.  The lobby was welcoming.  We stayed in a Yuha Suite.  The room was clean, nice tv's, and the kids especially loved the bunk beds.  Our kids enjoyed swimming in the pool and the food at the Sandbox restaurant was delicious and well priced.  It only took us 10 minutes to walk to the gates of Disney with four small kids walking with us.   That was a huge bonus!  We would definitely return again.

Summary Heading: Family what more could you ask
Summary: Had kalahari suite and stayed for ten days. Found all staff to be happy and very helpful. Reception exceptionally helpful special thanks to Jenny for the help in obtaining Angels game tickets. Rooms and hotel in general clean and tidy. Close to Disneyland gates  and would recommend for family accommodation.

Very nice hotel, clean rooms, nice breakfast, and an easy walk to Disney.  We stayed with our 3 kids in the Yuha Suite and it was perfect for us.  We stayed for 7 days and we really enjoyed our stay and the hotel room.

I booked this enough in advance due to our stay is going to be over the Labor Day weekend.  When we checked in, there were many rooms available.  Our first room was not what was going to work for my family.  I proceeded to the front desk to request a change in rooms.  Without a blink of any eye, we got a new room.  The staff was very freindly and helpful.

My family and I stay at Desert Palms every time we go to Disneyland.  It is great hotel with a great location and the breakfast in the morning is a wonderful value.   This time around it was a business trip, and my stay was great as always.
