I checked in a little early and the clerk kindly upgraded my room when she found that my room would not be available until later in the day.  Little stuff like that makes all the difference.

The hotel is in a great location, about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland entrances. Also very helpful having 7/11 next door to stock up on supplies. The room was OK size-wise but very noisy with the world's noisiest fan in the bathroom. Breakfast was terrible, you can smell it from the moment you walk out of the lift on that floor and it was so bad we turned around and walked out without trying it. The pool and spa were really good (although we only had a chance to use it once) and the staff were friendly when we needed their help (with the exception of the waitress at the Sand Box restaurant). Overall just OK.

My family and I stayed for 3 nights in their deluxe queen room. The hotel itself is nice clean and the maid service was always right on time when we were coming back from the park in the afternoon it was clean and ready for us to wind down and get ready to head back to Disneyland. The front desk was so helpful and friendly. Jennifer and Stevie in particular were very helpful with everything we asked of them. The only other thing is they do have a fee of 10 dollars a night added to the rate which is a small price to pay for all the amenities but be aware. I will stay at the desert palm inn again in the future.

My boyfriend and I went to Disneyland for the first time and stayed at the desert plam beacuse of the location and price I was greeted by the front desk girl Stevie Hall she made my trip amazing very friendly and helpful! Everyone was she went above and beyond to make my stay thebest it could be.

Summary Heading: Best hotel to stay in for Disneyland trip!
Summary: I'm so glad I found this hotel! 5 minute walk to the parks. Good pricing. FREE buffet breakfast! All around awesome place. The receptionist, Jennifer C., is awesome and friendly. Helped us with everything we needed and did it with a genuine smile.

My family of 5 had an excellent stay here!  We stayed in a suite with 2 queens and a kitchenette and couldn't have been happier!  This is the only hotel that offers free wifi, parking (saves you a lot many places charge $10-15/per day) and free buffet breakfast!  The Breakfast was great although it did get a little mundane having the same thing day after day!  Breakfast includes egg, potatoes, waffles, sausage, and pastries, which was well enough to keep us filled on our way to Disney!  The walk isn't bad and is fairly relaxing to tell the truth you are at Disney in 10-15 mins!  I would definitely stay here again!  The bartender also serves a delicious Mojito!

Our stay was great and we loved the hotel.  It was convenient to everything we needed.  Also loved that parking and breakfast were included. Hotel was very clean, staff was very friendly and professional.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for a week.  A group of 9 - we took three rooms, two standard and a Yuha Suite - designed for families.  All of us enjoyed the experience - and were very comfortable.  From the time of check-in to departure, we had a great visit.  Staff were friendly, the rooms kept very clean [although more coffee could be provided in the rooms] and the breakfast room was awesome.  The facility is close to the Disney main gates [about a 10 minute walk] as well as local restaurants...certainly no complaints.  We had complimentary parking for our rental car, and WiFi in the room for our computer...  The only negative was having to leave and go home.

Summary Heading: Walk to the parks & FREE breakfast
Summary: The location of this hotel is very convenient and the price is usually the most affordable of hotels in its class near the Disney parks.  In some rooms I've stayed in, the A/C unit has been loud, but other than that the property is always clean and the free full breakfast is great before a long day with the kids.  Speaking of breakfast, the coffee leaves a lot to be desired, but I've been assured a change for the better is in the works!  Staff is very accommodating and eager to help.

We stayed for five nights in a suite - thankfully a room for our family of 6!  The hotel really is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland - close enough that we put in half a day at Disney, went back to the hotel for pizza and the pool, then walked back to Disney for the fireworks and a few evening rides.  The pool and hot tub were great, as were the conveniences of a free hot breakfast and restaurant on site.  7-11 is right next door for any needs or cravings.  There was free underground parking for our vehicle, which we barely needed since everything was so close.  The suite was stocked with all the kitchen basics.  Staff were pleasant and helpful, and the facilities kept clean.  Will stay again.

Overall our stay at Desert Palms was very very good.  A nice hotel, very close to Disneyland, free parking, free internet, free hot breakfast. Excellent family value. A huge "Thanks" goes to the staff who gave my family a free upgrade during our stay.  Other than a rogue fire alarm going off during the middle of the week waking us up (due to vandalism), everything was fine.  I will definitely consider Desert Palms again in the future as well as recommend your hotel to friends visiting Anaheim.

I stayed here with my friend for 3 nights in September.  The hotel is about a 10 min walk from Disneyland and has shops and restaurants nearby if you don't want to go to downtown Disney. The pool is small but ok to sit by to get some sun. Breakfast was fine especially since it was free and parking was also free. Rooms are spacious and clean - not lots of luxuries but good value.

We had a great experience here. Our suite was spacious, plenty of room for the five of us. The room and hotel common areas were exceptionally clean at all times. The staff was friendly and super helpful. We ordered from the restaurant a couple of times and the food tasted good and was ready in 15 minutes. Another member of our family had a single room and had a great experience as well. A quick 10 minute walk to Disneyland and 5 minutes to the Anaheim Gardenwalk-a bunch of restaurants and stores. All in all a seamless stay. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Brilliant – clean and affordable rate. We were upgraded to a suite which was really too big for us but was fine. The free breakfast buffet was very substantial and plenty of seating available. Easy walk to Disney Land and convenience store right next door. Amazingly comfortable bed. Would definitely stay here again.

Perfect hotel for me and my wee daughter Lily(8). Ideal for Disneyland with a 10 minute walk if that. Friendly hotel staff and also the Sandwich Bar and Grille staff. Excellent breakfast. Eat all you can and go back for more if you can! Good little swimming pool and spa tub. Ideal location for little grocery stores too that sell everything you need.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms. We loved how close it was to Disneyland - just a short 5-10 minute walk. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The rooms were nice and we loved the flat panel TV's in our room. The breakfast was amazing however it would be really nice if you would include bacon on the menu as well as fresh fruit like bananas and apples. The pool was refreshing after a long day at the park.  Thanks for everything and we will be staying there in the future.

After getting back from a very busy but very enjoyable trip with the kids, I must say that I may have found our place to stay when visiting D-land.  We stayed in a Borrego Suite which had two queen beds and a sofa sleeper (very convenient for the kids). I suffer from lower back pain so there are times when I do need a seperate bed for myself to sleep so this really was the very best option for us. Breakfast was good nothing mind-blowing but definitely worth it since we didnt have to drive to Dennys or put up with the high-price-low-quality offerings accross the street. Every night we returned tired to our nice clean room and housekeeping was nice enough to leave spare towels as we had asked for early on.    Wonderful staff- the girl at the front desk, I think her name was

Stayed 5 nights over Labor Day weekend. Was a little worried before arrival about the walk to the parks as we usually stay right across the street but found out in no time it was a short shaded 10 minute walk with a 7-11 on the way. The Hotel was clean, the staff were super friendly and we never had any trouble with parking. We tried the breakfast a couple of mornings and it was fine. The hotel is very close to Disney, the convention center and all of the restaurants at the Garden Walk. Will stay here again.

Summary Heading: clean hotel nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times and we have been happy with the service. It's a really clean hotel and their guest service desk is real helpful! Almost every time we go we stay here! The breakfast was great! Everything was warm and good! I definitely recommend staying here!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: We have taken each of our grandchildren while they were 7 to Disneyland.  Each trip we stayed in a different hotel.  Desert Palms was by far our favorite.  We arrived around 10:30 in the morning, thinking we could drop of our luggage off and head to Disneyland  to enjoy the rest of the morning until we could check into our room. We were suprised by the desk clerk, Nevine, who checked us in at that time.  Our Granddaughter had left her jacket in our airport shuttle and was a little distraught.  Nevine called the shuttle company immediatly and made arrangements to have the jacket dropped off at the front desk upon the driver's next trip to the area.  She also helped up with getting tickets for the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) and told us to cross Harbor Street to catch the

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly Hotel located very close to Disneyland
Summary: Our stay was GREAT! We got in late and had reservations at a hotel near there only to find out the room was poorly air conditioned and below standard. As I was frantically calling around to find a kid suite open on labor day weekend, when I called Desert Palms Hotel I reached very helpful front desk staff who advised me I could come by to take a look at the room to ensure it fit my needs, which it did. My little boys absolutely loved the bunk beds and pool. The rate we received was great, hot breakfast was very high quality and parking was convenient.   Thank you for a wonderful stay for my son's 5th Birthday!

Summary Heading: Bad First Night But Balance of Stay Fine
Summary: We had booked a 6 night stay here through Expedia for our trip to the Anaheim area, especially since it was within walking distance to Disneyland.  We got to the hotel late (11 PM) and were given a 2Q room with an accessible bathroom.  My kids were extremely disappointed with the room, especially the bathroom since it had no bathtub.  I went back to the front desk to ask about getting a regular 2Q room but was advised that none were available and that they had correctly given me what I had booked, which was a 2Q room and not a 2Q non-accessible room.  They further advised that they had suites available but that as I did not pay for a suite, they would not give me one and that I would have to wait until the next day when some regular 2Q's became available.  As it was late and we

Summary Heading: Very nice accomodations for the price
Summary: This is our 3rd visit at this hotel, and is fast becoming one of our favorite!  We stayed during the busy Labor Day weekend, in which we participated in the Disneyland Half Marathon and were pleased that the hotel prices were not gouged for the events.  Free parking, wifi and a hot breakfast are all included. I've read from another review of a complaint about being served the same thing....ok, again...the hot breakfast is FREE!!  The pool and jacuzzi is nothing special,  but its clean and served its purpose.  The location is walking distance to pretty much everything. And the staff were friendly and very helpful.  Will definitely return next year with our party of 23+. Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Great Location - Great Staff - Great Hotel!
Summary: We booked this hotel through Get Away Today as a 5 night Disney Package (3 days at Disney, 1 at Universal, 1 at the Beach). This hotel is within a 5-7 minute walk of the entrance to Disneyland or the ART stop is right outside the door if you don't want to walk. For us, a family of four visiting with a family of 3 (Kids ages 18, 15, 12) we would typically walk to the park and ride the bus back.  The staff here are FANTASTIC! Very helpful in getting to and from other places like the beach, Universal, etc. They also have great information about nearby restaurants and grocery stores.   The room had a safe, microwave and frig which we used to store water and juice bottles plus fresh fruit to take into the parks. The micro was also great for those late night snacks (popcorn!). The

I found the Desert Palms to be an excellent value for the Anaheim Disney & Convention Center area. This place is within walking distance to mostly anything you want in this area. Service was great and the free breakfast was convenient and tasty…no complaints..Would definitely stay again if I’m out that way  Jeff

Summary Heading: No running water in showers one night!
Summary: Stayed here for several nights in July 2012. One night there was no running water in the shower. When I called the front desk, they went through a charade of having a maintenance person come in to fiddle with it, then transferred me to another room they said they had double checked and the plumbing was fine. After all that I find out the next day that it was a floor wide problem and the maintenance check and the move to the other room was all a lie to stall and appease me while they fixed the bigger problem. They thought the move would kill enough time so that it would be fixed by the time I got to the new room. Guess what? No shower water pressure in the other room too! I found out the truth the next day! Instead of being honest about the problem, they went through a lot of

It was great experience staying at Deserts Palms Hotel and Suites on our recent visit to LA. What we like is that the hotel is located very close to Disneyland and had great commute using ART service. The complimentary parking and awesome complimentary breakfast added to the value of staying here. The hotel also provides complimentary wi-fi service. The staff is also very courteous. They have business center which is also complimentary, it was helpful to checkin for our flights and print boarding passes.   There are other closeby hotels near Disney but they either charge for parking or does not provide breakfast.  I would recommend staying in this hotel.

Have just returned from our 2 week stay at this hotel and must say we had a great time. The hotel was everything we needed to make our California adventure a good one, the location is fantastic, took us (me, hubby and 2 kids, 14 & 12) under 10 minutes to walk to disney, an easy walk even in temperatures of almost 100 degrees! We had the suite with kitchenette which was always very clean and with plenty of room to suit our needs, also we were on the 4th floor so no noise from above..always a bonus! The two double beds are really comfortable however i do not recommend sleeping on the pull out bed..it is not comfortable at all! Breakfast was a bonus to start the day and was always well stocked and fresh and we always found somewhere to sit even though the hotel was busy. We found

Being a family of five we originally booked the Yuha suite. Once we actually saw the suite ( way smaller then pics on website) we had to upgrade to a kitchenette suite immediately. There was no way we were fitting a crib in the Yuha. Having the bunk beds was a great idea, but I couldn't believe the door had a deadbolt lock on the inside!!! To avoid our four year old locking himself in the room we decided to upgrade instead. The kitchenette suite was huge and accommodated us well. Plenty of room for a crib. The rooms apparently have been renovated. Yes there were some renos, but I really wouldn't call them "renovated". I also never heard such a loud bathroom fan....they need to get those fixed! The cleaning staff were great and breakfast was good. Swimming pool didn't look all

Very comfortable rooms, beds, and a refrigerator . A good tasting breakfast is included in your stay. Outdoor pool and hot tub is average but nice to have.Blocks away from Disneyland/California Adventures/Downtown Disney. Walking distance to many different restaurants. On a transit route that we could go see an Anaheim Angels baseball game.

We enjoyed our stay.  The location was great; the staff were very friendly and accommodating and the rooms clean and well kept; but were aged.  Beds comfortable.      My only negative feedback is:  1)	 Breakfast was nice to have in the mornings, however staying for 10 days and having the same food each day was tiring.  I would have loved to see a different flavored yogurt; maybe bacon one day instead of the same sausage patty and maybe some other fruit like berries and bananas.   Waffles were awesome!    2)	Water pipes were very loud – sounded like a jack hammer going off.  Okay in the morning; but we had two occasions where someone showered during the night at 11pm and it woke us up.    We would recommend this location to our friends.   Patty

We just spent 5 nights here on a family vacation centered around Disney.  The fact that the hotel had free parking, free breakfast, inside corridors, and walking distance was important.  The room was ok, we reserved a Borrego suite but none were available at check-in so we were upgraded to a suite with a kitchenette.  We used only the fridge, but it looked reasonable.  The beds were ok, but the bathroom fan was way too loud, in fact we would actually leave the door open a crack rather than turning the light/fan on if someone was sleeping.  Breakfast was average at best, the eggs, sausage, and pastries were mediocre, and the waffle makers were always busy and didn't seem to cook 100% through.  The juice was horrible, we stuck to water.  The staff was great and the hotel and room

We stayed here to be close to Disney for a quick one day during our trip to California. Our flight was getting in pretty late that night and we knew we were going to be leaving early for Disney so we really only needed a clean place to sleep for a few hours and this hotel definitely delivered. Check in was quick and easy and the lobby was pretty nice and definitely clean. The rooms are somewhat outdated to be sure, but they were clean and had the basic amenities we needed. The free breakfast is a plus, though as vegans we only grabbed some fruit before heading to the parks. And I must say that the orange juice was basically sugar water, but still. Overall I would recommend the hotel if you are using it the way we did. Clean, comfortable, and quick/easy service with a very close

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great breakfast and helpful staff at Desert Palms Hotel
Summary: I took a group of students from China to Disneyland and Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was our location of choice to stay. Julie is so great at the front desk. Very helpful and friendly. This hotel is clean and safe. The rooms are very nice and breakfast is really great. Just around the corner from Disneyland. The pool and hot tub is wonderful. Room service is a nice touch for a tired traveler. Ice and snacks are a nice touch. Easily accessable. I have stayed here before and will return. Thanks for a great time. Ruth Franklin EF/PL

Summary Heading: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME staying here!
Summary: Our family frequents Anaheim/Disney often.  We are a very laid-back, easygoing family that doesn't require much--a clean bed to sleep in.  We usually stay at another full-service hotel in the area that offers a complimentary cooked-to-order hot breakfast buffet but we wanted to try staying within walking distance to the parks this time.  HUGE MISTAKE.  The hotel website looks great, the foyer is nice here and the staff is very friendly.  HOWEVER, when we exited the elevator, that's when our "uh-oh" hit us.  We didn't have a very good feeling walking to our room and, to our horror, once we opened the door to our room we were welcomed by a mystery stain across the top of the duvet on the main bed.  Yes, no joke.  There were stains on the walls and our luggage (which totaled the

Very nice rooms, great breakfast to start a day at Disneyland, and nice staff. The breakfast was not just a continental breakfast, but consisted of eggs, oatmeal, breads, fruits, juices and milk. My only concern is that  not across the street exactly- 10 to 15 minute walk to front gate of Disneyland.

I brought a group of students here so I am unable to talk about price but I can talk about the important stuff. First, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. I slept great and breakfast was wonderful. The hotel is very family friendly. All the staff members (I remember Julie for helping us with a quick check in) were extremely helpful.  Second, you cannot beat the location. The hotel was a three minute away from the Disneyland entrance. This might be a great hotel not too far off the beaten path of the hotels near Disneyland.

The welcome we received from the member off staff on reception when we arrived was excellent.  He was very helpful and informative.  We asked for a room from which we could see the Disney fireworks and as he had none available said we could move the next day if we came down and asked in the morning.  We did this and the girl on the desk already knew and had arranged another room already. The hotel is 10 mins walk from the park, do not bother getting the bus!  The bus stop is outside the hotel but goes up the street, round the corner, back down the same street, round another corner, up the road and then into the park which took over half an hour!  Waste of time so walk! We chose this hotel because it had decent family rooms and offered a complimentary breakfast.  The only

Very nice hotel only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  Very comfortable and clean room which also had a separate sitting area with a couch.  Made it easy to stay up later than the kids without disturbing them.  Very good breakfast which included scrambled eggs, hash browns, fresh baked waffles, cereal, etc.  Very friendly staff at the desk and breakfast room.  Lots of family restaurants close by also.  Didn't use the pool since we were at the park all day, but it looked nice.  Price was very reasonable, way less than the Disney hotels.  All in all, no complaints.

Hotel was easy to access and front desk area inviting and cool.  Upon check in we were upgraded to a larger suite with two bathrooms. I was delighted as we were 4 adults and 1 child.  Staff were friendly and informative.  Underground parking was free.  Our room was really clean with fridge and microwave. The bathrooms were meticulously clean. Our airconditioning kept both rooms cool throughout our 5 night stay in excessive temperatures of 100 degrees.  The shuttle just across the street ran every 5 minutes to Disney.  Cold bottles water in gift shop available for 99 cents.  Pool area shaded in afternoon.  Subway and convenience store nearby.  Full breakfast buffet a real saving. I really feel our hotel had a great contribution in making our disneyland experience great in spite

Summary Heading: Great family suites close to Disneyland
Summary: We packed out one of the six-person suites with an extended family that included two children, and we were pleased with our choice of hotel. The room was clean, the staff friendly and the location convenient. Disneyland and California Adventure are an easy walk away, and there are plenty of nearby restaurants (including some bargains in the strip mall across Harbor Boulevard). Accommodations are excellent for the price range; our only complaint is that the pull-out sofa/bed wasn't particularly comfortable. The free breakfast each morning was a nice plus; there's a wide variety of food, nothing fancy but certainly tasty. We'd stay here again.

We stayed at the Hotel over two nights at Disney ! I am afraid we found to be over rated and over priced....the booking was jumbled up..we were told that the room we booked on-line was not available and we had to go for a change....overall forgetful experience..But the staff was quite friendly..particularly their travel desk...

I thought we were in for a disaster when we arrived after a 15hr flight to Desert Palms Hotel & Suites Anaheim to find our travel agent had incorrectly cancelled our booking!!!! The staff could not have been more sympathetic and helpful and as I had all the previous booking paperwork, the manager Shirley honoured our booking at the original price, which was wonderful and I'm sure saved me having a breakdown at the front counter. The room was very clean and comfortable. I loved that we had a fully equipped kitchenette, so I could cook lunch or dinner on any days I wanted. Our room on the second floor did get quite a lot of noise however from the room above. Sounded like a herd of elephants stomping around some nights which was a bit disappointing.There is a fully provided buffet

My family stayed here a weekend in July in a suite with bunkbeds and we were pleasantly surprised.  We normally stay at a different hotel in the area but they were booked so we went to the desert palms instead and I think they have won us over. The staff was lovely and very helpful, the breakfast in the morning was great and it was really close to disneyland. The only thing I could possibly fault them on is the bathroom fan is soo loud!  But overall a great stay and I will definately be returning soon.

We booked this hotel as part of a vacation package on the Disney website. After we checked in, we knew we had made a good choice. The young lady that checked us in was very friendly and helpful. We had arrived early, so we left our luggage in a secure area while went and explored Downtown Disney. We timed it: form door to park walking at a normal pace (with 7-year-old), it took us 10 minutes.  When we returned, the same nice lady was there and she upgraded us to a mini-suite with sunken living area, microwave and fridge. Fantastic!  We enjoyed the free secure underground parking and Wifi. Two big reasons for us to stay here as husband had to do work while on vacation as well, and Wifi was a necessity. I loved having a coin laundry area.   The breakfast was ample: waffles, eggs,

We had a nice stay.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The kids loved the complimentary hot breakfasts esp. the potatoes, sausages and make your own waffles.  This was the first time we stayed here and we will stay here again next year.

It was my first time staying at the Desert Palms.  The hotel was clean, staff were very friendly, our room was a good size, clean and to have a fridge and a microwave in our room was fantastic!  The breakfast was great and a real bonus to have that included as part of our hotel stay, especially for my three kids.  We enjoyed relaxing in the pool and hot tub after long days walking in the parks. Everything was within walking distance to the hotel and having a 'Seven Eleven' right next door was so handy to buy food or drink and store in our room refrigerator if needed be.  I will definitely be staying at your hotel again.

I stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites from July 21 through July 26, 2012.  Immediately upon arrival we were upgraded, which was a very nice surprise.  The lobby was very open and welcoming.  The room and beds were comfortable, we enjoyed the hot breakfast, which is far nicer than the other hotels near Disneyland, and the location was excellent and with free parking.  The staff at the hotel were very friendly, helpful and pleasant.  I liked my stay so much, that I have already booked a return visit to the hotel in January 2013.  We also plan to return for our annual SoCal trip next June.  The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.  We had no problems or issues at the hotel and look forward to return visits.  I'm happy that we tried the Desert Palms.  It's just a

Summary Heading: Noisy, dirty, bugs too, bad breakfast too.
Summary: Stayed while taking my boys to Disneyland, not impressed. Our first room was loud, and very dirty, with a broken noisy air conditioner that kept turning off.After one very hot noisy night, we asked for a complimentary upgrade, which they provided. The upgrade, had bugs in the bathroom, and dirty carpets. Every time I used the bathroom, I watched the bugs crawl back into the walls, yuck. Breakfast was awful, and very limited. I do not recommend this hotel at all.

Everything is great here at this hotel, from the staff, rooms, cleanliness, & the free full hot breakfast. Very lovely hotel. Great location to Disneyland and convenient to other attractions. We will be in the area this fall and hope to be able to stay here again.

Hotel has been recently updated (within 3 years imo).  The offer free parking and it is within walking distance to Disneyland.  We loved the location as we could get to Newport Beach/Balboa Island in 25 minutes, walked to dinner two blocks away with numerous options and walked to Disneyland - under a mile.  Pool is outside, but it is in a small courtyard so not much sun on it.  Breakfast had fresh fruit, waffles, eggs and sausage and bacon along with numerous juices etc.

We were very satisfied with our stay at Desert Palm Hotel & suites.  We had a kids suite, bunkbed + sofa bed and a separate room with 1 king bed. Our 13 year old son found that the bottom bunkbed felt too small so, he used the sofabed and our 11 year old slept on the top of the bunkbed. Bathroom and room were clean and it was convenient to have an extra sink separated from the bathroom.  Fridge and microwave in the room; very usefull!  The kids loved their room; they could see the Disneyland fireworks from their window! We were satisfied with the free breakfast offered on the 5th floor; a little crowded at times but a good variety of breakfast food; a big bonus not to have to go look for a restaurant before starting our busy day!  We ate 2 meals at The Sandbox Bar & Grill and

This hotel was clean and staff very friendly. Maid service was exceptional! The value of this hotel was great and being only 2 blocks to Disneyland was also a bonus. The only con I can think of was that our granddaughter only used the pool once because "it made her eyes hurt".

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland!
Summary: The room is clean and large.  They offer free breakfast. The staff is friendly.  I have no complaints other than the water in the bathroom smelled a little funny.  I would definitely stay here again!  Very close to Disneyland.  Walking distance to the park but we also had the transit passes which was nice after a long day...not wanting to walk back (but honestly it is so close we could have).  Great restaurants in walking distance.  Overall great experience!

The hotel is two blocks from Disneyland and has many great restaurants within walking distance.  The family suite room is very nice and family friendly.  Our room was with a king size bed and was very comfortable.  Did not like the first room they gave us and they were very friendly and accommodating when we ask for a different room.  Nice pool in the middle of the hotel with a hot tub. Parking was adequate.  There seemed to a lot of groups coming and going.  The kids would run up and down the stairs and make a lot of noise, but it was quiet otherwise.  I would stay at this hotel again.

These accommodations were average at best but clean. The front desk had one person who was able to knowledgeably answer questions we had about accommodations, directions, problems with lost item. Proximity to Disneyland and eating places were great. Free parking and breakfast a plus.

We choose to stay here because it was one of the least expensive for a Disney package; had a refrigerator in the room (necessity for us because of our son's medication); free parking and free breakfast. They upgraded us to the one bedroom condo with kitchenette for no additional charge. Because we were only staying two nights we didn't use the kitchenette but loved the room itself. The breakfast food was decent; not extraordinarly wonderful - but good. All of the staff that we talked to were very helpful. All in all, a good choice for us. It's an older building, so don't expect everything to look and feel brand new and it isn't a five star hotel - but a great stay!

Summary Heading: It doesn't get any better than this!!!
Summary: Me, my wife and our 2 boys (3 & 4) spent 9 days at the hotel in May 2011 and you couldn't ask for anything better.  Clean, quiet, excellent location and very friendly people.  Just a 2 minute ride on the bus to Disneyland, a 7-11 write next door and a rental car location on the other side of the hotel.  The rates were very good for all the benefits you get at the hotel.  Excellent breakfast buffet on the top floor where you can even eat outside and see California Adventures next door.  The swimming area is very nice and the parking is excellent, which is under the hotel and very secure.  If you want good value for your money and a great hotel with a very good location close to Disneyland, pick Desert Palms.  The rooms are very nice.  Were going back in August 2012 for another

We stayed here on 7/21 for only one night in a kids suite with a bunk beds in one room and a king in the other.  It was very comfortable but not really big. It was clean and didn't look old and shabby like some of the other hotels in the area we have stayed at. The breakfast offered was a nice selection of hot and cold food. We found it easy to walk to Disneyland although I think they have shuttle service. There was a small pool and jacuzzi though when we got there someone had put bubble bath in it. When we got back from the park it had been cleaned and looked good as new! This was our first stay at this hotel but I'm sure it will not be our last!

Summary Heading: Definitely a 4 star with great location within walking distance to Disney!
Summary: We stayed at the DP for 7 days this July. The hotel is within walking distance, which is about a 10 minute walk to Disney. You can catch the ART bus ($4 per adult) outside the hotel but we never did. We have two kids 8 and 3. The 3 year old needed the stroller especially after the three 12 hour days at DL.  Things we enjoyed: decent sized rooms with free microwave and refrigerator. Beds were comfortable. Free hot breakfast daily from 7-10 am although we did get tired of it a little so bought snacks etc to keep in the room. Free parking although there is a $10 daily resort fee which was annoying. The restaurant is reasonably priced and decent with sandwiches, salads, burgers etc. for around $10 a plate. Kids food was about $6. The bar manager Russ was really nice, attentive, and

Stayed here for 4 nights with my wife and 3 kids. Met my brother and his wife and kids.  The rooms were fantastic! We had a suite with a separate room with bunk-beds for the kids. The rooms are clean and very spacious! Good size refrigerator, stored cold drinks and half gallon milk for kids.   Breakfast buffet was great, had all the morning essentials. The pool area had shade so you can watch the kids if you choose no to go in.   The people were friendly and had customer service as a priority. They came to give us fresh towels and help with the TV within 20 minutes.   Next time in the Anaheim area I recommend this to anyone! If you ate going to Disney, it's just a 10 min walk and on the same side of CA Adventure.   You won't be disappointed!

We stayed 7/16-7/20 in the Sahara Condo Suite with Kitchenette.  It should be called Sahara Economy Suite it was so small compaired to other suite's we have stayed in. Although it met our needs I was a little disappointed.  You really don't stay too  long in your room but it was crowded with furniture it seemed.  We spent $77 (including tip)  for breakfast at IHOP across the street, for 4 (this includes1 child who ate from the kids menu) and decided the free breakfast would work for the rest of our trip.  The pool and bar/restaurant close very early, which is dumb, the bar would be extremly busy if it was open after you return from Disneyland, god knows we needed a drink after enduring that misery. A dip in the pool would have been nice, i probably would have given them 1 or 2

Summary Heading: My best hotel experience at Disneyland  out of 5 other hotels in area
Summary: We stayed in a kids suite and it was worth every penny. Actually, I feel like we got a steal. We had two beds in one room and bunk beds in the other - my kids were so excited they didn't even want to leave the room at first. Rooms were clean, location is awesome (you don't have to cross any major streets), and they have laundromats on every floor so if you're on the 4h floor you don't have to lug anything from the ground floor. The room has a refrigerator which fits half a gallon of milk and a whole lot more ( I have small kids). This has been, hands down, the best hotel I've stayed at in the area, and I'll probably only stay here from now on. Very happy!!

We were visiting the Anaheim area and stayed at this hotel from July 7th through the 13th.  The experience we had at this hotel was wonderful.  The staff were quite friendly and very helpful.  The location was perfect, as we did not have to drive to the Disney attractions and the Garden Walk area.  This allowed us to save quite a bit as we did not have to pay for Disney parking and were able to come back with more souvenirs and have nicer dining experiences.  Walking can be tough from time to time especially after spending all day in Disney parks, but we liked the idea that we know exactly what time we were able to return to our hotel room.  We did not need to get in a long line for the shuttle nor waiting for other drivers in front of you to exit from the parking lot.  it

Summary Heading: 3 star hotel is what you will get.
Summary: This place had pretty great reviews but it is really a 3 star hotel. This is why I'm giving it a 3 star not because it fell short of anything.   Pros: Free parking. They even let us park there the morning that we got in. We couldn't check in but since we were planning to go to Disneyland, we thought why not try. They let us. Free breakfast. Yes, it is super crowded. People line up before it opens. Not great variety, but consistent with a 3 star place. Usually you only get continental breakfast, but they have hot breakfast items which is great. Free internet: You get free wifii in the rooms! Walking distance to Disneyland. It was only a 10-15 minute walk. Don't even bother waiting for the shuttle, it will take longer. Keep in mind that there are other hotels closer to the

We recently visited Anaheim with a 3 day Disneyland pass. We stayed at Desert Palms and all 3 of us can attest that this Hotel is in the perfect location. We had a 2 queen bed room with a sunken lounge area and a separate television all with a view of the fireworks at Disneyland. This is the only one of 5 hotels we stayed at while in the US that actually has a fridge and microwave in the room which we take for granted in Australia.  It is an easy walk from the park and is next door to a Seven Eleven and another convenience store. Across the road is a Subway and several other takeaway stores. Just up the road is our favourite place to eat in the whole USA- The Cheesecake Factory. What a revelation, great service, huge meals and all at a great price. The hotel has a buffet

We stayed here because of everything we had read. When we got there we were impressed with the lobby but after that it fell short. The pool is super small and it is totally enclosed with in the building but outside. The room we had was big and worked nicely for us but it smelled musty. The breakfast was free so we aren't complaining but it was so crowded and the variety wasn't the greatest. It took forever for the shuttle to get to this location so we walked in the morning. It isn't that far but after a few days it got old.I don't think we will stay here agin

We come to disney 3 times a year and we always stay at desert palms. The staff is amazing and the location is perfect. We had an issue with the room but the staff took care of it right away. We walk to disney because we save money on parking and we get the chance to stop by at 7 eleven and buy snacks for us. We will be back soon : )

Me and my kids stayed here for the first time and we loved it. We stayed in the kids suite and we even had a view to disney. It was my sons birthday and when we got in the room there was a gift basket in the bed, that made my son feel really happy. I thank the hotel for making us feel very special, it was an easy walk to disney and on the way back we picked up the shuttle because we were tired of walking all day. My kids enjoyed making their waffles in the morning and i saved a little money to use at the park. We had alot of fun in the pool, we will stay here again next time we come to dineyland.

This is our second visit to this hotel and Disneyland.  We stayed in the borrego suite this time fit our family of four comfortably. The staff was very accommodating we wanted more pillow and the had them up to our room promptly. my son had a blast in the pool.  Cant wait to go back love this hotel.

Summary Heading: The staff is great... Location is excellent
Summary: First time staying in this hotel and we will from now on stay here all the time. The room was great and we got a free upgrade to a suit. The breakfast is good, we ate in the patio. The sandbox has delicious food of you stay here you gotta try it. Every time we come to Anaheim we will be staying here.
We loved this hotel, it made us feel like we were home. Great breakfast and location. We will be back soon and definetly stay here again.

we stayed in a kid suit and we loved it. the staff was great and very helpful. we enjoyed the breakfast and it was a very easy walk to Disney. we will definitely stay here again and we recommend families to stay here again. we loved it.

Summary Heading: A bit smoky... June 2012 - Trip to Disneyland
Summary: I booked our stay at this hotel because it's ranked pretty high and I wanted a suite since our children were 4 and 7.  The best thing about this hotel is the location.  10-20 minutes and you're in the gates.    The breakfast was also decent.  Nothing special - but it did go beyond a continental breakfast with eggs and sausage.  We stayed in one of the suites with a bunk bed.  Service was fine - nothing special.  The room was clean enough - although they may need to update in the next few years - especially the bedspreads which we took off immediately - although we always do this.    The main thing that bugged me was that I expected it to be a non-smoking experience and it wasn't.  When we first arrived in the room it smelled pretty strongly of smoke, even though it was a non

Our stay at the Desert Palms was great!  Very friendly staff and felt very safe in your hotel.  We traveled with 2 children and the fact that I saw so many families at your hotel made me feel very comfortable.  The location and walking distance to Disneyland was awesome.

So I just want to stay by saying that the desert palms has an amazing hotel and staff. We arrived at the hotel around two so are room wasn't ready yet. So we sat in the lobby for a little bit and the very nice lady saw that we had seven people in our group and change us to a bigger room that was ready and gave it to us for the same rate. Everybody we talked to was so nice to us and the breakfast was wonderful. Next time we come we will be staying with at the desert palms. We were all very happy with our stay.

Stayed for 5 nights in the kids suite, too small for our family of five. Customer service ok, but we never felt like the staff went out of there way to be friendly. Breakfast was alright, but no variety. Pool very small and gets little sun. On the plus side, an easy walk to Disney, but I think we will stay elsewhere next time.

We recently had a group of 60 stay at the Desert Palms. The staff was friendly and one of the sales associates, Julie, worked hard to accommodate our large group. The room we stayed in was a little older, but clean. The proximity to Disneyland is great- about a 10-min walk to the main entrance. The families in our group were able to come back from Disneyland in the afternoon for their kids to take naps and then return to Disney later on with little hassle. There were a lot of families with little kids staying at the hotel, but that's to be expected so close to Disneyland. The hot breakfast was a big plus.

This hotel is terrible!  Had problems from the second we walked in!  The gave us an occupied room!!!  We walked in on people!  No house phone, had to trek 2 kids and a bell cart back down to the lobby!  Complained gave us another room with out so much as an "I'm sorry"!  Day 2 of our stay....NO WATER!  After being at Disneyland all day we felt so gross and couldn't shower!  Room pics on website are so misleading!  rooms look nothing like the pictures, the pool is discusting and in the "kids" room the balcony has only a timy lock easily opened by a child.  Only good thing...it was close to Disneyland.  We ultimately check out and moved hotels.  Terrible!

Summary Heading: Thank you Desert Palms Hotel and Suites for a memorable trip...
Summary: We booked a Saraha Suite thru Disneyland Travel in Feb 2012.  Our trip was at the end of June 2012.  Our suite was not available the first night, so they gave us the Kalahari Suite.  We moved into the correct suite the next day.  I would highly suggest the Saraha Suite, it has a full kitchen and a seperate bedroom, living room.  We are a party of 6 and stayed there very comfortably.  Save lots of money by cooking your own meals.  The customer service is very good.  The breakfast is great.  10 - 15 min. walk to Disneyland.  Pool and Hot Tub for those aching muscles after a day at the park.  I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Summary Heading: Very good location especially if you are staying with small kids
Summary: We had four small kids - so the proximity to the entrance of Disneyland was quite a plus point. We had booked a suite with two rooms containing four queen beds - located on the ground floor. Breakfast menu was monotonously same for all the five days that we were there. Could have been better with a better variety. Suite had a small kitchen, old fashioned microwave and a tea/coffee maker - but all three were on top of each other and were quite cumbersome to use. The entrance to the suite/lobby was also quite small. Rooms were unequally built and not really twin. Overall plus points were the location and proximity to Disneyland, lot of eating places and a 7-11 convenience store nearby.

This was our first stop on our trip to the USA, it will not be forgotten! The staff were friendly & very helpful in all our requests. The rooms were clean & well presented. The room was the biggest we stayed in when we were in the USA, the drop down lounge area was a nice touch & we could see the fireworks at Disney Land as well, bit of a bonus for us. The included buffet breakfast was also very good too, this was held on the top floor of the hotel & you could sit outside on the roof patio & look at/into parts of Disney Lands California Adventure Park. The leisurely 10 or so minute walk (this was also easy for our 2 children aged 6 & 9) to the front gate of either Disney Land or California Adventure Park was good to let the breakfast digest before being thrown onto the rides, &

My husband and I had a wonderful time here.  Thestaff was very courteous, the room was comfortable, and the breakfasts made my husband very happy. It was a close walk to the convention center and the Disney attractions. I only wish that I could have taken the beautiful weather back home with me!

Great family hotel! We stayed a week while at Disneyland.   Nice hot breakfast. Potatoes, efgs, waffles, cereals, Danish, juice, milk and coffee!!   Rooms were clean. Front desk staff always smiling and helpful!

We visit Disneyland every 2 months and we always stay at Desert Palms! this time we got lucky and got the Yuha suite with a Disney view :-) (room 424).The staff are always great and greet us with smiles..love the free hot breakfast..We Will be backk!!

Summary Heading: Four Stars for the Proximity to Disney
Summary: The four stars are really for the location. You can easily walk to Disneyland, as we did so in under ten minutes with our two young boys. Other positives: parking is underground and free, there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, the suites with bunk beds for the kids are great for families, the free wifi signal is adequate, and the Mojitos downstairs are strong and good! The breakfast is fine for what it is: plenty of decent food options and weak coffee. On the negative side, the rooms really are a bit outdated and run down, and the pool area is cramped. The rooms aren't terrible, just not worthy of four stars. Also, make sure to call ahead for info on the suites as it's not clear from the website which suites have separation and which just have a gate between

I am a life insurance agent from India and I stayed at this hotel during my visit to the US for the MDRT insurance agents meet. I was very impressed with the services provided at the hotel. Keep up the good work.  Thank you Pradip Joshi

Just 5-minute walk to the Convention Center, this is a fantastic choice for business travelers who want to avoid getting gouged by food costs.  As others have noted, the breakfast is great.  Hot scrambled eggs, potatoes, an abundant supply of sausage, a waffle-maker and most everything else you could want for breakfast.  Directly across Harbor Ave. there is a small corner strip mall with a Subway sandwich shop.  So if you stay here, you can eat cheaply for lunch too!  Treat yourself a nice dinner by walking a block or two down Katella to the Garden Walk.  And you can't beat the free wifi.  We used it with no problems or glitches during our entire stay.  To give a comparison on how much you might pay for breakfast elsewhere, I accepted an invitation from a colleague to eat

I often make reservations for a large groups - I've never had as many problem as I've had with Desert Palms hotel and suites. A few of the reservations had to be changed last minute and they messed them up and now I'm being charged for their mistake! While still at the hotel I was told that I would not be charged, yet here I am making multiple phone calls a day and every time they say they "need to look into it" and they'll call me back....I've never had a call back and every time I call they still are no where with it. They keep asking for the confirmation email for these changes...only to find out today that they only send out a confirmation if the customer requests one...really? The incompetence of this hotel staff was so terrible that I am 100% surprised and shocked that

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what you get.
Summary: The good news, the hotel is across from the convention center, and very close to Disneyland. That's where any good news stops...the rooms need to be updated, nothing on the walls, too much space with no furniture (I was in room 217), and there was a crack down the wall where the ceiling met the wall. When the maids are out, the hallways are blocked...three times i had to wait for them to move their carts, and they were in no hurry to do so. Also, When exiting the elevator on the lobby floor, the person I traveled with was almost hit in the face by a door that opened outward into the hall by a maid, who had not bothered to look through the glass window to see if anyone was there...that is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Service areas that open out onto a hall, ESPECIALLY in a lobby

Summary Heading: Great Breakfast and close to Disneyand!
Summary: Family of 5 with a 2, 4 and 5 year old on a week long vacation to Disneyland on Cars Land opening weekend.  Pros: Clean hotel. Comfortable beds. Nice size rooms. Breakfast was our biggest perk for this hotel. Sausage patties, scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, oatmeal, fruit, doughnuts, pastries, cereal, and made fresh waffles with milk or juice to drink! Yum! Saved our family a ton of money on breakfast with it being served daily from 7 am to 10 am! Swimming pool was small but with two families in it when we were there no one was in each others way. Hot tub small as well and more like a hot bath than a jacuzzi. We walked to Disneyland every day for a week and it takes about 12 minutes to walk pushing a stroller. Used the busniness center and printing and computer use with

We spent a couple of days at Disneyland for family vacation and the staff and management at the Desert Palms Hotel in Anaheim, CA were simply excellent.  They were very accommodating and customer driven, going out of their way to ensure that our stay was as pleasant, enjoyable, and comfortable as possible.  We were walking distance (10 mins) to Disneyland and the hotel is very family oriented.  We loved the service and the family breakfast.  This was our first stay there and we plan to stay there again when we return to Disneyland.  Definitely a 'highly recommend' to all of our friends and family.

We really enjoyed our stay at The Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. Compared to some of the other hotels in vacinity of Disneyland, we felt more confortable at your hotel. We stayed in a Yuha suite, which was perfect for our family of 4, 2 adults and 2 teenagers.    Roy N. Sierra Vista, AZ

This hotel has a perfect location for Disneyland and neighboring parks. The room was way more than I expected. The room was very clean, spacious, with a microwave and a refrigerator, and the sunken living room with a second television was a great bonus. Friendly staff all around from the front desk on check in, to housekeeping staff. I have paid more for breakfast that wasn't as good as the free breakfast we had during our stay. Walked to Disneyland with no problem but the front desk offered inexpensive shuttle passes to the park and back. Overall, we had a perfect stay at the Desert Palms Hotel and will defiantly be back. Special thanks to General Manager, Fred Brown .

The hotel is rundown. My room smells dusty/moldy/old. The breakfast buffet is poor quality. If you are here for a convention stay at the major hotels.  All the positive reviews on here are Disney goers.  I guess it's fine for families according to the reviews but I would not bring my family to this dirty place. On the one plus side: their wifi is good.

Summary Heading: Mahalo (thank you) to the Desert Palms Hotel!
Summary: We went to California to celebrate our daughter's college graduation in April 2012. Joining us were one of our sons and his family. I had asked for adjoining rooms but because there were none, we were upgraded to a suite, which fit our party of 8 just great. The hotel was referred by another friend here in Hawaii and we're glad!    Despite the hotel being fully booked, the staff of Nevine, Jenny and everyone else were so courteous. With hungry grandkids, we appreciated the full complimentary breakfast. The kids loved it! The rooms were beautiful and always cleaned when we asked (which we didn't every day because we knew the staff was busy). The front desk staff always answered our questions with a smile and they were so courteous. Everything in the hotel is beautifully

This was our first stop on our trip to the USA, it will not be forgotten! The staff were friendly & very helpful in all our requests. The rooms were clean & well presented. The room was the biggest we stayed in when we were in the USA, the drop down lounge area was a nice touch & we could see the fireworks at Disney Land as well, bit of a bonus for us. The included buffet breakfast was also very good too, this was held on the top floor of the hotel & you could sit outside on the roof patio & look at/into parts of Disney Lands California Adventure Park. The leisurely 10 or so minute walk (this was also easy for our 2 children aged 6 & 9) to the front gate of either Disney Land or California Adventure Park was good to let the breakfast digest before being thrown onto the rides, &

Summary Heading: GREAT place to stay for our family's first trip to Disneyland!
Summary: The location was great...we didn't have to take a shuttle to Disneyland and could easily walk back to our room for lunch and a rest if we wanted to.  We also loved the buffet breakfast included with our room; the pool and hot tub; the friendly staff; our suite with the microwave, fridge, and sunken living room with pull-out bed (worked well for our family of 5--other hotels I checked into didn't offer this type of room) and 2 TVs. The price was right too!  I would stay at Desert Palms again, and I would recommend it to family and friends.

We came to California for my daughters graduation from High School.  This was our second trip to Disney and we stayed at another hotel last time, which prompted us to search for another hotel for this trip.  WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!!!  The Staff at the Desert Palms was TOP NOTCHED!!!!   Dylan, Jenny, Albena and Nevine were AWESOME to us. We have two special needs kids and they were just FABULOUS to them.  The Cleaning staff maintain our rooms so perfectly.  We were amazed at the entire staff.  Everything was CLEAN and everyone is Professional. And the Breakfast was very yummy!!!    You can't imagine the DIFFERENCE our experience was because of our stay there....they really rolled out the red carpet.  Thank you so much and we WILL be back!!!!

This is our fist trip overseas and we were very impressed with this facility. Front desk and service staff very helpful and courtious.Hotel common areas and room we were in was clean and inviting.Having airconditioning was great. Close to resonable priced restaurants and fast food establishments. The complimentary breakfast was adequate to begin a day of site seeing . Within walking distance to Disneyland and close to to other main attractions. Short trip to cheap department stores like Ross"s and Walmart (Very cheap brand name clothing and shoes compared to Australian prices.)We found it to be a very safe area for tourists.

Summary Heading: Fabulous room and the best service at an amazingly great price!
Summary: I had a large order to fill on our first extended family trip to Disneyland and we'd never stayed at Desert Palms before.  Having three men over 6 feet tall and all over 200 lbs makes it a bit difficult for comfortable rooms.  None of the men could sleep on a pull out for any reason.  I found the best deal with Desert Palms.  We got a double suite with 4 queen beds and two bathrooms.  The rooms were spacious, each man got their own bed with enough room to relax after our long days in Disneyland.  The best part was the free breakfast. I was so amazed by the make your own waffles along with a full breakfast bar that my whole family was quite full until lunch.  The hotel is close enough that we walked the two large blocks to the park. We were able to check into our flight when we

Summary Heading: Amazing Room and Service for a Great Price!
Summary: We had never stayed with Desert Palms before.  Now we can't imagine staying anywhere else.  All of the staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful.  We stayed in the Sahara efficiency suite and were thrilled to find that the kitchenette was stocked with cooking utensils and equipment.  The rooms were clean and orderly.  And the complimentary breakfast was amazing!  Much more than I expected and my kids were thrilled with the waffle bar.  Thanks for a great trip!

I just stayed at this hotel and I was very impressed. The location is great, the property is clean and comfortable and staff were friendly and helpful. The property is a fantastic choice for families as the property offers spacious suites complete with tables for meal time and an extra sitting couch. Some of the rooms also have a fantastic view of the nightly fireworks at Disneyland. There are plenty of food options within a 5 minute walk from the hotel for dinner ect. There is also a Mini Mart and 711 next door for any of those last minute things you may need during your trip. All over great choice for families on a budget.

What a great hotel for your family and you could not get closer to Disneyland!  They have a friendly and helpful staff and a great complimentary breakfast.  This is a hotel we will continue to visit as we make trips to Disneyland!

Best parts first: The location of this hotel is great, only 10 minutes' walk to Disneyland. The staff at the reception was attentive, answered questions, gave us maps, made arrangements for a shuttle pick up. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel plus a computer with printer for use by hotel guests in the lobby, easy to manage safe in the hotel room. But .... the hotel room was run down, no cozy atmospheret, a hard uncomfortable softa with a plastic surface in the living room, a very noisy air condition equipment, poor lights in the bathroom, no shower gel, the pool was small and situated in the middle of the building with no space around it. A European booking an American hotel should be aware of that a breakfast buffet usually does not consist of the variety of foods common at

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during our visit to Disneyland. We were pleasantly surprised by the very nice, spacious rooms and cleanliness of the hotel. The staff was courteous and friendly and very helpful. The pool and hot tub (outdoors, but surrounded by walls) were nice and well maintained. Our 3 grandchildren really loved the place--we had adjoining rooms that made it easy to visit. Breakfast had a good selection, but be prepared for family crowds! We had a hot water glitch, but it was dealt with quickly and we received a beautiful snack basket and other considerations from the manager.  It is about a 7 minute walk to Disneyland--with convenience stores and restaurants close by. Would highly recommend it for family groups!

Great location service was great, the rooms where tidy comfy bed free breakfast basic but it's free! Never got a chance to use spa as it was always filled with kids sometimes after 10 at night , but noisy every time the people in room above moved around it woke us up they always had at least half hour showers to our dismay late at night after 11 it sounded like they where in our room , I can understand tho as people came in late after Disneyland , sadly would not stay again but only because when your days are filled up it is nice to be able to sleep at night

Summary Heading: Family Suites, Hot Breakfast and Disneyland!!
Summary: What more could you ask for?!  A comfortable bed for everyone after a long day at Disneyland.  Waking up to a warm breakfast the next day is fabulous.  A short walk to Disneyland.  The rates are very reasonable for the accommodations and location to Disney.  No additional parking fees.  There is also an restaurant/bar adjacent; good for winding down after a long day.  We went with another family for the first time, and will definately be back.

Summary Heading: Close to disneyland good breakfast selection friendly staff
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. Overall an ok place. Good breakfast selection and free parking good location. are room was by the back door which anyone could enter thru since it was broken. Was a very noisy place. Had one of the maintanance workers trying to get in our room one night. Room was very damp and musty smelling. Staff was friendly. Bar has 2.00 beers but is only open until 10

We stayed 3 nights on are way back from San Diego. We have tried alot of other hotels near disneyland but this was the one I will stay at next year. It has a great breakfast to get you started  on your day and the location is perfect, one half block from diasneyland.Also the people at the hotel are friendly and make you feel welcomed. This and a very reasonable rate makes this a five star location, try it you won't be sorry.

We stayed 4 nights this trip. We have stayed here several times. The hotel is clean, quiet, has a good breakfast and a very accommodating staff. Transportation connections are excellent. Location for Disneyland and area attractions are excellent. All this and the rates are still very reasonable. Definitely will be staing here again. Donald V.

Stayed 4 nights in May 12. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable (nice bed and pillows). Free wifi was smooth. Staff were nice, speedy check-in and out, even helped cut cost by advising on arrangement for transport from hotel to LAX. Convenient food outlets - couple of minutes walk and Chinese food, pizza, etc. So nearby Disneyland - walking distance - but alas, tight business schedule, could not visit even if I wanted to relive the memories there of my last visit to Anaheim Disneyland in Dec 96! Nice hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: This place has been our regular place to stay when we go to Disneyland. The rooms are clean and the free breakfast is fantastic. The walk to Disneyland is not long at all and you don't have to cross any major intersections. The price is great for what you get.

We stayed five nights in the Desert Palms Hotel with our kids and grandkids.  It was awesome!!  Two of the families had suites and the other one had a regular room.  We certainly enjoyed the suites...we could all get together and have pizza after a long day in Disneyland.  The hot breakfast was really good...especially the country potatoes and waffles.  Our little granddaughter lost her build a bear which was found by an employee and turned in to lost and found.  She was so happy to have her bear back.  Thank  you Desert Palms for a great week!!!!!

We are 2 Adults and 3 Children and stayed here for 3 nights to see Disneyland. This Hotel was able to accommodate all of us in one large modern clean room.  We could not have been more impressed, it was lovely.  The breakfast was the standard continental.  The Pool area basic, but OK for kids to have a dip.  Everything was clean and beautifully maintained.  It's not more than an 8 minute walk to Disneyland, with plenty of Restaurants and Car Hire outlets nearby.  Plenty of fresh linen, clean towels and hot water.  The bedding was sublime!  Very good value for money indeed and would recommend this to anyone, especially large families like us.

Summary Heading: Disney land for the grand kids
Summary: The Desert Palms was great place to stay while visiting Disney land. We awoke every day, went to the hot breakfest . Then just a short drive around the block to the entrance to Disney land parking garage ,if you need speacal parking needs the Disney land staff will park you close to the Disney park shuttle ,or to handycap parking . Best if you get going by 9:00 due to less traffic . The Hotel parking is a bit limited but you can park along parking garage ramp . Nevine at the front desk was verry helpfull with my wife's handycap needs and room needs. I took one day trip to Lego land , the front desk has directions printted up for most trips . A gps is a good idea to find your way around the big city at $4.75 a gallon for gas. We flew into Long Beach air port and rented a car

Summary Heading: Great place to stay on a Disney trip
Summary: Desert Palms Hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and is a great place to stay with your family.  We stayed in the Yuha Kids Suite, which had a king bed in one area and bunk beds in another.  The two areas were separated by a frosted glass door and each had its own large screen television.  The kids loved the bunk beds!  A free breakfast buffet was offered in the morning.  It was serviced well by the staff, who kept it stocked and the tables bussed.  The location is excellent for a Disneyland trip, allowing you to walk to the park and avoid the hassle of parking.

Desert Palms Inn and Suites was a great pick as a place to stay for our Disneyland vaction. Their staff was so helpful and friendly, the rooms were spacious and very clean, the complementary full service breakfast made our stay even better so that we didn't have to spend time finding breakfast everymorning. We will use Desert Palms Inn and Suites again on our next visit to Disneyland!!

Summary Heading: Stayed here many times its a great and convenient place to stay!
Summary: We love staying here. Staff is friendly and great service. Rooms are excellent easy walking distance to the parks and very convenient. Pool area has limited space but overall very satisfied.

The hotel was very nice!  The staff was extremely friendly, and the breakfast was actually very good. We stayed in the Yuha Kids Suite. I was pleasantly surprised at the room, it was much larger than expected. It was perfect for the four of us. We could have easily fit six people, plenty of beds.  There are video games in the lobby, they are not free. Which is to be expected. I only added this note because prior our trip I was trying to find out if the games were in a special room (and if they happened to be free :)  We will definitely be staying again!.

Our family of seven enjoyed our stay here.  We stayed in a suite.  It was very efficient for our use.   It was not overly big.  Housekeeping always left our room nicely done.  Great walking distance to Disney.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool area is small but also efficient.   We would stay in this hotel again if visiting this area.

Summary Heading: Great location~for those on a budget!
Summary: The Desert Palms is located right next to Disneyland! The hotel is a quick 10 minute walk away from the main Disney gate. Upon check in, the front desk was very helpful and friendly. We parked our car for free which was great! The room was decent, yes there were a few stains on the carpet and dust ruffle, but overall it was clean. We stayed in the two room two bathroom suite. The room fit six adults and one two year old just fine. A bit cozy but not bad. This hotel does have a breakfast served every morning, but after the second morning we were over it. It was the same thing everyday, eggs, potatoes, waffles, sausage, cereal, donuts and oatmeal. A little variation would have been nice~but then again it's free! There is a pool and hot tub that is small, but well maintained. The
The first time in America and was glad to find ourself at the palm hotel. A nice and easy place to spend our holiday. All in All they made us feel welcomed so we could get on with our dream holiday.

I joined my son and the grand kids who were there for a week...I flew in for a one day Disney experience. The hotel is conveniently located...transit to the parks just steps out the front door, rooms are not huge but nice and clean and the property well cared for. The pool is nice, breakfast good with a fun rooftop outdoor dining option and the staff were helpful at every turn. I was in the middle of a real estate transaction and unexpectedly needed help recieving a fax and sending it back. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful and didn't even a chage a fee which was so nice. I had a super early morning departure to catch my plane and the staff was even nice and cheerful at that hour!! I was very  pleased with Desert Palms and the family enjoyed it as well. They

I booked two suites there where 4 adults and 4 grandchildren. Not a huge rooms but they work seprate room with bunks for the kids. House keeping did a excellant job we always returned to a clean room. Breakfast hot and cold food , well trained staff everything was always well stocked. We went to the supermarket the first nightt by cab under ten with a tip and stocked up on beer .wine drinks and snacks for the kids fruit etc. Yes there is a Seven 11 next door but price differences and selection more than covered the cab. .Odd charges never did get a  proper answer Resort fee $ 9.95 per room per day and $1.00 for safety deposit key. It is not a resort small  pool and a weight room. All in all it works good location. .

Stayed for five nights and was very pleased with the stay.  The suite was a little on the small side for two adults and three kids but it wasn't too small.  Breakfast was always busy but the staff always kept it well stocked.  Very nice 10 minute walk on the same side of the street to Disneyland.  Quiet rooms, decent housekeeping service and location made it a very nice stay.
Me and my family stayed at the hotel and we loved it. The breakfast is awesome and HK  a great job every day. The FD staff is very helpfull. We will definitely come back soon.

Summary Heading: Very basic, some good some poor
Summary: Hotel location was awesome for our events planned.  Hotel breakfast was inconsistent - hot foods continually were out and slow to restock; clean tables hard to come by.  Internet service was terrible, sometimes completely out, other times slow.  Room arrangement was great (separated bedrooms), but main bedroom was pretty small for a couple.  Room cleaning service was great.  Parking was great.  Checkout by Nevine was very good.  Staff handling of group that was noisy on one night on our floor - awesome.

went to Cali. to my niece's graduation. got this place on priceline, great price.when we arrived we got bumped to a full suite, which is very unusual when one book's through priceline.anyway's the hotel was 20 minutes to my brothers home, 3minute's to the freeway.if your going to Disney,it's a 10 to 15 minute walk, or there's a shuttle service right outside hotel.hotel was very clean & very quiet.

I can assure our visit to the Desert Palms Hotel & suite was non regretable, i loved the hotel which was clean, well maintained, & the front desk was truly accommadting... the hotel breakfast was great and such a great value. I can assure you i will be going back to this hotel for our next visit to Disneyland. It is walking distance to disneyland, around a 8-10 minute walk. i am extremly pleased with the service, hospitality, and overall experiance... the best part was that they allowed me to keep my car parked the day of check out in their parking lot while i finished the last day in disney!!!  The beds were super comfy, the room was fresh, and it was overall the best hotel i have stayed in.

Summary Heading: Family vacation - Awesome place to stay
Summary: This was our first visit to Desert Palms and i was very happy with our choice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The service was awesome! Upon arrival very late at night we were welcomed and given great service. The location is within walking distance to Disneyland and restaurants which we loved. The location is ideal. My son hurt himself in the pool and the hotel staff were very caring and helpful. They even sent a basket of goodies and a get well card to our room. My son loved it! I would recommend this hotel to all. Thank you Desert Palms for a great family stay.

Summary Heading: Business or Pleasure - Great place to stay
Summary: I have been to the Desert Palms many times both for business and for family vacations.  It is a great location and within walking distance of Disneyland.  I love that you can see the parks from many of the rooms.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean.  The service has always been very good.  The complimentary breakfast is warm and fresh.  There are several stores and restaurants, all within walking distance.  You want a well rounded, all together nice hotel... I recommend the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.

I stayed here recently and i enjoyed my stay.. the staff are awesome and the rooms are really nice. We loved the breakfast and the fact that they have a variety to choose from. I disagree with the bad comments people have said about the hotel because we had a great time. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay for Disney vacation!
Summary: We visit Disneyland every year and this was our 3rd stay at this hotel.  We've been very pleased each time we've stayed here.  Each time, we've been given an upgrade to a larger room at no extra charge (we have 4 young children) and the suites are very spacious and clean.  As a parent, it's very important that the room be clean, especially the beds.  And the carpet is always clean...most hotels, you end up with dirty feet after walking across the room but not here.  The showers are excellent...the tubs drain well.  Plenty of hot water and the toilets never clog.    Oh, and it's a very quiet hotel.  We were never woken by people walking up and down the hallway or from the people above us.    The complimentary breakfast is impressive.  Scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal,

The Bad: My family and I stayed here one night and then left. The rooms are pretty small. It feels like they took a normal room, put a wall in it and called it a suite.  The free breakfast is pretty low quality food that none of us wanted to eat.  The walls seemed really thin. It was a long walk from the elevator to our room.  The Good: The parking is pretty easy under the hotel. And it takes about 8 mins to walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Very Good Value for Hotel Within Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is only about a 7-10 minute walk to Disney's main gate and the entire area is clean, beautifully landscaped and illuminated with street lights and decorative lights in the trees.  You can also pay for a shuttle pass that takes you to many area attractions.  I enjoy walking so I preferred walking to and from Disney.  But the shuttle is very close to the hotel for those that prefer to ride.  The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms are larger than most standard rooms.  The room was clean and neat.  The only exception was an area of floor tile in the corner by the shower that needed new caulking and cleaning (it had a small spot of mildew).  The linens were of standard quality (not as soft as a higher priced hotel but certainly comfortable).  The pool and hot tub are

Summary Heading: The best place to stay for Disney Holiday
Summary: Just checking out of the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites after 13 nights.   I have to say this is the best place to stay for a Disney holiday, and I have stayed in a few over the years.   The room (we were in a Yuha suite) was neat and clean and the beds were very comfortable, bunks for the kids were large and the shower was great.   The king size bed in our room was the best hotel bed I've ever slept in.   There is ample room for the kids to have a bit of space for themselves and watch TV and the seperate bedroom meant we also had our own space.   Staff, particularly Jennifer and Dylan, were awesome and very friendly and helpful.   Pool and spa were clean and perfect after a long day at the parks.   Parking is supplied and easy to maneuver around even in the large SUV we had.

Good location, short walking distance to Disneyland and the Garden Walk shops / cafes. The room was clean and it was great to have free wi-fi, the staff were approachable and friendly. We were in a room facing a busy road so it was very noisy at night.
