Breakfast was included in our package however, it wasn't of very high quality - would have been nice to have fresh fruit available.  Overall, our stay was enjoyable and it's a good hotel for the price and location.

We just stayed here for 3 nights and loved it! Stayed in room 422 overlooking the park and got too see the fireworks on the weekend. Great free hot breakfast and free wifi. Parking was great underground since it was hot outside. Staff was awesome!well stay again.

Summary Heading: Great place for a family in Disneyland
Summary: Disneyland is only a 5-10 minute walk to the front gate.  Hotel is very clean, and great layout for us.  We stayed here with 3 adults and 3 children.  The breakfast was included with our package, and was great for a quick start to the morning.

We stayed here for 7 nights with an 8 month old and a 4 year old in the Sahara suite.  The room had a bit of wear but was clean and pretty functional.  The kitchen layout is a little hard to work in but it saved us a ton of money to eat in the room.  There are no sharp knives and no can opener which is a little weird.  The free breakfast is awesome and the breakfast room staff are great.  The pool is nothing special.  It is about a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland gates and it is a nice easy walk.  All of the staff that we encountered were very nice.  Compared to other hotels, this one is pretty quiet, especially when you consider the large number of kids staying here.  We heard some noise from the hallways but I found it to be pretty quiet overall.  The one major con was the TV

Summary Heading: Made it easy for Single Mom with 2 young kids to go to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was a great value and everyone was so nice!! There was a microwave and fridge in every room and great breakfast every morning. The transportation was easy and quick to Disneyland.   This was a sanctuary for me to find - the rooms are well appointed and comfortable. I was able to stock up for our backpack to Disneyland every day (water, lunchables, snacks, etc.) thanks to the fridge. It was next to a 7-11, a Quickie Mart and 24 hr Subway across the street.  The hotel TV had Cartoon Network AND Disney channels to keep children occupied while I got our things ready. We had breakfast and we were on our own way for a full day of fun.  And if we timed it right, we got back in time for the kids to splash in the pool and I soaked in the wonderful hot tub. It was HEAVEN ON

I enjoyed our stay. We were on a Brownie Troop adventure and were sharing rooms with many other parents and girls. I became ill and the staff was helpful in placing me in my own room and still at a very reasonable rate , even last minute. Great breakfast and very close to Disney.

Summary Heading: BEST HOTEL WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF DISNEYLAND
Summary: This place is great. Great rooms, great location, great prices, great customer service and free breakfast thrown in to boot. Central location to everything.

We have stayed here before about 4 years ago and found that it was very good for our family of 4.  We staying in one of the kids suites with the bunk beds which meant that the kids had their own space.  I good easy walk to Disneyland, a 7 eleven and ABC store right next door which was very handy and restaurants within a 5 to 10minutes walk.  We also spent some time in the bar/restaurant/cafe and the staff there were very friendly. The breakfast wasnt really to our taste but was good value as it was included in the price.

We stayed at the Desert Palm in Anaheim, California from April 28th to May 5th.  The hotel is an older hotel that has been renovated.  We had a double room with two queen size beds.   The room also has a microwave, coffee maker and small fridge plus an ironing board and iron.  The rooms that face the pool are a bit quieter for sleeping than the ones that face the street.  Breakfast is included with this hotel and consisted of scrambled eggs, roasted potatoes, sausages, porridge, some dry cereal,  pastries - donuts, cinnamon buns etc.  Also there was cottage cheese and yogurt.  There is a waffle making machine plus a big toaster with brown and white bread.  The breakfast doesn’t change each day except for the pastries.   The only fruits are oranges and orange juice.  It would

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel right by Disneyland! Going Back!
Summary: The Desert Palms is a beautiful and very nice Hotel just a short walk from Disneyland and CA. The parking is private, and the rooms are all different and unique in their own way. Not to mention the huge breakfast you get every morning, from where you can walk out to a roof top RIGHT behind the new Cars Land at CA! The pool is also very private, right in the middle of the Hotel. We loved our stay here, the staff was very accommodating and everything was top notch. We will stay there many more times!

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay!
Summary: We walked to Disney!  Lots of fun! The breakfast was great.

This was our first trip to Disneyland, and I chose this hotel for the room. We stayed in a Yuha kids suite so that my three kids would all have their own bed. The room was nice and clean. Each evening, when we would go back , the beds were made and we had clean towels. The pool was great. We went swimming every day. We were on the 4th floor, and we could see the fireworks from our balcony. The hotel provides a great free breakfast every morning. It saved us a lot of money. Disneyland is only about a ten minute walk, and there are lots of good places to eat within walking distance. The staff at the front desk was very helpful every time I asked for directions to the beach and to restaurants. I would definitely stay here again. We had a great time.

This is a fabulous hotel if you are after a clean room, friendly staff and a free breakfast.   The Front desk staff are courteous and very helpful - a special thanks to Nevine and Dylan!   The staff in the breakfast room do a great job of keeping the very busy room neat and tidy.   Our room was on the 3rd floor, with a bunked in the bedroom for our 4year old. It was exactly what we needed. The only thing we can Complain about was the stomping family that lived above us!  The walk to Disneyland is a pleasant 15 minutes long.  Plenty of restaurants to choose from only a short walk away and the seven eleven is conveniently located just next door.  We would recommend this place to all our friends, and we will definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the hotel with my family on a kids suite, my kids loved the bunkbeds and me and my wife slept great on the king bed. Breakdfast is delicious and they have a variety of things to choose from. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpfull, we got maps and directions to drive to many places. will stay here every time we visit disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great choice to stay for Disney
Summary: My friends recommend the hotel and we loved it. The breakfast is great and we walked to Disney. The front desk staff arranged some tours for Hollywood and sea world and we had a great time! Alot of restaurants walking distance. We enjoyed every minute of our vacation and we wil definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: loved our stay we'll be back
Summary: Great place to stay. Breakfast is awesome. FD staff was great, from now on this is our fanily hotel,

Summary Heading: great hotel...we will be back soon.
Summary: we had a great stay at the hotel...the room was big and the breakfast was awesome. we walked to disney since it was so close. the front desk staff were very helpfull. we will be back soon.

We stayed at the hotel recently because some friends recommended the place. I loved our room.. we had a newly made room and we had a great view to disney. The breakfast is awesome, we saved some money because we have a big family. We were able to walk to the parks so we saved money on parking. The Front desk staff is very helpful and they always welcomed us back from the parks with a smile. We will be back soon and from now on this is were me and my family will stay. thank you for making our vacation the best one.

Summary Heading: Nice and clean. Will stay there again.
Summary: Family trip with 7, so we got the Kalahari Suite. Only the carpet seemed dated. The room was very clean. Staff was very friendly and professional. The breakfast was very good with lots of variety. Always a wait at the waffle maker. Only about 10 min walk to Disneyland.  The room seemed a little small for being a suite. Fortunately, we usually at the park and didn't hang out in the room. The double bath was a must have. My biggest complaint would have to be the 2nd floor not being accessible from the main elevators. You had to use the secondary elevator, which didn't go to the 5th floor where breakfast is. Lots of elevator dancing and using the stairs to get around.  The room was quiet enough that I often wondered if there were other people staying there. Somebody did decide to

We booked the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites because we wanted some extra room. The suite is larger than the tradition two bed one bath all in one room hotel room but it is not a "roomy" suite. The other negative was our hotel room was very noisy since it faced Katella Ave. and that road is busy from five am until well past midnight and VERY NOISY!  On the upside it was an eight minute walk to the main gate of Disney and because we were so tired we slept through MOST of the horns and sirens from the street.   The hot breakfast was not a high quality breakfast but it was hot and did save us time and money.  The pool and hot tub were basic not very inviting and a little dirty. The Unofficial Guide to Disney rated the pool a 2 out of 10 and I would agree!  Since there are so many
Very clean.  Great breakfast.  Friendly staff that accommodated our special request.  Nice rooms with extra space for the family.  We loved our stay.  Not a far walk from Disenyland.

Great breakfast, saved tons on food. Room was fine, should have gone with bigger room for us buy it was very clean, Comfy beds,. Maid service was fantastic. The hotel was in the middle of some updating, I think it will be beautiful when finished. Walk to Disney for bigger kids, little ones should use shuttle.

The room was great! My husband and I stayed in the suite with balcony.. We spend a lot of time out there.. The balcony is very spacious.  The room was clean and very beautiful! The beds, they are very comfortable..  We can't wait to spend another night there.  The staff always greeted my husband and I when we walked by. They are very friendly? We will definitely be back very soon.

Stayed here for 2 nights for our Disneyland trip. This hotel is recommended for families. We stayed in the Kalahari suite I believe the name is... for our five night stay. Let me tell you this room was nice. two bedroom and two bathroom. this room was perfect for our full family of seven. We enjoyed the breakfast and the staff was nice. They were very attentive, they answered all of our question, and even gave us directions to great places to dine during our stay. Overall it was great and we look forward to coming back next year.
This hotel is nice. I will be back again. The breakfast was great. Not just the usual continental like most.

The hotel and room was beautiful,roomy,and clean.The staff was extremely friendly and went above and beyond.The room was amazing it had a kitchen and a living rm and a balcony(we stayed in the Sahara Suite)it was worth every penny.The free breakfast was great,no cheap box of cereal or donuts it was like going to a restaurant.We enjoyed the jacuzzi and swimming pool.It was nice that we were conveniently located near shops as well as being in walking distance of Disneyland.There was WiFi and tv in the living rm and bedroom.We will definitely be using this hotel again,it was worth every penny.

We stayed in the Yuha Suite with our three small children.  The two rooms were not huge but they were nicely decorated and provided each of the kids with their own bed and we were able to put the kids to bed in their own room.  It was absolutely perfect for our family and the rates were very reasonable.  The breakfast was good and it was an easy 10 minute walk to the parks and that is with a 7 and 5 year old walking.  Helpful staff.  I can't complain about anything.  Would definitely recommend and stay again.

The hotel and the rooms itself are beautifully designed and comfortable.  There are so many things available that were convenient for our squad.  The daily complimentary breakfast was very filling and full of many delicious options.  The business center was very useful for printing out our teams theme park tickets. Our kids got to enjoy the pool, the laundry room was available when we needed it, there's an affordable gift shop in the lobby, and we love that there is a 7-11 next door along with many other food places close by.  The walk to and from Disneyland wasn't all that bad.  Overall we loved staying at the Desert Palms and appreciate the friendly and helpful staff.  This was our teams second stay in two years and we will definitely be back the next time we're in Anaheim!

The staff were very friendly, location is great for getting to Disneyland. Has a 7/11 right next door and Garden Walk shopping centre in walking distance. Family room with king bed and bunk beds for kids is perfect. The free wifi is also a great bonus. Would definately recommend and would stay again.
I had a great time at the hotel..the staff is awesome and I would definately stay here again.
Room was nice. Breakfast was very big and had a lot of choices. A little bit of a walk to disneyland but not bad. Would stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Excellent friendly staff very enjoyable stay
Summary: We had booked a stay at another motel and were not happy with that room but from the moment we walked into the Desertpalms and were greeted by the front counter staff we were very impressed and turned the start of our Disneyland VACATION from a negative into a positive. I rarely write a review but everyone at this motel was commited to making our stay the best.This WAS possibly the cleanest motel I have stayed at and I travel quite regular and have stayed at some of the finest from the Ritz Carlton to Embassy Suites.My hats off to management and crew of Desertpalms.
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was great.  The room was very clean, everyone was very helpful and a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  I woukd stay there again.

Stayed here in March for a trip to Disney.   Pretty good value, but seemed a little high once they added in a resort fee.   Room was nice and big - Yuha Suite. Kids LOVED the bunk beds.   Rooms was clean. Not a tonne of room for relaxing, but we didnt spend much time in the room anyway. Nice to have the fridge so we could chill beer and juice after a long day!  Isn't a high-end hotel if that is what you are after, more family friendly.  Kind of noisey at times, as the walls are pretty thin, but I think that is standard for older, reno'd hotels.  Pool is abit shady becuase it's the centre of the hotel. Used it once. Kids were okay with it.  Lobby was super nice. Kids loved the games and we hung out there a bit.  Breakfast was great for families. The waffles are SOOOOOOOOOO good.

We needed a hotel that was close to Disneyland, the Convention Center, and could sleep 6.  This hotel was able to do all of that.  Both places were within easy walking distance and their suites offered a full kitchen in addition to sleeping 6. The staff was friendly and the facility clean. We already have our next trip booked.

My family went when our daughter had a cheer competition and it was the best.  The staff was so helpful.  The front desk was great and helpful, the maids did a great job, the restaurant was really good and inexpensive especially on friday night when the kids needed to eat and all the restaurants had an hour and half wait!  The pool was clean and easy to watch the kids from many different areas.  Just great great service. Recommend the room with the couch so you have a sitting area along with the bed area.  Location was perfect right across street from convention center, short walk to Disney and California adventures many restaurants and a mall. Thank You Desert Palms..........ladies serving hot delicious breakfast were the best!!!

the hotel was nice with a spacious lobby.  regular rooms were kind of small but we moved to a family room with four beds. the beds were just ok, and the breakfast was nice.  it rained on our second night there, and the ceiling leaked(we were on the top floor) water onto the bed and into my wifes eyes, hurting them for quite a little while because of the painty/dirty water...i reported this to shirley that morning, quite honestly expecting her to say oh well...tough!  but she VERY APOLOGETICALLY refunded my money for both nights. which by the way was not easy because i booked through bookit.com(book through the hotel if you go because they know exactly what rooms are good for you).  anyhow they all really seemed to care about us, even the maintenance manager.  would i go back?

..We stayed at this hotel for the cheerleading competition and loved it. it was across convention center and next to disneyland so we walked to both.. our suite was huge, 4 queen beds 2 baths so we can get our girls ready quick for our competitions..hot breakfast was amazing and plentiful.the staff was great and always smiling :)...we will defietely stay here again!!!

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Big Rooms for a Couple =)
Summary: We stayed at Desert Palms Hotel & Suites for 3 nights. It's a very comfortable room. the bus stop to get a shuttle to go Disneyland is just outside the Hotel 2 minutes walk. or you can walk to Disneyland Park for 10-15minutes walk. The hotel gets fully booked, so if you have a car sometimes the Parking area gets full.. There's a parking at the bottom level and upper level. The room is very clean and bed is very comfortable. and an indoor pool,  and spa, although we been so busy doing our Disneyland tour, we weren't able to try out the pool. They also have a Laundry facility in the hotel, and a free complimentary breakfast.. a lot of choices with bread, sausage, eggs, waffle and orange juice. Will come back again in the future.

Summary Heading: was good enough for us but we wouldn't stay here again
Summary: We flew in from SNA (airport) and called the hotel for guidance. Ended up having to call 2 additional times as their directions were TERRIBLE. We ended up super lost and it was misery. The front desk people were reading us outdated generic directions not current with up-to-date detours and construction. It was apparent they were not super local and although they may work in Anaheim they don't live in the area. No shame or apologies from the numerous people who sent us 20+ miles out of our way.  Check in was pretty painless and although the hotel was fully booked, luggage carts were abundant. Initial impression of our room was great. Bathroom smelled of bleach which is a turn off to lots of people but I find it comforting/soothing and it gives the sensation that the place is
Excellent place to stay next to Disneyland with free breakfast.  Great staff and clean and spacious room.  Will stay there again.

Family of 2 x adults & 4 x kids, stayed in Yuha suite!  Very very happy with hotel in every way!! Brekky included every morning, plenty to choose from! Great location, walking distance to Disneyland & downtown Disney! Would definately stay again :)

We were there for four nights for a conference and Disneyland. The hotel is very convenient to the Anaheim Convention Center. It took us only a few minutes to get to our conference each morning. Disneyland is just behind the hotel, but the walk is a few blocks to the entry gates--still very easy and fast to get there. The hotel's parking and complimentary breakfast make it a great value for hotels in that area. Our room was very clean, attractive, and had all the extras like refrigerator, microwave, iron, and coffee maker. We go every spring, and have stayed in so many of the hotels near the convention center. This was the best.

We ended up selecting the Palms because of the breakfast knowing this trip would be expensive enough just getting into Disneyland. We were very happy with our room it was clean & comfortable. The staff was very friendly & helpful & we enjoyed the pool & hot tub one of the nights we stayed there. The location is very convenient to stores & very good reasonably priced food.   We utilized the ART transit and on our first day we waited a little longet than we had expected however the driver was kind enough to point out if we cross the street we will have a bus pick every few minutes. So that was the last time we we had to wait during our five day trip. We started our days with a smoothy from the juice shop by the bus stop and off to Disneyland we went.  We found this hotel to be our

Summary Heading: THIS is where you need to stay for a perfect disney vacay
Summary: this is the 2nd year in a row that we've brought our college student spring break trip to disneyland and this is the 2nd year in row that we've stayed at the desert palms hotel & suites.  the facility is so super convenient, clean, comfy and awesome. the staff is wonderful, especially albina...what a sweet and helpful lady! we'll be back FOR SURE!

My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms Hotel on March 25 - March 29, 2012.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  It was helpful to have breakfast there every morning and that was actually the main reason I pick Desert Palms was for the Breakfast. I would gladly recommend your hotel to my friends and family.
I had a great stay at this hotel. the staff is awesome and the breakfast is perfect. It is walking distance to disney and we got discounted tickets to the parks.

My sister and I took a girls trip to Disneyland and stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The room was quiet and extremely clean. The staff was helpful and I hope to stay here every time I visit the happiest place on earth!

Summary Heading: Vacation and facilities were top rate!
Summary: We've stayed in several national chain hotels over the years that we have come to Disneyland and we've finally found a place where we will stay again.  We stayed in a child-suite with 4 children.  The bunk beds and fold out couch was plenty of room for the 4 children.  The breakfast was always hot and fresh.  We would have preferred a little more variety, however, there was no complaint.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  We had a situation where one of our children got sick in a bed and the staff was quickly there to retrieve the soiled linens and to remake the bed.  We will definitely stay there again.

A really nice place for the money.  Newly renovated and in a great location.  It took us less than 10 minutes to walk into Disneyland.  They have free parking and Wifi, as we as a good hot breakfast to start your day.  As many have said, the staff is very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay again.
Great place to stay. Room was very clean and hotel was perfect distance to Disney. I will definitely stay here again.  Breakfast was good, not to much and not to little.....just right..

All I have to say is I loved our stay. The staff was super friendly and accommodating upon our arrival. After six hours on the road with two toddlers all I wanted was a comfortable and clean from. And that is exactly what we got! clean, spacious, and  very comfortable. We were able to fit two cribs without compromising space. I was very grateful for the free wi-fi! I can't say it enough, this is definately a great place to say!

The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms looked a little outdated, but they were great for the 3 adults and 3 kids.  The pull out bed from the couch was uncomfortable, but we let the kids sleep on that.

I stayed at the desert palms hotel because some friends recommended the hotel and i gotta say that we loved it. Since we got there the staff was very friendly and kind, we got to check in early and we also saved time buying the tickets at the desk. Jennifer was very helpful explaining to us the area and the tips to enjoy Disney better. I would definitely go back and stay here with my family, the breakfast is awesome and also a very short distance to walk to the park.
Good location, easy walk to disneyland, decent breakfast, clean room,w 1 great choice for a disneyland stay.

Me and my family really enjoyed our stay in this wonderful hotel. The check in process was really easy, and so was the checkout service. Our room was nice and clean and we were able to find everything we needed in our closet (extra blankets for the sleeper sofa). The beds were extremely comfortable and the sheets were clean. We appreciated the fact that in the Borrego suite, there was two TV's in there. While looking at other hotels to accomodate our party (4 people) all they had was one TV in the room and they were asking for more money. We really enjoyed the separate sunken living room, it gave us a sense that we had two rooms when we only had one. The free continental breakfast was really nice. The seating arrangements were kind of off though. Though we did enjoy eating on

I have stayed at this hotel in the past and should have done this the first time also! I think this is a great hotel! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The hotel does offer a nice breakfast! Eggs, waffles, sausage, bacon, potatoes, oatmeal, yogurt, toast, pastries, cereal, fruit, it is a really great breakfast! I was offered a suite just because. The suite with the stairs in it. The first time we were in the room with the sliding glass door. The rooms are very nice! One thing that I loved was ALL of the bedding gets washed!! Even the bedspread!!! That was great because of the stigma that comes with hotel bedspreads! It is in a great location! They have a shuttle that pics up across the street every five minutes. And picks up from Disneyland every twenty minutes on

Great place to stay! The room was very nice they have just been remodeled which made them up to date and very clean! The location was just awesome! It was so close to the entrance of the park! It was also in walking distance of many restaurants and places to shop which kept everyone happy and busy. I couldn't think of a better place to stay. The price is right and the location is perfect. You must stay at this hotel!

I will start off by saying that our stay was a great experience. From the moment we booked our room over the phone to the day we checked out everyone was so helpful. The staff at this hotel are incredibly kind and very informative. Also I'm a complete germaphobe which makes it very hard to be comfortable in many hotels. Luckily The whole property is very well kept, the housekeeping left our room immacluate which made the stay amazing and worry free. There is also a restaurant inside the hotel that has good food but even better offers happy hour!! and that was a plus for me. To top it all off if our stay was not perfect enough we also recieved a free upgrade to a suite which had a full sized kitchen in it which was great since we stayed for four nights and it helped so much to be

This hotel was just so nice. The location is fantastic it is literally a 5-10 minute walk just like they said it would be to the Disneyland entrance. All the staff are very helpful at the front desk anything we seemed to need they would take care of with a smile. The amenities are amazing in the rooms and the whole property is immaculate. The best part about the hotel was the fact that they sell Disney park hopper tickets at the front desk, it saved so much time and was so effortless to put it on our room and head to the park for the day. We also saved so much money with our stay by having our complimentary breakfast that is not continental! but a full breakfast that was included with our stay. I would recommend the Desert Palms hotel to anyone who is looking for a great place

I’m very particular about hotels I stay in and usually choose a five star but a friend recommended the Desert Palms to me and I LOVED it!   My family and I stayed in the Escalante suite at the Desert Palms Hotel and had a wonderful time. It’s only two blocks from Disneyland and my 7 year old had no problem walking back and forth. We actually timed it and it took less time walking then taking a bus or shuttle. The room was fantastic, very clean and kid friendly. We had two queen beds and a large bathroom that divided the rooms. So we had two doors blocking the sound of noisy children and that made the grownups happy. The kids loved the second room it had a bunk bed with stairs, pullout couch, TV and a little table and chairs.   We also enjoyed the FREE breakfast and it wasn’t

I stayed at the hotel because i heard it was close to disney and it is.. It was soo easy for my family to walk right around the corner.  We were able to buy the tickets at the FD and that saved us alot of time. We got a great rate by calling directly to the hotel, they seemed to offer the lowest prices. We also saved money on the breakfast every morning it was delicious, they have variety of things and we served as many times as we wanted. The front desk staff are great, they were very helpful and answered all our questions. We had dinner at the Restaurant they had on site and our burgers were great. We loved our kids suite with bunkbeds and we would definately stay here again next time. I recommend the hotel for families.

Summary Heading: Not to shabby, but not very informative either
Summary: We stayed here on a package I booked through Costco travel and was a little hesitant due to the mixed reviews.  But for the price (we got the 4th nt free and many free extras with Costco) I couldn't resist.  We arrived around 3pm or so and they said it would be ready in about 30 minutes or so.  I had asked for a room close to an elevator due to we had a baby and LOTS to carry.  We were put in the farthest room from the elevator, actually one room away from being as far away as you can get.  Luckily when we checked in they had a luggage cart, but we were not so fortunate when we checked out. It is very close to Disney, about 10 minutes like other people said, but on the last day we were there we were told about discount bus tix that pickup across from the hotel and drop off in

You must stay at this hotel!!  The staff is amazing, accomodations are perfect for multi night stays, amenities are bountiful and the property is immaculate!  Perfect location for Disneyland and surrounding restaurants.
A short walk from Disneyland! Had a great breakfast, rooms were clean, and overall great experience! Was a little noisy but we expected that with all the kids excited for Disneyland!

Great stay we really enjoyed close to Disney older property but super clean. Staff very nice and free parking wow what a nice place. Thanks again.. Only problem the fan in the room made a horrible noise when the ac was on kinda weird but we lived through it.

We were just there for one night, but wished we'd stayed longer.  We received an upgrade to a "suite". The hotel has recently been redecorated.  It is clean, comfortable and well appointed with a fridge and microwave.  We would have rather had a king-sized bed, but they didn't have any.  That was really the only thing we found exception to.  The complimentary breakfast was ample. It was well worth the price, especially with the discounted Disneyland tickets!  The location is great as well.  We were able to walk to the Park. We'll be back everytime we go to Disneyland!

The hotel is well run and staff are competent. Rooms are typical 3 star rooms. Bedding feels like sand paper and takes several nights to get used of. If you have a room facing the road you will likely hear every car. Overall good hotel for kids as the price is cheap but if you want sleep stay somewhere else.

Desert palms makes it look like a good price, but upon check in they charge a $12 a day resort fee, a $30 nightly room fee (on top of the nightly room rate they quote you), and then they charge the 17% tax.  Not so good of a deal as they make it seem on website. Call before booking to get total price. Rooms clean but can hear e everyone stomping around -wont stay here again.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for one week and had an enjoyable experience.  We had a standard room for 4, which was on the small size, however we were only there to sleep, rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was nice every morning, plenty to choose from and it did get packed.  Kids enjoyed swimming in the pool.  We mostly used the shuttle to get back and forth to Disneyland, but walked the short 10 minute walk a few times.  I would recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for a close place to stay to Disneyland or Convention Center.

Stayed at the Desert Palms from Feb.11-18 and really enjoyed our stay. We spent 4 days at Disneyland and the other days taking in the other attractions in Southern California. We were served by Jennifer when checking in and had great service. We  were upgraded to a room with a sunken living room which was so nice since we were spending 7 nights and there was 4 of us. It was nice to have the extra floor space for luggage and extra sitting/relaxing space. The buidling is clean and the rooms were cleaned well each day. The breakfast buffet is really convenient and saves a family alot of money. While the menu doesn't change from day to day it did have enough selection. We were wishing they had peanut butter to go with the jelly they provide, so I bought a small jar at the

we have nothing but the highest praise for the desert palms hotel & suites Anaheim resort on west katella. we have stayed there 6 times in the past 10-12 years and each time the service,staff and all amenities have been outstanding. we have traveled with children and grandchildren and have never been disappointed in the slightest way. our time there is simply wonderful and relaxing. the staff always go out of there way to ensure all our needs/wants/requests are met in the most friendly and efficient manner. the rooms are large, comfortable and extremely clean. i cannot recommend the hotel too highly. we are customers for life! thank you. bob.nelson@att.net

I want to start off saying this is my 4th Hotel stay in the Anaheim Disney area, so I have some experience with hotels here.  I am very surprised by other reviews of this place.Me & the kids stayed Feb. 16th-18th . I made my reservations 3 months in advance and called the week before to check that everything was OK, I was told yes my res. was there and they had no problem with putting our 2 rooms on the same floor. I wasn't asking for next to each other or anything just the same floor. We ended up arriving early I went to the front desk and asked if we could park the car and go to Disneyland they we great about it and said yes. I then double checked that our Res was still OK for being on the same floor in the rooms I had booked and was told it was fine. After a full day in

Summary Heading: Exceptional Family Hotel for trip to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: We were surprised to find such exceptional service and value. The employees were very helpful and accommodating. With 2 queen beds in one room and a fold-out couch and adult-sized bunk-beds in an adjoining room, this was the only hotel we could find within a ten minute walk of Disneyland which slept 6. Each room had a flat-screen TV, full closets, and the main room had a small fridge. We had a late flight the day we checked out so they allowed us to keep all 12 pieces of our luggage in a secure room and continue using the heated pool and hot-tub till our shuttle arrived. But what we probably liked best was the complimentary hot buffet breakfast every morning. Which included scrambled eggs, hash-browns, sausage,  fruit, hot and cold cereal, milk, orange juice, coffee, and donuts,
We enjoyed our stay and will come back because of the comp breakfast, service and the close proximity to Disneyland. The service was great. Our door handle broke and it was replaced within 15 min.

What a nice thing to do!  Desert Palms offered me a 10% discount on my next visit for offering my opinion and I am glad to do it!   It will come in handy as I do plan on staying at the Desert Palms during my next visit. My husband, mother and myself enjoyed 3 nights in a suite on feb 3 -5, 2012. We spent one day in Disneyland which is conveniently located within walking distant. The free parking you offer is a luxury. I have paid over 18 dollars a night at other hotels in the vicinity. The room, pool area, lobby and breakfast room were always clean. Towels were always available and the free breakfast is well stocked with a variety of foods. It was impressive and the price is great.

We crammed six humans in this family suite. There was not alot of floor space but the king bed was comfortable and we put the teens in the bunks and the 3 and 6 year old on the sofa bed. We had great sleeps all the way round.  The room was clean all though ready for some carpet and paint touch ups, understandable as it was a little tight.  The breakfast was well laid out and lots of tables and despite many guests, flowed well.  We were in a easy walk, less than 10 min to the park entrance.   We did not use the pool. If i stayed again I would take the larger family suite.  On check out i saw the espresso bar in the far corner of the lobbly,  too bad the coffee for breakfast was awful  and no real cream.  they  lost at least 10 dollars a day that I would have spent on coffee just

After researching hotels for an over night cost efficient stay by Disneyland... I am happy to say this hotel met  my expectations.  The front desk staff was helpful and friendly.  We were able to check in early (1:30pm) and were upgraded to a "suite" without asking when a standard king room was not available yet. Our room was very clean, however, quite basic. Given the price, this was not surprising.  The room was quiet at night and the bed a little hard, but sleepable.  The free hot breakfast in the morning was perfect and we found plenty of food available even when we went to eat the last half hour it was being served (9:30am).  The hotel is walking distance, a few blocks, to the park entrances.  **TIP:  The hotel next door, Candy Cane Inn, has a free shuttle to/from the park.

Summary Heading: Well Located and value for money
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights.  Two adults and three teenage boys.  We booked a room over the net that was to suit the 5 of us and when we checked in it was not suitable as it had no bed for the 5th person.  They changed us into a family room for an extra $39 a night that was more suitable. Which was fine, but then there was no hot water and we had to try 3 times to get it fixed.  On the second day of putting up with this after a long flight from Aus my husband was once again complaining to the girl at reception and threatening to change hotels.  The manager overheard this and promptly said that we would be moved to new rooms at no extra charge and we were not charged the upgrade for the room with no hot water.  The rooms were clean and quite large and the Hotel is conveniently

My recent week stay during a busy trade show trip was made even more enjoyable by the spacious, cheerful, clean room at this hotel.  Daily breakfast buffet included in the cost of the room helped accomodate my busy schedule and made the trip even more affordable.  Courteous staff, conveniently located walking distance from convention center, restaurants and activities. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.
Friendly staff, excellent value, quiet.  Delicious breakfast with a good variety of food.  Walking distance to Disneyland!

My staff and I stayed at the hotel during the CHA convention. It was within easy walking distance to the convention center. It was great to have so many choices for breakfast. The room was big enough that we could hold mini meeting while having breakfast.   The rooms were clean and comfortable but a little small.  We had mini meetings in the bar in the evenings which was a nice way to relax. The menu was small but the food was great.

Stayed in room 424 from 1/27-29 for a Disneyland trip.  We have three children ages 4 and 2 years, and 3.5 months.  Had previously stayed in an Anabella Mission Suite, but needed a bigger bed for the older kids and the Anabella second "room" was more the size of a large closet.  The second room size and bunk bed of the Yuha room were perfect. The bunk steps were sturdy and the upper bunk rail felt secure so we weren't worried about our 4 yo rolling off. There was also a sofa bed in the room, but the room is large enough that we were able to roll in our sit n stand stroller with room to spare.  Main room had king bed with just enough room on left side to slide in the pack n play we brought.  Big room sized fridge, but we had to turn it on when we arrived so we had to find ice to

Our stay was TERRIBLE!  You can hear every single sound in practically every other room on the floor.  We hardly slept a wink.  The bathroom had mold spores growing on the ceiling, and we had to request that they clean it.  It was a NIGHTMARE, and I couldn't wait to get home.  Even though the breakfast was free, we chose to eat elsewhere after the first day because it was AWFUL!!!!!

I stayed at desert palms hotel and it was a pleasant stay. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. They went beyond there way to help my family in all our needs, thank you very much it made us feel like home and appreciated. The walking distance to Disneyland is very close right around the corner. The breakfast is great and when you have a lot of kids it helps you save some money. I would definitely stay again in this hotel and would recommend it to all my family and friends. We will be back very soon thank you.

Summary Heading: Great value & excellent llocation for Disneyland Resort.
Summary: This was a very nice hotel that was ideally located to not only the Disneyland Resort, but many other attractions and vacation amenities. The room rate was very reasonable, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were kept very clean and well supplied. You could walk to the Disneyland Resort if you wanted; resort shuttles and busses stop right out front and it is a very short drive to all attractions if you prefer to do that. My wife and I had a great time largely in part to having such a nice, centrally located hotel to stay in.

We stayed in a suite type room. ie 1 long room with 2 section with 2 double beds.  in the middle were double wash basin area and 2 rooms with Toilet and shower. This wasnt 100% ideal for layput, but suited us as a family--4 adults and 2 children 4, 6  In the inner room that backed onto the pool atrium, the noise levels were noticeable at time. This wasnt too bad as the pool open hours seemed to be adhered too.  Lifts--sometimes there was asmall wait for lifts. Definitely nothing too frustrating  Breakfast--up a few floors with an cement outdoor area with fixed outdoor type tables cereal, toast, fruit, waffles, coffee, juice tea.. And hot food..scambled eggs, meat type patties, fried diced potatoes  The rooms and facilities were clean and presentable. It was handy being able to

The Hotel was bright and well maintained. We were very pleased. Walk to the closest corner and turn left without crossing the street. Walk about 2 blocks and you're at Disney. It was great, then to make it better they upgraded us.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We took our children to Disneyland and stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel. Our experience was nothing less than wonderful.  It started and ended with a welcoming smile from Nevine.  She was so good to our little family.  I assume she is an employee, but treated us as if she was an owner.  She and every employee we saw in the halls greeted us with smiles and always offered to assist with what we needed.  The hot breakfast was great. My kids are picky eaters and they all found something they enjoyed. The pool is warm and we had fun swimming.  When we return to Disneyland we will definitely stay at the Desert Palms Hotel.  Thanks Nevine you are truly an asset to your company!!!!

Let me start with the pros....Free Parking, 10 min walk to Disney & CA Adventures, free breakfast, friendly staff.  Now the cons....resort fee of $10 per day, very loud with lots of children, rooms could use some updating.  All in all my husband and I had a good stay.  We booked thru priceline so the rate was good.  I dont know if I would have been as pleased if we would have paid full price.  Check in was easy.  We arrived early and the front desk clerk gave us a parking pass so we could go on to Disney and check in later when our room was ready.  Very nice of them so we didnt have to pay $15 to park at Disney for the day.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast wasnt "great" but good if you have a bunch of kids to feed in the morning.  My husband

We had a great experience here! The room was perfect, the location was ideal, the free parking was a huge sell and the free breakfast was very appreciated. Also, they provided a discount for Disney Annual Pass holders, so that's another plus!

We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites for our daughters 9th bday! Location was great as it only took us 5 mins to walk to Disneyland! Staff was friendly and helpful! Breakfast was pretty good. rooms and hotel were very clean. We enjoyed having the kids in their own room with their own tv as the 2 bedroom suite offers 2 tv's in the rooms. The kids also enjoyed some time in the pool. Not a huge pool but good enough for the kids to play in for a few hours. We will def!!! be back! The price was very reasonable! We will happy with how comfortable the beds were too!

We viewed many properties on line before booking this hotel.  We were traveling as a family of five, (two adults and three children) which makes it difficult to book a standard room.  We were happy with our "suite" as there was lots of room.  The kids enjoyed the buffet and the pool.  The proximity to the park and the Garden Walk Mall is also good. We would stay here again.  Only one negative; they have to do something about the bathroom fans, they are beyond loud.  You cannot turn the light on in the bathroom at night for fear of waking up everyone.  Tip:  Food for Less is about about a mile west on Katella and we were able to purchase everything we needed to make lunches to take to Disney.

I stayed for 2 nights, its very central to Disneyland and the Convention centre, plenty of restaurants around too. Some other reviews mentioned the hot water or lack thereof, i had a ground floor room and had no issues whatsoever. The staff were friendly and room clean. For the price is was a great stay, no issues with parking either

We really enjoyed our stay.  We found the breakfasts were wonderful.  We ate at a table outside on the roof every morning and enjoyed the sunshine.   The only complaint we would have ( and it is a very minor one) is that there was two of us in our room and there was only ONE coffee package each morning - when two of us like a bit of coffee while we are showering and getting organized for the day, we were down to a half a  cup each  -   hardly enough to get going on!!!:-) And maybe some tea bags, herbal and regular would be nice for in the evening. Your reception staff were very helpful and cheerful, and the daily cleaning of the room was good.

We really had a great stay at desert palms hotel. We thought the suit with two queen beds and the living area with the fold out bed was perfect for our family of grandparents, parents and two kids. It allowed us to save money on our hotel stay and not feel cramped, which made our Disneyland experience all the better. Also, after much comparison, we were able to pay less for our great suite than several nearby hotels for a regular room ( even places we've stayed before, and enjoyed). We will definitely stay at the dessert palms again! Thank you!  Kendra Eklund

Room is big, can accommodate to 5 adults in a room. Breakfast not much choices, everyday the same. But with the price paying,can't ask for more. Quite near to Disneyland, about 10 mins walking distance from hotel. There is a 7-Eleven right next to hotel, quite convenient as you can get drinking water, cup noodles, sandwiches, burger etc....you won't go hunger!

I had to go to an Convention in Anaheim and this resort is right between the Convention Center and Disneyland-walk or take a shuttle, many restaurants nearby, clean, plus Free Hot Breakfast a great idea

Arriving at the Desert Palms we were greeted by a smiling face and a pleasant attitude.  We were unable to check in early (we arrived at 11am), but were offered free parking while we headed over to Disneyland.  When we came back at 3 and checked in...my disappointment began.  We requested to be on the same floor as the other family we were staying with, and were told that would be fine, but when we got our room assignments, we were on different floors.  Not the end of the world, but it would have been fun to be together.  We were on the 4th floor, and when we got off the elevator, it was like a sauna.  Understanding that the weather has been unseasonably hot for January, I thought it was just a fluke, and would be better by the time we got back at night.  When walking down the

Summary Heading: The best hotel to stay in while visiting Disneyland!!
Summary: We stayed in the Yuha Kids Suite which includes two rooms, one with a king-size bed and the other with bunkbeds and a sofa-sleeper. First off I will get the few not so positives out of the way.   1-  The rooms are not as big as the website makes you believe.  When you walk in there is the room with the king bed which has the bathroom attached to it.  This is about the size of a normal hotel room.  On the other side of the bathroom was the extra room which was basically big enough to fit the two beds and that is it.  So don't think you're getting this huge room, it isn't much larger than a regular hotel room. 2-  The king bed and the sofa-sleeper were not very comfy.  I slept ok in the king bed, but my wife had a harder time.  I would not reccommend anyone in the sofa-sleeper

We had the Kalahari Suite which comprised 4 very comfortable queen size beds in two rooms with 2 bathrooms.  We are a family of 4 which includes 2 teenage boys (16 & 17) and we found the room was well suited to us.  The location to Disneyland was excellent (only a 10-15 minute walk) and it was also close to public transport.  The included breakfast was good enough to fill up on for the days activities.  We would definitely stay there again and would suggest it to friends and family.  It was close to lots of restaurants and take away places. The only problem we had were with the people in the room above us running in their room late at night while we were trying to sleep.  This is not so much the the hotels fault as the people in the room above us! The staff were all very

We are a family of 4 with a Yuha Suite.  This was great value for money, but not a lot of spare space.  The room was very clean with comfortable beds.  The breakfast buffet was adequate consisting of cereals, donuts, pastries, waffles, bacon, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausages, toast, coffee, juice, oatmeal and oranges.  We found the laundry's washer and dryer very convenient at $1.25 per cycle.  Ask for a room at the back of the hotel as we had a tiny balcony but it overlooked California Adventures and we were able to watch the Disneyland Fireworks show every night.  Another great feature is the location of this hotel as it was only a 10 minute walk to the entrances for Disneyland, California Adventures and Downtown Disney.  We also loved the 7 Eleven store next door which had

Very disappointed.  We have stayed at several different hotels around Disney and this by far the worst.  The people above us I think were doing laps in their room all night long.  The towels were thin as paper, no padding in the floor, rooms for a family of 4 were cramped.  We stayed 5 nights and maybe slept 2 of those nights, very noisy.  We mentioned this to the front desk and well when you hotel is full they don't really care.  The only thing that saved it was the free hot breakfast and free parking and the fact that it was Christmas and everyone else was booked up or we would have left after the first night.

We are a family of 5 so hotels are always a challenge.  We could book two adjoining rooms, but we normally prefer a family suite wherever we can find one.  Desert Palms stood out among Disneyland hotel options because of the affordable Borrego Suite, the free breakfast and convenient location (backs up to the south end of California Adventure park).  We found the hotel to be very clean - the lobby area was current and attractive, and the rooms were decently decorated.  Much nicer than some of the other "budget" hotels around the resort (including the similarly named Desert Inn across from the park entrance - don't get them confused, THIS is the better of the two).  The free breakfast was served on the top floor, with both indoor and outdoor seating.  Indoor was packed so we

We stayed here approx. 7 yrs ago, b4 rennovation and were happy, so decided to return, as the price was excellent and we knew where it was in proximity to the parks.  Wow!  They did a great job on remodel.  Our room was very clean, bed comfy, extra pillows and blanket, hot water, no threadbare towels.  Always had plenty of towels and washcloths.  Heater worked fine.  We arrived around 11 a.m. and did not expect our room to be ready, so we planned to ask them to store our luggage so we could immediately go to D'land.  Instead, the very friendly receptionist told us that she had an available room, but it was a suite and she would upgrade us at no charge.  Wow again!  Thus, we were able to check in, get what we needed for the park from our bags and not have to worry about checking

Summary Heading: Very Clean With No Major Hiccups
Summary: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Desert Palms for a trip to Disneyland.  Check-in was quick, easy and the desk clerk was very friendly and helpful.  We were given room 425 which has one king bed and a sofa bed.  The room was divided into a bedroom and small living room type area.  We had 2 tvs, a mini fridge, microwave and other "typical" amenities.  I must say that the room, including the bathroom, were EXTREMELY clean!  The bathroom was very large and had a separate vanity area with a sink.  The furniture was a little dated and worn but served its purpose.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable and clean as well.  Bathroom towels were a little thin but again, served their purpose.  Hot water was never an issue as stated in other reviews.  Breakfast is served daily

Ok, this hotel was nothing fancy but it worked out just fine for our family. We considered staying on the Disneyland 'campus' but decided against doing so and we're glad we did. The rooms were nothing special but the beds were very comfortable and clean. The best part...the breakfast buffet to fill us up before heading off to the parks, the free parking, and the close proximity to Disneyland/California Adventure. Our room overlooked the pool which could've been a little noisy but we like to sleep with a sound maker anyway so in this case we used their fan/AC unit and we slept fine. One interesting tidbit we've never experienced before was there are 3 elevators that essentially go different places. Our room was accessed by one specific elevator to get to the 2nd floor, the garage

Good place to stay regarding the safety, 10 minute walking distance to Disneyland, plenty of parking space, clean room but not fancy and kind of small, hot breakfast (scramble eggs, sausage, hash brown, waffles, o-juice, milk, donuts, fruits). Lots people complaint it's noisy but we chose to stay on the back side, instead of facing street and not many kids around our hallway, so we're ok. Also, people complaint it's too far away from Disneyland. I just don't understand how come people can spend 8-10 hours wondering at Disney on foot, but not able to spend 10 minutes walk to the gate. I walked with my 6 & 10 years old girls there everyday and heard no complain from them at all.I believe people who complaint it's too far away must  have taken the wrong route. It happened to us

We spent our first two nights in Anaheim at this hotel, before moving on to the Howard Johnson.  The first room we were given was a king room on the third floor - we needed twin beds for the adults (mother and daughter) - so we requested a room change.  The person on reception was quite willing to help and she was able to change the room for us.  The second room was much better - and substantially larger - with a much bigger separate bedroom with bunk beds for the children.  This room was #114 and it was on the ground floor of the hotel.  It looked directly into the hotel's parking lot.  First impressions of the hotel are that the carpets need replacing and the bathrooms need updating.  The twin basins in the hall between the bedrooms was handy, with the toilet and shower in a

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is a great place to stay with such a great location.  We really enjoyed the hotel & staff was always nice & ready to help at all times.  Our room was very clean & comfortable.  Kids loved the pool & the breakfast was awesome.  This is the only place we will stay at when visiting again. . . Thank you to the management & the entire staff for making our stay the most enjoyable.

Summary Heading: Wonderful, planning our return stay now.
Summary: This was our families 3rd visit to Disneyland and we have finally found the hotel we will always return to.  We have 6 children so finding a hotel that accomadated us, had great food and close to Disneyland was no easy feat, but we found it all here.  We will be staying here again next year.

We have stayed at several other hotels in Anaheim as this is our 4th time to Disneyland.  We chose to stay at the Desert Palms due to their ads saying it's walking distance to the park.  We read several other reviews on Tripadvisor stating "Yah Right! Not close at all" but we took our chances and stayed there anyways.  Well.... YAH RIGHT! it is almost 2 full blocks away and by the time you've walked around the parks ALL DAY with 2 kids, knowing you still have to walk that far back to your hotel was disheartening, to say the least!  Also, the shear amount of SCREAMING kids at the hotel was too much to take.  I know this is not the hotels fault, but we feel that people stay at this hotel with really young kids due to the fact there is a free breakfast (which was NOT that great.

We have stayed at many hotels around the Disneyland Resort! But none come close to this wonderful hotel! It was recently remodeled and rooms are always clean! we have stayed here three times in 2011 and will be returning in 2012. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland Gates !  Not only are the rooms spacious and clean the maid services is wonderful! my mother who went with us this previous time lost her diamond necklace , and when we returned to the room it was waiting on the night stand for her! Staying at the Desert Palm Inn & Suites is like coming home after a long day at the park! While staying at this wonderful hotel you get a complimentary hot breakfast, most hotels just serve juice & pastries. NOT the Desert Palm!They serve a full breakfast with healthy options

I'm an annual passholder who has stayed at many of the hotels near Disneyland from the Grand Californian to Travelodge.  I can tell you, I was pleasantly surprised by the Desert Palms.  The room was very clean, the housekeeping and front desk staff were excellent, and best of all the beds were extremely comfortable.  I don't usually give reviews, but I'm hoping that by doing so I will be able to encourage the hotel management to keep the prices reasonable so I can come back and visit again. The breakfast wasn't any culinary delight, but it filled us up, was warm, and was offered plenty of variety over the continential breakfasts offered by other hotels.  I have a 15 yr old, 13 yr old, and 5 yr old and all were happy with the food, the beds, and the pool!  :-)  No doubt about it,

I went to Anahiem, CA with some friends and stayed at Desert palms hotel and suites.  The rooms were clean, service was great.  the continental breakfast was pretty good.  its location is great too!  My friends and I had a great time.  and much of it was thanks to the hotel.

My boyfriend and a couple of friends came to Anaheim and stayed here at Desert Palms Hotel and Suites. Our stay was fabulous. The staff was fantastic and very professional, nice, and made our stay exciting and fun. I'd recomend anyone if they are looking for a place to stay in Anaheim to stay here at Desert Palms!

We have a large family and when we travel it is beneificial to have at least a microwave and fridge. We had that and more. Our suite had a full kitchen, living area and seperate room with two beds. We were able to cook dinner in the room and had free breakfast provided by the hotel. Since we stayed for three nights this allowed us to save our money for treats and souviners from Disneyland, which we were within walking distance from. We are annual passholders and this hotel offers discounts for that which is nice. I thought it was only the big three resort hotels that did that. Again a huge savings for us. We were pleasantly surprised and will definietly stay here everytime we go to Disneyland.

We stayed here for the first time for 3 nights.  The hotel was very close to Disneyland and next door to 7-11 and an ABC market.  The rooms were clean (a bit small) and the staff was professional, friendly and helpful.  The walls were thin (we could hear the pipes) when other rooms used water.

Totally, great! We stayed here  2x already , and it was always good! Clean, free breakfast, and not to mention free parking....while other hotels charges you expensive parking fees, which is ridiculous, by the way...Not to mention, one of the closest walk you can get near Disneyland---same block!! Near 7Eleven right next to it-- you can buy your snacks for cheaper prices, late snacks or meals.....my kids love their pool too.....I highly recommend it!!!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Place to Stay for Families Visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is the second time staying at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites and have been impressed both times.  This is a nice hotel that taylors to families visiting Disneyland.  We have stayed in the Yuha Kids suite, which is a room with 1 king bed, and in a seperate room with a pull out bed and bunk beds.  It is a perfect size for our family of five.    One of the key draws for our family is the full breakfast.  It consists of wafles, scrambled eggs, sausage, potatos, with the other traditional fare.  When you combine what you save for breakfast with the room price, you get a great deal.  The hotel is a 10 to 15 minute walk to the gates at Disneyland, so its location is wonderful.  One of the ways we experience Disneyland is that we get to the park when it opens, go back at noon for

From the moment we walked in until the moment we walked out 10 days later, it was a pleasure staying at the Desert Palms Hotel and Suites.  I must say that both my family and I were very pleased at the reception we received from both attendants upon arrival.  They were extremely helpful with getting us settled in and booking the events we wanted.  Thankfully, they brought up the fact that they could book events, otherwise we could have missed the events on the day we planned to see them.  There location is perfectly situated for our holiday needs (mainly Disneyland) and the complimentary breakfast, to start our day, is very nice.  My daughter loved making waffles.  This Hotel is very reasonably priced.  You definitely get your monies worth.  This was the 5th time staying at this

Rooms are clean and nice. We rented a suite and for the money difference well worth the money for the extra room you get. Four of us were in the room and it was comfortable because of the extra room. Staff good about helping. Pool and hot tub area pretty small and closes at 10 which was too early. Easy parking. Will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel for a Anaheim Convention Center and that other fun place that's near there
Summary: My wife and I stayed here while she was at a conference at the convention center.  Both the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland/Downtown Disney/Disney's California Adventure are all within walking distance of the hotel. The first room we were offered put us on a floor overlooking the pool and it was quite small. The noise from the pool was overpowering even with the windows closed.  Given the circumstances we asked if there was another room available and was given one on the ground floor.  This room was much larger and more convenient to get in and out of the hotel (the elevators seem very slow). The included buffet breakfast has a varying selection of food and includes the ability to make your own miniature waffles. The biggest problem was that whoever was staying above us

The girl at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. As was everyone during our stay.  She even gave us an extra parking pass to help with our situation. The rooms are large, clean and very quiet. The breakfast that is included was really good and plenty of choices. We will be staying again soon I hope!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disneyland Holiday.
Summary: Our family stayed for 7 nights during October and had a great time.  We stayed in a suite with four queen sized beds and two bathrooms, microwave, fridge and two TV's.  The suite was divided into two sections - first section had two queen sized beds, TV and fridge/microwave.  Second section again had two queen sized beds and a TV.  These rooms were divided by two good sized bathrooms in between.  The second room was handy for the kids to be able to have their own space and watch what they wanted on TV and it gave the adults a little privacy also.  The airconditioning was good and pool area was kept clean with plenty of towels.  The hotel staff were very helpful and went out of their way to ensure that our stay was memorable.  Alamo is right next door and when we mentioned that

I went to the Desert Palms Hotel for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.   The location is second to none.  Walking distance to the Convention Center, Disney, Disney California Adventure, many restaurants, and a shopping center.    What I didn't like was that the room was damp and the room was musty.  The room had no thermostat, so the air conditioner had no control.  You had to have it on or off.  That was a bother.  The room had a refrigerator in it, and the compressor was broken, so when it ran it made a lot of noise.  I talked to the front desk about switching rooms, however they informed me that the hotel was completely booked, and there were no rooms to change in to.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while you're in Anaheim.
Summary: Was very pleased with the hotel, It's room and the service. I will be back.

Hi we stayed for 5 days and you can fault the location, rooms always clean and cleaned, large enough for two adults and two kids, services was excellent. Right next door to Alamo car rental, and lots of great places to eat near by. Shame about the breakfast....it was very ordinary. If they improved it then sure the price would go up....but I think it's wort

Summary Heading: Good sized rooms in a good location
Summary: We stayed at DP for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. 3 of us shared a room with 2 beds and a pull out sofa. The room was a good size, beds were comfortable and it was very clean. It was a 10 minute walk to the park so not too far although it feels long when you do a 12hr day! The only downside was that the free breakfast was not that great but you can't really complain if it's free. I would stay here again or recommend this hotel.

The Staff is fabulous, everyone has a great smile on the their face, and very helpful.  The rooms were very clean, and just what we needed. Breakfast was perfect, especially when travelling wiith two hungry teens.  8-10 Minutes walking to Disneyland, Our stay was just great. The kids also enjoyed the pool almost every day.  Would certainly stay here again!!!

We spent a week at the Desert Palms (2 families with 5 kids) and had a wonderful vacation. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. We chose this hotel for the more complete continental breakfast and the kids Yuha room and were very satisfied. Everyone had a hot breakfast and was ready for the busy days we planned. The weather was hot so we enjoyed afternoon swims. The pool isn't huge but the kids had a great time swimming and there was room for all the kids to have fun. The pool area is shaded but with the heat we had, was perfect after all the time in the sun at the theme parks. The front desk staff was very helpful and arranged a tour for us and offered helpful information so we knew what to expect. The walk to Disneyland is about 10 minutes which worked out fine for us but

Summary Heading: Great value, excellent location for Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed for 4 nights in a suite,   (not the kids suite, just a normal suite with a sunk in living area with a pull out bed)   The room was clean, and we appreciated the small fridge and microwave.  The hotel is within walking distance to Disney and we loved that there was a grocery and convenience store next door.  There is also a strip mall with a few restaurants across the street.     Our only problems were that the pullout bed was broken/lopsided and was uncomfortable and the the windors were very easy to open and had no screen on them.  This would be a huge safety concern for families with toddlers.  (we were on the 4th floor)  We appreciated the free breakfast, as it was a huge moneysaver, but would of loved a little more variety in the

Summary Heading: Not bad but not great either
Summary: We had a lot of issues with the hot water being very inconsistent in the showers and at the bathroom sinks. The air condition was quite loud but it did work. The walls in the room were very thin as you heard a lot of noise from hallway and the room above us. For the value this hotel is ok but I would probably not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great room setup for kids, but check some things when arriving...
Summary: Location - Great, about a 10 minute walk, but the ART shuttles stop right in front, recommended for kid travelers after a long day at Disney.   Breakfast - EXCELLENT hot breakfast included with your stay.    Noise - Hotel is VERY loud, paper thin walls.  We were put on the first floor right next to the elevator.  NOT RECOMMENDED EVEN BEING ON THE FIRST FLOOR.  There is also a boiler or something that runs and grinds at 7 AM on the clock daily.  It's horrible.   Room - Clean and spacious, stayed in a kids suite, excellent for our 5 year old to have his own room, bunk bed and TV.  Hot water was an issue.  We had to have it checked 2 out of the three mornings we were there after I froze in a cold shower.    All in all, a good hotel,  Clean, newly remodeled.  Staff was cordial, not

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family vacations to Disneyland.
Summary: When we travel to Disneyland we pick the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites. The staff is always very courteous and extremely helpful. We arrive early and have no issues getting a parking pass for our vehicle so we can go play at the parks while we wait for our rooms to be ready. Rooms are clean and spacious. Plenty of room to move around without having to climb over beds or family members. Thermostats are simple to use, and units are comparatively quiet. The maid service is great. The lobby is a great spot to wait for additional family members in the morning when gathering to head to Disneyland park. The pool is clean with towels available so you do not have to bring any with you. Breakfast is always great. The breakfast that is offered has something for everyone in my house of picky

Summary Heading: Excellent location for Disneyland, hotel has all that you will need!
Summary: We had a great stay at the Desert Palms. It is located less than one mile from the front gate to Disneyland and California Adventure, you cannot get closer than this! Breakfast was great, the staff were helpful and friendly. the pool was nice and in use at all hours of the day. There is a 7-11 located next door which is completely stocked with anything you might need during your stay. Anaheim GardenWalk is across the street and up about a block. It has great restaurants like Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's and Bubba Gump Shrimp factory. All in all, this hotel is excellent value for the money paid and is in a superb location. We will definetly stay again on our next trip to Disneyland.

Our family of two adults amd two kids stayed for 7 nights in a kids suite and it was exactly what we needed and as advertised.  It was very clean and the seperated room from the two kids was perfect.  The maid service was excellent, with the room cleaned and fresh towells etc everyday.  The staff were excellent and friendly and could not do enough for us.  Fantastic location only a 5 minute walk from Disney, which suited us just fine.  I would highly recomend for families.  We will definately be going back.

Summary Heading: Great location for a family vacation @ Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 9, which included 3 children under 8 years of age, stayed at the Desert Palms for a week in September 2011. The location was great with respect to Disneyland, California Adventure, Downtown Disney, shopping, restaurants, the Honda Center for an NHL hockey game and I-5 for going south to Legoland in Carlsbad and north to Santa Barbara & Solvang.     The hotel staff were great and answered all questions willingly and completely. There were two free guest computers which came in handy. There was a 7-11 and an ABC Store as well as an Alamo rental location right beside the hotel.    The breakfast on the 5th Floor was as complete as you would ever need. If we go back to Disneyland we would certainly stay at the Desert Palms.

After a long plane flight from Australia was very pleased to arrive early in the morning and the room was available. We stayed in the Sahara suite with kitchenette and highly recommend it for  families with young kids.  The full sized fridge was fabulous for drinks and food for 3 young kids, especially after a long day at the park. The walk was 10 mins to Main gate Disney, no crossing of major roads and the area was very safe at night. The 7 Eleven and mini mart next door were great for stocking up on supplies.  At first i thought the room was small, but once unpacked there more than enough room for 5 of us and luggage, the lounge area was great for kids to sit and play etc. Room was clean and staff were very helpful and friendly.  I had read other reviews which left me worried

We wanted a hotel within walking distance to Disneyland and this one is only a 5-minute walk to the front gate! Comfortable & clean room, decent breakfast, no extra charge for parking. Would stay here again.

The first time we stayed here was in November 2010 for a much needed family vacation. Even with the renovation going on we enjoyed our stay. The walking distance to Disneyland is less than 10 miniutes and with three kids all under the age 8, made it convenient and less stressful. We enjoyed saving money with the complimentary full morning breakfast. They gave a reasonable three hour window to eat and staff kept the room neat. Beds were comfy and the room was clean,plus the kids loved the bunk beds  in their own room attached to ours. My husaband and I chose to come back again for our 10 year wedding anniversary. Arriving late we had a nice informative man check us in and quickly too. First glance I noticed a difference from the hotel renovations. The room was clean even in the

Stayed six nights. found location great. walk to Disneyland, shops, restuarants. Seven eleven down stairs, bus stop out front. rooms were good size,quiet and clean. laundry was avaliable.breakfast was average.would stay again.

We stayed in a kitchenette suite on the fourth floor.  The room was a bit on the small side, but it worked for four adults and two very active toddlers.  We never got around to using the kitchen but it was nice that it was stocked up on all the utensils so that we didn't have to bring our own.  It was nice to fill up daily on breakfast, which they had a variety of hot goodies such as eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, toast, cereal, and much more.  The only thing I would suggest is maybe change up the menu a bit.  With staying there for five days, by the third day, I had to skip the breakfast.  Staff was friendly, even checked up on us after we checked in to make sure everything was ok.  The only concern I had was that it was pretty hot on the fourth floor lobby and hallways.

We only stayed 2 nights, and one we got in late. The hotel is a good option for disney, an easy walk to the park (even for little kids ). The pool is nice, the family room was adequate. The beds were comfy. The breakfast was good, and the outdoor eating deck was fabulous. The only issue I had was a complaint to our room shortly after we arrived about foot noise. I think the hotel could have filtered that complaint as it was erroneous and spoiled our stay. Most of the hotels I have stayed at in the US you can hear people walking around upstairs. Otherwise, the staff were lovely.

Summary Heading: Looks great from the outside but pictures are deceiving!
Summary: For the price we could have stayed somewhere much nicer!  First night our fridge was not working, second night our smoke detector beeped all night.  The showers were horrible and we couldn't always get hot water.  The rooms are terribly small!  Do not recommend for large families or for extended stays.  The positives are:  walking distance to Disney and a great breakfast bar.

Our church youth group of 71 stayed for two nights and hotel was like dream came true. Everything was so perfect. They prepared for the parking for the charter bus and other van. The director of sales, Aileen was very professional and very helpful. The breakfast was great. The front staff were all kind and well trained. This place was so close to the Disney that we didn't even have to drive. Inside and outside of this hotel was so clean and shiny. I'll give this place full 5 stars. PrescottH from Seattle WA

Our stay was for 8 nights and the place was great. We had a room at the rear of the hotel so we had a bonus of being able to see the Fireworks each night when we were not still down at the park- Buffet breakfast each morning saved us time and cash - there was always plenty of food. I would stay here again as it is a very short 7 minute walk to the parks but also only a couple of minutes to Bubba Gumps, the Cheese Cake Factory and other great food places - the bus stop is also right out the front for tours etc. The front desk staff were very helpful.
