Look at this place  before you shell out big money to the other big Disney based resorts.

very Impressed with this hotels offers. free parking, free full breakfast   hovever, returning that nite we noticed our bags & luggage had been ransacked searched!  i called that nite & at check out to speak to a manager. no one ever came. so i left my cell number no one called me back. i called sunday & the manager was just too busy. i needed to call her back later. monday a manager called me she would talk to the maid & head housekeeper, her answer was they have never had any problems & the maid said she did nothing wrong, so how do you  explain the wallet left on top of the bag when it was stuffed at the bottom of that bag.. All she would say  is sorry  i'm sorry there's nothing I can do.

We were staying here for our Disneyland trip for a week. This was our first time trying this hotel and when we checked in everything seemed so nice and modern and clean but when we got to our guest room boy were we surprised! The room is very nicely finished and clean but it is so tight that really only one person can move around at a time. We have a two year old and if we were to spend anytime in here other than for naps then she would really go crazy. Also the separate room where the bunk beds are, the door is glass so when we have lights on she can see and of course hear everything too. The walls are very thin too! I can here everything going on down the hall and even as far as 4 rooms down. Also the ac control unit is in the bunk bed room so anytime I need to change the air

Summary Heading: Short,safe walk to Disneyland .. no roads to cross
Summary: The family loved staying here. We had an easy 10 minute stroll to Disneyland. The seperation between kids sleeping and ourselves was GREAT! Just meant we could relax as well in the evening with a takeaway meal, watching t.v whilst the kids slept. Shops for meals and wine across the road and they all do takeaways. In the afternoons the girls took a break in the reasonably sized swimming pool before going back to Disneyland in the evening. Very convenient, quiet, enjoyable and cost effective for a 5 night stay.  Inclusive breakfast on the roof of the hotel (inside or outside) was more than adequate. Our kids had cereal and (loved the) waffles. Fruit, yoghurt, sausages, potatoes and beef patties washed down with coffee, juice or water. Only negative comment was the wastage as all

This hotel is fantastic for the price that you pay. Much nicer than many of the hotels in the area, and the location is pretty good. Not right next to Disneyland, but still within walking distance. We stayed here for the D23 expo at the convention center and could not have picked a better hotel. It was literally right across from the convention center so we were able to get there in 5 minutes. The rooms were a good size, with a separate sitting area with a pull out sofa. Everything was clean and the beds were surprisingly comfortable. The full breakfast is really unique, not the usual cold pastries that you get at other hotels, but instead hot eggs, sausage, and make your own waffles. Saved us money during the day because we were able to fill up at breakfast. The restaurant

Summary Heading: My first choice of DL hotels
Summary: If you can get a room at this place in your budget, do so. It's a fully interior hotel which is nice compared to most hotels in this price range. The breakfast is also hands down the best free breakfast I have had at any hotel anywhere. Tons of options and even a patio with a view of Disneyland to eat on.

Summary Heading: Great Location -too many high school ball teams
Summary: The hotel was great. The staff was great. The place was dead easy to find. The parking was excellent. The breakfast was just what was needed to start your day. The full kitchen suite we had was an unexpected free upgrade. The location was an easy walk to Disneyland and there was a lot of great places to eat just around the corner. The 7-11 on the corner made picking up late night snacks easy.   The not withstanding was the place was filled with highschool ball teams which ran up and down the halls, yelling and making noise until well after midnight. The ball teams took over the breakfast room and you sure didn't want to go in the pool when they were in the pool. I would check with the hotel to find out how many teams are booked into the hotel.

Unique Hotel. Great Rooms. Walk to Disney!!  We love Desert Palms!! This is a wonderful hotel that we’ve been staying at for years. The staff is friendly. The Rooms are really nice. We stayed at their Family style suits as well are there more modern room. Breakfast is a perfectly healthy. Not too heavy. And you can grab an apple on the way out, which is a great snack at about 10 AM in Disney.  And trust me, you don’t want to drive to Disney. Parking sucks at Disney. You have to pay, and they’ll park you 5 miles away and you’ll have to take a tram to the park.

Summary Heading: AAA+++ Hotel, Amenities and Services are so Great!  We'll be back!
Summary: Rooms is so clean and Comfy. The total ambiance of the hotel is very Awesome. We love the swimming pool especially my kids and the small video game arcade too.  My husband loved the gym. All in all, we stayed in a very nice hotel. Complimentary Breakfast Buffet is excellet, lots of variety of food.

Summary Heading: We will be back next month
Summary: This is a nice hotel for the cost. The rooms are spacious and the breakfast is good.  Short walk to Disneyland. This is our 2nd time staying here and will stay again. There was some hair in the bathroom this time but overall clean room.

I just stayed at the Desert Palms.  We go to Disneyland 3-4 times a year and have tried a lot of hotels within walking distance to DL.  This hotel is one of the best.  The rooms are clean, the staff is nice and the breakfast is better then most in the area.   We will be back next month for another visit!

Staff very courteous and helpful. Rooms normal, but clean and comfortable. About 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Free parking. We had two adjoining rooms and 5 kids, and it was a blast. Small pool, but who cares, you're at Disneyland. Breakfast included, decent.

Summary Heading: Top stay at a decent price. So close to the action!
Summary: Booked upon a recommendation from a friend and will spread the word too!  Couldn't fault our 4-night stay here. Perfect location on the rear side of Disney California Adventure park (can even overlook from the balcony and windows at breakfast). Just two short blocks from the main Disney gates, surrounded by convenience stores, restaurants or fast food places. Didn't try the bar food in the hotel - must admit.  Rooms recently renovated. VERY comfortable, large flat screen plasma TV, microwave, refrigerator, tea/coffee facilities, iron and board. Plenty of free toiletries too. Safe did make a charge against your account every day, but is automatically deducted at end if stay (apparently this insures you against loss etc). Bathroom was plenty big enough and so was the main room. No

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at! Seemed more like a motel! Staff were very unfriendly and not helpful at all! Got to the hotel at lunch and told our room wasn't ready, as we were putting our bags in the storage room the unfriendly lady at the front desk fell asleep leaning on the door!! She seemed spaced out and definitely didn't want to be there! The only friendly person at this hotel was the nice guy in the little cafe that is attached! He gave us maps to Disney etc!!  The breakfast was disgusting the only nice things were the waffle makers!!  basically only stayed one night and then checked out early!! This hotel needs a refurbishment it's old and dingy! My reccomendation would be not to stay here! Our room was very small and old. The air conditioning unit looked like it

Summary Heading: Great Hotel which is walking distance to the park
Summary: We arrived early expecting to leave out bags in the lockup but were able to check into our room early which was great opportunity to freshen up after travelling to the area by train from Union Station.  We stayed for 4 nights and had a room on the ground floor facing Katella Ave. The room was large and felt recently renovated. We stayed in a Deluxe room which contained 2 large comfy beds and a large flat screen TV. There was a fridge, microwave and coffee machine in the room. The wardrobe (Closet) was a little small but we fitted out stuff in, it also contained an ironing board and iron as well as a key operated safe. The bathroom was clean, modern and presented to a high standard.  The breakfast included a large selection of foods including 2 cereals and porridge, 3 waffle

Summary Heading: Anniversary Stay: Great room and Service
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel for the first time. King Bed Suite.  Worth it. We booked through Travelocity easily enough, but they had virtually no customer service for additional activities. We celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary in Anaheim at Disneyland, and also for our first visit to Medieval Nights.  Everything was delightful. We even were able to walk to Disneyland from our hotel, and the parking fees we saved were enough to cover several purchases at Disneyland.  Thanks for a wonderful time! We'll be back.  Leon & Susie Felburg

Very nice hotel! We checked in at about 2am and it was so quick! The breakfast was so great! The potatoes..i love it! You go up to a top floor for the breakfast and it is super roomy with seating outside. It's not too far from Disneyland but it is a walk. Loved that there was a 711 right next door. The beds were so comfy & pillows were plush. Very clean and no dust. The restaurant there is good for a late night drink & snack. The little shop has a lot of cute little things to buy. We really felt at home in this hotel. Overall awesome hotel. Will stay again in they have room. The are always booked!

We stayed for six nights and enjoyed our stay!  Our room was the sahara kitchenette suite and it even had a large  ( i think only one of a few rooms that did)It was clean and a good location.  It was a close enough walk to Disneyland for us with two little ones ( two and five) in tow.  About 10 to 15 minute walk, even doable after a long day.  You do not need to cross any major streets which is a bonus. The beds were okay, honestly our only complaint is the pillows they were horrible!  We had NO water or air conditioning issues at all!  I was a little wary when I read this in other reviews, but no problems for us at all. The pool was good, a little cold because it is not in the sun a lot, but this did not phase my kids, At all!  The breakfast was decent, although mor fresh fruit

Stayed Aug 17 - 22, for the D23 Expo at the Convention Center across the street.  After seeing a lot of negative comments online, I was kind of worried about the Desert Palms, but it turned out to be a very nice mini-resort.  I was upgraded from a standard queen to a King suite, which had a separate bedroom, two TVs, a sofa/chair in the living room, and a really comfortable bed.  There was no view to speak of (the roof), but that was okay.  The room was clean and comfortable, and the air conditioning worked like a charm.  The only two problems I had were 1) The in-room fridge was filled with leftovers and half-eaten food from the previous guests, and 2) the vent in the bathroom was very loud.  The staff was very friendly and outgoing, although the housekeeping was inconsistent

Summary Heading: Desert Palms Hotel & Suites: Close to Disneyland
Summary: This is a decent hotel.  We were in the Yuha Suite and had booked through Costco Travel.  The hotel had us booked in a Deluxe Room but were able to change it to the Yuha Suite when I provided my confirmation stating we had booked the Suite.  The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly as he checked us in and gave us our room keys.  Upon entering our room, we noticed it appeared pretty small.  There is a bedroom in the back with bunk beds and a King bed in the front, and the bathroom is in the middle.  There is a small fridge and microwave in the room as well.  We started unpacking.  At first I didn't think there was going to be enough room but once we were all unpacked we found we had plenty of room.  Here is a quick review of some of the amenities the hotel has to offer:

Summary Heading: Great value and great location for Disney
Summary: We arrived early planning on using the baggage lock up but were able to get into our room which was really helpful - the receptionist was friendly and welcoming. The suite was clean and a great size for our family. It was only a 5 min walk to Disney's front gate and we felt very safe as there were plenty of people walking to and fro even at midnight when Disneyland shut. The breakfast was OK and we brought it back to our suite as there was plenty of room. We didn't use the pool but it looked clean and well kept.

Our room was on the second floor. Oddly, the main elevators didn't go to the second floor. We had to use a smaller elevator which was down the hall and around the corner.  We ended up taking the stairs most of the time...even to get to the breakfast room on the fifth floor. The halls are not kept air conditioned which I applaud on an "energy saving" basis, but they are also very warm when returning from DL...just be advised.  Disneyland is about two long blocks around the corner and down the road which made it convenient to walk to with my teenagers. No need to drive to the parks and pay for parking which was nice. Our room was fairly nice and clean. It overlooked the parking lot, but rooms higher up in the hotel have a view that you can watch the DL fireworks from. We watched

We booked 2 queen beds online for 1 night. Upon check in, we discovered that the staff had put us in a King Suite. When I explained that we required 2 queen beds they were very fast in rectifying the situation. Breakfast was adequate. Staff was very helpful in allowing us to store our bags for the day even though we had checked out after our stay. Location is very good, maybe a 15 minute walk to the gates.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites in Anaheim, Ca.  The hotel was clean and comfortable, and exactly as advertised.  We would definitely stay there again if ever in that area.  Rose M. Baker Charleston, SC
Just got back from 3 nights at the Desert Palms. Great hotel! Easy walk to Disneyland, extremely clean, friendly staff, good hot breakfast.  Jon

Summary Heading: Great location - shame about the noise
Summary: We were a family of five from New Zealand, staying for a full week at Desert Palms as part of our 3 week family holiday to the US. Location was fantastic, with a pleasant walk to Disney & California Adventure. Plenty of eating places along the way - we had many places to choose from for our late night dinners after the long days at Disney. Our unit was a 'two bed, two bath', which was spacious enough for the five of us, and was clean and tidy. Unfortunately the noise from surrounding rooms was increadible, every footstep, shower, faucet & flush could be heard. With the early risers & late settlers, as you would expect in this sort of location, there was not alot of quality sleep time to be had. There was alot of noise into one of our bedrooms which faced out over the pool,

We were a family of six visiting from New Zealand. The large room suited admirably, the breakfast was a bonus, the grand kids loved the pool but the front counter staff??? Apart from the very pleasant chap that booked us in the remainder of the staff (females) we had dealings fell short on personality. A cheerful smile wouldn't go astray and it costs nothing.

Summary Heading: Great value for a reason, worst experience yet!
Summary: We arrived on August 1st with  3 children and two adults. Upon entering the room, we discovered only 2 queen beds. Promptly called the front desk to find out if maybe there had been a mistake. Oh no, I was informed, that room can sleep this many, you just need to pay extra for the cot. I tried to explain that I had indicated the total amount of people on the reservation page but the staff did not care to listen. The majority of the staff was rude, with the exception of the gentleman working. Our room was musty and had dust and dirt all over the floor. There were never enough towels and requesting extra took forever. We visit Disneyland twice a yr from Portland and never will we stay here again.

We have stayed at other hotels near Disneyland but this one was the best by far. We arrived late on our check in day (got lost) and was informed that the childrens suite I reserved was having plumbing issues so we were upgraded to the larger suite. 4 beds and 2 bathrooms was perfect for us with 5 kids! The room was very clean and beds were comfortable!!! The Air Conditioning got a little too cold, but nothing to complain about! The breakfast was a great money saver, although it got kinda boring after the 3rd day but it still saved money and tatsted great. The pool was great if you get there around 2pm theres hardly anyone there. I love that there was a 7-eleven next door and Subway and a few other places accross the street since eating in Disneyland every meal is expensive. The

The plusses are the following:  1.  Complimentary breakfast-   eggs, sausage, fresh fruits, waffles, just to name a few, real food to help get you started for an energetic day.  They have everything for the pickiest eaters.  2.  The staff-   very friendly, curteous, helpful Kudos to the cleaning and kitchen staff.  It was so nice to come back to a clean room every night and find all the supplies replenished.  The staff in the breakfast room kept the food trays well supplied with hot, fresh food, and they keep it clean.  It must be a challenge because a lot of families with small children eat there on a daily basis.  3.  Location-   No need to cross the busy South Harbor blvd.  The hotel is on the same side of the street as Disneyland.  It's a walk, but a very manageable walk,

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, bar the front desk staff
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights July/Aug 2011 for our first trip to Disneyland, I have no complaints about our room as it was roomy, clean, had both a fridge and microwave and a good sized bathroom for 3 of us (2 adults and our 10 year old son) Location was great with just a short walk to Disneyland, 7/11, Dennys etc down the road Breakfast buffet was good, and we never had issues getting a table when we went up for breakfast. Housekeeping staff were all very smiley and friendly, wish I could say the same for the front desk staff.  With the exception of Dylan (who was exceptionally friendly and helpful) and the woman I spoke to when we first arrived to see if our room was ready, the others were bordering on rude, a smile would probably be asking for far too much, and being made to

Summary Heading: We absolutely love the Kalahari Suites at the Desert Palms
Summary: The Desert Palms  is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms have been renovated and the Kalahari Suites acomodate our family needs perfectly. Having 2 bathrooms and double sinks, a refrigerator , coffee maker and the  really nice complimentary breakfast  make getting up and out a breeze when we want to get to Disneyland. The staff at the Hotel have been pleasant and very helpful at all times of the day and night.  The location is great !  The Disneyland Park is within walking distance.  We are major Disney fans and ALWAYS book our stay at the Desert Palms. It is also more reasonably priced in comparison to the Disneyland Hotels.
Bed are sticky, overrun by children, everything feels sort of damp and dingy.  Staff was nice but the room needs improvement.

This hotel was amazing! From the moment we booked our reservations we were given the  BEST customer service by Wendy and Julie which helped me booked the perfect suite for my family! When we arrive at the hotel the front desk staff made us feel like home, everyone so friendly and always with smiles on there faces.....The hot breakfast was awesome, my kids really enjoyed making there own waffles in the morning. So the breakfast was a plus being that it was complimentary for having a family of 4 save us a lot of money!!! The rooms were clean and comfortable my kids really enjoyed the bunk beds in the kid suite. Overall, we loved the location to Disneyland an easy 10minute walk to the main gate. I loved this hotel for its great location and Great customer service! I will most

The staff were friendly and helpful. The kids enjoyed having their own space with the bunk bed room and their own TV Adult part of the room very small. walls very thin The hum of the fridge very annoying when trying to sleep, after 2 nights of this I would just turn it off at night. 10 minute walk to disneyland  7/11 next door and ABC store, pizza,subway very close Pool and spa ok Over all...not too bad

I stayed with my teenage boys for 4 nights.  We loved the fact that Disneyland was really a very convenient walk.  The REAL breakfast every morning was very good as well! Anyone feeding teenagers can certainly appreciate the value of a breakfast to start the day! The staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome, even when we checked in in the middle of the night.  We enjoyed having two queen beds, a microwave and refrigerator. Keeping extra drinks and snacks accessible made the trip more enjoyable.

Summary Heading: We've been staying here for years!
Summary: My kids and I have been going to Disneyland almost every Summer for the last 8 years. This is probably the 4th time we have stayed at the Desert Palms hotel over the last 6 years. Before finding Desert Palms I was dissatisfied with two previous hotels because of the distance and cost.  I have two kids (now 16 and 19), so I always book the Borrego Suite and it is just perfect for us! My son is only now getting a little tall for the pull out couch, but he'd rather be on that than share the bed with his older sister. We noticed that the bedding has been updated since the last time we were there two years ago, and the curtain between the drop down area was gone, which is ok, but we liked having that there for extra privacy to change clothes when someone is in the bathroom. The only

We did not stay here in August 2010 but I forgot to write one when we stayed and they DESERVE the recognition. We stayed here in Dec of 2008. Their breakfast was amazing. It was included in the price and was WARM. This was not your usual toast and cereal breakfast. They had hot items (eggs/sausage/bacon/etc) and they DESERVE to be recognized. The walk is not crazy long to Disney. We did it with a 2 year old and a 4 year old EVERY day for 5 days. We had a fridge and microwave in our room and the parking was a breeze.   I'd highly recommend this place.

No hot water don't worry, the maid staff will be sure to turn off your air conditioning in your room each day to make sure your room is nice and toasty just like the hallways for you in the summer so you need a cold shower anyway.  We had to make several trips through the week down to the front desk to re-activate our key to get into our room.  After about the second time of being sure we did what they instructed to solve the problem and being told it was our fault we politely told them to save the speech each day and fix the darn key.  This was a bonus as we got to interact with their less than pleasant staff almost daily, sometimes twice a day.  Want to watch tv in your room make sure you request a room in which it works.  Apparently this is an upgrade in this hotel and it

After a 17 hour trip from Australia, this was our first stop and very excited to coming to the Disneyland area. We were greeted by a Very Unfriendly pierced face, untidy receptionist, so a little bit taken back, as we were expecting a friendly arrival greeting. The "kids Suite" room we booked because it was advertised as "spacious" and recently refurbished - well it was cramped, and the only refurbished item we could work out in the room was the flat screen TV. We could hear the guests in the next rooms and above, and the noise from the water systems from people running baths around midnight was unacceptable. Our complaint fell on deaf ears. The included breakfast was terrible. on a positive note - the pool/spa was nice. There are so many places to stay in Anaheim, and shuttle

Summary Heading: Average - wasn't bad but I would try another next time
Summary: Pros:   - very convenient to walk to Disney and shopping/restaurants - friendly staff - free parking.   - clean  Cons:  - everywhere smelled like the cleaning solution they used. - breakfast was super greasy potatoes, rubbery eggs, not enough pastries - the pool is in a center atrium and rooms facing it get a LOT of noisy echos from pool users - our room was split into 2 sections, separated by a wall.  The sleeping section didn't seem to have A/C, so it got stuffy when we closed the door to block out the pool noise.

Summary Heading: A nice option for the Disneyland area
Summary: Chose this hotel while attending the Disneyland park. It is very convenient, located on the corner of Katella and Harbor adjacent to the park property. Stayed three nights. The room and facilities appear to be recently renovated. Everything looks new and reasonably well maintained. Our King room had a very comfortable bed, large screen TV and a choice of wireless or wired Internet. Had one minor problem. Requested laundry service for a few items at 8:30am on the day before checkout and was assured that it would be ready that same night. It was not. In fact we found the next morning that it had not been picked up that day as promised but was picked up early the morning we were checking out. After several discussions with the front desk staff they finally offered the solution of

Stayed there for 1 night, and wish we would have scheduled more nights there!  Great location with a short walk to Disneyland.  Room was great for a family of 4 ---  had a separate room with bunk beds for the kids, including a couch, TV and door --- they had their own space!  Very clean, and friendly / helpful staff.

the advertised spacious family kids room is narrow and dirty; when we open the room I felt claustrophobic, NOT ENOUGH SPACE for the family as they advertised; DON'T GET FOOLED! this hotel is not family-friendly, the bathroom is very unsafe for kids, NO non-skid flooring, my son almost hit the floor, if I wasn't there! and their so-called FREE Internet access?? you are Risking yourself if you LOG-on, it's UNSECURED, I even called the Manager about it and she says "that's what we have" you Log-on to word "PALMS" and OPEN Internet and Risk yourself!  and we are paying a lot for the stay in this Hotel with all the Risk!!  Also, NOT ENOUGH FOOD served during their so-called continental breakfast in OASIS Ballroom as  they advertised; guests came to form up lines til the hallway;

Thank you very much we did enjoy the stay.We had a delux suite which had a seperate room with TV and lots of space outside of the twin Queen bedroom ...very comfortable.   Im visiting from Australia ,first visit to Disney. Your staff were always pleasent and helpful. The breakfast setup was very flexible and sensible menu.   We didnt leave the MAID card out one day and the housekeeper came along later and replaced the towels and took the rubbish which was most appreciated.  The Hotel is about a five minute walk from the Disney Park, as we had a three year old and one of us had a foot injury we used the  bus which runs every 20 minutes to and from the park ..(.you purchase daily tickets for about $3.00 one way or $4.00 unlimited trips)  Would recommend the Desert Palms to others.

Upon entering our room, there was a feeling of claustrophobia. The bunkbed suite was a long narrow corridor, and the only windows were in the bunkbed section of the room. No matter though, we were at Disneyland. The kids loved the bunkbeds, we moved on. The next morning, we had a visitor in our bathroom. A large cockroach. We called down to the desk, who told us that they had never had a report of cockroaches before (which I am certain is untrue as one of the other comments on this site mentions them.) A maintenance person came to our room, removed the offending creature and we were shuttled to a different room (no more bunkbeds unfortunately.) The new room was also a long corridor, but had two bathrooms, which both turned out to be quite dingy. The feeling of unease was

As always, upon arrival we were greeted warmly and in no time at all checking into oour rooms. This year we had a group of over 50 staying at this property and all those in our party were more than pleased dwith the rooms and ammenities. Rooms were clean and ready in a timely manner. The morning breakfast was a perfect starting point for each day. Additionally, I required the use of a scooter and it was waiting and charged in the lobby. At the end of each day, the front desk personnel took charge of the scooter and had it ready to go the following morning. My hasband and I have been staying here annually for over ten years and have never been disappointed.

A very FRIENDLY welcome upon arrival followed by a very CLEAN, spacious, nicely appointed room complete with kitchenette (refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, sink), sitting area, and a very comfortable bed. Front desk was very accomodating in meeting any needs and always did so quickly and with a smile! The complimentary HOT breakfast was delicious with something to please everyone.*HIGHLY RECOMMENDED hotel with a very special staff whose main priority is providing an enjoyable stay for their guests! We stayed for three nights and enjoyed every one of them! We cant wait to be back to the happiest place on earth.

The room we were given was very spacious and you can also see the firecrackers from Disneyland/Disney California Adventure. The staff were great. We nearly ended up with a handicapped room when we reserved for a deluxe room, but the gentlemen was able to ugrade our room to a more spacious suite.   We stayed four nights and had lots of fun. Breakfast was fullfilling. You get to bake your own waffles and toast your bread!  Happy Family

When planning our Disneyland Trip I came across this hotel..it looked fairly new and for the price I couldn't refuse. The Front Desk workers are GREAT and FRIENDLY. We got there very early and they had rooms available for us. Our room was on the bottom floor, the only complaint that i had was the noise level above us.I did inform the front desk the next morning and they promptly moved us. The rooms were very clean as well! We call for extra towels they promptly brought them to us! Yes worth staying!

Summary Heading: Not a bad choice for getting a great deal
Summary: Got a great a great package deal for this hotel that included breakfast, so we went with it.  When we arrived we were greeted by the front desk staff  that was always very helpful and friendly.  The lobby is very nice and well kept.  When we arrived in our room we were very pleased with how clean it was.  I opened the blinds to check out our view only to see another wall five feet away.  It was very quiet at night and during the day.  I never heard anyone from inside our room other than ourselves.        The breakfast was actually very good for being complimentary.  Not only was it good, it is one of the best free breakfast's I have ever had at any Disneyland area hotel, and I have been to more than a dozen.  The breakfast staff is very attentive, and kept the area well cleaned

The only real drawback was the room was like a long closet.  We chose this hotel because the room we picked had bunk beds (Yuha Suite), and it was within walking distance to Disneyland.  It was very nice, that the room had a door and a tv for the kids and one for us.  The breakfast was the best I've had free in any hotel I've stayed at, and the kids loved the waffle machines.  My only complaint, really, would be that it was the first time I've stayed in a "suite" and it was smaller than probably any other hotel room I've stayed in.  I'd definitely stay there again if we were to go back--I got a great deal for this hotel through a Disney package.

Summary Heading: Garbage....Don't believe the pictures or write-up.
Summary: Paid extra for a bigger room, got a room half the size described/pictured. The room was old, small, stains/holes on sheets and we didn't have a window to the outside, only to the pool. The air-conditioner was in a separate area and we had a fan in the wall to blow the air into the main part of the room. Asked for a different room and the hotel would not accommodate.  The free breakfast was nothing special to say the least, not much room to sit.   The only good thing about it is it is a 10 minute walk to the park.

Summary Heading: Excellent suite accomodation for the price.
Summary: Very nice hotel. We were  travelling with our adult son and chose the Sahara Kitchenette Suite and were nicely surprised. Although it is practically speaking a kitchenette, it offered the facilities of a full kitchen with its big cook top, good size sink and cupboards generously packed with plates, glasses, cutlery and cookware that puts many an expensive hotel offering full size kitchens to shame.  Don't be put off by some older reviews complaining about noise, the hotel has been refurbished and although our suite faced Katella Avenue, we experienced no offensive noise. The beds and sofa bed in the lounge were very comfortable, everything was very clean, we were well looked after, excellent and attentive cleaning staff and helpful concierge. It has a nice pool and spa, a

Summary Heading: Great Place with friendly and helpful staff
Summary: My family have stayed here before and always return to Desert Palms Hotels and Suites due to the size of the suites, proximity to Disneyland, free parking and breakfast and wonderful staff.  My family of six enjoyed staying here while on vacation to Disneyland and surrounding areas.  Chuks UC Ukaoma

We booked this hotel because of the "spacious" "newly renovated" rooms and the hot breakfast that was included.  The rooms are closets!  The management took us to three rooms before we reluctantly agreed to stay.  We were foolish in paying the prepay/no cancellation room rate to get a good deal.  The funiture in the rooms and carpet look a minimum of 20 years old.  They are dirty and dingy.  The linens were stained with holes.  We had a room with a separate kids room with bunks.   The doors can be lock from the kids' side but there is no key for the parents to unlock it.  We also needed a crib, but there was really no where to put it without it being in the way in case of an emergency or blocking the bathroom.  The hot breakfast is a joke.  Not good at all.  Food was disgusting,

Summary Heading: we have stay twice and had have an excellent service, we'll get back
Summary: Excellent service from our arrival to the hotel. The two times we have styed at this hotel have been very nice and clean. It is very close to Disneyland, we walked, too close. Have a good breakfast. We liked all.

Summary Heading: We NEVER stay any where else! Love it!
Summary: I cannot say enough about the Desert Palms Hotel. We've tried various other motels(right across the street from Disneyland) but nothing compares to the Desert Palms for $$$, friendly staff, amenites, and location. Our son has severe food allergies and the food staff was so helpful with the breakfast. They even brought out the box of potatoes and sausage for me to read the ingredients myself.  The rooms are basic but clean and very well kept.  We also LOVE that you can still park in the garage through the day of your check out. Other motels we've been to make you leave OR pay for an additional day of parking at the time of check out. This helps SO much, as parking at Disneyland is expensive. We've stayed at the Desert Palms at least 10 nights and will be back again in Sept. 2011

Stayed at Desert Palms and the hotel is average I will say. Rooms are dated and my room 325 should make it for a suite, but it wasn’t. Location was perfect for the convention centre where we were. Breakfast was free but disappointing – if you are on business trip you expect better, but might be OK if you have 2-4 kids to feed and get it for free. All in all a so-so experience; internet was free although.
, the breakfast was alright, the rooms were moderate and great distance from the park, however we had a cockroach in our room! management did nothing about it, will not stay here again

We had our school group of 150 there over Memorial Day weekend.  This hotel was incredibly accommodating.  The kids loved the breakfast, the location to convenience stores,and the Disney Parks.  This hotel would be fantastic for any high school group that is travelling to Southern California.  Our kids loved it.

We had a great time here.  We had 7 families and they had a room configuration for each need.  We would certainly recommend this hotel to others.  The staff was very pleasant and the breakfast was good to start the day at Disneyland.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and took the park hopper for Disneyland and California Adventure.  I booked this hotel because of free breakfast and close vicinity to Disneyland resort.  However, on the map it may look close but it is a lengthy walk to the park entrance...approximately 15 to 20 minutes if you have children.  I also booked this hotel because of the free breakfast.  The breakfast is one of the worst I have had.  They have a waffle maker that never makes perfect waffles, no matter how hard you try, and everyone struggled to get them out of the waffle maker.  There is no fresh cut fruits.  The sausages tasted nasty and salty.  In two words: avoid it.  We ended up eating the cereal every morning to get the day started.    This hotel has no hotel room service, so

we stayed for 10 nights with our two babies - 9 month and 3 yr old sons. Firstly, the water was contaminated, it is cloudy and tastes disgusting. When I went to our next hotel with clean water, I noticed our pot for boiling our babies water had a thick white grime attached to it and it took 3 scrubs to get it off. Secondly, the two bed suite was tiny, we had trouble getting in and out of the door because the king bed was right in front of the door as was the tv. It was ridiculous. The room was noisy at night because everyone was in the pool yahooing. I slept with earplugs in. Nothing like the rooms are adverticed on website.  The bathroom has a light attached to the fan, so evertime the light is turned on at night the roaring fan wakes everyone up.  The most annoying thing was

Summary Heading: Exceeded our expectations in all respects
Summary: We arrived late morning with 2 grandkids after a 24 hour international trip and front desk found us a room immediately. First junior suite was small and layout was not what we expected and they changed us straight away. All staff were helpful and friendly. Included breakfast was plentiful and varied although real eggs would be much better than powdered. Free WiFi was great. Bar kitchen closes early but fast food and better restaurants within 10 minute walk. Front desk booked us an LA tour with no problems. Easy access to freeways. Disneyland 10-15 minute walk. Couldn't have been better for us.

Summary Heading: Would love to stay here again.
Summary: Our dream holiday started here and couldn't have gone smoother.  Reception were friendly and helpful, we could see Disneyland from our room and was only a 10 minute walk to the front entrance.  We were also close to other Anaheim restaurants.  Breakfast was good (although we don't want another waffle for awhile).  The price for room and breakfast was definately worth it.  If we ever get to Anahiem again, this is where we would stay.

Summary Heading: Great location, rooms and buffet breakfast saves a lot of money.
Summary: The location is  just a short walk to Disneyland among beautiful palm trees and flowers.  We were given an upgrade in rooms without asking upon our arrival; found the room clean and spacious.  The fridge and microwave came in handy for snacks.  The buffet breakfast had everything we needed with a nice outside area to sit and look at the Tower of Terror.

Summary Heading: I would stay here again in a Heartbeat!
Summary: I arrived early, and was greated at the front desk by a sweet young woman who checked me in.  She even let me check in early, as my room was available!!!  I have never stayed anywhere where they allow you to check in early.  She was friendly, very knowledgeable and helpful. My room was awesome.  Beautiful interior, comfortable, roomy, and clean! The breakfast bar was fully stocked, eggs, sausage, toast, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt etc. etc. etc. Quiet, I never heard a sound outside our room. The shuttle service to Disneyland was wonderful, short ride to the park with very little wait, plus it saved me $11.00 everyday. Best stay ever!

Summary Heading: Like Hot Water Showers?  Try Someplace Else!
Summary: Chose this hotel through a travel arrangement by Expedia because of its proximity to Disney.  The entrance really IS walking distance away.    Room was clean, hotel appears recently surface remodeled, staff was friendly and helpful, check in and check out was quick, painless and smooth. But these are all things you expect for $150 a night.  I know times are tough....consumers and businesses alike are cutting corners wherever possible...........BUT.  At the rates this hotel charges, I don't think hot water should be considered a luxury.  My wife first noticed that the sink water never got warm as we got ready for bed on our first night in.  Then she tried the shower......got lukewarm after running about 10 minutes.  Called front desk.....sorry, our maintenance man lives IN

My husband and I took an "adults only" trip to Disneyland in June of 2010 and stayed at the Desert Palms because of it's proximity to the Disneyland Resorts.  We expected there to be lots of kids and families running around, so it was no surprise that we could hear kids running up and down the halls in the mornings on their way to the parks.  The noise level wasn't too bad, and considering that it's mostly families staying there, we didn't encounter any late-night disturbances.  We, apparently, weren't up as early as the families though, as the free breakfast was always gone by the time we got to it.  The room we were in was spacious, clean, and came with a microwave and mini-fridge, so we were able to store extra food during the stay, which was definitely an added bonus.    The

I have 2 kids 3 and under so cleanliness is a very high priority and this hotel delivered!! Wonderful complementary breakfast with a make your own waffle, scrambled eggs, fruit, cereal, milk, o.j, Danish or donuts, with outside or inside eating and it went until 10.  Great location and very short walk to Disney without crossing and major streets( super plus).  The safe was friendly, beds comfy, Disney channel for little ones.  We are planning a second trip in December and will always go back to this hotel!!

It was fantastic. I made an error when I booked the room and it was not big enough for our family. They gladly changed rooms to one that would fit better the first night.   When we had to change rooms ( because of late reservations)  for the rest of the trip so they had us leave our stuff packed on the beds. We went to Disneyland and when we came home late  all of our suitcases were waiting in our new room. I was thinking we would have to put them in the car all day and then come back in the afternoon and check into our new room. This saved the walk back to the hotel and the hauling of luggage in and out.  Facilities were clean, staff bent over backwards for us.

We stayed at the Desert Palms with our two children 6 and 10 years for 6 nights, the rooms were very keen and so well maintained and beds comfortable, however our window only opened 2 inches and the air conditioning smelt terrible so we felt hot and stuffy while in the rooms.  The breakfast was not great lacked in healthy breakfast cereals and fresh fruit.  On the plus side there was free internet access and the pool and hot tub were good, and location was within great walking distance to  Disneyland. We did think the pool was open too long in the evening 10pm is very late when there were many families with small children staying at the hotel, the noise from the pool could often be heard up until 10pm.

We had booked a trip throw Get away today. We asked for the desert palm but they were full we had stayed there befor about 3 years ago and loved it. But they ended up boking us with the Ramada inn. We new the min we walked in it wasn't going to be good. I called the next day and there still was no openings to move us. But on the 3rd day Desert Palm had an opening. The staff there are so nice and the rooms so clean they make your stay worth every penny I will only book throw them. It is awsume and close to disney. Thanks to all of the staff at Desert Palms:D Want to expecially thank Nevine you were the best.. Pam Post West Valley City, Ut

We stayed for 3 nights and found the staff very friendly, helpful and we even got an upgrade which was a very pleasant surprise.  Nothing seemed too much trouble. Our room was very spacious and had everything we needed.  Everything was very clean and the beds were comfortable.  Nice and quiet our room was on level 3 on the back wall. Located very close to Disneyland (only 10 min easy stroll). The breakfast was great we loved it.  The waffle makers were a highlight for our kids (and us).  All in all a great start to our holiday.  We were so busy with Disneyland etc we didn't have time to use the other amenities eg pool but was nice to know they were there.  They appeared very popular.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location and great rooms
Summary: You can't beat the Desert Palms suite variety for room arrangements. We decided to stop by Disneyland on our way taking back our son and his girlfriend to USC. Obviously we wanted to keep the sleeping arrangements separate without the expense of an extra room. The two bed suite plus separate living area with a foldout bed worked perfectly for us. We were close enough to Disneyland to walk, but isolated enough to not have the constant noise and traffic of families coming and going. We have stayed here on a number of family trips over the years and we keep on coming back. We are planing another visit right now.

As Randy from American Idol would say, it was "just a'ight." We arrived very late in the evening, and the only kid suite that was available had a gas leak and smelled awful. They ended up putting us in another room which was not what we had booked, and it as just ok - a little on the tacky side, but livable.   The next day, we were moved to a kid suite right next to the elevator. That meant that we got to listen to the elevator all night long (our room shared a common wall!) and also listen to people waiting for the elevator right outsite our door and talking all night long. Needless to say, we were not happy, but there were no other rooms available. We were absolutely exhausted between spending the day at Disneyland, and not being able to sleep at night. Based on this

-Exceeded my expectation, very clean and quiet, great service, great location. Actually the rooms are much bigger and of better quality  than the 'tour' pictures on the hotel website suggests.  -I booked one of the cheaper rooms, but it still had 2 tvs, large sitting area, fridge, microwave, safe, etc. Pointers:  -Curiously, a note on the safe says you will be billed an additional $1/day 'convenience fee' for it, but apparently they don't do it behind your back. My bill was credited $1 daily without my requesting.    -Breakfast area can get crowded with a lot of young families getting ready for Disneyland, but food is always plenty; coffee was good.

We had stayed here once before upon a classmate's recommendation. On this latest visit, we stayed two nights. When we arrived, I was told that they did not have our reservation. I knew this was just an oversight since I had the reservation number and details saved to my phone. It turned out to be just a software glitch. But the people at the front desk were very apologetic and insisted on upgrading us to a suite for the original price we paid for the regular room. Every business drops the ball every once in awhile. What sets them apart is how they deal with those situations and the staff here went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Our rooms here have always been clean and the breakfast is always over and above. Our kids love eating out on the terrace on the roof area in

Summary Heading: Best Location - Save Yourself from Parking Hassles
Summary: My husband and I took four teenagers to Disneyland over Thanksgiving weekend 2010, and Desert Palms was the perfect place for us.  The rooms are large enough for the kids, and the hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Park. Very convenient.  I will definately stay there again.

Actually we had a completely different experience than some reviewers. We stayed at the hotel's kid suite. It was newly renovated. Had lovely furniture, everything was clean and tidy. You can tell a hotel room from their bathrooms, and Desert Palms had one of the cleanest and newest bathrooms we've come across. We have stayed in some upscale hotels, but when you travel with kids you need practical and not chi-chi rooms. This had an awesome bunk bed and a TV, in a separate room. That by itself was a steal for the money we paid (about $230/night total through Expedia.com.) Again, if you are traveling with little ones, you need clean and practical. And this was it for us. Especially it being a few blocks from Disneyland. The staff was very nice. They accommodated us although we

Summary Heading: It's like our home away from home
Summary: This is our third time staying at the Desert Palms...and won't be our last.  The kitchenette suite offers us the space and comfort we need during our stay in the Disneyland resort.  The staff are extremely friendly and warm.   The hot breakfast served daily from 7-10 is the perfect start to the day.  We highly recommend this hotel...especially if you have children.  Carmine & Edwina Vancouver, CANADA

First trip to Disney with the kids. Hotel is older and has paper thin walls. Was so noisy!!!! I have stayed in other hotels along this strip that are just as old and definitely not as noisy with much more friendly, knowledgeable staff.   Coffee pot didn't work too well. hotel staff not too friendly and didn't know too much about where to catch buses for shuttle tours.

Summary Heading: Nice location, nice room, nice staff.
Summary: This hotel is very convenient.  It is just around the corner from Disneyland Resort.  We walked to the park(s) everyday & saved $ from the parking fees.  Room was very nice.  We had requested a non-smoking room w/ 1 bed but upon cking in Sam at the front desk suggested a different room w/ two beds because the location was better and quieter.  The room was a nice size & nicely decorated.  Hotel pool & spa was nice and clean too.  And the hot complementary breakfast was better than most hotels offer.  The front desk staff we encountered, Sam & Nevine, were pleasant and accommodating. Would recommend.

We completely enjoyed our stay at the Desert Palms. The value was great and the hotel is in terrific shape.  We are Season Pass Holders at Disneyland and have stayed at the majority of the "harbor blvd" hotels, and we will definately look for specials in the future at your hotel and stay there again!  Breakfast is really key!!! :) Thanks for providing that wonderful service and a rooftop morning :)  Underground covered parking.... Interior corridors....

Newly renovated, super clean and a great value hotel with the best location possible.  You can actually walk to the Disneyland from this hotel with your kids.  It is like one long city block.  It beats the line at the end of the day to wait for a hotel shuttle or other shuttle services. Stayed in the kitchenette suite and it was invaluable to have a full kitchen with a picky 4 year old wanting this or that.  I have to say the two room suite is great for a couple with maybe two kids.  If you have more people, just get another room.  I looked at many hotels and looked at other hotels while at Anaheim, and this hotel has the best combination.  I looked at Hyatt and Doubletree and they are way too far to walk. For the money I paid, the breakfast and the parking is icing on the cake.

The hotel was very nice and we were greeted quickly.  Our room was great- quiet and comfortable.  The staff was wonderful.  They upgraded our room and helped us out when our car battery went dead.  Thank you soooo much Kristen and Maya for helping us out with our car. They have a great breakfast, but would like the hours to be earlier.

Summary Heading: This hotel is the best kept secret close to  Disney!!
Summary: They had a room for every need.  My grandaughter stayed with her mom and dad in the Yuha room which gave the parents a little privacy. My husband an I had a suite so we could gather there for visiting and meals. It rained all five days so it was wonderful to have dryers on  each floor to dry ourselves out.  THE BEST  was the full breakfast every morning. great way to start your day. For the price,  the hotel was more than worth it.  WIthin one hakf mile of the  gates of Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A great hotel for a family visiting Disneyland.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  We felt the price was very fair for the location and quality of the facility.  It is about a 10 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland and you can see the Tower of Terror and California Screamin' Roller Coaster from the hotel.  The staff was friendly and helpful, they let us check in when we arrived at 11:45am instead of waiting until 3pm check in.  The breakfast was very good: eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, waffles, danish, fruit, cereal and more.  We had a Yuha Kid Suite with a king  size bed and a seperate room with bunk beds.  The room wasn't large, but big enough.  We spent the majority of each day at Disneyland so we didn't need a big room to hang out in.  We would go back to this hotel.

Great hotel for Disneyland visitors.  We had a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland gates.  Our room and bathroom were very clean.    The safe in our room was quite handy.  Free parking and a free breakfast buffet was great.  Having the same breakfast every morning was a bit tedious.  2 out of the 7 days we stayed there, we went elsewhere for breakfast.  The breakfast buffet included make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage patties, hashbrowns, oranges, cottage cheese, yogurt, toast, danishes orange juice and coffee.  Internet worked but it was painfully slow!  I would definitely stay here again for our next trip to Disneyland.
Our stay was wonderful. The room with kitchen was very useful, quiet and clean. I would recommend this hotel for the excellent room and vicinity to Disneyland, very family friendly!

This hotel was wonderful!  The front desk was very friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast was a great bonus that helped us start our day.  The suite rooms were great for larger families.  The pull out beds were uncomfortable (as they usually are), but the regular beds were extremely comfortable.  The free wireless internet was handy to have but bring your own computer because the one computer provided in the lobby was slow and then not working.    What a great location!  It was a beautiful 10 min walk to Disneyland in the morning which provided the kids time to burn off some energy.   The hotel is on the same side as disneyland so we didn't have to cross any major streets.  The hotel was a little bit loud at times.  It was just a little bit more than I was anticipating

Summary Heading: A few days at Disneyland for our 10th Anniversary :)
Summary: We have stayed at a few hotels in the area, both "good neighbor hotels" and disneyland hotels (with and without children)...and we prefer to stay here at the Desert Palms!  They were a good hotel even before their remodel, but now they are even better!  They have clean rooms, a good location, and a yummy continental breakfast in the mornings.  With kids we like the Yuha Kids Suite, and without we like their Deluxe room with the king bed.  This last trip in November we reserved online and made a note it was our anniversary.  When we checked in and got to our room it was a Deluxe room with two queens...we went back to the front desk and explained that we wanted a king bed and the nice woman switched us and apologized for the confusion.  I was re-leaved they were so accommodating

Summary Heading: I would definitely stay here again, just not near the elevator
Summary: Clean, comfortable and good value. The hot breakfast buffet was very good. They had everything! 10 minute walk to the parks. They 'upgraded' us to a bunk-bed suite, right next to the noisy elevator. Other than that, our stay was enjoyable! We will be back next year!
I get to go to Disneyland often.  I stay at this new hotel for the cleanliness, spacious rooms and suites, breakfast, and location. Price this place. It's a remarkable value.

We stayed at the Desert Palms for 4 nights, all of them being comfortable & clean. We were in one of the Yuha Suites as we have 3 kids.. an 8yr old, 11yr old & a16yr old. The kids room had bunk beds & a pull out couch that needed to be folded up everday to be able to walk freely in the room. There was also a tiny deck off the kids room.  It was really nice that we could put them to bed, close the sliding door & have a little quiet time. They had their own tv & so did we. The main room had a microwave, small fridge & a safe with a key, iron & board & coffee maker. Very nice decor with granite tops on all the furniture. (Same granite i have at home 2000 miles away! Weird!) The bathroom was good because there was a 2nd sink outside the bathroom so that one person could be in the

It's not the Ritz but the rooms are quite large and the location is great with a 10 minute walk to Disney.  Parking, breakfast, and wifi are included which is a huge plus.  The beds were a bit uncomfortable and the room did remind me of a college dorm but again for the price it's a great value.  Note the 90% of guests are families with young kids so its very noisy.

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best place to be
Summary: Front desk clerk-Sam was very courteous and helpful. He assisted my family with local information regarding attractions and some of the best places around town to eat. Sam's assistance definitely makes me want to come back and stay at the Desert Palms!

Summary Heading: Great alternative to high priced Disney hotels
Summary: We normally stay at one of the Disney properties but this trip we decided to try another hotel.  The Desert Palms Hotel is a fantastic option if you want service, cleanliness and location.  We stayed in one of the kids suites and it was so nice to have a separate room for the kids.  They each (3) had their own bed.  The beds were comfortable and clean.  The rooms were clean and well maintained.  It had 2 flat screen tv's, a fridge and microwave.  The bathroom had a nice high showerhead and the pressure was great. The service was great too.  We called for more blankets and they brought them up in less than 5 minutes.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast was great.  They had make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, sausage,

This room was great for the four of us. Two adults and two kids. Plenty of room with a table to eat at. Easy walking distance to Disneyland and even closer to places to eat. Very clean and staff was very friendly. We WILL stay here again.

Summary Heading: Loved the hotel! Better than expected and will definately go back.
Summary: I travel to Disneyland several times a year and have stayed at many hotels over the years. I have a favorite hotel on Harbor but they were too expensive this trip so I thought I'd try the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites. I was VERY pleasantly surprised!  Positive: Room size! Full breakfast, free parking, free internet, close proximity to Disneyland, view from rooftop dining area for breakfast. Negative: Smell in the hallways was very strong cleaning agents, pool is rather small if you love to swim.

Summary Heading: Our stay in Desert Palms was just great.
Summary: Our stay in Desert Palms was just great. Good accommodations, breakfast and location (walking distance to  Disneyland ). Also, congratulations on your very friendly staff. The whole family had a great time.

Summary Heading: Will stay again and recommend to others
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel from 18/01/2011. Booked two queen beds in one room, got upgrated to a family suite at no extra cost. Staff were friendly and helpful, both check in and check out were very smothly and quick. Beds were confortable and the room was quiet. The breakfast was good.  Location is exllent, there is a 7-eleven and super market right next door. There are some take away food places across the road ( the pizzas were nice), 10 to 15 minutes easy walk to Disneyland.
We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights,Great location, 10 minutes walk to Disneyland. Roomy space ,free parking and free wi-fi. Breakfast was ok,it's free!

I decided to book this hotel based on good reviews, location to Disneyland and value. I was very pleased with our stay here. It's just about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, this saves 15 bucks for the parking fee. They serve a very good breakfast to get your day started. We were a party of six so this saved us some money. When we arrived at about 9pm to check in the gentleman who was at the front desk was very nice, he even upgraded our room to two bedroom suite at no extra cost to us. Our room was spacious, with 2 queen beds in one room and bunkbeds in another that included a sofabed. the room was very clean. We enjoyed our stay and will definately return and will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

The hotel was just right for our family trip. We had a warm welcome, a spacious suite and a great time. I was very happy to find that a free breakfast was included with our suite, considering the cost of feeding our little army of kids. This hotel is definitely one that I'll be visiting again in the summer.

Summary Heading: if your going to disney this is the place
Summary: the staff is friendly and helpful,the free breakfast is good, i found it less crowded after 9:30 service is until 10 ..several reasonable priced eateries across the street for lunch or diner-disney is a short walk but we saw a few  families  without strollers,a must if you have small ones

My family and i have been staying at this hotel for twenty two years.This hotel is very family orientated,its location is pretty well central to everything,all you have to do is walk out the front door. The service is excellent, the staff is excellent,the rooms are superlative,and there is plenty of FREE parking.

I loved staying at this hotel since it was easy to get to many great attractions.The staff were extremely helpful and some went above and beyond what was expected.The hotel was clean, had many ammenities and has recently been upgraded.I would stay at this hotel again.

A group of my friends from out of state came to visit me, and  I arranged to get rooms at the Desert Palms, to make it convenient for everyone.  I stayed with them for 2 nights, and it felt like  I was at home.  Great customer service, spacious, and nice outdoor patio.  The reference desk told us a couple of great places to go for entertainment/dancing.  They arranged a taxi cab for pick up and everything ran smoothly. Being that it is in the epicenter of all great things, not only is this hotel in a great location, but the the operations of the hotel were superb.  Highly reccomend.

Summary Heading: Great Service, Great Room, and Great Time!
Summary: From the moment we checked in, to the time we checked out, we had a great experience.  Anything we needed was brought up to the room, and the staff went above and beyond great customer service to ensure we were completely satisfied with our stay.  I will definately be staying here again!
very good  hotel, friendly  staff very close to disnyland.

Summary Heading: Awesome Stay, Sam made it work & Worth the Stay
Summary: My stay at the Desert Palms Hotel was fantastic, The Clerk at the front desk made our stay even better. His name was Sam, he is a true representative of your company. He made our stay even more enjoyable.We really enjoyed the daily breakfast. There were a variety of options (eggs, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, Danishes, cold cereal, juice, etc.) We enjoyed the free wireless internet and free hotel parking. The proximity to Disneyland was not bad, And all kind of places to eat near by.cannot say enough about the way we were treated.

Summary Heading: Not a particularly nice place to stay.
Summary: Arrived in the lobby only to be greeted by the receptionist with a "name please", not even a hello or anything. Good that it was the last we saw of her, when we got into the lift to go to our room, the doors wouldn't close on the lift, so the maintenance man walked by and bashed them until they closed. We arrived in our room to find that the carpet had stains, there was rubbish beneath the bed and that the bathroom fixtures were not only dirty but falling apart. The plug in the sink would not stay in and the tap in the shower would only work on the bath and not shower head, when you pulled the knob on the tap it would just pop back out again. The air conditioner was noisy and would not turn down below 73F. The red pillows on the bed had assorted stains on them too. The so-called

stayed here with my family and loved it! they allowed us to check in (11am) which was a greatly appreciated when u have small kids! we loved the free breakfast, especially the part where kids make their own waffles :). Free parking allowed us to walk to disney ( which is 10 minutes with kids on tow). The staff was wonderful, helped us chooses places for dinner and were always smiling! We will definetely come back here again next time we are back to the Happiest Place on Earth :)

Our experience at this property was very nice. The room was a bit small but overall we found it to be clean and comfortable. We stayed in a King Suite and our king bed was EXTREMELY comfortable!  On the other hand, the sofa sleeper that our kids slept on was not great.    We were there during a very rainy period and there appeared to be some leaks in the roof based on the buckets scattered around the building collecting the rain water. This did not cause any difficulty for us during our stay.  Due to the weather, it was nice to have access to the clothes dryer on our floor (although many other guests were taking advantage of it as well and there was a significant wait to use it).    We really enjoyed the daily breakfast. There were a variety of options (eggs, waffles, oatmeal,

This was the hotel I stayed if I go to Disney in the past. But I will definitely change to another hotel later. During my last stay here with my family for seven nights here, I and my husband was bited by "BedBugs". We reported it to the hotel the next day and they changed a new room for us. But the guy said we just had allergy. That is the most aburd thing I heard. My husband and I absolutely has no any allergies to anything since born. Besides the bites look  different than allergy. There are small hole of stings in the affected area. When we argued with the manager, the manager said that they went there and checked, they did not find any bugs. Anyone with bedbug knowledge should know that these bugs are very hard to find. Special lights are used to find them. Basically, I am

When my husband, another couple, and I took a vacation to Anaheim we chose this hotel for four reasons. 1) Proximity to Disneyland  2) Free breakfast  3) fitness room  4) price  We were not disappointed. The hotel was an easy walk to the park which allowed us to return in the middle of the day for a break. The breakfast was fantastic and the fitness room was nice to have as well. We also enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi as well as the free wi-fi. My only disappointment was the fitness room hours, which were from 9AM-10PM, which made it impossible to get up early and exercise before going to Disneyland when the gates open at 8. However, we were able to exercise during the midday break, so all in all, the hotel suited our needs perfectly.  We will absolutely stay here again.

I stayed at the Desert Palms hotel with my family for a couple different reasons. One was that the price was very reasonable, and two, it is close to Disneyland. A good priced hotel nowadays helps a lot since Disney prices are continuing to increase all the time.  The staff was fantastic, always greeting us with their smiles. They booked the Los Angeles and Hollywood tour for us which was amazing. The room was great, with two beds and a pull out that came in handy. I do believe that the breakfast and different varieties offered, needs a bit help.

What can i say, staying here at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites was a wonderful experience. My family and i had a fun time. the staff was very helpful and was always there to suite me. I loved the new rooms and the FREE hot breakfest...i saved sooo much money with the breakfest...me and my family will defenatley come back to stay here

Summary Heading: You get the best service for your money at the dessert palm hotel.
Summary: This was a great vacation for my family and I. Besides all the excitement  we had at Disneyland. It was nice to stay at a hotel with wonderful service and excellent staff they are very friendly. My family and I well for sure come back to this hotel in the years that follow.

Me and my family just love coming down to So. Cal and enjoying the disney magic experinece. I have been to many of the hotels in the area. This hotel has been great to me and my family. Its clean, buffet is excellent, walking distance to disneyland, free parking, and great customer service. i highly recommend this hotel to begin your disney experience.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We had a terrible stay here.   We read some earlier reviews & decided to chance it for a few days. I wish we hadn't, we had three very bad nights sleeps as it was so noisy you could hear when people came in from Disneyland at midnight.  The foyer is done very nicely at this hotel but it is deceptive, the rooms & halls are very average.  We had a 2 room family suite, whilst technically it allows for 6 people too sleep here, it's a pretty tight fit. We were all under each other's feet and when the couch was unfolded our kids couldn't get out of the bunk beds.  The breakfast was very ordinary, the breakfast at other hotels was much better.  Yes this place is cheap & a short walk to Disneyland with a breakfast inclusion but you do get what you pay for, pay a little more & stay

The room was clean but the laundry facilitys were horrible.  We were staying for a couple of days so we just did a load of laundry.  There were no dryers available.  Just make sure you pack enough so you don't have to do any laundry.  We had asked the front desk questions and they said they would call us back.  Never called back up.  So if you are expecting excellent front desk service don't come here.  They also have a resturant but it took them 20 minutes after we were done eating to get our bill.

We were pleasantly surprised with our room; very nice and updated for the price.  We got our room for $68 plus taxes a night.  The location is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland just like they said.  The full breakfast in the morning was great to get your day started; you can make your own waffles, have eggs and sausage, cereal, hot cereal, yogurt, pastries or fruit.  A big variety to choose from.  The only draw back for us was we were on the street side and it was a bit noisy for sleeping, but we just turned on the fan and it covered the traffic noise enough for sleeping.  We would stay there again.  The lobby is very nice as well.

Great location can easily be walked to the Park 3 yr old was in stroller 7 yr old walked it no problems along with 87 yr old Great Grandma (little slower).  Service was good, rooms were clean and neat. The complimentary breakfast buffet was one of the better ones that we have had  Food was constantly being refreshed and wait staff were always present cleaning up.  They had scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, oatmean. fresh fruit, donuts, yogart, cottage cheese, cold cereal and make your own blegium waffles and toast along with assorted juices, milk, hot tea and coffee. Beats trying to get into a sit down breakfast with small children who really only want cereal and be on the way to park.  Would recommend to all

Summary Heading: Great value for your money and great location!
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights shortly following Thanksgiving.  After a LONG day traveling, we arrived shortly after midnight where I was greeted by a polite friendly front desk clerk who informed me we had been upgraded to suite.  This was a welcome surprise as we have a 5 year old, 3 year old and 2 year old, the more space the better!  Carpets appeared to be new throughout the hotel.  We did not use the hot tub or pool but both were clean and in working order.  The free breakfast is very good.  Fruit, cereal, eggs, sausage, waffles you can make fresh yourself, juice and coffee.  Would easily cost our family $40 at a restaurant.  Staff in the breakfast area are great about keeping things clean and refilled. We walked to Disney with all kids in tow and made it there in 8 minutes.  They

Summary Heading: We've shopped around, stayed at many, but this one has them all beat for the price and location!
Summary: I can save the money-thrift, value shopper a lot of time and energy by highly recommending this hotel! You won't find a better value, delicious full breakfast (which saved us a minimum of 60$ a morning), and helpful staff anywhere. This is not the Ritz, but it more than met our high standards for boarding. All our kids loved it, ages 9-16, and that is really saying something!!! We will stay again FOR SURE!

Summary Heading: you don't need to stay anywhere else!
Summary: We have stayed here many times.  The worst experience was not having enough towels in the room.  I called housekeeping and with in 5 minutes we had more towels.  The service is excellent.  Highly recommend to large families.  We have 6 in our family 2 teens and 2 younger kids, this is a perfect place for us.

Very nice hotel ,freindly staff ,I really enjoyed our stay. Spent 4 nights and the staff was nice, helpful. Breakfast every morning for free.... and even though the choices are not many, it worked out great. ... we got a crib, in good shape, clean. plenty of room for a 3 year old and 1 year old to run, watch tv and play. I would definitely go back

We loved this hotel because.... - 10 minutes to Disneyland by walking (with a 3 year old daughter) - Full breakfast (Not fancy, but my daughter enjoyed making the waffles by herself) - Free internet service (no problem on getting the signals) - Our room had a refrigerator (it was a small one, but it had a freezer inside) - We called them for extra pillows and blankets. They came to our room immediately. - Room was clean and all the staff were friendly.  One bad thing was that the fan in the bathroom was very noisy. There were no separate switches for the fan and the light.

Very nice staff, rooms were clean. The continential breakfast the hotel offered on the 5th Floor for free was AWESOME!!! I have never seen anything like it.  Booked for one nite but will be back for more!

Summary Heading: Affordable and Beautiful place to stay!!!
Summary: I went with some friends on a Disneyland trip and was looking for something nice and affordable. I looked into a few other hotels and decided to stay here because it offered more amenities than any of the other nearby hotels. All the other hotels in the area charged ridiculous prices where the rooms were basically the same and had the same amenities!! I will honestly say I wasn't completely sure to stay here at first but this girl I believe her name may have been Jessica, definitely reassured me!! She provided sufficient information about the hotel that I was sold!! I couldn't pass up such a great deal and great service!!! I would definitely stay here again! It is very close to Disneyland, major attractions, affordable, nice rooms and friendly staff!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, reasonable price, and great service”
Summary: My family and I booked Five Days/Six Nights at The Desert Palms in Anaheim, we made our decision mostly on location. It is relatively close to Disneyland (probably about a 5-10 minute walk to the turnstiles), and very central to a lot of restaurants.   When we arrived and checked in, One of the staff at the desk (Sam!) asked us if we wanted to upgrade to larger room with a better view of the fireworks, and we did want that, so he upgraded us to the better room at no cost. Throughout our entire stay the entire staff was great, especially Sam, who was amazing. (Say Hi to him if you stay there, you can't miss him!) Breakfast (7:00-10:00) was better than other hotels, in my opinion. The lineup: potatoes, sausage patties, scrambled eggs, oatmeal, donuts (yum), oranges, cereal and

Summary Heading: Right across the street from Conference Center
Summary: This hotel is affordable, has a nice breakfast with a rooftop dining area and is right across the street from the Anaheim Conference Center.  If you're going to Disneyland, it's just a short walk right around the corner.  The hotel is on a corner with bus and Anaheim Resort Transit stops.  The staff are very friendly and helpful. Business center where you can check in with your airline and print your boarding pass Seemed like a safe area to me. Not all of the elevators go to every floor, so check on this.

1. Book rate directly through hotel online it is cheaper. 2. No nonsense place, rate is rate the rest is free. Breakfast, internet and parking. 3. Breakfast is toast, oatmeal, sugary cereal (2x choices), oranges for fresh fruit, yoghurt, waffles to make yourself, egg (cardboard texture), some kind of processed meat (I wouldn't eat it), fried potatoes.  If you are ok with this list and happy to pay for breakfast other times, this place works out to be great value with the other items above free. 4. Laundry facilities major + for a family as there is always a need to do laundry. But not cheap. $2.00 per load but dryer does it's job for the same price. I know this as I paid $1.25 in San Diego.  But remember this is Disneyland world! 5. Pool and spa not bad but wished it was open

So we get to the hotel after i had prebooked in June for Blizzcon 2010. They had messed up my reservation and gave me a room with one one bed for three people. No problem the lady says and free upgrade to a suite (ha!) however it was definately not a suite. 2 Small Queen beds and a couch. That was it.   The hotel cleaning staff was very rude and none of them spoke a word of english which was a challenge getting someone to clean our room for our entire 4 night stay.
