Practically had to beg and plead with the Front Desk to get someone and when they finally did come my bed received a bloody pillow. Yep you heard it. Bloody! When i called to complain about it they literally acted liked i was lying until i brought it down and sure enough, a 12" blood stain on my pillow.   Parking is

Summary Heading: A good value and location near Disneyland
Summary: Myself and two friends stayed here for four nights in October while enjoying the Halloween festivities at Disneyland. I booked the trip via Orbitz and felt that it was a reasonable deal ($149/night including a rental car). The hotel is situated near the corner of Katella and Harbor and is about a 10 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland (we timed it). The lobby of the hotel is quite clean and well maintained. During our stay they were working on the hotel which did lend to some construction noises during the day  which, were slightly loud at time but it was usually wrapped up by 6pm. Our room was #409, which was a deluxe room which had been recently updated and was extremely tidy. There were two queen size beds as well as a desk area, mini-fridge and microwave. The beds

Positives: the room is clean, shower is ok and the service (concierge) is fine. Parking is free, internet is free and apparently you get breakfast. Now for the rest...Thought the photos and reviews would do this hotel justice...we say No. Maybe its because we booked at the last minute (we did book directly on the hotels' website) but the room is the smallest we've come across (even NYC have bigger!) Don't get room 301 - right across from the laundry and a metre away from the lifts - so high traffic volume area. The price isn't that cheap ($170 AUS ish) but perhaps it is for the area? We considered staying two nights...until we got into the room. We only intend to stay one night and visit Disneyland etc tomorrow - this would be the only reason you would stay here...unless you
6 in our family group from australia ,very satisfied with service location and helpful staff we would stay again

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, reasonable price, and great service
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland, so we had to depend on online reviews and internet pictures to find a hotel.  We got a great deal at Desert Palms, and I'm very glad we did.  - Beautiful hotel.  The lobby is luxurious, and as we walked in, the man cleaning the doors opened them for us.  Quite a welcome. - Nice rooms.  Our reserved Kalahari suite was being renovated, so we got two Borrego suites instead at no extra cost.  Roomy and beautiful. - Breakfast.  The complimentary hot breakfast buffet was nice. We've had better, and for a week-long stay, the selection wasn't great.  However, it was very good, and a great money-saver for a Disneyland vacation.  The rooms have microwave and fridge, so we always took a few things with us for snacking later. - Mario.  I think the guy

Summary Heading: Great hotel and very good location
Summary: I stayed in this hotel with my three teenage sons. The room was very nice and tidy and cleaned every day. The beds were very comfy.  There was a small amount of noise in hallways which may have woke us early some mornings.  The breakfast of cereal, yoghurt and quartered oranges or eggs, sausage patties and potato was exactly the same for thewhole 9 mornings we were there however it was free.  As far as location goes this hotel is excellent. A 10minute walk to Disneyland and California theme park and maybe 15mins in bus  to Knotts Berry Farm.  There is a 7 11 Shop right out the door of the hotel which was great for buying bottled water at $6.00 for 20 bottles compared to $3.00 per bottle at Disneyland.   There are plenty of close by restaurants within easy walking distance

We booked this hotel for 11 nights as they advertised a family suite large enough for our family (2 adults & 4 children) and fully paid for the accommodation before leaving Australia. We arrived before checkin time and were advised our room was NOT READY, which is fine, checkin is 2pm. However we returned later in the day and was told that not only was the room not ready, but it was not available at all! They gave us 2 rooms side by side instead - the rooms were not even interconnecting and they expected us to leave kids in the second room or the 2 adults had to sleep one in each. We advised them this was not suitable, then were give two interconnecting rooms which were half the size.  We eventually found out that the Kalahari suite we had booked was being refurbished, however

Activities we were in Anaheim for were at Marriott. We chose this hotel that was within walking distance for its free parking, free internet and free breakfast. Location on Katella is walking distance to great restaurants, Disney, Convention Centre. Rooms are large and our free upgrade to our suite had full size fridge and stove, and separate bedroom. Plenty of room for our family of 4 to wind down after a long day. Hotel staff was friendly. Breakfast was very good and had good variety. Two thumbs up. Pay less here, get more and walk to great meals out!! Also quick mart on the corner to grab anything we needed on our walk home from dinner along the beautifully lit palm tree lined street.

I loved this place!  The room was huge, with the bath and bedroom complete with a TV in a media cabinet on one level, and then a step down into a full living room with a kitchen table and chairs, sofa, and another TV.  Felt very luxurious.  It was also meticulously clean and the housekeeper insisted on giving me a huge stack of fresh towels without me even asking when I declined to have her clean the room.   The pool and hot tub were located in a courtyard in the center of the building and were great.  The breakfast too exceeded my expectations with make your own waffles, and real eggs (not the kind you pour from a box) along with lots of other good eats.

The one thing that really let me down about this hotel is the fact that they use plastic, and foam (worst of all) cups, plates and cutlery in their breakfast dining room.  Apart from the fact it is impossible to eat with these bendable knives and forks, what about the environment?  Very disappointing.  On the plus side, the desk staff were extremely courteous and helpful and our rooms were great and pretty much what we expected.

Rooms are clean and spacious, service personnel are kind, pleasant and helpful.  Great late check out! Although I am in easy driving distance of Disneyland I always stay here for convince. I recommend to all my friends and family as well.

Summary Heading: GREAT SERVICE FROM ALL THE EMPLOYEES
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for one night as me and my wife wanted to spend the day at Disney. When we called to book our reservation the staff was very polite. We wanted to book a regular room with one bed but instead were offered a King Spa for only a couple dollars more. I figured it would be nice to have a spa to relax after a long day at Disneyland.  On check in time the staff was great they quickly checked us in to our room. Our suite was very nice, with a great view, and very clean. The breakfast is excellent plenty of items to get you started for the day. I loved this hotel the Service is great and the hotel is nice. I am planning to visit soon.

Their website gave us medium expectations.  It's walking distance from Disneyland (1/2 mile) and medium priced.  We were still disappointed.  The room we had was outdated and in bad repair.  Broken window blinds, cramped room.   Shower drain was backed-up.  Internet very slow (but free).  Breakfast was so-so.  Nowhere near an Embassy Suites, but better than a plain continental.  We would have been fine with these things.    The tipping point for me was the construction they had going on (surprise).  Hammering and drilling  on the floor above us during the day.  Not helpful when trying to get a 3 year old down for a nap.  Also, the water was turned off from 11am till 5pm on the two days we were there.  The staff worked to be helpful.   Hopefully, the construction is something
Pool is in a strange spot, not much sun. The elevator was a little scary, it didn't open all the way so we had to take the stairs but we were on the 2nd floor so we didn't mind.

Summary Heading: Ruined my Disneyland Experience - need a vacation from my vacation
Summary: This was the WORST place I've ever stayed. Let me tell you a little about my family/vacation plans - Military Family Wanted a fun vacation with a decent hotel to shower/sleep/close to Disneyland 2 year old and 7 year old child Wanted to spend a decent amount of money (not as much as the Resort hotels charge, because last year we stayed at Disneyland and found we only slept and showered there, so we didn't need an expensive hotel. Boy was I wrong.)  To be fair, below is listed the good items. The good: The lobby The staff Parking 7-11 next door  So, our story begins with us being to late to score a $75 military voucher for the deluxe rooms, or a voucher to get a suite for $139.00. The hotel had "already given away all of the voucher rooms." We were getting the deluxe room for

Summary Heading: This is not a four star hotel!
Summary: This hotel was given 4 stars and it is not even close to what I would  consider 4 star. The furniture was very outdated and worn in our "suite." When we walked into the room there was a very strong scent of some sort of cleaner . We had to open up the balcony window to air out the room.  I would never reccomend this hotel to anyone.

We (two adults and young two children) staid there three times in 2009 and 2010 on our trips to Disneyland.  We were looking for something larger than a hotel room with a kitchen, reasonably priced, and walking distance from Disneyland.  This hotel was pretty much the only choice.  Their Sahara suite has a "full" (but small) kitchen - a small stove, a smallish fridge, a microwave and a kitchen sink with a tiny bit of counter space, plus all the basic (cheap and not not very well maintained) cooking utensils.  It worked well for us to prepare basic meals/snacks for the kids, reheat a slice of pizza, and kept fruit and drinks cool.   Sahara suite offers a separate bedroom with two queen sized beds, and a living room (area) with a pull-out sofa.  We did not use the sofa, so can't

Summary Heading: The staff treated our large group with courtesy and profesinallism at all time and made our stay very pleasant.
Summary: Following is a letter that I emailed to the General Manager of the Desert Palms Hotel.  Hello John P.   I must say that you certainly have an "over the top" staff at your hotel.  Starting from my first call and conversation with Maria to our final check out with Albina and Jessica nothing could have been handled in a more courteous, professional and helpful way.  Putting my group of 27 up in the requested room configuration could not have been handled any better than it was by the young ladies in reservations.  We ended up with eight rooms.  I called so many times in the beginning of my project that Maria recognized my voice and I'm sure she was saying to herself, "oh no, not him again.  When she wasn't on duty Jessica handled all of my needs superbly.  I also spoke with

We stayed in a Borega Suite with 2 Adults and 2 Children for 4 nights.  The location of the hotel is the best feature with Disneyland in your back yard and within walking distance of all the main Anneheim features. It's not the flashest hotel on the block. The staff were reasonably friendly, though could improve.  The pool was OK though on the margin for cleanliness as were the rooms which are a bit tired. It's all pretty 80's and in need of a refurb. But for the Money we paid which was $360NZ total included resort fees etc for 4 night for 4 people when booking through Air New Zealand we really couldn't complain. We had a good stay here but would try somewhere else next time if visiting Annaheim again. The Castle Inn across the road or the Candy Inn next door looked like good

Went with family of 4 (2 kids 11 & 9.  The good> Not a ton.  -Lobby is maybe the nicest thing there but really don't imagine this hotel offered anything more than any other hotels in the area.  -10 mins form Disney is good and next to 7/11 and cheap ABC T-Shirt shop helped.  - Also close to Garden Walk Restaurants, but all these hotels are. - Comp breakfast was very basic. Make your own waffles is nice. Coffee is bad (I think it was coffee anyway). -Can accommodate large group (We had 90) -Staff seem friendly  The Bad> -If you're on the 4th floor count on being woken up at 7 AM by shifting chairs one floor up in buffet breakfast room. Not good. -Beds are boards. -Loud AC -Fan in bathroom sounds like a helicopter when light turns on, so anyone getting up in the night to go will

Summary Heading: Best hotel we have stayed in.  Wonderful!
Summary: We visited Disneyland and stayed stayed at Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.  It is a 5 minute walk to Disneyland, all sorts of restaurants, and convenient stores,  This was important to us because we have a 2 year old baby so we needed milk, diapers, and groceries.  The staff was very friendly!  The room was exquisite.  They had a refrigerator and a microwave in the room which was very helpful because my 2 year old must have her milk at different times.  We had a great time in the heated pool and we enjoyed the delicious breakfast they offer on the terrace.  I am definitely staying at this hotel again when I come back to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: By far the worst hotel I've stayed in while visiting
Summary: My family and I have been driving down to Disneyland at least once a year since I was born. Needless to say, we've stayed in a variety of hotels in the area. This particular hotel was cheap and irritatingly misleading. Almost a scam! For example, their wedbsite online provides one photo of the rooms, and it's the photo of the suite, not a regular room. The consierge was rude, arrogant, and masochistic. He had an attitude with my mother-- a 50 year old woman-- when we reported that the closet in our room wouldn't shut properly and we asked to either have it fixed or be moved. Instead of listening, he kept cutting her off whenever she tried explaining the problem, saying if she didn't "be quiet" he couldn't help her. He refused to speak directly to her, deeming her "difficult" and

Summary Heading: Was okay if you just sleep & shower there
Summary: When we got to our room, we had a handicap room, which I did not request, I requested a Suite and  I made the reservations back in February!   When I called the front desk they said there was nothing else available, so we spent 6 days, 5 nights in an awkward handicap room & restroom.  The weekday breakfast was terrible & the 5th floor room they had it in was very hot & stuffy, the weekend breakfast was a little better.  The pool is in a small area, no trees, just concrete & rooms all around. The parking was underground, one way in & one way out, very weird.  On one day the maid didn't even clean our room, which was terrible & when I called to ask they said all the maid staff left for the day, so we were stuck with a dirty room & dirty towels. The only postive thing is it was

This hotel was recommended as a "good neighbor" hotel by the Walt Disney Travel Company so we booked it.  I would like to say that the front desk staff was kind and helpful to my family of six.  JESSICA and NEVINE were friendly and accomodating to us in making sure we got a good room were familiar with the area and hotel processes.  They also recommended a the room with bunk beds next time we come for my family with four children.  This hotel is definitely kids friendly and its proximity to Disneyland's main gate makes it the perfect 10 minute walk.  The rooms were clean and well kept for a renovated hotel.  I agree with other reviews that the walls are fairly thin and the mattresses could be swapped out for new ones.  The microwave, refrigerator, and kitchen were perfect for us

Summary Heading: We were happy with location and facility - but thin walls
Summary: We were at Disneyland for a class trip and our high school band marched down Main Street in Disneyland.  This hotel accomodated our large group so that was one of the selection criteria.    Overall our room (#351) was very nice.   The pros are the refrig and microwave as well as the spaciousness.  Two TVs in the room and the suite-like ambiance (really one big room separated by a step and rail).  Large bathroom with load fan but it pulled out all the moisture and the mirror was always clear.  Our room was clean and we found no problems.   Two queen beds were comfortable as were the pillows.  The view from the window was a wall but that meant we didn't face the busy streets and it was always quiet from outside....except the walls are thin.  You hear everything in the hallway and

There are many pluses here. The location is excellent if you are visiting Disneyland or the convention center. The hotel and its rooms are clean and in very good shape. The parking is free, as is breakfast and wireless internet. My husband and I were pleased until we tried to sleep. I don't know if it was just our particular room, but the walls are INCREDIBLY thin. We could hear everything going on in the hallway. Not only that, but as people walked down the hall, our walls would rumble, and the floor would squeak and creak. Even the furniture in our room would bounce from the vibrations. And being that we were placed in a room right by the elevator, we got a LOT of foot traffic. The noise was so loud and the vibrations so jarring, it made it almost impossible to sleep, and

We went 3 days without Hot Water, and the front desk just kept saying" fixed soon!" We should have gotten those 3 days free, and only got $75.00 discount. Rooms stuff and old. Hair in sink and bathtub when we checked in. DO not recommend.

Summary Heading: Would definitely stay again! Fantastic experience!
Summary: We stayed in the Borrego room with our 3 kids and I would have to say we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were cleaned to perfection everyday, with many little extras that were done by the housekeeping. Upon check in, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with any questions that we had. The  complimentary breakfast every morning that ran from 7 - 10 am, was always fully stocked with plenty of choices for everybody. There were eggs, sausage, ham, hash browns, biscuits and gravy, cereal, yogurt, fresh pastries, fresh fruit, cottage cheese, juice , coffee, milk, tea. You cant get much better than this if you had gone out to a restaurant to eat. We would definitely stay here again without any hesitation. The pool was also wonderful and very clean and inviting. I cannot

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - will definitely stay here again!
Summary: My husband, 2 children aged 8 and 12, and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in November 2009.  It was great!  I had booked a standard room at a 20% discount rate directly with the hotel, but we upgraded to a suite after checking in.  I think we paid about $125/night for the new room.  It had a lounge, kitchen with full size fridge/freezer, microwave, eating area, bedroom with 2 double/queen beds, plus a bathroom.  Very, very spacious.  Breakfast was included each morning and offered toast, cereals, bagels, donuts, juices, coffeee/tea, and a rotation of other hot foods.  It was very filling and really got us going each day.  The staff were great, particularly at the reception desk. Very friendly and helpful.  One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was for its non-smoking

The hotel was great with plenty of space for the six of us and really comfortable close to Disney and evrything you want in Anaheim. It was hard to find any thing for a family of six so I would recommend this place to any one with a large  family. Sam was the best he organised a tour of downtown LA, Hollywood etc etc etc with Fernando which was awsome and we all got to see all the high lights and low lights of LA and we all got so much out of it. Really great Value for money and an awsome experience.

Summary Heading: NOT BAD BUT WOULD PAY A LITTLE MORE TO BE CLOSER NEXT TIME
Summary: This hotel was not bad this was our second time staying here 1st time was in 2004 and was just my spouse and I this trip consisted of 3 children ages 3,9,11 and 3 adults we stayed in the mojave suite and it wasn't huge but worked out pretty good for us there were 2 queen beds and a small room with the sofa bed where the refrigerator and microwave are plus there are 2 tvs one for each room.  there was also a sink outside the bathroom that was helpful with such a big group.  The room was clean and worked for us we really only slept there most of our time was in the parks.  The hotel itself was very hot and not many of the housekeeping staff spoke english but we didn't have a problem. The room was clean and I am one that worries about a clean room.   The pool is small but worked

Summary Heading: Great stay! Clean, close, roomy, afforadable!
Summary: We have stayed here many times and this time was really great. The staff was friendly, rooms affordable, nice size rooms for my family of 6, and close to the park. And everything was VERY clean.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney but watch the fees
Summary: The price is very good if you book ahead. They have several wierd daily fees, one for the safe and a resort fee. They do not clearly disclose these but they currently add about $10 per day. The hotel was clean, close to Disneyland and had a nice breakfast. Great for families but understand there are other fees.

Summary Heading: We stayed in a four star inn and I cant wait to do it again!
Summary: We had a short family trip and got the luxury of staying in your beautiful Inn for one night . We were checked in in a matter of seconds, but it did take a few extra minutes get to our beautiful room because our kids had to check out the gorgeous lobby and of course the gift shop. We stayed in the Borrego Suite and it was definitely the most beautiful room we have stayed in. The beds are extremity comfortable, even on the pull out sofa bed my 18 year old son said he had slept great! In the morning we all got to enjoy a delicious continental  breakfast on the outside patio over looking Disneyland, It was the perfect way to start the day. Lastly;  The staff was very friendly and also very helpful, with extra pillows and coffee for our room and  even recommendations on  local

Summary Heading: Could do better for the money
Summary: On the plus side, this place had some good things going for it.  The hotel has a great location for visiting Disneyland plus a decent pool, a nice lobby, and free parking. They also provide a free, good sized breakfast with potatos, eggs, sausage, tea, coffee, donuts, cereal, toast, and fruit all of which can be eaten on a nice rooftop deck overlooking Disneyland.    The reasons for giving this hotel a lower rating are related to my personal experience.  Upon arrival my wife and I were upgraded to a room which felt like a downgrade.  The room was extremely small and noisy.  People in the room adjacent to ours had a window less than a foot from our window that could look straight into our room, so there was no sense in opening the curtains to enjoy the view of the pool area.  For

Summary Heading: Good staff, clean and close to attractions
Summary: nice and clean rooms. staff is nice, close to disney about a 10 minute walk. Will definitely stay here again

We stayed in the Sahara Suite with kitchen and a balcony for six nights.  The room was very clean at check-in and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job.  The hotel is an easy 10 minute walk to disneyland and is convienant.   The daily brekfast was only decent; the only complaint was the big crowds and the staff was slow to keep the buffet full of food.  The wi-fi worked only some of the time but the free internet in the room worked well.   The beds were just decent and the towels were very small and worn but acceptable.   All in all this is a decent hotel that is close to Disneyland and I would rate it at 2.5*.

What a great hotel, clean,excellent service and fair price.  My wife and grand doughter Mitra visited Micky and had great time and you could see every one is service oriented and willing to help.  We will return when the budget is right.  Keep up the good work!

Visited Anaheim for a day meeting at our California office.  Hotel is very easy to find.  My room was reasonably priced and clean.  I will definitely come back and maybe next time with my family so we can go to Disneyland next door!

Summary Heading: Do not bother staying there, no hot water breakfast horrible
Summary: We went without hot water for over a day, had to move to another room without the help of the management and since they did not want to pay their maids any overtime they needed us to pack up and move ourselves in 10 minutes so they could clean our former room for the next sucker checking in. The fridge in our room kept running all night and kept my daughter awake.The breakfast WAS bad! Management did not seem to care about the 5 other guests in line complaining about the same issues. Pick another hotel.

Summary Heading: Good location when visiting the convention center
Summary: The hotel has a good location if you need to visit the convention center. Next to that there are a couple of nice restaurants in the area. The breakfast is not very attractive, we just went to 7eleven next to the hotel. The hotel is good, however nothing special. The staff is very helpful. The rooms are clean and roomy.

Set the GPS for the hotel address and cruised right in. Parking area was well lighted and near entrance. First impression when entering the lobby was good. Quick check in with Sam who was very friendly and jovial. Got a third floor room which was very clean with reasonably comfortable beds. Brisk walking to Disneyland is 10 minutes and feels perfectly safe at 10 pm. Breakfast room is adequate and breakfast is OK although not gourmet quality. Can eat inside or out on a terrace. Free internet is wireless in lobby, but cabled ethernet in rooms. WiFi works well and fast. They also have free use of computer and printer in lobby area. Pool looked good but was too populated for our taste. Various eating places within a one block walk. People on fourth floor above us obviously kidnapped

Summary Heading: I give this Hotel a solid "B".
Summary: We just finished our trip to Disneyland and we stayed at the Desert Palms for 5 nights.  Overall, it was a good experience.  Not a great one, but not a bad one either.  The most important thing to me was the the room felt and smelled clean as I entered, and the bathroom was clean.  We have 4 young kids and we stayed in the Mini Mojave Suite.  "Mini" is appropriate here.  While it slept 6 just fine, it was a tight fit.  Not a lot of room to spread out, nor much floor space to put a lot of luggage.  If you look on line, however, there are other suites that appear bigger, so keep that in mind.  As we walked down the hallways, we peered into rooms they were cleaning and we saw suites that were much larger and roomier than ours.  The hotel is located at the corner of Disneyland where

I went with my family and my close friend to this hotel and our experience was great! My family usually stays at the Embassy suites but they didn't have a room big enough for us so we decided on the desert palm. This hotel wasn't like the embassy suites but it was still nice. Breakfast could have been better but the outside balcony is beautiful you can see California Adventure. The walk was like 5 to10 min  and wasn't that bad. The hotel gift shop was really cool and cheap. You could also get stuff at the 7-Eleven next door. Our room was good there were four queen beds seperated into 2 sections of our room. The room had two bathrooms which was really nice. For dinner they had a take-out special at  the sandbox grille this included two pizzas and two salads. I would stay here

We stayed at the Desert Palms for 2 nights. We switched hotels before our trip based on the pictures and reviews & the free "hot" breakfast. BIG MISTAKE!!! The hotel claims to have been renovated, but our room must have been skipped. The room was old and smelled musty. The walls were beyond paper thin. We heard every move, sneeze, etc. from our neighbors. The "hot" breakfast consisted of one luke warm item each morning in addition to cereal and stale pastries. Then to top it all off we found cockroaches!!! And not small cockroaches, like 1-2 inch long cockroaches. I ended up catching one in a plastic cup to prove my case to the front desk. They did give me part of my money back, but they should have done more. We left ASAP!! I did email coorporate and never received a response.

Summary Heading: This place should be your LAST pick!
Summary: At check in they tried to charge me $6/day resort fee. This place is NOT a resort! Dont use the inroom safe, there is a fee for it. The breakfast is truly awful, the bar in the hotel is a DIVE, and it's a pretty far hike to Disneyland! The pull out bed was extremely uncomfortable. There are a couple of convenience stores next to the hotel. The Candy Cane Inn next door has a free shuttle that will take you to DL. Unsupervised kiddies running wild after 10PM at nite in the halls make for very disturbed rest. My granddaughter enjoyed the pool. The ladies room next to the pool is a onesie & usually there were people waiting to use it. Signs of extreme money-saving efforts were all over the place. The non-English speaking cleaner walked in to our room before we were ready to leave &

Summary Heading: worth the price I paid, great location
Summary: This hotel is a great value! We took our 3 boys age 9,14,and 4. We stayed in the escalante kids suite. Tons of space! The hotel is close to the front gate about a 10 min walk. The breakfast is that just food nothing to be excited about. But How many hotels have you stayed in that offer free breakfast and you get danishes and muffins? Its hot its food and its free! If you dont like it eat at the park or on the way!   The staff was very nice. We arrived at 11 am parked there went in to get a parking pass before we went to the park. Check in isn't till 3, but the lady at the desk let us check in early. Even upgraded us from the yuka kids to the bigger one for free! The maids where nice and the room was cleaned good she even laid my sons blanket out on the bed for him.  My only

Summary Heading: No way this comes close to 4 stars
Summary: Very convenient to the Disneyland front gate as others have said (you save daily parking expense at Disneyland).  If you like chopped ham/powdered eggs for breakfast, this is a great deal.  Rooms are generally clean, and the staff is friendly.  So far, we are at a 2.5 star accomodation.  The issues:  1) Breakfast leaves much to be desired -- plastic everything, dixie cup size drink cups (maybe 2 ounce size), and the food is just lousy.  2) Beyond the front desk, the staff is clueless as to guest needs.  We had a power breaker fail, and the service tech started by checking flourescent light bulbs. 3) Overall, customer service is not great: a pipe broke in our ceiling, flooding the bathroom, and forcing us to move to another room at 5:00 am.  The desk manager graciously offered us

Booked this two days prior to the trip, the online experience was fine and easy to work.  The location of the hotel is very convenient to the main gate of Disneyland and California Adventure.  Only about a five minute walk down the street.  The room was very comfortable and parking was available without charge.  The worst part of our stay was the breakfast offered.  For the price paid for the room, the breakfast was a very big dissappointment.  Runny scrambled eggs, cheap bread for toast, you get the idea.  Parking at the park is aobut $20 a day and for what you can save and drive a short distance to the park, you might be money ahead.

Summary Heading: Good for Budget Minded Family wanting to visit Disney
Summary: Don't stay in room 110...corner room, with dumpster right outside room!  Basic room I was given, most like a Super 8 room.  Free WIFI?  Only if you go to the lobby area.  I picked up stronger/faster WIFI from the neighboring hotels...but it was not consistent.  Room had microwave/refrigerator which was very nice.  The heating/cooling in the room was very old style.  A single fan that could not maintain a temp.    The fitness room was not conducive to a traveler, open at 9 am.  I did not use the pool.  The free parking was nice.  There is a 7-11 next door and Alamo/National car rental next door too (if you want to rent a car).  I used the business center (1 computer/printer) to print off my boarding pass.  Breakfast was 0700-0900, nothing special.  One day it was scrambled eggs

Summary Heading: Great Stay for Kids - Escalante Kids Suite
Summary: The Escalante Kids Suite was great for us. Two rooms separated by the bathroom area. We traveled with 3 kids (6,3,1.5) and we got a room on the first floor. We didn't hear much noise from above, just kids running down the hallway in the morning. The kids room had a bunk bed,  sofa bed and room for the kids to run around and play. Room may not be as updated as some other hotels but who cares. We were mostly interested in keeping the kids happy when they were in the hotel and ours were. The two separate rooms were great when you wake and do not need to tip toe around because you are afraid to wake up the kids. In the past when everyone was in one large room, you couldn't do much in fear of waking everyone else up.  There was a 7-11 next to the hotel and Target a few block away.

Summary Heading: Good Location but only just average
Summary: The owners of the hotel need to wake up to themselves the place is about 10 -12 years over due for a refurb. whilst the cleaning staff were fairly good.. my god look at what have they got to deal with. the wall paper in the hallways is torn/damaged looks dirty. Carpets have seen better days and the food for breakfast that they dish out was only and just only eatable - our dog eats better food!!  We saw a number of homeless people in the evening hanging arround that main intersection, very close to the hotel... whilst I do feel sorry for them,  they (the hotel industry and authorities) need to move them on as this is a main tourist hub to Disneyland... as a traveler we did not feel too safe at night and were approached several times.  The good side would be the location ....price

Our family (3 adults, 2 children age 4 and 3), stayed at the Desert Palms for 4 nights beginning 30Nov 2009.  Accommodations were in the Kalahari Family Suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 full baths.  I was surprised to find that our 2 bedroom suite was exactly that 2 bedrooms and no living room as in some of the hotel's other suites  The baths were between the bedrooms and bedrooms could be closed off from each other.  There was also a microwave and small refrigerator that was great for storing fruits, and beverages. I We were able to use our laptap with the properties free in room wifi and going to the hotel's business center to print our return boarding passes wasn't and issue. The icnluded in the rate breakfast was adequate.  Scrambled eggs with ham and biscuits and gravey on

Huge disapointment. Straight from the early 90's. Chipped paint, Salvation Army furnishings, holes in the sheets, dirty carpets and stinky hallways. Internet access is NOT wireless - hooked up with a wire. Outlets are almost impossible to use.  For the price I could have doubled my stay at the beautiful Annabelle Suites!  NEVER AGAIN - and this is in the Disney Resorts?!?!?! Never book through AAA either. The shuttle service is actually the city transit with a Micky Mouse picture on the ticket. What a joke!

Hot breakfast nice, Very polite team. 7-eleven and other stores walking distance. For disabled travelers like me, bed is at the right height is you do a side by side transfer, toilet and roll-in shower very accessible. Spacious handicap room. The best part was being able to wheel (power chair) right to Disneyland without having to take a shuttle. Reccomend.

I stayed in the Sahara Kitchenette suite with a balcony during the Thanksgiving week.  There was myself and my 2 daughters with their husbands, my 14 year granddaughter, my 2 year old grandson and the 5 month old baby.  There was enough room for all of us.  The living room area has a pull out queen size sofa bed.  The kitchen comes with dishes and utensils.  The laundry area was located near the elevator on our floor (4th).  Hotel is located on the south corner of the Disneyland property.  It is 10 minute walk which was my main concern when booking the hotel.  I needed to be able to come back in the afternoon to put the 2 little ones down for their nap and then walk back to the park.  There is a 7-11 store just right outside the hotel lobby which makes it very convenient if you

The hotel was very clean and pleasant and had FREE parking. It is a quick walking trip (10 minutes or less) to Disneyland. They put on a nice FREE breakfast every morning. I expected it to be just muffins and fruit; but, they had hot eggs, sausages, cold cereal, hot cereal...etc. My only complaint was that I could hear the people above us - and that might be only because this particular person must have been "pacing" the floor for an hour (I mean, there isn't any other reason to be walking around in a hotel room as much as this person did) and the floor squeaked a bit;  The jacuzzi was nice and HOT. They were doing a water conservation and didn't wash the sheets every night unless you requested it; but that was ok with us. I would stay here again.

As you arrive to the Desert Palms Hotel it gives you the misleading feeling of being a nice place.  The entrance of the hotel is a round-about circle that marked completely as a fire lane leaving you no place to load or unload your luggage.  If you are traveling with a large family this is a big inconvenience since the baggage carts are located in the lobby.  Upon arrival to our room we found the living space to be small, dirty and smelled of cigarette smoke in a non smoking room.  The couches and seating all had some sort of disgusting stains on them and were scary to sit on without a barrier.  The wall next to the refrigerator had some sort of liquid spatter covering almost the entire height of it.  Our first night there we pulled out the sofa bed to find that the mattress was

It's about 45 min from LAX but with our rented car we brought out GPS which was our saviour! When we arrived at the hotel around 4 PM, we checked in right away. The lobby was really nice, actually nicer than the rooms. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. We chose this place because: close to Disney, free parking, free internet, free hot breakfast every morning, and great value through Orbitz (with car rental). The breakfast wasn't exactly anything fantastic, but it filled the stomach. They had cereal, eggs, sausage/ham, and oatmeal. It's a great hotel for families, and it was so close to Disney, about 5 min walk.  The rooms were clean but nothing special about them. Our king bed was a bit hard but after walking 8-10 hrs a day we didn't complain. There was a fridge and a

Summary Heading: Loved that it's close to Disneyland, hated the powdered eggs for breakfast.
Summary: Stayed here for 4 days with kids and grandkids (got great pricing at getawaytoday.com) and it was mostly ok.  Rooms average, but there was construction outside our room below, a tile saw started up at  7:30 am first 2 days we were there.  Hot breakfast was fine for the kids, but I don't care for powdered eggs.  Sausage was fine.  Lots of other families there, so if you have a cranky little one, no worries.  Staff not especially helpful, but proximity to the Happiest Place on Earth made up for it.  The best part:  we went into the exercise room on the 5th floor, turned out the lights and watched the fireworks from Disney one evening.

I booked the Desert Palms because as a woman traveling aIone with a kid, I wanted a complimentary breakfast, pool, and interior corridors. This is a great location,  close to the parks and at a busy intersection, yet quiet, which is a combination that is hard to come by. I had asked for a quiet location and was surprised to see that my room, 226, was directly across the hall from a soda machine. But it faced a wall (odd) with the pool below, and it was, indeed, quiet! We were able to sleep safely with the window open.    The room did seem a little worn (bedspreads) but we found the beds comfortable (firm). There were a couple of quirks; 2 office-type chairs (?), no mirror in the room, and an odd add-on closet door rather than the open closet typical for a hotel room of this

We have stayed at the Carousel Inn and Suites and the Candy Cane before and thought we would try something else.  This hotel was very clean but it is worn and the beds really could use replacing. The breakfast was okay but not worth the reason to stay here. Scrambled eggs, toast, orange and donuts with some fruit loops, cornflakes and orange juice and grapefruit juice.  They alternated between sausage patties and biscuits and gravy.   It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and it was quite an easy walk after a day at the park. There is a 7-11 next door and many places to find food near by.  If you want to be able to walk to the park and want free parking this works pretty well but if you want a comfy bed and a better breakfast I would go elsewhere.

the hotel staff was fine, they brought extra pillows quickly (pillows are very small and lumpy. the breakfast buffet was so so, we paid extra to get the "hot" items but there was no one there to check who was supposed to get it, furthermore there was nothing to say that we were to get it, so we wasted extra money for no reason, fairly frustrating... our room felt worn out , but looked like it had been cleaned. the beds were horrid, we felt the springs and we are average sized people. the hotel had NO hot water for 2 days (not their fault) so they gave us 50% off those 2 nights, but when we got the refund (over a month later)  it was for $58 total and we had the borrego suite, so that was very disappointing. the lobby is nice enough, but the halls just look worn out. we could see

Despite having booked our vacation 5 months prior, we were disappointed upon check-in to be given a 1st floor  room that opened directly onto the rear parking lot, with cars driving by only a few feet away from the window. (We  had to wonder if this was our "punishment" for declining to pay for the upgrade suggested to us by the front desk when we arrived.)  We requested a room change, and were moved to a 2nd floor room with a view of metal ductwork and the enclosed pool area. The pool noise (kids yelling) kept on until my husband called the desk at 10:30 p.m. (the pool area is supposed to close at 10 p.m.).  The next morning, we woke to find  there was no hot water anywhere in the hotel. We were told a water heater part had broken "because it had been raining".   We asked to be

Summary Heading: First Timers who will definately stay again!
Summary: We have seen many reviews and decided to try out this hotel.  Our experience with previous hotels were not good ones so we decided to change.  We are so glad we did.  We were greeted by an extremely nice gentleman and the check-in process was so easy.  The family thought the suite was awesome.  It was clean and everything worked properly.  We will definately stay again.
Clean hotel, great location for trade show exhibitors.  Not a good place for breakfast if you do not like kids.  We made our own breakfast.  Other than that its a nice hotel.

Summary Heading: Great value for a multi-family mini-vacation!
Summary: The hotel was clean and inviting upon arrival.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Our Borrego Suite room was perfect for our group- one adult, two teenage brothers, and one teenage girlfriend.  The breakfast, included in the hotel stay price, was decent - both hot and cold food choices given.  We did not have a chance to experience the swimming pool, so I cannot comment on that.  The only slighty negative thing I would say would be the walking distance to the actual Disneyland entrance - a bit further than expected; although, we did find a Disney shuttle (by the second day!) that was running back and forth from a drop-off/pick-up point closer to the hotel.  A convenience store is located right next door to this hotel, so that was helpful to get bottled water, snacks, etc...

Summary Heading: we really enjoyed our stay at the Deset palms!
Summary: We stayed at the D P in Mar 08 and enjoyed it so much we took 13 extended family members with us in Mar 09.  We had 4 different types of rooms and no problems during the whole week. The employees were pleasant throughout the entire stay both years. We enjoyed eating breakfast on the roof. The walk to Disneyland was close enough that we could walk back to take a nap and let the kids swim in the pool and get back to Dland and have pleanty of time for dinner. The room was always clean no matter what time we came back. The Yuha suite was awesome! The boys loved the bunks. My wife and I loved the queen bed and the door between the rooms.  My daughter slept on the pullout sofa just fine. We will Stay here again.

We recently visited Anaheim & Disneyland.  We usually stay closer to the main entrance of the park, but decided to try Desert Palms because of the breakfast and suites.  A microwave and a fridge in the room were a bonus at no extra cost.  Very courteous staff, clean lobby, clean room, nice hot breakfast.  What more could you ask for?  (Well, maybe a shuttle)  The walk was a little longer than other hotels we've stayed at in the past.  But we thoroughly enjoyed our experience there and didn't mind the walk because of the amenities this hotel provides.  Nice scenery on the way to the park also.  We will definitely visit this hotel again!

My family and I stayed here last December for almost a week. We chose this hotel mainly because they had a family room and it was very near Disneyland, around 5 - 10 min walk. It was also near other restaurants and a convenience store next door was a big plus as well for purchasing water and other necessities. Overall I'd say the staff were very accommodating and the rooms were clean. The only thing i didn't like was that the room we booked seemed to be a little small for 6 people. We booked the kids suite with a bunk bed, sofa sleeper and a king size bed. The beds were great, it was the space that was a bit of a problem but other than that everything was great. The breakfast buffet was great as well. There was also a laundry room, ice machine and vendo machine. There were also

If I had been in almost any other room I would have been very happy, but Lord!  Room 129 has a window looking out at the pool right next to a spring loaded door. (Pool closes at 10PM)  It's also next to an elevator and they've got a hotel bar people enjoy (Bar closes at 2AM) and believe it or not, one wall faces the lobby (They vacuum the lobby every morning at 3AM).  Only way to make it worse would be if it was also next to the ice machine, but it wasn't - that was down the hall about 50 feet.  I think as a joke, they put on the door that it would normally cost $600 a night. Why didn't I demand a different room? I won the trip at work and any changes or exchanges would have cost me money, whereas this room was already paid for, and yes, I am cheap.  It should really be turned

Stayed here for 4 nights. Enjoyed the breakfast of eggs,toast, doughnuts, oranges and cold cereal. Also had biscuits and gravy 2 days. We had a 4 year old and walked to  Disney. in 10 min.  Restaurants nearby. I would stay here again. The pool area isn't anything to brag about but we spent most of our time at the parks. Staff was friendly and helpful.

My family and I booked Five Days/Six Nights at The Desert Palms in Anaheim, we made our decision mostly on location. It is relatively close to Disneyland (probably about a 5-10 minute walk to the turnstiles), and very central to a lot of restaurants.   When we arrived and checked in, One of the staff at the desk (Sam!) asked us if we wanted to upgrade to larger room with a better view of the fireworks, and we did want that, so he upgraded us to the better room at no cost. Throughout our entire stay the entire staff was great, especially Sam, who was amazing. (Say Hi to him if you stay there, you can't miss him!)  The breakfast buffet was different every other day ( First day was Biscuits & Gravy, Eggs with ham. Second day was Eggs, Sausage and diced potatoes.) It switched every

We stayed at the Desert Palms during our 5 day vacation to Disneyland. It's only a 10 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland. (Candy Cane Inn is right next door, but more expensive.) The breakfast was abundant and hot, but not much variety. However, it fills you enough to start the day. As soon as a food item was gone, the servers were right there filling it up again. The pool is a bit small and unheated, but we didn't come all the way to Southern California to swim in a pool. I was a bit confused why they didn't provide wash clothes in the bathroom, but didn't bother to call the front desk to ask. Overall, we were quite satified with the location, service, and value of Desert Palms.

Summary Heading: Brilliant for Disney, roomy and comfortable
Summary: Desert Palms is hard to beat if you're going to Disney. We have 3 kids and they had no problem walking to and from the hotel, even at 11pm - it's a slow 15-minute stroll or 10-minute walk. It saves loads of time on car park/shuttle queues. The room we had, Borrego suite, was very comfortable and spacious even for five of us, exactly as described. It's slightly faded, but very clean and well looked after. Make use of free breakfast, it's decent food but gets busy after 9am, and also the grocery stores next door - save on Disney prices.  Would thoroughly recommend this hotel, though don't expect overfriendly staff!

This is a great spot for Disneyland. Not right at the door step but a short 5-10 min walk.  Comp breakfast wasnt spectacular but it was nice enough to kick start the day. Pool was nice but busy with kids. Room was clean with free internet Staff very friendly and helpful Rooms always serviced. Would stay here again when we return next year

We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. the room was well laid out allowing the kids to have there own area while mum and dad could put there feet up. We have been traveling for 2 weeks now and this has been the best room for the family. The hotel is in walking distance to Disney Land which is the whole reason for staying here. Enjoy as we did

Pros: Above Average Continental Breakfast, Location to Disneyland a short walk  Cons: The Desert Palms is a dirty hotel in desperate need of updating. Pictures on the website are deceiving. Not a great value. In Anaheim you can do better.

Spent 8 days there at start of July.  We had two rooms; ours was a sahara kitchenette suite, (room 435) to the front of the hotel, with a nice view out to the street and all the gorgeously lit trees.  Other couple with us had a standard room (426) along the hall, which looked out to a brick wall and developed a damp smell during the holiday.  So... I'd probably recommend one of the suites if you visit!  Location is ideal, 10 mins to Disney, 10 mins to the Gardenwalk, where you'll find lots of eating places, nice shops and a cinema complex.  Check in staff were very friendly, lobby is spacious and spotless. Parking was in a underground area, which I found a little off-putting, but it was free, which many others are not.  My abiding memory of this hotel is how clean it was, the

Visit Disneyland every year, but this was the first time at the Desert Palms. Myself, Daughter, and Granddaughter stayed the first week of May. It was great! The people at the front desk were very helpful. The room was everything we needed and wanted. Breakfast was great. We could eat until filled - inside or out on the roof terrace. The walk to the park was a snap, and given that 7-11 is right there - you pick up water, soda, etc. before going anywhere which saves money. I was awed by the custodial staff as they took great care in polishing the floors of the elevators. They shown like glass. Very nice place to stay - as a matter of fact - trying to work out some time to go back in the fall. Will definitly stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great jumping off point to Disneyland
Summary: We were wondering if the 0.7 mile (per Google maps) hike to and from Disneyland would be too much for our 5 year old daughter.  It was a snap!  The sidewalk to Disneyland was wide, heavily traveled, and well-lit.  Forget the $4 per person shuttle.  Walk and save $8 per person per day.  That being said, the hotel was great.  It is a newer hotel and has a wide varied of rooms.  We had a 1-bedroom suite which is actually a mini-suite.  However, it was neat, clean, and well-appointed.  The parking was free which is a plus.  The continental breakfast room got a bit crowded, but the food was fine and saved $$$.  Especially in the Disneyland area.  There is a 7-11 right next door for snacks and soda.  A lot of very good family restaurants are within walking distance and if you have a

Summary Heading: There are better places to stay.
Summary: One reason we stayed was because of the "full complimentary" breakfast.  It was hardly what we were accustomed to - fruit loops and corn flakes, juice, tasteless scrambled eggs with chopped ham, small sausage patty, biscuits and sausage gravy.  Lots of boxed donuts and icky coffee served in small styrofoam cups.  No fresh fruit, yogurt or muffins - much less waffles to go with the syrup that was set out.  We paid extra to upgrade our room to have a view and the view on the 3rd floor looked at the wall to the motel directly behind ours.  Our room accomodated 6 people but we could only ever get 3 washcloths.  When the sofa bed (awful, awful) was pulled out - there was no room to walk.

Summary Heading: best trip ever!!!!!! great hotel!!!! so sad to be home!!!
Summary: great hotel! great ppl at the front desk and i work for marriott resorts...i know! breakfast is great and free! even better! eggs, sausages, cereals, donuts, gravy biscuits! yeah it was a wonderful trip!! the hotel is close to everything! easy to get to... easy to travel to universal, san diego! grocery stores near by, outlets, malls.... you name it!  lots of cheap places to eat around there too!!! ;) buffets, family style restaurants...etc!  all i can say for sure, rent a car... take in all the parks with city pass....drive the hour to san diego! so much to do there too! the zoo, wild animal park, la jolla!!!!  oh man i wish i was still there!!!!! awesome!  and thank you sooooooo much for making this trip truly the happiest place on earth!!!! i will be back... in fact..i am

Summary Heading: Close to the Theme Parks and comfortable
Summary: This hotel did all it said it would.  The rooms are big (like most US hotels) and the bathrooms are big and there are 3 times as many towels as you need. :)  Could do with a little updating, but it's within a few hundred metres of Disneyland's main entrance and worth every penny we paid.  I'd go back tomorrow.

We were travelling with another family and we all found this hotel an excellent place to stay. It was very very clean. They even change the sheets on the beds everyday! Close enough to Disneyland to walk quite easily. Another plus, was that it came with breakfast. Nothing fancy but did the job. I must admit I was a bit hesitant as I had read alot of negative feedback about this hotel on Trip Advisor.  We were all very comfortable staying at this hotel and would definately stay here again on our next visit.  The only negative thing I can think of is that our room was quite noisy in the mornings as I think it may have been positioned underneath the outdoor breakfast area and we could hear all the chairs scraping as people pushed them in and out. Would still definately recommend

We traveled from Ohio and stayed from Thursday thru Sunday for a wedding.   It was very beautiful, the service was great, the desk clerks were always very helpful.  Our room was very nice, the beds were comfortable after long days of walking.  When I return, I will stay at the Desert Palm.

Summary Heading: A superb place to stay for your southern CA visit!
Summary: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! I second "jiminhi's" review. I was even there at the front desk when he and his lovely wife and daughters gave the Hawaiian cookies to the staff. They didn't offer to share though (sniff).  The staff will try to sell you an upgrade, so if possible deal with "Sam" at the front desk (after 3:00 P.M.) We stayed Jun 8-14, and had a slight mix-up during check-in, but Sam upgraded us to a Borrego Suite; a fabulous room for 2 adults and 3 kids. Our stay was smoooooth!  Breakfast (7:00-10:00) was better than other hotels, in my opinion. The lineup: potatoes, sausage patties, scrambled eggs, oatmeal, donuts (yum), oranges, cereal and juice/milk. Oh yes, and don't forget the biscuits and gravy every other day! If you hit the breakfast room early, it will be

Summary Heading: This hotel offers room suites, breakfast, friendly staff, at reasonable prices.
Summary: My wife and I travel and know that hotels typically only receive bad notes...never the good ones.  So...here is a good one...  We have stayed in many hotels...from Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton’s on down.  We were at Desert Palms Hotel & Suites from June 6th to June 11th while going to Disneyland.  We really enjoyed our stay.  The front desk people are very charming.  We really like them!  Because of them...we always bring over cookies and/or candies from Honolulu.  We feel like we are coming home to family (without being yelled at by my mother!)  when we stay at this property.  We consider this Hotel our Southern CA home!  The included breakfast is appreciated.  We use to go to the Pancake house and pay $40 for the four of us.  Now the breakfast is included at no additional

Summary Heading: Can't complain, but still, not amazing
Summary: Firstly, the price quoted online was 50% off, even at that price, it was still just cheaper than the local Hilton (across the road).  When we arrived, tired from an 11 hour flight, and 1 hour drive, we were given the "hard sell" by the receptionist to upgrade our room.  He made us several offers, until he finally persuaded us to pay $70 to get the Mojave suite.    The Mojave suite consisted of a partitioned area at the end of the room with a second television and a sofa bed.  The air conditioning was insubstantial (there was a fan to connect it to the main room).  The coffee facilities consisted of one coffee bag only with only two sachets of sugar.  The room and carpet had both seen better days.  The pool was tiny and seemed always to be full of children, and the gym had the

I was a little wary after reading some bad reviews, The hotel was clean and the staff was great.  The rooms were adequate and comfortable.  It was about a 15 minute walk 1/2 mile to disneyland not bad.  They offered a nice little breakfast great for little ones and the pool was on the small size but the kids were fine with it.  I will definatly stay here again.
Stayed in April for a couple of days.  Really enjoyed the hotel and all it offered.  We will be back

I stayed here with a group May 18-21 (six rooms) and found everything adequate for us. The desk staff was helpful, knowledgeable about the area, and always willing to help when asked. We lost a pillowcase set from home (brought along for allergies) and they had it returned in a short time. Other reviews said noise was a problem, but during our visit there was no problem nor mention of it from anyone in our group. In fact, everyone seemed to like it being close to Disneyland, offering breakfast, having the 7-11 next door, and tons of great eating places close by. Yeah, the pool is kind of small, but we don't travel hundreds of miles to sit in the pool. I have stayed here before and will stay here again. It is a good facility and has good staff who watch out for their guests.

The hotel was so noisy that we didn't get a single nights good rest! which in turn made us cranky which ruined the whole vacation!  We also had a hard time checking in and despite repeated requests to the staff about the noise, nothing was ever resolved.

Summary Heading: noisy,breakfast not good but clean and friendly.
Summary: The rooms are nice and clean The staff are friendly The full hot breakfast is not a full hot breakfast It was very noisy , the pool, hallways and rooms above. Close to Disneyland.

The hotel was very clean, the staff was curtious and very helpful, the breakfsat was limited, but good, the short walk to Disneyland and to good restaurants was great. The parking was somewhat limited, but worked out okay. We were greeted upon check-in and our room was ready prior to check-in time, so we were very appreciative.  Overall, this is a great place to stay if you are going to the theme parks and want a convienient, quiet place to come back to.

Summary Heading: A pretty good hotel for the money....
Summary: We were 5 people (3 adults and 2 children) that stayed for 5 nights in April.  We had the Borrego Luxury Suite.  The room was ok.  It was not spacious by any means but it did the trick for us.  Our view was overlooking the 7-11 roof.....Not so pretty..... The check-in went very smoothly.  Everyone at the front desk seemed to be helpful.  We had the complimentary breakfast every morning.  I would give the breakfast a 5 out of 10.  It was free, but the variety was lacking.  I would suggest a little bit more fruit other that just oranges.  They rotated daily the hot items between biscuits and gravy (no thanks) and scrambled eggs, sausages and potatoes.  If you are looking for a healthy breakfast, you should go elsewhere....  It did save us some money and some time though. The pool

Wow  What a let down this hotel was.   The room smelt musty and  the walls seem paper thin  with noise from other rooms being heard very easy and ruining sleep . This hotel had  3 bus loads of Kids in during the time of our stay.  There seemed to be no consideration shown to the other guests by Hotel staff.  The room service stated at 7.00AM so if the noise at night didnt keep you awake then the maids did the following day.  Looking for something good to say I'd have to say the location was great, very close to Disneyland  and a great seven-eleven store that stocked  good healthy food cheap.  This hotel does not deserve to be on QANTAS recommend list.

Great rooms, lovely maids that kept room tidy & clean on our 10 day stay, good location, not a bad walk, 10 mins or so. Breakfast was OK, if Aussie pack vegemite, didn't like sugary cereals or biscuits & gravy (no offense just a cultural thing). Kids started getting tired after 4 days at DL so we started buying the ART bus (anaheim resort transit) tickets, well worth it but make sure you buy multiple days from the discount tour places, as they are cheaper. When we had the tickets we made great use of them & popped back & forth from the hotel & DL for lunch, naps, swims etc. Felt very comfortable at this resort except for 2 things: One was the cranky receptionist's, kept hoping they would have a few day's off. Don't dare ask local info like where is the nearest supermarket? (food

Summary Heading: Great family friendly rooms, cleanliness and service
Summary: We stayed here to be close enough to walk to Disneyland. It was so conveniently located. The rooms was perfect for family, with additional bunk beds and fold out sofa so everyone was confortable. The service was great and the rooms and baths were very nice and extremely clean! Great stay!

Summary Heading: Read all the reviews on this hotel before booking and was sorry to have stayed
Summary: I've worked in two 4 diamond hotels and one 5 diamond hotel, so I've developed somewhat of an eye to how a properly run hotel should be. First off the hotel front desk staff were polite and helpful, with the exception of the ear ringed male graveyard staff member. This person called us a cab on the early morning of our departure, this "cab" did not have a meter rather the female driver told my wife ( after my wife asked 1/4 into our ride ) that it was $45.  I told this "cabbie" our ride in on a metered cab was only $36, no response just a nod of the head. Obviously, either the hotel gets a kickback for this service or the front desk staff does, shady dealing for any hotel to enact. The bar and snack shop attached to the hotel were both not visited, nor did we see any others

We stayed at the Desert Palms for 6 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. Travelling with two kids 11 and 13, I would recommend booking a room with a separate kids room. It is worth the little extra money. All staff were very helpful, with aspecial mention to Nevine at reception, she was wonderful. Ideally located withing very easy walking distance of the Disneyland entrance. There are plenty of very nice restaurants within walking distance and a very well stocked 7/11 next door. I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: It was little different as we expected.
Summary: When we came and checked in our room was not as expected.We pay for lux. suite,but resieved room#462  which has fitness above,when is  someone working out It is very noisy.And  also has broken shower,on next day did not have room service!.Good thing Was:When I asked  to change room They were  Gladly to do so.!!! And WE HAVE NEW ROOM #354.It was VERY GOOD ROOM.!

Stayed here for 3 nights (1-4 Jan. 2009). Booked a Yuha Kid's suite on the internet. We have kid's aged 16, 12 and 11. Thought this would give us some space (as it had a Queen bed, a bunk bed and a sofa bed)  the kids could each have their own bed to sleep in. The bunk beds and sofa bed were in a seperate room with a door . (We were on a 3 week trip to  America. The 2 youngest are getting too old to be sleeping in the same bed together. It is hard to find an American Hotel that has single or bunk beds.) Our initial reaction on seeing the room was: "it is very small and cramped!" (That was even before the sofa bed was pulled out!). When the sofa bed was pulled out , there was literally no room to move in that room. The kids in the bunks had to crawl across the sofa bed to get out

I stayed here while at a conference, location was great, 6min walk to conference centre.  Ideal for Disneyland, walk approx 10mins, would take longer with children. The male staff were very helpful while on duty but if it was close to knock off time they weren't quiet as keen to help.  The ladies were not so friendly, very hard to get a smile!! The was an incident with a couple of items missing from our room, we complained to house keeping, one item was returned a couple of days later, the other item was never returned.  I recommend you keep your belongings locked away!.  Housekeeping don't seem to speak much English, so communication was a bit of a problem..  We had an other room on the ground floor, was ok but smelt damp & needed a good airing. Breakfast was ok, as it was free

The hotel was very clean and the room was as advertised.  Breakfast was good and all you can eat.  Only two minor issues with the hotel that are worth mentioning.  The bed was very hard and felt like there was no padding in it as I awoke each day with a sore back.  The second minor issue was the location of my room #470.  It was by the elevators.  You could hear each conversation as people walked by the room to the elevator.  It seemed as though the walls were paper thin.  Other than these two small issues my family and I enjoyed our stay and will stay there again in the future.  Make sure you get to the breakfast before 8:30 in the morning as it gets very crowded in the dining room after that.

Went to California with a friend that had business. Picked this hotel for the location to Disney. I played while she worked. Booked a suite and it was as advertised. Very clean and bathroom was up to date, very bright, clean with no mold. Loved the room. The roof top dining for breakfast was a treat overlooking Disneyland. The location was everything. I didn't have to wait on a shuttle. The walk was about 1 block with no street crossing and seemed very safe. There is a great shopping area in the next block that have fantastic restuarants.  Would recommend for families. Park your car and never move it until you leave.

our family of five stayed 2 nights and were satisfied with the deluxe room we had.  room was clean and ready when we arrived.  staff was friendly and helpful  pool was clean and warm   only problem we had was the VERY VERY loud bathroom fan  the light and fan are on one switch and every time anyone used the restroom the darn thing had to be on        though it is close to disneyland it is still a rather long walk for children    would stay again    pizza at the sand box grill at the hotel was great!

We stayed at Desert Palms for three nights in December. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and accomodating, and the best part was it was a very short walk to Disneyland (maybe 10 minutes from the front door of the hotel to the Disney gates). The free breakfast wasn't fancy but it was good and filling. Our room was larger than usual (as it included 2 rooms, one with a king size bed and the other with bunk beds and a couch). Overall a great place to stay. I only have two complaints: 1) the mattress was really hard which is not comfortable for me (but my husband loved it) and 2) it tends to be noisy because the beds are right by the entry door and it sounds like there is no soundproofing at all in the walls so anyone walking by your room sounds like they're having a

We spent 4 days at the Desert Palms with 2 kids to do a Disneyland trip.  I had a very frustrating experience with Travelocity and the hotel in terms of an advertised  room upgrade that was going to require more hassle than it was worth to sort out.  Upon arrival Sana immediately resolved the problem for us in 2 minutes vs the 2 hours I spent on the phone with Travelocity and hotel management.  She was very courteous to me and my family, including sending back my son's glasses that were left in the room.  Her customer service skills were probably what made the property worth returning to again.  The hotel is basic but clean.  We were at the park from open to close so we only needed a clean quiet place to sleep and it served that purpose.  if you want a California Grand type
Very clean, large room, friendly staff, next to Disneyland and good rates. Thank you for a nice stay!

Summary Heading: Do not believe anything on the hotel web site
Summary: We had a party of 15 and we stayed four days.  The rooms we had reserved were not what we got and king beds were changed to double queens.  The suites (with two bedrooms) were so cramped we could not fit a stroller in the room let alone the crib we needed to use for the 2 babies with us.  Checking in took 30 minutes!   The quiznos closed over 3 months ago, but the hotel's web site still shows it's open.   The hotel is close to the park and there is a small entrance into the disney parking lot a block away where you can ride the parking tram, but the hotel staff evidently did not know about it.  The told us to walk about 6 blocks farther to the main disney entrance.   Find a better hotel for your money.

Summary Heading: Love the Desert Palm Hotel & Suites
Summary: The hotel is great--right next to Disneyland and a real bargin for how nice it is.  A trolley picks you up right out front and drops you off right at Disneyland and does the same for a return trip.  The hotel serves a very nice continental breakfast all included in your room charge.  There's a microwave and refrigerator in the room as well.  The rooms are clean and well appointed.

Solid value for our two-night stay on 10/31 and 11/1. We were assigned one of the non-renovated room, which was older and had older linens, comforter, chairs, etc.  The hotel does go 3 for 3 in my criteria of what I like in a hotel; free breakfast (eggs and sausage patties onr day, eggs and biscuits and gravy the next), free parking (although they were repainting the garage) and free Internet.  The walk to Disney Maingate wasnt too far either and took less than 15 minutes.

We stayed here for our Disneyland vaction. The hotel was great the pool was nice, it a little small but perfect for a relaxing time after a long day. The room we stayed in was newly renovated and was great. We had an absolute blast. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from Disneyland which was great. The breakfast was good, I wouldn't say great but it hit the spot. All in all I think this is a great place and I would absolutely stay again.

November 2, 2008 Modesto, California  We have been staying at Desert Palms for the last three years.  We go to the Disneyland Resort 3-4 times per year and find this hotel to be very convenient to the park.  It is within walking distance.  The breakfast is a wonderful perk and has recently been upgraded with additional food items.  The staff has always been very helpful and in fact, on our most recent trip last week, we were given an upgrade on our room at no additional charge.  I strongly recommend Desert Palms because of the amenities and very reasonable price.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed a pleasant stay at Desert Palms
Summary: We had a very nice stay at this hotel.  It is located very close to the Anaheim Convention Center, allowing me to walk quickly to a conference I was attending.  It is located relatively close to Disneyland--within walking distance for adults, but too far to walk for small children.  If you plan to walk back and forth to the park with tired, young children, be sure to bring a stroller or you will regret it!  They do offer a shuttle service...for a fee.  The staff was friendly and courteous, the continental breakfast was convenient and tasted good.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  One thing to keep in mind is that the pictures on their website are mostly of their deluxe suites--if you are expecting their regular rooms to look that nice, you will be disappointed.

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay!
Summary: Not a bad hotel! Could use some up-dating.  Small outdoor pool and hot tub in an enclosed courtyard. Breakfest buffet was not as expected, fair to say the least! Free parking was a big plus for a resort hotel close to Disneyland. The walk to Disneyland was only 10 minutes, better then parking there. Plenty of resturants close by.

We stayed at this hotel because basically everything else was booked because of a convention that week-end.  This hotel charged us $132 a night for a noisy, outdated, cramped room.  We felt like we were in a maze because the elevators and stairs  were so confusing.  Apparently when this hotel was updated and rooms were added they never updated the elevators so some don't go to all the floors.  It was very very annoying.  The bedspread was worn out and torn and the pillows looked like someone had just slept on them!  The blanket was some old sky blue color that looked like something my grandmother might have on her bed. The alarm clock was broken and everything just looked old and worn.  The noise out on the street was very loud.  The internet connection was not available for a

We stayed four nights here.  Upon check in we were upgraded to a king suite at no additional charge!  T.J. at the front desk was very pleasant.  Our room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job each day.  The location is great (only a 5 minute walk to the theme parks) and free parking was one of the main reasons we stayed here.  Our room was next to the elevator but the noise wasn't bad.  We were street side and it was incredibly quiet.  The complimentary breakfast leaves much to be desired but it's free so what do you expect?  One free meal a day really helps with the overall vacation budget.  The Sandbox restaurant has a small menu and the food is just ok.  We ate there only once mainly because we were too tired to seek anything else out.  The lobby is nice and

Summary Heading: Pull Back The Comforter Before Laying Down!
Summary: I liked the free parking and the location - it is right across the way from Disneyland and CA Adventures and the Convention Center.  The lobby was very clean and nice.    We had a normal room with two queen size beds.   Maybe we just had a bad room or the cleaning lady didn’t feel like owning her job earlier that day - but when we pulled back the comforters there were 3D stains... HUGE smeared stains on the blanket and disgusting stains on the comforter.  This could NOT be missed... so gross. We called the front desk and told them and they ACTUALLY had the gall to tell us that the blanket and comforter had been washed and argued with us!  We finally got a new blanket and comforter.   The bathroom was clean but the light was TOO bright and was a little muggy in there... I think

I took over 100 high school students with me to Southern California to check out the amusement parks, beaches and a Dodger's game. Desert Palms was conveniently located to Disney and not to far from the beach. About 2/3 of our rooms were newly renovated but all were clean and presentable. The breakfast was truly a hot breakfast not just a cold bowl of cereal and halfway cooked waffles. The hotel staff treated me and my students with respect and were there to offer assistance at a moments notice. I have been to many of the hotels in the area some double the price and have not had the service that was extended to me at the Desert Palms. We will be back!

Summary Heading: Location was probably the best feature
Summary: I would have to say that this hotel was just ok. The pictures online make this place look fancier than it really is. The hallways and parking garage had no ventilation making it very uncomfortable to walk through(extremely hot). The continental breakfast was very plain and the same day after day. I rented a 2bedroom suite and the room was very basic and outdated. There was a daily resort  fee of $6.95 that I did not know about until I had checked in. I definately would not return next time.

I forwarded this hotel to my niece as it looked OK on the internet.  Unfortunately it was not what we expected.  2 bedroom "suite"  doesn't have room for anything.  The rooms are tired looking and the shower had mold in it!!!  When I called for extra towels the front desk stated we don't know what time the housekeeper will clean the room"   My response was all I needed was 4 towels.  When housekeeping came up I received 2 towels!!! That clearly  was a difficult request. . I would not stay there again.  Give me the Disneyland Resort.  It is worth the money for service and convenience.

Family of 5 stayed here 3 nights in July '08-Borrego style suite. Room was comfy and decent. As there were 5 of us, I asked for extra soap from the maid but she said she didn't have any (what's up with that?). Bathroom fan was loud and startling when you first turn on the lights. I liked that you could control the AC as I like it on the cool side. Some hotels have it preset where you can't adjust the temperature.
