I don't think the hallways had AC though because it always felt warm and muggy going to and leaving our room. Free breakfast was included--scrambled eggs, grits/biscuits (which alternated w/sausage patties every other day), grilled potato cubes, cold cereal, day old pastries, bread, oj, milk, coffee, and fruits (the canned kind that were mushy). I liked the fresh

I booked our stay at the Desert Palms for our family vacation to Disneyland.  To get to the point the room I booked online was not available when we arrived.  I had booked a king suite with private living room with fold out bed.  They did not have any when we got there.  They ended up sending us to 2 other different rooms hauling our bags around with no help.  None of the rooms were what I had requested.  I found that several of the desk staff were not easy to understand.  By the third try and a threat to deal with the manager they ended up finding a room with what I had requested.  They mentioned the rooms were either booked with extended stays folks or out of service.  Not to mention he said the hotel was booked out.  Funny,  they sent us to 3 different room types.  Guess they

Not really happy with my recent stay at this hotel. I stopped by in the morning and did a "pre-check in" and got my parking pass. I was told that I can check in after 3 PM. Arrived to hotel at 3:30 and room was not ready. We have booked "Yuha" Suite. Waited about 45 minutes. Found out later that they offer extended check out for $30 (at 4 PM). I think that is the issue. Room was never cleaned before 4 PM in afternoon. Brekfast same every day (but it is free so can not complain too much). Found out few bugs in our room but otherwise clean. Ladder for double beds in kids area broken and fixed with screws - not very safe. Walking distance to main entrance - about 10-15 minutes. Overall - I would not stay at this hotel again.

This is the second time I have stayed at the Desert Palms. The first time we really had a good stay and the location is very good. It is a short walk to the parks and the 7-11, while frequented by some shady folks, is a great place to get water etc. before going to the parks.   This second stay was a little less pleasurable. We got a King Suite and the room had bad air circulation. The HVAC was in the bedroom and it was either hot or cold in there. It, along with the bathroom vent fan were crazy loud to boot! The carpet turned my socks black after walking around for a short time without my shoes on. The room did look very clean otherwise.   My biggest problem was with the last minute add on charges. The daily resort fee is the biggest rip off of all time. I also got charged for

Summary Heading: Pretty good for the price you pay
Summary: Okay, so most of these bad reviews you are probably reading are from people who expect nothing less than a PERFECT 5 star super hotel for $125. I'm going to be completely honest..... this hotel is GREAT! In total, there was 6 of us, and we chose the Borrengo suite and I have to say that it was actually pretty spacious.The front desk was nice, the maids ALWAYS cleaned the room so well. The only problem we had was trying to get them to leave more than 6 towels, but we would just call them to bring more, and they would. The AC really keeps the room nice and cool, the bathrooms were nice and the shower, tiolet and everything was always clean.  The pool is not what it looks like in the pictures, but seriously..... what's more important? the pool, or being right behind California's

We booked the Borrego Luxury Suite for our 5 night stay in Anaheim.  We were looking for a hotel with large rooms to accomodate our family of five, within walking distance to Disneyland, a nice pool,  pay movies, free parking, free breakfast, and a fitness room with a decent treadmill.  The hotel had all of these things but there are a few details I want to mention.  The fitness room doesn't open until 9:00 am, so if you are an early-morning exerciser as I am, you may want to consider another hotel.  The breakfast included sausage, hashbrowns, scambled eggs, donuts, toast, cereal, yogurt, cottage cheese, and a few fresh fruit options.  The breakfast staff were outstanding.  They had a clean table with a high chair ready for our family as soon as we walked through the door and

Right from the begining the hotel staff was excellent. We stayed 3 nights and 4 days. The room was very clean and well equipped (fridge and micro).  The breakfast was good.  We had b-fast there tues, Wed, and Thursday. Tues and Wednesday we had our choice of pastrys, hard boiled eggs, cereals, on Thursday they stepped it up and we had everything from before as well as scrambled eggs, sausage and hash browns. The walk to Disney is about 10 minutes. It is a long a wide sidewalk that is not right on top of the busy street which is nice when walking with little ones. We will diffently come back to this hotel not just because the ammenties were great (I'm sure you can get these at other hotels) but the service from every department went out of the way to make our stay special.

This motel is directly across from Disneyland - a 5 minute walk to the park's entrance. The price is good for the area. The rooms are adequate but tired. The chemical fumes from the indoor pool waft into the parking lot. The pool is sad. There are only two elevators in this complex so be prepared to walk or wait. The breakfast barely qualifies for the description "continental". White or wheat sandwich bread, two dry cereal choices, stale sweet rolls, coffee, oranges and juice. The breakfast room is small and dreary. But heck - a quick walk across the street and you're in the happiest place on earth.

We selected this hotel based on our review on Tripadvisor and other feedback media. The rooms were ok but a little tight. The staff wasn't that friendly. While checking in, my wife tried to make "small talk" with the clerk who appeared extremely bored. I don't know, maybe it's me; but if you are going to offer hotel services near Disneyland, then your staff had better be well-prepared to engage with a lot of really excited patrons!  Forget the "breakfast"!!! Hard boiled eggs just don't cut it for me with respect to getting my protein for the day. The fruit looked like it had been shipped in from some third-world country and the general condition of the "dining room" was absolutely deplorable! I felt like I was slogging through a grub line at some gulag! Ummm, another thing

Stayed there for one night before going to disneyland the following day. Breakfast was mediocre, nothing bad, but nothing good. The rooms were standard, beds had typical paper thin comforter although housekeeping was very prompt when we asked for extra blankets and towels. The a/c was very loud and when we first arrived the room was HOT and we had to run the a/c on high for half an hour before it was comfortable.  The lobby was very nice but the rooms didnt look as if they were updated with the lobby. Very good location, was a short ten minute walk to disneyland and compared to the cost of the other hotels near disneyland was a good value.  One negative is that there was a few elevators, but the one closest to our rooms and the one we were directed to was basically a freight

Summary Heading: Good location but Noisy at night
Summary: Pros:  We booked a kids suite which was a nice set up for 2 adults and 3 kids. The adjoining kids room had a bunk bed and pull out sofa, a good size closet, and it's own TV.   The room was very clean and the location of the hotel, at corner of Katella and Harbor , is about two long blocks to Disney entrance on Harbor. There is a 7-11 store and ABC store next to the hotel-very convenient for sunscreen and snack purchases.  The pool was reasonably clean.  Yes the hot tub was foamy - I didn't know this was a bad sign as other reviewers mentioned...oh well! Breakfast was better than I expected (cold boiled eggs, variety of toasts and donuts/pastry, bananas/oranges, corn flakes, fruit loops, oatmeal, yogurt, cottage cheese, milk, coffee and juices(although they did run out of OJ two

Myself and family have been staying at the Desert Palms Hotel & Suites since 1988.we have yet to miss a year.There has been many changes thru the years ,far to many to mention,yet the service has always remained EXCELLENT.We have always delt with a lovely lady named Shirley, she is the epitome of customer service.On more then one occasion Shirley has phoned the front desk to ensure we have arrived safely and given the right room, all this when she herself  was on holidays.Where could one expect service like this.We as a family have many wonderful memories of Southern California ,most would be centered around our accommodation,its location,ambience,and the incredible staff, that has been assembled, from management to maintenance.End result being a service that is

My 2 year old daughter and I went up to Disneyland for 2 days and I have to say, the hotel was PERFECT! All the staff I came across were friendly, helpful, and accommodating. They were gracious and absolutely FABULOUS! We felt very comfortable. In fact, even the housekeeoing boiys on our floor were pleasant, even though they could speak much english. We were lucky enough to see the fireworks from our room. Even our swim in the pool was wonderful. I've worked for more than 10 years in customer service and I know great service when I see it.  We will be back FOR SURE!

Summary Heading: Loved the service at the Desert Palms
Summary: We selected this hotel simply because of its convenient location--right across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center where we would be attending a 3-day conference.  Our group booked a group of 14 rooms and were very pleasantly suprized by the service we received.  Roshni Patel, the Sales and Meeting Events manager, was so helpful, always going out of her way to accomodate our needs and make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

Summary Heading: Nice people - however what a dump!
Summary: We have traveled to Disneyland 4 times and have stayed at different places each time (Paradise Pier, Crown Plaza, Carousel Inn and the Desert Palm).  The way I see it, you have 3 options when traveling to Disneyland:  1) Stay at a DL resort hotel 2) Stay way off site at and shuttle in 3) Stay at a hotel within walking distance  Here are the repercussions for each of the above:  1) You pay a lot of $, however you get what you pay for.  CLEAN, excellant service and the little extras with staying at a DL resort.  Well worth the extra money to be treated so well and to stay at such a clean resort.  2) While you can stay at a really nice hotel off site for a reasonable price, the shuttle is a total pain.  You end up taking an hour to and hour and a half out of your day.   3) They all

Booked a Disney trip for our family of five during Valentine's day and the Desert Palms was a decent value for what we needed. We booked a mini-suite so our daughters could stay in the separate room with a pull out sofa while our son stayed in the second queen. The room was a bit small, but comfortable. It was in good condition overall, but one complaint was mediocre water pressure out of the shower head. It did include two TV's, coffee maker and a mini fridge that came in handy. The continental breakfast could be better. Cold cereal, oatmeal, toast and fruit (banana and oranges). The front desk staff was both friendly and helpful, and the parking was plentiful. There is a Quizno's inside the hotel which came in handy for a quick bite. One last note-while their web site claims

The Desert Palms Hotel is a great place to stay in Anaheim.  Disneyland park is w/in walking distance. The staff was wonderful. They let us check in early.  I definately recommend this hotel if you are visiting Disneyland.

I was looking for something as close as possible to the Anaheim Convention Centre where I was attending a Trade Show. I had no clue where to stay having not been in the area for 20 years, I was just looking for something decent without getting into Sheraton, Hyatt type rates. The Hotel met my expectations exactly, very nice appearance, clean, above average lobby and what you'd expect for the room at the price. The front desk staff was very courteous and one person; " Sana" stood out especially. These places often fail to realize that the interacions with the Hotel staff over what might seem very trivial matters can often make or break the impression of the hotel. Not so here, the girl upgraded us to a little suite after our first night when she "thought" street noise in our

Summary Heading: excellent hotel.. Great place to stay...
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel last week and had the best time ever. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff are excellent with their service. They were very friendly and helpful. The hotel Suite we stayed in was great it was nice and clean and very comfortable. We had a fantastic time at the hotel as well as Disneyland. We will surely return to this hotel again and again. Thank you Desert Palm for making our vacation worthwhile.
hi i´m from durango, mexico my experience in this hotel was nice it´s a good hotel they have a goog service and it´s a nice hotel

Hotel:  Desert Palms Hotel and Suites:  I would give it a 3/5.   Upon arrival they did have our room ready...for early check in which was nice.  However they did have a problem getting a room for my inlaws ready. My inlaws had to finally approach a maid directly to find a room ready.   The hotel was clean and presentable. They had two eateries...One Quiznos and the other a Bar & Grill. We only tried Quiznos once. The kids and my husband used the pool and hot tub almost nightly. I just have a thing about a "community hot tub" so I didn't go in.  They enjoyed it although they said it made their suits smell wierd and I have to agree.  The pool is small but was never really busy so adequate.  Our hotel room was the Sahara Suite with kitchenette room 432. We were in the newer part of

This was a four day stay with my two grand-daughters ages 12 and 14, to visit Disneyland.The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland, probably the only plus. If you have small children I would suggest the Anaheim Resort Transit , tickets can be purchased across the street from the hotel. The trolley stops next t the hotel. Tickets are $3 per person for the day. In peak Disneyland time the trolleys can be crowded, and they do make several stops before Disneyland. The hotel was clean, but not very comfortable beds. The pool was clean, but no place to shower before or after swimming, except for your own room. The hot tub was so full of foam that I dare not get into it. I asked at the desk if they used de-foamer for their hot tub as I do at home. The response was "What is

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. When we first arrived at Desert Palms, it seemed okay from the outside. Since it was late we decided to eat at the restaurant inside the hotel. The food was bad and expensive. Here, a cheese pizza, sprite (no refills), water, small side salad and bbq chicken sandwich all came to over $50.00. You are better going to McDonalds  if you are hungry. The free continental breakfast was okay. It consisted of: banannas, apples, hard boiled eggs, powder sugar donuts, coconut crumble donuts, chocolate cake donuts, one type of pastry, three dry cereals (oatmeal, fruit loops, and corn flakes) and toast. You had your choice of white milk, oranage juice, rasberry lemonade, and grapefruit juice.   As for the stay, the first night we were woken up at

I chose this hotel as it was ideally siutated within walking distance to Disney, and convenient for pickups and tours from the nearby bus stop. Would definately recommend just walking as it's literally 5 minutes.  The staff were at first very welcoming, although became less so further into the holiday. The lobby is very nice. Some of the furnishings are very old/battered looking in the lobby and the rooms, but we didn't spend much time in the room so this wasn't too important.  Cleaning was spotless and perfect every day.   The only significant criticism is that the breakfast only started at 7:30 with a 2 hour window and so became more and more packed towards thanksgiving. We ended up taking some breakfast items back to the room.  Right across the street is a food area with

I work for a company that offers this hotel as one of our Anaheim/Disneyland properties, so I was really looking forward to not only staying here and checking it out, but getting a feel of its location in conjunction to Disneyland.   We had booked the Sahara Kitchenette Suite, and I liked the room alot. It has a living room/parlor area with sofa sleep, sitting chair, tv, then a table and chair set that can fit four, seperate bedroom area with two double beds, and a FULL SIZE kitchen with stove/oven/microwave, sink, fullsize refrigerator. The unit also contains all the cooking/eating utensils you can possible want/need.   We squished in our family of 6 1/2 (traveling with a baby, so he slept with us. ) and while it was a bit crowded for 3 adults, two teens and a baby, we did just

They will not give you an early check-in no exceptions.  When we went into our room it was very small, but that wasnt the worst part.  There was chocolate,(i hope it was) on the bedspread.  We called the front desk and they moved us to a suite, which was nice.  However the carpets were stained as was the sofa.  It just didnt give you a clean feeling.  The breakfast is not that great for what you pay for.  We could have stayed at a less expensive place down the road and had more amenities.  I needed a sewing kit as a button came off my daughters shirt, I called the front desk and they told me they had them at the front desk, so I went to get one all they had was a basket with a neddle and different colored thread which I couldnt take with me so I had to go back up to my room and

Summary Heading: Not terrible, but not great either.
Summary: I stayed at The Desert Palms for 3 nights, a Sunday through the following Tuesday.  This isn't a bad hotel by any stretch, particularly when you take the price into consideration.  The room was average, but clean, and had a fridge and a microwave standard.  The staff was polite and attentive.  There are some things you may wish to consider however, particularly if you are traveling with kids: For one thing, it is a bit of a hike to Dland.  Not terribly far, but not as close as it looks from the map (yes, this hotel is right up against California Adventure, but it's on the far side, and The Magic Kingdom is farther than that.)  On the plus side, you won't have to cross the busy road to get to the park from this hotel, as it's on the same side of the street.        I found a roach

This is a great hotel that is very close to Disneyland!  My husband and our two daughters were very pleased with our room (small suite).The room was nicer than I imagined for the discounted (AAA) price that we paid.  It was comfortable, clean and provided all the amenities listed. We originally booked for a 2 night stay but, had to cut back to only one night. The staff was very accommodating and professional regarding this last minute change.   The continental breakfast was donuts, danishes, cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, fruit, etc. Basically enough to get you started for the day. The only complaint was it was a little warm in the main hallways. The heater seemed to be working overtime for October. We plan on visiting Disneyland again very soon and we'll definately stay here.

I come to this hotel at least 1-2 times a month. We have annual passes to Disneyland so staying here is very conveinent to the park and surrounding restaurants. The walk is an easy 10 minute walk to the park. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, parking is ok. I will definitely stay here again and again. Highly recommended. The two room suite is nice when there are lots of people traveling with you.

HOTEL: I believe half of the hotel is new(er), and the other half is obviously refurbished.  (In fact, from the pool area, you can see how half the hotel looks like it was constructed at a later time from the other half.)  Many rooms seem to have a view of the pool, the street, Disneyland, or an uninviting 20 foot cinderblock wall across a parking lot.  RATE TIPS: 1) Their website had a cheaper rate than all the travel sites.  2) When we called and asked if there was anything cheaper, they offered us a “Manager’s special” and knocked of a few bucks.  3) I learned that your average nightly rate will remain the same, even if you later cancel the most expensive night of your stay… grrrrr.  4) Rates can and do change daily.  OUR ROOM: We probably got one of the crappier rooms – in

I stayed in this hotel in July with my husband, son and his friend. We stayed here because we want to Disneyland. I think this a great family hotel!! Not only is it within walking distance to Disneyland, the rooms were large and clean. I would not say this is a luxury hotel, if you are looking for that then you need to spend more money. The only real complaint that I have has nothing to with the hotel. After returning from Disneyland we decided to grab a bit to eat in the Sandbox(?), which is attached to the hotel. Not only was the waiter/bartender a grump, the food was overpriced and not very good. I would say that this is more of a bar than a restaurant.  I have stayed in many hotels and I am a bit fussy when it comes to cleanliness as well as the condition of the furnishings

We were so excited to stay at this hotel after looking at their website.  Once we got there, we noticed how differently the hotel looked as compared to the photos from the website.  The rooms are nothing special and the lobby is about the only semi-nice part of the hotel.  The breakfast was one of the worst that I had ever experienced (toast was the main attraction)! We had a lot of problems with the rooms: First we were placed in a room with bugs in the bathroom and a broken fridge and microwave.  When they moved us into a new room there was urine in the toilet, hair in the shower & more bugs.  The ironing board even broke on us! Also, the hotel has complimentary parking, however, don't expect to find a spot on the weekend because they definitely don't have as many spots as

We just got back from a great stay in Anaheim. We had the best time. This hotel is outstanding! We had a chance to meet the manager in the lobby one day and he's a really nice guy who obviously cares about his hotel. It shows. The staff is friendly and the place is really clean! We got a double suite with two bedrooms and two bathrooms! Plenty of room for all the kids, my wife and me. The breakfast is nice. I was relieved that we didn't have to spend $40 for a family breakfast which would take an hour to get. We went into the breakfast room, got our food, ate and away we went to the park. If you get a chance, go to the Desert Palms.
Wow! This place is just right. VERY close to Disneyland, a beautiful lobby, a wonderful, comfortable room, and a really nice staff.

We booked a suite with two queens and a full-sized sofa bed.  The hotel allowed us to park there the morning before check-in, and we walked to the Disneyland entrance.  There is a tram stop in front of the 7-11 next door to the hotel if you want to pay $3 for a day's usage to and from Disneyland.  The room and bathroom were very clean and the room was big enough for six adults.  The sofa bed was the only real downfall, as the mattress was indented in the middle (V-shape) and not very comfortable.  On the hotel website they showed an online coupon for 10% off for Disney's Celebration, but the staff said that expired a year ago.  They really should remove it from their site then.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as you may think.......
Summary: The lobby was the nicest thing about this place.  The rooms are small.. The breakfest was not worth getting up for... Woke up to the floor buffer at 1:45 am....What where they thinking ???? Would not stay here again.. Look else where.. Holiday Inn Express had better services...

I stayed the week of June 18-22, 2007 with my wife while attending a conference. Th location is easily in walking distance to the convention center and not far from Disneyland. The hotel lobby was nice, but the pool was nothing great. It sits directly in the middle of the hotel  and if you want sun, you need to go at noon because there are walls (5 floors) surrounding each side. The reason I mention this is my wife wanted to lay out while I was gone and didn't feel comfortable that every person using the elevator had plain view of the pool.   We stayed in a "mini" suite, but it was nothing but a small room off the bedroom with a couch. It couldn't have been more than 5 feet wide and the couch was hard. The rooms appeared ok but the most negative aspect of the trip was the

We were disappointed.  The hotel was dirty (the hot tub had a film of scum on the top), and cheap (if you want more than the bare minimum for breakfast there is an extra charge).  The web site and promotional material is misleading ( a "2 room suite" was one standard size room with a curtain down the middle. It was inexpensive - so I should have not had such high expectations.

I took my 2 sons and their friends to see Disneyland and stayed here for 3 nights.  We were able to get one of their suites which we all could stay in together, had door separating my room so the boys couldn't hear my snoring.  All in all it was a good deal for a large group in one room/suite, if you don't mind sharing one bathroom between you.  Good location due to Timon parking lot tram.  Would stay here again!

We had a great stay. It was super comfortable and roomy. It was a short walk from the Disney Resort. I loved the room they put us in, it was the Borrego Luxury Suite. Clean rooms and bathroom, hot water, ref., microwave, closet, 2 televisions (one for the kids and the other for the adults), and a curtain that seperates the beds from the sunken living area.  I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It was AWSOME!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a reasonable price
Summary: We stayed in the Yuha Kid's suite from May 31 to Jun 3/07.  With the separate bedrooms, it was definitely large enough for our family of four (children are 8 & 9), but it seemed a touch narrow (ie., not much room between the end of the bed and the wall).  The rooms (including bathroom) were very clean.  The air conditioner was quiet and effective.  The pool area (decking around the pool) was on the small side, but again, everything was clean.  The continental breakfast is nothing special... cereal, donuts, some fresh fruit, wheat and white bread to make toast, jams & jellies (but no peanut butter), milk, juice and coffee to drink.  You could also purchase microwaveable sandwiches, but they are no different than what you'd get at 7-11.  The breakfast wouldn't be the deciding

I have stayed here at least 5 times in the past 2 years. A perfect hotel for anyone's Disneyland vacation. very close to the park, the walk isnt bad at all. inside the hotel, there is a Quizno's subs. (If you're over 21, the 7-11 is right next door!)  The rooms are always very clean and comfortable. I personally enjoyed the room with the spa bath tub, it is gigantic. Also, the walls are not paper thin like all the other hotels in the area. I have never once heard a guest in another room, and I have never gotten a complaint from other rooms, even with groups of 8 "mid-20's-but-act-like-16-year-olds" friends. Basically, there has never been a problem with the hotel. HIGHLY RECCOMENDED.

This hotel is a most definite 10/10.  Everyone from the front desk to the wait staff was extremely attentive and productive.  Booking through the front desk over the phone was painless and was done in a very timely manor.  (Booking through one Sophie Johnson)  She was on top of things 100% of the time.  She got my party the best available accommodations with no hassle.  Everyone there is very aware of all the attractions and big landmarks throughout the city and know exactly on how to point you in the right direction.    This hotel is a must if going to Disney or any other major landmark in the area.  Highly recommended.

I know this review is way overdue but I didn't know that this site existed and I've been dying to write a review on this place. I found this hotel online and traveled with my husband so we could visit Disneyland. I chose this hotel because they were having a special at the time and because it was within walking distance to the parks. We drove down from the Bay Area and arrived to check-in around 10pm.   I had reserved a non-smoking room with a king bed. When we entered our room, it was seriously the size of a janitor closet. The room was very cramped and it had just enough room for our bed and a little table with one chair. The bathroom was just big enough for the pedestal sink and the towles were old and mismatched! The room we got was definitely not one of the "standard" rooms

Larry Williams  I have stayed here twice, in January , when I made reservations wonderful lady kay helped me to get  my room with good rates and information and same thing in February I called  again azeema helped me to make reservations and she was as good as kay.  The rooms at this Desert palms Hotels & Suites was very nice. They are much larger than I expected. I've stayed in both the King Size and Two Queen bed rooms. Setup is almost the same in each room. Lots of room space in each room, which was very important for women sharing. All room has Refrigerator, microwave, coffee, 27 Inch TV provided in living room area and bedroom. The bathrooms are nice and big!     They have kind of indoor but outdoor pool open from top and small business room. Gym is Big and nice, with large

The Desert Palms Hotel was an affordable luxury hotel that our family enjoyed immensely.  It was clean, breakfast was great, and the staff was professional.  It is more like a resort than a Disneyland "strip" hotel.  We have stayed in others and this is by far the best one so far.  I would definitely stay here next time.

First the good stuff....great location.  Next, the bad stuff....We reserved a Deluxe room with 2 queen beds.  When we entered, I thought they had made a mistake, there was only one bed visible in the room.  Upon further investigation, we discoverd a murphy bed against the wall.  I lowered it to the floor and figured out why there wasn't a table and chairs in the room...there is no way that they would fit.  The bed went almost all the way to the wall.  The bathroom was tiny...no counter, only a pedestal sink, a small tub/shower, and a toilet.  No frills at all in this room.  We couldn't even use the coffee maker because there was no place to set it to plug it in.  If you wanted to read, you had to go out to the lobby to find a chair to sit in with decent light.  We stayed at this

The room and location were adequate, but the continental breakfast was less that adequate and the pool area was extremely disappointing. The pool was freezing cold and the sun barely can reach the pool area as it is surrounding by the buildings -- it feels like it is in a tunnel. After 4 days we booked at the Anabella Hotel --- huge difference for very little more money. I would recommend the Anabella.

Service was good, friendly, helpful staff.  Location was good, near Disneyland and other shops and conveniences.    We chose a suite for 6 for the 4 of us (two adults, two children) and we were crowded. If the sofa bed in the kids room was used, it would have been impassable - the beds butt up against eachother.  Very little floor space in the adjoining king bedroom - bedside tables did not even fit beside the bed - rather claustrophibic.  For a suite, we expected more space.  Pool area was also very small, not a place to relax.   I would not recommend this hotel to a friend. Good for sardines!

Summary Heading: Don't believe everything you read! Except Mine!!!!
Summary: After reading the reviews, I was a little afraid of what we may find! I travel quit a bit and feel i have high expectations.  To my surprise the Hotel was clean, Staff very accommidating (Especially, Ray at the Front desk) . The Continential Breakfast was much better than the reviews gave it credit for. what do you expect for free?! Plenty of food for everyone, constantly replenishing donuts, bread for toast, fruit and coffee Ceral canister always full. They also offer breakfast sandwiches for a  small fee (I think 2.00).  The staff was on the ball.  I guess you should always take what you read with a grain of salt.  Some people are never happy, they will always find fault with something.

We stayed 4 nights, February 21-24, 2007. Family with 6 children, ages 1.5 to 11 years old.    Location - The best thing about this hotel is its location. It literally is an easy half mile walk to Disney's main gate (I measured it with my GPS). My young children had no problem at all making the walk in 10 minutes. The youngest walker is 4 years old and we pushed a stroller for the 18 month old.  Service - We didn't have much interaction with the staff. They weren't as outgoing as other hotels where we've stayed, nothing to complain about. One of the days the maid left our garbage can full.  Restaurant - there is a Quizno's on the property as well as a bar & grill. We didn't try either one so I can't rate them. We did eat at the Jolly Roger across the street which needed some

We spent 5 nights here and would definitely go back.  We stayed in the suite with a sunken living room. (2 queens and a queen sofa sleeper)  It was clean and well kept.  It was very adequate for our family of 6 other than there is no sink outside the bathroom.  This made getting ready for the day a bit of a challenge.  The front desk staff was incredibly nice and helpful.  We did stay on the third floor...and as mentioned in other reviews this gives a view of a wall. (we could see over it to see tower of terror) This was not a big deal for us, but if a view is important, make sure you stay on floor 4 or 5.  The breakfast was less than good.  They charge extra for anything truly appetizing.  Still, a pastry and boiled egg works.  The location was excellent if you are moderately

Summary Heading: Suite is good for the price
Summary: Okay...we always book suites because the kids (2&4) go to bed around 8 and we're night owls.  The standard suite we booked was sufficiant, but very noisy.  The Central AC was running through our wall and creating a vibration and high pitched squeal all night.  Not good.  Good news - we complained and they put us in a Sahara Suite w/kithchenette.  Great upgrade, go with it if you can.  The rooms are OK, but we all know this isn't a luxery hotel.  The free breakfast in the morning is fine, toast, hard boiled eggs, conrn flakes, muffins  does the job.  You are about 200 yards from a shuttle in one of the Disneyland parking lots that takes you to the entrance.  200 yrds with 2 little ones seems long a few times but looking back...not bad at all.  Overall, I would say that the Sahara

Opted for this Hotel instead of the resort hotels which are getting too costly!  (Would rather keep cash in pocket for the park!)  A little further from the entrance than we thought, but we enjoyed the walk none the less.  I went at 6 months pregnant and found everything to be in order.  We had a two room suite which wasn't bad at all.  We really loved the two bathrooms as my parents accompained my husband and I and our 3 year old.  The 7-Eleven right next door was great for coffee in the morning!!  The fridge came in handy as my son enjoys his nightime milk.  We never made it to the complinentary breakfast, but IHOP, Denny's and numerous other places to eat are on the way.  Do NOT eat at CAPTAIN KIDDS accross the street from the park!! Too much money and we couldn't swallow the

Just returned from 7 days in Anaheim.  We had originally booked all nights at the Desert Palms...We left after two nights...Several reviews say great location...I suppose if you are full of energy after 8 or 10 hours of Disney, you're right.  A real perspective...dragging an exhausted 6 and 9 year old back to the hotel takes about twenty minutes.  As one traveller wrote 150 yards from the second entrance...wrong!  you may be 150 yards from the Downtown Disney entrance, you then have to walk another 10 minutes through Downtown Disney.  Some of these reviews are very deceiving!  We switched to the Best Western Park Place Inn.  It was a moderate hotel...Very basic, not fancy but the housekeeping was good and the location is great.  If you are anticipating having tired kids, this is

We booked this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews. It was not as the reviewers had made it out to be. The bedding seemed dusty. We booked a suite with 2 bedrooms. The children's room was on the side of the hotel with the pool. There were very loud teenagers in the pool until about 10:30, and the noise carried right into the children's room. Our kids were unable to fall asleep. Also, the continnental breakfast was not very good. The only selections to spread on toast were apple jelly and grape jelly. Both of these had "high fructose corn syrup" listed as the first ingredient. There was no peanut butter, and only 2 choices of cereal. Our last trip to Anaheim we stayed at a different hotel offering a free continnental breakfast. Breakfast there was much better, way

We enjoyed our stay at the Desert palms Hotel in Anaheim, the room was kept very clean and tidy the beds were changed every day, the breakfast was satisfactory. We were close enough to Disneyland to walk there in approximately 10 minutes, it seemed a long way back at the end of the day but it was worth the $3 each it cost for a shuttle trip back to the cross road by the hotel.                            Colin and June Walton, Australia.

The close location is what initially drew our attention to this hotel. Three of us decided on a "Girl's Trip" to Disneyland, one who hadn't been in years, and we read the reviews before booking. We flew in and there was a shuttle provided to the hotel door. We were an hour early for check in and were advised we would have to wait up to an hour for our suite to be ready. Not even 5 minutes later, Ray from the front desk asked us if we'd like to upgrade our room at no charge and handed over the keys to a much larger room with 4 beds and 2 bathrooms.    The rooms were rather large, with a microwave, refrigerator, and both rooms accomodated with televisions. There were doors to close the rooms off from one another, as well as from the bathroom and vanities (which are in separate

I stayed at this hotel earlier this week (a weekday) and was pleasantly surprised.  Knowing that any hotel within walking distance of Disneyland would not be cheap, we were still pleasantly surprised that our regular room was more like a small suite, with a living area separate from the small bedroom.  The pool area was tiny but we weren't looking to swim - just stay at a decent place before a day at Disneyland.  The front staff was friendly and the room very clean.  We were on the 3rd floor which was absolutely silent, and the bedroom did not share a wall with the hallway - there was even a door between the living room and bedroom so if it were noisy we could close the door if we needed to.  We didn't get up in time for breakfast, but we just had a hearty breakfast at IHOP up

Summary Heading: Nice Location but the Rooms Need Some Work
Summary: We stayed between Christmas and New Year's at the Desert Palms.  The location was great!!  Being able to walk to Disney vs. fight the crowds driving was a real bonus.  We opted for the Family Suite as there were 7 of us.  It was nice to have two bathrooms and the extra room to move around.  However, the room was in need of some definite updating.  The pillows were like not sleeping with one at all.  The room was next to the service elevator and the walls are thin so all outside noise could be heard inside the room.  The room did have a small fridge but it made such loud noises that we finally had to unplug it.  The continental breakfast was o.k. as long as you got there early.  It was only available between 7:30AM and 9:30AM which seemed pretty limited.  You had your choice of

We did not actually stay here but did a site inspection for work (I am a travel agent).  The Desert Palms Hotel & Suites opened in 2004, and the hotel is located directly next to Disneyland Park & Disney's California Adventure and across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center.  This property is well suited to business travellers and also families. I would recommend putting families into the ‘Sahara’ suite as it features a full kitchenette with a separate living room.

Summary Heading: Noise was unbearable; Pack your earplugs!
Summary: This hotel has one good thing going for it, it is close to Disneyland and the convention center so good for walking.   I should mention there is an excellent gym facility on the fifth floor.  That is where the benefits ended for us. Parking is very tight.    The pool is the worst I've seen in the area.   We were up all night because of doors slamming and noise in the halls.   We asked management several times for assistance and they said there was nothing they could do.   We were on the top floor facing the pool.    Rooms are very small, we had the Yahu kid's suite, looks great on the internet but in reality is very small and worn.    The bunks were so rickety that every time the kids moved the beds creaked and we could hear them in our room that was seperated with a bathroom

Summary Heading: Good Choice for Families with Kids
Summary: I was also hesitant to book at the Desert Palms after reading all the reviews.  It turned out to be a great decision to stay here.  We traveled with 2 toddlers and it's so convenient to walk to Disneyland maingate from the hotel within 15 minutes.  The staffs at the front desk were very friendly and the room was nice and clean.   The suite provided plenty of space for the toddlers to roam around freely.  One improvement to the room would be to reduce the fan noise in the bathroom or have a separate light/fan switch.  We missed the breakfast since we didn't see the schedule published and woke up too late.

We chose this property for 2 reasons, the first being location to Disneyland Resort and the 2nd that it included a continental breakfast. Location was ideal, just a 12 minute stroll to the front gates of Disneyland Resort. Continental brekfast was very, very ordinary. Mornings rotated between frosted donuts and Danish Pastries. If you like cold boiled eggs, and having a lengthy queue just to get some cereal because some bright spark placed the toaster right in the middle of the servery, then it is OK. Get there early and the queues are not so bad. Ideal hotel for familys. Rooms not only have a fridge but a very hand miscrowave oven too. Theire are 2 convenient stores right next door, and if you have a car the Food For Less is a few minutes away along Katella. We stayed 4 nights

Summary Heading: This hotel is passable at best
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for 7 days and found it passable.  There certainly is nothing extraordinary about it.  The housekeeping staff do the bare minimum.  They emptied our trash cans and gave us clean towels each day, but our kitchen floor was not cleaned in the entire 7 days.  We were not left with any dishcloths or dishtowels for washing dishes, and they did not replace our coffee packets after we used them the first day.  The continental breakfast is a joke.  We went the first morning and never went back.  If you like cold hard-boiled eggs and oatmeal, you're in luck.  But the coffee is not even edible and there is a lady there trying to upsell!  She is selling packaged breakfast sandwiches for $2.50 each.  Thankfully there is an IHOP across the street.  Definitely

What can I say, FANTASTIC!  The room was everything and more than we expected it to be.  We were going to stay at another hotel across the road but when I stumbled across this one which offerred the boreggo suite (an extra bed to accommodate my teenage son so he didn't have to sleep with his mother, sister, or grandmother) plus breakfast included for $30 more per night (for all four of us) than the other place, I knew I was on a good thing from the start.  When we arrived, we were offerred an upgrade to a double suite for only $15 extra per night.  This meant we each got a queen sized bed to ourselves, plus 2 bathrooms.  I naturally jumped at that chance.  The room was clean and comfortable.  It had a fridge, microwave and coffeemaker.  That's  more than adequate, considering we

This hotel is definately convenient.  Convenient to the parks and also to several markets located directly adjacent to the property.  We did not have any trouble with the parking, it did seem ample and secure.  We visit Disneyland approx. once a month and have passed by this hotel many times.  Viewing the property from the street definately does not give you a true impression of the hotel it self.  The money and effort has been put into the lobby.  Very nice and spacious, but the rooms are very definately outdated.  Very dark and creepy.  Getting to the rooms is confusing too.  It appears there are two seperate hotels hooked together during a remodel.  You could only access our floor from a elevator at one end of the hotel.  In order to access the fifth floor (breakfast area) or

Summary Heading: Be sure you get the Palm!
Summary: There are 2 hotels in this are with very similar names.  This is the one you want and after reading reviews of both, staying at this one and knowing someone who stayed at another this one is the good one.  I am afraid because of the name some people may be reviewing the wrong ones.  There are no bugs here!  There are inside cooridors which reduce the noise.  This is a nice place.  The walk is about 10 minutes and after a long day it may seem long, but paying to park at Disneyland can be just as long.  We did it in August.  The breakfast room does get crowded but it is big, a lot bigger than the other places we have stayed in at the area.  The food is the same as everywhere other continental breakfast in the area, just o.k.  The rooms are clean, the only problem we had was the

Summary Heading: 10 minutes walk to Disney for so little money!
Summary: Having looked at the reviews on this website I wasn't entirely sure what I was going to be getting, but shouldn't have been worried in the slightest! Do sometimes wonder if people have stayed at the hotels in the recent past - for instance we didn't need to use a keycard to get into the hotel despite getting back from ESPN Zone at 12:30pm. Arrived before the room was ready, but I knew that anyway and so put luggage in storage. Off we went to Disney for the day, then spent three nights in a Borrego Suite and have to say that it was great. As we were three singletons it's hard finding a room with three beds, but all were good even the sofabed - which was remarkable in itself! Room was cleaned every day, with always coffee, etc. replenished - why is the coffee maker in the

Summary Heading: Fine place to stay; close to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: My father and I had a good time staying at the Desert Palm Hotel and Suites.  We only stayed for one night and found our stay to be enjoyable.  I can't comment on the houskeeping concerns previous poster  had but I saw a ton of housekeeping staff cleaning while we were there so I'd like to think that the previous poster's experience was a one-off. While the hotel is clean and comfortably appointed, it's not luxurious.  For the approximately 150.00 dollars we paid I think that the suite we had was reasonable given the hotel's proximity to Disneyland and its inclusion of a pretty generous continental breakfast.  I've stayed in a lot of hotels near and around Disneyland and it seems generally to be true that the closer that you get to the park the more expensive and the less

Summary Heading: Help help my room was not cleaned in three days
Summary: Dear Travelers, I stayed at the Desert Palms from July 17 - 20th. When I first entered the room I observed used soap and wet used wash cloth in the sink. The one chair by the desk had a big yucky stain on it. On the second day I returned from Disney after 4 because the folder said that they clean between 9 - 4. I was undressed, taking a shower at 4:30 and the cleaners tried to get the front door open (thanks for bolts). I asked them to come back a little later. They never came. I looked at the hotel folder and they mention to put a "maid please so room" sign on the door when you leave. I left at 7am but when I returned again at 4 no one had come by. So for three days I had no coffee or clean towels or trash removal. I went to the desk and told the lady that I did not have any

Okay, well this was our first time going to Disneyland and we were all pump. Everyone wanted to stay in a nice hotel, relax and so on. Of course we drove 6.5 hours from Sacramento, California so everyone was really tired. We came in a group of 12 peoples and when we got there to the hotel everyone was like what the heck the lobby was so small compare to the picture on the internet, but we was like okay maybe it's not that bad. Finally when we were planning to check in the lady at the front desk was really nice and really helpful. We park and got the room key and all and went and got our loggage we came through the side door at the back and the first thing we saw was the tiny pool we was not happy. Okay then we went looking for our room. The elevator somehow in the lobby did not

I just returned from staying here on business, and felt like I HAD to write a review.  After reading the previous couple of posts, I almost feel bad for the management here.  I stayed in a King Suite (Rm 470), and have to say that I was impressed.  I was there on a Tuesday night, and was able to get a great deal.  (somewhere around $85 or so).  The room itself was very clean and comfortable.  It was a two room suite, with the second room containg bunkbeds, couch, and a TV for the kids.  The fist room held a kingsize bed, TV, Fridge, and Microvave.  All of which worked very  well.  The TV only had a few channels, but to be honest, I wasn't there to watch TV anyways.  I made it a point to stay on the top floor, and didn't have any problems with traffic noises.  One thing to

Summary Heading: online photo and tours are misleading
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms hotel in their so called luxury suite for two nights. I was very disappointed with the room, the carpet was comming up and the room was not very clean, the breakfast was a joke ( dry doughnuts ) also the towels were very rough and smelt like musty bleach. The key cards only worked on the rooms I had a problem with the entrance doors from the outside. The beds were not very comfortable, The television had a broken front cover also the remote batteries were almost dead. The online tour was totally different from the real room the online tour made this place look like it was a high quality suite in all this place is not worth the money they gouge you for ($300.00 a night in my case)The room did not look anything like they promote on the online tour!

We started out staying here on our Disneyland vacation b/c it was a Good Neighbor hotel.  We were in the mini suite - which is just that - miniature.  It didn't feel like a suite at all!  The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything above and beside your room, the beds were hard/too firm, the bathroom was dirty.  The next morning (after the first night), while taking a shower the water went cold as soon as someone above us turned their water on.  On top of that, there was a hair on my roll at breakfast.  Needless to say, we checked out that day after only one night and went elsewhere - thank goodness Disney worked with us to move us quickly! I could not have stayed there another night - I was disgusted.

Summary Heading: Uneventful stay at the Desert Palm
Summary: First visit to Anaheim with husband and 2 kids. Check-in was easy and quick. We booked the Mohave suite, which we were told had view of fireworks.  It also appeared roomy from pictures on website.  In reality this suite was very, very tiny and faced a brick wall.  It looked like they took a standard hotel room and walled off 1/3 of the room.  We went to the front desk to express concern and we were quickely helped by the Manager T.J..  He showed us a couple rooms and we decided on the Sahara suite, which he gave to us at no extra charge!  The Sahara suite had one bedroom with a king size bed, a living room with a sleeper sofa and a fully stocked kitchen. Both beds were comfortable, even the sleeper sofa.  We were right next to the elevator and laundry room (rm 330) which was

I really cant understand why there are bad reviews for this hotel.  This hotel is GREAT for the price, Our room was nice, The housekeeping made the room look amazing every day, It felt brand new every time we got back into the room.  The TV is good, The microwave and fridge is good.  Bathrooms were perfect, Allways clean and spotless.   The hotel staff are freindly but not that helpfull, Like they do their job, They answer your questions and do what there meant to. But they wont go out of their way (But who does these days!)  I will definatley be staying here again, Im from australia and will definatly visit anaheim and stay at desert palms again.   I Really cant comprehend how people gave this place a bad review.  A+++++ Must stay at!

Just got back from the desert Palm and Disneyland, check in was easy adn we got upgraded from a king suite to a kids suite...nice room, asked for a crib and got one right away, did not have to reask.  The Hotel is a good location, it is right across from Disney but actually it is behind California Adventure so you have to walk a bit to the enterance ways about 15 mins.  There is a quiznos in the hotel and a 7-elevan and ABC Grocers next door. Get the water and snacs for the kids there before you go to the parks...alot cheaper, carry them in a back pack or stroller if you have one, water is a neccesity, it is 2.75 for a pop or water inthe park so you can ssave lots of money.  The breakfast is simple, do not go there thinking you can get lots of items..it is simple and quick, I
horrible, no service. at all. ever. I got strep while staying in this hotel, and no one would give me service even then. not even an extra pillow. Steer clear of this disasterous hotel.

We chose the Desert Palms because it was across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center and was less expensive than some of the other nearby hotels.  The convention center was an easy 5 minute walk - definitely much better than fighting the parking nightmare there.  We reserved our room through Orbitz and check-in was a breeze - the staff very friendly and efficient. The hotel room was clean and comfortable and included all the amenities such as microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot, iron,adequate towels, etc.  The bathroom was equipped for those physically challenged.  There was no counter space as the sink was mounted on the wall, which made it a bit awkward to handle all the morning toiletry products.    The free continental breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, whole

Summary Heading: Two Room Suite fits the bill
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our annual visit to Disneyland.  This time we were three adult sisters and one 9 year old niece. We chose the two-room suite because it gave us room to spread out and two bathrooms! The room was average as far as decor and cleanliness. No real complaints.  The beds were more comfortable than most motel beds we've slept in. There was a fair amount of noise from the room above us and from the hall but we expected that, being in a family destination.  But, why do parents think it's ok for their kids to run in the halls and jump up at down at 7 in the morning?  We never could get the Pay-Per-View TV to work, nor could the hotel attendant sent up to help us. Hotel is extremely convenient to Disneyland. We walked through the parking lot gate and caught the

Summary Heading: Not bad at all.  Much better than I expected
Summary: Not bad at all.  Maybe we had gotten a newer room but the accomodations were very nice.  The lobby was very nice but who really cares about that?  The room was very nice.  No smell.  Everything looked new.  Would stay here again.  Did not see any rats.  Clean accomodations.

After much research (and juggling of dates) we ended up at this hotel. The main thing we requested was a hotel with a separate bedroom, close to the Parks. We were originally booked into a Mohave Suite, but when we checked in, Ray on the front desk suggested that maybe we would be happier in a Borrego Suite. He offered to let us look at both before deciding (the hotel was not busy at this point) After looking at both, the Mojave was sooo small and cramped, and we said we would take the Borrego, unless he could suggest another suite that would have more room for the same price. He was very accommodating and let us look at two more, the Escalante and the Yuha Kid's Suite. The Escalante we saw was under construction, so not sure what the dimensions were, but the Yuha Kids Suite had

we stayed here for two nights in july 2005. my dad suggested that we stay there because we had stayed there when we went to disneyland as a family before. although the hotel was redone, or so they say. NOT the entire hotel was redone. we got put in a VERY old and gross room. when i asked about they said it was in their older section of the hotel. I dont know why they say everything is new when our room was NOT. the cleaning stuff they use smells so aweful i could barely stand it. the sheets on the bed were so hard and ruff i coudlnt even sleep. i swear they must have been 75 thread count sheets. when we got back to the hotel at night we needed some extra pillows. so like 30 minutes later some random guy shows up at the door with 1 pillow. we asked the front desk about it and

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Close to Disneyland Terrific Location!
Summary: I was surprised at some of the negative reviews of this VERY pleased with the hotel.  We stayed in a Borregio Suite as we had 4 adults and 2 kids in our group.  The lobby is very beautiful and our room was very clean and just like the pictures we saw on Expedia.  The front desk was always staffed with very pleasant and friendly people. Checking in and out was quick and easy. It was very quiet and we only ever heard one loud voice when it passed outside our door.  The breakfast is very basic but free with toast, cereal, oatmeal, apples, oranges, juices, coffee, danishes.  Enough to get us going for the morning.  The pool & spa looked very inviting but we never had time to take advantage of it. The walk to Disneyland was an easy 10-15 minute stroll.  I loved the location of the

I must say our stay at the Desert Palms Suites at Anahiem during the past Thanksgiving week was very nice.  The only complain I have was with the in-room Internet access.  In their web site they failed to mentioned that they charge $9.95 per 24 hours period.  I can see that price if I was going to work out of the hotel room, but not for occasional checking email and such.  Other hotels I've stayed offered free Internet access.  These days that should be considered as part of the amenities.  I would have looked for another hotel if I had knew that they were charging $9.95 per day for Internet access.

After reading some reviews, I was alittle scared to stay here, but it was great.  We were on the 4th floor and had plenty of room.  Having a mini frig and microwave was great for left overs to help save some money on food.  We had neighbors, but never heard them.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable, staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was just what I expected and all that I needed to get my day started.  Walking distance was great!  From the windows of the eating area you could see California Adventure.  For the low price, we got more than other hotels were offering.  I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if ever in the area.

Some reviewers obviously were staying at a different place.  We had a super experience.  LOcation is perfect for disney visit.  The room was large, staff was helpful & very friendly.  Having a fridge & microwave was great.  The breakfast is simple with cereal, toast & juice but for free and quick it was great.  Hot water was an issue later in the day (perhaps they were doing the laundry or something) but early was ok.  For the price, it was great.

It was a pleasure staying at Desert Palms.  It made our whole Disneyland experience even more enjoyable.    The staff was exemplary and customer service was A-1.  Also great was that we were walking distance to Disneyland Resort.  We were, of course, tired from walking all day at the parks but the comfortable beds soaked up the aches and pains :)   There was a continental breakfast every morning until 9:30 and it was just enough to get us going for the day.  Our next trip we will definitely be staying with Anaheim Desert Palms Resort.

Summary Heading: What a Great Suite For a Stay at Disneyland!!
Summary: We just returned from a stay at the Desert Palms (Oct. 6 - 13) and it was wonderful to say the least.  At first I was a little worried about having booked the Borrego Suite for 3 adults and 3 children and wondered if we'd be too cramped.  However, this turned out not to be a problem at all.  The room was spacious enough and by the end of a long day at the parks, everyone just needed a bed to crash on anyways.  My sister in-law and the 3 kids slept in the 2 queens, and my husband and I were on the pull-out bed in the sunken living room area which was separated by a curtain.  The decor was nice and pleasant, the room was extremely clean and we never once encountered any unwelcome critters (ie. bugs, roaches, etc.).  We booked our suite on Expedia and had heard horror stories of

This hotel provided me with the worst guest experience I have ever had.  Upon checking in and going to my room at 9:00 p.m. after a long day in Disneyland, I was welcomed by a live RAT.  It ran across my feet and into the bathroom where it disappeared into a hole under the vanity.  When I reported this to the front desk personnel, they acted like it was ordinary.  They offered me another room which I decided to look at because it was late and we were tired.  My examination of room number two was not acceptable.  The carpets were dirty and the room smelled.  We found accomodations at another hotel.  I would recommend you avoid this hotel.

Booked through Expedia.  The pictures on Expedia are what the rooms are like, however the pictures are really brightened up.  Our room was very dim which made it feel old and perhaps less clean than it was.    There was a huge sewer roach crawling up our wall at night.  It was the only roach I had seen.  Unfortunately, this happened the first night, and I was paranoid and had trouble sleeping after that.    It is definitley walking distance to Disneyland, which was a real plus since we had a toddler and had to return to the room everyday at 1:00 p.m. for nap time.  You can walk to the Timon parking lot and take the tram or you can just walk all the way to the front entrance.   Both take about the same amount of walking time.  Quiznos is right downstairs.  That came in handy for

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of a west coast trip. We got there and the entrance and lobby looked really smart as most do. The pool looked good as well with a jacuzzi next to it. The girls on the front desk was polite and helpful and got us checked in quite efficiently.  The rooms were a real let down. Really old decor and smelt a bit off. The beds were no better either. The rooms were not sound proofed as you could hear every word coming from the guests next door. I've stayed in many hotels and so not exaggerating the room. I was really let down from how the photos looked on the website.   I chose this hotel on the basis it had a free breakfast, internet connection and close to Disneyland. Only one of these was satisfactory enough which was the location to

Desert Palms Staff-  I wanted to let you know of our wonderful stay at your hotel last night.  My husband and I just needed to stay just overnight, but we have put your hotel at the top of our list of our get-away hotels.  We were temped to stay another day just because we had such a relaxing time.    Our room was very comfortable- the beds soft enough to make for a great night’s sleep, extra towels, coffee pot, hair blower and even a microwave and ice box!  We were most impressed with the sunken living room with an extra TV!  This made the room feel “homey” as we didn’t need to sit on the bed to just relax.  The color and décor of the room was warm and beautiful.  The use of softer lighting there was even romantic!    The hallways and reception area were richly decorated,

We stayed in this hotel from September 12-16th.  We had a handicapped room on the 3rd floor.  I thought the room was clean and I liked the safe and fridge.  The walk was just a bit farther than the walk from the hojo but much less crowded than the walk on the other side of Harbor.  I liked the 7-11 and abc market right next door.  Still prefer to eat at Mimi's, however. The strange things about our room were because it was a handicapped room I think.  There was no counter space in the bathroom at all.  And no table to eat on in the room.  Still, it had decent beds, it was mostly soundproof (except when the pool was full, then it was noisy).  The breakfast was small but useful.  The staff was great.

My wife and I stay at the Desert Palms on the night of the Aug 25th. The hotel rooms are nice and look fairly new. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking Katella. If you stood right next to the window, you can hear traffic faintly through the window, but once you are in bed, traffic noise is not heard or is very, very faint. No problems here. I found the room very clean and very satisfactory. There was a refridgerator and microwave in the room which my wife liked. The bathroom and tub were very clean. The shower head on the shower seemed to be oldest thing in the room. A plastic shower head. It delivered the water ok, which I guess is the main thing. The room and the bathroom, tub was very clean. No noise from kids or other guests. We were two doors down from the laundry/ice

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We stayed at the Desert Palms for three nights. The front desk was extremely helpful and polite.  The walk to the Disneyland tram only took about 5 min, and the 7-11 next door came in very handy. However, the room was less than average. The only mirror and sink was the one in the bathroom, so I couldn't do my hair until the bathroom was empty. They did have a fridge,a microwave, and an in room safe so that was a plus. Our room 311 was right across from the elevator, which worried me at first about noise, but we never heard anything. The elevators are confusing, from the parking garage that elevator will only take you up to the first floor, then you have to walk down a hallway to another elevator to get you to your room. Our first night there, we did hear the people in the room

This hotel was awful.  The pool is very, very small.  At night it was wall to wall kids.  You could not move three steps without hitting someone.  I reported a used condom and empty bottles (poolside) to the front desk and was told, "This happens all the time".  The rooms were large, but dated and dirty.  "Close to Disney" is not exactly correct. The walk home is long for small children.   I would NOT recommend this property for anyone.  I have previously stayed at the Embassy Suites for $10 more a night.  The have a full cook to order breakfast and Happy Hour.  I am a business traveler; this hotel is extremely deceptive in its pictures and descriptions.  Do not visit for business or vacation.

We recently spent 4 days at the Desert Palms Hotel in the Borrego Suite.  It was a great visit from start to finish.  The front desk personnel were all extremely efficient and pleasant; special hello and thanks to Denise and Manny.  The hotel is spotless, (beautiful lobby), rooms were perfect and exactly as we expected.  Very comfortable beds. Daily maid service was great.  Breakfast was satisfying.  Great location to Disneyland tram service, just a 5-10 minute walk.  Pool and spa were a great treat after a long day walking around the parks.  We look forward to staying there again. LEONA & BILL

Summary Heading: Not Bad for the Money, Great Location.
Summary: Just got back from a 2 day stay at the Desert Palms Hotel. Overall it was a decent place. The room rate was about $130 per night including all fees and taxes. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. We didn't spend much time in the room, so all we were looking for was a reasonable price and a good location. This fit the bill. It's on the outside corner of the Disneyland resort and a short walk to the parking lot tram that takes you to the front entrance. Unfortunately when we checked in there were two events going on in the conference rooms, a wedding reception and a family reunion, so the hotel lobby was packed with mostly kids being very noisy and parking initially was a big problem. Once you get your car parked either underground or above ground you are pretty much set.

Summary Heading: Want to be ripped off? Stay here!
Summary: We made reservations for early June and had to cancel. We called the hotel and cancelled and were given a cancelation number. We were still charged $137.00! After 7 phone calls and messages left for the front desk manager, I finally got ahold of the hotel manager. He then informed me that he would not give me a refund because my cancelation number was not correct. He was unwilling to budge and suggested that I fight it with my bank to have the charge disputed. Don;'t waste your hard-earned money! Stay at the Red Roof Inn for $100.00 less per night and only 1 block away.

It was clean. Close to DL park/resteraunts. Walls are paper thin - with babys crying on boths sides of us during the night. We must have stayed in the old part - pretty outdated. Had to take two different elevators to get to the top floor for breakfast. If you're looking for an included breakfast during your stay - this one was skimpy.

We stayed at the Desert Palms from 3/28/05 to 4/1/05 with our three boys ages: 3, 11 & 13.  The location is great for walking to the park and eating out.  Many choices easliy reach on foot.  There is a 7-11 right next door.  The room we had was in the new section.  It had two queens and a pullout in the sunken living area.  There is a table with four chairs to eat at- this was great- no eating sitting on the bed! The room also had a microwave and fairly large fridge.  I get the impression there was a hotel here and they built more hotel on top of it.  We were told that any room with a number larger than 330 was new. There is also a safe in the room that you can use for free.  We never had cups after the first day.  We called for more cups.  We finally went and got cups at the

we stayed here in oct of 2004 and had a great time the breakfast was ok my wife and i are both cooks and know what to expect when it comes to free continental breakfast if you want more then a donut some fruit coffee milk and cereal then stop whinning and go  to dennys the beds we had were the best we have ever sleep in.. the only prob we had was getting info about the shuttle bus to the park i asked a lady at the desk and  i had to pry the info out of her -- does the shuttle stop at the hotel ? no-- do you know where i can catch it ? yes -- where is that ? by 7-11 - i hear i have t buy a pass to ride it ? yes - do they sell pass's on the bus ? no -- do you know where i can buy one ? yes-- and where is that ? across the street -- across the street at one of the motels? no --

We just returned from a week at the Desert Palms and I can honestly say that we will look to stay here again next time we're in the Disneyland area. We booked the Borrego Luxury Suite and it worked out great for us. The wife and I in one bed, two kids in the other, and our oldest on the hide-a-bed in the "living room". The room was always clean, and there were no problems to speak of. While it's probably not a bad walk to Disney's main gate, we found it worthwhile to park the car in the "Timon" parking area (right between the hotel and the parks) and ride the free shuttle up to the entrance of Disneyland. Parking was $10 but it allowed us to keep stuff in the car and ride the shuttle back and forth whenever we needed something. Parking at the hotel is a bit difficult at times.

Summary Heading: Great place to bring your family
Summary: My wife and 2 kids stayed at the Desert Palms Hotel two weeks ago. When we arrived, we were overwhelmed by the lobby and the marble floors. Having been to Anaheim before, we were used to the standard boring lobby. We reserved there Borrego Suite which was really nice considering the seperate step down living room gave my wife and I some privacy. The room was clean and the staff was really helpful. The breakfast was good, nothing too fancy, but then again for free I wouldn't have expected it. The walk to the park was less than 10 minutes and we didnt even need to use the resort shuttle. They have two places to eat in the hotel, a Quiznos sandwich shop which was good for the kids and another restaurant which had good food but more importantly, had a bar that was open fairly late!

Summary Heading: Average hotel, at a decent price
Summary: Our family just got back from a 7 night stay at the Desert Palms Inn and Suites; March 10-17th. I booked at package on Expedia, so I got a Standard room for about $55 CAD a night. For the price, I felt it to be a good value. The room was basic, with 2 queen beds, a mirrored closet, fridge and microwave. The bathroom was average with marble counter top. Each floor had laundry, which I found helpful when travelling with small children. The room had a new air/ heating unit in it, and worked well. The water was always warm for showers, and we always had clean towels. I did notice on one of the beds that the bedding was ratty, the acrylic blanket under the bedspread had a fairly good sized hole in it. I thought that it should have been garbaged rather than putting it on a bed. The

After reading some of the reviews posted on this site, I was a little hesitant about staying here.  I have since found that if you are always looking for something to complain about then you will surely find it no matter where you go.   We booked two rooms.  A mini-suite in the older section of the hotel and a kids suite in the newer section.  The mini-suite was very nice.  It did have an older smell to it but the bedding was all new, the carpet was new and the walls had a new paint job and crown moulding added.  It was very clean.  The Yuha kids suite was in the newer part of the building and was extremely nice.  It was nice having the kids in a separate room than us and they loved the bunk beds.  It was also very clean.  My first reaction to both rooms though was they they

The rooms were very clean and inviting. Marble counter tops, fridge, safe, microwave, blow drier and coffe maker.  Free breakfast was okay.  Everything you need at a great price.  I was worried becasue I was traveling alone with a 6 year old.  Felt very comfortable and safe.

We checked into the Kalahari Family Suite.  We had my family with me, wife and 3 daughters and my parents.  This room was very small and very old.  They are not in the remodeled part of the hotel.  The heater did not work.  It got down to 62 degrees overnight.  We tried several solutions for 3 nights.  After unsucessful attempts to make it work, we spoke with the front desk.  They said they would have maintenance look at it while we were gone.  If he could not fix it, the day manager would speak with the night manager and they would allow us to switch rooms.  When we returned to the park, the heater was still broken.  We went down to the front desk, and the night manager had no clue what we were talking about.  He appeared very put out by our request for a room with a heater.

Summary Heading: It was okay...not great but not horrible
Summary: First warning - If anyone in reservations guarantees you a certain type of room don't be fooled - at check-in they'll tell you they don't guarantee any type of room, i.e. room with a view.  Luckily Robert at the front desk was able to find us a room with a Disney view.  This was an unsettling way to begin our stay.  Old part of the building is exactly that..old.  Elevators are old, hallways are dark.  Our room was in newer part of the building and was decent.  We had a suite with 2 queen beds plus queen sofa sleeper in "living area".  It was spacious and having two tv's and a refrigerator was a plus for my family.  The cooling unit was in living area and air didn't circulate very well so those sleeping in 2 queen beds were usually hot.  That could be a problem if there during

Summary Heading: Offers park visitors a good value
Summary: The Desert Palms is a good value when you're spending lots of money and energy at Disneyland.  After a long day at the park and expensive park food the hotel offer a nice affordable place to rest your head.  The hotel is clean and located within walking distance to both parks (15 minutes).  There are also plenty of convenience stores and places to eat within walking distance. The suite does not really provide a second room. The second room is only about 9'x6' so I wouldn't really recommend it for families who want more space.  The buffet breakfast, while free, is not worth your time. as it had weak coffee and offered no appealing foods.  You may want to bring your own if you stay there.

My husband and I just returned from a 3 night trip to Anaheim.  The Desert Palm Inn & Suites was fine for us and we got a good deal too.  Yes, you can hear people in the hallway but that's true for most hotels.   We had a nice large room (2 queens and a sofabed) and it was just the 2 of us.  We had a view of a wall and the back of the Tower of Terror but we were only there to sleep anyways.  The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast.  All they had was one kind of pastry, bread to toast, cereal, apples and oranges.  The only thing good was the orange juice.    We went to a newly opened French-Vietnamese bakery on Brookhurst & Hazard the rest of the trip for our breakfasts (& desserts) (10 mins away in Little Saigon) and bought Vietnamese sandwiches a block away at Lee's

We got a family suite at the Desert Palm Inn & Suites.  The walls are thin and you can hear everything from babies crying to people walking above you in your room.  There are lots of strange noises like odd thumps and dripping sounds that could never be explained.  Overall the room was very dark.  The lights in the bathrooms blinked on and off and made you nauseated when you were in there.  We asked the staff to fix it, and they never did.  We had two TV's and one remote control that didn't work.  Our room overlooked the pool.  Beware of getting a room like this.  The pool is supposed to close at 10:00pm.
