We had to call down both nights (one night we called down twice) because people weren't out of the pool.  I'm not talking a few adults hanging out.  This was screaming wailing

We stayed at the Desert Palms in Sept'04. There were seven of us in our party with one couple in one suite and one family of five in the other. Every time we went to the desk with a concern or question we found the desk staff to be more than willing to help us.  We had reserved a family suite and after a couple days found the suite to be a bit cramped for our needs. Robert at the front desk moved us to a new suite and made sure that the new suite was to our liking. The original suite was in the old part of the hotel and was showing it's age. It had a bit of a musty smell and was long and narrow.  The new suite was in the new part of the hotel and was a kitchen suite with full size fridge and stove. It had a balcony, a bedroom, living room and of course a full bathroom. It worked

Summary Heading: Nice place for a nice price
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for over a week and it was great. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast was limited but fine, the pool was clean. The suites are really nice and the sofa bed was very comfortable. Rooms are clean and comfortable and pleasently decorated.

Our trip this year had to be inexpensive, and we were able to get an incredible deal on Expedia for 6 nights in a deluxe room for only $450 CDN.  The hotel lobby is really nice, but the room was very very average.  The toilet didn't flush properly, and the drapes let in alot of light at night (thank goodness for long Disney days).  The pool area is in the middle of the hotel, which only gets sun for about an hour during the day, and it seemed to always be crammed with kids and adults...I saw the hot tub full of 10 people one time (and it looks like it could only fit 6).  The continental breakfast was about what you would expect for free, but it felt kinda dirty being in there.  The convience of the 7-11 was great.    We arrived at 11am and could not check in till 3pm, but the

On the plus side..... Two room mini suite for a family of four gaves us some space.  Not huge but there were two t.v's and a separate couch, living space. Refrigerator and microwave in room saved some cash.  We stocked up on some sodas and waters.  This saved some time and money. Location.  My 9 and 13 year olds had no problem walking the 8 minutes to the park entrance every day.  (Mom was a little tired though)  We were close enough to go back for an afternoon rest. Food proximity.  Close to a subway, 7-11, McDonalds and pizza places.  This saves some money on meals. Continental breakfast.  While basic it did fill us up until lunch. The pool/hot tub was a nice break for the kids and rarely crowded. Interior doors.  I am not a big fan of hotels with doors that open to the

Our 5 day stay at Desert Palms was wonderful!  I am very particular and I felt the room was VERY CLEAN and everything worked great--showers, tvs, a.c.  It was a blessing to have the microwave and fridge.  The walk to Disneyland was only ten minutes--plus you are right next to a 7-11 if you need anything.  Restaurants are nearby.  The staff was always helpful and our family would stay there again with NO hesitation.

My 11 year old & I stayed here from 7/16 - 7/20, we thought it was very convenient to the parks, everyone was very nice.  The only thing that we disliked was the continental breakfast.  I know it is free, but could they have at least put a tablecloth on the dirty wooden tables with splinters in them.  At least there was coffee, juice and toast.  Otherwise, the hotel was really nice.

We stayed there on July 21-22, 2004.   Minuses: It is about a 15 minute walk to the Disneyland front gate.  The walls in the room are very thin.  We were woken up at about 8 am from noise from the neighbors.    The room appeared to be newly renovated but they must have skipped the plumbing.  Parts of of the shower were missing but it functioned.  One of the two sinks drained verrrryyyy slowly.  Pluses: Arrived at the hotel at about 11 am and we were allowed to check in.  Free parking.  We stayed in a room with two queen beds and it came with a sofa sleeper.  You could actually sleep 6 people in the room.  Bought our 2 day park hopper tickets there at the hotel desk, for no additional charge.  Did not have to wait in line at Disneyland for tickets.  The hotel allowed us to leave

This hotel is great for the price.  Air conditioning was ice cold, refridgerator and microwave worked great.  There was a problem with a remote, but, it was replaced quickly.  TV's both worked great, lots of room. The decoration of the rooms and the lobby area will not be an issue if you're planning to leave the hotel each day, to visit Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farms, various beaches, etc. If you are looking for a place in a great location and have a husband and two kids, this is the hotel for you.  If you are looking for something better than you'll have to pay anywhere between 50 to 150 dollars extra for the same space, or get two adjoining rooms.

Don't be deceived by this hotel!  It may look nice on the outside - but the rooms are another story.  When we arrived at 3:45 on June 30th for a two-night stay,  the maid was still cleaning our room (check-in time is 3!).  Although there were 2 TVs in our room, the smaller TV was not functioning properly.  We had to call the front desk to "fix" our TV, but half the channels were still not clear.  At night, there was adult material on TV (HBO) as we were flipping the channels (what if kids saw this?).  They have high-speed internet access but it is $10 a day, and local calls from the hotel cost 60 cents.  Warning, bring your own shampoo!

This was one of the most sadest hotels we have ever stayed at. When we stayed there it was dirty, the view was a brick building, the parking was tight, I could not understand any of the workers, we had a broken tv and fridge, we had to keep the curtains closed the whole time because of workers walked by and looked in the windows. Think a second time before staying here.

We stayed at hotel from June 3-8. Room was great. Had two queen beds on main level and lower-level living room had pull-out sofa. Two tv's, refrigerator and microwave. We faced out towards city and had a nice view. Staff was friendly and helpful. Parking is limited-as long as you don't move your car in the evening, you should be fine. Breakfast was basic but decent. Great view of fireworks in the evening. Swimming pool area is small but was nice. 7-11 store next to hotel. Disney was about an 18 minute walk from hotel room to ticket entrance. Unfortunately, the walk seemed too far in the evening after a long Disney day!   Tip: Request room in new section of hotel.  We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Newly renovated, good prices, but very busy
Summary: Was at Desert Palms from 6-8 June, getting a special price for a suite via Expedia ($55). The hotel looks fresh and everything is still clean, but I suspect in a few months--with the extremely heavy load this place takes--its going to wear down.  The Suite itself was excellent for the price. 2 double beds, one TV in front of the beds, and one more TV down in the 'living room' area. Very spacious. Room and bath was very very new and clean.  The b/fast was on the 5th floor, and if you've read the previous few reviews, its true...continental and really basic.   The pool was small and the spa even smaller. And always crowded.  That's the only drawback of this hotel. It is very very crowded. Even parking for guests could be a problem.   Its location is very prime if you want to go

The lobby was decorated fairly nice... If you could ignore the fact that there was a giant fake rock waterfall smack dab in the middle of the room. Totally didn't go with the decor and was just tacky. We wanted to check in early in the morning (even though we knew our room wouldn't be accesible until later) but were told to come back later and just go ahead and park our car there. When we did come back to check in, a different clerk gave us a parking permit and said if we didn't display it our car would be towed at our expense. Lucky for us, it was still there. The point is, it could have been towed because they didn't bother to give us the required permit. So, up to our room. It was definatly less than spectacular. The toilet seemed kind of dirty, as did the shower. There

I just thought I would add my experience since I read some terrible reviews about this hotel.  We just got back from our Disneyland vacation and stayed at the Desert Palms hotel due to my special AAA rates.  I was quite nervous after reading some of these reviews, but figured we were going to Disneyland for the vacation and not for the room.  The construction is completely finished and I experienced absolutely no problems.  I got upgraded to the Borrego suite (I assume because they overbooked the deluxe room I reserved!)  and it was just as it was represented on the website.  It was new and very nice.  The refrigerator is a decent size, the air conditioner kept the room nice and cool.  The continental breakfast is as stated, continental breakfast, nothing fancy, just hot or cold

This was our first family trip to Disneyland and to the Desert Palms Hotel.  We were very pleased with our stay at the hotel, especially for the great price we got for the room:  $89/nt for the Sahara Kitchenette Suite (via Expedia).  It's the largest room available and quite spacious.  There were three of us, one being an excited toddler.  Plenty of room to accommodate two adults and two kids, any more would start to get a little crowded.    The kitchenette had brand new appliances:  large refrigerator, small-size four-burner stovetop and oven, microwave, kitchen sink, full set of dishes, glasses, mugs and utensils.  It was a great setup especially since we often came back with leftovers from dinner and could easily reheat it for the next day.    Room is nicely decorated (even

For our first two visits to Disneyland we stayed at the Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.  We decided to try Desert Palms because it was newly remodeled, it had the kids suite, and because of the great rate we got.  We stayed in a 'Yuha Kid's Suite' with bunk beds, a King Size Bed, and a sleeper sofa.  We paid about $85 a night for 3 nights at the end of May.  There did not appear to be any further construction going on, and everything was very nice and new looking.    Checking in took awhile, because they did not have rooms ready when we arrived an hour before check in time.  At least they had a nice big lobby to wait in.   The suite was on the small side, but had everything we expected including a refrigerator, microwave, two tv's, and a nice sized bathroom.  We liked that the

With so many choices while visiting Anaheim Orange County, I opted to stay at the Desert Palms Inn. The hotel was very unique in appearance.  A water fountain is located in the porte cochere leading to the entrance of the hotel. In the middle of the lobby was a rock formation with waterfalls. It was a very relaxing atmosphere. The lobby was huge and was a great place to sit and meet with clients I have in the area.  The meeting room was an excellent size for my seminar. The sales staff helped me with my meeting room arrangements and catered events. The hotel staff was superb. For a new hotel in Anaheim, they did a great job winning my business.
Manager Response: Hello,  My name is Fred Brown and I am the General Manager of the new Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.  I was reading the reviews of my property and would like the say that I am truly sorry for the inconveniences that my guests have experienced over the past 18 months.  I would like to say that rates were drastically discounted during construction as well as the majority of the guests were notified that the rate reduction was due to the inconvenience of construction prior to their arrival.   My hotel underwent a $19 million dollar renovation adding a new building that houses 2 restaurants (Quiznos & Sandbox Bar & Grill) 7500 feet of meeting space, a spacious gift shop, a new pool and spa, plenty of parking as well as one of the most beautiful lobbys in Anaheim.  We have a spacious breakfast room as well as an outdoor terrace.  We offer the largest array of suites in Anaheim.  All of the construction is complete and I assure you that you will experience a wonderful vacation in the Disneyland Resort while staying at my hotel.  If you do decide to stay with me and enjoyed your stay, please come back to Trip Advisor and let everyone know that the completion of construction ended the dark cloud over Desert Palms Hotel & Suites.  If your experience was not as expected, please contact me and I will do my best to rectify any issue that you may have experienced.  Feel free to contact me personally if you have any concerns that I have not addressed.  Sincerely,  Fred Brown, GM Desert Palms Hotel & Suites (714) 535-1133 x104 (714) 399-0161

Summary: I was a little worried with my reservation because I read things on the review. But I was very satified with my stay. The hotel just had construction and I was given a very nice kids suite. My children enjoyed the bunk beds in my room. The breakfast room was very nice and spacious. It overlooked Disneyland. Walking to Disneyland was very easy due to the entrance on the right side of the hotel. Overall it was a very satisfying and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I felt it was worth the money I spent for a family vacation.
